Sense.DEF: the 19th letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第十九个字母
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= south or southern 南﹔南方（的）﹔朝南（的）
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= small , used on clothes to show the size 〔衣服尺码〕小号

Sense.DEF: forms the plural of nouns
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cat and two dogs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只猫和两条狗

Sense.DEF: forms the third person singular of the present tense of most verbs
Sense.TRAN: 〔构成大多数动词的第三人称单数现在式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: he plays
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他玩
Sense.EXAMPLE: she sits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐

Sense.DEF:
forms the
possessive
case of plural nouns
Sense.EXAMPLE: the girls’ dresses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 姑娘们的连衣裙
Sense.EXAMPLE: the islands’ inhabitants
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些岛上的居民

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘is’
Sense.EXAMPLE: John’s here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰在这儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s that?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s writing a letter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在写信。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘has’
Sense.EXAMPLE: Polly’s gone out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 波莉出去了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A spider’s got eight legs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜘蛛有八条腿。

Sense.TRAN: a short form of 缩略式= ‘us’ used only in ‘let’s’〔仅用于let’s〕
a short form of 缩略式= ‘does’, used in questions after ‘who’, ‘what’ etc that many people think is incorrect 〔用于疑问句中的 who﹐what 等词后﹐但许多人认为这种用法不正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How’s he plan to do that?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打算怎样去做那件事？

Sense.DEF:
forms the
possessive
of singular nouns, and of plural nouns that do not end in -s
Sense.TRAN: 〔构成单数名词和非-s结尾的复数名词的所有格〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: my sister’s husband
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的妹[姐]夫
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary’s generosity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽的慷慨
Sense.EXAMPLE: yesterday’s lesson
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天的课
Sense.EXAMPLE: the children’s bedroom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们的卧室

Sense.DEF: the shop or home of someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I bought it at the baker’s at the baker’s shop .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我在面包店买的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I met him at Mary’s at Mary’s house .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是在玛丽家遇见他的。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= savings and loan association 储蓄贷款协会
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= sadomasochism 施虐受虐癖

Subsense.DEF: Sunday, considered as a day of rest and prayer by most Christian churches
Subsense.TRAN: 安息日〔星期日﹐大多数基督教会认为应当休息和祈祷的日子〕

Subsense.DEF: Saturday, considered as a day of rest and prayer in the Jewish religion and some Christian churches
Subsense.TRAN: 安息日〔星期六﹐犹太教以及一些基督教会认为应当休息和祈祷的日子〕

Sense.DEF: to obey or not obey the religious rules of the Sabbath
a period when someone, especially someone in a university job, stops doing their usual work in order to study or travel
Sense.TRAN: 休假﹐公休假〔尤指大学教师暂停平时的工作去进行研究或旅行的假期〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She took a long sabbatical .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她休了个长假。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dr Watson’s away on sabbatical.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沃森博士去休假了。

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
sabre
an expensive fur used to make coats etc, or the small animal that this fur comes from
black or very dark in colour
to secretly damage or destroy equipment, vehicles etc that belong to an enemy or opponent, so that they cannot be used
Sense.TRAN: 暗中破坏〔敌人或对手的设备﹑车辆等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every single plane had been sabotaged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每架飞机都遭到了破坏。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately spoil someone’s plans because you do not want them to succeed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Demonstrators have sabotaged the conference.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游行示威者破坏了这次大会。

Sense.DEF: deliberate damage that is done to equipment, vehicles etc in order to prevent an enemy or opponent from using them
Sense.TRAN: 〔对敌人或对手的设备﹑车辆等的〕蓄意破坏
Sense.EXAMPLE: The terrorists were planning acts of sabotage to destabilize the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖分子在策划破坏国家安定的行动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: industrial sabotage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工业破坏活动

Sense.DEF: someone who deliberately damages, destroys, or spoils someone else’s property or activities, in order to prevent them from doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lorries were wrecked by saboteurs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些大卡车被人蓄意损毁。

Sense.DEF:
a light pointed sword with one sharp edge used in
fencing
a heavy sword with a curved blade, used in past times
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时使用的弯刃的〕军刀﹐马刀

Sense.DEF: when someone threatens to use force but you do not think they are very frightening or serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: What the situation calls for is calm discussion – not sabre-rattling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种局面需要的是心平气和的商谈﹐而不是武力恐吓。

Sense.DEF: a part inside a plant or animal that is shaped like a bag and contains liquid or air
a chemical substance that tastes sweet and is used instead of sugar in drinks
too romantic in a way that seems silly and insincere
Sense.TRAN: 故作多情的﹐过分甜蜜的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hated the movie’s saccharine ending.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌这部影片煽情的结尾。

Sense.DEF: a small plastic or paper package containing a liquid or powder

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sachet of shampoo
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一小袋洗发剂

Sense.DEF: a small bag containing dried herbs or flowers that smell pleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lavender sachet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 薰衣草小香袋

Subsense.DEF: a large bag made of strong rough cloth or strong paper, used for storing or carrying flour, coal, vegetables etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔装面粉﹑煤﹑蔬菜等用的〕麻袋﹐粗布袋﹐厚纸袋﹐大口袋

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sack of potatoes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大袋马铃薯

Subsense.DEF: the amount that a sack can contain

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We need about a sack of rice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要大约一袋米。

Sense.DEF: when someone is dismissed from their job
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve never actually given anyone the sack .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们从未真的辞退过什么人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He got the sack for stealing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因偷东西而被解雇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She claimed she’d been threatened with the sack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她称自己受到过解雇的威胁。

Sense.DEF: to go to bed
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s one o’clock – time to hit the sack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1点钟了——该睡觉了。

Sense.DEF: in bed – used to talk about sexual activity
Sense.TRAN: 在床上〔用于谈论性行为〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I bet she’s great in the sack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我敢打赌她床上功夫一流。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which an army goes through a place, destroying or stealing things and attacking people
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sack of Rome in 1527
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1527年对罗马城的劫掠

Sense.DEF: to dismiss someone from their job
Sense.EXAMPLE: They couldn’t sack me – I’d done nothing wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不能解雇我——我没做错什么事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was sacked from every other job he had.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他工作他做一次被解雇一次。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was sacked for being drunk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因为醉酒遭到解雇。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written and formal British English, people often prefer to use dismiss rather than sack .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面和正式英国英语中,人们更常说dismiss,而不说sack
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: People can be dismissed for misusing the Internet at work.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 上班时滥用因特网可能会被解雇。

Sense.DEF:
to knock down the
quarterback
in American football
Sense.TRAN: 〔在美式橄榄球中〕擒抱〔四分卫〕

Sense.DEF: if soldiers sack a place, they go through it destroying or stealing things and attacking people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Goths sacked Rome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哥特人洗劫了罗马城。

Sense.DEF: to go to sleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sacked out on the sofa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在沙发上睡着了。

Sense.DEF: rough cloth used for making sacks
to behave in a way that shows everyone you are sorry about something wrong you have done

a race in which the competitors, usually children, have to jump forwards with both legs inside a
sack
Sense.TRAN: 套袋赛跑〔通常为儿童玩的﹑双脚套上袋子的跳跃式赛跑〕

Sense.DEF:
the bread and wine that are eaten at
communion an important Christian ceremony
Sense.TRAN: 圣餐〔基督教圣餐仪式中的面包和酒〕

Sense.DEF:
one of the important Christian ceremonies, such as marriage or
communion
Sense.TRAN: 圣事﹐圣礼〔如婚礼﹑圣餐等〕

Sense.DEF: relating to a god or religion
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sacred vow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神圣的誓言
Sense.EXAMPLE: the miraculous powers of sacred relics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣物的神奇力量
Sense.EXAMPLE: Certain animals were considered sacred.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些动物被认为是神圣的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The land is sacred to these tribesmen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块土地对这些部落成员而言是神圣的。

Sense.DEF: very important or greatly respected
Sense.TRAN: 很重要的﹐神圣的﹐深受尊重的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Human life is sacred.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人的生命是神圣的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Frontiers which have held for over forty years are no long-er sacred.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已经存在40多年的边界不再是不可动摇的了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Few things were sacred to Henry, but local history was one of them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对亨利来说很少有什么东西是宝贵的﹐但当地的历史可以算是其中之一。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He had no respect for everything I held sacred .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为重要的事情他全都不屑一顾。

Sense.DEF: used to express shock when something you think is valuable or important is being changed or harmed
Sense.TRAN: 怎么能这样呢？〔对有价值的或重要的事物被改变或受损害时表示惊讶〕

Sense.DEF: a belief, custom, system etc that is so important to some people that they will not let anyone criticize it
Sense.TRAN: 不容置疑的信念[习俗]﹔批评不得的制度
Sense.EXAMPLE: In New York’s show business scene, money, fame and power are sacred cows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在纽约的娱乐圈里﹐金钱﹑名声和权力是不容置疑的信条。

Sense.DEF: when you decide not to have something valuable, in order to get something that is more important
Sense.EXAMPLE: The minister stressed the need for economic sacrifice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长强调了在经济上作出牺牲的必要性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The workforce were willing to make sacrifices in order to preserve jobs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇员为了保住饭碗情愿作出牺牲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She brought three children up single-handedly, often at great personal sacrifice .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她独自一人把三个孩子带大﹐常常需要作出巨大的个人牺牲。

Subsense.DEF: the act of offering something to a god, especially in the past, by killing an animal or person in a religious ceremony
Subsense.TRAN: 献祭〔尤指旧时在宗教仪式中把动物或人杀死作祭品〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They made sacrifices to ensure a good harvest.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们举行献祭以保丰收。

Subsense.DEF: an animal, person, or object offered to a god in sacrifice

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In those days, an animal was offered as a sacrifice to God.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时候把动物作为祭品献给上帝。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: a human sacrifice a person killed as a sacrifice
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人祭

Sense.DEF: the act of dying while you are fighting for a principle or in order to help other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Captain Oates made the ultimate sacrifice in a bid to save his colleagues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥茨上尉为救同僚而牺牲了自己的生命。

Sense.DEF: to willingly stop having something you want or doing something you like in order to get something more important

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A Labour government chose to sacrifice defence for welfare.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一届工党政府选择牺牲国防来提高福利。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He sacrificed a promising career to look after his kids.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为了照看孩子牺牲了很有前途的事业。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: mothers who sacrifice themselves for their children
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了子女而牺牲自己的母亲们

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say give up rather than sacrifice .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们经常说give up,而不说sacrifice
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He gave up a promising career to look after his kids.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为照看孩子放弃了很有前途的事业。

Sense.DEF: to kill an animal or person and offer them to a god in a religious ceremony
relating to or offered as a sacrifice
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sacrificial ceremony
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 献祭仪式
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sacrificial lamb
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 献祭用的羔羊

Sense.DEF: when someone treats something holy in a way that does not show respect
when someone treats something that another person thinks is very important or special without enough care or respect

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is sacrilege (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s sacrilege to even think of destroying that lovely building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幢美丽的建筑﹐哪怕只是有把它拆除的念头都是不敬。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to take care of the holy objects in a church
a small room in a church where holy cups and plates are kept, and where priests put on their ceremonial clothes
something that is sacrosanct is considered to be so important that no one is allowed to criticize or change it
Sense.TRAN: 神圣不可侵犯的﹐不可更改的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Weekends are sacrosanct in our family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我们家﹐周末的时间是神圣不可侵犯的。

Sense.DEF: not happy, especially because something unpleasant has happened
Sense.TRAN: 不愉快的﹐伤心的﹐难过的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dad looked sad and worried as he read the letter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸读着信﹐看上去又难过又担心。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be sad to hear/see/read etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was very sad to hear that he had died.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 听说他去世我非常难过。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lilly felt sad that Christmas was over.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节过去了﹐莉莉感到很伤感。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was sad about the friends I was leaving behind.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要离开那些朋友﹐我很难过。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was such a sad look in her eyes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的眼神充满忧伤。

Sense.DEF: a sad event, situation etc makes you feel unhappy
Sense.TRAN: 令人伤心的﹐使人难过的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry to hear the sad news .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听到这令人伤心的消息我很难过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a sad case . The boy ended up in prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事情很惨﹐那个男孩最后进了监狱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a story with a sad ending
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 结尾令人伤感的故事

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is sad to see/hear etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was sad to see them arguing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到他们争吵真叫人心里难受。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This is a sad day for us all.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天对我们大家是一个伤心的日子。

Sense.DEF: very bad or unacceptable
Sense.TRAN: 〔状况〕糟糕的﹔令人无法接受的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There aren’t enough teachers, which is a sad state of affairs bad situation .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 师资不足﹐这种情况很糟糕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s sad if people are too afraid to go out alone at night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果人们吓得晚上都不敢独自出门﹐那就太糟糕了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sad fact is that prejudice still exists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可悲的是﹐偏见仍然存在。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Sad to say unfortunately , the country is heading towards civil war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很不幸﹐这个国家正在走向内战。

Sense.DEF: a sad person has a dull, unhappy, or lonely life
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a sad character – without any friends at all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个可悲的人——一个朋友都没有。

Sense.DEF: boring or not deserving any respect
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stay in on Saturday night? What a sad idea!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期六晚上待在家里？这想法多没劲！

Sense.DEF: having learned something from an unpleasant experience
Sense.TRAN: 因吃过苦头而变得聪明
Sense.EXAMPLE: He came out of the relationship sadder but wiser.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走出了那段恋爱关系﹐吃了苦头也学了乖。

Exponent.DEF: not happy
Exponent.TRAN: 伤心的,难过的,不开心的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She felt sad as she waved goodbye.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她伤心地挥手告别。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a sad and lonely figure
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 悲伤孤独的身影
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a sad face
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 愁容
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a sad film
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 悲伤的电影

Exponent.DEF: sad, especially for a long time – used about people and periods of time
Exponent.TRAN: 〔人或一段时间〕不开心的,不快乐的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was unhappy at school.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上学时候不快乐。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an unhappy childhood
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不幸的童年

Exponent.DEF: sad because you are away from your home, family, and friends
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She sometimes felt homesick when she first arrived in Japan.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她初到日本时有时会想家。

Exponent.DEF: feeling sad for a few hours or days, often for no reason
Exponent.TRAN: 〔常常无理由地持续几小时或几天〕情绪低落的,心情不好的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Whenever I’m feeling down, I go out and buy myself some new clothes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每次心情不好就出去给自己买几件新衣服。

Exponent.DEF: looking or sounding sad and without hope – used about people, places, and weather
Exponent.TRAN: 〔人〕消沉的﹔〔地方〕令人沮丧的﹔〔天气〕阴沉的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Why are you all looking so gloomy?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们大家为什么都愁眉苦脸的？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the gloomy immigration office
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 死气沉沉的移民局办公室
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a gloomy afternoon in February
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 2月里一个阴郁的午后

Exponent.DEF: looking sad and disappointed because something you hoped for did not happen
Exponent.TRAN: 垂头丧气的,沮丧失落的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘I didn’t pass,’ he said, looking dejected.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “我没有通过。”他说道,看上去垂头丧气的样子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a downcast expression
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 沮丧的表情

Exponent.DEF: looking or sounding sad
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the dog’s big mournful eyes
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那狗忧伤的大眼睛
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the mournful sound of the church bell
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 教堂钟声的悲鸣

Exponent.DEF: very sad, especially because you are lonely, cold, ill, or upset – used about people and periods of time
Exponent.TRAN: 〔人或一段时间〕极不愉快的,痛苦的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I felt miserable and blamed myself for what had happened.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生了这事,我感到难过而自责。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her life was miserable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的生活非常不幸。

Exponent.DEF: very sad and without hope for a long time, because things are wrong in your life or because of a medical condition
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因生活中的变故或生病而〕沮丧的,消沉的,忧愁的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: After his wife left him, he became depressed and refused to talk to anyone.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 妻子离开他以后,他变得很消沉,并且拒绝和任何人说话。

Exponent.DEF: extremely sad because of something that has happened to someone or something that you care about very much
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was heartbroken when her dog died.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 狗狗死时她心都碎了。

Exponent.DEF: very upset because of something bad that has happened, so that you cannot think clearly
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因发生不好的事情而〕苦恼的,忧虑的,心烦意乱的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was very distressed when he left her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他离开她之后,她伤心欲绝。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The boy’s hospital bed was surrounded by distraught relatives.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩的病床边围着忧心如焚的亲人。

Exponent.DEF: extremely sad and shocked, because something very bad has happened
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The whole town was devastated by the tragedy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这起悲剧事件让全镇的人都很悲痛。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= seasonal affective disorder 季节性情感紊乱﹐季节性情感障碍

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel sad
Sense.EXAMPLE: Those who knew him are saddened by his death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 认识他的那些人都为他的去世感到难过。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It saddened him that they no longer trusted him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不再信任他了﹐这让他很伤心。

Sense.DEF: a leather seat that you sit on when you ride a horse

a seat on a bicycle or a
motorcycle

Subsense.DEF: riding a horse
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We did six or eight hours in the saddle every day.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每天有六或八个小时骑在马背上。

Subsense.DEF: in a position in which you have power or authority
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He always has to be in the saddle, controlling everything.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是一定要掌握大权﹐控制一切。

Sense.DEF: a large joint of meat taken from the middle of the animal’s back
to put a saddle on a horse
to put a saddle on a horse

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was in the stable, saddling up his horse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在马廐里﹐给马装鞍。

Sense.DEF: to make someone have a job or problem that is difficult or boring and that they do not want
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been saddled with organizing the whole party!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我摊上了筹备整个派对的苦差事！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many farms were saddled with debts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多农场都背负债务。

Sense.DEF: a bag for carrying things, fixed to the saddle on a horse or bicycle
Sense.TRAN: 鞍囊﹐马褡裢﹔〔自行车车座后的〕挂包

Sense.DEF: someone who makes saddles and other leather products, or a shop where these are sold
saddles and leather goods made by a saddler
a shoe that has a toe and heel of one colour, with a different colour in the middle
Sense.TRAN: 鞍脊鞋〔一种鞋面中部与鞋头﹑鞋跟颜色不同的鞋〕

Sense.DEF: feeling stiff and sore after riding a horse or bicycle
Sense.TRAN: 〔骑马或骑自行车后〕感到疼痛并发僵的

Sense.DEF: someone who you do not respect, especially because you think their interests are boring or strange
Sense.TRAN: 呆瓜﹐傻蛋〔尤指因认为其兴趣乏味或怪异而看不起的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bunch of saddos dressed up as science fiction characters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一帮打扮得像科幻小说人物的怪人

Sense.DEF: a Hindu holy man who lives a very simple life
behaviour in which someone gets pleasure from hurting other people or making them suffer
Sense.EXAMPLE: There seemed to be an element of sadism in the training regime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个常规强化训练有种虐待狂的味道。

Sense.DEF: when someone gets sexual pleasure from hurting someone
someone who enjoys hurting other people or making them suffer
cruel and enjoying making other people suffer
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took sadistic pleasure in humiliating her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 羞辱她让他有一种施虐的快感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: sadistic fantasies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 施虐的幻想

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows that you are sad
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peter shook his head sadly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得难过地摇摇头。

Sense.DEF: unfortunately
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sadly, the business failed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很遗憾﹐这家企业经营失败了。

Sense.DEF: very much – used when talking about bad situations or states
Sense.TRAN: 极为﹐非常〔用于谈到不好的情形或状态〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The garden’s been sadly neglected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座花园已经完全荒芜了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good restaurants were sadly lacking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好饭店少得可怜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a popular man who will be sadly missed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他人缘很好﹐大家都会非常想念他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid you’re going to be sadly disappointed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕你要大失所望了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you think you’ll get any money from him, you’re sadly mistaken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你认为自己可以从他那里拿到点钱﹐你就大错特错了。

Sense.DEF: the state of feeling sad

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She sensed Beth’s deep sadness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感觉到了贝丝深深的哀痛。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was with great sadness that we learned of his death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们听到他去世的消息﹐感到极为悲痛。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a touch of sadness in his voice he sounded a little sad .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的声音里含着一丝悲伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His relief was tinged with sadness he also felt rather sad .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的欣慰中带着一丝哀伤。

Sense.DEF: when someone gets sexual pleasure from hurting someone or being hurt
an envelope on which you have written your own name and address, and usually put a stamp, so that someone else can send you something
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常贴足邮票并写有自己姓名地址的〕回邮信封
Sense.EXAMPLE: For further details, send an sae to the following address.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如需详细信息﹐可将回邮信封寄至下面的地址。

Sense.DEF: a trip to see or hunt wild animals, especially in Africa
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在非洲的〕野外观兽 [猎兽]旅行

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They went on safari in Kenya.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们去肯尼亚游猎。

Sense.DEF: a suit or jacket that is made of light material, usually with a belt, and pockets on the chest
Sense.TRAN: 轻便猎装/猎装夹克〔用轻便衣料做成﹐通常有腰带和胸袋〕

Sense.DEF: an enclosed area of land where wild animals are kept, so that people can drive round to look at them
Sense.TRAN: 〔可以驾车游览的〕野生动物园

Sense.DEF: not in danger of being harmed, lost, or stolen
Sense.EXAMPLE: She doesn’t feel safe in the house on her own.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她独自一人在家感到不安全。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The birds’ nests are high up, safe from predators.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸟巢筑在高处﹐安全地避开了捕食者。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure you keep these documents safe .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定要妥善保管这些文件。

GramExa.GLOSS: be completely safe
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 绝对安全
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your money will be as safe as houses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的钱将会安然无恙。

Sense.DEF: not harmed, lost, or stolen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your family are all safe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的家人都平安无事。

GramExa.GLOSS: unharmed, especially after being in danger
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔尤指经历危险后〕安然无恙的
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The missing children were found safe and sound.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 失踪的孩子们找到了﹐他们都安然无恙。

Sense.DEF: not likely to cause any physical injury or harm
Sense.TRAN: 不会造成危险的﹐安全的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Flying is one of the safest forms of travel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘飞机是最安全的出行方式之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t go near the edge – it isn’t safe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要靠近边缘——这不安全。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a safe working environment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安全的工作环境

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is safe (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is it safe to swim here?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里游泳安全吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The water is treated to make it safe to drink.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的水经过处理﹐可以安全饮用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: play areas that are safe for children
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安全的儿童游乐区

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We watched from a safe distance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在安全的距离观看。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Drivers should keep a safe distance from the car in front.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 驾驶员应该与前面的车辆保持安全距离。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Women are safer drivers than men.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性开车比男性安全。

Sense.DEF: not involving any risk and very likely to be successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: a safe investment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有风险的投资
Sense.EXAMPLE: a safe method of contraception
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安全的避孕方法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think it’s safe to say that the future is looking pretty good.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想可以肯定地说前景是乐观的。

Sense.DEF: a place where something is not likely to be stolen or lost
Sense.TRAN: 保险的地方﹐安全的地方

GramExa.PROPFORM: keep/put sth in a safe place
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Keep your credit cards in a safe place.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把信用卡放在安全的地方。

Sense.DEF: a journey etc when someone or something is not harmed or lost
Sense.TRAN: 平安的旅行/到达/归来等
Sense.EXAMPLE: His family celebrated his safe return home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家人庆祝他平安归来。

GramExa.GLOSS: said to someone when they start a long journey
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dad rang to wish me a safe journey.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸打电话来祝我一路平安。

Sense.DEF: a safe subject of conversation is not likely to upset anyone or make people argue
Sense.TRAN: 保险的﹐不会令人不快的﹐不会引起争议的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I kept to safe subjects, like the weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只谈一些无关痛痒的话题﹐例如天气。

Sense.LEXUNIT: to be on the safe side
Sense.DEF: to do something in order to be certain to avoid an unpleasant situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d take an umbrella, just to be on the safe side.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为稳妥起见﹐我还是带把伞好。

Sense.DEF: to be with someone who will look after you very well
Sense.TRAN: 在可靠的人手里﹐受到妥善照顾
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone wants to feel that their children are in safe hands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都希望认为自己的孩子交到了安全可靠的人手里。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is better to be careful, even if this takes time, effort etc, than take a risk that may have a bad result
Sense.EXAMPLE: Set the alarm clock – better safe than sorry!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给闹钟设好时间——宁求稳妥以免后悔啦！

Sense.DEF: completely certain that something is true or will happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: She went out, safe in the knowledge that no one else was awake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她确定其他人都没醒﹐就出去了。

Sense.DEF: someone you can trust to do a difficult job without making mistakes
used by young people to show approval of something
Sense.TRAN: 酷！棒！好！〔年轻人用来表示赞成某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Alex is having a party.’ ‘Oh, safe!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “亚历克斯要开派对。”“噢﹐太好了！”

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is good and that there is no problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How’s your new boss?’ ‘She’s safe.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你的新老板怎样？”“她挺好。”

Sense.DEF: a strong metal box or cupboard with special locks where you keep money and valuable things
said by young people as a greeting
Sense.TRAN: 嗨﹐喂〔年轻人打招呼时说〕

Sense.DEF:
a
safety-deposit box
Sense.TRAN: 〔银行里的〕贵重物品存放箱﹐银行保险箱

Sense.DEF: to protect something from harm or damage

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The industry has a duty to safeguard consumers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个行业有责任保护消费者。

Sense.EXAMPLE: technology that will safeguard the environment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将会保护环境的技术

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a program for safeguarding the computer system against viruses
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机系统防病毒程序

Sense.DEF: a rule, agreement etc that is intended to protect someone or something from possible dangers or problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: International safeguards prevent the increase of nuclear weapons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际安全条约防止核武器数量增加。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: safeguards against the exploitation of children
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 避免儿童遭受剥削的保护措施

Sense.DEF: a place where someone can go in order to escape from possible danger or attack

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The prime minister wanted to create a safe haven for the refugees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相想要为难民建一个避难所。

Sense.DEF: a house where someone can hide and be protected. Safe houses are used especially by criminals hiding from the police, or by people who are being protected by the police.
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指罪犯或受警方保护的人使用的〕安全屋﹐安全藏身处

Sense.DEF: the state of being kept safe, or the action of keeping something safe

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My passport was in the inner pocket of my bag, for safekeeping.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为安全起见﹐我的护照放在包的内袋里。

Sense.DEF: in a way that is safe
Sense.EXAMPLE: Drive safely!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安全行驶！
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think we can safely assume that she will pass the exam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们可以确信她会通过考试。

Sense.DEF: official protection for someone when they are in danger or passing through a dangerous area

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government offered safe passage to militants taking up their offer of peace talks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府向接受和平谈判的激进分子提供安全通行保障。

Sense.DEF:
ways of having sex that reduce the risk of spreading
aids
and other sexual diseases, especially by using a
condom

PIC.HEADING: SAFETY 安全
PIC.PICCONTENT: safety pin安全别针；safety harness安全带；safety goggles 护目镜

Sense.DEF: when someone or something is safe from danger or harm

GramExa.EXAMPLE: measures to improve the health and safety of employees
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 改善雇员健康状况和安全保障的措施

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were able to watch the lions in complete safety.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以绝对安全地观看狮子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For safety, always climb with a partner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为安全起见﹐登山一定要有同伴。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t travel alone, for safety’s sake .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为安全起见﹐不要独自一人旅行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For your own safety , please do not smoke inside the plane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了您自身的安全﹐请不要在飞机上吸烟。

Sense.DEF: how safe something is to use, do etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Campaigners have challenged the safety of genetically modified foods.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 活动参加者对转基因食品的安全性提出了质疑。

GramExa.GLOSS: things that are done in order to make sure that something is safe
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 安全标准/条例/预防措施等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The device meets safety standards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 此设备符合安全标准。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lower speed limits are part of a new road safety campaign.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 降低汽车限速是新的道路安全运动的一个内容。

Sense.DEF: how safe someone is in a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boy had been missing for five days and there were fears for his safety.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩失踪已经五天了﹐大家都担心他的安全。

Sense.DEF: a place where you are safe from danger
Sense.TRAN: 安全的地方﹐没有危险的地方

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 30,000 people fled to the safety of the capital.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三万人逃往首都安全的地方。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Firefighters led the children to safety.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防员把孩子们带到安全的地方。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They reached safety seconds before the bomb went off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在炸弹爆炸前的几秒钟他们跑到了安全的地方。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is safer to be in a group than alone

a way of getting two points in American football by making the other team put the ball down in its own
goal
Sense.TRAN: 安全得分〔美式橄榄球中迫使对方在自己球门区内将球放下而得两分〕

Sense.DEF: a lock on a gun that stops anyone from shooting it by accident
Sense.TRAN: 保险机﹐保险栓〔枪上的一种锁定装置﹐用来防止意外走火〕

Sense.DEF: equipment etc that keeps you safe when you are doing something dangerous

a
seat belt
a lock on a gun that stops anyone from shooting it by accident
a thick curtain at the front of a theatre stage that prevents fire from spreading
a small box used for storing valuable objects, usually kept in a special room in a bank
Sense.TRAN: 〔银行里的〕贵重物品存放箱﹐银行保险箱

Sense.DEF: strong glass that breaks into very small pieces that are not sharp, used, for example, in car windows

a special lamp used by
miners
, with a flame which will not make underground gases explode
a match that you can light only by rubbing it along a special surface on the side of its box

a large net that is placed below an
acrobat
who is performing high above the ground, in order to catch them if they fall
Sense.TRAN: 〔高空杂技表演等用的〕安全网

Sense.DEF: a system or arrangement that exists to help you if you have serious problems or get into a difficult situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔一种帮助遇到严重问题或陷入困境者的〕安全保障措施[系统]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: State support should provide a safety net for the very poor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府补贴应该可以为极度贫困者提供保障。

Sense.DEF: someone in an organization who is responsible for the safety of the people who work there
Sense.TRAN: 安全员〔机构中负责员工安全的人〕

Sense.DEF: a metal pin for fastening things together. The point of the pin fits into a cover so that it cannot hurt you.

a
razor
that has a cover over part of the blade to protect your skin
a part of a machine that allows gas, steam etc to escape when the pressure becomes too great
something that allows you to get rid of strong feelings without doing any harm
Sense.TRAN: 疏导情绪的方法﹐排解情绪的途径
Sense.EXAMPLE: Being able to express emotion is a healthy safety valve for the relationship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能够把情感表达出来是两性关系中健康的排解方法。

Sense.DEF: a bright yellow spice that is used in cooking to give food a special taste and colour. It is sold as a powder or in thin pieces.
Sense.TRAN: 番红花（粉）〔用于调味和添色〕

Sense.DEF: a bright orange-yellow colour
to hang down or bend in the middle, especially because of the weight of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The branch sagged under the weight of the apples.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树枝被苹果压弯了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The skin around my eyes is starting to sag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我眼睛周围的皮肤开始下垂了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sagging roof
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凹陷的房顶

Sense.DEF: to become weaker or less valuable
Sense.EXAMPLE: attempts to revive the sagging economy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为振兴衰退的经济所作的努力

Sense.DEF: a long and complicated series of events, or a description of this
Sense.TRAN: 一长串的事件﹔长篇的描述
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole saga began back in May.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整件事情的开始要回溯到5月份。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She launched into the saga of her on-off engagement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始讲起她订婚复退婚的曲折长篇故事。

Sense.DEF: a long story about events that happen over many years

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a saga of four generations of the Coleman family
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关科尔曼家族四代人的家世小说

Sense.DEF: one of the stories written about the Vikings of Norway and Iceland
Sense.TRAN: 萨迦〔关于挪威和冰岛地区海盗的传说〕

Sense.DEF: able to understand and judge things very well
good judgment and understanding
a herb with grey-green leaves
someone, especially an old man, who is very wise
very wise, especially as a result of a lot of experience
Sense.EXAMPLE: sage advice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明智的忠告

Sense.DEF: a small plant that is very common in dry areas in the western US
something that is saggy hangs down or bends more than it should
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bed was saggy in the middle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 床中间塌下去了。

Sense.DEF:
the ninth sign of the
zodiac
, represented by an animal that is half horse and half human, which some people believe affects the character and life of people born between November 23 and December 21
someone who was born between November 23 and December 21
Sense.TRAN: 属人马座的人〔即11月23日至12月21日之间出生的人〕

Sense.DEF:
small white grains obtained from some
palm
trees, used to make sweet dishes with milk
used in India, especially during the period of British rule, when talking to a man in authority
Sense.TRAN: 先生﹐老爷〔印度对男子的一种尊称﹐尤用于英国统治时期〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good morning, sahib!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早上好﹐老爷！

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
say
mentioned before
Sense.EXAMPLE: The said weapon was later found in the defendant’s home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上述武器后来在被告家中发现。

Sense.DEF: to travel on or across an area of water in a boat or ship

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the first Europeans to sail across the Atlantic
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘船横渡大西洋的首批欧洲人

Sense.EXAMPLE: Three tall ships sailed past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三艘大船驶了过去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She always wanted to sail around the world .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直想要乘船环游世界。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re taking two months off to sail the Caribbean.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要请两个月假去加勒比海航行。

Sense.DEF: to start a journey by boat or ship
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sail at dawn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在黎明时起航。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re sailing for Antigua next week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们下星期要起航前往安提瓜岛。

Sense.DEF: to direct or control the movement of a boat or ship that has a sail
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blake sailed the ship safely through the narrow passage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布莱克驾船安全驶过这条狭窄的航道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My father taught me to sail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲教过我驾船。

Sense.DEF: to move quickly and smoothly through the air

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A ball came sailing over the fence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只球飞过围栏。

Sense.DEF: to move forwards gracefully and confidently
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sailed into the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她翩然走进房间。

Sense.DEF: to do or say something that is nearly wrong, illegal, or dishonest
Sense.TRAN: 近乎违法﹔几乎逾规﹔近乎说谎

Sense.DEF: to succeed very easily in a test, examination etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Adam sailed through his final exams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚当顺利地通过了期终考试。

Sense.DEF: a large piece of strong cloth fixed onto a boat, so that the wind will push the boat along
Sense.EXAMPLE: a yacht with white sails
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扬着白帆的游艇

GramExa.GLOSS: put the sails up or down

Sense.DEF: to begin a journey by boat or ship

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The following week the ‘Queen Elizabeth’ set sail for Jamaica.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了下周﹐“伊丽莎白女王”号起航前往牙买加。

Sense.DEF: moving along on a ship or boat that has sails

a flat board with a sail, that you stand on in the sport of
wind-surfing
a small boat with one or more sails
the sport or activity of travelling in or directing a small boat with sails
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bud has invited us to go sailing this weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴德邀请我们这个周末驾船出游。

Sense.DEF: a time when a ship leaves a port
Sense.EXAMPLE: Luckily, there was another sailing at 2 o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸好两点钟还有一班船。

Sense.DEF: a small boat with one or more sails
a large ship with sails
someone who works on a ship
Sense.EXAMPLE: Six British sailors drowned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 六名英国海员溺水身亡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were both experienced sailors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们两个都是经验丰富的水手。

Sense.DEF: someone who does or does not feel sick when they are on a boat or ship
a blue and white suit that looks like an old-fashioned sailor’s uniform, worn by small boys
someone who is given the title ‘saint’ by the Christian church after they have died, because they have been very good or holy
Sense.TRAN: 〔死后由基督教会追封的〕圣徒﹐圣人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Saint Patrick
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣帕特里克
Sense.EXAMPLE: Statues of saints lined the walls of the church.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教堂的墙边立着一排圣徒像。

Sense.DEF: someone who is extremely good, kind, or patient
Sense.TRAN: 圣人〔指道德高尚﹑善良或有耐心的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: His wife must have been a saint to put up with him for all those years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他妻子容忍了他那么多年﹐一定是个圣人。

Sense.DEF: a very large amount of patience
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need the patience of a saint for this job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做这份工作需要有极大的耐心。

Sense.DEF: having been made a saint by the Christian church
Sense.TRAN: 被（基督教会）追封为圣徒的

Sense.DEF: used when talking about a dead person
Sense.EXAMPLE: my sainted mother, God rest her soul
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我那在天国的母亲﹐愿上帝保佑她灵魂安息

Sense.DEF: used to express surprise or shock
Sense.TRAN: 我的妈呀！〔用于表示惊讶或震惊〕

Sense.DEF: the state of being a saint
completely good and honest, with no faults
Sense.EXAMPLE: She led a saintly and blameless life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的生活圣洁无瑕。

Sense.DEF: the day of the year when the Christian church remembers a particular saint
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教会纪念某一圣徒的〕圣徒节

Sense.DEF: says
in order to help, improve, or please someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He moved to the seaside for the sake of his health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为了健康而迁居海滨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I only went for Kay’s sake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是为了凯才去的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope he’s told the truth for his own sake because it will be good for him .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了他自己好﹐我希望他已经说出了真相。

Subsense.DEF: used when you are telling someone how important it is to do something or not to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 看在上帝的份上〔表示某事很重要〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: For goodness’ sake, don’t be late!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看在上帝的份上﹐千万别迟到！

Subsense.DEF: used to show that you are angry or annoyed
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What is it now, for God’s sake?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天哪﹐又怎么啦？

Sense.DEF: if you do something for the sake of it, you do it because you want to and not for any particular reason
Sense.TRAN: 只是想那样做〔没有特殊的原因〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She likes spending money just for the sake of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她喜欢花钱就是因为想花钱。

Sense.DEF: if something is done for its own sake, it is done for the value of the experience itself, not for any advantage it will bring
Sense.TRAN: 鉴于某事本身的价值﹐为某事本身的缘故
Sense.EXAMPLE: art for art’s sake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为艺术而艺术

Sense.DEF: if you say something for the sake of argument, what you say may not be true but it will help you to have a discussion
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s say, just for the sake of argument, that you’ve got £200 to invest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了方便讨论﹐比方说你有200英镑可用于投资。

Sense.DEF: a Japanese alcoholic drink made from rice

another spelling of
saleable
showing too much interest in sex
Sense.EXAMPLE: the media’s love of salacious gossip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 媒体对传播桃色八卦的热衷

Sense.DEF:
a mixture of raw vegetables, especially
lettuce
,
cucumber
, and tomato
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like some salad with your pasta?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的意大利面要配些色拉吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spinach salad
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菠菜色拉

GramExa.GLOSS: mix it all together, usually with a dressing

Sense.DEF: raw or cooked food cut into small pieces and served cold
a place in a restaurant, with different vegetables that you can choose to make your own salad
Sense.TRAN: 凉拌菜自助柜[长条桌]﹐色拉吧

Sense.DEF:
a thick light-coloured liquid, similar to
mayonnaise
, that you put on salad
the time of your life when you are young and not very experienced
Sense.TRAN: 少不更事的年代﹐青涩的年轻时代

Sense.DEF:
a liquid mixture made from oil and
vinegar
, for putting on salads

a small animal similar to a
lizard
, which lives on land and in the water
Sense.TRAN: 蝾螈〔一种形似蜥蜴的小动物〕

Sense.DEF:
a large
sausage
with a strong taste that is eaten cold
receiving money every month for the work you do, rather than for every week or every hour
Sense.EXAMPLE: salaried workers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 领月薪的员工

Sense.DEF: money that you receive as payment from the organization you work for, usually paid to you every month
Sense.EXAMPLE: The average salary for a teacher is $39,000 a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师的平均工资是39,000美元一年。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She’s now earning a good salary as an interpreter.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她现在当口译薪酬很高。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be earning a salary
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He won’t tell me what salary he’s on.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不告诉我他工资是多少。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She moved to a job with a higher salary.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她换了一份工资更高的工作。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It sounds an interesting job, but the salary is too low.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 听上去像是一份很有意思的工作,但是工资太低了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His annual salary is $200,000.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的年薪是20万美元。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What's your monthly salary?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的月薪是多少？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the basic amount that someone is paid
the salary someone gets when they start a job

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was given a huge salary increase.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获得了大幅加薪。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a decrease in someone’s salary
the list of increasing salaries that someone in a job can earn

Exponent.DEF: the money that you receive regularly for doing your job, usually paid to you every month. Salary is usually used for professional jobs such as teachers, managers, doctors etc.
Exponent.TRAN: 薪金,工资〔常指教师﹑经理﹑医生等专业工作的月薪〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Nurses earn a basic salary of £21,250.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士的基本工资是21,250英镑。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her salary is paid directly into her bank account.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的工资直接打入她的银行账户。

Exponent.DEF: the money you receive for doing a job
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The pay is pretty good.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 报酬相当不错。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Teachers are asking for higher pay.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师正在要求涨工资。

Exponent.DEF: the money that someone is paid every week by their employer, especially someone who works in a shop or factory
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指店员或工人每周领取的〕工资,工钱
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Practically all my wages go on housing and transport to work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的工资几乎都花在住房和上下班的交通费上。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The average weekly wage was £350.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 平均周薪是350英镑。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a wage increase
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 加薪

Exponent.DEF: the money that you receive regularly for doing your job, and from things such as a business or investments
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The amount of tax you have to pay depends on your income.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳税多少取决于你的收入。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People on low incomes are finding it difficult to pay their fuel bills.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 低收入者觉得支付不起燃油费。

Exponent.DEF: the total amount of money you earn from any job you do – used especially when the amount is different each month or year
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The average worker’s earnings have not kept up with inflation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人的平均工资跟不上通货膨胀。

Sense.DEF: a man who works in an office, often for many hours each day, and receives a salary as payment, especially in Japan
Sense.TRAN: 工薪职员〔尤指日本的白领人士〕

Sense.DEF: when you sell something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The use and sale of marijuana remains illegal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸食和贩卖大麻一直是违法的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Harvey gets a $50 commission every time he makes a sale sells something as part of his job .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈维每做成一笔生意可得到50美元的佣金。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Car salesmen will often bring down the price rather than lose a sale fail to sell something .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车推销员常常宁愿降价也不愿失去一笔生意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: arms sales to Iran
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对伊朗的军火销售

Subsense.DEF: the total number of products that are sold during a particular period of time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Britain’s retail sales all the things sold to the public in shops jumped 3.2 percent in April.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 4月份英国的零售销量猛增了3.2%。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sales of automobiles are up this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车销量今年增加了。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: We did not reach our summer sales targets .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们未能达到夏季的销售指标。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The company no longer releases its sales figures how much money it makes or loses from sales .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司不再公布自己的销售数字。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We grossed more than $500,000 in sales last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去年的销售总额超过50万美元。

Subsense.DEF: the part of a company that deals with selling products
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She found a job in sales.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她找到了一份销售部的工作。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a sales manager
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售部经理
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a worldwide sales force of 1,100
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全球范围内1,100人的销售队伍

Sense.DEF: available to be bought
Sense.EXAMPLE: Excuse me, are these for sale?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请问﹐这些是要出售的吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a ‘for sale’ sign in the yard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 院子里有一块写着“待售”的牌子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reluctantly, they put the family home up for sale made it available to be bought .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们万分不舍地把家里的房子拿去出售。

Subsense.DEF: available to be bought in a shop
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A wide range of postcards and other souvenirs are on sale in the visitors’ centre.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游客中心有各种明信片以及其他纪念品出售。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Stephen King’s new novel will go on sale will begin to be sold next week.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂芬·金的新小说将于下星期上市。

Subsense.DEF: available to be bought at a lower price than usual
Subsense.EXAMPLE: These gloves were on sale for only $9.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这副手套削价出售﹐只卖九美元。

Sense.DEF: a period of time when shops sell their goods at lower prices than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marsdon’s department store is having a sale this week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马斯顿百货商店本周大减价。

GramExa.GLOSS: when all the shops have a sale
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I picked up some real bargains in the January sales this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年1月份大减价时我买了些很便宜的东西。

Sense.DEF: an event at which things are sold to the person who offers the highest price
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sale of 17th-century paintings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 17世纪油画拍卖会

Sense.DEF: when a company makes a special effort to try to increase the amount of its products that it sells
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new sales campaign
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新一轮的促销活动

Sense.DEF: the things that someone says when they are trying to persuade you to buy something
if a shop buys something on sale or return, it can return the goods that it is unable to sell
Sense.TRAN: 剩货包退〔零售商可以把卖不完的货物退还给批发商〕

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项2

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: good
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company has reported continuing strong sales.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司公布销售持续强劲。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Sales for the first three months of this year were disappointing.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年前三个月的销售量令人失望。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: better than ever before
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The Ford Fiesta has achieved record sales in Italy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 福特嘉年华汽车在意大利实现了创纪录的销量。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 汽车销量/票房/书的销量等
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Car sales have fallen every month for the past two years.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去两年里汽车销量每月都在下跌。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company has annual sales of over $300 million.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司年销售额超过三亿美元。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: sales of things to the public in shops
sales of things to other countries
in shops in towns and cities

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Sales rose by 9% last year.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年销量上升了9%。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: become lower
Collocate.EXAMPLE: European sales have fallen by 12%.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲销量下降了12%。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: increase quickly and by a large amount
decrease quickly and by a large amount

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company said its sales figures continued to show growth.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司称其销售额继续表现出上升势头。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It achieved only 20% of its sales target.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 只完成了销售指标的20%。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the people who sell a company’s products
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The sales force had grown from 40 to 270.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售队伍从40人增加到了270人。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: how much a company sells
how much a company expects to sell

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company is expecting a 20% increase in sales next year.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司预计明年销量将会增加20%。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the amount of goods a company sells

Sense.DEF: something that is saleable can be sold, or is easy to sell
Sense.EXAMPLE: a saleable commodity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有销路的商品

Sense.DEF:
a room where things are sold by
auction
someone who sells things in a shop
someone who sells things in a shop
a young woman who sells things in a shop
Sense.TRAN: 女售货员﹐女店员﹐女营业员

Sense.DEF: a man whose job is to persuade people to buy his company’s products

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 计算机/汽车/保险等推销员

Sense.DEF: the skill or ability to persuade people to buy things as part of your job
someone whose job is selling things
someone who travels around, usually within a particular area, selling their company’s products
a small piece of paper that you are given in a shop when you buy something
a tax that you have to pay in addition to the cost of something you are buying
Sense.TRAN: 〔顾客购物时额外支付的〕销售税

Sense.DEF: a woman whose job is selling things
the salient points or features of something are the most important or most noticeable parts of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: the salient points of the report
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报告的要点

Sense.DEF: containing or consisting of salt
Sense.EXAMPLE: saline solution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盐溶液

Sense.DEF: a special mixture of water and salt
the liquid that is produced naturally in your mouth
a part of your mouth that produces saliva
to produce more saliva in your mouth than usual, especially because you see or smell food
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因见到或闻到食物而〕流口水﹐垂涎

Sense.DEF: to look at or show interest in something or someone in a way that shows you like or want them very much – used to show disapproval

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The media are salivating over the story.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 媒体对这则新闻趋之若鹜。

Sense.DEF: sallow skin looks slightly yellow and unhealthy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a woman with dark hair and a sallow complexion
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个黑头发﹑脸色蜡黄的女人

Sense.DEF: a sudden quick attack and return to a position of defence
an intelligent remark that is intended to amuse people
to go out in order to do something, especially something that you expect to be difficult or dangerous – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 出发﹐出去〔做困难或危险的事﹐常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each morning they sallied forth in search of jobs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们每天早上外出找工作。

Sense.DEF: a large fish with silver skin and pink flesh that lives in the sea but swims up rivers to lay its eggs
this fish eaten as food
a pink-orange colour

a kind of
bacteria
in food that makes you ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: a case of salmonella poisoning
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙门氏菌中毒病例

Sense.DEF: a place where you can get your hair cut, have beauty treatments etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an exclusive hair salon
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高级发廊

Sense.DEF: a shop where fashionable and expensive clothes are sold
a room in a very large house, where people can meet and talk
a regular meeting of famous people at which they talk about art, literature, or music, popular in the past in France
Sense.TRAN: 沙龙〔以前在法国流行的谈论艺术﹑文学或音乐的定期名流社交聚会〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a literary salon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文学沙龙

Sense.DEF: a public place where alcoholic drinks were sold and drunk in the western US in the 19th century

a comfortable room in a
pub
a car that has a separate enclosed space for your bags etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔有独立空间装行李的〕厢式小客车﹔大轿车
Sense.EXAMPLE: a four-door family saloon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 四门家庭厢式轿车

Sense.DEF: a large comfortable room where passengers on a ship can sit and relax

special trousers that are worn by
skiers
. They reach up to your chest and have
straps
that go over your shoulders.
Sense.TRAN: 滑雪服﹐滑雪裤〔长可至胸口﹐有肩带〕

Sense.DEF: a type of Latin American dance music

a sauce made from onions, tomatoes and
chillies
that you put on Spanish or Mexican food
Sense.TRAN: 辣番茄酱〔一种用洋葱﹑番茄和辣椒做的调味辣汁﹐常浇于西班牙或墨西哥食物上〕

Sense.DEF: a natural white mineral that is added to food to make it taste better or to preserve it
Sense.EXAMPLE: This might need some salt and pepper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里面也许要加点盐和胡椒粉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pinch of salt a very small amount
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一撮盐
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you pass the salt?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 递一下盐好吗？

Sense.DEF: someone who is ordinary but good and honest
Sense.TRAN: 世上的盐﹐地上的盐〔指普通但品行良好诚实的人〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: take sth with a pinch/grain of salt
Sense.DEF: to not completely believe what someone tells you, because you know that they do not always tell the truth
Sense.TRAN: 〔因某人不总是说实话而〕对某事半信半疑﹐有保留地相信某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of what he says should be taken with a pinch of salt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说的大部分话都不可全信。

Sense.DEF:
a type of chemical substance that is formed when an acid is combined with a
base
Sense.TRAN: 盐〔酸和碱形成的化合物〕

Sense.DEF: to add salt to food to make it taste better
Sense.EXAMPLE: salted peanuts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盐花生

Sense.DEF: to add salt to food to preserve it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meat is salted to store it through the winter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肉用盐腌着以存放一冬。

Sense.DEF: to put salt on the roads to prevent them from becoming icy
to save money for the future, especially dishonestly by hiding it
Sense.TRAN: 储蓄﹐把…存起来〔尤指不诚实地把钱私存起来〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She salted the money away in a secret account.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她偷偷把钱存在一个秘密账户里。

Sense.DEF: preserved with salt
Sense.EXAMPLE: salt pork
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 腌猪肉

Sense.DEF: water that contains salt, especially naturally in the sea
consisting of salt water
Sense.EXAMPLE: a salt lake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咸水湖

Sense.DEF: a small container for salt

a substance used in making
gunpowder powder that causes explosions
and matches
a small container for salt
a large vehicle that puts salt or sand on the roads in winter to make them less icy
living in salty water or in the sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: saltwater fish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海鱼

Sense.DEF: containing salt water
Sense.EXAMPLE: a saltwater lake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咸水湖

Sense.DEF: tasting of or containing salt
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slightly salty taste
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一丁点咸味
Sense.EXAMPLE: salty foods
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咸味的食物

Sense.DEF: language, a story, or a joke that is salty is amusing and often about sex
Sense.TRAN: 〔语言﹑故事﹑玩笑〕不正经的﹐下流的

Sense.DEF: a salubrious area or place is pleasant and clean, especially compared to other places – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔场所〕环境宜人的﹐清洁的〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the less salubrious area near the docks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 码头附近环境较差的地区

Sense.DEF: a salutary experience is unpleasant but teaches you something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Losing money in this way taught young Jones a salutary lesson.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样赔了钱也算让年轻的琼斯得了个不无益处的教训。

Sense.DEF: a word or phrase used at the beginning of a letter or speech, such as ‘Dear Mr Smith’
something you say or do when greeting someone
to move your right hand to your head, especially in order to show respect to an officer in the army, navy etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two soldiers saluted Lieutenant Cecil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那两名士兵向塞西尔中尉行了礼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The men jumped to their feet and saluted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些人赶紧起立敬礼。

Sense.DEF: to praise someone for the things they have achieved, especially publicly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: James Joyce was saluted as the greatest writer of the 20th century.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯·乔伊斯被誉为20世纪最伟大的作家。

Sense.DEF: to greet someone in a polite way, especially by moving your hand or body
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤用手或身体动作〕向…打招呼﹐向…致意

Sense.DEF: an act of raising your right hand to your head as a sign of respect, usually done by a soldier to an officer
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常指士兵向军官的〕敬礼﹐致敬
Sense.EXAMPLE: As they left, the corporal gave them a respectful salute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们离开时﹐下士恭敬地向他们行礼。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The officer raised his hand in salute.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名军官举手行礼。

Sense.DEF: something that expresses praise to someone for something they have achieved, or that expresses honour or respect to someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everyone at the table raised their glasses in salute.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 桌上每个人都举杯致意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His first words were a salute to the people of South Africa.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的开场白是向南非人民致意。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when guns are fired into the air in order to show respect for someone important
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 21-gun salute
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸣21响礼炮

Sense.DEF: to save something from an accident or bad situation in which other things have already been damaged, destroyed, or lost
Sense.TRAN: 〔从事故或糟糕情形中〕抢救出〔某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Divers hope to salvage some of the ship’s cargo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 潜水员希望能够抢救出船上部分货物。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They managed to salvage only a few of their belongings from the fire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们从大火中只抢救出几样自己的东西。

Sense.DEF: to make sure that you do not lose something completely, or to make sure that something does not fail completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: He fought to salvage the company’s reputation .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他竭力挽回公司的声誉。

Sense.DEF: when you save things from a situation in which other things have already been damaged, destroyed, or lost
Sense.EXAMPLE: a massive salvage operation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大规模的抢救行动

Sense.DEF: things that have been saved from an accident, especially when a ship has sunk
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在船沉没时〕抢救出的财物

Sense.DEF: something that prevents or saves someone or something from danger, loss, or failure

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A drug treatment program was Ron’s salvation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戒毒治疗计划拯救了罗恩。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Internet turned out to be the salvation of the company.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最终因特网挽救了这家公司。

Sense.DEF: in the Christian religion, the state of being saved from evil
a Christian organization that tries to help poor people
Sense.TRAN: 救世军〔基督教慈善组织〕

Sense.DEF: a substance that you put on sore skin to make it less painful
Sense.EXAMPLE: lip salve
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 润唇膏

Sense.DEF: if you do something to salve your conscience, you do it to make yourself feel less guilty
Sense.TRAN: 使良心得到宽慰﹐减轻内疚感

Sense.DEF: a large metal plate used for serving food or drink at a formal meal
Sense.TRAN: 〔正式用餐时端饭菜或饮料用的〕金属托盘
Sense.EXAMPLE: a silver salver
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银托盘

Sense.DEF: when several guns are fired during a battle or as part of a ceremony
the first in a series of questions, statements etc that you use to try to win an argument
Sense.TRAN: 〔在争论中提出的〕第一个问题﹐头一炮
Sense.EXAMPLE: Congressman Saunders fired the opening salvo during a heated debate on capital punishment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑德斯议员在有关死刑的激烈讨论中开了头一炮。

Sense.DEF:
sudden laughter,
applause
etc from many people at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 〔突然的〕一阵﹐一片〔笑声﹑掌声等〕

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a stranger, who helps you when you have problems or need something
a fast dance from Brazil, or the type of music played for this dance

Subsense.DEF: the same person, place, thing etc is one particular person etc and not a different one
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He sits in the same chair every night.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他每天晚上都坐在同一把椅子上。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They went to the same school.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们上的是同一所学校。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was born on the same day as me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和我同一天出生。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: It is those same people who voted for the Democrats who now complain about their policies.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正是那些当初投票选民主党的人﹐现在却抱怨起民主党的政策来。

GramExa.GLOSS: the same person or thing and not a different one – used to emphasize that what you are saying seems surprising
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 正是这一个/恰好是同一个〔用于强调﹐含惊讶意味〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We stood in front of the very same house in which Shakespeare wrote his plays.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们就站在莎士比亚创作戏剧的那所房子前面。

Subsense.DEF: used to say two or more people, things, events etc are exactly like each other
Subsense.TRAN: 〔两个或两个以上的人﹑物﹑事情等〕完全相同的﹐一模一样的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Both women were wearing the same dress.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两位女士穿着一模一样的连衣裙。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The same thing could happen again.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同样的事可能还会发生。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He gets the same pay as me but he gets his own office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和我拿同样的工资﹐但他有自己的办公室。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That’s funny – Simon said exactly the same thing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 真有趣﹐西蒙说了一模一样的话。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: The furniture is made in much the same almost the same way as it was 200 years ago.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家具的制造工艺和200年前的几乎一样。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often prefer to say that two amounts or values are equal rather than the same .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中,表示两个数量或价值相等,人们常常更喜欢用equal,而不是the same
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They demanded equal pay for work of equal value.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们要求同工同酬。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular person or thing does not change
Sense.TRAN: 同样的﹐没有变化的﹐一成不变的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her perfume has always had the same effect on me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身上的香水给我的感觉一如既往。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s the same old Peter – moody and irritable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他还是以前那个彼得——喜怒无常且爱发火。

Subsense.DEF: if two things happen at the same time, they both happen together
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Kate and I both went to live in Spain at the same time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和凯特同时移居西班牙。

Subsense.DEF: used when you want to say that something else is also true
Subsense.TRAN: 与此同时﹐同时〔用于表示另外的事情也属实〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We don’t want to lose him. At the same time, he needs to realise that company regulations must be obeyed.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不想失去他﹐同时他也要认识到公司的规章制度必须要遵守。

Sense.DEF: to have the same result or effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: It doesn’t matter whether she was happy to leave or not. It amounts to the same thing – she’s gone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想不想走无所谓﹐结果都一样——她已经走了。

Sense.DEF: something that you have heard many times before – used especially to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 老一套的说法/借口等〔尤作贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s the same old story – his wife didn’t really love him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还是那一套——他老婆并不真正爱他。

Sense.DEF: used to say that different actions, behaviour etc have the same result or effect
Sense.TRAN: 都一样﹐反正一个样〔用于表示行为或表现等不同但效果一样〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I could mail the letter or send a fax in the morning.’ ‘Same difference. It still won’t get there on time.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我可以明天上午寄信或者发个传真。”“都一样﹐反正都来不及了。”

Sense.DEF: for the same reasons – used when you want to say that something else is also true, especially something very different or surprising
Sense.TRAN: 同样地﹔由于同样的原因
Sense.EXAMPLE: I realise that he hasn’t come up with any new ideas, but by the same token we haven’t needed any.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道他没有想出什么新点子﹐不过我们也并不需要。

Sense.DEF: to be in the same difficult situation that someone else is in
Sense.EXAMPLE: Others in her profession are in the same boat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和她干同一行的人也处于同样的困境。

Exponent.DEF: used to say that two people, things, events etc are exactly like each other
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The houses on the street all look the same.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 街上的房子看上去全都一样。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They were doing the same jobs as the men, but being paid less.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她们做着和男人相同的工作,但是报酬却比他们少。

Exponent.DEF: used to say that there is very little difference between two people, things etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s just like his father.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他长得像极了他的父亲。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There are insects that look exactly like green leaves.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有的昆虫看上去跟绿叶极其相似。

Exponent.DEF: identical things are exactly the same in every way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The tablets were identical in size, shape, and colour.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些药片大小﹑形状和颜色完全一样。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: identical names
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 相同的名字

Exponent.DEF: two things that are indistinguishable are so similar that it is impossible to know which is which or to see any differences between them
Exponent.TRAN: 无法分辨的,无法区分的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The copy was indistinguishable from the original painting.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅复制品和真迹难以区分。

Exponent.DEF: two or more amounts, totals, levels etc that are equal are the same as each other
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Spend an equal amount of time on each essay question.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 每道作文题使用相等的时间。

Exponent.DEF: to be the same, even though you expect them to be different
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People often think that movie stars are special, but really they’re no different from anybody else.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们往往以为电影明星与众不同,但其实他们和其他人并没有分别。

Exponent.DEF: if you can’t tell the difference between two people or things, or if you can’t tell them apart, they look, sound, or seem exactly the same to you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Emma and Louise sound so alike on the phone that I can’t tell the difference.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃玛和路易丝在电话里的声音非常像,我都分不出来。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that two or more people or things are exactly like each other
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The coins may look the same but one’s a forgery.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些硬币虽然看起来一样﹐但其中有一个是假币。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your measurements are exactly the same as Dana’s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的尺寸和达纳的完全相同。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Thanks for your help – I’ll do the same for you one day.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢你的帮助——总有一天我会报答你的。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that a particular person or thing does not change
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Things just won’t be the same without Sam.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有萨姆在﹐情况再也不一样了。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often prefer to say that an amount or level remains constant rather than stays the same .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中,人们更常说数量或水平remain constant,而不说stay the same。

Subsense.DEF: used as a reply to a greeting
Subsense.TRAN: 你也一样！〔用于回答对方的问候〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Merry Christmas!’ ‘And the same to you, Ben.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “圣诞快乐！” “也祝你圣诞快乐﹐本。”

Subsense.DEF: used as an angry reply to a rude remark
Subsense.TRAN: 你也一样！〔用于生气地回答粗鲁话〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Up yours!’ ‘Same to you!’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “去你的！”“滚你的！”

Sense.DEF: in spite of a particular situation, opinion etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I realise she can be very annoying, but I think you should apologise all the same.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道她有时候会很讨厌﹐但我认为你还是应当向她道歉。

Sense.DEF: in spite of something that you have just mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not likely to run out of money, but all the same, I’m careful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不大可能会没有钱用﹐不过尽管如此﹐我还是很小心。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’s all the same to sb
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone does not mind what decision is made, would be pleased with any choice, or does not really care
Sense.TRAN: 对某人来说都一样﹐对某人来说无所谓
Sense.EXAMPLE: If it’s all the same to you, I’ll go this weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你无所谓的话﹐我这个周末去。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you feel the same way as someone else
Sense.TRAN: 我也一样〔用于表示与别人有同感〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m exhausted.’ ‘Same here!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我累死了。”“我也一样！”

Sense.DEF: used to ask for another drink of the same kind
Sense.TRAN: 再来一杯〔用于吩咐要同样的饮料〕

Sense.DEF: another person, thing etc like the one just mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 也是一样[相同]的〔用于指人或事物与刚才提及的那个一样〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has produced a string of thrillers, and this movie is just more of the same.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拍过一系列惊悚片﹐这部也是一样。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Same usually has ‘the’ before it.
F2NBox.TRAN: same前面一般都有the
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They both gave the same reasons for leaving.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他俩离开的理由一样。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The buildings all look the same.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些建筑看上去全都一样。
F2NBox.EXPL: You can also use ‘this’ or ‘that’ before same when it has a noun after it, to emphasize it.
F2NBox.TRAN: same后面有名词时,前面也可以使用this或that加以强调
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: At that same moment the telephone rang.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 与此同时,电话铃响了。
F2NBox.EXPL: Same never has ‘a’ before it.
F2NBox.TRAN: same前面从不用a
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We went to the same school (NOT 不说 a same school).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们上的是同一所学校。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I’d like the same sort of car as that (NOT 不说 a same car as that).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想要一辆那种样子的车。
F2NBox.EXPL: You can say that one thing is the same as another. Do not use ‘like’ or ‘with’ after same.
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示一物与另一物相同,可以说the same as,same后面不可用like或with
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: His answer was the same as mine (NOT 不说 the same like/with mine).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的回答和我的一样。

Sense.DEF: in the same way
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Rain’ and ‘reign’ are pronounced the same, even though they are spelt differently. rain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和reign发音相同﹐尽管拼法不一样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone had to dress the same as a well-known historical figure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都必须装扮成一位历史名人。

Sense.DEF: just like someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have my pride, same as anyone else.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和别人一样﹐我也有自尊心。

Sense.DEF: a boring lack of variety, or the quality of being very similar to something else
Sense.TRAN: 千篇一律﹐单调﹔相同性﹐共同之处

Sense.DEF: a couple, relationship etc between two men or two women
a marriage between two men or two women
boring and having very little variety
Sense.EXAMPLE: His novels tend to be very samey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的小说往往千篇一律。

Sense.DEF:
a type of Indian food made from meat or vegetables covered in thin
pastry
and cooked in hot oil
Sense.TRAN: 萨莫萨三角饺〔印度的一种油炸肉馅或菜馅饺〕

Sense.DEF: a large metal container used in Russia to boil water for making tea
a small boat used in China and Southeast Asia
a small part or amount of something that is examined in order to find out something about the whole

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d like to see some samples of your work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想看看你做的一些样品。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They took a blood sample to test for hepatitis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们取了血样做肝炎化验。

Sense.DEF: a small amount of a product that people can try in order to find out what it is like

GramExa.EXAMPLE: samples of a new shampoo
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新洗发剂的试用品

Sense.DEF: a small group of people who have been chosen from a larger group to give information or answers to questions
Sense.TRAN: 〔抽查的〕样本﹐被抽选的一组人员
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sample consisted of 98 secondary school teachers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抽样对象是98名中学教师。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Out of a random sample of drivers, 21% had been in an accident in the previous year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在随机抽样调查的驾驶员中﹐有21%曾在上一年发生过事故。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nationally representative sample of over 950 elderly persons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抽选950余位老人作为全国具有代表性的样本

Sense.DEF:
a small part of a song from a
cd
or record that is used in a new song
Sense.TRAN: 节录乐曲〔用在新曲子中的﹑选自唱片中某一首曲子的一小段旋律〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her latest album makes extensive use of samples from a wide range of acid jazz tracks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的最新专辑从各类迷幻爵士乐中选用了大量节录乐曲。

Sense.DEF: to taste food or drink in order to see what it is like
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chance to sample the local food
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 品尝当地食品的一个机会

Sense.DEF: to choose some people from a larger group in order to ask them questions or get information from them
Sense.EXAMPLE: 18% of the adults sampled admitted having had problems with alcohol abuse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在接受抽样调查的成年人中有18%承认有过酗酒问题。

Sense.DEF: to try an activity, go to a place etc in order to see what it is like
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here’s your chance to sample the delights of country life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让你体验乡村生活乐趣的机会来了。

Sense.DEF:
to use a small part of a song from a
cd
or record in a new song
Sense.TRAN: 节录〔唱片的某一首曲子﹐用于新乐曲中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of his songs have been sampled by other artists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的许多歌曲都被别的歌手节录过。

Sense.DEF: a machine that can record sounds or music so that you can change them and use them for a new piece of music
a piece of cloth with different stitches on it, made to show how good someone is at sewing
a member of a powerful military class in Japan in the past
a type of hospital for sick people who are getting better after a long illness but still need rest and a lot of care
to make something seem morally right or acceptable or to give something official approval
Sense.TRAN: 正式认可﹐批准﹐使正当化
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rule of the Czar was sanctified by the Russian Orthodox Church.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙皇统治是经俄国东正教会认可的。

Sense.DEF: to make something holy
behaving as if you are morally better than other people, in a way that is annoying – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 假装圣洁的﹐伪善的﹐自认为道德高尚的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: sanctimonious politicians preaching about family values
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大谈家庭价值观的虚伪政客

Sense.DEF: official orders or laws stopping trade, communication etc with another country, as a way of forcing its leaders to make political changes

GramExa.EXAMPLE: US sanctions against Cuba
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国对古巴的制裁

Sense.EXAMPLE: a resolution to impose sanctions start using sanctions on DPRK
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对朝鲜实施制裁的决议
Sense.EXAMPLE: the threat of trade sanctions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贸易制裁的威胁
Sense.EXAMPLE: The UN security council may impose economic sanctions .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国安理会可能会实施经济制裁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any talk about lifting sanctions ending them is premature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现时就谈取消制裁为时过早。

Sense.DEF: official permission, approval, or acceptance
Sense.EXAMPLE: Apparently, the aide had acted without White House sanction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名助理的所作所为显然未经过白宫的批准。

Sense.DEF: a form of punishment that can be used if someone disobeys a rule or law
Sense.EXAMPLE: the harshest possible sanction which could be imposed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能采取的最严厉的处罚

Sense.DEF: to officially accept or allow something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The church refused to sanction the king’s second marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教会拒绝批准国王的第二次婚姻。

Sense.DEF: to be made acceptable by something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a barbaric custom, but one sanctioned by long usage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种野蛮但由来已久的风俗

Sense.DEF: the quality that makes life, marriage etc so important that it must be respected and preserved
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sanctity of the Constitution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宪法的无上尊严

Sense.DEF: the holy or religious character of a person or place
Sense.EXAMPLE: an aura of sanctity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神圣的气氛

Sense.DEF: an area for birds or animals where they are protected and cannot be hunted

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The park is the largest wildlife sanctuary in the US.

Sense.DEF: able to think in a normal and reasonable way

the past tense of
sing
courage and the ability to keep calm in dangerous or difficult situations

happy and hopeful about the future

Sense.DEF:
an American spelling of

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疾病因卫生条件很差而传播开来。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座缺少适当卫生设施的监狱

Sense.DEF: clean and not causing any danger to people’s health

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 营地里常常不太卫生。

Sense.DEF:
to clean something thoroughly, removing dirt and

Sense.DEF: when someone or something is being reasonable and sensible

the past tense of
sink

Sense.DEF: without – usually used humorously

Sense.DEF:

to make something weaker or destroy it, especially someone’s strength or their determination to do something

Sense.DEF: very wise

full of

Sense.DEF: thin transparent plastic, used for wrapping food

Sense.DEF: saying things that are the opposite of what you mean, in order to make an unkind joke or to show that you are annoyed

a

Sense.DEF: an English person – used by Scottish people in a humorous way or to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 英格兰人〔苏格兰人对英格兰人的戏称或贬称〕

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of

Sense.DEF: an examination that American high school students take before they go to college

Sense.DEF: the Devil, considered to be the main evil power and God’s opponent
relating to practices that treat the Devil like a god

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children were abused as part of a satanic ritual.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为撒旦崇拜仪式的一部分﹐这些儿童受到了虐待。

Sense.DEF: extremely cruel or evil
Sense.TRAN: 穷凶极恶的﹐极其邪恶的
Sense.EXAMPLE: satanic laughter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狰狞的笑

Sense.DEF: the practice of worshipping Satan
a leather bag that you carry over your shoulder, used especially in the past by children for carrying books to school
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指旧时小孩用的〕书包﹐小背包

Sense.DEF: feeling that you have had enough or too much of something, especially food or pleasure
a machine that has been sent into space and goes around the Earth, moon etc, used for radio, television, and other electronic communication
Sense.EXAMPLE: the launch of a communications and weather satellite
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 气象通信卫星的发射

GramExa.GLOSS: using a satellite
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This broadcast comes live via satellite from New York.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本节目通过卫星从纽约现场直播。

PIC.HEADING: SATELLITE 人造卫星
PIC.PICCONTENT: satellite 人造卫星；satellite dish 碟形卫星天线

Sense.DEF:
a natural object that moves around a
planet
Sense.EXAMPLE: The moon is a satellite of the Earth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月球是地球的卫星。

Sense.DEF: a country, area, or organization that is controlled by or is dependent on another larger one
Sense.EXAMPLE: a satellite country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卫星国

Sense.DEF: a town that has developed next to a large city
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stayed in Aurora, a satellite suburb of Chicago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们停留在奥罗拉﹐芝加哥的一个卫星郊区。

Sense.DEF: a large circular piece of metal that receives satellite television broadcasts
television programmes that are broadcast using satellites in space, and which you need a special piece of equipment to be able to watch
to satisfy a desire or need for something such as food or sex, especially so that you feel you have had too much
the condition of feeling that you have had enough of something, for example food
Sense.EXAMPLE: physical feelings of hunger and satiety
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饥饿和饱足等生理感觉

Sense.DEF: a type of cloth that is very smooth and shiny
Sense.EXAMPLE: a red satin ribbon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红缎带

Sense.DEF: having a smooth shiny surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new paints are available in gloss and satin finishes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这几种新的油漆有亮光的﹐也有缎面效果的。

Sense.DEF: smooth, shiny, and soft
Sense.TRAN: 光滑的﹐柔软的﹐亮泽的﹐缎子似的
Sense.EXAMPLE: women in tight, satiny dresses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身穿光滑面料的紧身礼服的女人

Sense.DEF: a way of criticizing something such as a group of people or a system, in which you deliberately make them seem funny so that people will see their faults
Sense.EXAMPLE: the characteristic use of satire in Jonson’s work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼森作品中讽刺手法的独到运用

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a comedy group that does political satire
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个专门搞政治讽刺的喜剧团体

Sense.DEF: a piece of writing, film, play etc that uses this type of criticism
Sense.TRAN: 〔文章﹑电影﹑剧本等的〕讽刺作品

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a satire on American politics
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于美国政治的讽刺作品

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a biting satire of the television industry
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对电视业的辛辣讽刺

Sense.DEF: someone who writes satire
to use satire to make people see someone’s or something’s faults
Sense.EXAMPLE: a play satirizing the fashion industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部讽刺时装业的戏剧

Sense.DEF: a feeling of happiness or pleasure because you have achieved something or got what you wanted
Sense.EXAMPLE: She got great satisfaction from helping people to learn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在帮助人们学习的过程中得到很大的满足。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ve passed all my exams’, he announced with satisfaction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我通过了所有的考试。”他满意地宣布。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Finance officials expressed satisfaction with the recovery of the dollar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 财政官员对美元价格的回升表示满意。
