GramExa.EXAMPLE: I didn’t want to give him the satisfaction of knowing that I was jealous.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想让他知道我嫉妒他而得意。

GramExa.GLOSS: because you want to be sure about something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: For her own satisfaction, she checked through the figures again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了放心﹐她把数字再检查了一遍。

Sense.DEF: if something is done to someone’s satisfaction, it is done as well or as completely as they want, so they are pleased
Sense.EXAMPLE: The question could not be resolved, at least not to my satisfaction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这难题无法解决﹐至少达不到让我满意的地步。

Sense.DEF:
when you get money or an
apology
from someone who has treated you badly or unfairly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got no satisfaction from the customer complaints department.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顾客投诉部的答复没有让我满意。

Sense.DEF: when someone gets something that they want, need, or have demanded

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the satisfaction of basic human needs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类基本需求的满足

Sense.EXAMPLE: sexual satisfaction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 性满足

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was hard work, but it gave her great satisfaction.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作很辛苦,但是给了她极大的满足。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: great satisfaction
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is real satisfaction in helping other people to overcome their problems.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 帮助别人克服困难能够得到极大的满足。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They expressed complete satisfaction with the agreement.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对协议表示完全满意。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: happiness with your own life or achievements
satisfaction that you express in a quiet, not very obvious way
enjoyment of your job
among customers/patients/voters etc
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 顾客/病人/选民等的满意度

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I get a lot of satisfaction from teaching.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 教书给了我很大的满足感。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They found satisfaction in helping others achieve their goals.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在帮助别人实现目标的过程中找到了满足。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He took great satisfaction in doing his job well.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他做好本职工作,从中获得极大的满足。

Collocate.COLLOC: have the satisfaction of doing sth
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 因为做某事而得到满足
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They have the satisfaction of knowing that the company needs them.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们知道公司需要他们,心中十分满足。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: To have won both awards in the same year gives us great satisfaction.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一年里两个奖项全都拿下给了我们极大的满足。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: As she looked at what she had created, she felt a quiet satisfaction.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看着自己的作品,暗自得意。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: performing such a difficult piece gave her a deep sense of satisfaction.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 演奏如此高难度的曲子给了她深深的满足感。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He allowed himself a little smile of satisfaction.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他露出了一丝满足的笑容。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the number of people who feel satisfied
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Research shows a high level of satisfaction with the system.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究表明,人们对这个系统的满意度很高。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: something that gives you a feeling of satisfaction

Sense.DEF: something that is satisfactory seems good enough for you, or good enough for a particular situation or purpose
Sense.TRAN: 令人满意的﹐够好的﹐合适的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His progress this term has been satisfactory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这学期的进步令人满意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an arrangement that is satisfactory to both sides
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 令双方都感到满意的安排

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There seems to be no satisfactory explanation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 似乎没有令人满意的解释。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: None of the solutions was entirely satisfactory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些解决办法没有一个是让人完全满意的。
令人满意的结果/结局/解决方法

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The question has not been satisfactorily answered.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题并未得到令人满意的回答。

Exponent.DEF: good enough – often used when something reaches a fairly good standard, but is not of a high standard
Exponent.TRAN: 令人满意的,还算可以的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her grades are satisfactory.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的成绩还算可以。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: For a beginner, this camera produces satisfactory results.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于初学者来说,这款相机的拍摄效果还是不错的。

Exponent.DEF: not bad, but not very good
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The meal was all right, but rather expensive.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 饭菜还可以,就是贵了点。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘How was the film?’ ‘It was OK.’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “电影怎么样？”“还行吧。”

Exponent.DEF: fairly good
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a reasonable standard of living
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 还算可以的生活水平
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The quality of the food was reasonable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 食物质量还算不错。

Exponent.DEF: if something is acceptable to you, you think it is good enough and you are willing to take it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an acceptable offer
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 可接受的提议
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an acceptable level of risk
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 可接受的风险程度
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They can't find a solution that is acceptable to both sides.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们找不到一个双方均可接受的解决办法。

Exponent.DEF: enough in quantity, or of a good enough standard. Adequate sounds rather formal and is used especially in official contexts.
Exponent.TRAN: 数量充足的﹔足够好的〔此词较正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an adequate supply of drinking water
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮用水的充足供应
Exponent.EXAMPLE: adequate standards of hygiene
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 合格的卫生水平

Exponent.DEF: good enough in quality – used especially when something is as good as most other things
Exponent.TRAN: 足够好的〔尤用于与大多数其他事物相比〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I want my kids to get a decent education.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望我的孩子能接受良好的教育。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Where can I get a decent cup of coffee?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪里能喝上一杯不错的咖啡呢？

Exponent.DEF: satisfactory, but not of the best quality – used especially about food and drink, or someone’s skill at doing something. Passable sounds rather formal.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指食物﹑饮品或某人的技巧〕过得去的,尚可的〔此词较正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a passable French wine
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 尚可的法国葡萄酒
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His Japanese was passable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的日语还过得去。

Exponent.DEF: to be of a good enough standard
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His work wasn’t up to scratch.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的作品不够好。

Exponent.DEF: to be good enough for a particular purpose
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Any kind of paper will do.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 什么纸都行。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘How about Ken?’ ‘I suppose he’ll do.’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “肯怎么样？”“我想他能行。”

Sense.DEF: feeling that something is as good as it should be, or that something has happened in the way that you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: a satisfied smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 满意的微笑
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have plenty of satisfied customers .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的许多客户都很满意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will she ever be satisfied?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她何时才能满足？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m not satisfied with the way he cut my hair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对他给我理的发型不满意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you’re not completely satisfied, you can get your money back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你不十分满意﹐可以退款。

Sense.DEF: feeling sure that something is right or true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was satisfied that he had done nothing wrong.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他确信自己没有做错什么。

Subsense.DEF: used to say in an annoyed way that you agree to do something that you do not really want to do
Subsense.TRAN: （你）该满意了吧？〔表示勉强同意某人的要求〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Okay, okay, I’ll ask him this afternoon. Satisfied?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好吧﹐好吧﹐我今天下午问他﹐满意了吧？

Subsense.DEF: used when you are annoyed with someone because they have done something that has a bad result
Subsense.TRAN: （你）满意了吧？〔因某人做了不好的事而表示不满〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Dad’s said neither of us can go now. Are you satisfied?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸说了﹐现在我俩谁也不能去。 这下你满意了吧？

Exponent.DEF: feeling that something is as good as it should be, or that something has happened in the way that you want
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The teacher is satisfied with his progress.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师对他的进步感到满意。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: another satisfied customer
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 又一位满意的顾客

Exponent.DEF: satisfied. Happy is very commonly used instead of satisfied in everyday English.
Exponent.TRAN: 满意的〔在日常英语中多用happy而非satisfied〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The boss seems happy with my work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 老板似乎满意我的工作。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m happy to work part-time until the kids are older.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我干点兼职的活儿就可以了,等孩子们大点再说。

Exponent.DEF: very satisfied
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m pleased with the results.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对结果非常满意。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He came out looking pleased with himself.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他出来了,看上去对自己很满意。

Exponent.DEF: satisfied with what you are doing, so that you do not want to change anything
Exponent.TRAN: 〔对自己的状态〕满意的,满足的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She seemed content to just sit and watch the others.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 只是坐着看着别人她似乎就满足了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sam was quite content with his life on the farm.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆很满足于农场生活。

Exponent.DEF: feeling that you have achieved enough in your life, and that you do not need things that are more interesting, important, or useful
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I enjoy being a mother, but to feel fulfilled I need to work too.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我享受做母亲的快乐,但是我还需要通过工作充实自己的生活。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel pleased by doing what they want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nothing I did would ever satisfy my father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我做什么都不能让父亲满意。

Sense.DEF: if you satisfy someone’s needs, demands etc, you provide what they need or want

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The program is designed to satisfy the needs of adult learners.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一课程是为满足成年学习者的需要而设计的。

GramExa.GLOSS: give someone enough food to stop them from feeling hungry
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 让某人吃饱/满足某人的胃口
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A salad won’t be enough to satisfy my appetite.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一份色拉是不够让我吃饱的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Just to satisfy my curiosity find out something , how much did it cost?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是好奇想问一下﹐这花了多少钱？

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel sure that something is right or true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jackson tried to satisfy me of his innocence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克逊试图让我相信他是清白的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Having satisfied herself that no one was there, she closed the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她确信那里没人﹐就把门关上了。

Sense.DEF: to be good enough for a particular purpose, standard etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you satisfied all the requirements for the general degree?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你达到普通学位的所有要求了吗？

Sense.DEF: making you feel pleased and happy, especially because you have got what you wanted
Sense.TRAN: 令人高兴的﹐令人满意的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deeply satisfying feeling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 深深的满足感

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It can be very satisfying to work in the garden.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在花园里干活可以让人十分满足。

Sense.DEF: food that is satisfying makes you feel that you have eaten enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: a satisfying meal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丰盛的一餐

Sense.DEF:
a piece of electronic equipment in a car. It can tell you which way you need to go by using information received from a
satellite
Sense.TRAN: （车载）卫星导航设备﹐卫星导航系统
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Audi A6 comes with sat-nav and climate control as standard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥迪A6车型的标准配置有卫星导航设备和空调系统。

Sense.DEF:
a special telephone that sends and receives its signal through a
satellite
that is moving around the Earth
Sense.TRAN: 卫星电话〔一种通过人造卫星接收和发送信号的电话〕

Sense.DEF: a fruit like a small orange, that has no seeds and a loose skin you can pull off easily
Sense.TRAN: 萨摩蜜橘〔一种无籽小蜜橘〕

Sense.DEF: to make something very wet
Sense.EXAMPLE: Water poured through the hole, saturating the carpet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水从洞里流进来﹐浸湿了地毯。

Sense.DEF: to put a lot of something into a particular place, especially so that you could not add any more

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our culture is saturated with television and advertising.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的文化里充斥着电视和广告。

Sense.DEF: to offer so much of a product for sale that there is more than people want to buy
to mix as much of a solid into a chemical mixture as possible
a type of fat from meat or milk products that is thought to be less healthy than other kinds of fat from vegetables or fish
Sense.EXAMPLE: Choose a type of spread that’s lower in saturates than butter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挑选一种饱和脂肪含量比黄油少的酱。

Sense.DEF: extremely wet

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a T-shirt saturated with sweat
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被汗水湿透的T恤衫

Sense.DEF: if a chemical mixture is saturated, it has had as much of a solid mixed into it as possible
a type of fat from meat and milk products that is thought to be less healthy than other kinds of fat from vegetables or fish
when an event or person is given so much attention by newspapers, television etc that everyone has heard about it
Sense.TRAN: 饱和报道﹐连篇累牍的报道
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trial was given saturation coverage by the press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报刊对这次审讯进行了连篇累牍的报道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: saturation advertising
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铺天盖地的广告

Sense.DEF: a military attack in which a whole area is bombed
the degree to which something has been mixed into something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep saturation below 80%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把饱和度保持在 80% 以下。

Sense.DEF: when something is made completely wet
a situation in which no more people or things can be added because there are already too many
Sense.EXAMPLE: The number of summer tourists in the area has reached saturation point .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一地区的夏季游客人数已经达到极限。

Sense.DEF: the state that a chemical mixture reaches when it has had as much of a solid substance mixed into it as possible
the day between Friday and Sunday

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We went for a picnic on Saturday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们星期六去野餐了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The festivities begin Saturday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 庆祝活动从星期六开始。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They arrived in Paris on Saturday evening.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们于星期六晚抵达巴黎。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I saw Sally last Saturday at the mall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上星期六在购物中心见到了萨莉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What are you doing this Saturday?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个星期六你要干什么？

GramExa.GLOSS: Saturday of next week
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ask her yourself next Saturday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下星期六你自己去问她。

GramExa.GLOSS: one of the Saturdays in the year
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was a crazy idea to go to the store on a Saturday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期六去商店真是个疯狂的想法。

Sense.DEF:
the
planet
that is sixth in order from the sun and is surrounded by large rings
an occasion when people enjoy themselves in a very wild and uncontrolled way
looking sad and serious, especially in a threatening way
Sense.EXAMPLE: his lean saturnine face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那消瘦又忧郁的脸

Sense.DEF: a god in ancient Greek stories, represented as half human and half goat
Sense.TRAN: 萨堤尔〔古希腊神话中半人半羊的神〕

Sense.DEF: a thick cooked liquid that is served with food to give it a particular taste

GramExa.EXAMPLE: vanilla ice cream with chocolate sauce
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加巧克力酱的香草冰激凌

Sense.EXAMPLE: spaghetti sauces
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意大利面酱

Sense.DEF: rude remarks made to someone that you should respect
Sense.EXAMPLE: Less of your sauce, my girl!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不得无礼﹐姑娘！

Sense.LEXUNIT: what’s sauce for the goose is sauce for the gander
Sense.DEF: used to say that if one person is treated in a particular way, other people should be treated in the same way
Sense.TRAN: 应该一视同仁﹐适于此者亦应适于彼

Sense.DEF: a container that has a handle and is shaped like a boat, used for serving sauce with a meal
a deep round metal container with a handle that is used for cooking
Sense.EXAMPLE: Heat the oil and garlic in a large saucepan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在大平底锅里把油和大蒜加热。

Sense.DEF: a small round plate that curves up at the edges, that you put a cup on
Sense.EXAMPLE: a china cup and saucer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套瓷茶杯和杯托

Sense.DEF: saucy jokes, remarks etc are about sex in a way that is amusing but not shocking
Sense.TRAN: 过时】〔玩笑﹑话语等〕粗鲁的﹐不雅的﹔开色情玩笑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: saucy postcards
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不雅的明信片

Sense.DEF:
a German food made from
cabbage a round green vegetable
that has been left in salt so that it tastes sour
a room that is heated to a very high temperature by hot air, where people sit because it is considered healthy
a period of time when you sit or lie in a room like this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have a sauna and massage every week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每星期洗一次桑拿浴﹐做一次按摩。

Sense.DEF: to walk in a slow relaxed way, especially so that you look confident or proud

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He came sauntering down the road with his hands in his pockets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他双手插在口袋里悠闲自在地沿路漫步。

Sense.DEF: a small tube of skin filled with a mixture of meat, spices etc, eaten hot or cold after it has been cooked
Sense.EXAMPLE: pork sausages
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猪肉香肠

Sense.DEF: nothing at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Have you heard from Tom yet?’ ‘No, not a sausage!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你有没有汤姆的消息？”“没有﹐毫无音讯！”

Sense.DEF:
a
dachshund
the soft meat mixture that is used to make sausages
Sense.TRAN: 灌香肠用的碎肉﹐香肠肉馅

Sense.DEF:
a piece of sausage meat surrounded by
pastry
to cook something in a little hot oil or fat
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sauté the onions for 5 minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把洋葱爆炒五分钟。

Sense.DEF: very violent or cruel
Sense.EXAMPLE: a savage dog
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条凶猛的狗
Sense.EXAMPLE: a savage murder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凶残的谋杀

Sense.DEF: criticizing someone or something very severely
Sense.EXAMPLE: a savage attack on the government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对政府的猛烈抨击

Sense.DEF: very severe
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has announced savage cuts in spending.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府宣布大幅度削减开支。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a savage storm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狂风暴雨

Sense.DEF: an offensive word used to describe people who have a simple traditional way of life
Sense.TRAN: 未开化的﹐原始的﹐野蛮的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a savage tribe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 野蛮部落

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He was savagely attacked and beaten.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他遭到了野蛮的袭击和殴打。

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for someone who has a simple, traditional way of life
if an animal such as a dog savages someone, it attacks them and injures them badly
to criticize someone or something very severely
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Prime Minister was savaged by the press for failing to take action quickly enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相因未能迅速采取行动而受到新闻界的猛烈抨击。

Sense.DEF: extremely cruel and violent behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: Local people were shocked by the savagery of the attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地人为这次凶残的袭击感到震惊。

Sense.DEF: a large flat area of grassy land, especially in Africa
someone who knows a lot about a subject
someone who has mental problems and may have lower intelligence than average, but who can do one thing very well, such as adding numbers very quickly
Sense.TRAN: 天才白痴〔指独通一行的精神病人或独开一窍的弱智者〕

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something safe from danger, harm, or destruction
Sense.EXAMPLE: Emergency aid could save millions threatened with starvation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧急援助可以拯救数百万受到饥饿威胁的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new treatment that could save his life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能够挽救他生命的一种新疗法
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was determined to save her marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决心挽救自己的婚姻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the campaign to save the rainforests
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拯救热带雨林的运动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He saved the child from drowning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他救起了那个溺水儿童。

Sense.DEF: to keep money in a bank so that you can use it later, especially when you gradually add more money over a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: He managed to save enough to buy a small house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想办法攒够钱买了一幢小房子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: So far, I’ve saved about £500.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到目前为止﹐我已存了大约500英镑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m saving up for a new car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正在存钱买新车。

Sense.DEF: to use less money, time, energy etc so that you do not waste any
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll save a lot of time if we go by car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要是开车去﹐可以节省很多时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone is being encouraged to save energy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都被鼓励节约能源。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ways to save money on heating bills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 节省取暖费的种种办法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: money-saving ideas
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 省钱的点子

Sense.DEF: to keep something so that you can use or enjoy it in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll save the rest of the food and have it later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把剩下的食物留着以后吃。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had a bottle of champagne which I’d been saving for a special occasion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有一瓶香槟﹐是留到特别的日子喝的。

Sense.DEF: to keep all the objects of a particular kind that you can find, so that you can use them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m saving up vouchers to get a cheap air ticket to the States.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在积存代金券来换一张去美国的便宜机票。

Sense.DEF: to help someone by making it unnecessary for them to do something that they do not want to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you lent me £5, it would save me a trip to the bank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你能借我五英镑﹐我就省得去一趟银行了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll take the shopping home in the car to save you carrying it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会把买的东西放在车里带回家﹐免得你用手拎着。

GramExa.PROPFORM: save sb the trouble/bother (of doing sth)
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll get a taxi from the station to save you the trouble of coming to collect me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会从火车站乘出租车﹐省得你费事来接我。

Sense.DEF: to stop people from using something so that it is available for someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you save me a seat?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我留个座位好吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll save some dinner for you if you’re late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是回来晚了﹐我们会给你留饭的。

Sense.DEF: to make a computer keep the work that you have done on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to save before you close the file.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在关闭文件之前﹐不要忘记保存。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you save the changes that you made?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把你做的改动保存了吗？

Sense.DEF: to stop the other team from scoring in a game such as football
Sense.EXAMPLE: The goalkeeper just managed to save the shot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 守门员刚好挡住了这次射门。

Sense.DEF: used to thank someone who has helped you out of a difficult situation or solved a problem for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thanks again for the loan – you really saved my life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再一次谢谢你借钱给我﹐你真是救了我啊。

Sense.DEF: to help someone to escape from an extremely difficult or dangerous situation
Sense.TRAN: 帮助某人逃脱困境[险境]
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lied in court to save his own skin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为了自保在法庭上撒了谎。

Sense.DEF: to stop things from going badly and make a situation end successfully
Sense.EXAMPLE: A local businessman saved the day by donating £30,000 to the school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位当地的商人向这所学校捐助了三万英镑﹐挽救了局面。

Sense.DEF: to do something that will stop you from looking stupid or feeling embarrassed
Sense.EXAMPLE: A compromise must be found which will allow both sides in the dispute to save face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须找到折中的办法﹐让纠纷双方都可以保住面子。

Sense.DEF: the one good thing that makes someone or something acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: His sense of humour was his only saving grace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幽默感是他唯一的可取之处。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb can’t do sth to save his/her life
Sense.DEF: to be completely unable to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He couldn’t draw to save his life!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 画画他可是一窍不通！

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that it is not worth saying anything, because nothing they say will make any difference to the situation
Sense.TRAN: 用不着白费唇舌﹐说也没有用
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried to explain, but she told me to save my breath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想解释﹐但她叫我还是省点口水吧。

Sense.DEF: to prevent someone from doing something that they want to do but that you think is harmful
Sense.TRAN: 阻止某人做某事以免自尝苦果

Sense.DEF: in the Christian church, to free someone from the power of evil and bring them into the Christian religion
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教〕拯救（某人）﹔使摆脱罪孽
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jesus came to save sinners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耶稣来是为拯救罪人而来。

Sense.DEF: an action in which a player in a game such as football prevents the other team from scoring
Sense.TRAN: 〔足球等守门员的〕救球﹐阻碍对方得分
Sense.EXAMPLE: Martin made a brilliant save from Nichol’s shot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马丁做了个精彩的救球动作﹐挡住了尼科尔的射门。

Sense.DEF: except
Sense.EXAMPLE: She answered all the questions save one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有问题﹐除了一个以外﹐她都回答了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Little is known about his early life, save that he had a brother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了知道他有个弟弟外﹐他的早期生活几乎不为人知。

Sense.DEF: someone who saves money in a bank
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mutual funds have been attractive to small savers people who save small amounts of money .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 共同基金对小额储户很有吸引力。

Sense.DEF: a street in London, known for having many expensive clothes shops for men which sell traditional, often hand-made, suits
Sense.TRAN: 萨维尔街〔伦敦的一条街﹐有许多昂贵的男装店〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Savile Row suit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨维尔街买来的一套西装

Sense.DEF: all the money that you have saved, especially in a bank
Sense.EXAMPLE: Buying a house had taken all their savings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 买房子花掉了他们所有的积蓄。

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that you have not spent, or an amount of something that you have not used
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new engines will lead to savings in fuel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种新引擎能节省燃油。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This represents a saving of £60,000.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这表示可以省六万英镑。

Sense.EXAMPLE: All small companies will need to make savings if they are to survive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的小公司若要生存就必得节省。

Sense.DEF: when you save money rather than spend it

a bank account in which you keep money that you want to save for a period of time, and which pays you
interest
on the money you have in it
a business, similar to a bank, that lends money, and into which you pay money that you want to save
Sense.TRAN: 储蓄贷款协会 贷款给会员购房用﹐会员也可在其中储蓄的商业机构〕

Sense.DEF:
a bank where people can save small amounts of money and receive
interest
on it

a
bond
that is sold by the US government and that cannot be sold from one person to another
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国政府发行的不能转卖给他人的〕储蓄公债

Sense.DEF: someone who saves you from a difficult or dangerous situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was seen by many as the saviour of the organization.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被许多人看作该组织的救星。

Sense.DEF: Jesus Christ – used by Christians
Sense.TRAN: 救主﹐救世主〔基督徒对耶稣基督的称呼〕

Sense.DEF: a child that is born so that cells from its body can be used to treat a sick brother or sister
Sense.TRAN: 救命宝宝〔为了救治哥哥或姐姐而出生的孩子〕

Sense.DEF: the ability to do and say the right things in social situations
Sense.TRAN: 机敏处事的才干﹐随机应变的能力

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
savour

the American spelling of
savoury
a plant that is used in cooking to add taste to meat and other food
to fully enjoy the taste or smell of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sipped her wine, savouring every drop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她慢慢地啜着酒﹐细细地品尝每一滴的滋味。

Sense.DEF: to fully enjoy a time or experience
Sense.EXAMPLE: She savoured her few hours of freedom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她充分享受那短短几小时的自由。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hesitated, savouring the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他踌躇着﹐细细品味这一刻。

Sense.DEF: to seem to involve something bad or to have some of a bad quality
Sense.TRAN: 有点…的成分﹐带有…的味道〔指不好的事或品质〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must avoid anything that savours of corruption.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须避免任何与腐败沾边的事。

Sense.DEF: a pleasant taste or smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sweet savour of wood smoke
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香甜的木柴烟味

Sense.DEF: interest and enjoyment
Sense.EXAMPLE: Life seemed to have lost its savour for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他来说﹐生活似乎已经了无乐趣。

Sense.DEF: savoury food tastes of salt
Sense.EXAMPLE: savoury party snacks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 聚会上的咸味小吃
Sense.EXAMPLE: pancakes with sweet and savoury fillings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 甜馅的和咸馅的薄饼

Sense.DEF: a savoury smell or taste is strong and pleasant but is not sweet
Sense.TRAN: 好闻的﹔味道可口的﹐美味的

Sense.DEF: unpleasant or morally unacceptable
Sense.TRAN: 令人不快的﹔名声不好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the customers in the pub looked none too savoury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒吧里有些顾客看上去不是善类。

Sense.DEF: a small piece of food with a salty taste that is served at a party
Sense.EXAMPLE: plates of cakes and savouries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一碟碟的糕饼和咸味小吃

Sense.DEF: practical knowledge and ability
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s obviously got a lot of political savvy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然他有丰富的政治见识。

Sense.DEF: someone who is savvy is clever and knows how to deal with situations successfully
Sense.TRAN: 聪明有见识的﹐能应对实际情况的
Sense.EXAMPLE: savvy consumers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在行的消费者

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
see
a tool that you use for cutting wood. It has a flat blade with an edge cut into many V shapes.
a short, familiar phrase or sentence that is considered to contain some truth about life
Sense.EXAMPLE: That reminds me of the old saw about being careful about what you wish for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这使我想起了许愿需谨慎的那条古训。

Sense.DEF: to cut something using a saw
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was in the back yard sawing logs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在后院锯木头。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He sawed through a power cable by mistake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他误把电缆给锯断了。

Sense.DEF: to cut something with a repeated backwards and forwards movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sawed at the loaf with a blunt knife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用一把钝刀来回切面包。

Sense.DEF: to remove something by cutting it off with a saw
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sawed off the dead branches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把枯枝锯掉。

Sense.DEF: to cut something into many pieces, using a saw
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tree was cut down and sawn up for logs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这棵树被砍倒﹐锯成了一段段木头。

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper money worth
very small pieces of wood that are left when you have been cutting wood
a factory where trees are cut into flat pieces that can be used as wood

a
shotgun
whose
barrel long thin tube
has been cut short so that it is easier to hide
a member of the race of people from northern Europe that came to live in England in the 5th century
Sense.TRAN: 撒克逊人〔北欧的一个民族﹐5世纪时定居于英格兰〕

Sense.DEF:
a curved musical instrument made of metal that you play by blowing into it and pressing buttons, used especially in popular music and
jazz
someone who plays the saxophone
to express an idea, feeling, thought etc using words
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m so tired,’ she said.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我太累了。”她说。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Don’t cry,’ he said softly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “别哭了。”他柔声说道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t believe anything he says.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说什么都不要相信。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A spokesman said that the company had improved its safety standards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名发言人说公司已经提高了安全标准。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I always said I would buy a motorbike when I had enough money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直说等我有了足够的钱就买一辆摩托车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did she say what happened?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有没有说发生了什么事？

Sense.EXAMPLE: I would like to say how much we appreciate your hard work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想说我们对你的辛勤劳动非常感谢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Why did she leave?’ ‘I don’t know – she didn’t say .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她为什么要离开？”“我不知道——她没说。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What did you say to her?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对她说了什么？

GramExa.PROPFORM: a terrible/silly/strange etc thing to say
GramExa.EXAMPLE: What a silly thing to say!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这话说得多傻！

GramExa.GLOSS: say something to greet someone, thank someone etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She left without saying goodbye.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不辞而别。

GramExa.GLOSS: apologize
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve said I’m sorry – what more do you want?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经道歉了——你还要怎样？

GramExa.GLOSS: agree or refuse
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can I go, Mum? Oh, please say yes!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以去吗﹐妈妈？唉﹐请你同意吧！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He looked as if he was going to say something.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看起来好像要说什么。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wished I had said nothing about Jordi.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真希望当时没有对乔迪发表任何意见。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Does anyone else have anything to say?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 还有人要说什么吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: Although he didn’t say so , it was clear that he was in pain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然他没说﹐但是他明显很痛苦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What makes you say that why do you think that ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么会那么说呢？

GramExa.GLOSS: tell someone to do something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nina said to meet her at 4.30.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼娜说4点30分和她碰头。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to say a few words make a short speech .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想简单地说几句。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘So what are your plans now?’‘ I’d rather not say .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那么你现在的计划是什么？”“我还是不说的好。”

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: You cannot ‘say someone something’ or ‘say someone to do something’ . Use tell .
F2NBox.TRAN: 不能说say someone something或say someone to do something,要用tell
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She told me (NOT 不说 said me) something shocking.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她告诉了我一件令人震惊的事。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He told me (NOT 不说 said me) to sit down.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他叫我坐下。
F2NBox.EXPL: You can say something about something but you cannot ‘say about something’ . Use talk .
F2NBox.TRAN: 可以说say something about something,但是不能说say about something,要用talk
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He did not talk about (NOT 不说 say about) his feelings.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有谈及自己的感受。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often avoid using say when referring to opinions or ideas expressed by another writer. Instead, they prefer to use a more formal verb such as argue , assert , claim , or maintain .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中,说到某位作者表达了什么意见或观点时,人们经常避免使用say,而是使用一个比较正式的动词,如argue, assert, claim或maintain。

Sense.DEF: to give information in the form of written words, numbers, or pictures – used about signs, clocks, letters, messages etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用文字﹑数字﹑图画〕表达〔信息〕﹐说明
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sign said ‘Back in 10 minutes’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牌子上说“十分钟后回来”。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The clock said twenty past three.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这钟显示时间为3点20分。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He received a letter saying that the appointment had been cancelled.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他收到一封信﹐说预约取消了。

GramExa.GLOSS: gives information about what you should do
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The label says to take one tablet before meals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 标签上写着饭前服一片。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The card doesn’t even say who sent the flowers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡片上甚至没说是谁送的花。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It says here they have live music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里说他们有现场音乐演出。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about what someone means
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you think the writer is trying to say in this passage?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为作者在这一段要表达什么意思？
Sense.EXAMPLE: So what you’re saying is, there’s none left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么你的意思是说什么都没剩下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you saying I’m fat?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的意思是说我胖吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not saying it’s a bad idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没说这主意不好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All I’m saying is that it might be better to wait a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是说最好等一等。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about something that people think is true
Sense.TRAN: 说〔人们认为是真实的事〕﹐据说

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They say that she has been all over the world.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们说她到过世界各地。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is said that he was a spy during the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说他在战争期间是个间谍。

GramExa.PROPFORM: sb is said to be sth/do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s said to be the richest man in the world.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说他是世界上最富有的男人。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, you know what they say – blood’s thicker than water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀﹐你知道大家都是这么说的——血浓于水。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rest, as they say , is history.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来的﹐就如他们所说的﹐都是尽人皆知的故事了。

Subsense.DEF: to show clearly that something is true about someone or something’s character
Subsense.TRAN: 表明〔某人的性格或某物的特质〕是…
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The kind of car you drive says what kind of person you are.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你开什么样的车说明你是哪种类型的人。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The fact that she never apologized says a lot about shows something very clearly what kind of person she is.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直没有道歉﹐这足以说明她是什么样的人。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It said a lot for the manager it showed that he is good that the team remained confident despite losing.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队虽败自信犹在﹐这充分说明主教练的执教有方。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: These results don’t say much for the quality of teaching they show that it is not very good .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些考试成绩说明教学质量不高。

Subsense.DEF: to show what someone really is feeling or thinking, especially without using words
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指不用话语〕显示﹐表明〔真实的感受或想法〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The look on her face said ‘I love you’.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上的表情写着“我爱你”。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His expression said it all.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的表情说明了一切。

Sense.DEF: to speak the words that are written in a play, poem, or prayer
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you say that line again, this time with more feeling?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能把那句台词再说一遍吗？这次多带些感情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll say a prayer for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会为你祈祷。

Sense.DEF: to pronounce a word or sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do you say your last name?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的姓是怎么念的？

Sense.DEF: used when suggesting or supposing that something might happen or be true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If we put out, say, twenty chairs, would that be enough?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们搬出去比方说20把椅子﹐够不够?

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let’s say your plan fails, then what?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 假设你的计划失败﹐那怎么办？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just say you won the lottery – what would you do?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 假定你中了彩票——你打算做什么？

Sense.DEF: to try to persuade yourself that something is true or not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: I kept saying to myself that this wasn’t really happening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不断地对自己说这不是真的在发生。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize what you are saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cake does look good, I must say.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得说﹐这蛋糕看上去真不错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have to say I was impressed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不得不说我印象很深刻。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not think or feel something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t say I envy her being married to him!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可不会羡慕她嫁给他！

Sense.DEF: used for giving your opinion even though other people may not agree
Sense.TRAN: 我倒是要说〔尽管别人可能不同意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d say he was jealous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 照我说他是在妒忌。

Sense.DEF: used when you do not know the answer to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t say who will win.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说不准谁会赢。

Sense.DEF: used to be polite when saying something that may embarrass or offend the person you are talking to
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s just the point, Mr Glover, if I may say so.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恕我直言﹐格洛弗先生﹐那正是问题的关键。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is true in spite of what you have just said
Sense.EXAMPLE: The diet can make you slim without exercise. Having said that, however, exercise is important too.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份食谱可以让你不用锻炼就能苗条﹐但话虽如此﹐锻炼还是很重要的。

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone whether they agree with the statement you have just made
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems very unlikely, wouldn’t you say?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这好像极不可能﹐你说对不对？

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone if they agree with a suggestion
Sense.TRAN: 你觉得怎样？你看行吗？〔用以询问某人是否同意所提的建议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We could go into partnership – what do you say?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以合作﹐你觉得怎样？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you say we all go to a movie?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大家一起去看电影﹐你看怎么样？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What would you say to a meal out?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们出去吃饭﹐你说好吗？

Sense.DEF: used to say that you understand what someone means, although they have not said it directly
Sense.TRAN: 别说了﹐不用再说了〔用以表示明白了某人的意思〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I saw him leaving her house at 6.30 this morning.’ ‘Say no more!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我看到他今天早晨6点30分从她家出来。”“不用说了！”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you completely agree with someone
Sense.TRAN: 你说得真对！〔表示完全同意某人的意见〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It’s cold in here.’ ‘You can say that again!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这里很冷。”“说得没错！”

Subsense.DEF: used when someone says something that you agree with, although you would not have actually said it yourself because it is not polite
Subsense.TRAN: 这可是你说的！〔表示同意某人的话﹐只是碍于礼貌自己不便说出〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘I was always stubborn as a kid.’ ‘You said it!’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我小时候总是很固执。” “这可是你自己说的！”

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you agree with someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Let’s go home.’ ‘You said it! I’m tired.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们回家吧。”“同意！我也累了。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not agree with a statement, opinion etc
Sense.TRAN: 谁说的？〔表示不同意别人的说法﹑意见等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who says museum work doesn’t pay?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁说博物馆的工作不值得干？

Sense.DEF: used to say that nobody can know something
Sense.TRAN: 谁能说得准？〔表示没有人知道问题的答案〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who can say what will happen between now and then?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁能说得准这段时间里会发生什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many women believe that skin cream makes their skin look younger, and who’s to say that they’re wrong?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多女性相信护肤霜会使她们的肌肤显得年轻﹐谁知道她们是不是错了呢？

Sense.DEF: used to show you are surprised by what someone has told you – also often used when you are not at all surprised by what someone has told you
Sense.TRAN: 不会吧！不至于吧！〔表示对某人所说的事表示惊讶﹐亦常用来表示一点也不觉得惊讶〕

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone to tell you when to stop pouring them a drink or serving them food because they have got enough
Sense.TRAN: 够了请说一声〔用于给某人倒饮料或添食物时〕

Sense.DEF: used to tell people to smile when you are taking their photograph
used to tell someone that they have only to ask and you will do what they want
Sense.TRAN: 只要你说一声〔表示愿意做某人要求的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anywhere you want to go, just say the word.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想去任何地方﹐你只要说一声。

Sense.DEF: used when you want to mention something good about someone, especially when you have been criticizing them
Sense.TRAN: 我也要为某人说句公道话〔尤用在批评过某人之后〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I will say this for Tom – at least he’s consistent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我也要为汤姆说句公道话——他至少能始终如一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve got determination – I’ll say that for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你很有决心——我也得为你说句公道话。

Sense.DEF: used when giving an opinion that you are sure is correct, even if the person you are talking to might disagree with you
Sense.TRAN: 即使你不同意﹐不管你怎么认为〔强调自己的看法没错〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Say what you like about him, he’s a very good writer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管你怎么看﹐他就是个非常优秀的作家。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you agree to do what they want, accept their opinion etc, especially because you do not want an argument
Sense.TRAN: 随便你﹐由你吧〔尤指说话人因不想引起争执而接受某人观点〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that you have made the best offer that you can
Sense.TRAN: 再公道不过了〔表示已提供了最好的条件〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I win, I’ll buy you a drink. Can’t say fairer than that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我赢了就请你喝杯酒﹐这样再公道不过了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you would like something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t say no to coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我倒不介意来杯咖啡。

Sense.DEF: used to say yes to a question, in a strong way
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Was there a big argument?’ ‘I’ll say!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “争得很厉害吗？”“就是啊！”

Sense.DEF: used when you do not want to give a lot of details about something
Sense.TRAN: 这么说吧﹐大致说来〔不想说具体细节时用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s just say she wasn’t very pleased about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么说吧﹐她对此不大高兴。

Sense.DEF: used when you are not quite sure how to describe someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is, shall we say, slightly unusual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这人﹐怎么说呢﹐有点怪怪的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: what have you got to say for yourself?
Sense.DEF: used to ask someone for an explanation when they have done something wrong
Sense.TRAN: 你还有什么可说的？〔用于要求做错事的人作出解释〕

Sense.DEF: used when you did not hear what someone said or when you cannot believe that something is true
Sense.TRAN: 你说什么？〔用于没听清别人的话或不敢相信某事属实时〕

Subsense.DEF: used to get someone’s attention
Subsense.TRAN: 喂﹐嘿﹐我说呀〔用于引起别人的注意〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I say, don’t I know you?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐我是不是认识你呀？

Subsense.DEF: used before giving your reaction to something
Subsense.TRAN: 啊﹐哟〔对某事作出具体回应前使用的开头语〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘My husband’s broken his leg.’ ‘I say! I’m sorry to hear that.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我丈夫腿骨折了。”“啊！听到这事我很难过。”

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone or say something unpleasant directly to them instead of saying it to someone else
Sense.TRAN: 当着某人的面直说[直接批评]
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew they wanted me to leave, even though they wouldn’t say it to my face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我也知道他们要我走﹐虽然他们没有当面这么说。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is not surprising that someone or something is better than another person or thing because the other person or thing is so bad
Sense.TRAN: 没什么奇怪的﹐没什么不寻常的〔表示另一人或物太糟糕〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This version is better than the original, but that’s not saying much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个版本比原版好﹐不过这也没什么可奇怪的。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you could have described something, criticized someone etc a lot more severely than you have
Sense.TRAN: 至少可以说﹐说得客气点
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jane could have been more considerate, to say the least.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说得客气点﹐简当时可以考虑得更周到一些。

Sense.DEF: used before giving more details or being more exact about something
Sense.TRAN: 那就是说﹐换句话说﹐更具体地说
Sense.EXAMPLE: They, that’s to say Matt and John, were arguing about what to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们﹐也就是马特和约翰﹐在争论该怎么办。

Sense.DEF: used to make sure the person you are talking to does not think something that is not true
Sense.TRAN: 那并不是说﹐那并不表示
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m quite happy in my job but that’s not to say I’m going to do it for the rest of my life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对自己的工作很满意﹐但这并不是说我就准备一辈子干这个工作。

Sense.DEF: used when adding a stronger description of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The information is inadequate, not to say misleading.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信息不够充分﹐更不用说还会误导别人。

Sense.LEXUNIT: a lot/something/not much etc to be said for (doing) sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that there are a lot of or not many advantages to something
Sense.TRAN: （做）某事有许多/有些/没有多少好处等
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a lot to be said for taking a few days off now and then.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偶尔休几天假大有好处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a town with very little to be said for it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是个乏善可陈的小镇。

Sense.DEF: used to mention another thing involved in what you have just been talking about
Sense.EXAMPLE: It wasn’t much for three years’ work, to say nothing of the money it had cost.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三年没有干出什么名堂﹐更不用说花掉的钱了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have something to say about sth
Sense.DEF: to be angry about something
Sense.TRAN: 为某事不高兴﹐对某事生气
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her father would have something to say about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事她父亲会不高兴的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a lot to say for yourself
Sense.DEF: to talk a lot
Sense.TRAN: 有许多话要说﹐有一肚子话要说

Sense.LEXUNIT: not have much to say for yourself
Sense.DEF: to not talk very much
used to emphasize who is in control in a situation
Sense.TRAN: 某人说了算﹔照某人说的办〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My wife wants to go to Italy this year, and what she says goes!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妻子想今年去意大利﹐她说了算！

Sense.DEF: to give your opinion about something, especially something you do not like
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指对不喜欢的事〕说出心里话﹐说出意见

Crossrefto.REFLEX: wouldn’t say boo to a goose

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone something, using words
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘I really ought to go,’ she said.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “我真的该走了。”她说。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Lauren said she’d probably be late.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳伦说她可能会晚到。

Exponent.DEF: to say something, especially in a definite or formal way – used in official contexts
Exponent.TRAN: 陈述,说明〔用于正式文体〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The witness stated that he had never seen the woman before.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 证人称他以前从未见过那名女子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Please state your name and address.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 请说出你的姓名和地址。

Exponent.DEF: to publicly tell people about something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The chairman announced his resignation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 主席宣布辞职。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The results will be announced tomorrow.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天公布结果。

Exponent.DEF: to say something very firmly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘My personal life is none of your business,’ she declared.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “我的个人生活与你无关。”她断然说道。

Exponent.DEF: to talk about someone or something, especially without giving many details
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Did Tom mention anything about what happened at school?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆有没有提到学校里发生了什么？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Your name was mentioned!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 提到你名字了！

Exponent.DEF: to let someone know your feelings by putting them into words
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Young children often find it difficult to express their emotions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 幼儿往往难以表达自己的情绪。

Exponent.DEF: to say what your opinion is about someone or something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The prime minister was asked to comment on the crisis.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相被要求对这次危机发表评论。

Exponent.DEF: to say that you have noticed that something is true – used especially in formal writing
Exponent.TRAN: 指出,谈到〔尤用于正式的书面文体〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We have already noted that most old people live alone.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经谈到大多数老人是独居的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Someone once remarked that the problem with computers is that they only give you answers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人曾经说过,电脑的问题在于它只提供答案。

Exponent.DEF: to say something more, after what has already been said
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He added that he thought it could be done fairly cheaply.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他又补充说,他觉得可以便宜点搞定。

Exponent.DEF: to mention something that seems particularly important or relevant
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Dr Graham points out that most children show some signs of abnormal behaviour.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷厄姆博士指出,大多数儿童都会显露出行为异常的某些迹象。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s worth pointing out that few people actually die of this disease.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 值得指出的是,很少有人真的死于这种疾病。

Exponent.DEF: to talk about your opinions, worries, or the things you disagree about

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The programme will give listeners the chance to air their views about immigration.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这档节目为听众提供了对移民问题发表看法的机会。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Workers were able to air their grievances.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们可以说出自己的不满。

Section.SECHEADING: DIFFERENT WAYS OF SAYING SOMETHING说的不同方式

Exponent.DEF: to say something very quietly, using your breath rather than your full voice
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Don’t wake the baby,’ Jenny whispered.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “别吵醒宝宝。”珍妮轻声说。

Exponent.DEF: to say something quietly without pronouncing the words clearly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He mumbled his thanks.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他嘴里含糊不清地说着感谢的话。

Exponent.DEF: to say something quietly, especially when you are annoyed but do not want someone to hear you complaining
Exponent.TRAN: 嘀咕,悄声说〔尤指不高兴,但又不想让人听到你在抱怨〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘This is ridiculous,’ he muttered under his breath.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “这真荒唐。”他轻声嘟囔着。

Exponent.DEF: to say something in a soft slow gentle voice
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She stroked his hair and murmured, ‘Don’t worry. You’ll be all right.’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她轻抚着他的头发柔声说道:“别担心,你会没事的。”

Exponent.DEF: to say something in a low angry voice
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘As I was saying,’ Lewis growled, ‘it needs to be finished today.’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “我刚才说过的,”刘易斯低声吼道,“今天必须完成。”

Exponent.DEF: to say something in a nasty angry way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Get out of my way!’ he snarled.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “滚开！”他吼道。

Exponent.DEF: to say something suddenly and loudly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘How beautiful!’ she exclaimed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “多美啊！”她惊叹道。

Exponent.DEF: to suddenly say something without thinking, especially something embarrassing or secret
Exponent.TRAN: 脱口说出〔令人难堪或秘密的事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was partly nervousness that had made him blurt out the question.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脱口问了这个问题,部分原因是紧张。

Exponent.DEF: to speak with a lot of pauses and repeated sounds, because you have a speech problem, or because you are nervous or excited
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因为口吃紧张或激动〕结结巴巴地说
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ll, I’ll only be a m-moment,’ he stammered.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “我——我只要一——一会儿。”他结结巴巴地说。

Sense.DEF: the right to take part in deciding something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The workers had no say in how the factory was run.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人在工厂管理方面没有发言权。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The chairman has the final say has the right to make the final decision about something .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主席有最后决定权。

Sense.DEF: to have the opportunity to give your opinion about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll get a chance to have your say.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会有发表意见的机会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Parents can have their say in the decision-making process.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长可以在决策过程中发表自己的意见。

Sense.DEF: used to express surprise, or to get someone’s attention so that you can tell them something
Sense.TRAN: 哎﹐我说〔用于表示惊讶或引起别人注意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Say, haven’t I seen you before somewhere?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎﹐我以前是不是在哪里见过你啊？

Sense.DEF: a well-known short statement that expresses an idea most people believe is true and wise
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t judge a book by its cover, as the old saying goes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老话说得好﹐人不可貌相。

Sense.DEF: someone’s permission to do something
Sense.TRAN: 某人的允许﹐某人的许可
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t leave the hospital without the say-so of the doctor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有医生的允许你不能离开医院。

Sense.DEF: based on someone’s personal statement without any proof
Sense.TRAN: 根据某人的个人意见〔而非真凭实据〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s hired a number of people on my say-so.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她经我一说雇了几个人。

Sense.DEF: a bend in a road in the shape of an ‘S’ that can be dangerous to drivers
a bend in a waste pipe in the shape of an ‘S’
a hard layer of dried blood that forms over a cut or wound while it is getting better

an insulting word for someone who works while the other people in the same factory, office etc are on
strike
Sense.TRAN: 拒不参加罢工的人﹔破坏罢工者﹐工贼〔侮辱性用语〕

Sense.DEF: a metal or leather cover for the blade of a sword
scabby skin is covered with scabs

a skin disease caused by
mites small creatures like insects
rude or shocking, especially in a sexual way
scabrous skin is rough, not soft
large numbers or quantities of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They got scads of calls from reporters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们接到大量记者打来的电话。

Sense.DEF: a structure built next to a wall, for workers to stand on while they build, repair, or paint a building
a raised structure which was used in the past as a place to kill criminals by hanging them or cutting off their heads
a structure that can be moved up and down to help people work on high buildings
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑工人用的〕升降吊架﹐吊篮

Sense.DEF: a set of poles and boards that are built into a structure for workers to stand on when they are working on the outside of a building

another spelling of
skag
the degree to which a computer system is able to grow and become more powerful as the number of people using it increases

if a piece of computer
hardware
or software is scalable, it continues to work well even if it is made bigger or connected to a larger number of other pieces of equipment
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机硬件或软件〕可扩缩的﹐可伸缩的﹐可扩展的

Sense.DEF:
a
scallywag
to burn your skin with hot liquid or steam
Sense.TRAN: 〔滚烫的液体或蒸汽〕烫伤〔皮肤〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t scald yourself with that kettle!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心别让水壶烫着！

Sense.DEF: a burn on your skin caused by hot liquid or steam
Sense.TRAN: 〔滚烫的液体或蒸汽造成的〕烫伤

Sense.DEF: extremely hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bowl of scalding water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一碗滚烫的水
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cup of scalding hot tea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯滚烫的茶

Sense.DEF: scalding tears feel hot on your skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scalding tears poured down her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 行行热泪从她的脸颊上滚落。

Sense.DEF: the size or level of something, or the amount that something is happening

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We had underestimated the scale of the problem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们低估了问题的严重性。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There has been housing development on a massive scale since 1980.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自1980年以来一直在大规模地进行住宅开发。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most alternative technologies work best on a small scale.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数替代性技术小规模使用效果最佳。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A structural survey revealed the full scale of the damage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结构检验揭示了实际受损程度。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was shocked by the sheer scale very big scale of the destruction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 破坏程度之大让我大为震惊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pollution could cause changes to weather patterns on a global scale.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 污染会引起全球气候模式的改变。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Large firms benefit from economies of scale ways of saving money because they are big .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大公司从规模经济中得益。

Sense.DEF: a whole range of different types of people or things, from the lowest level to the highest
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some rural schools have 50 pupils, while at the other end of the scale are city schools with nearly 5,000 pupils.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 某些农村学校只有50名学生﹐而规模大的城市学校却有近5,000名学生。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She gradually made her way up the social scale .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的社会地位逐渐提升。

Sense.EXAMPLE: animals which are lower down the evolutionary scale the range of animals that have developed gradually over a long time
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 进化级别中较低等的动物

Sense.DEF: a machine for weighing people or objects
Sense.EXAMPLE: a set of kitchen scales
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套厨房用秤
Sense.EXAMPLE: some new bathroom scales scales that you use to weigh yourself
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些新的浴室秤

Sense.DEF: a system of numbers that is used for measuring the amount, speed, quality etc of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于计量数量﹑速度﹑质量等的〕标准﹐级别

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The earthquakes measured 7 on the Richter scale.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次地震经测定为里氏7级。

Sense.EXAMPLE: changes to the company’s pay scale
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司工资等级的变动
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your performance will be judged on a scale of 1 to 10.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的表现将按1到10的标准来评定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We use a sliding scale in which prices are not firmly fixed for charges.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们采用浮动收费。

Sense.DEF: a set of marks with regular spaces between them on a tool that is used for measuring, or on the side of a mathematical drawing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ruler with a metric scale
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有公制刻度的尺子

Sense.DEF: the relationship between the size of a map, drawing, or model and the actual size of the place or thing that it represents
Sense.TRAN: 〔实物与图表﹑模型之间的〕比例（尺）﹐比率
Sense.EXAMPLE: a map with a scale of 1:250,000
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比例尺为1比250,000的地图

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All our models are made to scale.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们所有的模型都是按比例制作的。

GramExa.GLOSS: one done using a strict scale
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 按比例缩放的模型/绘画等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a scale drawing of the Eiffel Tower
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃菲尔铁塔的一幅缩尺图

Sense.DEF: a series of musical notes that become higher or lower, with fixed distances between each note
Sense.EXAMPLE: the scale of G major
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: G大调音阶

Sense.DEF: one of the small flat pieces of skin that cover the bodies of fish, snakes etc
a white substance that forms on your teeth
a white substance that forms around the inside of hot water pipes or containers in which water is boiled

Sense.LEXUNIT: the scales fell from sb’s eyes
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone suddenly realized something important
to climb to the top of something that is high and difficult to climb
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rescuers had to scale a 300-metre cliff to reach the injured climber.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 救援人员要登上300公尺的悬崖才能到达受伤的登山者所在地点。

Sense.DEF: to make writing or a picture the right size for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 改变〔文字﹑图片〕的尺寸大小﹐缩放

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The writing can be scaled to any size, depending on the paper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 文字可缩放到任何尺寸﹐视纸张的大小而定。

Sense.DEF: to be extremely successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the age of 21, he had already scaled the heights in the academic world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在21岁时就已登上学术界的高峰。

Sense.DEF: to reduce the amount or size of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The emergency aid programme has now been scaled down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧急救援计划现在已经缩减了规模。

Sense.DEF: to increase the amount or size of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Production at the factory is being scaled up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家工厂的生产规模在扩大。

Sense.DEF:
a
triangle
whose sides are each a different length
a type of young onion with a small round end and a long green stem
a small sea creature that you can eat, with a flat round shell made of two parts that fit together
Sense.TRAN: 扇贝〔一种小型海洋生物﹐可食用〕

Sense.DEF: one of a row of small curves that are used to decorate the edge of clothes, curtains etc
if the edge of something is scalloped, it is made into a row of small curves
scalloped potatoes, corn etc have been baked in a cream or cheese sauce
someone who causes trouble – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 调皮鬼﹐小坏蛋〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You rude little scally !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这个没规矩的小捣蛋！

Sense.DEF: a child who causes trouble but not in a serious way – used when you are not angry with them
Sense.TRAN: 调皮鬼﹐小坏蛋〔用于指小孩淘气但并不生他们的气时〕

Sense.DEF: the skin on the top of your head
Sense.EXAMPLE: Massage the shampoo gently into your hair and scalp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把洗发液轻轻揉进头发和头皮。

Sense.DEF: if you want someone’s scalp, you want them to be completely defeated
Sense.TRAN: 某人的头皮〔要某人的头皮表示要彻底击败某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The board members were after the chairman’s scalp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 董事会成员要彻底扳倒董事长。

Sense.DEF: to buy tickets for an event and sell them again at a much higher price
to cut the hair and skin off the head of a dead enemy as a sign of victory
Sense.TRAN: 剥下〔敌人〕的头皮作为战利品

Sense.DEF: a small, very sharp knife that is used by doctors in operations
someone who makes money by buying tickets for an event and selling them again at a very high price
a scaly animal or fish is covered with small flat pieces of hard skin
scaly skin is dry and rough
a clever but dishonest way to get money
Sense.EXAMPLE: He got involved in a credit card scam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他卷入了一桩信用卡诈骗事件。

Sense.DEF: to deceive someone in order to get money from them
a child who has fun by tricking people
to run with quick short steps, like a child or small animal

large
prawns sea creatures
that are covered in bread
crumbs
and cooked in hot oil
to examine an area carefully but quickly, often because you are looking for a particular person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: He scanned the horizon, but there was no sign of the ship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他朝地平线处仔细眺望﹐但是找不到那艘船的踪影。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She scanned his face, looking for signs of what he was thinking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她端详着他的脸﹐想知道他在想些什么。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Video cameras scanned the car park.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摄像机监视着停车场。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I scanned the street for people I knew.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我扫视街道﹐寻找认识的人。

Sense.DEF: to read something quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I scanned the page for her name.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我快速浏览那一页找她的名字。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She scanned through the paper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她浏览了一下报纸。

Sense.DEF: if a machine scans something, it passes an electrical beam over it to form a picture of what is inside it
Sense.EXAMPLE: All luggage has to be scanned at the airport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有行李在机场都得接受扫描检查。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They scanned his brain for signs of damage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们给他做了脑部扫描﹐检查是否有损伤迹象。

Sense.DEF: if you scan a document or picture, you put it into a machine attached to a computer so that the information in the document can be taken into the computer and stored there

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You scan the text into the computer, then edit it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把文本扫描进电脑﹐然后进行编辑。

Sense.DEF: poetry that scans has a correct regular pattern of beats
a medical test in which a special machine produces a picture of something inside your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: The scan showed that she was expecting twins.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扫描显示她怀了双胞胎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a brain scan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脑部扫描

Sense.DEF: when you read something quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a quick scan of the newspapers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 快速浏览报纸

Sense.DEF: an event in which someone, especially someone important, behaves in a bad way that shocks people
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指牵涉重要人物的〕丑闻﹐丑事
Sense.EXAMPLE: It caused quite a scandal when he left his wife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他离开妻子成了一大丑闻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The college has recently been involved in a drugs scandal .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所大学最近卷入了毒品丑闻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has been at the centre of a political scandal .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他成了一桩政治丑闻的焦点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a major scandal involving the government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 涉及政府的一桩重大丑闻
Sense.EXAMPLE: a series of financial scandals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一连串金融丑闻
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sex scandal that ruined his reputation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让他名誉扫地的性丑闻
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had already left the country when the scandal broke .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丑闻爆出时他们已经离开了这个国家。

Sense.DEF: talk about dishonest or immoral things that famous or important people are believed to have done
Sense.EXAMPLE: The magazine is full of gossip and scandal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本杂志登载的全是八卦内容。

Sense.DEF: to be very shocking or unacceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The price of petrol these days is an absolute scandal!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近日的汽油价格高得简直让人不能接受！

Sense.DEF: to make people feel very shocked
Sense.EXAMPLE: His outspoken views scandalized the nation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他直言不讳的言论让全国震惊。

Sense.DEF: someone who tells people untrue and shocking things about someone else
Sense.TRAN: 散布流言蜚语者﹐搬弄是非者﹐诽谤他人者

Sense.DEF: completely unfair and wrong
Sense.TRAN: 极不公正的﹐令人反感的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scandalous waste of public money
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骇人听闻的公款浪费
Sense.EXAMPLE: scandalous behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人反感的行为

Sense.DEF: involving stories about dishonest or immoral things that someone has done
Sense.EXAMPLE: scandalous stories about the prime minister
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关首相的丑闻故事

Sense.DEF: someone from the area of northern Europe that consists of Norway, Sweden, Denmark, and usually Finland and Iceland
Sense.TRAN: 斯堪的纳维亚人〔指北欧的挪威﹑瑞典﹑丹麦﹑芬兰和冰岛诸国居民〕

Sense.DEF: a machine that passes an electrical beam over something in order to produce a picture of what is inside it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a high-tech body scanner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高科技人体扫描仪

Sense.DEF: a piece of computer equipment that allows written or printed information to be taken onto a computer and stored there
Sense.TRAN: 〔把图文信息扫描进计算机的〕扫描装置﹐扫描仪

Sense.DEF: not enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: The story has received scant attention in the press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事没在报界引起多少注意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They produce goods with scant regard for quality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的产品不够重视质量。

Sense.DEF: a little less than a full amount of a particular measurement
not enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is only scanty evidence of his involvement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 显示他牵涉其中的证据不足。

Sense.DEF: scanty clothes are small and do not cover very much of your body – used to show disapproval
someone who is blamed for something bad that happens, even if it is not their fault

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She believed she had been made a scapegoat for what happened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她认为自己成了所发生之事的替罪羊。

Sense.DEF: one of the two flat bones on each side of your upper back
a permanent mark that is left on your skin after you have had a cut or wound
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a long, curved scar on his right cheek.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的右脸上有一道弯弯的长疤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deep cut that could leave a permanent scar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能会留下永久性疤痕的一道很深的伤口

Sense.DEF: a feeling of fear or sadness that remains with you for a long time after an unpleasant experience
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her mental scars will take time to heal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的精神创伤需要时间来治愈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The war has left a deep scar on this community.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争给这一群体留下了深深的创伤。

Sense.DEF: a place where the land or a building was damaged in the past

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The landscape still bears the scars of the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的景观仍旧可见战争的疮痍。

Sense.DEF: a cliff on the side of a mountain
if a wound or cut scars you, it leaves a permanent mark on your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: His hands were badly scarred by the fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的双手被那次大火烧得疤痕累累。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She will probably be scarred for life .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有可能留下永久的疤痕。

Sense.DEF: if an unpleasant experience scars you, it leaves you with a feeling of sadness or fear that continues for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was scarred by her father’s suicide.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲的自杀使她遭受心理创伤。

Sense.DEF: to spoil the appearance of something
Sense.TRAN: 损害…的外观﹐破坏…的景致
Sense.EXAMPLE: quarries that scar the landscape
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 破坏景致的采石场

Sense.DEF:
a type of large black
beetle
if something is scarce, there is not very much of it available
Sense.EXAMPLE: Food was often scarce in the winter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬季常常粮食短缺。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was fierce competition for the scarce resources .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这些紧缺资源的争夺非常激烈。

Sense.DEF: to leave a place, especially in order to avoid an unpleasant situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔为避免出现令人不快的情形而〕离开﹐溜走
Sense.EXAMPLE: I decided it was time to make myself scarce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得自己该走了。

Sense.DEF: scarcely
Sense.EXAMPLE: He could scarce believe it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他几乎无法相信此事。

Sense.DEF: almost not or almost none at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city had scarcely changed in 20 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城市20年中几乎没有什么改变。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country had scarcely any industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国几乎没有工业。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He scarcely ever left the region.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他几乎没有离开过这个地区。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was getting dark and she could scarcely see in front of her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 天色越来越黑﹐她几乎看不见眼前的东西。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Scarcely a day goes by when I don’t think of him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我几乎没有一天不想到他。

Sense.DEF: only a moment ago
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had scarcely sat down when there was a knock at the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他刚坐下就有人敲门。

Sense.DEF: definitely not or almost certainly not
Sense.EXAMPLE: Early March is scarcely the time of year for sailing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三月初可不是帆船运动的季节。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which there is not enough of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the scarcity of employment opportunities
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就业机会的短缺

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel frightened
Sense.EXAMPLE: Loud noises can scare animals or birds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噪声太大会惊吓到鸟兽。

GramExa.PROPFORM: scare the life/living daylights/hell etc out of sb
GramExa.GLOSS: scare someone very much
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The alarm scared the hell out of me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警报声把我的魂都吓没了。

GramExa.GLOSS: scare someone very much

Sense.DEF: to be frightened by things that are not very frightening
Sense.TRAN: 容易受惊吓﹐动不动就感到害怕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t scare easily, you know.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道我不是那么容易给吓倒的！

Sense.DEF: to make someone do something by frightening them or threatening them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can’t scare me into telling you anything.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你吓唬我也没用﹐我不会告诉你的。

Sense.DEF: to make an animal or person go away by frightening them
Sense.EXAMPLE: She moved quietly to avoid scaring the birds away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她动作很轻﹐不想把鸟儿吓走。

Sense.DEF: to make someone uncertain or worried so that they do not do something they were going to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rising prices are scaring off many potential customers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 涨价把很多潜在顾客都吓跑了。

Sense.DEF: to make something although you have very few things to make it from
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me see if I can scare up something for you to eat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来看看能不能给你凑合着弄点吃的。

Sense.DEF: a sudden feeling of fear
Sense.EXAMPLE: You really gave us a scare !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真的吓了我们一跳！

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a lot of people become frightened about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bomb scare
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸弹恐慌
Sense.EXAMPLE: a health scare
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 健康恐慌

Sense.DEF: an object in the shape of a person that a farmer puts in a field to frighten birds away
frightened of something, or nervous about something
Sense.TRAN: 害怕…的﹔对…感到惊慌[恐惧]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: At first, he was really scared.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚开始时他非常害怕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve always been scared of dogs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直怕狗。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t be scared of asking for help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要害怕开口求人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wanted to ask her out, but was scared that she might refuse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想约她出去﹐但又怕她会拒绝。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boys were scared to cross the street.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些男孩害怕过马路。

GramExa.PROPFORM: scared stiff/scared to death/scared out of your wits
GramExa.GLOSS: extremely frightened
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被吓呆了的/被吓得要死的/被吓傻了的
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was scared stiff at the thought of making a speech.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一想到要去演讲就吓得动弹不得。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Scared is slightly informal. In written English, people usually prefer to use afraid or frightened .
F2NBox.TRAN: scared略有些不正式。在书面英语中,人们一般更喜欢用afraid或frightened
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Many generations have been afraid of nuclear power.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 好几代人都害怕核能。

Sense.DEF: the practice of deliberately making people worried or nervous, especially in order to get a political or other advantage
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为取得政治或其他方面的优势〕散布恐怖消息﹐制造恐慌

Sense.DEF: a report, especially in a newspaper, that makes a situation seem more serious or worrying than it really is
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指报纸上的〕危言耸听的报道
Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite the scare stories in the media, no jobs will be lost at the factory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管媒体的报道危言耸听﹐但该厂不会有人失业。

Sense.DEF: methods of persuading people to do something by frightening them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Employers used scare tactics to force a return to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇主们用威逼手段迫使雇员复工。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
scary
a piece of cloth that you wear around your neck, head, or shoulders, especially to keep warm
to eat something very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She scarfed down a bagel on her way to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在上班的路上匆匆地吃了个面包圈。

Sense.DEF: to break and make loose the surface of a road or field using a pointed tool
Sense.TRAN: 〔用尖锐的工具〕挖开﹐翻松〔路面﹑田地〕

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone very severely
bright red
Sense.TRAN: 绯红色的﹐猩红色的﹐鲜红色的

Sense.DEF: if you go scarlet, your face becomes red, usually because you are embarrassed or angry

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Eileen blushed scarlet at the joke.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 听了这个笑话﹐艾琳的脸涨得通红。

Sense.DEF: a serious infectious illness that mainly affects children, causing a sore throat and red spots on your skin
a woman who has sexual relationships with many different people
a line of natural cliffs
to run away
Sense.EXAMPLE: They scarpered without paying their bill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没结账就开溜了。

Sense.DEF:
a piece of equipment used in some countries to connect electrical equipment so that video and sound signals can go from one piece of equipment to another, for example from a
video recorder
to a television
Sense.TRAN: 21针音视频连接器﹐SCART接口〔一些国家使用的一种电子设备上音视频互通接口﹐例如可用来将录像机连接到电视机〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a SCART cable
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: SCART连接线

Sense.DEF:
the plural of
scarf1
frightening
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scary moment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖的一刻
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scary movie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖片
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book is both scary and funny.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书既恐怖又有趣。

Sense.DEF:
a style of
jazz
singing, in which the singer sings sounds rather than words
Sense.TRAN: 〔爵士乐中不唱歌词的〕拟声唱法

Sense.DEF: a scathing remark criticizes someone or something very severely

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a scathing attack on the government’s planned tax increases
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对政府计划增税的尖刻攻击

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s always been so scathing about psychiatrists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 说到精神科医生﹐他总是出语尖刻。

Sense.DEF: too interested in or related to human waste, in a way that people find offensive
Sense.TRAN: 对粪便过分感兴趣的﹔关于粪便的
Sense.EXAMPLE: scatological humour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粗俗的幽默

Sense.DEF: if someone scatters a lot of things, or if they scatter, they are thrown or dropped over a wide area in an irregular way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Scatter the onions over the fish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把洋葱撒在鱼上面。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The flowers fell and scattered on the ground.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 花落下来﹐撒了一地。

Sense.DEF: if a group of people or animals scatter, or if something scatters them, they move quickly in different directions
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sound of gunfire made the crowd scatter in all directions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 枪声使人群四散奔逃。

Sense.DEF: not thinking in a practical way, so that you cannot do things or you forget or lose things
Sense.TRAN: 思想不集中的﹔疏忽健忘的

Sense.DEF:
a small
cushion
that you put on
sofas
and chairs for decoration
Sense.TRAN: 〔散放在沙发或椅子上用作点缀的〕小靠垫

Sense.DEF: spread over a wide area or over a long period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Broken glass lay scattered over the floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 碎玻璃散落在地板上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sky was scattered with stars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 天上繁星点点。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There will be some scattered showers short periods of rain in the afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下午将有零星阵雨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a widely scattered set of islands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分散得很广的一片群岛

Sense.DEF: a small number of things or people spread out over a large area
Sense.TRAN: 零星分散之物﹔零散稀疏的人群
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scattering of isolated farms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分散各处的几座偏僻的农场

Sense.DEF: someone who is scatty often forgets or loses things because they are not sensible or practical
Sense.TRAN: 心不在焉的﹐丢三落四的﹐没有头脑的

Sense.DEF: if an animal scavenges, it eats anything that it can find
Sense.TRAN: 〔动物〕以（任何找到的东西）为食
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pigs scavenged among the rubbish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猪在垃圾堆里觅食。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: rats scavenging for food
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 觅食的老鼠

Sense.DEF: if someone scavenges, they search through things that other people do not want for food or useful objects
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are people who live in the dump and scavenge garbage for a living.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人生活在垃圾场﹐以捡破烂为生。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Women were scavenging for old furniture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女人们在翻找旧家具。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Foxes and other scavengers go through the dustbins.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 狐狸和其他一些食腐动物在垃圾箱里翻找食物。

Sense.DEF: a situation that could possibly happen
Sense.TRAN: 可能发生的事﹐可能出现的情况
Sense.EXAMPLE: Imagine a scenario where only 20% of people have a job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设想一下这种情况: 只有20%的人有工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Under a likely scenario, world population will double by 2050.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很有可能世界人口到2050年将翻一番。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a possible scenario
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能出现的情况

GramExa.GLOSS: the worst possible situation
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 可能出现的最坏/噩梦般的情况
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The worst-case scenario was that he would have to have an operation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最坏的情况是他必须得动手术。

Sense.DEF: a written description of the characters, place, and things that will happen in a film, play etc

Subsense.DEF: part of a play during which there is no change in time or place
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Hamlet, Act 5 Scene 2
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《哈姆雷特》第5幕第2场
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the opening scene
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开场

Subsense.DEF: a single piece of action that happens in one place in a film, book etc
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战斗场面
Subsense.EXAMPLE: tender love scenes
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柔情蜜意的爱情戏
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The film contains some violent scenes.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片有几处暴力场面。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: colourful pictures depicting scenes from the Bible
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 描绘《圣经》场景的色彩丰富的图画

Sense.DEF: a particular set of activities and the people who are involved in them
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种活动的〕圈子﹐活动领域﹐…界﹐…坛
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not into the club scene going to night clubs .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢逛夜店。
Sense.EXAMPLE: LA’s music scene
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洛杉矶的音乐圈
Sense.EXAMPLE: the drug scene
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒品圈子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a newcomer to the political scene
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政坛新人

Sense.DEF: the place where an accident, crime etc happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police soon arrived at the scene of the crime .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察很快就到达了案发现场。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Investigators are now at the scene, searching for clues.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查人员正在现场寻找线索。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Journalists were on the scene within minutes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻记者几分钟后就到了事发现场。

Sense.DEF: a view of a place as you see it, or as it appears in a picture
Sense.TRAN: 〔某地方或图画中的〕景色﹐景象
Sense.EXAMPLE: He photographed a wide range of street scenes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拍下了丰富多彩的街景。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She returned home to find a scene of devastation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她回到家里﹐看到的是一片狼藉的景象。

Sense.DEF: what is happening in a place, or what can be seen happening

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were scenes of rejoicing after the election.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大选之后是一片欢庆的景象。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘It’s a bad scene here,’ she said. ‘Jamie is very sick.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “情况不妙﹐”她说﹐“杰米病得很重。”

Sense.DEF: a loud angry argument, especially in a public place
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在公开场合的〕争吵﹐吵嘴
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were angry scenes in parliament today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 议会今天出现了愤怒的争吵场面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was mad, but I didn’t want to make a scene .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我气疯了﹐但我不想大吵大闹。

Sense.DEF: to not be the type of thing you like
Sense.TRAN: 并非某人喜爱的事物﹐不合某人口味
Sense.EXAMPLE: Loud discos aren’t really my scene.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喧闹的迪斯科舞会并不合我的口味。

Sense.DEF: secretly, while other things are happening publicly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Behind the scenes, both sides are working towards an agreement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方在幕后努力想达成妥协。

Subsense.DEF: to provide the conditions in which an event can happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The prison riots have set the scene for major reform.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 监狱暴乱为重大改革铺了路。

Subsense.DEF: to describe the situation before you begin to tell a story
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A few words on the rules of English law will help to set the scene.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先用几句话介绍一下英国的法律规则﹐可以提供一个背景。

Sense.DEF: to be or become involved in a situation, activity etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: By then, there was a boyfriend on the scene.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到那时﹐她已经有一个男朋友了。

Sense.DEF: the natural features of a particular part of a country that you can see, such as mountains, forests, deserts etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The best part of the trip was the fantastic scenery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此次旅行最精彩之处就是那美妙绝伦的风景。

Sense.DEF: the painted background, furniture etc used on a theatre stage
surrounded by views of beautiful countryside
Sense.EXAMPLE: a region of scenic beauty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 景色优美的地区
