Sense.DEF: a longer way than usual, especially one that goes through beautiful or interesting areas – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 景色优美的路线〔尤指途经风景优美或富有情趣地区的路线﹐比一般路线行程要长﹐常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s take the scenic route home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走这条风景优美的路回家吧。

Sense.DEF: a pleasant smell that something has
Sense.EXAMPLE: a yellow rose with a lovely scent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香气怡人的黄玫瑰

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the sweet scent of ripe fruit
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 成熟水果那种甜甜的香味

Sense.DEF: the smell of a particular animal or person that some other animals, for example dogs, can follow
to give someone false information to prevent them from catching you or discovering something
Sense.TRAN: 〔提供错误信息〕使某人失去线索
Sense.EXAMPLE: Was he trying to put me off the scent because I had come too close to the truth?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是不是因为我快要发现真相了﹐他就想法儿误导我？

Sense.DEF: a liquid that you put on your skin to make it smell pleasant
to give a particular smell to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Honeysuckle and roses scented the air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空气中弥漫着忍冬和玫瑰的花香。

Sense.DEF: written to suddenly think that something is going to happen or exists
Sense.EXAMPLE: We scented danger and decided to leave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们觉察到有危险﹐便决定离开。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The press had immediately scented a story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻界立刻就嗅出有东西可写。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trade unions have scented victory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会预感到胜利在望。

Sense.DEF: if an animal scents another animal or a person, it knows that they are near because it can smell them
with a particular smell, especially a pleasant one
Sense.EXAMPLE: scented soap
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香皂

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dry cold air was scented with wood smoke.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 干冷的空气中飘着木柴烟的香味。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 玫瑰花香的/香草香的/松木香的等

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
sceptre
a person who disagrees with particular claims and statements, especially those that are generally thought to be true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sceptics argued that the rise in prices was temporary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 持怀疑态度的人士争辩说价格上涨是暂时的。

Sense.DEF: tending to disagree with what other people tell you
Sense.TRAN: 持怀疑态度的﹐不相信的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m extremely sceptical about what I read in the press.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对报纸上读到的东西极度怀疑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Environmental groups are sceptical of the government’s claims.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境保护组织对政府的声明持怀疑态度。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is highly sceptical of the reforms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对改革持极度怀疑的态度。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You can trust me,’ he said. Jane looked sceptical.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你可以相信我。”他说。而简看上去一脸怀疑。

Sense.DEF: an attitude of doubting that particular claims or statements are true or that something will happen
a decorated stick carried by kings or queens at ceremonies
a feeling of pleasure that you get when something bad happens to someone else
a plan of what someone is going to do and when they are going to do it

GramExa.GLOSS: at the planned time
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The majority of holiday flights depart and arrive on schedule.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分假日航班都能按时起降。

GramExa.GLOSS: before or after the planned time
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Meg’s new book is still well ahead of schedule.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅格的新书在进度上时间仍很充裕。

Sense.EXAMPLE: How can he fit everything into his busy schedule ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是怎么把所有的事情都排进自己忙碌的时间表的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to be working to a very tight schedule including a lot of things that must be done in a short time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的工作安排将会非常紧。

Sense.DEF: a list that shows the times that buses, trains etc leave or arrive at a particular place
Sense.TRAN: 〔公共汽车﹑火车等的〕时间表﹐时刻表

Sense.DEF: a formal list of something, for example prices
Sense.EXAMPLE: a schedule of postal charges
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邮费价目表

Sense.DEF: to plan that something will happen at a particular time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The elections are scheduled for mid-June.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 选举预定在6月中旬举行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her first album is scheduled for release in September.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的首张专辑定于9月份发行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Meetings are scheduled to take place all over the country.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议安排在全国各地举行。

GramExa.GLOSS: a plane service that flies at the same time every day or every week
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Prices include scheduled flights from Heathrow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格包括乘坐从希思罗机场起飞的定期航班的费用。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We will not cancel your holiday less than eight weeks before the scheduled departure date .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离预定出发日期少于八周﹐度假行程将不能取消。

Sense.DEF: a drawing or description of the main parts of something
showing the main parts of something in a simple way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a schematic diagram of DNA
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脱氧核糖核酸结构简图

Sense.DEF: to arrange something in a system
Sense.TRAN: 对…作系统性整合﹐使系统化

Sense.DEF: an official plan that is intended to help people in some way, for example by providing education or training
Sense.EXAMPLE: The money will be used for teacher training schemes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱将用于教师培训计划。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pension scheme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 退休金计划

GramExa.EXAMPLE: schemes for two new cross-city lines
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 建两条新的跨城铁路的规划

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new scheme to boost exports
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 促进出口的新计划

GramExa.GLOSS: something that is done on a small scale in order to see if it is successful enough to be done on a larger scale
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pilot scheme proved to be a great success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个试点项目非常成功。

Sense.DEF: a clever plan, especially to do something that is bad or illegal – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: a get-rich-quick scheme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快速致富的手段

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a scheme to pass false cheques
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 开假支票的诡计

Sense.DEF: a system that you use to organize information, ideas etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于组织整理信息﹑思想等的〕系统﹐体系
Sense.EXAMPLE: a classification scheme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分类系统

Sense.DEF: in the way things generally happen, or are organized
Sense.TRAN: 按事物的一般规律﹐在一般格局中
Sense.EXAMPLE: the unimportance of man in the whole scheme of things
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界万物中人类的渺小

Sense.DEF: to secretly make clever and dishonest plans to get or achieve something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She schemed to kill him with poison.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她密谋毒死他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He became aware that people were scheming against him and called an emergency meeting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他知道有人在密谋反对他﹐就召开了一次紧急会议。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s nothing but a lying, scheming little monster!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她就是个爱撒谎﹑爱算计的小巫婆！

Sense.DEF: a happy piece of music that is meant to be played quickly

the standard unit of money used in Austria before the
euro
Sense.TRAN: 奥地利先令〔欧元使用之前奥地利的标准货币单位〕

Sense.DEF: the separation of a group into two groups, caused by a disagreement about its aims and beliefs, especially in the Christian church
Sense.TRAN: 〔组织内由于目标﹑信仰上的分歧引起的〕分裂﹔〔尤指基督教的〕教会分裂

Sense.DEF: a type of rock that naturally breaks apart into thin flat pieces
typical of schizophrenia
Sense.TRAN: 精神分裂样的﹐类精神分裂症的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a schizoid personality disorder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分裂样人格障碍

Sense.DEF: quickly changing between opposite opinions or attitudes
Sense.TRAN: 〔意见﹑态度〕反复无常的﹐自相矛盾的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Martin’s latest play is as schizoid and erratic as its characters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马丁的新剧本和剧中的人物一样﹐自相矛盾﹐难以捉摸。

Sense.DEF: a serious mental illness in which someone’s thoughts and feelings are not based on what is really happening around them
relating to schizophrenia
quickly changing from one opinion, attitude etc to another
Sense.TRAN: 〔意见﹑态度等〕反复无常的﹐颠三倒四的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film was an example of schizophrenic movie-making at its worst.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一部内容颠三倒四﹑烂到底的影片。

Sense.DEF: someone who has schizophrenia
to carry or pull something heavy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I schlepped his bag all the way to the airport and he didn’t even thank me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把他的行李一路拖到飞机场﹐他竟然连一声谢谢也不说。

Sense.DEF: to spend your time lazily doing nothing useful
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spent the afternoon schlepping around the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一下午我都在屋子里游荡﹐无所事事。

Sense.DEF: things that are cheap and of poor quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gift store sells both tasteful gifts and cheap schlock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家礼品店既出售高档礼品﹐又经销劣质便宜货。

Sense.DEF: a schmaltzy piece of music, book etc deals with emotions such as love and sadness in a way that seems silly and not serious enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: a schmaltzy love song
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 矫揉造作的情歌

Sense.DEF: expensive and fashionable in a way that is meant to be impressive – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 华丽精致的﹐昂贵时髦的﹐花哨的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a schmancy all-girls college
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一所时髦的女子学院

Sense.DEF: a stupid or annoying person
to talk in a friendly way about unimportant things at a social event, especially because you want to gain an advantage for yourself later

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Politicians spent much of their time schmoozing with contributors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政客们花大量时间和捐助者闲聊拉关系。

Sense.DEF: a stupid person
a strong alcoholic drink

a small piece of
veal meat from a young cow
covered with
breadcrumbs
and cooked in oil
a stupid person
an intelligent and well-educated person
Sense.EXAMPLE: the great Dutch scholar Erasmus
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 荷兰的大学问家伊拉斯谟

Sense.DEF: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, especially one that is not a science subject
Sense.TRAN: 学者〔尤指精于一门文科学问的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Shakespearean scholar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究莎士比亚的学者

Sense.DEF: someone who has been given a scholarship to study at a school or college
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a King’s scholar at Eton College.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是伊顿公学的国王奖学金获得者。

Sense.DEF: relating to serious study of a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scholarly journal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学术期刊

Sense.DEF: someone who is scholarly spends a lot of time studying, and knows a lot about a particular subject
Sense.TRAN: 勤奋好学的﹐〔对某一学科〕有学术造诣的

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that is given to someone by an educational organization to help pay for their education

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She won a scholarship to Iowa State University.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她获得了艾奥瓦州立大学的奖学金。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He attended college on a drama scholarship.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他靠一份戏剧奖学金上了大学。

Sense.DEF: the knowledge, work, or methods involved in serious studying
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her latest publication is a fine piece of scholarship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她最新出版的作品是一部优秀的学术著作。

Sense.DEF: relating to schools or teaching
Sense.EXAMPLE: scholastic skills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教学技巧

Sense.DEF: relating to scholasticism
a way of studying thought, especially religious thought, based on things written in ancient times
a place where children are taught
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mother always used to pick him up from school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他母亲以前一直去学校接他。

Subsense.DEF: a day’s work at school
Subsense.EXAMPLE: School begins at 8.30.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 8点30分开始上课。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll see you after school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 放学后见。

Subsense.DEF: the time during your life when you go to school
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He’s one of my old friends from school.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是我上学时候就认识的一个老朋友。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Children start school between the ages of four and five.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童四五岁左右开始上学。

Subsense.DEF: a college or university, or the time when you study there
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Their kids are away at school now.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的孩子现在都上大学了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She was going to school in Boston.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在波士顿上大学。

Subsense.DEF: a department or group of departments that teaches a particular subject at a university

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Harvard School of Public Health
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈佛大学公共卫生学院

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After two years of medical school, I thought I knew everything.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上了两年的医学院﹐以为自己什么都懂了。

Sense.DEF: a place where a particular subject or skill is taught
Sense.EXAMPLE: a language school in Brighton
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布赖顿的一所语言学校

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Amwell School of Motoring
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿姆韦尔汽车驾驶学校

Subsense.DEF: in the school building
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I can get some work done while the kids are at school.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子上学的时间里我可以干一些活。

Subsense.DEF: attending a school, rather than being at college or university or having a job
Subsense.TRAN: 在上学〔指在读中小学﹑还未开始工作〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’ve got two children at school, and one at university.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有两个孩子在读中学﹐还有一个在读大学。

Subsense.DEF: in the school building
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sandra’s not in school today.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑德拉今天没上学。

Subsense.DEF: attending a school or university rather than having a job
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Are your boys still in school?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的儿子们都还在上学吗？

Sense.DEF: a number of people who are considered as a group because of their similar style of work
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Impressionist school
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印象派

Sense.DEF: an opinion or way of thinking about something that is shared by a group of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are two main schools of thought on the subject.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这个问题主要有两派意见。

Sense.DEF: with old-fashioned values or qualities
Sense.TRAN: 老派的﹐老式的﹐具有传统观念的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a family doctor of the old school
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个老派的家庭医生

Sense.DEF:
a large group of fish,
whales
,
dolphins
etc that are swimming together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a school of whales
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群鲸鱼

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Did you go to school in Paris?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在巴黎上的学吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Children in Britain start school when they are five.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国儿童五岁开始上学。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He left school when he was 16.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他16岁离开学校。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a school that gets its money from the government
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Universities want to encourage more applicants from state schools.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学想鼓励更多的公立学校学生申请入学。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a school where students pay to study
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was educated at a private school.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一所私立学校接受教育。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the school someone went to when they were young
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人以前的学校,某人的母校
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He went back to his old school to give a talk to the children.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他回到母校给孩子们做一个讲座。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a school near where someone lives
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They sent their kids to the local school.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把孩子送到当地的学校上学。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a school where children also live and sleep
for children under 5
for children aged 5 to 7
for children up to 11
for children from 11 to 16 or 18
a school for students aged 14 to 18
a secondary school for all children
a secondary school for children who have passed an exam when they are 11

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Most school students have musical interests of some kind.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数中小学生都对音乐有某种兴趣。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She met some old school friends.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她遇见了几个老同学。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was still wearing his school uniform.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仍然穿着校服。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the journey taking children to and from school each day
an elected person who works with teachers to make decisions about how a school is organized
the group of people who are elected to govern a school or group of schools

Sense.DEF: to train or teach someone to have a certain skill, type of behaviour, or way of thinking

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was schooled in hiding her emotions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被教育要隐藏自己的情绪。

Sense.DEF: to educate a child
the age at which a child is old enough to go to school
Sense.EXAMPLE: children below school age
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学龄前儿童

Sense.DEF: a group of people, including some parents, who are elected to govern a school or group of schools in the US
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国的〕校董会﹔地方教育委员会

Sense.DEF: a book that is used in school classes
a boy attending school
jokes that are silly and rude but not offensive
a child attending school
a day of the week when children are usually at school
the time of your life when you go to school
an area in one state of the US that includes a number of schools which are governed together
a friend who goes to the same school as you
a girl attending school
a member of a group of people in Britain who are elected to make decisions about how a school should be managed
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国的〕学校管理委员会委员﹐学校董事

Sense.DEF: a school building, especially for a small village school
school education
Sense.EXAMPLE: children in their final year of compulsory schooling the time during which children have to attend school by law
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校义务教育最后一学年的儿童
Sense.EXAMPLE: Al’s dad had only a few years of schooling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿尔的爸爸只受过几年的学校教育。

Sense.DEF: a child attending school
someone who has just left school, especially to do or look for a job rather than going to college, university etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shortage of jobs for school-leavers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中学毕业生就业岗位的短缺

Sense.DEF: a woman who is considered to be old-fashioned, strict, and easily shocked

a male teacher, especially in a
private school one that parents pay to send their children to
someone who goes or went to the same school as you

a female teacher, especially in a
private school one that parents pay to send their children to
a room used for teaching in a small school
when parents drive their children to school in the morning or home from school in the afternoon
Sense.TRAN: 上下学接送〔指父母开车接送子女上学或放学〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We hope to increase the safety of children who walk to school and cut the number of cars doing the school run .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望提高孩子步行上学的安全性﹐减少接送汽车的数量。

Sense.DEF:
a
teacher
a special tie with a particular colour or pattern that children wear at some schools in Britain
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国有些学校学生戴的〕学生领带

Sense.DEF: the unofficial system by which people who went to the same school, especially an expensive one, help each other to gain important positions later in their lives
work done for or during school classes
the area next to a school building where the children can go or play when they are not having lessons
a fast sailing ship with two sails
Sense.TRAN: 双桅纵帆船﹐斯库纳帆船

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
shtick
quiet or silent
Sense.TRAN: 默不作声的﹐沉默不语的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boss of the failed company is keeping schtum about his role in the disaster.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家经营失败的公司的老板对自己在这场灾难中应承担的责任闭口不谈。

Sense.DEF:
a vowel typically heard in parts of a word that are spoken without
stress 1 4
, such as the ‘a’ in ‘about’
the sign (ə), used to represent the vowel schwa

relating to the
hips

pain in the lower back,
hips
, and legs
knowledge about the world, especially based on examining, testing, and proving facts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many leading scientists do not consider that science can give absolutely reliable knowledge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多杰出科学家都不认为科学能够提供绝对可靠的知识。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the founder of modern science, Isaac Newton
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代科学创始人艾萨克·牛顿
Sense.EXAMPLE: developments in science and technology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学技术的发展

Sense.DEF: the study of science
Sense.EXAMPLE: What did you do in science class today?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天你们自然科学课做什么？

Sense.DEF:
a particular part of science, for example
biology
,
chemistry
, or
physics
Sense.TRAN: 自然科学学科〔如生物﹑化学﹑物理〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the physical sciences
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 物理科学

Sense.LEXUNIT: sth is not an exact science
Sense.DEF: used to say that something involves a lot of guessing and there is not just one right way to do it
Sense.TRAN: 某事难以捉摸﹐某事说不准
Sense.EXAMPLE: Advertising is not an exact science – you’re always taking a risk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 广告业充满变数——你总是在冒风险。

Sense.DEF:
stories about events in the future which are affected by imaginary developments in science, for example about travelling in time or to other
planets
with life on them
an area where there are a lot of companies or organizations that do scientific work
about or related to science, or using its methods
Sense.EXAMPLE: We believe in investing in scientific research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们相信科学研究的投资价值。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the limits of scientific knowledge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学知识的极限
Sense.EXAMPLE: decisions based on scientific evidence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据科学证据作出的决定
Sense.EXAMPLE: the international scientific community scientists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际科学界

Sense.DEF: using an organized system
Sense.TRAN: 精细的﹔系统的﹐有条理的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I keep accounts for the business, but I’m not scientific about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 业务往来我留有账目﹐但不是很精细。

Sense.DEF:
the usual process of finding out information in science, which involves testing your ideas by performing
experiments
and making decisions based on the results

RunOn.EXAMPLE: It hasn’t been scientifically proven though.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 不过这还没有经过科学证明。

Sense.DEF: someone who works or is trained in science
a sword with a curved blade that was used in the past
a very small amount of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There isn’t a scintilla of evidence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一点证据也没有。

Sense.DEF: interesting, clever, and amusing
Sense.EXAMPLE: scintillating conversation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妙趣横生的谈话
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scintillating performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精彩的演出

Sense.DEF: a young member of a famous or important family

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a scion of an ancient Scottish family
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰一个古老家族的后裔

Sense.DEF: a tool for cutting paper, cloth etc, made of two sharp blades fastened together in the middle, with holes for your finger and thumb
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of scissors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把剪刀

Sense.DEF: a disease that causes an organ or soft part of your body to become hard
to laugh at a person or idea, and talk about them in a way that shows you think they are stupid

GramExa.EXAMPLE: David scoffed at her fears.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维嘲笑她的恐惧。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Officials scoffed at the idea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 官员们都嘲笑这个想法。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You, a scientist!’ he scoffed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “就你﹐还科学家！”他讥笑道。

Sense.DEF: to eat something very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She scoffed the plate of biscuits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一下子吃光了那盘饼干。

Sense.DEF: to angrily criticize someone, especially a child, about something they have done
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do not scold the puppy, but simply and firmly say ‘no’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要责骂小狗﹐但要干脆利落地说“不”。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her father scolded her for upsetting her mother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲斥责她惹母亲生气。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I got a scolding from my teacher.

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say tell someone off rather than scold someone.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说tell someone off,而不说scold someone
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She told us off for making a mess.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她骂我们搞得一塌糊涂。

Sense.DEF:
an object that is attached to a wall and holds
candles
or electric lights
a small round cake, sometimes containing dried fruit, which is usually eaten with butter
Sense.EXAMPLE: tea and scones
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 茶和烤饼

Sense.DEF: an important or exciting news story that is printed in one newspaper or shown on one television station before any of the others know about it
Sense.TRAN: 〔抢先登出或播出的〕独家新闻
Sense.EXAMPLE: a journalist looking for a scoop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抢独家新闻的记者

Sense.DEF:
a round deep spoon for serving food, for example
ice cream
or
mashed
potato
an amount of food served with a scoop

GramExa.EXAMPLE: two scoops of ice cream
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两勺冰激凌

Sense.DEF: information about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the inside scoop special information that other people do not have on the markets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于市场的内部消息

GramExa.GLOSS: used to ask for information or news

Sense.DEF: to pick something up or remove it using a scoop or a spoon, or your curved hand
Sense.EXAMPLE: She bent down and scooped up the little dog.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她弯腰抱起小狗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cut the tomato in half and scoop out the seeds with a teaspoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把番茄切成两半﹐用茶匙把籽挖出。

Sense.DEF: to be the first newspaper to print an important news report
Sense.EXAMPLE: Time and again we have scooped our rivals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一再抢在对手之前登出报道。

Sense.DEF:
to win a prize or
award
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain scooped the top prize in the over 50s category.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国队捧走了50岁以上组别的头奖。

Sense.DEF: if a lot of people scoop something up, they buy it quickly so that soon there is none left
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fans scooped up the trading cards in the first few hours of the sale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开卖仅仅几个小时﹐影迷们就把收藏卡抢购一空。

Sense.DEF:
a round, quite low neck on a woman’s
top
Sense.TRAN: 〔女服的〕汤匙领﹐开得较低的圆领

Sense.DEF: to move quickly and suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s the bus – I’d better scoot!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车来了——我得快跑！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She scooted off on her bike.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她骑着自行车匆匆离去。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something move a short distance by pulling or pushing
Sense.EXAMPLE: I scooted my chair over to their table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把我的椅子拉到他们的桌旁。

Sense.DEF: to move to one side, especially in order to make room for someone or something else
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤为腾出空间给别人或他物〕挪到边上
Sense.EXAMPLE: He scooted over so I could sit down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他往边上挪了挪﹐让我坐下来。

Sense.DEF:
a type of small, less powerful
motorcycle
with small wheels
a child’s vehicle with two small wheels, an upright handle, and a narrow board that you stand on with one foot, while the other foot pushes against the ground
the range of things that a subject, activity, book etc deals with

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the need to define the scope of the investigation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 界定调查范围的需要

Sense.EXAMPLE: measures to limit the scope of criminals’ activities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 限制罪犯活动范围的措施

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A full discussion of that issue is beyond the scope of this book.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全面讨论那个问题不在本书论述范围之内。

GramExa.PROPFORM: widen/broaden/extend etc the scope of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let us extend the scope of the study to examine more factors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我们把研究范围扩大一下﹐对更多的因素进行考查。

GramExa.PROPFORM: narrow/limit etc the scope of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The court’s ruling narrowed the scope of the affirmative action program.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭的裁决缩小了反歧视行动计划的实施范围。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His efforts were too limited in scope to have much effect.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的努力范围太有限﹐因而效果不大。

Sense.DEF: the opportunity to do or develop something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The scope for successful gardening increases dramatically with a greenhouse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有了温室﹐园艺栽培的成功率就能大大提高。

GramExa.PROPFORM: there is considerable/great/little etc scope for sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is considerable scope for further growth in the economy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济还有很大的增长空间。

Sense.DEF: a particular set of activities and the people who are involved in them

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 乐坛/影坛/俱乐部圈子等

Sense.DEF: to look at something or someone to see what they are like
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go inside and scope out the menu.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们进去看看菜单。

Sense.DEF: if you scorch something, or if it scorches, its surface burns slightly and changes colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: The walls had been blackened and scorched by fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些墙被大火熏黑了。

Sense.DEF: if strong heat or wind scorches plants, it dries and damages them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Direct sunlight will scorch the plant’s leaves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直射的阳光会使这种植物的叶子枯萎。

Sense.DEF: if strong heat scorches you, it burns you
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hot sand scorched our feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滚烫的沙子炙烤着我们的脚。

Sense.DEF: to travel extremely fast

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He scorched out of the gate, almost crashing his new sports car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他驾车飞快地从大门里开出来﹐差点把他那辆新跑车给撞坏了。

Sense.DEF: a mark made on something where its surface has been burnt
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were scorch marks on the kitchen worktop where a hot pan had been placed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房工作台上放过热锅的地方有几处焦痕。

Sense.DEF: brown colouring on plants caused by some plant diseases
the destruction by an army of everything useful in an area, especially crops, so that the land cannot be used by an enemy
an extremely hot day
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a scorcher of a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一个大热天。

Sense.DEF: extremely hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: the scorching desert heat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙漠里的酷热
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scorching hot day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酷热的一天

Sense.DEF: the number of points that each team or player has won in a game or competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: At half-time the score was one all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 半场时的比分是一比一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the score?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比分是多少？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is anybody keeping score making a record of the score ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有没有人负责记分？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The final score was Southampton two, Leeds United nil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后的比分是二比零﹐南安普敦队击败利兹联队。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a score of 3-2
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 3比2的比分

Subsense.DEF: the number of points a student has earned for correct answers in a test
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The school’s test scores have not improved.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学校的考试成绩没有提高。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a score of 90%
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 百分制的90分

Subsense.DEF:
the number of points that a person or group of people gets in a scientific test or
experiment

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had an IQ score of 120.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的智商为120。

Sense.DEF: a written or printed copy of a piece of music, especially for a large group of performers, or the music itself
Sense.EXAMPLE: a musical score
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐谱
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who wrote the score for the movie?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影的配乐是谁谱写的？

Sense.DEF: concerning the particular thing you have just mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 关于那一点﹐关于那个问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: As for the cost, you don’t need to worry on that score.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 至于费用﹐你不需要为这个问题操心。

Sense.DEF: to know the real facts of a situation, including any unpleasant ones
Sense.TRAN: 知道事情真相﹐了解实情
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are trying to attract managers who know the score.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在设法把了解实情的经理们吸引过来。

Sense.DEF: to do something to harm or hurt someone who has harmed or hurt you in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack came back after five years to settle some old scores .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克在五年之后回来清算旧账。

Sense.DEF: a mark that has been cut onto a surface with a sharp tool
Sense.EXAMPLE: deep scores in the wood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木头上一道道很深的划痕

Sense.DEF: to win a point in a sport, game, competition, or test
Sense.EXAMPLE: Great cheers went up when he scored in the final minute of the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当他在比赛的最后一分钟得分时﹐人群爆发出了雷鸣般的欢呼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She scored an average of 9.9 in the test.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次考试她的平均分是9.9。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has scored 12 goals so far this season.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个赛季到目前为止他进了12个球。

Sense.DEF:
to give a particular number of points in a game, competition, test, or
experiment
Sense.TRAN: 〔在比赛﹑考试或实验中〕给…评分﹐给…打分
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each event will be scored separately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个项目将单独评分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Responses to the individual items are scored on a scale ranging from 0 to 12.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每道题的回答都按0到12的标准来打分。

Subsense.DEF: to say or do something in an attempt to prove that you are better or cleverer than someone else
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Too many MPs use debates as a chance to score political points.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有太多的议员把辩论当作在政治上给自己加分的机会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Advertising may be used to score points off the competition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 广告宣传可以用来给自己在竞争中增加筹码。

Subsense.DEF: to do or say something to please someone or to make them respect you
Subsense.TRAN: 取悦某人﹔赢得某人尊重

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’ll score points with your girlfriend if you send her roses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 给女朋友送玫瑰花可以加深她对你的好感。

Sense.DEF: to be very successful in something you do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her new book has scored a spectacular success .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的新书取得了极大的成功。

Sense.DEF: to have sex with someone, especially someone you have just met
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指与刚认识的人〕发生性关系

Sense.DEF: to mark a line on a piece of paper, wood etc using a sharp instrument
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scoring the paper first makes it easier to fold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先在纸上划一道痕﹐就比较容易折了。

Sense.DEF: to arrange a piece of music for a group of instruments or voices
Sense.TRAN: 为〔一组乐器或几个声部〕配乐﹐谱曲

Sense.DEF: to manage to buy or get illegal drugs
to say or do something in an attempt to prove that you are better or cleverer than someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: He liked scoring off his pupils in his days as a teacher.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他当老师的时候喜欢显本事镇住学生。

Sense.DEF: to draw a line through something that has been written
a group of 20, or about 20, people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our coach was escorted by a score of policemen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们乘坐的客车有20个警察护送。

GramExa.GLOSS: 70 years, a person’s expected length of life
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 人生70年〔指人正常的寿命〕

Sense.DEF: a lot of people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scores of victims were killed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多受害者被杀。

Sense.DEF: in large numbers
Sense.EXAMPLE: Friends came to help by the score.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多朋友前来帮忙。

Sense.DEF: a board on which the points won in a game are recorded
a printed card used by someone watching a sports match or race to record what happens
Sense.TRAN: 〔观赛者持的〕比赛成绩记录卡

Sense.DEF: a system that is used for checking or testing something

a football match in which both teams score at least one
goal
and the final score is 1-1, 2-2, 3-3 etc

if a sports match or part of a sports match is scoreless, nobody scores any points or
goals
Sense.TRAN: 双方均未得分的﹐零比零的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scoreless first half
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一球未进的上半场

Sense.DEF:
the score or the final result in a football,
rugby
, or tennis match
Sense.TRAN: 〔足球﹑英式橄榄球﹑网球比赛的〕最终比分﹐最终结果

Sense.DEF: someone who keeps an official record of the points won in a sports game

a player who wins a point or
goal

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was Palace’s top scorer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是水晶宫队的头号得分手。

Sense.DEF: a special piece of paper on which someone records the points won in a sports match

to score one or more
goals
or points in football,
rugby
, and some other sports
Sense.TRAN: 〔足球﹑英式橄榄球及其他体育比赛中〕有进球[得分]记入名下

Sense.DEF: the feeling that someone or something is stupid or does not deserve respect

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He felt scorn for his working-class parents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他鄙视自己工薪阶层的父母。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rachel looked at me with scorn.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蕾切尔神情蔑视地看着我。

Sense.DEF: to strongly criticize someone or something because you think they do not deserve respect
Sense.TRAN: 对某人/某事物嗤之以鼻[不屑一顾]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Labour poured scorn on the Tory claim to be the party of law and order.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保守党自称是重视法治的政党﹐工党对此嗤之以鼻。

Sense.DEF: to show that you think that something is stupid, unreasonable, or not worth accepting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many women scorn the use of make-up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多女性不屑于使用化妆品。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone or something because you think they do not deserve respect
Sense.EXAMPLE: He scorned the government’s record in dealing with crime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对政府在处理犯罪问题上的表现持批评态度。

Sense.DEF: feeling or showing scorn
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scornful look
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻蔑的表情

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was scornful of the women’s movement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对妇女运动嗤之以鼻。

Sense.DEF:
the eighth sign of the
zodiac
, represented by a
scorpion
, which some people believe affects the character and life of people born between October 24 and November 22
someone who was born between October 24 and November 22
Sense.TRAN: 属天蝎座的人〔即10月24日至11月22日之间出生的人〕

Sense.DEF: a tropical animal like an insect, with a curving tail and a poisonous sting
someone from Scotland
to stop something happening by firmly doing something to prevent it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He issued an announcement to scotch rumours of his death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发表了一项声明﹐驳斥有关他已经死亡的谣言。

Sense.DEF: a strong alcoholic drink made in Scotland, or a glass of this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two scotches, please.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请来两杯苏格兰威士忌。

Sense.DEF:
thick soup made from vegetables, meat, and
barley type of grain
Sense.TRAN: 〔用蔬菜﹑肉类﹑大麦熬煮的〕苏格兰浓汤

Sense.DEF:
a cooked egg that is covered with sausage meat and
breadcrumbs
, then
fried
Sense.TRAN: 〔外裹香肠和面包屑的〕苏格兰煎蛋

Sense.DEF: thin clear plastic tape that is sticky on one side, used for sticking light things such as paper together
to avoid being punished although you deserve to be
the part of the London police that deals with serious crimes, or their main office
Scottish
a man from Scotland
a woman from Scotland
relating to Scotland or its people
a name for Shakespeare’s play Macbeth, used by actors because they believe that it is unlucky to say ‘Macbeth’
Sense.TRAN: 苏格兰剧〔演员给莎士比亚戏剧《麦克白》起的别名﹐因为他们认为直接说“麦克白”不吉利〕

Sense.DEF: a bad or dishonest man, especially someone who cheats or deceives other people
to search very carefully and thoroughly through an area, a document etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her family began to scour the countryside for a suitable house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的家人开始在乡下寻找合适的房子。

Sense.DEF: to clean something very thoroughly by rubbing it with a rough material
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ada was scouring out the pans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿达在擦锅。

Sense.DEF: to form a hole by continuous movement over a long period
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over the years, the stream had scoured out a round pool in the rock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经年累月﹐溪水在岩石上冲出了一个圆圆的水潭。

Sense.DEF: a small ball of wire or rough plastic for cleaning cooking pots and pans
Sense.TRAN: 〔刷洗锅盘用的〕金属丝球﹐塑料丝球

Sense.DEF: something that causes a lot of harm or suffering

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the scourge of unemployment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业的祸害
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the scourge of war
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争的祸害

Sense.DEF:
a
whip
used to punish people in the past
to cause a lot of harm or suffering to a place or group of people
to hit someone with a whip as punishment in the past
the way of speaking that is typical of people from Liverpool
someone from the city of Liverpool in England

Subsense.DEF: an organization for boys that teaches them practical skills
a boy who is a member of this organization

Sense.DEF: a girl who is a member of an organization for girls that teaches them practical things
a soldier, plane etc that is sent to search the area in front of an army and get information about the enemy
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sent three scouts ahead to take a look at the bridge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他派出三名侦察兵到前面侦察大桥的情况。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to look for good sports players, musicians etc in order to employ them
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指发掘运动员﹑音乐人才等的〕人才发掘者﹐星探
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was spotted by a scout at the age of 13.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在13岁时被星探发现。

Sense.DEF: to look for something in a particular area

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m scouting round for a place to stay.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在找住的地方。

Sense.DEF: to examine a place or area in order to get information about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: American companies are keen to scout out business opportunities in Vietnam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国公司很想在越南寻找商机。

Sense.DEF: to find out about the abilities of sports players, musicians etc in order to employ them
the activities that scouts take part in
a man who is the leader of a group of scouts
to look at someone in an angry way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Patrick scowled, but did as he was told.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕特里克一脸不悦﹐但还是照办了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mum scowled at him and refused to say anything.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈瞪着他﹐一句话也不肯说。

Sense.DEF: an angry or disapproving expression on someone’s face
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked at me with a scowl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对我怒目而视。

Sense.DEF: to try to find or do something very quickly, usually by moving your hands or feet in an uncontrolled way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He scrabbled for the light switch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他摸索着找电灯开关。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was scrabbling around, searching for the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她摸索着找门。

Sense.DEF: a game in which players try to make words from the separate letters they have
Sense.TRAN: 〔用已有的若干字母组词的〕拼字游戏

Sense.DEF: growing in a way that looks uneven and in bad condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: his scraggly gray beard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那散乱的灰白胡子

Sense.DEF: too thin
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scraggy neck
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 细瘦的脖子

Sense.DEF: to leave a place very quickly, especially so that you do not get caught
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为避免被抓〕迅速离开﹐跑开
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scram, you two!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快跑﹐你们两个！

Sense.DEF: to climb up, down, or over something quickly and with difficulty, especially using your hands to help you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They tried to scramble up the cliff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想爬上悬崖。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She scrambled down the tree as quickly as she could.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她以最快的速度爬下树。

Sense.DEF: to move somewhere in a hurried awkward way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Alan scrambled out of the way.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伦慌忙让开。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Micky scrambled to his feet stood up very quickly and awkwardly and hurried into the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米基连忙站起来﹐匆匆进了厨房。

Sense.DEF: to try to do something difficult very quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were scrambling to give the impression that the situation was in control.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们急于给人一种形势已得到控制的印象。

Sense.DEF: to struggle or compete with other people to get or reach something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Thousands of people will be scrambling for tickets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将有数千人抢购门票。

Sense.DEF: to use special equipment to mix messages, radio signals etc into a different form, so that they cannot be understood by other people without the correct equipment
Sense.TRAN: 倒换[扰乱]…的频率〔用特殊仪器改变信息﹑无线电信号等以使他人无法识别〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our conversation will be electronically scrambled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的对话将被加以电子扰频。

Sense.DEF: to mix words, ideas, sentences etc so that they are not in the right order and do not make sense
Sense.EXAMPLE: The words in each sentence are scrambled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个句子中的词语都被打乱了。

Sense.DEF: to cook an egg by mixing the white and yellow parts together and heating it in a pan
to make someone unable to think clearly or reasonably
Sense.TRAN: 使某人头脑糊涂﹐使某人思维混乱
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maybe the alcohol has scrambled his brains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能是酒精把他的脑子给弄糊涂了。

Sense.DEF: if a military plane scrambles, it goes up into the air very quickly in order to escape or to attack an enemy
Sense.TRAN: 〔军用飞机为逃跑或攻击敌人〕紧急起飞

Sense.DEF: a difficult climb in which you have to use your hands to help you
Sense.EXAMPLE: The village was a 20-minute scramble away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 村子离这里有20分钟的攀登路程。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which people compete with and push each other in order to get what they want

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the usual scramble for the bathroom every morning
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每天早上照例上演的卫生间争夺战

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a scramble to carry the baggage into the house
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 抢着把行李搬进屋子

Sense.DEF: a situation in which something has to be done very quickly, with a lot of rushing around
Sense.TRAN: 〔因赶任务出现的〕忙乱﹐忙作一团
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a mad scramble trying to get things ready in time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了及时做好准备﹐大家忙成一团。

Sense.DEF:
a
motorcycle
race over rough ground
eggs cooked in a pan after the white and yellow parts have been mixed together
a machine that mixes up a radio or telephone message so that it cannot be understood without special equipment
Sense.TRAN: 倒频器﹐扰频器〔用于扰乱无线电或电话信号﹐只有用特殊仪器才能识别〕

Sense.DEF: the activity of climbing over rocks using your hands but no ropes

the activity of racing on
motorcycles
over rough ground
a type of powerful engine that can make an aircraft fly at more than ten times the speed of sound
Sense.TRAN: 超燃冲压发动机〔一种功率强大的发动机﹐能使飞机的飞行速度超过音速十倍以上〕

Sense.DEF: a small piece of paper, cloth etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wrote his address on a scrap of paper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把住址写在一张小纸片上。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a rug made out of old scraps of material
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用旧零碎材料拼做的一块小地毯

Sense.DEF: materials or objects that are no longer used for the purpose they were made for, but can be used again in another way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The equipment was sold for scrap .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件设备被当成废品卖了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scrap metal metal from old cars, machines etc fetched high prices after the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后﹐废金属卖到很高价钱。

Sense.DEF: pieces of food that are left after you have finished eating
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mother fed the dog on scraps to save money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲为了省钱﹐用吃剩的东西喂狗。

Sense.DEF: a small amount of information, truth etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He obtained every scrap of information available.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获得了所有可以得到的信息。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There isn’t a single scrap of evidence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一点证据都没有。

Sense.DEF: a short fight or argument
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s always getting into scraps with other dogs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它老是和别的狗打起来。

Sense.DEF: to decide not to use a plan or system because it is not practical
Sense.TRAN: 〔因不切实际而〕放弃﹐抛弃〔计划﹑体系〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We believe that car tax should be scrapped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们认为汽车税应该取消。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of an old machine, vehicle etc, and use its parts in some other way
Sense.TRAN: 把〔旧机器﹑旧汽车等〕当作废料处理﹐报废
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two aircraft carriers are being scrapped this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年有两艘航空母舰要报废。

Sense.DEF: to have a short fight
a book with empty pages where you can stick pictures, newspaper articles, or other things you want to keep
to remove something from a surface using the edge of a knife, a stick etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scrape the carrots and slice them thinly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这些胡萝卜去皮切成薄片。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The earth was scraped away to uncover a trapdoor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把土刮掉后露出了活板门。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Teresa scraped the mud off her boots.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 特雷莎把靴子上的泥巴刮掉。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The two of them scraped their dishes clean .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们两个把盘子擦得干干净净。

Sense.DEF: to rub against a rough surface in a way that causes slight damage or injury, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The coat was too long; the hem scraped the pavement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大衣太长﹐下摆都拖到地面了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I heard the side of the car scrape against the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到汽车的侧面蹭着墙了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I scraped my knee painfully on the concrete.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的膝盖蹭到混凝土上﹐很痛。

Sense.DEF: to make a noise by rubbing roughly against a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chairs scraped loudly as they stood up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们站起来时椅子发出很响的刮擦声。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He opened the gate quietly, trying not to let it scrape on the gravel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他轻轻地打开大门﹐尽量不让它刮到碎石。

Sense.DEF: to win a race, election, or competition by a very small amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Tories may scrape home, but it’s unlikely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保守党也许会以微弱优势获胜﹐但可能性不大。

Sense.DEF: to have to use something even though it is not very good, because there is nothing better available
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was clear that the party was scraping the barrel for competent politicians.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很明显﹐该政党正对能干的政治家降格以求。

Sense.DEF: if you scrape your hair back, you pull it away from your face and tie it at the back
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her blonde hair was scraped back into a ponytail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一头金发拢在脑后扎成一个马尾辫。

Sense.DEF: to have just enough money to live
Sense.TRAN: 勉强维持生活﹐勉强糊口
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can scrape by, thanks to what we grow ourselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多亏了我们自己种的东西﹐我们还能勉强维持生活。

Sense.DEF: to only just succeed in passing an examination or dealing with a difficult situation
Sense.TRAN: 勉强通过〔考试〕﹔勉强克服〔困难〕

Sense.DEF: to only just succeed in getting a job, a place at university, a position in government etc
Sense.TRAN: 勉强进入〔大学〕﹔勉强获得〔一份工作﹑政府职位等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Labour scraped in by a small majority.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党以微弱优势勉强当选。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He just scraped into college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他勉强进了大学。

Sense.DEF: to only just succeed in passing an examination or dealing with a difficult situation
Sense.TRAN: 勉强通过〔考试〕﹔勉强应付〔困境〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I managed to scrape through the exam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我勉强通过了考试。

Sense.DEF: to get enough money for a particular purpose, when this is difficult
Sense.TRAN: 〔为某目的〕勉强筹集﹐凑足〔钱款〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She scraped together the last of her savings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她凑拢自己最后的那点积蓄。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They could hardly scrape up enough money for the train fare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们几乎连买火车票的钱都凑不足。

Sense.DEF: a mark or slight injury caused by rubbing against a rough surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: I came away from the accident with only cuts and scrapes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次事故我只受了点皮外伤。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you are in trouble or have difficulties
Sense.EXAMPLE: He got into all sorts of scrapes as a boy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他小时候闯过各种各样的祸。

Sense.DEF: the noise made when one surface rubs roughly against another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He heard the scrape of chairs being dragged across the floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听到椅子从地板上拖过去的刮擦声。

Sense.DEF:
a way of arranging a man’s hair, in which a long piece of hair from one side is
combed
over the top of the head in an attempt to hide the fact that the man is going
bald losing his hair
– used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔秃顶男人的〕横梳发式〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a tool used to remove something from a surface by rubbing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a paint scraper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刮漆刀

Sense.DEF: not wanted or used any more – used especially when this seems unfair
Sense.TRAN: 废弃的﹐不再用的﹐被抛弃的〔尤用于看起来不公平时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three years later he was on the political scrapheap.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三年后﹐他就被政坛抛弃。

Sense.DEF: a pile of unwanted things, especially pieces of metal
a serious disease that sheep can get
Sense.TRAN: 痒病〔绵羊患的一种严重疾病〕

Sense.DEF:
small pieces that have been
scraped
from a surface
paper, often paper that has already been used on one side, that you use for making notes, lists etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔常指一面用过﹑另一面可用于记事的〕废纸片

Sense.DEF: untidy or badly organized
Sense.TRAN: 不整洁的﹔散乱的﹐无条理的
Sense.EXAMPLE: scrappy notes from the meeting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 零乱的会议记录

Sense.DEF: having a determined character and always willing to compete, argue, or fight
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scrappy team that plays hard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一支敢打敢拼的球队

Sense.DEF: to rub your skin with your nails because it feels uncomfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: John yawned and scratched his leg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰打了个呵欠﹐挠了挠腿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try not to scratch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量别挠。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was scratching at the bites on his arm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他挠着手臂上被叮咬的地方。

Sense.DEF: to cut someone’s skin slightly with your nails or with something sharp
Sense.TRAN: 〔用指甲〕抓破﹐抓伤﹔〔用利器〕划破
Sense.EXAMPLE: She ran at him and scratched his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她冲过去抓他的脸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t scratch yourself on the thorns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别让刺扎着自己。

Sense.DEF: to make a small cut or mark on something by pulling something sharp across it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid I’ve scratched your car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不好意思﹐我把你的汽车给刮坏了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the prisoners had scratched their names on the walls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些囚犯在墙上刻下自己的姓名。

Sense.DEF: if an animal scratches, it rubs its feet against something, often making a noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: A few chickens scratched around in the yard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几只小鸡在院子里抓抓刨刨。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dog scratching at the door to be let in
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 挠门想进屋的一条狗

Sense.DEF: to remove something from a surface by rubbing it with something sharp

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I scratched away a little of the paint with my fingernail.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我用指甲刮掉一点油漆。

Sense.DEF: to remove a word from a piece of writing by drawing a line through it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have scratched his name from the list.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把他的名字从名单上划掉了。

Sense.DEF: to make a rough sound by moving something sharp across a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: His pen scratched away on the paper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用钢笔在纸上沙沙地写着。

Sense.DEF: to deal with only a very small part of a subject or problem

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think we have only scratched the surface of this problem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为我们仅仅触及了这个问题的表面。

Sense.DEF: to think carefully about a difficult question or problem
Sense.TRAN: 动脑筋﹐〔对难题〕苦思冥想
Sense.EXAMPLE: This crisis has politicians scratching their heads and wondering what to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场危机让政治家们抓破了脑袋﹐不知怎么办才好。

Sense.DEF: if you scratch an idea or a plan, you decide that you will not do it
if someone scratches from a race, or if you scratch them from the race, they do not take part in it

Sense.LEXUNIT: you scratch my back, I’ll scratch yours
Sense.DEF: used to say that you will help someone if they agree to help you
to try to find or get something which is difficult to find or get

GramExa.EXAMPLE: homeless people scratching around for a place to shelter
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 四处找寻容身之所的无家可归者

Sense.DEF: to remove a word from a piece of writing by drawing a line through it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Emma’s name had been scratched out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃玛的名字被划掉了。

Sense.DEF: a small cut on someone’s skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were deep scratches all over her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上全是深深的伤痕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, it’s only a scratch not a serious injury .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐只是一道划伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was unharmed apart from a few cuts and scratches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了几处皮外伤外﹐她安然无恙。

Sense.DEF: a thin mark or cut on the surface of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a big scratch on the car door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车门上有一条深深的划痕。

Sense.DEF: if you start something from scratch, you begin it without using anything that existed or was prepared before
Sense.TRAN: 从零开始﹐从头开始﹔白手起家
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to start again from scratch .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只好再次从零开始。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had built the business up from scratch .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他白手起家创办了这家企业。

Sense.DEF: good enough for a particular standard
Sense.TRAN: 够得上标准﹐达到应有的水平
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of this work isn’t up to scratch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项工作有一部分没有达到标准。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We spent thousands of pounds getting the house up to scratch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们花了几千英镑把房子弄得像个样子了。

Sense.DEF: when you rub part of your body with your nails because it feels uncomfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stretched and had a scratch .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他伸了个懒腰﹐抓了抓痒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He brushed his hair and gave his scalp a good scratch .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他梳了一下头发﹐又使劲挠了挠头皮。

Sense.DEF: a sound made by something sharp or rough being rubbed on a hard surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: I heard the scratch of an animal’s claws on the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到动物在抓门的声音。

Sense.DEF: a scratch team or group of people has been put together in a hurry, using anyone that is available
Sense.TRAN: 〔团队等〕仓促拼凑的﹐匆匆组成的

Sense.DEF: a scratch player in golf is very good and is not given any advantage in games
Sense.TRAN: 〔高尔夫球员〕无让杆的﹐无让步优 待的

Sense.DEF: a small card you can buy which gives you a chance to win a prize. You rub off the surface of the card to find out whether you have won anything.

the activity of playing a record on a
turntable
and making new sounds by quickly spinning the record forwards and backwards with your finger while it is playing
Sense.TRAN: 搓盘〔在唱盘上放唱片时﹐用手指把唱片快速前后拨转弄出新的声音效果〕

Sense.DEF: small pieces of pig’s skin that have been cooked in hot fat and are eaten cold

a
dj
who is skilful at scratching
several sheets of cheap paper that are joined together into a small book you can write notes in

a small screen on a
mobile phone
that lets you write short notes and stores them for you
Sense.TRAN: 〔手机上的〕手写屏幕﹐手写便笺本

Sense.DEF: cheap paper, or paper that has already been used on one side, that you use for writing notes
Sense.TRAN: 〔一面用过﹑另一面可用于记事的〕废纸片

Sense.DEF: something that is scratchy feels rough against your skin
Sense.TRAN: 〔衣物等〕粗糙的﹐扎人的﹐使皮肤发痒的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scratchy woollen jumper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件扎人的套头羊毛衫

Sense.DEF: a scratchy voice or musical sound is rough and not smooth and pleasant
Sense.TRAN: 〔嗓音〕沙哑的﹔〔音乐〕带沙沙声的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scratchy old recording of some folk songs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一段有沙沙声的民歌老旧录音

Sense.DEF: to write in a careless and untidy way, so that your words are not easy to read
Sense.EXAMPLE: He scrawled his name at the bottom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在底端潦草地写下了自己的名字。

Sense.DEF: untidy, careless writing
Sense.TRAN: 潦草的文字﹔潦草的笔迹
Sense.EXAMPLE: The note was written in his usual illegible scrawl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 便条上是他一贯潦草难认的字迹。

Sense.DEF: a scrawny person or animal looks very thin and weak
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scrawny kid in jeans and a T-shirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个穿着牛仔裤和T恤衫的瘦弱孩子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a few scrawny hens
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几只瘦得皮包骨的母鸡

Sense.DEF: to make a loud high noise with your voice because you are hurt, frightened, excited etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔因疼痛﹑惊恐﹑兴奋等〕尖声大叫
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the first few shots, people started screaming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几声枪响过后﹐人们开始尖叫起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a screaming baby
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尖声哭叫的婴儿

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She jumped to her feet, screaming in terror.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她吓得尖叫一声﹐跳了起来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The children were screaming with laughter .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子们在尖声欢笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was screaming her head off screaming a lot .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不停地尖叫。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She began to scream blue murder scream very loudly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始高声尖叫。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was dragged kicking and screaming to a nearby van.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他又踢又叫着被拖到附近的一辆小货车上。

Sense.DEF: to shout something in a very loud high voice because you are angry or frightened
Sense.TRAN: 〔因愤怒或恐惧〕高声喊﹐大声叫
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Get out!’ she screamed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “出去！”她高声叫道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He screamed out her name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他高声叫喊她的名字。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I screamed for help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我高声呼救。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He screamed at her to go away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大声叫喊让她走开。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The crowd continued to scream abuse at him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群继续对他高声叫骂。

Sense.DEF: to make a very loud high noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police car approached, its siren screaming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警车鸣着警笛驶近了。

Sense.DEF: a loud high sound that you make with your voice because you are hurt, frightened, excited etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔因疼痛﹑惊恐﹑兴奋等发出的〕尖叫声
Sense.EXAMPLE: We heard screams coming from the flat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们听到公寓里传出尖叫声。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She saw the knife and let out a scream .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看到刀﹐发出一声尖叫。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He fell back with a scream of terror and pain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发出恐惧而又痛苦的尖叫声﹐往后倒去。

Sense.DEF: a very loud high sound
Sense.TRAN: 响而尖的声音﹐尖锐刺耳的声音
Sense.EXAMPLE: the scream of a jet taking off
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喷气机起飞时的巨大声响

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is very funny
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film was a scream!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片非常滑稽！

Sense.DEF: extremely
Sense.EXAMPLE: a screamingly funny film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极其滑稽的一部电影

Sense.DEF: an area of loose soil and broken rocks on the side of a mountain
Sense.TRAN: 〔山坡上的〕松土碎石地带﹐岩屑堆
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scree slope
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 碎石坡

Sense.DEF: to shout loudly in an unpleasant high voice because you are angry, afraid, or excited
Sense.TRAN: 〔因生气﹑害怕或兴奋而〕尖叫﹐尖声喊叫
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Look out!’ she screeched.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “当心！”她尖声叫道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They screeched with laughter .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们尖声大笑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She screeched at me to take off my muddy shoes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她尖叫着要我脱掉沾满泥污的鞋子。

Sense.DEF: if a vehicle screeches, its wheels make a high unpleasant noise as it moves along or stops
Sense.TRAN: 〔车辆开动或停下时〕发出尖锐刺耳的响声
Sense.EXAMPLE: A van screeched onto the road in front of me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆小货车嘎吱一声从我前面开上了路。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car screeched to a halt .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那辆汽车嘎的一声停了下来。

Sense.DEF: a very long, boring piece of writing – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 冗长的文章﹐长篇大论〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: the part of a television or computer where the picture or information appears
Sense.EXAMPLE: a computer with an 18-inch colour screen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带18英寸彩色屏幕的电脑
Sense.EXAMPLE: He went on staring at the TV screen .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他继续盯着电视屏幕看。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her picture appeared on the screen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的照片出现在屏幕上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s easy to change the text on screen before printing it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 打印之前在屏幕上修改文本是很方便的。

Subsense.DEF: the large white surface that pictures are shown on in a cinema
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was horrified at some of the images he saw on the screen.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从屏幕上看到的一些图像让他感到很恐怖。

Subsense.DEF: films in general
Subsense.EXAMPLE: This is the first time the play has been adapted for the big screen films .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个剧本首次改编成电影。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a star of stage and screen the theatre and films
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戏剧﹑电影双栖明星

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his first appearance on screen
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在电影屏幕上的首次亮相

Subsense.EXAMPLE: a well-known screen actor
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 著名的电影演员

Sense.DEF: a piece of furniture like a thin wall that can be moved around and is used to divide one part of a room from another
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a screen around his bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的床围着屏风。

Subsense.DEF: something tall and wide that hides a place or thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house was hidden behind a screen of bushes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子隐藏在一片灌木丛后。

Subsense.DEF: something that hides what someone is doing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The business was just a screen for his drug-dealing activities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司只是他从事贩毒活动的幌子。

Sense.DEF: a medical test to see whether someone has an illness
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is offering a free health screen to all employees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司为所有雇员提供免费体检。

Sense.DEF: a wire net fastened inside a frame in front of a window or door to keep insects out
a decorative wall in some churches

a player in a game such as
basketball
who protects the player who has the ball
Sense.TRAN: 篮球比赛等运动中的〕掩护队员

Sense.DEF: to do tests on a lot of people to find out whether they have a particular illness
Sense.EXAMPLE: All women over 50 will be regularly screened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有50岁以上女性都将定期接受检查。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is now possible to screen babies for diabetes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在可以给婴儿作糖尿病筛查了。

Sense.DEF: if something screens something else, it is in front of it and hides it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A line of trees screened the house from the road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一排树木把这幢房子遮蔽起来﹐从马路上看不见。

Sense.DEF: to show a film or television programme
Sense.TRAN: 放映〔影片〕﹔播放〔电视节目〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film is being screened around the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影正在全国放映。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The match will be screened live on television.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场比赛将在电视上直播。

Sense.DEF: to find out information about people in order to decide whether you can trust them
Sense.TRAN: 审查﹐甄别〔看是否可以信任〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police are very careful when screening politicians’ bodyguards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方在审查政要保镖时非常仔细。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Applicants are screened for security.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 申请人要接受安全审查。

Sense.DEF: to check things to see whether they are acceptable or suitable
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can use an answerphone to screen your phone calls before you answer them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以用电话答录机对来电进行筛选﹐选择要接听的电话。

Sense.DEF: to separate one part of a room from the rest by putting a thin temporary wall or a curtain across it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The back part of the room had been screened off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间后部被隔开了。

Sense.DEF: to prevent something harmful from passing through
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sun lotions screen out damaging ultraviolet light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防晒霜可以隔离有害的紫外线。

Sense.DEF: to remove people or things that are not acceptable or not suitable
Sense.TRAN: 剔除﹐清除〔不可接受或不合适者〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: An answering service can screen out nuisance calls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应答服务可以挡掉骚扰电话。

Sense.DEF: a door with wire net fastened inside a frame, which is used outside the main door of a building to keep insects out
a picture of what is on a computer screen at a particular time, or the process of saving or printing this picture
the showing of a film or television programme
Sense.EXAMPLE: a screening of Spielberg’s new movie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯皮尔伯格的新片放映

Sense.DEF: tests that are done on a lot of people to make sure that they do not have a particular disease

GramExa.EXAMPLE: screening for breast cancer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乳腺癌筛查

Sense.DEF: tests or checks that are done to make sure that people or things are acceptable or suitable for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: security screening of airline passengers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对飞机乘客的安全检查

Sense.DEF: the words that are written down for actors to say in a film, and the instructions that tell them what they should do
a way of printing pictures by forcing paint or ink through a specially prepared cloth onto paper or cloth
a computer program that makes a moving image appear on the screen when the image on it has not changed for a period of time, especially so that the screen does not become damaged
a picture of what is on a computer screen at a particular time, which can be saved and put into a document or printed out
an occasion when someone is filmed while they are performing, in order to see if they are suitable to act in a film
someone who writes plays for film or television
a thin pointed piece of metal that you push and turn in order to fasten pieces of metal or wood together
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fix the frame in position and tighten the screws .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把框子固定在正确位置上﹐拧紧螺丝。

PIC.HEADING: SCREW 螺丝
PIC.PICCONTENT: nail 钉子；screw 螺丝；bolt 螺栓；nut 螺母；tack 平头钉

Sense.DEF: not polite

Subsense.DEF: an offensive word meaning an act of having sex
an offensive word for someone who is good at having sex
Subsense.TRAN: 性交好手﹐好的性交对象

Sense.DEF: to be slightly crazy
Sense.TRAN: 有点疯疯癫癫﹐头脑有些不正常

Sense.DEF: to force someone to do something by threatening them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has started to tighten the screws on illegal share dealers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府开始打压不法证券商。

Sense.DEF: a prison officer – used especially by prisoners
Sense.TRAN: 监狱看守人﹐狱警〔尤为囚犯用语〕

Sense.DEF: to attach one thing to another using a screw

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The chairs were screwed to the floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些椅子用螺丝固定在地板上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wooden frame should be screwed onto the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个木框应该用螺丝固定到墙上。

Sense.DEF: to fasten or close something by turning it, or to be fastened in this way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The lens screws onto the front of the camera.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 镜头旋扣在照相机正面。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She carefully screwed the cap back onto the toothpaste.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她小心地把牙膏盖子拧回去。

Sense.DEF: to twist paper or cloth into a small round shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: She screwed the letter up and threw it in the bin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把信揉成一团扔进垃圾桶里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I screwed my handkerchief into a ball.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把我的手帕揉成一团。

Sense.DEF: an offensive word meaning to have sex with someone
an offensive expression used to show that you are very angry with someone
to cheat someone in order to get money from them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They screwed us for $60 in the end.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们最后骗走了我们 60 美元。

Sense.DEF: to do silly things that may cause trouble
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids were screwing around down by the bus station.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些小孩在汽车站边上捣蛋。

Sense.DEF: an offensive expression meaning to have sex with a lot of different people
to make a bad mistake or do something very stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’d better not screw up this time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次你最好别搞砸了。

Sense.DEF: to spoil something by doing something stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: She realized that she had screwed up her life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她意识到她把自己的生活都给毁了。

Sense.DEF: to move the muscles in your face in a way that makes your eyes seem narrow
Sense.EXAMPLE: He screwed up his eyes against the bright light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强烈的光线下他瞇起了眼睛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her face was screwed up with pain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她痛得脸都扭曲了。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very unhappy, confused, or upset so that they have emotional problems for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔长时间地〕使某人很不愉快﹐使某人非常烦恼
Sense.EXAMPLE: It really screwed her up when her mother died.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母亲的去世让她十分难过。

Sense.LEXUNIT: screw up the/enough courage to do sth
Sense.DEF: to be brave enough to do something you are very nervous about
Sense.EXAMPLE: I finally screwed up enough courage to talk to her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我终于鼓足勇气和她说了话。

Sense.DEF: someone who seems very strange or crazy
a film or television programme that is funny because crazy things happen
a tool with a narrow blade at one end that you use for turning screws

an alcoholic drink made from
vodka
and orange juice
Sense.TRAN: 伏特加橙汁鸡尾酒﹐螺丝刀鸡尾酒

Sense.DEF: someone who is screwed up has a lot of emotional problems because of bad or unhappy experiences in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔因过去的倒霉或不快经历〕焦虑不安的﹐神经质的

Sense.DEF: a top for a bottle or other container that you fasten on by turning it
an idea or plan that is screwy seems very strange or crazy
to write something quickly and untidily
Sense.EXAMPLE: I scribbled his phone number in my address book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在地址簿上潦草地写下他的电话号码。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He scribbled down our names.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他潦草地写下我们的姓名。

Sense.DEF: to draw marks that have no meaning
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone had scribbled all over my picture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人把我的画涂得乱七八糟。

Sense.DEF: meaningless marks or pictures, especially done by children
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指小孩的〕乱涂的无意义的东西﹐涂鸦

Sense.DEF: untidy writing that is difficult to read
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t read his scribble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看不懂他潦草的字。

Sense.DEF: a writer, especially an unimportant one
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不重要的〕作家﹔蹩脚文人

Sense.DEF: someone in the past whose job was to make written copies of official documents

a
journalist
– used humorously
a fight

a practice game of football,
basketball
etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔足球﹑篮球等的〕练习比赛﹐队内分组比赛

Sense.DEF: to try to save as much money as you can, even though you have very little
Sense.TRAN: 尽力攒钱﹐省吃俭用﹐节衣缩食
Sense.EXAMPLE: They scrimped and saved for years to buy their own home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们为买一栋自己的房子省吃俭用了许多年。

Sense.DEF: the written form of a speech, play, film etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔演讲的〕原稿﹐讲稿﹔〔戏剧﹑电影等的〕剧本
Sense.EXAMPLE: They write all their own scripts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们所有的剧本都是自己写的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a film script
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影剧本

Sense.DEF: the set of letters that are used in writing a language
Sense.TRAN: 〔一种语言的〕全套字母﹐字母表
Sense.EXAMPLE: Arabic script
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿拉伯语字母表

Sense.DEF: a piece of work that a student writes in an examination
writing done by hand
Sense.EXAMPLE: a diary entry written in neat black script
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用工整的黑色字写下的一则日记

Sense.DEF: a speech or broadcast that is scripted has been written down before it is read
contained in the Bible or based on the Bible
the Bible
Sense.EXAMPLE: the way God is portrayed in Scripture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《圣经》中对上帝的描写

Sense.DEF: the holy books of a particular religion
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hindu scriptures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度教经文

Sense.DEF: someone who writes the stories and words for films or television programmes
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影或电视〕剧本作者﹐剧作家﹐编剧

Sense.DEF: a long piece of paper that can be rolled up, and is used as an official document
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于正式文件书写的〕纸卷﹐卷轴

Sense.DEF: a design shaped like a piece of rolled up paper
to move information on a computer screen up or down so that you can read it
Sense.TRAN: 〔将计算机屏幕上的信息〕上下滚动﹐滚屏〔以便阅读〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He scrolled through the document.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在屏幕上把这份文件从头到尾滚动读了一遍。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Could you scroll down a few lines?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你往下滚动几行好吗？

Sense.DEF:
a part on the side of a computer screen that you move using a
mouse
in order to move up or down
someone who hates spending money

the bag of skin that contains a man’s
testicles
to get money or something you want by asking other people for it rather than by paying for it yourself

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a group of children scrounging for food
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群乞讨食物的儿童

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I managed to scrounge some money off my dad.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我设法从爸爸那儿要了一点钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Leroy would scrounge around for old car parts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 勒罗伊会到处向别人讨要旧的汽车零件。

Sense.DEF: to be trying to get money or things you want by asking other people for them
to rub something hard, especially with a stiff brush, in order to clean it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was on her hands and knees scrubbing the floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她正趴着擦地板。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He scrubbed the dirt off his boots.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把靴子上的脏土擦掉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The table needs to be scrubbed clean .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这桌子要擦干净。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She scrubbed at her face with a tissue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用一张纸巾擦脸。

Sense.DEF: to decide not to do something that you had planned
Sense.EXAMPLE: We scrubbed the idea in the end.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后我们放弃了这个想法。

Sense.DEF: to clean the inside of a place thoroughly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rooms are all scrubbed out once a week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有房间每星期彻底清扫一次。

Sense.DEF: to wash your hands and arms before doing a medical operation
Sense.TRAN: 〔医生﹑护士等在手术前〕清洗手臂

Sense.DEF: low bushes and trees that grow in very dry soil
if you give something a scrub, you clean it by rubbing it hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: I gave the floor a good scrub .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把地板仔细刷洗了一遍。

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for a woman who has sex for money, or has sex with a lot of different men. Do not use this word.
a stiff brush that you use for cleaning things
scrubby land is covered by low bushes
scrubby trees and bushes are small and do not look very healthy
Sense.TRAN: 〔树木﹑灌木〕低矮的﹐矮小的﹐生长不良的

Sense.DEF: an area of land that is covered with low bushes

Sense.LEXUNIT: by the scruff of the neck
Sense.DEF: if you hold a person or animal by the scruff of their neck, you hold the skin, fur, or clothes at the back of their neck
Sense.TRAN: 抓住颈背﹐揪住脖子﹔抓住衣领

Sense.DEF: someone who looks untidy or dirty
dirty and untidy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scruffy old pair of jeans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条不干净的旧牛仔裤
Sense.EXAMPLE: scruffy shops
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凌乱的商店

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个穿得很邋遢的男人

Sense.DEF:
a part of a game of
rugby
when the players all push together in a circle, with their heads down, and try to get the ball
Sense.TRAN: 〔英式橄榄球赛中的〕对阵争球

Sense.DEF: a crowd of people who are all close together and pushing each other to try to get something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He struggled through the scrum of people to the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他奋力穿过推推搡搡拥挤的人群来到厨房。

Sense.DEF:
a player in
rugby
who has to put the ball into the
scrum
Sense.TRAN: 〔英式橄榄球赛中的〕传锋﹐争球前卫

Sense.DEF:
a
scrum 1
Sense.TRAN: 〔英式橄榄球赛中的〕对阵争球

Sense.DEF: food that is scrummy tastes very good
to steal fruit from trees in people’s gardens
Sense.TRAN: 偷摘〔别人园子里的水果〕

Sense.DEF: food that is scrumptious tastes very good
Sense.TRAN: 〔食物〕 美味的﹐可口的﹐顶呱呱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scrumptious chocolate cake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美味可口的巧克力蛋糕
Sense.EXAMPLE: That was absolutely scrumptious !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那东西好吃极了！

Sense.DEF: a strong alcoholic drink made from apples
if stones, leaves etc scrunch as you walk on them, they make a noisy sound
Sense.TRAN: 〔脚踩碎石﹑树叶等时〕发出嘎吱声
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dry leaves scrunched under our feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干树叶在我们脚底下嘎吱作响。

Sense.DEF: to crush and twist something into a small round shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: I scrunched up the letter and threw it in the bin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把信揉成一团扔进垃圾桶。

Sense.DEF: to move the muscles in your face in a way that makes your eyes seem narrow
Sense.EXAMPLE: He scrunched up his eyes and grinned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他瞇起眼睛咧着嘴笑。

Sense.DEF:
a small circular piece of rubber covered loosely with cloth, which is used for holding hair together in a
ponytail
a belief about what is right and wrong that prevents you from doing bad things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had no scruples about selling faulty goods to people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他卖次货给人﹐心里没有丝毫不安。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a man with no moral scruples
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个道德上无所顾忌的男人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They made thousands of families homeless without scruple.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们肆无忌惮﹐令成千上万的家庭流离失所。

Sense.DEF: to be willing to do something even though it may be wrong or may upset people
Sense.EXAMPLE: They did not scruple to bomb innocent civilians.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们毫无顾忌地轰炸无辜平民。

Sense.DEF: very careful to be completely honest and fair
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not all lawyers are as scrupulous as she is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 并不是所有的律师都像她那样正直。
Sense.EXAMPLE: scrupulous honesty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 至诚

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The organization will be scrupulous in maintaining the highest moral standards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本组织将力求保持最高的道德标准。

Sense.DEF: doing something very carefully so that nothing is left out
Sense.TRAN: 极仔细认真的﹐一丝不苟的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was not very scrupulous about keeping himself clean.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对个人卫生不很讲究。

Sense.EXAMPLE: scrupulous attention to detail
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对细节的一丝不苟

Sense.DEF: an official who checks that the votes in an election are counted fairly
to examine someone or something very carefully
Sense.TRAN: 仔细检查﹐认真查看﹐详审
Sense.EXAMPLE: He scrutinized the document.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他细阅了这份文件。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She scrutinized his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她细细端详他的脸。

Sense.DEF: careful and thorough examination of someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 仔细的审视﹔彻底的检查

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Careful scrutiny of the company’s accounts revealed a whole series of errors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 仔细查看公司的账目﹐有一连串的错误被发现。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Their activities have come under police scrutiny .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的活动受到警方的严密监视。

Sense.DEF:
something that helps a small computer work with another piece of electronic equipment, such as a
printer
, especially when they are connected by wires
Sense.TRAN: 小型计算机系统（专用）接口
Sense.EXAMPLE: a SCSI port
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小型计算机系统接口

Sense.DEF: the sport of swimming under water while breathing through a tube that is connected to a container of air on your back
Sense.TRAN: 斯库巴潜泳﹐带水肺潜水

Sense.DEF: if clouds scud across the sky, they move quickly
to make a mark on a smooth surface by rubbing it against something rough
Sense.EXAMPLE: His shoes were old and badly scuffed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的鞋子旧了﹐磨损得很厉害。

Sense.DEF: to walk in a slow lazy way, not lifting your feet up very high
a short fight that is not very violent
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scuffles broke out between rival supporters during the match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛过程中﹐双方球迷之间发生了打斗。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: scuffles with police
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和警察扭打

Sense.DEF: to have a short fight with someone, in a way that is not very serious or violent

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some of the demonstrators scuffled with the police.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 示威者中有些人和警察扭打起来。

Sense.DEF: to walk quickly and make a noise as your feet rub on the ground
a mark made on something when it has rubbed against something rough
a small light boat for only one person, used in races

one of a pair of
oars
that you use to move along in a small light boat

to make a small boat move along using a pair of
oars
a room next to the kitchen in a large house, where cleaning jobs were done in past times
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时大宅中紧挨厨房的〕洗涤室

Sense.DEF: to make a particular shape from stone, wood, clay etc
having a clear smooth shape that looks as though an artist has made it
Sense.TRAN: 雕刻般的﹐雕塑般的〔指外观线条清晰﹑表面光滑〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: high, sculpted cheekbones
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高高的﹑雕塑般的颧骨

Sense.DEF: someone who makes sculptures
a woman who makes sculptures
an object made out of stone, wood, clay etc by an artist

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sculpture of an elephant
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一尊大象雕塑
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an exhibition of sculpture
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雕塑展

Sense.DEF: the art of making objects out of stone, wood, clay etc
cut or formed from stone, wood, clay etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a row of sculptured animals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一排动物雕塑

Sense.DEF: having a smooth attractive shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: her sculptured face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那雕塑般美丽的脸

Sense.DEF: an area of land where there are a number of sculptures for the public to see
an unpleasant dirty substance that forms on the surface of water
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pond covered with green scum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漂满绿色浮沫的池塘

Sense.DEF: nasty unpleasant people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scum like that should be locked away!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像这种人渣应该关起来！
Sense.EXAMPLE: People like that are the scum of the earth .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那种人是社会渣滓。

Sense.DEF: a nasty, unpleasant person
to ruin someone’s plans or chance of being successful – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 破坏﹐使〔计划﹑机会等〕泡汤〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plans to build a private hospital have been scuppered after a government inquiry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过政府调查后﹐建造一家私人医院的计划泡汤了。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately sink your own ship
a hole in the side of a ship that allows water to flow back into the sea
scurrilous remarks, articles etc contain damaging and untrue statements about someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scurrilous attack on his integrity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他正直人格的恶意诋毁

Sense.DEF: to move quickly with short steps, especially because you are in a hurry
Sense.EXAMPLE: People were scurrying off to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们急匆匆赶着去上班。
