Sense.DEF: a bend in the road in the shape of an ‘S’, that can be dangerous to drivers

a disease caused by not eating foods such as fruit and vegetables that contain
vitamin
C
to move quickly with short steps, especially because you are afraid and do not want to be noticed
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因害怕且不想被注意到而〕小步急跑﹐疾走
Sense.EXAMPLE: A little lizard scuttled across the path.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条小蜥蜴急急地从路上爬过。

Sense.DEF: to ruin or end someone’s plans or chance of being successful – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 破坏﹐阻挠〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The incident threatens to scuttle the peace process.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一事件可能会破坏和平进程。

Sense.DEF: to sink a ship by making holes in the bottom, especially in order to prevent it being used by an enemy
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为不让敌人使用而〕凿沉〔船只〕

Sense.DEF: a container for carrying coal
stories about other people’s personal lives, especially stories that are unkind or untrue
Sense.TRAN: 〔关于别人私生活的〕流言蜚语

Sense.DEF: unpleasant and dirty

Sense.TRAN: 小型计算机系统（专用）接口
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the biggest scuzzy hard drive you have?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们最大的小型计算机系统接口硬盘驱动器是哪一种？

Sense.DEF: a farming tool that has a long curved blade attached to a long wooden handle, and is used to cut grain or long grass
to move through or destroy something quickly and violently
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bullets scythed through the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一颗颗子弹向人群扫去。

Sense.DEF: to cut with a scythe

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= southeast or southeastern 东南（方）﹔东南部的﹔来自东南方的

Sense.DEF: the large area of salty water that covers much of the Earth’s surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jay stripped his clothes off and ran into the sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰伊脱光衣服奔入海里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most exports went by sea .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分出口商品都走海路。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a little cottage by the sea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座海滨小屋
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spent over 30 years at sea .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在船上工作了30多年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They stood side by side looking out to sea .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们并排站着眺望大海。

Sense.DEF: a large area of salty water that is mostly enclosed by land
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Mediterranean Sea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地中海

Sense.DEF: a very large number of people or things that all look similar
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked out at the sea of faces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他放眼望去﹐人海茫茫。

Sense.DEF: confused or not sure what to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Living in a foreign country can mean you’re always at sea about what’s going on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活在异国他乡可能意味着你对周围的事总是茫然不知所措。

Sense.DEF: the sea – used especially when you are not talking about a particular ocean

GramExa.GLOSS: far away
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They came from lands across the seas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们来自遥远的国度。

Sense.DEF: one of the broad areas that seem flat on the moon and Mars
Sense.TRAN: 海〔指月球或火星表面的一片广阔平原〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The sun shone brightly upon the clear blue sea.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 清澈湛蓝的海面上,阳光灿烂。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The sea was perfectly calm.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 海面上风平浪静。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with big waves
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The sea was too rough to swim in.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 海上浪太大,不能游泳。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with a lot of small waves
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The wind was starting to pick up and the sea was becoming choppy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 风大起来,海面开始微波荡漾。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a rough sea
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The tanker split apart and sank in heavy seas.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 油轮船体断裂﹐沉入波涛汹涌的大海。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the part of the sea that is far away from land

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Our ancestors crossed the sea in small boats.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的祖先驾着小船远渡重洋。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: go to work on a ship
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He went to sea when he was eighteen.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他18岁出海。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: sail a boat away from land
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The refugees put to sea in rickety rafts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民们驾着破筏子驶入大海。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be drowned in the sea
be taken far away from land by the sea

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Removing salt from sea water is an expensive process.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 海水淡化是个代价昂贵的过程。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: All the bedrooms have a sea view.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有房间都能看到海景。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Average sea levels are rising year on year.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 海平面平均高度在逐年升高。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the air close to the sea
the land at the bottom of the sea

Sense.DEF: the air near the sea, which is considered to be clean, fresh, and good for your health
a small brightly coloured sea animal that sticks onto rocks and looks like a flower
Sense.TRAN: 海葵〔一种色泽鲜艳的海生小动物〕

Sense.DEF: the land at the bottom of the sea
a bird that lives near the sea and finds food in it
the part of a country that is near the sea

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the eastern seaboard of the US
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国的东海岸

Sense.DEF: carried on or arriving in ships
Sense.TRAN: 海运的﹐经由[来自]海上的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the threat of a seaborne invasion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海上入侵的威胁

Sense.DEF: a light wind that blows from the sea onto the land

the
captain
of a ship
a very big change in something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sea change in attitudes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 态度的大转变

Sense.DEF: someone with a lot of experience of ships and sailing

a
sailor
or someone who travels regularly by ship
Sense.TRAN: 水手﹐海员﹔经常乘船旅行的人

Sense.DEF: working or travelling on ships and the sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: a seafaring man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海员

Sense.DEF: the land at the bottom of the sea

animals from the sea that you can eat, for example fish and
shellfish
Sense.EXAMPLE: a seafood restaurant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海鲜餐馆

Sense.DEF: the part of a town where the shops, houses etc are next to the beach

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a hotel right on the seafront
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在海滩边的一家宾馆

Sense.EXAMPLE: a seafront café
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海滨咖啡馆

Sense.DEF: built to travel on the sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: a seagoing ship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 远洋轮

Sense.DEF: bluish-green
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jo’s large sea-green eyes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔蓝绿色的大眼睛

Sense.DEF: a large common grey or white bird that lives near the sea
a small sea fish with a head and neck that look like those of a horse
a large sea animal that eats fish and lives around coasts

Subsense.DEF: a mark that has a special design and shows the legal or official authority of a person or organization
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The document carried the seal of the governor’s office.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文件上盖有州长办公室的章。

Subsense.DEF: the object that is used to make this mark

Sense.DEF: a piece of rubber or plastic that keeps air, water, dirt etc out of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔防止空气﹑水﹑灰尘等渗入的〕密封条﹐密封纸

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an airtight seal around the windows
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗户四周的密封条

Sense.DEF:
a piece of
wax
, paper, wire etc that you have to break in order to open a container, document etc
if you give something your seal of approval, you say that you approve of it, especially officially
Sense.EXAMPLE: A number of employers have already given their seal of approval to the scheme.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些雇主已经对这项计划表示认可。

Sense.DEF: to make something definite or complete
Sense.TRAN: 确定某事﹐使某事成定局
Sense.EXAMPLE: In 1972, Nixon himself went to China to set the seal on the new relationship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1972年尼克松亲自访华﹐以确立新的外交关系。

Sense.DEF: to close an entrance or a container with something that stops air, water etc from coming in or out of it
Sense.TRAN: 〔为防止空气﹑水等渗入或渗出〕把…封住﹐封闭
Sense.EXAMPLE: The window was sealed shut.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这扇窗户被封了起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A quick way to seal awkward gaps is to use a foam filler.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要填补难弄的裂缝﹐一个快捷办法就是使用泡沫填充剂。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Dried milk is kept in hermetically sealed very tightly closed containers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奶粉储藏在完全密封的容器里。

Sense.DEF: if a building, area, or country is sealed, no one can enter or leave it
Sense.TRAN: 封闭﹐封锁〔建筑物﹑地区﹑国家〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Authorities plan to seal the border.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当局计划封锁边境。

Sense.DEF: to close an envelope, package etc by using something sticky to hold its edges in place
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wrote the address and sealed the envelope.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他写好地址﹐封上信封。

Sense.DEF: to cover the surface of something with something that will protect it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wooden decks should be sealed to prevent cracking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木质平台应该刷防护漆防止开裂。

Sense.DEF: to make something, especially something bad, sure to happen
Sense.TRAN: 决定某人的命运〔尤指厄运〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The outbreak of war sealed the government’s fate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争爆发使政府的命运成为定局。

Sense.DEF: to make an agreement more formal or definite
to make a victory certain
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smith’s goal sealed the victory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史密斯的入球锁定了胜局。

Sense.DEF: to stop something that is inside something else from getting out
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fry the meat quickly to seal in the juices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把肉快煎一下锁住肉汁。

Sense.DEF: to stop people from entering an area or building, because it is dangerous
Sense.TRAN: 〔因有危险而〕封闭﹐封锁〔某地区或某幢建筑〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Following a bomb warning, police have sealed off the whole area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接到有炸弹的警告后﹐警方封锁了整个地区。

Sense.DEF: a path across the sea that ships regularly use
a substance that is put on the surface of something to protect it from air, water etc
Sense.TRAN: 密封胶﹐密封剂﹐防渗漏剂

Sense.DEF: shut or protected with something that prevents air, water etc from getting in or out
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sealed container
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 密封容器

Sense.DEF: sealed documents are closed so that they can only be read by a certain person or at a certain time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sealed bids offers to pay a particular price for something should be sent to Richard Walker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 密封的标书应该送到理查德·沃克那里。

Sense.DEF: the ability to walk normally, not feel ill etc when you are travelling on a ship
Sense.TRAN: 能在颠簸的船上平稳走动的本领﹐不晕船的能力

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I felt awful yesterday. But, thankfully, I’ve found my sea legs now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天我感觉很糟﹐不过谢天谢地﹐现在我不晕船了。

Sense.DEF: a substance that is put on the surface of something to protect it from air, water etc

a person or ship that hunts
seals
the average height of the sea, used as a standard for measuring other heights and depths, such as the height of a mountain

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 1,000m above sea level

Sense.EXAMPLE: changes in sea level
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海平面的变化

Sense.DEF:
the activity of hunting or catching
seals
a red substance that melts and becomes hard again quickly, used for closing letters, documents etc, especially in the past

a large type of
seal
that lives near the coast in the Pacific Ocean

the skin or fur of some types of
seal
, used for making leather or clothes
a line where two pieces of cloth, leather etc have been stitched together
Sense.TRAN: 〔两块布﹑皮革等连接处的〕缝﹐线缝
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was repairing Billy’s trousers, where the seam had come undone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在补比利裤子的开线处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Join the shoulder seams together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把肩部缝起来。

Sense.DEF: a layer of a mineral under the ground

Sense.LEXUNIT: be coming/falling apart at the seams

Subsense.DEF: if a plan, organization etc is coming apart at the seams, so many things are going wrong with it that it will probably fail
Subsense.TRAN: 〔计划〕接近失败﹔〔组织〕分崩离析
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The health service seems to be falling apart at the seams.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共医疗卫生服务似乎到了崩溃的边缘。

Subsense.DEF: if a piece of clothing is coming apart at the seams, the stitches on it are coming unfastened

Sense.DEF: if a room or building is bursting at the seams, it is so full of people that hardly anyone else can fit into it
a thing, place, or group from which a type of thing can be obtained
Sense.TRAN: 某物很丰富﹐大量的某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The 466-page book is a rich seam of statistical information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本466页的书是一个内容丰富的统计信息库。

Sense.DEF: a line where two pieces of metal, wood etc have been joined together
Sense.TRAN: 〔两块金属﹑木头等的〕接合处﹐接缝

Sense.DEF:
a
sailor
on a ship or in the navy who is not an officer
someone who has a lot of experience of ships and the sea
the skills and knowledge that an experienced sailor has
Sense.TRAN: 航海术﹐航海技能﹐船舶驾驶术

Sense.DEF: having a seam
Sense.EXAMPLE: seamed stockings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有接缝的长筒袜

Sense.DEF: a seamed surface has many deep lines on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: A gentle smile spread over her seamed face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她布满皱纹的脸上露出慈祥的笑容。

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring distance at sea that is slightly longer than a land mile, and equals 1,853 metres
a mist on land that comes in from the sea
Sense.TRAN: 海雾〔从海上飘到陆上的雾〕

Sense.DEF: done or made so smoothly that you cannot tell where one thing stops and another begins
Sense.EXAMPLE: the seamless integration of data, text, images and sound
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数据﹑文本﹑图像和声音的完美结合

Sense.DEF:
without any
seams
Sense.EXAMPLE: seamless stockings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无缝长筒袜

Sense.DEF: a woman whose job is sewing and making clothes
a woman who is good at sewing
involving unpleasant things such as crime, violence, or immorality
Sense.EXAMPLE: the seamy side of the World Wide Web
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 万维网的阴暗面

Sense.DEF: a meeting where people try to talk to or receive messages from the spirits of dead people
Sense.TRAN: 降神会〔试图与亡灵对话的集会〕

Sense.DEF: a plane that can take off from and land on a body of water

a large town on or near a coast, with a
harbour
that big ships can use
the size and strength of a country’s navy
a country with a powerful navy
to burn something with a sudden powerful heat
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heat seared their skin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高温灼伤了他们的皮肤。

Sense.DEF: to have a very strong sudden and unpleasant effect on you
Sense.TRAN: 给…留下极不愉快的感觉﹐铭刻
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pain was searing through her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疼痛传遍她全身。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The image was seared into his brain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个影像烙进了他的脑海里。

Sense.DEF: to cook the outside of a piece of meat quickly at a high temperature, in order to keep its juices in
Sense.TRAN: 把〔肉〕用高温快煎〔以锁住肉汁〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: seared tuna steaks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煎金枪鱼排

Sense.DEF: an attempt to find someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bad weather is hampering the search for survivors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 恶劣的天气妨碍了对幸存者的搜寻。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two more bodies were found after a search of the woods.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 搜寻树林以后﹐又找到了两具尸体。

Sense.DEF: a series of actions done by a computer to find information

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a computerized search of 10,000 medical journals
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对一万份医学期刊的计算机化检索

Sense.EXAMPLE: A search found 46 websites.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 搜索后找到46个网站。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an online search
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 网上搜索

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do a search on ‘rabbit’ and see what it brings up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 搜索一下rabbit﹐看看能查到什么。

Sense.DEF: looking for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark went in search of water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克去找水了。

Sense.DEF: an attempt to find an explanation or solution

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the search for a cure
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 寻找治疗方法

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Police have carried out a search of his home.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方对他家进行了搜查。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: start a search
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A massive search was launched for the former soldier.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 搜寻这位老兵的一场大规模行动已经展开。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They called off the search when it got dark.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 天黑了,他们就停止搜寻。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We conducted a thorough search of the building.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对大楼进行了彻底搜查。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one done in an organized way
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They set about a systematic search of the ship.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们开始对这艘船进行系统搜查。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an unsuccessful one
in every part of a country
a search of every house or building in an area
a careful search for clues by police officers
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔警方为寻找线索而进行的〕细致彻底的检查

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: people are trying to find someone or something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The search is on for someone with the same blood type.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 寻找相同血型者的工作正在进行。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it has started

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The search area has now been widened.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 搜寻范围现已扩大。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of search, look for and try to find in spoken and written English. search﹐look for和try to find在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。

This graph shows that the expressions look for and try to find are much more common in both spoken and written English than the verb search. Look for and try to find are used in a very general way. Search is used when someone, often a group of people, spends time looking for someone or something in a careful, organized way. 本图表显示,在口语和书面英语中,词组 look for 和 try to find 比动词 search 常用得多。look for 和 try to find 用法非常广泛,search则常指一群人仔细﹑有条理地寻找某人或某物。

Sense.DEF: to try to find someone or something by looking very carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was too dark to search further.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天太暗﹐无法继续寻找。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The area was thoroughly searched .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一地区已被彻底搜查过。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: An RAF plane searched for the missing men.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一架皇家空军飞机在搜寻失踪者。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve searched high and low everywhere for my glasses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我到处找我的眼镜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Detectives are searching the yard for clues.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 侦探们在院子里寻找线索。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Alice bent to search through a heap of clothes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾丽斯弯腰在一大堆衣服中翻找。

Sense.DEF: to use a computer to find information

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Search the Web for cheap flights.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在网上搜索廉价航班。

Sense.DEF: if someone in authority searches you or the things you are carrying, they look for things you might be hiding

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was searched by the guards for weapons.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警卫在他身上搜查武器。

Sense.DEF: to try to find an explanation or solution

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Scientists are still searching for a cure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家们仍在寻找对策。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She paused, searching for inspiration.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她停下来寻找灵感。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you do not know the answer to a question
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Where is she?’ ‘Search me!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她在哪里？”“我不知道！”

Sense.DEF: to examine something carefully in order to find something out, decide something etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anya searched his face anxiously.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿妮娅焦急地察看他脸上的表情。

Exponent.DEF: to look carefully for someone or something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Detectives continue to search for clues.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 探员继续寻找线索。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She searched through all his clothes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她翻遍了他所有的衣服。

Exponent.DEF: to try to get someone or something you want or need
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m looking for something to wear for my sister’s wedding.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在找参加姐姐婚礼穿的衣服。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The band is looking for a singer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队正在寻找一名歌手。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s decided to look for a new career.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他决定寻找新的事业。

Exponent.DEF: used especially when someone or something is difficult to find
Exponent.TRAN: 寻找某人/某物〔尤指不容易找到〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I spent half an hour trying to find a parking space.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我找停车位找了半个小时。

Exponent.DEF: to try to find something or someone. Used especially about jobs, help, or information. Also used in newspaper advertisements when trying to find a suitable person
Exponent.TRAN: 寻找,寻求〔尤用于指寻找工作﹑帮助或信息﹔也用于报纸广告中寻找合适的人选〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They went there seeking work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们去那儿找工作。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She decided to seek help.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决定寻求帮助。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Tall blond 18-year-old male seeks female 17+ for friendship.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 男,18岁,高个儿,金发,欲觅17岁以上女性为友。

Exponent.DEF: to look for someone or something. Used when you look very carefully and thoroughly, or in the phrase house/job/bargain hunting
Exponent.TRAN: 〔非常仔细彻底地〕搜寻,寻找〔也用于短语 house/job/bargain hunting 中〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve hunted everywhere, but I can’t find a recipe for French onion soup.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我到处都找了,还是没有找到法国洋葱汤的食谱。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s gone out bargain-hunting in the sales.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她去特卖会淘便宜货去了。

Exponent.EXP: be on the lookout for sb/sth
Exponent.DEF: to be continuously looking for someone or something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m always on the lookout for a good bargain.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直在留意着便宜的东西。

Exponent.DEF: to look for someone or something in every possible place
Exponent.TRAN: 〔寻找某人或某物时〕不放过任何一个地方
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The police say they will leave no stone unturned in their search for the killer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方说他们将全力搜捕凶手,不放过任何一个地方。

Sense.DEF: to find something by searching
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were too tired to search out extra blankets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们太累了﹐不愿意再去翻几条毯子出来。

Sense.DEF: a computer program that helps you find information on the Internet
intended to find out all the facts about something
Sense.TRAN: 深挖细究的﹐仔细彻底的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Interviewees need to be ready for some searching questions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 接受面试的人要准备好回答一些刨根问底的问题。

Sense.DEF: a look from someone who is trying to find out as much as possible about someone else’s thoughts and feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: She avoided his long searching look.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她避开了他长时间探寻的目光。

Sense.DEF: a very bright electric light that turns in any direction, used for finding people, guarding places etc
a group of people who are organ-ized to look for someone who is missing or lost
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s get going or they’ll send out a search party .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走吧﹐不然他们要派搜救队来了。

Sense.DEF: a legal document that gives the police official permission to search a building
extremely hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: the searing heat of the desert
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙漠的灼热

Sense.DEF: searing pain is severe and feels like a burn
searing words or attitudes criticize someone or something very strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Adorno’s searing analysis of mass culture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿多诺对大众文化的辛辣分析
Sense.EXAMPLE: Emily felt a searing anger against her father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米莉对父亲感到一阵强烈的愤怒。

Sense.DEF: a type of salt made from sea water, used in cooking
a picture of the sea
the empty shell of a small sea creature
Sense.EXAMPLE: jewelry made out of seashells
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用贝壳做的首饰

Sense.DEF: the land at the edge of the sea, consisting of sand and rocks
feeling ill when you travel in a boat, because of the movement of the boat in the water

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hal was seasick almost at once.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈尔几乎马上就晕船了。

Sense.DEF: the areas or towns near the sea, where people go to enjoy them-selves
Sense.EXAMPLE: a trip to the seaside
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去海滨的旅行

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a day at the seaside
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在海滨的一天

Sense.DEF: relating to places that are near the sea

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the popular seaside resort of Brighton
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很受欢迎的海滨度假胜地布赖顿

Sense.EXAMPLE: a seaside holiday
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海滨度假

Sense.DEF: one of the main periods into which a year is divided, each of which has a particular type of weather. The seasons are spring, summer, autumn, and winter
Sense.EXAMPLE: the effect on plants as the seasons start to change
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 换季对植物的影响

Sense.DEF: a period of time in a year during which a particular activity takes place, or during which something usually happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: the first game of the season
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本赛季的第一场比赛

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the end of the football season
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球赛季的结束

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The racing season starts in June.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 赛马季节于6月份开始。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some footpaths are closed during the shooting season.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在狩猎季节﹐一些人行小道会被封闭。

GramExa.GLOSS: when an activity is not allowed
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was caught fishing out of season.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在禁渔期捕鱼被人抓住。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The season for strawberries when they are available to buy usually starts in early June.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 草莓一般从6月初开始上市。

GramExa.GLOSS: the time when it rains a lot or does not rain at all
GramExa.EXAMPLE: African rivers turn to hard mud during the dry season.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 非洲的河流在旱季会变成干硬的泥地。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The planting season is in spring, with harvest in the fall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 春天是播种的季节﹐秋天是收获的季节。

Sense.DEF: the time of the year when most people take their holidays

GramExa.GLOSS: the busiest part of this time
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are two boat trips a day, more in high season.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一天两班游船﹐旺季班次更多。

GramExa.GLOSS: the least busy part of this time
GramExa.EXAMPLE: An off-season break costs £114.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 淡季度假费用是114英镑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s quieter out of season.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 淡季要清静些。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We arrived at the height of the tourist season the busiest time .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到的时候是旅游旺季。

GramExa.GLOSS: Thanksgiving to New Year, including Christmas, Hanukkah etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔感恩节到新年期间包括圣诞节﹑献殿节等在内的〕节期﹐节假期

GramExa.GLOSS: Christmas and New Year
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 圣诞节节期〔即圣诞节和新年〕

Sense.DEF: the time in each year when new styles of clothes, hair etc are produced and become fashionable
Sense.TRAN: 〔一年中新款式时装﹑新发型等的〕流行期
Sense.EXAMPLE: This season’s look is fresh and natural.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今季的流行风格是清新﹑自然。

Sense.DEF: vegetables and fruit that are in season are cheap and easily available because it is the time of year when they are ready to eat. If they are out of season, they are expensive or not available
Sense.TRAN: 〔蔬菜﹑水果〕当令的/不合时令的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vine tomatoes are in season from April to October.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 藤蔓番茄的当令季节是从4月到10月。

Sense.DEF: a series of films, plays, television programmes etc that are shown during a particular period of time
Sense.TRAN: 〔一系列电影﹑戏剧﹑电视节目等的〕会演期﹐上演期﹐献演期

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new season of comedy on BBC 1
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在英国广播公司电视一台播出的新喜剧系列

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The network has several new dramas lined up for the fall season.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该电视网有好几个新剧排在秋季档播出。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Glyndebourne’s season opens with a performance of Tosca.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格林德伯恩歌剧节以一场《托斯卡》开幕。

Sense.DEF: the time of the year when animals are ready to have sex
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their dog was coming into season .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的狗正处于发情期。

Sense.DEF: used on cards to tell someone you hope they have a happy Christmas, Hanukkah etc
Sense.TRAN: 节日快乐〔圣诞节﹑献殿节等写在贺卡上的祝词〕

Sense.DEF: the time around Christmas
to add salt, pepper etc to food you are cooking

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Season the chicken with pepper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 给鸡肉加胡椒粉调味。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Mix and season to taste add the amount of salt etc that you think tastes right .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 搅拌后酌情加调味料。

Sense.DEF: to prepare wood for use by gradually drying it
suitable or usual for a particular time of year
Sense.EXAMPLE: seasonable temperatures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 符合季节的气温

Sense.DEF: happening, expected, or needed during a particular season
Sense.TRAN: 季节性的﹐时令的﹐当令的
Sense.EXAMPLE: heavy seasonal rains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 季节性的大雨

GramExa.EXAMPLE: seasonal jobs in the tourist industry
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游业的季节性工作

Sense.DEF: an illness that makes people feel sad and tired in winter, because there is not enough light from the sun
Sense.TRAN: 季节性情感紊乱﹐季节性情感障碍

Sense.DEF: the fact that something changes according to the time of the year

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the seasonality of sales of the product
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种产品销售的季节性

Sense.DEF: according to what is usual for a particular season
Sense.EXAMPLE: bird migrations that occur seasonally
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸟类的季节性迁徙

GramExa.GLOSS: ones that are changed according to what usually happens at a particular time of year
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 随季节调整的数字/比率/数据等

Sense.DEF: used to describe someone who has a lot of experience of a particular thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Artie was by then a seasoned musician with six albums to his credit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到那时阿蒂已经发行了六张专辑﹐是个经验丰富的音乐家了。

Sense.DEF: seasoned food has salt, pepper etc added to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly seasoned piece of fish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 味道很浓的一块鱼

Sense.DEF: seasoned wood has been prepared for use by drying
salt, pepper, spices etc that give food a more interesting taste

a ticket that allows you to make a lot of journeys during a particular period of time, or go to all the games, concerts etc being held during a particular time. Season tickets cost less than it would cost to buy a ticket for each journey, game etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: an annual season ticket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年票

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who owns a season ticket

Sense.DEF: a place where you can sit, especially one in a vehicle or one from which you watch a performance, sports event etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was in the back seat and Jo was driving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在后座﹐乔开车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 10,000-seat stadium
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 万人体育场
Sense.EXAMPLE: People were shifting in their seats, looking uncomfortable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们在座位上动来动去﹐看上去不大自在。

Sense.DEF: a position as an elected member of a government, or as a member of a group that makes official decisions

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a seat in the National Assembly
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国民议会中的一个席位

Sense.EXAMPLE: Promotion would mean a seat on the board of directors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 升职意味着在董事会中拥有一个席位。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Senate seat for Colorado
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科罗拉多州的参议员席位

GramExa.GLOSS: at an election
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔大选中〕赢得/得到/失去一个席位
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He predicts that his party will gain at least 12 seats.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他预测他的政党将至少赢得12个席位。

GramExa.GLOSS: have a seat
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Republicans hold 235 seats and the Democrats have 197.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 共和党有235席﹐民主党有197席。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr Adams is expected to keep his seat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 预计亚当斯先生可以保住他的席位。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Labour held onto the seat with a 7﹪ majority.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党以7%的优势保住了这个席位。

GramExa.GLOSS: one that a party will not lose
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 能稳保的席位

GramExa.GLOSS: one that another party might easily win
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔很可能被另一政党赢得的〕边缘席位

Sense.DEF: the flat part of a chair etc that you sit on
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t put your feet on the seat!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要把脚放在椅座上！
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wooden toilet seat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木质的抽水马桶座
Sense.EXAMPLE: a broken bicycle seat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 损坏的自行车座

Sense.DEF: a special seat that you put in a car for a baby or small child
a city where a country’s government is based
a university, college etc
the part of your trousers that you sit on

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a rip in the seat of his jeans
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他牛仔裤臀部上的裂缝

Sense.DEF: to have less influence or importance
Sense.TRAN: （相对某人/某事）退居次要位置
Sense.EXAMPLE: Foreign policy will take a back seat to domestic problems for a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外交政策暂时要排在国内问题之后了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: on the edge of your seat
Sense.DEF: waiting excitedly to see what happens next
Sense.TRAN: 心情紧张地等待﹐兴奋地等待〔接下来的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gripping movie that will keep you on the edge of your seat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部扣人心弦﹑让人想要一口气看完的影片

Sense.LEXUNIT: do sth by the seat of your pants
Sense.DEF: to do something by using only your own skill and experience, without any help from anyone or anything else, especially when this is risky or dangerous
controlling what happens in a situation, organization, or relationship
Sense.TRAN: 处于控制地位﹐处在统领地位
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re trying to put young people in the driving seat .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们尽量让年轻人来当家做主。

Sense.DEF: in a difficult position where you have to make important decisions, answer questions etc
Sense.TRAN: 处于〔必须作出重大决定﹑回答问题等的〕困难境地

Sense.DEF: a home of a rich important family in the countryside
Sense.TRAN: 〔大户人家在乡间的〕别墅﹐宅邸

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Excuse me, is this seat free?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 不好意思,这个座位有人吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Patrick spotted an empty seat near the back.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕特里克看到靠后的地方有个空座位。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in a car
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Never leave bags on the back seat of a car.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 千万不要把包放在车的后排座位上。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 副驾驶座,前排乘客座位

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one next to the window or the space between seats, for example in a plane
one at the front of a theatre, sports ground etc
one in the front row at a sports event, especially a boxing match
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔尤指拳击比赛的〕台边区前排座位

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one from which you can see well

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We had really good seats, just in front of the stage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有非常好的位子,就在舞台的前面。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: sit down
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Take a seat, please.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 请坐。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You can book seats online.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以在网上预订座位。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A flight attendant showed them to their seats.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘务员领他们到座位处。

Collocate.COLLOC: go back to/return to your seat

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: sit down again
tell other people not to sit there
used for saying that something or someone can attract a large audience
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He is an actor who will put bums on seats.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个很叫座的演员。

Sense.DEF: if a place seats a number of people, it has enough seats for that number
Sense.TRAN: 〔某处〕坐得下…人﹐能供给…人座位
Sense.EXAMPLE: The arena seats 60,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个圆形运动场能坐六万人。

Sense.DEF: to sit down somewhere
Sense.TRAN: 使自己就座（在某物的里边/上面/旁边等）
Sense.EXAMPLE: She seated herself at her desk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐在自己的书桌旁。

Sense.DEF: to arrange for someone to sit somewhere

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the old custom of seating boys and girls on opposite sides of the classroom
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让男孩和女孩分坐在教室两边的老习惯

Sense.DEF: a belt attached to the seat of a car or plane which you fasten around yourself for protection in an accident
if someone is seated, they are sitting down

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paul was seated at his desk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗坐在自己的书桌旁。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Remain seated until the aircraft has come to a complete stop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机完全停稳之前请大家坐好。

Sense.DEF: used to ask people politely to sit down
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please be seated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请入座。

Sense.DEF: a vehicle, piece of furniture etc with space for 4, 12 etc people to sit
all the seats in a theatre, cinema etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔剧院﹑电影院等内的〕全部座位

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a restaurant with seating for 40 customers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家有40个座位的餐厅

Sense.EXAMPLE: The hall has a seating capacity of 650.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座礼堂有650个座位。

Sense.DEF: the places where people will sit, according to an arrangement
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人坐某位置的〕座位安排﹐座位设置

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the seating plan for the wedding dinner
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚宴的座位安排

Sense.DEF: the person who sits next to you on a plane
a small round sea animal with a hard shell covered in sharp points
a wall built beside the sea to stop the water from flowing onto the land
facing towards the sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep to the seaward side of the path.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿着路上靠海的一侧走。

Sense.DEF: salty water from the sea
a plant that grows in the sea
a ship that is seaworthy is in a suitable condition to sail
Sense.TRAN: 〔船〕能安全行驶的﹐状况良好的﹐适于航行的

Sense.DEF: relating to a part of the body that produces oil
Sense.EXAMPLE: sebaceous glands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮脂腺

Sense.DEF: a very short period of time

GramExa.PROPFORM: hang on a sec/hold on a sec/just a sec etc
GramExa.GLOSS: wait a short time
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Is Al there?’ ‘Hold on a sec, I’ll check.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “阿尔在吗？”“稍等一下﹐我去看一看。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll be with you in a sec.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一会儿就来。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= second 秒
Sense.EXAMPLE: Journey time: 25 mins 14 secs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅程时间: 25分14秒。

Sense.DEF: strong scissors used for cutting plant stems
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of secateurs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把修枝剪

Sense.DEF: if a country or state secedes from another country, it officially stops being part of it and becomes independent

GramExa.EXAMPLE: By 1861, 11 states had seceded from the Union.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到1861年﹐已有11个州退出联邦。

Sense.DEF: when a country or state officially stops being part of another country and becomes independent
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vote in favor of secession
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赞成独立的一票

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Croatia’s secession from Yugoslavia
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克罗地亚脱离南斯拉夫

Sense.DEF: someone who wants their country or state to be independent of another country
very private and quiet

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We sunbathed on a small secluded beach.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在一小片僻静的海滩上晒日光浴。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s 80 years old now and lives a very secluded life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在80岁了﹐过着远离尘嚣的生活。

Sense.DEF: the state of being private and away from other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: They enjoyed ten days of peace and seclusion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们享受了十天与世隔绝的宁静生活。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He preferred to stay at home in seclusion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他更喜欢安安静静地在家里待着。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the relative seclusion of the Norfolk countryside
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 诺福克郡乡间相对的清静

Sense.DEF: the second person, thing, event etc is the one that comes after the first
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Second World War
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二次世界大战
Sense.EXAMPLE: the second of August
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 8月2日
Sense.EXAMPLE: a second year student
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 二年级学生
Sense.EXAMPLE: his second wife
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的第二任妻子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clinton’s second term in office
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克林顿的第二个任期
Sense.EXAMPLE: the second half of the year
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下半年
Sense.EXAMPLE: the second time in three days
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三天中的第二次

Sense.DEF: the position in a competition or scale that comes after the one that is the best, most successful etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She won second prize.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她赢得了二等奖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They climbed to second place in the League.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在联赛中的排名上升到了第二位。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Africa’s second highest mountain
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 非洲的第二高山

GramExa.GLOSS: used to emphasize that something is nearly the largest, most important etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The euro will have a circulation second only to that of the dollar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧元的流通量将仅次于美元。

Sense.DEF: another example of the same thing, or another in addition to the one you have
Sense.EXAMPLE: We advertised for a second guitarist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们登广告再招聘一名吉他手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a second reason for his dismissal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被解雇还有个原因。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I asked the doctor for a second opinion when you ask another person to repeat an examination, test etc for you .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我又征求了这位医生的意见。

Subsense.DEF: the second, then the fourth, then the sixth year etc
Subsense.TRAN: 每两年/每两人/每两样东西等
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The nurse comes every second day.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士隔天来一次。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize that in a group of similar things, there is too much of one particular thing
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于强调某一批类似的事物中﹐某一特征的东西太多〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Every second house seemed to be boarded up.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分房子都好像用木板封上了。

Sense.DEF: to be the best
Sense.TRAN: 不亚于任何人[事物]﹐首屈一指
Sense.EXAMPLE: The quality of Britain’s overseas aid programme is second to none.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国海外援助计划的水准是首屈一指的。

Sense.DEF: help given to someone who has failed, in the hope that they will succeed this time
Sense.TRAN: 〔为失败者提供的〕第二次机会
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just want to give these kids a second chance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是想给这些孩子第二次机会。

Sense.DEF: to start having doubts about a decision you have made
Sense.TRAN: 〔对原先的决定〕犹豫﹐产生怀疑
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re not having second thoughts, are you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不会改变主意了吧？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’d had second thoughts about the whole project.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对整个计划产生了疑问。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you have changed your mind about something
Sense.TRAN: 又一想﹐再一想〔用于表示改变主意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll call her tomorrow – no, on second thought, I’ll try now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明天打电话给她——算了﹐我还是现在就打吧。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not give sth a second thought/without a second thought
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone does not think or worry about something
Sense.TRAN: 对某物不加考虑﹔对某事毫不担心
Sense.EXAMPLE: She dismissed the rumour without a second thought.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对这个谣传不屑一顾。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not give sth a second glance/look
Sense.DEF: to not look at something again, because you have not really noticed it or because it does not seem important
Sense.TRAN: 对某物不看第二眼﹐没有多看某物一眼
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one gave the woman in the grey uniform a second glance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没人对这个身穿灰色制服的女人多加注意。

Sense.DEF: something that is second nature to you is something you have done so often that you do it almost without thinking
Sense.TRAN: 成为（某人的）第二天性﹐成为（某人的）习性
Sense.EXAMPLE: Driving becomes second nature after a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过一段时间之后﹐驾车就习惯成自然了。

Sense.DEF: a new feeling of energy after you have been working or exercising very hard, and had thought you were too tired to continue
Sense.TRAN: 〔感到精疲力竭后的〕精力恢复
Sense.EXAMPLE: He got his second wind and ran on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他又来了精神﹐继续往前跑。

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring time. There are 60 seconds in a minute.
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hold your breath for six seconds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你屏气6秒钟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The operation takes only 30 seconds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个操作仅需要30秒钟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ultrasonic waves travel at around 300 metres per second .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超声波的传播速度约为每秒300米。

GramExa.GLOSS: after only a few seconds
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Within seconds, Bev called back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不一会儿﹐贝弗就回了电话。

Sense.DEF: a very short period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be back in a second.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一会儿就回来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just a second wait a moment , I’ll come and help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稍等片刻﹐我就来帮忙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At least 30 shots were fired in a matter of seconds in a very short time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不一会儿便至少开了30枪。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something will or may happen extremely soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: He should be here any second.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他应该很快就到这里。

Subsense.DEF: another serving of food, after you have eaten your first serving
clothes or other goods that are cheaper than usual because they are not perfect
Subsense.TRAN: 〔衣物等削价出售的〕次货﹐次品

Sense.DEF:
one of the 60 parts into which a
minute
of an angle is divided. It can be shown as a symbol after a number. For example, 78˚ 52'11''means 78 degrees 52 minutes 11 seconds.

someone who helps someone in a fight, especially in
boxing
or, in the past, a
duel
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指拳击比赛或旧时决斗中的〕副手﹐助手

Sense.DEF: used before you add information to what you have already said
next after the first one

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I came second in the UK Championships.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在英国锦标赛中得了第二名。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Tea is the most popular drink, while coffee ranks comes second.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 茶是最受欢迎的饮料﹐咖啡次之。

Sense.DEF: to formally support a suggestion made by another person in a meeting
Sense.TRAN: 〔在会议上〕支持﹐赞成﹐附议 〔建议〕

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 支持一项动议/建议/修正案等

Sense.DEF: to send someone to do someone else’s job for a short time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jill’s been seconded to the marketing department while Dave’s away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维不在的时候﹐吉尔被临时调到市场部工作。

Sense.DEF: the education, teaching etc of children between the ages of 11 and 16 or 18
Sense.TRAN: 中等教育/学校教育/教学等〔指对11至16或18岁孩子的教育〕

Sense.DEF: not as important as something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: the novel’s secondary characters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本小说中的次要人物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Writing was always secondary to spending time with my family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 与和我的家人共度时光相比﹐写作总是排在第二位。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be of secondary importance/be a secondary consideration
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cost is the important thing – any benefits for the user are a secondary consideration.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 成本才是重要的——对用户的益处是次要的考虑。

Sense.DEF: a type of school that existed in Britain until the 1960s, where children who had not passed a special examination were sent
Sense.TRAN: 现代中学〔英国20世纪60年代以前专为未通过专门考试的儿童开设的学校〕

Sense.DEF: a school for children between the ages of 11 and 16 or
Sense.TRAN: 18〔为年龄在11至16或18岁之间的儿童开办的〕中等学校﹐中学

Sense.DEF:
a book, article etc that
analyses
something such as a piece of literature or a historical event and that can be used to support your ideas in an
essay
Sense.TRAN: 第二手资料﹐二手文献﹐辅助资料

Sense.DEF:
the second strongest
stress
that is put on a part of a long word when you speak it. It is shown in this dictionary by the mark (‚).
the second of the four places you have to run to in games such as baseball in order to get a point
something that you have to accept which is not perfect or not the best
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not going to settle for second best .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不会退而求其次。

Sense.DEF: not quite as good as the best one
Sense.EXAMPLE: Allie was the second best shooter on the rifle team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿利是步枪队里的二号射手。

GramExa.GLOSS: lose a game or competition, or not be as successful as someone else

Sense.DEF: someone who is in their second childhood is old, and their mental abilities are greatly reduced
Sense.TRAN: 第二次童年〔指人到老年智力大幅衰退的时期〕

Sense.DEF:
a way of travelling on a ship or train that is cheaper and less comfortable than
first class
Sense.TRAN: 〔轮船的〕二等舱﹔〔火车的〕二等车厢

Sense.DEF:
a way of delivering letters etc in Britain that is cheaper and slower than
first class
Sense.TRAN: 第二类邮件〔在英国指比第一类邮件收费便宜但速度较慢的邮件〕

Sense.DEF: the system in the US for delivering newspapers, magazines, advertisements etc through the post
Sense.TRAN: 第二类邮件〔在美国指报纸﹑杂志﹑广告等的投递〕

Sense.DEF: considered to be less important and less valuable than other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why should old people be treated like second-class citizens ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么老年人要被当作二等公民对待？

Sense.DEF: of a lower standard or quality than the best
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will not accept a second-class education for our children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不会接受自己的孩子只得到二流的教育。

Sense.DEF: tickets etc that are for cheaper, less comfortable seats on a train or ship
relating to the system of delivering mail in Britain that is cheaper and slower
used to describe a university degree in Britain that is good, but not the highest level
Sense.TRAN: 二级荣誉的〔英国大学学士学位﹐仅次于优等的一级〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a second-class honours degree
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 二级荣誉学位

Sense.DEF: the second most serious form of burns
a crime that is less serious than the most serious type, especially because it was not planned
Sense.TRAN: 二级谋杀罪/袭击罪/入室盗窃罪等

Sense.DEF: a person who supports a proposal etc in a formal meeting so that it can be discussed
Sense.TRAN: 〔正式会议上对某项提议的〕附议者﹐赞成者

Sense.DEF: to try to say what will happen or what someone will do before they do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not going to try and second-guess the committee’s decisions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想去猜测委员会的决定。

Sense.DEF: to criticize something after it has already happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: The decision has been made – there’s no point in second-guessing it now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 决定已经作了——现在放马后炮已经没有意义。

Sense.DEF: the long thin piece of metal that points to the seconds on a clock or watch
if you get something second hand, it is not new and has been used by other people before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We got most of our furniture second hand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大部分家具都是二手货。

Sense.DEF: if you hear something second hand, the person who tells you is not the person who originally said it
Sense.EXAMPLE: It may not be true – I only heard it second hand .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这不一定是真的——我只是从别人那里听来的。

Sense.DEF: if you experience something second hand, you experience it through other people, rather than directly
second-hand things are not new when you get them, because they were owned by someone else before you
Sense.EXAMPLE: second-hand clothes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧衣服
Sense.EXAMPLE: a second-hand car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 二手车

GramExa.GLOSS: a shop that sells second-hand things

Sense.DEF: second-hand information or knowledge is told to you by someone who is not the person who originally said it – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔信息﹑知识等〕间接得来的﹐二手的〔含贬义〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: second-hand accounts of mass killings
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对大屠杀的二手报道

Sense.DEF: a house or apartment that you own as well as your main home and which you use, for example, for holidays
Sense.EXAMPLE: town-dwellers who buy second homes in the countryside
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在乡村购置第二居所的城里人

Sense.DEF: a place where you spend a large amount of time but which is not where you live
Sense.EXAMPLE: I love Italy. It’s my second home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢意大利﹐它是我的第二故乡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: From then on, the hospital became my second home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从那时起﹐医院就成了我的第二个家。

Sense.DEF: the person who has the next highest rank to the leader of a group, especially in a military organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指军事组织的〕副司令员﹐副指挥官

Sense.DEF: a language that you speak in addition to the language you learned as a child
a middle rank in several of the US and British military forces, or someone who has this rank

an
online virtual world
. Users, called ‘Residents’, can talk to and meet each other, and take part in various activities.
Sense.TRAN: 第二人生〔指网络虚拟世界。用户称为“居民”﹐可以在网上交谈﹑会面﹐并参与各种活动〕

Sense.DEF: used when you want to give a second point or fact, or give a second reason for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Firstly, they are not efficient, and secondly, they are expensive to make.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先﹐它们效率不高﹐其次﹐它们的制作成本很高。

Sense.DEF: a period of time that you spend away from your usual job, either doing another job or studying

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a government adviser, on secondment from the Metropolitan Police
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名借调自伦敦警察厅的政府顾问

Sense.DEF: a family name
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What’s your second name?’ ‘Jones.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你姓什么？”“琼斯。”

Sense.DEF: a name that comes after your first name and before your family name
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stephen’s second name, Anthony, is after my brother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂芬的中间名叫安东尼﹐取自我哥哥的名字。

Sense.DEF:
a form of a verb or
pronoun
that is used to show the person you are speaking to. For example, ‘you’ is a second person pronoun, and ‘are’ is the second person singular and plural of the verb ‘to be’.
not of the very best standard or quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: a second-rate artist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 二流艺术家

Sense.DEF: the ability to know what will happen in the future, or to know about things that are happening somewhere else, that some people claim to have
Sense.TRAN: 〔对未来或别处事物的〕预见力

Sense.DEF: not regularly part of a team, group etc, but sometimes taking someone else’s place in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Vikings’ second-string quarterback
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北欧海盗队的替补四分卫

Sense.DEF: the process of keeping something secret, or when something is kept a secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: I must stress the need for absolute secrecy about the project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我必须强调这项计划一定要绝对保密。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His work was shrouded in secrecy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的工作秘而不宣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the veil of secrecy that covered the talks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 笼罩在会谈上的神秘面纱

Sense.DEF: to make someone promise not to repeat what you have told them
known about by only a few people and kept hidden from others
Sense.EXAMPLE: They kept their relationship secret from their parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们俩的关系瞒着父母。
Sense.EXAMPLE: agents on a secret mission
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 执行秘密任务的特工人员
Sense.EXAMPLE: secret talks with the terrorists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与恐怖分子的秘密谈判

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The drugs were found in a secret compartment in Campbell’s suitcase.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒品是在坎贝尔手提箱的一个秘密夹层里找到的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cookies are made to a secret recipe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些小甜饼是根据一个秘方做的。

Sense.DEF: secret feelings, worries, or actions are ones that you do not want other people to know about
Sense.EXAMPLE: His secret fear was that Jenny would leave him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他暗自担心珍妮会离他而去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you know you had a secret admirer someone who is secretly in love with you ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知不知道有个人暗恋你？

Sense.DEF: something that will help you gain a big advantage over your competitors, that they do not know about
Sense.TRAN: 〔有助于在与对手的较量中获得优势的〕秘密武器

Sense.DEF: used to describe the behaviour of someone who is keeping their thoughts, intentions, or actions hidden from other people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re being very secret about it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对此讳莫如深。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a secret smile on her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上带着神秘的微笑。

Exponent.DEF: known about by only a few people, who have agreed not to tell anyone else
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a secret meeting place
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 秘密约会地点
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The details of the proposal must remain secret.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 提议的具体内容必须保密。

Exponent.DEF: used about information, especially in business or government, that is secret and not intended to be shown or told to other people
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指商业或政府信息〕机密的,保密的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a highly confidential report
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 高度机密的报告
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Employees’ personal details are treated as strictly confidential.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇员的个人资料绝对保密。

Exponent.DEF: used about information that the government has ordered to be kept secret from most people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was accused of passing on classified information to the Russians in the 1950s.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被指控于20世纪50年代向苏联提供机密情报。

Exponent.DEF: used about information that is kept secret because there would be problems if the wrong people knew it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A teenager managed to hack into sensitive US Air Force files.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名少年通过网络侵入窃取了美国空军的机密文件。

Exponent.DEF: used about things that are done secretly, especially by a government or official organization
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指政府或官方机构活动〕隐蔽的,秘密的,暗地的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a CIA covert operation
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 中央情报局的秘密行动

Exponent.DEF: used about things that are done secretly by the police in order to catch criminals or find out information
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Detectives arrested the suspect after a five-day undercover operation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过五天的秘密行动,警探终于逮捕了嫌疑犯。

Exponent.DEF: an underground organization or newspaper is one that operates or is produced secretly and opposes the government
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her father was a member of the underground resistance movement in France during World War II.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父亲是第二次世界大战期间法国地下反抗运动的成员。

Exponent.DEF: secret and often illegal or immoral
Exponent.TRAN: 〔违法或不道德的事〕秘密的,暗中进行的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: clandestine meetings
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 秘密会议
Exponent.EXAMPLE: his involvement in a clandestine operation to sell arms to Iran
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他涉及向伊朗出售军火的秘密交易
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a clandestine love affair
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 私情

Exponent.DEF: used about information or activities that are kept officially secret
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was put in charge of some hush-hush military project.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被指派负责某项秘密军事计划。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve no idea what he does – it’s all very hush-hush.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道他是干什么的——这都是严格保密的。

Sense.DEF: something that is kept hidden or that is known about by only a few people
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t tell you. It’s a secret .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能告诉你﹐这是个秘密。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was no secret that the two men hated each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个男人相互仇视﹐这算不得什么秘密。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry. Your secret is safe with me I won’t tell anyone about it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐我会替你保守秘密。

Sense.DEF: in a private way or place that other people do not know about
Sense.EXAMPLE: The negotiations were conducted in secret.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判是秘密进行的。

Sense.DEF: a particular way of achieving a good result, that is the best or only way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The secret to making good pastry is to use very cold water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 油酥点心要想做得好﹐秘诀在于所用的水得很凉。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Your hair always looks so great – what’s your secret ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的头发看起来总是很漂亮——你的秘诀是什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you think is the secret of her success ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为她成功的秘诀是什么？

Sense.DEF: to make your opinions about something clear
Sense.EXAMPLE: Louise made no secret of her dislike for John.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路易丝毫不隐瞒自己对约翰的厌恶。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the secrets of life/nature/the universe etc
Sense.DEF: the things no one yet knows about life, nature etc
Sense.TRAN: 生命/大自然/宇宙等的奥秘

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We have no secrets from each other.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们之间没有秘密。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: about someone else
Collocate.EXAMPLE: You can tell Tom that I know his secret.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以告诉汤姆我知道他的秘密。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not tell it to anyone
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Can you keep a secret?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能保守秘密吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Shall I tell you a secret?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 要我告诉你一个秘密吗？

Collocate.COLLOC: let sb in on a secret
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: tell them a secret
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Frank let me in on the secret.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰克告诉了我这个秘密。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: tell it to someone
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was accused of revealing state secrets.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被指控泄露国家机密。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: tell it to someone carelessly or by mistake
tell it to someone because you trust them
an important secret or one that very few people know
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The event was supposed to be a big secret, but everyone knew about it.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个活动本来是个重大机密,但是人人都知道了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a personal secret that very few people know
Collocate.EXAMPLE: You must promise me that this will be our little secret.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要保证,这是我们俩之间的小秘密。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a secret that few people are allowed to know
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The recipe is a closely guarded secret.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个食谱严格保密。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: something that a lot of people know, but do not talk about because it is supposed to be a secret
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was an open secret that he was having an affair.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和别人有私情,这是公开的秘密。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a secret about something bad
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’m sure every family has a few dark secrets.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信,家家都有难言之隐。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a secret that someone feels guilty about
a government secret
a company or business secret

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘say a secret’ or 或 ‘say your secrets’. Say 要说 tell sb a secret or 或 tell sb your secrets .

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to find out and report on the military and political secrets of other countries
relating to the work of a secretary
Sense.EXAMPLE: a secretarial course
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 秘书课程
Sense.EXAMPLE: secretarial college
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 秘书专科学校

Sense.DEF:
a government office or the office of a large international organization, especially one that has a
secretary general
in charge of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: the United Nations Secretariat in New York
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设在纽约的联合国秘书处

Sense.DEF:
someone who works in an office
typing
letters, keeping records, answering telephone calls, arranging meetings etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: My secretary will fax you all the details.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的秘书会把所有的细节发传真给你。

Subsense.DEF: the head of an important department in the British Government
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the Foreign Secretary
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外交大臣

Subsense.DEF: an official in charge of a large government department in the US
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the Secretary of Defense
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国防部长

Subsense.DEF:
a British official who works in a government department or
embassy
and is below the rank of
minister
or
ambassador
Subsense.TRAN: 〔英国政府大臣的〕助理﹔〔英国大使馆的〕秘书
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the First Secretary at the British Embassy
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国大使馆的一等秘书

Sense.DEF: a member of a club or organization who takes notes in meetings, writes official letters etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔俱乐部或团体的〕书记员﹐干事
Sense.EXAMPLE: the secretary of the tennis club
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 网球俱乐部的干事

Sense.DEF: the most important official in charge of a large organization, especially an international organization
Sense.TRAN: 秘书长﹐总干事〔主管大机构﹐尤指国际组织〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the UN Secretary General
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国秘书长

Sense.DEF: the head of an important department in the British Government
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Secretary of State for Transport
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 交通大臣

Sense.DEF: the head of the US government department that deals with the US’s relations with other countries
a way of voting in which people write their choices on a piece of paper in secret, or an act of voting in this way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The chairman was elected by secret ballot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 主席是通过无记名投票方式选出的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: votes cast in a secret ballot
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 以无记名方式投的选票

Sense.DEF: if a part of an animal or plant secretes a liquid substance, it produces it
Sense.TRAN: 〔动物或植物的某一部分〕分泌〔某物质〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The toad’s skin secretes a deadly poison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蟾蜍的皮肤会分泌一种致命毒素。

Sense.DEF: to hide something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The money had been secreted in a Swiss bank account.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱藏匿在一个瑞士银行账户里。

Subsense.DEF: a substance, usually liquid, produced by part of a plant or animal
Subsense.EXAMPLE: These secretions are used by the caterpillar as a defence.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些分泌物被毛虫用作自卫武器。

Subsense.DEF: the production of this substance
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the secretion of hormones by the pituitary gland
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脑垂体的荷尔蒙分泌

Sense.DEF: a secretive person or organization likes to keep their thoughts, intentions, or actions hidden from others
Sense.TRAN: 守口如瓶的﹔遮遮掩掩的﹔神秘的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has been accused of being secretive and undemocratic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该政府被指责政务不公开﹑缺乏民主。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Carla was always very secretive about her work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡拉对自己的工作总是讳莫如深。

Sense.DEF: a police force controlled by a government, that secretly tries to defeat the political enemies of that government
Sense.TRAN: 秘密警察〔由政府掌控﹑从事秘密活动打击政敌的警察组织〕

Subsense.DEF: a British government organization that protects the country’s military and political secrets, and obtains secrets about other countries
a US government department that deals with special kinds of police work, especially protecting the president
Subsense.TRAN: 特工处〔美国政府部门 主要负责保护总统〕

Sense.DEF: a group of people with their own particular set of beliefs and practices, especially within or separated from a larger religious group
violence etc that is related to the strong feelings of people who belong to different religious groups
Sense.TRAN: 教派之间的暴力/冲突/谋杀等
Sense.EXAMPLE: people on both sides of the sectarian divide in Northern Ireland
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北爱尔兰两个宗教派系的人

Sense.DEF: supporting a particular religious group and its beliefs
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sectarian school
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教派学校

Sense.DEF: one of the parts that something such as an object or place is divided into

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a busy section of road
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 交通繁忙的路段
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the reference section of the library
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 图书馆的参考书区

Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane’s tail section was found in a cornfield.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机的尾部在玉米田里找到了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the smoking section where you can smoke
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟区

Sense.DEF: one of the separate parts of a structure, piece of furniture etc that you fit together to form the whole
Sense.TRAN: 〔结构物﹑家具等整体中的〕部分

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boats were built in Scotland, and transported to Egypt in sections.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 船只在苏格兰建造﹐各部分分装运往埃及。

Sense.DEF: a separate part of a book, newspaper, document, report etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: This issue will be discussed further in section two.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题将在第二节作进一步讨论。

GramExa.GLOSS: particular part of a newspaper
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 体育/时尚/商务/旅游等版面

Sense.DEF: a separate group within a larger group of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a large section of the American public
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国公众的一大部分

Sense.DEF:
the people or person in a band or
orchestra
, who play the
brass
,
rhythm
etc instruments
Sense.TRAN: 铜管乐组/节奏乐器组/木管乐组/弦乐组等

Sense.DEF: one of the parts of a law or a legal document
Sense.EXAMPLE: Article I, Section 8 of the U.S. Constitution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国宪法第八款第一条

Sense.DEF: a picture that shows what a building, part of the body etc would look like if it were cut from top to bottom or side to side

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Here’s the outside view, and here are the floors in section.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是外观图﹐这是各楼层的剖面图。

Subsense.DEF: a medical operation that involves cutting

a very thin flat piece that is cut from skin, a plant etc to be looked at under a
microscope
Subsense.TRAN: 〔放在显微镜下观察的皮肤﹑植物等的〕切片

Sense.DEF: a square area of land in the US that is one mile long on each side
the shape that is made when a solid figure is cut by a flat surface in mathematics

to officially force someone with a mental illness to go to a
psychiatric
hospital, because they are dangerous to themselves or other people
to separate something into parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peel and section the oranges.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把橙子剥皮并切开。

Sense.DEF:
to cut a very thin flat piece from skin, a plant etc so that you can look at it under a
microscope
Sense.TRAN: 做〔皮肤﹑植物等〕的切片〔以便放在显微镜下观察〕

Sense.DEF: to cut a part of the body in a medical operation
Sense.TRAN: 〔在医疗手术中〕把〔身体的某部分〕切开﹔切断

Sense.DEF: to divide an area into parts, especially by putting something between the parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: The vegetable plots were sectioned off by a low wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菜地用一道矮墙隔开。

Sense.DEF: concerned only with your own small group in society or in an organization, as opposed to being concerned about society or the institution as a whole
Sense.EXAMPLE: community groups seeking to protect sectional interests
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 致力保护群体利益的社区组织

Sense.DEF: a sectional drawing or view of something shows what it would look like if it were cut from top to bottom, or from side to side
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sectional view of the building
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大楼的剖面图

Sense.DEF: made up of sections that can be put together or taken apart
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sectional sofa
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 组合沙发

Sense.DEF: a part of an area of activity, especially of business, trade etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指商业﹑贸易等领域的〕部门﹔行业

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the agricultural sector of the economy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济中的农业部门

GramExa.GLOSS: business controlled by the government or by private companies

Sense.DEF: one of the parts into which an area is divided, especially for military purposes
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为军事目的设立的〕地区﹐区域

Sense.DEF: a plane figure bounded by two radii and the included arc of a circle
relating to the various economic sectors of a society or to a particular economic sector
Sense.TRAN: 与社会经济各部门有关的﹔与某一经济部门有关的

Sense.DEF: not connected with or controlled by a church or other religious authority
Sense.TRAN: 世俗的﹐非宗教的﹔不受教会管辖的
Sense.EXAMPLE: secular education
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世俗教育
Sense.EXAMPLE: our modern secular society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的现代世俗社会

Sense.DEF:
a secular priest lives among ordinary people, rather than with other priests in a
monastery
Sense.TRAN: 〔教士〕在俗的﹐不住在修道院内的

Sense.DEF: a system of social organization that does not allow religion to influence the government, or the belief that religion should not influence a government
Sense.TRAN: 现世主义﹐世俗主义〔禁止或反对宗教对政府产生影响的社会组织体系〕

Sense.DEF: the quality of behaving in a way that shows religion does not influence you
Sense.TRAN: 现世化﹐世俗化〔指行为方式不受宗教影响〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the secularism of popular culture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大众文化的世俗化

Sense.DEF: to remove the control or influence of religious groups from a society or an institution
Sense.TRAN: 使世俗化﹐使脱离宗教影响

Sense.DEF: a situation that is secure is one that you can depend on because it is not likely to change
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are no secure jobs these days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今已经没有铁饭碗了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We want a secure future for our children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望我们的孩子未来生活无虞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: United’s position at the top of the league seems relatively secure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联队在联赛中的头名位置似乎相对稳固。

Sense.DEF: locked or guarded so that people cannot get in or out or steal anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house isn’t very secure – we need some new locks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子不是很安全——我们需要加几把新锁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep your passport in a secure place .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的护照放在安全的地方。

GramExa.GLOSS: a type of prison
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the last year, only three children under the age of 14 have had to be placed in secure accommodation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年﹐只有三名14岁以下儿童需要进管教所。

Sense.DEF: safe from and protected against damage or attack
Sense.EXAMPLE: Companies can offer secure credit card transactions over the Internet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司可以提供安全的网上信用卡交易。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These elephants are relatively secure from poachers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些大象相对比较安全﹐不太会受到偷猎者的威胁。

Sense.DEF: feeling confident about yourself and your abilities
Sense.TRAN: 〔对自己和自己的能力〕有自信的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We want our children to be secure and feel good about themselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望孩子有自信﹐对自己感觉良好。

Sense.DEF: feeling confident and certain about a situation and not worried that it might change
Sense.TRAN: 感到有保障的﹐没有顾虑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Workers no longer feel secure about the future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们对未来不再感到有保障。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was enough money to make us feel financially secure .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那笔钱足够使我们感到经济上有保障。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We huddled together, secure in the knowledge that the rescue helicopter was on its way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们挤在一起﹐知道救援直升机已经在赶来的路上﹐因而感到放心了。

Sense.DEF: firmly fastened or tied, and not likely to fall down
Sense.TRAN: 固定住的﹐系牢的﹐缚紧的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you sure that shelf is secure?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你肯定那个架子牢固吗？

Sense.DEF: to get or achieve something that will be permanent, especially after a lot of effort
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指经过大量努力〕获得﹐得到
Sense.EXAMPLE: Boyd’s goal secured his team’s place in the Cup Final.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 博伊德的进球确保了球队进入足总杯决赛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company secured a $20 million contract.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司争取到了一份2,000万美金的合同。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Negotiators are still working to secure the hostages’ release.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判人员仍在努力争取人质获释。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Redgrave won his third Olympic gold medal, and secured his place in history .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷德格雷夫赢得了个人第三枚奥运会金牌﹐使自己的名字载入了史册。

Sense.DEF: to make something safe from being attacked, harmed, or lost
Sense.EXAMPLE: Troops were sent to secure the border.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队被派去保卫边境。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They built a ten-foot high fence to secure the house against intruders.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们筑了一道十英尺高的围栏﹐防止人闯入房子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an agreement to secure the future of the rainforest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一份保护热带雨林未来的协议

Sense.DEF: to fasten or tie something firmly in a particular position

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John secured the boat firmly to the jetty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰把小船牢牢系泊在码头。

Sense.DEF:
if you secure a debt or a
loan
, you legally promise that, if you cannot pay back the money you have borrowed, you will give the lender goods or property of the same value instead
Sense.EXAMPLE: He used his house to secure the loan .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用自己的房子作抵押贷到了这笔钱。

Sense.DEF: tied, fastened etc tightly, especially in order to make something safe

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All firearms should be kept securely locked in a cabinet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的枪支都应该安全稳妥地锁到柜子里。

Sense.DEF: in a way that protects something from being stolen or lost
Sense.EXAMPLE: Customers can now buy products securely over the Internet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今顾客可以安全放心地在网上购物了。

Sense.DEF: in a way that is likely to continue successfully and not change
Sense.EXAMPLE: By that time, democracy had become securely established in Spain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时候﹐西班牙已经建立了稳固的民主制度。

Sense.DEF: things that are done to keep a person, building, or country safe from danger or crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trial was held under tight security .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场审讯是在戒备森严的情况下进行的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: lax security at airline check-in desks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 登机手续柜台松懈的安全措施
Sense.EXAMPLE: terrorist activity that is a threat to national security
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威胁国家安全的恐怖活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prison was ordered to tighten security after a prisoner escaped yesterday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天一名囚犯越狱后﹐该监狱被勒令加强安全措施。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Security Commission investigates breaches of security .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安全委员会对违反安全规定的事项进行调查。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have been asked not to say anything for security reasons .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出于安全考虑﹐我们被要求守口如瓶。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The security forces opened fire, killing two people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保安部队开枪打死了两个人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The thief was caught on a security camera .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小偷被保安摄像机当场拍了下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are strict security checks on everyone entering the Opera House.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人进入歌剧院都要接受严格的安全检查。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A large number of homes lack adequate security measures .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多住宅都未采取足够的安全措施。

Sense.DEF: protection from bad things that could happen to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parenting is about giving your child security and love.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 养育儿女就是要给他们保护和爱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Workers want greater job security not being in danger of losing your job .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们希望有更多的工作保障。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This insurance plan offers your family financial security in the event of your death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份保险能在你死后给你的家人提供经济保障。

Sense.DEF: the department of a company or organization that deals with the protection of its buildings and equipment
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of the sales clerks called security.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一名销售员给保安部门打了电话。

Sense.DEF: something such as property that you promise to give someone if you cannot pay back money you have borrowed from them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Reiss used his Brooklyn home as security for the loan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 赖斯把他在布鲁克林的住宅作为贷款抵押。

Sense.DEF:
stocks
or
shares
in a company
a piece of material that a child likes to hold, to comfort himself or herself
Sense.TRAN: 〔小孩喜欢抱着以得到安全感的〕安乐毯

Sense.DEF: something that you have had for a long time, and that you use to make yourself feel less anxious
Sense.TRAN: 给人以安全感的熟悉物件﹐安慰物

Sense.DEF: official permission for someone to see secret documents etc, or to enter a building, after a strict checking process
Sense.TRAN: 〔经过严格安全审查后〕对参加机密工作的批准﹔出入某建筑物的许可

Sense.DEF:
an amount of money that you give to a
landlord
before you rent a house or apartment, and that is returned to you after you leave if you have not damaged the property
Sense.TRAN: 〔租房子时交给房东的〕保证金

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to guard money or a building
a light that turns on when someone tries to enter a building or area at night
Sense.TRAN: 智控安全灯〔当有人在晚上进入某建筑物或区域时能自动亮起的灯〕

Sense.DEF:
an American mother who believes that protecting the US and its citizens from
terrorism
is the most important thing that the US government can do
Sense.TRAN: 安全妈妈﹐安全母亲〔认为保护美国及其公民不受恐怖主义袭击是美国政府最重要的工作〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The soccer moms of the 1990s have become the security moms of today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪90年代的足球妈妈们已经成了今天的安全妈妈。

Sense.DEF: someone in a government or organization who you cannot trust with important secrets, because they might tell them to an enemy
Sense.TRAN: 〔政府或组织内的〕不可靠分子﹐危险分子

Sense.DEF: a situation that could put people in danger
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the bomb threat, it was considered too much of a security risk to let the races go ahead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生炸弹恐吓后﹐大家都认为比赛继续进行下去安全风险太大。

Sense.DEF: a government organization that protects a country’s secrets against enemy countries, or protects the government against attempts to take away its power
Sense.TRAN: 〔政府的〕安全机构﹐国家安全机构

Sense.DEF:
a car that has four doors, seats for at least four people, and a
boot
a seat on two poles with a cover around it, used in the past to carry an important person
calm, serious, and formal
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sedate seaside town
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宁静的海边小镇
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wedding was rather a sedate occasion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚礼上气氛庄重。

Sense.DEF: moving slowly and calmly
Sense.EXAMPLE: We continued our walk at a sedate pace .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们慢悠悠地继续走。

Sense.DEF: to give someone drugs to make them calm or to make them sleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was still in shock, and heavily sedated .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仍惊魂未定﹐服用了大量镇静剂。

Sense.DEF: the use of drugs to make someone calm or go to sleep

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The patient was still under heavy sedation .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个病人用药后仍处于深度镇静状态。

Sense.DEF: a drug used to make someone calm or go to sleep
spending a lot of time sitting down, and not moving or exercising very much

GramExa.EXAMPLE: health problems caused by our sedentary lifestyles
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于我们久坐不动的生活方式引起的健康问题

Sense.DEF: a sedentary group of people tend always to live in the same place
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sedentary people living north of the Danube
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多瑙河北面的一个定居民族

Sense.DEF: a plant similar to grass that grows in wet ground and on the edge of rivers and lakes
solid substances that settle at the bottom of a liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thick layer of sediment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一层厚厚的沉积物

Sense.DEF: made of the solid substances that settle at the bottom of the sea, rivers, lakes etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在海﹑河﹑湖等的底部〕沉积的﹐沉积形成的
Sense.EXAMPLE: sedimentary rock
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沉积岩
Sense.EXAMPLE: sedimentary deposits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沉积矿床

Sense.DEF: the natural process by which small pieces of rock, earth etc settle at the bottom of the sea etc and form a solid layer
speech, writing, or actions intended to encourage people to disobey a government
Sense.TRAN: 煽动反政府行为的言论[文章﹐行动]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Trade Union leaders were charged with sedition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会领导人被控犯有煽动罪。

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone to have sex with you, especially in a way that is attractive and not too direct
Sense.EXAMPLE: The head lecturer was sacked for seducing female students.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个首席讲师因诱奸女学生而被解雇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you trying to seduce me?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是在勾引我吗？

Sense.DEF: to make someone want to do something by making it seem very attractive or interesting to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was young and seduced by New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我当时年轻﹐抵挡不住纽约的诱惑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Leaders are people who can seduce other people into sharing their dream.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 领导人就是要能够说服别人来共同实现他们的梦想。

Sense.DEF: a man who persuades someone to have sex with him
an act of persuading someone to have sex with you for the first time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the seduction of a young girl
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 勾引年轻姑娘

Sense.DEF: something that strongly attracts people, but often has a bad effect on their lives
Sense.TRAN: 〔常常对人产生不良影响的〕诱惑﹐魅力﹐吸引力

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the seductions of power
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 权力的诱惑

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a woman, who is seductive is sexually attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: She used all of her seductive charm to try and persuade him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她使出浑身魅力来说服他。

Sense.DEF: something that is seductive is very interesting or attractive to you, in a way that persuades you to do something you would not usually do
Sense.TRAN: 〔某物〕有吸引力的﹐有诱惑力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the seductive power of advertising
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 广告的诱惑力

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She smiled seductively at him across the table.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐在桌子对面﹐朝他迷人地笑了笑。

Sense.DEF: a woman who persuades someone to have sex with her
to notice or examine someone or something, using your eyes
Sense.EXAMPLE: The moment we saw the house, we knew we wanted to buy it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一看到这房子就知道我们要买。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He crouched down so he couldn’t be seen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他蹲下来好让别人看不见他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I see your ticket, please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能看看你的票吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw the offer advertised in the newspaper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在报纸上看到这个减价的广告。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can see the Houses of Parliament from here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这里看得到议会大厦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you see where the marks are on the wall?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能看出墙上哪里有污迹吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He saw that she was crying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看到她在哭。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I saw him leave a few minutes ago.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看见他几分钟前离开的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The suspect was seen entering the building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人看到疑犯进入了大楼。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: , the house needs some work doing on it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你也看到了﹐这房子需要整修了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you seen Chris do you know where he is ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你见过克里斯吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The accommodation was so awful it had to be seen to be believed you would not believe it if you did not see it yourself .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住宿条件太糟了﹐不是亲眼所见是不会相信的。

Sense.DEF: to notice that something is happening or that something is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: More money must be invested if we are to see an improvement in services.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们想要服务质量有所提高﹐就必须投入更多的资金。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a month’s practice, you should see a difference in your playing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过一个月的练习﹐你应该能看出自己演奏上的变化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Seeing his distress, Louise put her arm around him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到他难过﹐路易丝伸出手搂着他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I would like to see changes in the way the course is run.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望看到这门课程的设置有所改变。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You’re not denying it, I see,’ he said coldly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你并没有否认﹐我看出来了。”他冷冷地说道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can see you’re not very happy with the situation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看得出来﹐你对这种局面不是十分满意。

Sense.DEF: to be able to use your eyes to look at things and know what they are
