GramExa.EXAMPLE: From the tower, you can see for miles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这座塔上可以看到好几英里远。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t see a thing without my glasses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不戴眼镜什么也看不见。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His eyes are so bad that he can’t see to read anymore.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的视力太差﹐根本没法再看书。

Sense.DEF: to find out information or a fact

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll call him and see how the job interview went.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要打个电话问问他求职面试怎么样。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She went outside to see what was happening.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她到外面去看发生了什么事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve just come to see if you want to go out for a drink.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我过来就想看看你想不想出去喝一杯。

Sense.EXAMPLE: These chocolates are gorgeous. Try some and see for yourself find out if it is true .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些巧克力棒极了﹐尝一点你就知道了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: By looking at this leaflet, you can see at a glance find out very easily how much a loan will cost.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要看这小册子一眼﹐你就能知道贷款成本要多少。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it can be seen that/we can see that
GramExa.EXAMPLE: From this graph, it can be seen that some people are more susceptible to the disease.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这张图表可以看出﹐有些人更容易得这种病。

Sense.EXAMPLE: As we have seen in chapter four, women’s pay is generally less than men’s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在第四章里看到﹐女性的工资一般要低于男性。

Sense.DEF: to find out about something in the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It will be interesting to see if he makes it into the team.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都会很有兴趣看他是否能进入这个球队。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I might come – I’ll see how I feel tomorrow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可能会来——我要看明天感觉如何。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s try it and see what happens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们试一试﹐看看会出现什么情况。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can we go to the zoo, Dad?’ ‘ We’ll see .’ used when you do not want to make a decision immediately
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们去动物园好吗﹐爸爸？”“看看再说吧。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How long can you stay?’‘ I’ll have to see . It depends used when you cannot make a decision immediately .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你能待多久？”“再说吧﹐得看情况。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll just have to wait and see .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只能等着瞧吧。

GramExa.PROPFORM: see how it goes/see how things go
GramExa.GLOSS: used when you are going to do something and will deal with problems if they happen
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t know. We’ll just have to see how it goes on Sunday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道﹐我们得看星期天的情况再说。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Things will work out, you’ll see you will find out that I am right .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会有办法的﹐你就等着看吧。

Sense.DEF: used to tell you where you can find information
Sense.EXAMPLE: See p. 58.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参阅第 58页。
Sense.EXAMPLE: See press for details.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 详情请见报纸。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The results are shown in Table 7a (see below).
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 结果如表7a所示（见下文）。

Sense.DEF: to understand or realize something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t see why he’s so upset.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不懂他为什么这么不高兴。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I see what you mean I understand what you are saying .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明白你的意思。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘He lives here but works in London during the week.’ ‘Oh, I see I understand .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他住在这里﹐但平时都在伦敦上班。”“噢﹐我明白了。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: You see, the thing is, I’m really busy right now used when you are explaining something .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看﹐问题是我现在真的很忙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You mix the flour and eggs like this, see used to check that someone is listening and understands ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要这样搅拌面粉和鸡蛋﹐明白了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t see the point of I do not understand the reason for spending so much money on a car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看不出花这么多钱买一辆车有什么意义。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you see the point I’m making do you understand what I’m trying to say ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你明白我说的意思了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The other officers laughed, but Nichols couldn’t see the joke .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他警官都笑了﹐但尼科尔斯却听不懂有什么好笑。

GramExa.GLOSS: realize that you are wrong or doing something stupid
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I just can’t get her to see reason!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就是没办法让她明白过来！

Sense.DEF: to watch a television programme, play, film etc
Sense.TRAN: 看﹐观看〔电视节目﹑戏剧﹑电影等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you see that programme on monkeys last night?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看了昨晚那个讲猴子的节目了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to see ‘Romeo and Juliet’ tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚我们要去看《罗密欧与朱丽叶》。

Sense.DEF: to think about or consider someone or something in a particular way, or as having particular qualities
Sense.EXAMPLE: Having a child makes you see things differently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有了孩子会改变你看问题的方式。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Violence is seen in different ways by different people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不同的人对暴力问题有不同的看法。

GramExa.PROPFORM: as sb sees it/the way sb sees it
GramExa.GLOSS: used to give someone’s opinion
GramExa.EXAMPLE: As I see it, you don’t have any choice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我看来﹐你没有选择的余地。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The way I see it, we have two options.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 照我看﹐我们有两种选择。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I see the job as a challenge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把这份工作看成是一个挑战。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He saw himself as a failure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得自己是一个失败者。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The peace talks are seen as a sign of hope.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次和谈被看作是希望的征兆。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This type of work is often seen as boring.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种工作常常被认为是单调乏味的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Teachers need to be seen to be in control.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师要让人觉得一切都在其掌握之中。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government must be seen to be doing something about the rise in violent crime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府对暴力犯罪案件数量的上升必须有所作为。

Subsense.DEF: to find out if someone can deal with a situation or problem
Subsense.TRAN: 看看某人/某物能做什么

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll call them again and see what they can do about it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我再给他们打个电话﹐看看他们有什么办法。

Subsense.DEF: to find out how good someone or something is at what they are supposed to be able to do
Subsense.TRAN: 看看某人/某物到底有多行
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Let’s take the Porsche out to the racetrack and see what it can do!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把这辆保时捷开到赛道上去﹐看看它到底能跑多快！

Sense.LEXUNIT: I’ll see what I can do
Sense.DEF: used to say that you will try to help someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leave the papers with me and I’ll see what I can do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这些文件留给我吧﹐我来想想办法。

Sense.DEF: used to say goodbye when you know you will see someone again

GramExa.EXAMPLE: See you Friday – your place at 8:30.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期五见——8点30分在你家。

GramExa.GLOSS: see you soon, or later in the same day
see you soon
see you soon
see you soon

Sense.DEF: to visit or meet someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be seeing her tomorrow night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天晚上我要去见她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t seen her since we left school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从我们离开学校后﹐我就没有见过她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s too sick to see anyone right now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在她病得很重﹐谁也不能见。

Sense.DEF: to meet someone by chance
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw Jane while I was out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在外面碰到了简。

Sense.DEF: to have an arranged meeting with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Thomas is seeing a client at 2:30.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托马斯先生两点半要接待一位客户。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was seen by a doctor but didn’t need hospital treatment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看了医生﹐但不需要入院治疗。

GramExa.GLOSS: see someone to discuss something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have to see my teacher about my grades.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得去见老师﹐谈谈我的成绩。

Sense.DEF: to spend time with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve been seeing a lot of each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们交往频繁。

GramExa.GLOSS: see someone more or less often
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’ve seen more of each other since Dan moved to London.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从丹搬到伦敦之后﹐他们见面的机会就多了。

Sense.DEF: to be having a romantic relationship with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is she seeing anyone at the moment?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她这阵子是否在和什么人谈恋爱？

Sense.DEF: to imagine that something may happen in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: He could see a great future for her in music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看出她在音乐方面很有前途。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t see him winning, can you?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看不出他能获胜﹐你呢？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s got a new book coming out, but I can’t see it doing very well.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有一本新书马上要出版﹐但我不是很看好。

GramExa.GLOSS: be able to imagine someone being something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I just can’t see her as a ballet dancer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怎么看她也不像是个芭蕾舞演员。

Sense.DEF: used before giving a reason for what you are saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I might as well do something useful, seeing as I’m back,’ she said.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “既然我已经回来了﹐还是做点有用的事吧。”她说。

Sense.LEXUNIT: see sth for what it is

Variant.LEXVAR: see sb for what they are

Sense.DEF: to realize that someone or something is not as good or nice as they seem
Sense.TRAN: 认为某事[某人]不过如此
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are unimpressed with the scheme and rightly see it for what it is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对这个方案印象平平﹐觉得它不过如此。

Sense.DEF: to make sure or check that something is done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s up to you to see that the job’s done properly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 确保工作顺利完成是你的责任。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Please see that the lights are switched off before you leave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离开之前一定要把灯都关了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry – I’ll see to it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不用担心——我来处理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel’s owners see to it that their guests are given every luxury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店的老板一定要客人尽享奢华。

Sense.DEF: to experience something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was so sick that doctors didn’t think she’d live to see her first birthday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她病情很重﹐医生认为她活不过一岁生日。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never thought I’d live to see the day when women became priests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从未想到我此生能够看到女性成为牧师。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s seen it all before have experienced so much that nothing surprises you in her long career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在漫长的职业生涯中﹐她什么都见识过。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: been there, seen that, done that

Sense.DEF: if a time or place has seen a particular event or situation, it happened or existed in that time or place
Sense.EXAMPLE: This year has seen a big increase in road accidents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年道路交通事故大增。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city has seen plenty of violence over the years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些年来本市暴力事件频发。

Sense.DEF: used when you are trying to remember something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me see ... where did I put that letter?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我想想……我把那封信放在哪儿了呢？

Sense.DEF: used to say ‘yes’ in answer to a request
Sense.TRAN: 当然可以﹐好啊〔用于表示答应某人的请求〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can we go to the park?’ ‘I don’t see why not.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们可以去公园吗？”“行啊。”

Sense.DEF: to go somewhere with someone to make sure they are safe
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mother used to see me across the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妈妈以前一直送我过马路。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll get Nick to see you home .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会让尼克送你回家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me see you to the door go with you to the door, to say goodbye .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我送你到门口吧。

Sense.DEF: to imagine that you see someone or something which is not really there
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no one there – you must be seeing things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那里没人﹐一定是你产生幻觉了。

Sense.DEF: if you see double, something is wrong with your eyes, so that you see two things when there is only one
to be in a bad condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her hat had seen better days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的帽子已经破旧了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be glad/pleased etc to see the back of sb/sth
Sense.DEF: to be pleased when someone leaves or when you get rid of something, because you do not like them
Sense.TRAN: 巴不得某人离开/巴不得摆脱某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be glad to see the back of him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我巴不得他离开。

Subsense.DEF: to not see someone or something again, especially someone or something you do not like
Subsense.TRAN: 以后再也不用和某人/某事打交道
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I thought we’d seen the last of him.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们以后再也不用看到他了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It was a relief to see the last of them.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真好﹐以后再也不用和他们打交道了。

Subsense.DEF: to not have to deal with something any more
Subsense.TRAN: 以后再也不用处理某事
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Police hoped they’d seen the last of the joyriding.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方希望以后再也不用对付偷车兜风的事了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We may not have seen the last of this controversy.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这争议说不定还没完呢。

Subsense.DEF: to realize that something is true
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She finally saw the light and ended the relationship.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她终于明白过来﹐结束了这段关系。

Subsense.DEF: to have a special experience that makes you believe in a religion
Subsense.TRAN: 〔因特殊的经历而在宗教上〕省悟﹐皈依

Subsense.DEF: if something sees the light of day, it is brought out so that people can see it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: This decision will ensure that the Pentagon Papers never see the light of day.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一决定确保了“五角大楼文件”将永远不会公开。

Subsense.DEF: to start to exist
Subsense.EXAMPLE: This type of PC first saw the light of day in 1981.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这款个人电脑是在1981年问世的。

Sense.DEF: to become very angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: The thought of Pierre with Nicole had made her see red.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到皮埃尔和妮科尔在一起﹐她气疯了。

Sense.DEF: if you do not see someone for dust, they leave a place very quickly in order to avoid something
Sense.TRAN: 不见某人踪影﹐某人拔脚开溜〔指某人为逃避某事而迅速离开〕

Sense.DEF: if two people see eye to eye, they agree with each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: We didn’t exactly see eye to eye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的看法并非完全一致。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t always see eye to eye with my father.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和我父亲的观点并不总是相同。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We don’t see eye to eye on business issues.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在生意上观点互不相同。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is boring because it is very similar to other things
Sense.EXAMPLE: When you’ve seen one of these programmes, you’ve seen them all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的节目看一个就够了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: see your way (clear) to doing sth
Sense.DEF: to be able and willing to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Small companies cannot see their way to taking on many trainees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小公司没有能力接纳大量实习生。

Sense.DEF: to look at or be noticed by important or fashionable people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Royal Ascot is the place to see and be seen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皇家阿斯科特赛马会是一个结识社会名流的地方。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not see the wood for the trees

Variant.LEXVAR: not see the forest for the trees

Sense.DEF: to be unable to understand what is important in a situation because you are thinking too much about small details rather than the whole situation
Sense.TRAN: 见树不见林﹐抓不住重点〔因注重细节而忽略整体〕

Sense.DEF: to realize that there is going to be a problem before it actually happens
Sense.TRAN: 意识到要出问题﹐看得出要出乱子
Sense.EXAMPLE: John’s going to have a lot of trouble with him. You can see it coming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰和他相处会麻烦不断﹐这看得出来。

Sense.DEF: to recognize that someone will be easy to trick or deceive
Sense.TRAN: 看出某人容易上当受骗
Sense.EXAMPLE: You paid £500 for that! They must have seen you coming!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你花500英镑买这东西！他们肯定觉得你很好骗！

Sense.DEF: to make sure that someone gets what they need or want, especially money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just do this for me and I’ll see you right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把这事给我做了﹐我不会亏待你的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tell the landlord I sent you and he’ll see you right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 告诉房东说是我让你来的﹐他会照应你的。

Sense.DEF: to think that something is not important
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t see that it matters what I think.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得我怎么想并不重要。

Sense.DEF:
to risk the same amount of money as your opponent in a
card
game

Exponent.DEF: to notice something with your eyes, usually without planning to. Also used when saying that you watched a particular programme, film, game etc.
Exponent.TRAN: 看见,看到﹔观看〔节目﹑电影﹑比赛等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Have you seen my keys anywhere?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有在哪里看到过我的钥匙？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Did you see the basketball game last night?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天晚上你看篮球比赛了吗？

Exponent.DEF: to keep your eyes pointed toward someone or something, especially someone or something that is not moving
Exponent.TRAN: 看某人/某物〔尤指静止的人或物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I looked at the map.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看了地图。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was looking at him in a strange way.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她正奇怪地看着他。

Exponent.DEF: to see something interesting or unusual
Exponent.TRAN: 注意到〔有趣或异常的事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I noticed a police car outside their house.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我注意到他们房子外面停着一辆警车。

Exponent.DEF: to suddenly see something, especially something you are looking for
Exponent.TRAN: 突然发现〔尤指正在寻找的东西〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Nick spotted the advertisement in the paper.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克在报纸上看到了这则广告。

Exponent.EXP: catch sight of/catch a glimpse of
Exponent.DEF: to suddenly see someone or something for a short time, usually not clearly
Exponent.TRAN: 突然看到,瞥见〔常指看得不清楚〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I caught sight of him in the hotel lobby, and followed him out the door.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在酒店大堂里瞥见他,便跟着他出了门。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He glimpsed her face as she went into the courtroom.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走进法庭时,他瞥见了她的脸。

Exponent.DEF: to see something, but only with difficulty
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Ahead, I could just make out the figure of a woman.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 前面我只看得出是一个女人的身影。

Exponent.DEF: to see something happen, especially a crime or an accident
Exponent.TRAN: 亲眼看见,目击〔尤指看到罪案或事故〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The police are asking anyone who witnessed the attack to come forward.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方呼吁这起袭击事件的目击者出来作证。

Exponent.DEF: to see and pay attention to something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Officers observed him driving at 100 mph.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警官注意到他的行驶速度是每小时100英里。

Exponent.DEF: to suddenly see something or someone from a long distance, especially when you have been looking for a long time
Exponent.TRAN: 看见,发现〔尤指找了很久的人或物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The missing boys were sighted by a rescue helicopter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 失踪的男孩们被一架救援直升机发现。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The crew finally sighted land.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 船员们终于看到了陆地。

Sense.DEF: to make arrangements or deal with something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d better see about dinner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还是去准备晚饭吧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Claire’s gone to see about getting tickets for the concert.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱尔已经去张罗音乐会的门票了。

Variant.LEXVAR: we’ll have to see about that

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you do not know if something will be possible
Subsense.TRAN: 我们还得看看行不行﹐看看再说
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘I want to go to Joshua’s tonight.’ ‘Well, we’ll have to see about that.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “今晚我想到乔舒亚家里去。”“嗯﹐我们还得看看再说。”

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you intend to stop someone from doing what they were planning to do
Subsense.TRAN: 我们等着瞧吧〔用于表示要阻止某人的计划〕

Sense.DEF: to consider something together with something else
Sense.TRAN: 把…和…放在一起考虑﹐把…联系起来考虑
Sense.EXAMPLE: The unemployment data must be seen against the background of world recession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业数据必须放在世界经济衰退的大背景下来看。

Sense.DEF: to notice someone regularly in places you go to, but not talk to them
Sense.TRAN: 经常看到某人〔但不说话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know who he is but I’ve seen him around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道他是谁﹐但我经常看见他。

Sense.DEF: used to say goodbye to someone when you have not made a definite arrangement to meet again
Sense.TRAN: 再见〔用于道别而没有约定再见面〕

Sense.DEF: to visit a place and walk around looking at it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like to see round the house?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想在屋子里看看吗？

Sense.LEXUNIT: not know what sb sees in sb

Variant.LEXVAR: what does sb see in sb?

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not know why someone likes someone else
Sense.TRAN: 不知道某人看上了某人什么
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know what she sees in him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不明白她看中了他什么。

Sense.DEF: to notice a particular quality in someone or something that makes you like them
Sense.TRAN: 注意到某人/某物有某种让人喜欢的特点
Sense.EXAMPLE: He saw a gentleness in Susan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在苏珊身上看到了温柔。

Sense.DEF: to go with someone to make sure they arrive at a building or room
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took her home and, after seeing her in, drove off without a word.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他送她回家﹐把她送进门就开车走了﹐没说一句话。

Sense.DEF: to celebrate the beginning of a new year
to defeat someone or stop them from competing against you
Sense.EXAMPLE: To see off the threat, the company will have to cut its prices still further.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了应对这种威胁﹐公司将不得不进一步降价。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team saw off their old rivals in last night’s championship game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支球队在昨晚的冠军争夺赛上击败了他们的老对手。

Sense.DEF: to go to an airport, train station etc to say goodbye to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve gone to the airport to see their son off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们到机场送儿子去了。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to leave a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Security guards saw him off the premises.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保安人员把他赶了出去。

Sense.DEF: to go to the door with someone to say goodbye to them when they leave
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll see you out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我送你出去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, I can see myself out leave the building without anyone coming with me .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐我自己能出去的。

Sense.DEF: to continue doing something or being somewhere until a particular period of time or an unpleasant event is finished
Sense.EXAMPLE: Connolly has promised to see out the remaining 18 months of his contract.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 康诺利答应坚持做完合同期余下的18个月。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She saw out her last years at Sudeley Castle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在休德利城堡度过了自己最后的岁月。

Sense.DEF: to look at something large such as a house, especially in order to decide if you want to buy it
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在考虑是否购买时〕察看〔房屋等〕

Sense.DEF: to realize that someone is trying to deceive you
Sense.TRAN: 看穿某人/某事物﹐识破某人/某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw through his excuses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我识破了他的借口。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could never lie to her because I know she’d see through me straight away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在她面前撒不了谎﹐因为我知道她一眼就能识破。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t bluff – she’d see right through me .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能吹牛——她一眼就能识破。

Sense.DEF: to continue doing something until it is finished, especially something difficult or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 把某事进行到底〔尤指困难或不愉快的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll take a lot of effort to see the project through.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 完成这个项目需要投入很大的精力。

Sense.DEF: to give help and support to someone during a difficult time
Sense.TRAN: 帮助某人﹐支持某人（渡过难关）
Sense.EXAMPLE: Setting goals should help see you through.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 确定好目标能帮助你渡过难关。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got enough money to see me through six months of unemployment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的钱够我失业后维持六个月。

Sense.DEF: to see something or think about it in the way that someone else does
Sense.TRAN: 从某人的眼里看某事﹐从某人的角度考虑某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The world is very different when seen through the eyes of a child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个世界在儿童的眼里是截然不同的。

Sense.DEF: to deal with something or do something for someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go on, you go out. I’ll see to the washing-up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 行了﹐你出去吧﹐我来洗碗。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You should get that tooth seen to by a dentist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你该让牙医看看你的那颗牙。

Sense.DEF:
an area governed by a
bishop

Subsense.DEF: a small, hard object produced by plants, from which a new plant of the same kind grows
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a packet of sunflower seeds
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一包葵花籽

GramExa.GLOSS: put them in the soil
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sow the seeds one inch deep in the soil.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把种子种到一英寸深的土里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We grew all our tomatoes from seed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们所有的番茄都是从种子开始种的。

Subsense.DEF: a quantity of seeds
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Some of the poorest farmers don’t have enough money to buy seed.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些贫穷的农民连买种子的钱都不够。

Sense.DEF: one of the small hard objects in a fruit such as an apple or orange, from which new fruit trees grow
something that makes a new situation start to grow and develop

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The seeds of change in Eastern Europe were beginning to emerge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 东欧剧变的种子开始萌芽。

GramExa.GLOSS: something which makes a bad feeling or situation develop
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 怀疑/灾难/毁灭等的种子
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Something Lucy said began to sow seeds of doubt in his mind.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 露西说的一些话在他心里播下了怀疑的种子。

Subsense.DEF: if a plant or vegetable goes or runs to seed, it starts producing flowers and seeds as well as leaves
if someone or something goes or runs to seed, they become less attractive or good, especially because they are getting old and have not been properly looked after
Subsense.TRAN: 〔人〕衰老﹐失去活力﹔〔事物〕衰败﹐破落
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The old central bus station is going to seed.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座老中央公共汽车站日益破败。

Sense.DEF: a player or team in a competition that is given a particular position, according to how likely they are to win
Sense.TRAN: 头号/二号/三号等种子选手 [球队]
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been top seed for the past two years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在过去两年中一直是头号种子选手。

Sense.DEF:
semen
or
sperm
– often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 精液﹐精子〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: the group of people who have a particular person as their father, grandfather etc, especially when they form a particular race
to remove seeds from fruit or vegetables
Sense.TRAN: 给 〔果实或蔬菜〕去籽[去核]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add one lime, seeded and sliced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加一个来檬﹐去籽并切成片。

Sense.DEF: to give a player or team in a competition a particular position, according to how likely they are to win
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sharapova was seeded fifth at Wimbledon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莎拉波娃被确定为温布尔登公开赛五号种子选手。

Sense.DEF: to plant seeds in the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: a newly-seeded lawn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新撒了草籽的草坪

Sense.DEF: to produce seeds
if a tree or plant seeds itself, it produces a new plant using its own seeds
a place or condition that encourages something to develop

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Strong personal beliefs can become a seedbed for conflicts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 强烈的个人信仰有可能成为产生冲突的温床。

Sense.DEF: an area of ground where young plants are grown from seeds before they are planted somewhere else

Sense.TRAN: 种子资本﹐本钱﹐原始资本

Sense.DEF: people or things that will develop to become useful or successful in the future
Sense.TRAN: 日后有用的人[物]﹔有远大前景的人[物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young people are the seed corn management of the future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人是未来的管理者。

Sense.DEF: grain that is used for planting next year’s crops
Sense.TRAN: 〔留作来年耕种用的〕谷种﹐粮种

Sense.DEF: seedless fruit has no seeds in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: seedless grapes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无籽葡萄

Sense.DEF: a young plant or tree grown from a seed
the money you have available to start a new business
Sense.TRAN: 种子资本﹐本钱﹐原始资本

Sense.DEF:
a very small and often imperfect
pearl
Sense.TRAN: 种珠〔常有点瑕疵的小粒珍珠〕

Sense.DEF: a seedy person or place looks dirty or poor, and is often connected with illegal or immoral activities
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕肮脏的﹔〔地方〕乌烟瘴气的﹔不正派的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a seedy nightclub
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家乌烟瘴气的夜总会
Sense.EXAMPLE: a seedy-looking old man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个看上去脏兮兮的老人

Sense.DEF: because a particular fact or situation is true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I won’t stay long, seeing as you’re busy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不会待久﹐看你挺忙的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oh, all right, seeing as it’s you used to agree humorously to someone’s request .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐没问题﹐因为是你呀。

Sense.DEF: a dog trained to guide blind people
Sense.TRAN: 导盲犬〔经过特殊训练能为盲人引路〕

Sense.DEF: to try to achieve or get something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you think the President will seek re-election ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为总统会谋求连任吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Thousands of people crossed the border, seeking refuge from the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 成千上万的人穿过边境寻求庇护﹐躲避战争。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He sought revenge against Surkov for separating him from his wife and son.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏尔科夫害得他妻离子散﹐他要报复。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Local schools are seeking to reduce the dropout rate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地学校在寻找办法降低辍学率。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 吸引别人注意/寻求知名度

Sense.DEF: to ask someone for advice or help
Sense.TRAN: 征求（某人的）意见/请求（某人的）帮助/援助等
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the symptoms persist, seek medical advice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如症状持续﹐请咨询医生。

Sense.DEF: to look for someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: new graduates seeking employment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在求职的刚毕业的大学生
Sense.EXAMPLE: Attractive woman, 27, seeks male, 25-35, for fun and friendship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 魅力女性﹐27岁﹐欲觅25-35岁男子为友﹐同玩共乐﹐发展友情。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that they are looking for someone or something rather than seeking someone or something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说looking for someone或something ,而不是seeking someone或something
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: What kind of job are you looking for ?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在找什么样的工作？

Sense.DEF: to go to another place hoping to gain success and wealth
Sense.TRAN: 寻找成功致富之路﹐闯世界
Sense.EXAMPLE: Coles came to the Yukon in the 1970s to seek his fortune.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科尔斯在20世纪70年代来到育空地区寻找致富的机会。

Sense.DEF: to move naturally towards something or into a particular position
Sense.EXAMPLE: Water seeks its own level.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水往低处流。

Sense.DEF: to try to find someone or something, especially when this is difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our mission is to seek out the enemy and destroy them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的任务是要找到敌人并把他们消灭。

Sense.DEF: someone who is trying to find or get something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a brilliant politician and a ruthless power-seeker
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位杰出的政治家和坚定的权力追求者

Sense.DEF: if something seems to be true, there are qualities or facts that make people think it is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ann didn’t seem very sure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安看来并不十分肯定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems a foolish decision now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在看来这是一个愚蠢的决定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rainbow seemed to end on the hillside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 彩虹好像到山坡那里就断了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Doesn’t that seem weird to you?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不觉得那有点怪异吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It seems to me you don’t have much choice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得你没有多少选择的余地。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It seemed that Freeman had killed the man, and dumped the body in the lake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 似乎是弗里曼杀死了这个男人﹐把尸体扔到了湖里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It seems likely that he will miss Ireland’s next match.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来他有可能会错过爱尔兰队的下一场比赛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Teri seemed like a nice girl.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰里好像是个不错的女孩子。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Well, it seemed like a good idea at the time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好吧﹐当时看来这好像是个不错的主意。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We waited for what seemed like hours .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们等了好像有好几个小时。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It seemed as if the end of the world had come.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 似乎世界末日已经来临。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems like you’re catching a cold, Taylor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你好像感冒了﹐泰勒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘So Bill’s leaving her?’ ‘ So it seems that seems to be true .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这么说来﹐比尔要离开她？”“好像是这样。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you have tried to do something but cannot do it
Sense.TRAN: 似乎无法做某事〔用于表示已经试过但做不了〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just can’t seem to relax.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我好像就是放松不下来。

Sense.DEF: used to make what you are saying less strong or certain, and more polite
Sense.TRAN: 好像〔用于缓和语气或表示不确定﹐显得更客气〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I seem to have lost my car keys.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我好像把汽车钥匙给弄丢了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would seem that someone left the building unlocked.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好像是谁忘了锁大楼的门了。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Seem can be followed by an adjective or by an adjective and noun. seem
F2NBox.TRAN: 后面可以跟形容词﹐或形容词加名词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She seemed happy.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她似乎很开心。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He seems a nice man.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他好像人不错。
F2NBox.EXPL: Seem can also be followed by like and a noun or by like and an adjective and noun.
F2NBox.TRAN: seem后面还可以跟like加名词,或like加形容词加名词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It seemed like a miracle.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这就像是个奇迹。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He seems like a nice man.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去像是个好人。
F2NBox.EXPL: Seem can also be followed by a verb in the infinitive.
F2NBox.TRAN: seem后面还可以跟动词的不定式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: His story seems to be true.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的故事好像是真的。
F2NBox.EXPL: Seem can be followed by as if or as though but not just by as .
F2NBox.TRAN: seem后面可以跟as if或as though,但不能只跟as
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It seems a small thing (NOT 不说 It seems as a small thing), but it’s very important.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这看来是件小事,但是非常重要。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It seemed as if he wanted us to leave (NOT 不说 It seemed as he wanted ...).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他好像是要我们走。

Sense.DEF: appearing to be something, especially when this is not actually true
Sense.EXAMPLE: a seeming piece of good luck, which later led to all kinds of trouble
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 表面上的好运﹐后来却带来各种各样的麻烦

Sense.DEF: appearing to have a particular quality, when this may or may not be true
Sense.EXAMPLE: seemingly unrelated bits of information
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 似乎互不相关的零星信息

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new minister was faced with a seemingly impossible task.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位新上任的大臣面临一项似乎不可能完成的工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Alice was standing in the street, seemingly oblivious to the rain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾丽斯站在街上﹐似乎没有注意到天在下雨。

Sense.DEF: according to the facts as you know them
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is seemingly nothing we can do to stop the plans going ahead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看样子我们无法阻止这些计划的实施。

Sense.DEF: suitable for a particular situation or social occasion, according to accepted standards of behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 适宜的﹐得体的﹐合乎行为规范的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was not seemly for ladies to talk about money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女士谈论钱的事似乎不大得体。

Sense.DEF:
the past participle of
see
to flow slowly through small holes or spaces

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Blood seeped down his leg.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 血从他腿上渗下来。

Sense.DEF: to move or spread gradually

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His tension was seeping away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的紧张感逐渐消失了。

Sense.DEF: a gradual flow of liquid or gas through small spaces or holes
someone who can see into the future and say what will happen
a light cotton cloth with an uneven surface and a pattern of lines on it
a piece of equipment that children play on, made of a board that is balanced in the middle, so that when one end goes up the other goes down
a repeated movement from one state or condition to another and back again
Sense.TRAN: 拉锯局面﹐不断起伏的状态

Sense.DEF: to keep changing from one state or condition to another and back again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Before the election, the president seesawed in the polls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大选之前﹐总统在民意测验中的情况时好时坏。

Sense.DEF: to feel an emotion, especially anger, so strongly that you are almost shaking

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was seething with anger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他气得浑身发抖。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I was absolutely seething.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我胸中充满了怒火。

Sense.DEF: if a place is seething with people, insects etc, there are a lot of them all moving quickly in different directions
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cellar was seething with spiders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地窖里爬满了蜘蛛。

Sense.DEF: a see-through material or surface allows you to see through it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a see-through blouse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件透明的女衬衫

Sense.DEF: a part of something that is different from or affected differently from the whole in some way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: segments of the population
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人口中的若干组成部分

Sense.DEF: a part of a fruit, flower, or insect that it naturally divides into
Sense.TRAN: 〔水果或花自然形成的〕片﹐块﹐瓣﹔〔昆虫的〕节
Sense.EXAMPLE: Decorate with orange segments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用几瓣橙子作点缀。

Sense.DEF: the part of a circle that is separated from the rest of the circle when you draw a straight line across it
the part of a line or of a length of something between two points

GramExa.EXAMPLE: segments of DNA
DNA
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 链段

Sense.DEF: to divide something into parts that are different from each other
when something divides or is divided into smaller parts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the segmentation of society
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会的划分

Sense.DEF: consisting of separate parts that are connected to each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: segmented worms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 环节动物

Sense.DEF: to separate one group of people from others, especially because they are of a different race, sex, or religion
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因种族﹑性别﹑宗教差别而〕使分开﹐使分离﹐使隔离

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Blacks were segregated from whites in schools.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在学校里﹐黑人与白人是分开的。

Sense.DEF: to separate one part of a place or thing from another
Sense.TRAN: 使〔场所或物品中的一部分〕分离﹐使隔离

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The coffee room had been segregated into smoking and non-smoking areas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 咖啡室分隔成吸烟区和非吸烟区。

Sense.DEF: a segregated school or other institution can only be attended by members of one sex, race, religion etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a racially segregated education system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实行种族隔离的教育制度

Sense.DEF: when people of different races, sexes, or religions are kept apart so that they live, work, or study separately
Sense.TRAN: 〔不同种族﹑性别﹑宗教的〕分开﹐隔离

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 种族隔离

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the segregation of men and women
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 男女分开

Sense.DEF: relating to the practice of keeping people of different races, sexes, or religions separate
Sense.TRAN: 〔种族﹑性别﹑宗教上〕隔离主义的
Sense.EXAMPLE: segregationist policies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隔离主义政策

Sense.DEF: to move smoothly from one song, idea, activity, condition etc to another
Sense.TRAN: 〔顺畅地〕转到﹐接入〔另一首歌﹑另一个主意﹑另一种情形等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The conversation segued into banter about the Cup Final.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 交谈中说着说着就拿足总杯决赛开起了玩笑。

Sense.DEF:
relating to or caused by
earthquakes
Sense.EXAMPLE: increased seismic activity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越频繁的地震活动

Sense.DEF: very great, serious, or important
Sense.TRAN: 极大的﹔极为严重的﹔非常重要的
Sense.EXAMPLE: seismic changes in international relations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际关系的重大改变

Sense.DEF:
an instrument that measures and records the movement of the earth during an
earthquake

the scientific study of
earthquakes

a Japanese food made from wheat, containing a lot of
protein
and usually eaten instead of meat
Sense.TRAN: 素肉〔一种小麦制成的日本食品﹐富含蛋白质﹐常作为肉的替代品来食用〕

Sense.DEF: to take hold of something suddenly and violently
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly he seized my hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然抓住我的手。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Maggie seized the letter from her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛吉从她手上把信抢过去。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say grab or grab hold of rather than seize .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说grab或grab hold of,而不说seize
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She grabbed hold of his hand.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一把抓住他的手。

Sense.DEF: to take control of a place suddenly and quickly, using military force

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rebels have seized power.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛乱分子夺取了政权。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A group of soldiers seized the airport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一队士兵占领了机场。

Sense.DEF: if the police or government officers seize something, for example illegal drugs, they take legal possession of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: 160,000 CDs were seized from illegal factories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从非法工厂缴获了16万张激光唱片。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All of my assets were seized , including my home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的所有财产﹐包括我的住宅﹐都被没收了。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly catch someone and make sure they cannot get away
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gunmen were seized at 1 a.m.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这几名持枪歹徒在凌晨1点被抓获。

Sense.DEF: to quickly and eagerly do something when you have the chance to
to suddenly be affected by an extremely strong feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: When she saw his face, she was seized by fear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一看到他的脸﹐就感到无比恐惧。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly become very interested in an idea, excuse, what someone says etc
Sense.TRAN: 突然对…大为关注﹔抓住﹐利用〔某想法﹑借口﹑某人所说的话等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: His every remark is seized upon by the press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的每句话都被新闻界抓住大做文章。

Sense.DEF: if an engine or part of a machine seizes up, its moving parts stop working and can no longer move, for example because of lack of oil
Sense.TRAN: 〔发动机或机器部件因缺油等〕卡住﹐停止运转
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mechanism had seized up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机械装置停止了运转。

Sense.DEF: if a part of your body, such as your back, seizes up, you suddenly cannot move it and it is very painful
the act of suddenly taking control of something, especially by force

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the fascist seizure of power in 1922
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1922 年法西斯的夺权

Sense.DEF: when the police or government officers take away illegal goods such as drugs or guns
Sense.TRAN: 〔警方或政府官员对毒品﹑枪支等的〕查获﹐没收
Sense.EXAMPLE: drugs seizures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查获毒品

Sense.DEF: a sudden condition in which someone cannot control the movements of their body, which continues for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had an epileptic seizure .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然癫痫发作。

Sense.DEF: very rarely or almost never
Sense.EXAMPLE: Karen had seldom seen him so angry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡伦很少见他这么生气过。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: In formal writing, seldom can be put first, followed by an auxiliary and the subject, to emphasize that something very rarely happens.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在正式的书面写作中,seldom可以位于句首,后面跟助动词和主语,强调某事很少发生
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Seldom have I read an article that was so full of lies.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很少读到这样满纸谎言的文章。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Seldom sounds rather literary. In everyday English, people usually say rarely or not very often .
F2NBox.TRAN: seldom听上去带点文学色彩。在日常英语中,人们一般说rarely或not very often
F2NBox.GOODEXA: I don’t go there very often .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不常去那里。

Sense.DEF: to choose something or someone by thinking carefully about which is the best, most suitable etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔经过认真思考后〕挑选﹐选择﹐选拔
Sense.EXAMPLE: a group of students selected at random
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随机挑选出来的一组学生

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had hopes of being selected for the national team.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有望入选国家队。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: York was selected as the site for the research centre.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约克被选定为研究中心所在地。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They selected the winner from six finalists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们从六名决赛选手中选出了获胜者。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Simon’s been selected to go to the conference.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西蒙被选去参加此次大会。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say choose rather than select .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说choose,而不说select
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They chose the winner from six finalists.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们从六名决赛选手中选出了获胜者。

Sense.DEF: a select group of people or things is a small special group that has been chosen carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party was small and select.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 团里人员不多﹐都是经过精心挑选的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Honorary degrees are handed out to a select few .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 荣誉学位颁给挑选出的少数几个人。

Sense.DEF: only lived in, visited, or used by a small number of rich people
Sense.TRAN: 仅限于少数富人使用的﹐专用的﹐高级的﹐奢华的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a select block of flats
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一栋高级公寓楼

Sense.DEF: the careful choice of a particular person or thing from a group of similar people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the selection of a new leader
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新领导人的选拔

Sense.EXAMPLE: The judges have made their final selection.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 评委已经作出最后的评选。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had narrowly missed selection for the team.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只差一点就入选球队了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Perlman’s selection as the party’s candidate
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 珀尔曼被选为该党的候选人

Sense.DEF: something that has been chosen from among a group of things
Sense.EXAMPLE: To order, just write your selections on the form.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 订购只需在表上写下你所选的东西。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These drawings represent a selection from a larger exhibition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些画作是从一个规模更大的展会上选出来的。

Sense.DEF: a group of things of a particular type, often of things that are for sale
Sense.TRAN: 供选择[选购]的同类物品
Sense.EXAMPLE: There's a big selection to choose from.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可供选择的东西很多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a wide selection of shellfish
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 品种繁多的贝类
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They only have a limited selection of his books.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的书﹐他们只有为数不多的几本。

PIC.HEADING: SELECTION 供选择的同类物品
PIC.PICCONTENT: a selection of cheeses 各种供选择的干酪

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Students should be able to make a selection from a range of reference materials.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生应该可以从多种参考资料中作出选择。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Adair emphasises the importance of careful selection of team members.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿代尔很注重仔细挑选队员。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: choosing without any reason or order
Collocate.EXAMPLE: the random selection of genes
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 基因的随机选择

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The final selection will be based on local requirements.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后的选择要看当地的需要。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Before the selection process begins, candidates need to be clear about what the job entails.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 求职者在开始选择之前,需要清楚地了解工作所包含的内容。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the set of reasons used for choosing something
a group of people responsible for choosing something

Sense.DEF: careful about what you choose to do, buy, allow etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔做事﹑购物等〕认真选择[挑拣]的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re very selective about what we let the children watch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让孩子们看什么节目﹐我们挑选得很仔细。

Sense.EXAMPLE: selective schools
Sense.GLOSS: that choose which students to accept
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 择优录取学生的学校
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has a very selective memory he chooses what he wants to remember and what to forget .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的记忆选择性很强。

Sense.DEF: affecting or relating to the best or most suitable people or things from a larger group
Sense.TRAN: 有选择的﹐选择性的﹐择优的
Sense.EXAMPLE: selective breeding
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 择优育种

Sense.DEF: a member of a committee that chooses the best people for something such as a sports team
Sense.TRAN: 〔运动队等的〕选拔人﹐选拔委员会委员

Sense.DEF:
a piece of equipment that helps you find the right thing, for example the correct
gear
in a car

a poisonous chemical substance, used in electrical instruments to make them sensitive to light. It is a chemical
element
: symbol Se
Sense.TRAN: 硒〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Se〕

Sense.DEF: the type of person you are, your character, your typical behaviour etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sid was not his usual smiling self.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 锡德不是平常那个笑容满面的样子。

GramExa.GLOSS: be the way you usually are again, especially after having been ill, unhappy etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔尤指生病或不愉快等之后〕复原﹐恢复老样子
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jim was beginning to feel like his old self again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆开始感觉自己又恢复老样子了。

GramExa.GLOSS: what someone is really like, rather than what they pretend to be like
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Peter was the only one to whom she showed her true self.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得是唯一一个她愿意向其展现真实自我的人。

Sense.DEF: someone’s idea that they are a separate person, different from other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a child’s developing sense of self
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童逐渐形成的自我意识

Sense.LEXUNIT: be a shadow/ghost of your former self
Sense.DEF: to not be as healthy, strong etc as you used to be
Sense.TRAN: 判若两人〔已不再像从前那样健康﹑强壮等〕

Sense.DEF: a word written in business letters, on cheques etc meaning yourself
Sense.TRAN: 本人〔用于商业函件﹑支票等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cheque written to self
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开给本人的一张支票

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a person
Sense.EXAMPLE: a picture of a journalist and your good self you
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位新闻记者和你本人的一张合影

Sense.DEF: by yourself or by itself
Sense.EXAMPLE: a self-propelled vehicle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机动车

Sense.DEF: of, to, with, or for yourself or itself
Sense.TRAN: 独自的﹔（对）自身的﹔为自己的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a self-portrait
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自画像

Sense.DEF: interested only in yourself and the things that affect you
Sense.TRAN: 只顾自己的﹐专注于自我的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teenagers always seem so self-absorbed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 青少年似乎总是只关心自己。

Sense.DEF:
masturbation
– used to show disapproval
a method of learning in which students choose their own books, materials etc and study on their own
Sense.TRAN: 自主学习法〔由学生自选课本﹑教材等并自学〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a self-access centre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自主学习中心

Sense.DEF: when someone achieves what they want through work or in their personal life
Sense.TRAN: 自我实现〔通过工作或在个人生活中实现个人目标〕

Sense.DEF: a self-addressed envelope has the sender’s address on it, so that information can be put in it and sent back to them

a self-adhesive envelope,
bandage
etc has a sticky surface and does not need liquid or glue to make it stay closed
giving yourself a responsibility, job, position etc without the agreement of other people, especially those you claim to represent – used to show disapproval
self-assembly furniture is sold as separate parts that you put together yourself at home
very confident about saying what you think or want
Sense.TRAN: 非常自信的﹐极有主见的

Sense.DEF: when you judge your own work or progress
when someone who works for themselves calculates how much tax they should pay
calm and confident about what you are doing
knowledge and understanding of yourself
Sense.TRAN: 自知﹐自我了解﹐自我认识

Sense.DEF: when you build your own house rather than paying a professional builder to do it for you
relating to a holiday in which you stay in a place where you can cook your own food
Sense.TRAN: 〔在度假住宿处〕自己做饭的﹐自办伙食的

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自己做饭的住处/公寓套间/村舍等

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Prices start from £114 per person for seven nights’ self-catering.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 膳食自理﹐七个晚上每人114英镑起。

Sense.DEF: paying so much attention to yourself that you do not notice what is happening to other people
Sense.TRAN: 自我中心的﹐只顾自己的﹐自私的

Sense.DEF: when you sign a form or note to say that you have been ill, to explain why you have not been at work or school for a short time
Sense.TRAN: 自签证明〔指自己签名说明缺勤或缺课缘由〕

Sense.DEF: the idea that someone has of what their own character is like
admitting that you have a particular quality, especially one that is bad
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指对坏事〕自己承认的﹐自动坦白的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a self-confessed drug addict
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自己坦白的吸毒者

Sense.DEF: sure that you can do things well, that people like you etc
Sense.TRAN: 自信的﹐对自己信心十足的

Sense.DEF: behaviour that shows in an annoying way that you think you have done very well at something
worried and embarrassed about what you look like or what other people think of you
Sense.TRAN: 〔因顾虑自己的外表或他人的看法〕忸怩的﹐害羞的﹐不自然的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jerry’s pretty self-conscious about his weight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰里很在意自己的体重。

Sense.DEF: self-conscious art, writing etc shows that the artist etc is paying too much attention to how the public will react to their work
Sense.TRAN: 〔艺术﹑文学作品等〕过于重视公众反应的﹐强调社会效果的

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The boys posed rather self-consciously for the photo.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩子们拍这张照片姿势很不自然。

Sense.DEF: complete and not needing other things or help from somewhere else to work
Sense.TRAN: 配套齐全的﹐自成体系的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a self-contained database package
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自足性数据库包

Sense.DEF: someone who is self-contained does not seem to need other people or show their feelings
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕独立自主的﹐感情不外露的

Sense.DEF: a self-contained apartment has its own kitchen and bathroom
Sense.TRAN: 〔公寓〕有独立设备的﹔设备齐全的〔指有独立的厨房和卫生间〕

Sense.DEF: containing two opposite statements or ideas that cannot both be true
the ability to behave calmly and sensibly even when you feel very excited, angry etc
when you judge your own behaviour or character, especially when you have done something bad
when you make yourself believe that something is true when it is not
causing even more problems, or causing exactly the same problems and difficulties that you are trying to prevent or deal with
Sense.TRAN: 适得其反的﹐弄巧成拙的﹐事与愿违的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Constant dieting can be self-defeating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一直节食结果可能适得其反。

Sense.DEF: something you do to protect yourself or your property

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He shot him in self-defence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他出于自卫开枪打死了他。

Sense.DEF: skills that you learn to protect yourself if you are attacked
when you do not do or have the things you enjoy, for moral or religious reasons
Sense.TRAN: 〔出于道德或宗教原因的〕克己﹐苦行

Sense.DEF: trying to make your own abilities or achievements seem unimportant
Sense.EXAMPLE: self-deprecating humour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自嘲

Sense.DEF: if something such as a bomb self-destructs, it destroys itself, usually by exploding
deliberately doing things that are likely to seriously harm or kill yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: a self-destructive alcoholic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个自暴自弃的酗酒者

Sense.DEF: the right of the people of a particular country to govern themselves and to choose the type of government they will have
responsible for judging and organ-izing your own work, rather than getting instructions from other people
Sense.TRAN: 自我指导的﹐自主的〔自己负责对自己的工作作出判断和进行安排﹐而不是从别人那里得到指示〕

Sense.DEF: the ability to make yourself do the things you know you ought to do, without someone making you do them
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of the kids seemed to lack self-discipline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些小孩中有许多好像都缺乏自我约束力。

Sense.DEF: the feeling that you and your abilities are not good enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: a moment of self-doubt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 片刻的自我怀疑

Sense.DEF:
a self-drive car is one that you have
hired
to drive yourself
a self-drive holiday is one in which you use your own car to visit the holiday area
having taught yourself by reading books, thinking about ideas etc, rather than learning things in school
not wanting to attract attention to yourself or your achievements
Sense.TRAN: 避免引人注目的﹐不爱抛头露面的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a quiet, self-effacing man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个沉默寡言﹑谦虚持重的人

Sense.DEF: working for yourself and not employed by a company
Sense.TRAN: 个体经营的﹐自雇的﹐自由职业的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a self-employed plumber
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名个体经营的管子工
Sense.EXAMPLE: pension plans for the self-employed people who are self-employed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为自雇者安排的养老金计划

Sense.DEF: the feeling of being satisfied with your own abilities, and that you deserve to be liked or respected

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Playing a sport can boost a girl’s self-esteem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 体育运动能够增强女孩子的自尊心。

Sense.EXAMPLE: students’ sense of self-esteem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生的自尊心

GramExa.GLOSS: not much self-esteem

Sense.DEF: clearly true and needing no more proof
Sense.TRAN: 不证自明的﹐显而易见的
Sense.EXAMPLE: self-evident truths
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不言自明的真相

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is self-evident that childhood experiences influence our adult behaviour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 童年经历会影响到我们成年后的行为﹐这是显而易见的。

Sense.DEF: careful thought about whether your actions and your reasons for them are right or wrong
Sense.TRAN: 自省﹐〔对自己行为等的〕反省

Sense.DEF: the practice of checking parts of your body for early signs of some illnesses
clear and easy to understand without needing any more explanation
Sense.TRAN: 无须解释的﹐明白易懂的﹐一目了然的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The video controls are pretty self-explanatory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 录像机的这些控制键都是一看就懂的。

Sense.DEF: the expression of your feelings or thoughts, especially through activities such as painting, writing, or acting
Sense.TRAN: 自我表现〔尤指通过绘画﹑写作﹑演戏等实现〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Corporate dress codes don’t give workers much room for self-expression.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的着装规定没有给员工多少自我表现的余地。

Sense.DEF: if a statement or belief about what will happen in the future is self-fulfilling, it becomes true because you expect it to be true and so behave in a way that will make it happen
Sense.TRAN: 〔预言或信念〕自我实现的﹐自我应验的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a self-fulfilling prophecy : expect things to go wrong, and they probably will.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个自我应验的预言: 估计事情会出问题﹐就很可能会出问题。

Sense.DEF: a country or organization that is self-governing is controlled by its own members rather than by someone from another country or organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔国家﹑组织〕自治的﹐自己管理的
Sense.EXAMPLE: self-governing states
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自治州

Sense.DEF: physical harm that someone deliberately does to their own body, for example cutting their skin with a knife
the use of your own efforts to deal with your problems, instead of depending on other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shelf of self-help books
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一架子励志类图书
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our program emphasizes self-help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们这个计划强调的是自助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a self-help group for single parents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个单身父母自助团体

Sense.DEF: the idea that you have of yourself, especially of your abilities, character, and appearance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Depression affects people with a poor self-image.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自我印象差的人易得抑郁症。

Sense.DEF: behaving in a way that shows you think you are more important than other people – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 妄自尊大的﹐自负的﹐高傲的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a self-important pompous little man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个妄自尊大﹑自命不凡的平庸之辈

Sense.DEF: a self-imposed rule, duty etc is one that you have made for yourself, and which no one has asked you to accept
Sense.TRAN: 自己规定的﹐自愿承担的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She spent five years in self-imposed exile in Bolivia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在玻利维亚度过了五年的自我流放生活。

Sense.DEF: the process of trying to become a better and happier person, for example by gaining new knowledge
allowing yourself to have or do things that you enjoy but do not need, especially if you do this too often – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 放纵自己的﹐纵容自己的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It feels self-indulgent spending so much on a pair of shoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花这么多钱买一双鞋子﹐感觉太纵容自己了。

GramExa.GLOSS: said when you think the book or film only expresses the author or director’s own interests, which are not interesting to other people
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 只顾自我表现的小说/电影等

RunOn.EXAMPLE: My one self-indulgence is good coffee.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝好咖啡是我放纵自己的一大嗜好。

Sense.DEF: self-inflicted pain, problems, illnesses etc are those you have caused yourself
Sense.TRAN: 〔痛苦﹑问题﹑疾病等〕自己造成的﹐自己施加的
Sense.EXAMPLE: self-inflicted gunshot wounds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自己造成的枪伤
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stress is often self-inflicted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 压力往往是自己施加的。

Sense.DEF: when you only care about what is best for you, and do not care about what is best for other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: His offer was motivated solely by self-interest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的提议完全是出于私利。

Sense.DEF: caring only about yourself and not about other people – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 自私的﹐自私自利的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How can you be so selfish?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎能这样自私？
Sense.EXAMPLE: selfish behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自私的行为

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a lack of greed and selfishness

Sense.DEF: an understanding of your own character and behaviour
caring about other people more than about yourself – used to show approval
Sense.EXAMPLE: selfless devotion to their work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对工作的无私奉献

Sense.DEF: a self-made man or woman has become successful and rich by their own efforts, not by having money given to them
Sense.TRAN: 靠个人奋斗成功的﹐白手起家的

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 靠自己奋斗成功的人/百万富翁/商人

Sense.DEF: believing that your own opinions are always right and that everyone else should agree with you – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 自以为是的﹐固执己见的〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF:
the feeling of being sad and
depressed
because you think that something unfair or unpleasant has happened to you – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: a note of self-pity in her voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她话音中一点自怜的口气

Sense.DEF: a drawing, painting, or description that you do of yourself
calm, confident, and in control of your feelings, even in difficult or unexpected situations – used to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 〔在困难或意外情况下〕镇定的﹐沉着的﹐泰然自若的〔含褒义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a confident, self-possessed public speaker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个自信﹑镇定的演说家。

Sense.DEF: protection of yourself and your own life in a threatening or dangerous situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: the instinct for self-preservation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自我保护的本能

Sense.DEF: having given yourself a position or title without the approval or agreement of other people – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: a self-proclaimed champion of the working class
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自封的工人阶级斗士

Sense.DEF:
a type of flour that contains
baking powder
a self-regulatory system, industry, or organization is one that controls itself, rather than having an independent organization or laws to make sure that rules are obeyed
Sense.TRAN: 〔系统﹑产业或组织〕自我调节的﹐自动控制的

Sense.DEF: able to do or decide things by yourself, without depending on the help or advice of other people
Sense.TRAN: 依靠自己的﹐自力更生的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our aim is to teach our son to become an independent self-reliant adult.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的目标是把儿子培养成为独立自主的成年人。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of being happy about your character, abilities, and beliefs
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to keep your self-respect when you have been unemployed for a long time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你长时间失业就很难维持自尊。

Sense.DEF: having respect for yourself and your abilities and beliefs

GramExa.EXAMPLE: No self-respecting actor would appear in a porn movie.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有自尊的演员是不会演色情电影的。

Sense.DEF: the ability to stop yourself doing or saying something, even though you want to, because it is more sensible not to do or say it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The UN appealed for both sides to exercise self-restraint.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国呼吁双方要自我克制。

Sense.DEF:
proudly sure that your beliefs, attitudes, and
morals
are good and right, in a way that annoys other people – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 自以为正直的﹐以正人君子自居的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a vegetarian, but she’s not at all self-righteous about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个素食者﹐但她并不以此来标榜自己。

Sense.DEF:
a type of flour that contains
baking powder
when a country or part of a country is governed by its own citizens
when you decide not to do or have something you want or need, in order to help someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: several years of hard work and self-sacrifice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几年的辛苦工作和自我牺牲

Sense.DEF: exactly the same
Sense.EXAMPLE: two great victories on the selfsame day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同一天内的两大胜利

Sense.DEF: too pleased with yourself and what you have done – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 沾沾自喜的﹐自鸣得意的﹐自满的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A self-satisfied smile settled on his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脸上露出自鸣得意的笑容。

Sense.DEF: doing things only because they will give you an advantage that other people do not have – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 追逐私利的﹐为自己打算的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a self-seeking politician
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 追求私利的政客

Sense.DEF: a self-service restaurant, shop etc is one in which you get things for yourself and then pay for them
showing that you will only do something if it will gain you an advantage – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 只为个人打算的﹐一心谋私利的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: self-serving politicians
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只为自己打算的政客

Sense.DEF: someone who is able to work successfully on their own without needing other people’s help or a lot of instructions – used to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 有独立工作能力的人﹔工作主动积极的人〔含褒义〕

Sense.DEF: having given yourself a title or position without having a right to it – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: a self-styled poet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个自封的诗人

Sense.DEF: able to provide all the things you need without help from other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a self-sufficient farm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自给自足的农场

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Australia is 65% self-sufficient in oil.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 澳大利亚65%的用油能够自给自足。

Sense.DEF: able to earn enough money to support yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: The business will soon become self-supporting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司很快就能独立经营了。

Sense.DEF: able to stand or stay upright without support
Sense.EXAMPLE: self-supporting fencing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自撑的篱笆

Sense.DEF: having learned a skill or subject by reading about it, practising it etc yourself, rather than in a school
Sense.TRAN: 自学而成的﹐自学成材的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She received some education at night school, but was largely self-taught.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在夜校接受过一些教育﹐但主要是靠自学成材。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a self-taught pianist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位自学成材的钢琴家

Sense.DEF: very determined to do what you want, whatever other people think – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 任性的﹐固执的﹐执拗的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wild and self-willed child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个放肆任性的小孩

Sense.DEF:
a self-winding watch is one that you do not have to
wind
to make it work
the feeling that you deserve to be liked and respected
Sense.EXAMPLE: Work gave me a sense of dignity and self-worth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作给了我自尊﹐使我认识到了自己的价值。

Sense.DEF: to give something to someone in exchange for money
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you offer him another hundred, I think he’ll sell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你再加一百元钱﹐我想他会卖的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He regrets selling all his old records.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他后悔把所有的老唱片都卖掉了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Toni’s selling her car for £700.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 托妮准备以700英镑卖掉她的汽车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I won’t sell you my shares!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是不会把我的股份卖给你的！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The vase was sold to a Dutch buyer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只花瓶卖给了一名荷兰的买主。

GramExa.GLOSS: make or lose money on a sale
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tony had to sell the business at a loss.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尼只得把企业亏本卖掉。

Sense.DEF: to offer something for people to buy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you sell cigarettes?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们有香烟卖吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a job selling advertising space
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 推销广告版面的工作

GramExa.GLOSS: be offered for sale at £100/$50/30p etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 以100英镑/50美元/30便士等出售
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Smoke alarms sell for as little as five pounds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟雾警报器最便宜的只卖五英镑。

Sense.DEF: to make people want to buy something
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某物〕吸引顾客﹐使畅销
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scandal sells newspapers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丑闻使报纸畅销。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The car’s new design will help sell it to consumers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这款汽车的新设计将会更加吸引消费者。

Sense.DEF: to be bought by people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tickets for the concert just aren’t selling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场音乐会的门票销路不佳。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her last book sold millions of copies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的最近一本书卖出了几百万本。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the new houses have been sold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的新房都售完了。

GramExa.GLOSS: be bought by a lot of people, or very few people
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anti-age creams always sell well.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 抗衰老护肤霜总是很畅销。

Sense.DEF: to sell quickly and in large amounts
to try to make someone accept a new idea or plan, or to become accepted
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s all right for Washington, but will it sell in small-town America?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这在华盛顿没有问题﹐但在美国的小城镇中能被接受吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s hard for any government to sell new taxes to the electorate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何一个政府要让选民接受新的税项都很困难。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: managers selling employees the new working hours
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 设法让雇员接受新的工作时间的经理们

GramExa.GLOSS: think an idea or plan is very good
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 热衷于（做）某事﹐对（做）某事极感兴趣
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Joe’s completely sold on the concept.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔对这个想法极感兴趣。

Subsense.DEF: to make yourself seem impressive to other people
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If you want a promotion, you’ve got to sell yourself better.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你如果想晋升﹐就得更好地推销自己。

Subsense.DEF: to have sex with someone for money

Sense.DEF: to not give someone or something the praise, attention, or reward that they deserve
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t sell yourself short – tell them about all your qualifications.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要自谦﹐把你所有本领都告诉他们。

Sense.DEF: to agree to do something bad in exchange for money, power etc
Sense.TRAN: 出卖灵魂（给魔鬼）〔以换取金钱﹑权力等〕

Sense.DEF: to do something that harms a group of people who trusted you, in order to gain money or power for yourself
Sense.TRAN: 〔为个人利益或权力〕出卖[背叛]某一群人

Sense.DEF: to take money from someone who wants you to vote for a particular person or plan
Sense.TRAN: 出卖选票〔指以选票作交换收取某人的钱〕

Exponent.DEF: to give something to someone in exchange for money
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He sold his motorcycle.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把摩托车卖掉了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The shop sells old furniture.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家商店出售旧家具。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do you sell books on gardening?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们有园艺方面的书卖吗？

Exponent.DEF: to send goods to another country to be sold
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Which countries export oil to the United States?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪些国家向美国出口石油？

Exponent.DEF: to buy and sell a particular type of goods as part of your business
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He deals in antiques.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他经营古董。

Exponent.EXP: put sth up for sale/put sth on the market
Exponent.DEF: to make something available to be bought
Exponent.TRAN: 把某物拿去出售/上市出售某物
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When the painting was first put up for sale, no one thought that it would be worth so much money.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画首次出售的时候,没有人想到它会值这么多钱。

Exponent.DEF: to sell your house or your business so that you can move to a different place or do something different
Exponent.TRAN: 卖掉（房子或企业）〔以便移居别处或另谋发展〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They’re thinking of selling up and moving to Canada.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在考虑卖掉房子,移居加拿大。

Exponent.DEF: to sell things at a special event to the person who offers the most money
Exponent.TRAN: 拍卖某物/在拍卖会上卖某物
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The contents of his home will be auctioned.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他家中的物件将被拍卖。

Exponent.DEF: to sell something, especially something that is of low quality
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A man at the market was flogging £10 watches.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场上有个男人在兜售十英镑的劣质手表。

Exponent.DEF: to sell cheap things in the street. Also used about selling illegal drugs and pornography.
Exponent.TRAN: 兜售〔廉价物品或毒品﹑黄色书刊〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Street vendors peddled American and British cigarettes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 街头小贩兜售美国和英国香烟。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People who peddle drugs to children should be severely punished.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 向儿童兜售毒品者应该受到严惩。

Sense.DEF: to sell something, especially for a cheap price, because you need the money or because you want to get rid of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the war, we had to sell off part of the farm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后﹐我们只好把农场的一部分廉价出售。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sell off leftover cakes before we close.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们关门前把剩下的蛋糕削价出售。

Sense.DEF: to sell all or part of an industry or company
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Leicestershire company has sold off many of its smaller branches to cut debts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莱斯特郡的那个公司为了减轻债务卖掉了许多小的分部。

Sense.DEF: if a shop sells out of something, it has no more of that particular thing left to sell

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sorry, we’re sold out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐全卖完了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve completely sold out of those shirts in your size, sir.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 先生﹐您那个尺码的衬衫已经全部卖完了。

Sense.DEF: if products, tickets for an event etc sell out, they are all sold and there are none left
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wow! Those cakes sold out fast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哇！那些蛋糕很快就销售一空。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tonight’s performance is completely sold out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚的演出门票全部售罄。

Sense.DEF: to change your beliefs or principles, especially in order to get more money or some other advantage – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为了钱财或其他利益〕出卖原则﹐放弃信仰〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ex-hippies who’ve sold out and become respectable businessmen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放弃原则摇身一变成为有头有脸的生意人的曾经的嬉皮士

Sense.DEF: to sell your business or your share in a business
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wyman says he’ll sell out if business doesn’t pick up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怀曼说如果生意没有起色﹐他就要把商店卖掉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The T-mail Co. has sold out to San José-based DMX Inc for an undisclosed sum.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: T-mail公司已经出售给位于圣何塞的DMX股份有限公司﹐具体售价没有披露。

Sense.DEF: to sell most of what you own, especially your house or your business
Sense.TRAN: 卖掉（绝大部分财产）〔尤指住房或企业〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liz decided to sell up and move abroad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利兹决定卖掉家产移居国外。

Sense.DEF: something that it is difficult to persuade people to buy or accept
Sense.TRAN: 滞销品﹔不容易被接受的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: This tax increase is going to be a hard sell to voters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次增税很难说服选民接受。

Sense.DEF: the date stamped on a food product, after which it should not be sold
Sense.TRAN: 〔印在食品包装上的〕销售期限﹐最迟销售日期
Sense.EXAMPLE: a yoghurt two days past its sell-by date
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一瓶超过保质期两天的酸奶

Sense.DEF: a time beyond which something or someone is no longer interesting or useful
Sense.TRAN: 〔某物或某人〕过时﹐无用﹐不再受关注
Sense.EXAMPLE: This type of games console is starting to look well past its sell-by date .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种游戏操纵台盘开始像老古董了。

Sense.DEF: someone who sells something
a product that has been popular, not popular etc with customers
Sense.EXAMPLE: The album ‘Thriller’ remains one of the biggest sellers of all time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专辑《颤栗》依然是有史以来最畅销的唱片之一。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which there is not much of a particular thing available, such as houses, so prices are high
the job and skill of persuading people to buy things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a career in selling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 推销工作

Sense.DEF: a particular quality that something has which will make people want to buy it
Sense.TRAN: 〔吸引顾客的〕商品特色﹐销售特色﹐卖点
Sense.EXAMPLE: Small classes are a selling point for private schools.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小班授课是私立学校的卖点。

Sense.DEF: the price at which something is actually sold
the sale of an industry that the government owns, to private companies or other people

the sale of a lot of
stocks
or
shares
, which makes the price decrease
thin clear plastic tape that is sticky on one side, used for sticking things together
Sense.EXAMPLE: a roll of Sellotape
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一卷Sellotape透明胶带

Sense.DEF: a performance, sports game etc for which all the tickets have been sold
Sense.TRAN: 爆满的演出[体育比赛等]﹔满座
Sense.EXAMPLE: The concert was expected to be a sell-out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场音乐会估计会爆满。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sellout crowd of 32,000
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 满座的3.2万名观众

Sense.DEF: a situation in which someone has not done what they promised to do or were expected to do by the people who trusted them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sellout of the poor for political reasons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出于政治原因而出卖穷人

Sense.DEF: someone who has not done what they promised to do or who is not loyal to their friends or supporters, especially in order to become more popular, richer etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many black students regarded him as a sellout.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多黑人学生把他看成背叛者。

Sense.DEF: water that contains small bubbles
the edge of a piece of cloth, made strong so that the threads will not come apart

the plural of
self
relating to the meanings of words
the study of the meaning of words and phrases
the meaning of a word
a system of sending messages using two flags, which you hold in different positions to represent letters and numbers
a situation, condition etc that is close to or similar to a particular one, usually a good one
Sense.TRAN: 〔情况或性质的〕稍微相似﹐有点类似
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was trying to get her thoughts back into some semblance of order .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想稍微理出个头绪来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the war, life returned to a semblance of normality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后﹐生活稍微恢复了正常。

Sense.DEF:
the liquid containing
sperm
that is produced by the male sex organs in humans and animals
one of the two periods of time that a year at high schools and universities is divided into, especially in the US
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指美国中学和大学的〕一学期﹐半学年
Sense.EXAMPLE: the fall semester
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 秋季学期

Sense.DEF:
a
semi-detached
house
Sense.TRAN: 〔一侧与他屋相连的〕半独立式住宅
Sense.EXAMPLE: a three-bedroomed semi
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一栋三个卧室的半独立式住房

Sense.DEF:
a
semi-final
a very large heavy truck consisting of two connected parts, which carries goods over long distances
Sense.TRAN: 〔长途运输的〕铰接式重型卡车

Sense.DEF: exactly half
Sense.EXAMPLE: a semicircle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 半圆

Sense.DEF: partly but not completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: in the semi-darkness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在半明半暗之中
Sense.EXAMPLE: semi-literate people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 半文盲

Sense.DEF: happening, appearing etc twice in a particular period
Sense.TRAN: 在一段时间内〕出现两次的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a semi-weekly visit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一周两次的探访
Sense.EXAMPLE: a semi-annual publication
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 半年一期的出版物

Sense.DEF: a semi-automatic weapon moves each bullet into position ready for you to fire, so that you can fire the next shot very quickly

a musical note which continues for four
beats
half a circle

GramExa.EXAMPLE: About 50 children sat in a semicircle around me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约有50个小孩子围成半圆坐在我身边。

Sense.DEF:
a
punctuation mark
(;) used to separate different parts of a sentence or list

a substance, such as
silicon
, that allows some electric currents to pass through it, and is used in electronic equipment
a semi-detached house is joined to another house on one side
Sense.TRAN: 〔房屋〕一侧与他屋相连的﹐半独立式的

Sense.DEF: one of two sports games whose winners then compete against each other to decide who wins the whole competition
a person or team that competes in a semi-final
Sense.TRAN: 参加半决赛的选手[队伍]

Sense.DEF: a seminal article, book etc is important, and influences the way things develop in the future
Sense.TRAN: 〔文章﹑书等〕开创性的﹐有重大影响的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a seminal study of eighteenth-century France
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对18世纪法国的开创性研究

Sense.DEF:
producing or containing
semen
a class at a university or college for a small group of students and a teacher to study or discuss a particular subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔大学里师生分组进行专题讨论的〕研讨班
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Shakespeare seminar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莎士比亚研讨班

Sense.DEF: a class on a particular subject, usually given as a form of training
Sense.EXAMPLE: Publishers and writers from 13 countries attended the seminar .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自13个国家的出版商和作家参加了此次研讨会。

Sense.DEF: a college for training priests or ministers
a school
the way in which people communicate through signs and images, or the study of this

a semi-precious jewel or stone is valuable, but not as valuable as a
diamond
,
ruby
etc
a semi-professional sports player, musician etc is paid for doing a sport, playing music, but does not do it as their main job
Sense.EXAMPLE: a semiprofessional boxer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位半职业拳击手

Sense.DEF:
a musical note that continues for a sixteenth of the length of a
semibreve
someone who is semi-retired continues to work, but not for as many hours as they used to, especially because they are getting older and want time to do other things
a semi-skilled worker has some skills related to the job they do, but is not fully skilled
Sense.EXAMPLE: semi-skilled workers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 半熟练工人

Sense.DEF: a semi-skilled job is one that you need some skills to do, but you do not have to be highly skilled
Sense.EXAMPLE: a semi-skilled job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 需要半熟练技术的工作

Sense.DEF: milk that has had some of the fat removed

semisweet chocolate is only slightly sweet and has a darker colour than
milk chocolate

Subsense.DEF: belonging to the race of people that includes Jews, Arabs, and, in ancient times, Babylonians and Assyrians
Subsense.TRAN: 闪米特人〔包括犹太人﹑阿拉伯人﹑古巴比伦人和古亚述人等〕的

Subsense.DEF: relating to any of the languages of these people

Sense.DEF:
another word for
jewish

the difference in
pitch
between any two notes that are next to each other on a piano

a sound made in speech that sounds like a vowel, but is in fact a
consonant
, for example /w/

small grains of crushed wheat, used especially in making sweet dishes and
pasta
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤用于做甜食和意大利面食的〕粗面粉

Sense.DEF: a sweet dish made with these grains and milk
Sense.TRAN: 粗面粉布丁〔用粗面粉和牛奶做的甜食〕

Sense.DEF: a powerful explosive often used illegally to make bombs
Sense.TRAN: 塞姆汀塑胶炸药〔一种烈性炸药﹐常用于非法制造炸弹〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= Senator 参议员
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sen. Biden
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拜登参议员

Subsense.DEF: the smaller and more important of the two parts of the government with the power to make laws, in countries such as the US, Australia, and France
Subsense.TRAN: 〔美国﹑澳大利亚﹑法国等国家的〕参议院
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The Senate approved the bill.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参议院批准了这项议案。

Subsense.DEF: a similar part of the government in many US states
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the California state senate
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加利福尼亚州的参议院

Sense.DEF: the highest level of government in ancient Rome
Sense.TRAN: 〔古罗马政府最高级别的〕元老院

Sense.DEF: the governing council at some universities
Sense.TRAN: 〔某些大学的〕大学理事会﹐大学评议会

Sense.DEF: a member of the Senate or a senate
Sense.EXAMPLE: Senator Kennedy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯尼迪参议员

Sense.DEF: to arrange for something to go or be taken to another place, especially by post
Sense.TRAN: 送出﹐发出﹔〔尤指通过邮政系统〕寄出
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lyn sent some pictures of the wedding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琳恩寄了几张婚礼照片。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We sent Mom flowers for Mother’s Day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在母亲节给妈妈送去了一些花。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We sent her a letter of apology.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们给她寄去了一封道歉信。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll send a copy to you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会寄给你一份。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He ordered coffee to be sent up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他要了份咖啡送上去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Monday is the last day to send cards by post to arrive by Christmas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要让贺卡在圣诞节之前收到﹐最晚必须于星期一寄出去。

Sense.DEF: to make a message, electronic signal etc go somewhere, using radio equipment, computers etc
Sense.TRAN: 发送﹐发出〔信息﹑电子信号等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I sent her an email yesterday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天我给她发了封电子邮件。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Radio signals were sent into deep space.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无线电信号被发送到深邃的太空。

Subsense.DEF: to ask or tell someone to go somewhere, especially so that they can do something for you there
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The United Nations is sending troops.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国正在派遣军队。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A police officer was sent to Ryan’s home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名警官被派到瑞安的家中。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many of the refugees were sent back to Vietnam.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多难民被遣送回越南。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: When Frank came, I told him I was ill and sent him away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰克来时﹐我告诉他我病了﹐把他打发走了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They sent me down to talk to Mr. Strachan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们派我去和斯特罗恩先生谈话。
