Subsense.EXAMPLE: Mr Ellison is here. Shall I send him in tell him to enter the room ?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃利森先生来了﹐要不要我去叫他进来？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The U.S. offered to send ships to help in the rescue operation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国提出派船去为营救行动提供帮助。

Subsense.DEF: to arrange for someone to go to a place such as a school, prison, or hospital and spend some time there
Subsense.TRAN: 安排〔某人〕去﹐将〔某人〕送往

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t afford to send my kid to private school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无力供孩子上私立学校。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was sent to prison for five years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被判入狱五年。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was sent away to school at the age of six.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我六岁时被送去上学。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: New employees are sent on a training course.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新雇员被送去参加培训课程。

Sense.DEF: if something that someone does or says sends a particular message, it has that meaning
Sense.TRAN: 传递（给某人）一个信息/信号
Sense.EXAMPLE: Advertising sends the message that you have to be thin to be successful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 广告传递的信息是﹐要想成功就得瘦。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone to give your greetings, good wishes etc to someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mother sends her love.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母亲向你问好。

Sense.DEF: to make something move from one place to another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The blaze sent smoke over much of the city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大火产生的浓烟扩散到市内的很多地区。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something move quickly through the air or across something
Sense.TRAN: 使某人/某物乱飞/趴倒在地/摇晃等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The explosion sent glass flying everywhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爆炸使玻璃四处乱飞。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something start to be in a particular state
Sense.EXAMPLE: His lectures always send me to sleep .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他讲课总是让我昏昏欲睡。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tail broke apart, sending the plane into a dive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 机尾断裂﹐飞机一头栽了下去。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone something by sending them a letter or message

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They sent word to the king of their arrival.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们叫人传话给国王说他们到了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: send shivers/chills up (and down) your spine
Sense.DEF: to make you feel very frightened or excited
Sense.TRAN: 使人脊骨发凉﹐令人毛骨悚然﹔令人十分兴奋
Sense.EXAMPLE: The eerie howl of the siren sent chills up her spine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怪异恐怖的汽笛声使她感到毛骨悚然。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone who is not wanted that they must leave at once
Sense.TRAN: 叫某人立即离开﹐撵走某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: After his four years as governor, the voters sent him packing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他当了四年州长之后﹐选民叫他滚蛋了。

Sense.DEF: to send a letter to a company or organization asking them to send something to you
Sense.TRAN: 写信去索取﹐寄信去索要
Sense.EXAMPLE: Send away for a free recipe booklet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 写信索取免费的烹饪小册子。

Sense.DEF: to make something lose value
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s bad figures sent its share price down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司业绩不佳使其股票价格下跌。

Sense.DEF: to send someone to prison

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was sent down for possession of cocaine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因藏有可卡因而被判入狱。

Sense.DEF: to be told to leave a university because of bad behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 〔大学生因行为不检〕被开除﹐被勒令退学

Sense.DEF: to ask or order that something be brought or sent to you, especially by writing a letter or by telephone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Send for your free sample today!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天就来索取免费样品！

Sense.DEF: to ask or tell someone to come to you by sending them a message
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charlie said he’d find a place to live and then send for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查利说他会找一个住处﹐然后就派人来接我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Get back into bed. I’ll send for the doctor .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回到床上去﹐我让人去请医生来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve sent for help .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经去请人帮忙了。

Sense.DEF: to send something, usually by post, to a place where it can be dealt with
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sent in a few job applications last week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上星期我寄出了几封求职信。

Sense.DEF: to send soldiers, police etc somewhere to deal with a difficult or dangerous situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: British troops were sent in as part of the peace-keeping force.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国军队被派往那里加入维和部队。

Sense.DEF: to send something somewhere by post
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sent off the letter this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今天早上把信寄出去了。

Sense.DEF: to send a letter to a company or organization asking them to post something to you
Sense.TRAN: 写信索取某物﹔函索某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sent off for a copy of the photograph.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我写信去要一张这种照片。

Sense.DEF: to order a sports player to leave the field because they have broken the rules
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of Dundee’s players was sent off for punching another player.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邓迪队的一名球员因拳打另一名球员而被罚出场。

Sense.DEF: to send someone’s letters or possessions to their new address from their old address
Sense.TRAN: 把〔信件等〕转寄到新地址
Sense.EXAMPLE: My flatmate said she’d send on all my post.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原来和我合租公寓的朋友说她会把我的全部邮件转寄给我。

Sense.DEF: to send something that has been received to another place so that it can be dealt with
Sense.TRAN: 把〔收到的东西〕转送〔到另一处〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The data is then sent on to the Census Bureau.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些数据随后又转送到人口调查局。

Sense.DEF: to make a person or a group of people or things go from one place to various other places
Sense.EXAMPLE: Information was sent out to interested students.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信息发送给了感兴趣的学生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Search parties were sent out to look for survivors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 派出了搜救队去寻找幸存者。

Sense.DEF: to broadcast or produce a signal, light, sound etc
Sense.TRAN: 广播﹔发出〔信号﹑光﹑声音等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ship is sending out an SOS signal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那艘船正在发出呼救信号。

Sense.DEF: to ask a restaurant or food shop to deliver food to you at home or at work
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sent out for sandwiches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们叫了三明治外卖。

Sense.DEF: to make something increase in value
Sense.EXAMPLE: The oil shortage is bound to send prices up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油短缺必定会造成价格上升。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something seem silly by copying them in a funny way
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过滑稽模仿〕使显得可笑﹐取笑﹐嘲弄
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film hilariously sends up Hollywood disaster movies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影把好莱坞的灾难片嘲弄了一番﹐令人捧腹大笑。

Sense.DEF: the person who sent a particular letter, package, message etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔信件﹑包裹﹑信息等的〕发送者﹐寄件人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a package marked ‘ return to sender ’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 标有“退回寄件人”字样的包裹

Sense.DEF: a party or other occasion when people meet to say goodbye to someone who is leaving
Sense.EXAMPLE: When he leaves the department, we’re going to give a send-off that he won’t forget!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等他离开本部门的时候﹐我们要给他开一个让他永生难忘的欢送会！

Sense.DEF: a film, article, show etc that copies someone or something in a way that makes them seem funny or silly
Sense.TRAN: 嘲弄性的模仿电影[文章﹐演出]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a hilarious send-up of a Hollywood disaster movie
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘲弄好莱坞某部灾难片的﹑令人捧腹的电影

Sense.DEF: becoming old and showing the effects of getting older
Sense.EXAMPLE: a senescent industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 衰落的行业

Sense.DEF: mentally confused or behaving strangely, because of old age
Sense.EXAMPLE: a senile old man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个年老糊涂的老人
Sense.EXAMPLE: She worries about going senile .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她担心自己变得年老糊涂。

Sense.DEF: a serious medical condition that affects the minds of some old people, and makes them confused and behave in a strange way
used after the name of a man who has the same name as his son
Sense.TRAN: 年纪较大的﹐年长的〔父子同名时﹐用于父亲的姓名后〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: John J. Wallace, Sr.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老约翰·J﹒华莱士

Sense.DEF: having a higher position, level, or rank
Sense.TRAN: 〔地位﹑水平或级别〕较高的﹐高级的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the senior Democrat on the House committee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 众议院委员会中的资深民主党人
Sense.EXAMPLE: White men hold most of the jobs in senior management .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白人占据高级管理层的大部分职位。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the senior partner in a law firm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 律师事务所里的资深合伙人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is also a diplomat, but senior to me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他也是一名外交官﹐但级别比我高。

Sense.DEF: a senior competition is for older people or for people at a more advanced level
Sense.TRAN: 〔比赛等的参赛者〕年纪较大的﹔级别较高的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I won the 60-metre race, my first senior success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在60米赛跑中获胜﹐这是我第一次在高级别的赛事中获得胜利。

Sense.DEF:
a student in their last year of
high school
or university
Sense.TRAN: 〔中学或大学〕最高年级的学生﹐毕业班学生
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jen will be a senior this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍今年将是毕业班学生了。

Sense.DEF:
a
senior citizen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Seniors can get a 10% discount.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年人可以享受10%的折扣。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be two/five/ten etc years sb’s senior
Sense.DEF: to be two, five, ten etc years older than someone
Sense.TRAN: 比某人年长两岁/五岁/十岁等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her husband was nine years her senior.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她丈夫比她大九岁。

Sense.DEF: an adult or a person who has reached an advanced level in a particular sport
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一体育项目的〕成人运动员﹔高水平选手
Sense.EXAMPLE: Juniors and seniors train together on Wednesdays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 少年组和成年组周三一起训练。

Sense.DEF:
someone who is over 60 years old or who is
retired
Sense.TRAN: 老年人﹐长者〔指60岁以上或已退休者〕

Sense.DEF: if you have seniority in a company or organization, you have worked there a long time and have some official advantages
Sense.TRAN: 〔在某一公司或组织供职的〕年资﹐资历
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had 15 years seniority , and they couldn’t fire me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在这里有15年的资历﹐他们不可以解雇我。

Sense.DEF: when you are older or higher in rank than someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: a position of seniority
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高级职位

Sense.DEF: a time when you cannot remember something, because you are getting older – used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a senior moment and just couldn’t think of his name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我老糊涂了﹐怎么也想不起他的名字。

Sense.DEF:
a
secondary school

a tropical plant with a fruit that is often used to make a medicine to help your
bowel s
work
Sense.TRAN: 番泻树〔一种热带植物﹐其果实常用作泻药〕

Sense.DEF: a feeling that you get from one of your five senses, especially the sense of touch

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One sign of a heart attack is a tingling sensation in the left arm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 心脏病发作的一个征兆是左臂有刺痛感。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sensation of heat
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种灼热感

Sense.DEF: a feeling that is difficult to describe, caused by a particular event, experience, or memory
Sense.TRAN: 〔由某一事件﹑经历或记忆引起的难以描述的〕感受﹐感觉

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Caroline had the sensation that she was being watched.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡罗琳有种感觉﹐有人在监视她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was a strange sensation – I felt I’d been there before.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一种奇怪的感觉——我觉得以前曾到过那里。

Sense.DEF: the ability to feel things, especially through your sense of touch
Sense.TRAN: 知觉﹐感觉能力〔尤指触觉〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jerry realized that he had no sensation in his legs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰里意识到自己双腿都没有了知觉。

Sense.DEF: extreme excitement or interest, or someone or something that causes this
Sense.TRAN: 轰动﹐激动﹔引起轰动的人[事]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sex scenes in the film caused a sensation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片中的性爱镜头引起了轰动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the latest pop sensation from England
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自英格兰的引起轰动的最新流行歌曲

Sense.DEF: very interesting, exciting, and surprising
Sense.TRAN: 令人极度兴奋的﹐轰动的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sensational discovery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引起轰动的发现
Sense.EXAMPLE: The show was a sensational success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次演出取得了轰动性的成功。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sensational 6-0 victory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轰动性的6比0大胜

Sense.DEF: intended to interest, excite, or shock people – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 大肆渲染的﹔耸人听闻的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: sensational newspaper stories
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哗众取宠的新闻报道
Sense.EXAMPLE: sensational headlines
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耸人听闻的标题

Sense.DEF: very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked sensational.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看上去漂亮极了。

Sense.DEF: a way of reporting events or stories that makes them seem as strange, exciting, or shocking as possible – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔新闻报道〕追求轰动效应的做法﹐耸人听闻的手法﹐哗众取宠〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: to deliberately make something seem as strange, exciting, or shocking as possible – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 耸人听闻地夸张﹐大肆渲染 〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The media often sensationalizes crime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 媒体常常对犯罪活动大肆渲染。

Sense.DEF: a feeling about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Afterwards, I felt a great sense of relief.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 后来﹐我感到如释重负。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A sense of panic has spread over the country.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 举国上下一片恐慌。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Employees need the sense of being appreciated.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇员需要被赏识的感觉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He looked around the room with a sense of achievement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他带着一种成就感环顾房间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had the sense that he was lying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有一种感觉﹐他在撒谎。

Sense.DEF: the ability to understand or judge something

GramExa.GLOSS: the ability to understand and enjoy things that are funny
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I like Pam - she has a really good sense of humour .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢帕姆﹐她很有幽默感。

GramExa.GLOSS: the ability to judge which way you should be going, or what your aims should be
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was dark and he had completely lost his sense of direction .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 天黑了﹐他完全失去了方向感。

GramExa.GLOSS: the ability to judge what is important and what is not important
GramExa.COLLOINEXA: 区别轻重缓急的能力﹐主次观念
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let’s keep a sense of proportion, and not rush to any hasty conclusions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要有主次观念﹐不要急于下结论。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kids have a natural sense of justice .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子都有一种天生的正义感。

GramExa.GLOSS: the ability to judge which clothes look good
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 着装感﹐对服装的鉴赏力

Sense.DEF: one of the five natural powers of sight, hearing, feeling, taste, and smell, that give us information about the things around us
Sense.TRAN: 感官﹐感觉官能〔即视觉﹑听觉﹑触觉﹑味觉和嗅觉〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has a good sense of smell.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她嗅觉很好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Cats have a very acute sense of hearing very good, so that they can hear even the smallest sound .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫的听觉非常敏锐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Combinations of flavors, textures, and colour that can delight the senses .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使感官愉悦的味道﹑口感和颜色的结合。

GramExa.GLOSS: all of the senses

Sense.DEF: when someone makes sensible or practical decisions, or behaves in a sensible, practical way

GramExa.PROPFORM: have the sense to do sth
GramExa.GLOSS: behave in a sensible way and do what is best in that situation
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 有做某事的常识﹐知道好歹
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You should have had the sense to turn off the electricity first.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该知道要先关掉电源这个常识。

GramExa.PROPFORM: there is no sense in (doing) sth
GramExa.GLOSS: it is not sensible to do something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s no sense in getting upset about it now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在没有必要为这件事苦恼。

GramExa.GLOSS: realize what is the sensible thing to do
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 开始明白事理﹐变得明智起来
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wish the politicians would see sense and stop the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望政客们能够变得明智一点﹐结束这场战争。

GramExa.GLOSS: try to make someone behave in a more sensible way
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 开导某人使其明智起来﹐让某人明白过来

Subsense.DEF: to have a clear meaning and be easy to understand
Subsense.TRAN: 有意义﹐表述清晰﹐易于理解
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Read this and tell me if it makes sense.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 读读这篇东西﹐告诉我通不通。

Subsense.DEF: to be a sensible thing to do
Subsense.TRAN: 是明智的﹐是合乎情理的

GramExa.PROPFORM: it makes sense (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It makes sense to save money while you can.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 钱能省就省﹐这是明智的做法。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Would it make sense for the city authorities to further restrict parking?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市政当局进一步限制停车的做法是否合乎情理？

Subsense.DEF: if something makes sense, there seems to be a good reason or explanation for it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Why did she do a thing like that? It doesn’t seem to make sense.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为什么做那种事情？这似乎讲不通。

Sense.DEF: to understand something, especially something difficult or complicated
Sense.TRAN: 理解[弄懂]某事物〔尤指困难或复杂的事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you make any sense of this article?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能看懂这篇文章吗？

Sense.DEF: the meaning of a word, sentence, phrase etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔单词﹑句子﹑短语等的〕意义﹐意思
Sense.EXAMPLE: The word ‘record’ has several different senses. record
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个词有几种不同的意思。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any alteration would spoil the sense of the entire poem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何改动都会破坏整首诗的含义。

Sense.DEF: a way in which something can be true or real

GramExa.PROPFORM: in a sense/in one sense/in some senses etc
GramExa.GLOSS: in one way, in some ways etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: What he says is right, in a sense.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他所说的是对的﹐从某种意义上来说是这样。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel was in no sense not at all comfortable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店怎么也称不上舒适。
Sense.EXAMPLE: George was a big man in every sense of the word in every way .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治不管怎么说都是个大个子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is true in a general sense .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从一般意义上来讲﹐这是对的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Communication, in any real sense of any real kind , was extremely limited.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真正意义上的交流极其有限。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to emphasize that a statement or description is true
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A head of a school is a manager in a very real sense.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校校长实际上就是一个管理人员。

Sense.DEF: someone’s ability to think clearly and behave sensibly – used in some expressions when you think that someone has lost this ability
Sense.TRAN: 健全的心智﹐理智 用于某些表达法﹐表示某人失去理智〕

GramExa.GLOSS: to start to think clearly and behave sensibly again
GramExa.EXAMPLE: One day he’ll come to his senses and see what a fool he’s been.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总有一天他会清醒过来﹐明白自己曾经有多么傻。

Sense.EXAMPLE: See if you can bring her to her senses . make someone think clearly and behave sensibly
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看看你能否让她明白过来。

GramExa.GLOSS: have lost the ability to think clearly and behave sensibly
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you completely out of your senses?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是不是疯了？

Sense.DEF: to say things that are reasonable or sensible – often used when you think someone has just said something silly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Talk sense! There’s no way we can afford a new car!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说话要有脑子！我们哪里买得起新车！

Sense.DEF:
to stop feeling
faint
or slightly sick
Sense.TRAN: 恢复清醒的头脑﹐恢复精神

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had a strong sense of responsibility.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他责任感很强。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a strong feeling
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Children need to feel a real sense of belonging.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童需要有强烈的归属感。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very strong feeling
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He felt a deep sense of disappointment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他感到深深的失望。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: becoming stronger
not very strong

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I felt a great sense of pride.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到非常自豪。

Collocate.COLLOC: give sb a sense of sth
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The job gave her a sense of control over her life.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个工作让她有了能够掌控自己生活的感觉。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 轻松感/恐惧感/内疚感等
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We reached the medical centre with a sense of relief.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了医疗中心,我们感到如释重负。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a feeling that you know what you are trying to achieve
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Becoming a mother had given her a new sense of purpose.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 成为人母给了她新的人生目标。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a feeling that something is urgent
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The rescuers felt a real sense of urgency now.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 营救人员这时有了强烈的紧迫感。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a feeling that you must do something because it is right
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Parents try to give their children a sense of responsibility.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长试图培养孩子的责任感。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a feeling of sadness for someone or something you no longer have
a feeling that you have achieved something good
a feeling that you are safe
a feeling that you are safe, which is not actually true
a feeling of knowing who you are and how you belong to a community
a feeling that you belong to a group
a feeling that an event is special or important
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 盛会的感觉,隆重的气氛

Sense.DEF: if you sense something, you feel that it exists or is true, without being told or having proof
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps he sensed your distrust.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许他感觉到了你的不信任。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I could sense that something was wrong.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到有什么不对劲。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hugo had already sensed how unhappy she was.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨果已经觉察到了她很不高兴。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If a prairie dog senses danger, he whistles a warning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 草原犬鼠如果觉察到有危险﹐就会鸣叫发出警告。

Sense.DEF: if a machine senses something, it discovers and records it
Sense.EXAMPLE: an electronic device used for sensing intruders
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用来自动监测闯入者的电子装置

Sense.DEF: happening or done for no good reason or with no purpose
Sense.TRAN: 无道理的﹐无目的的﹐无意义的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her death seemed such a senseless waste of life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的死真是无谓地浪费生命。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a senseless crime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无目的的犯罪行为

Sense.DEF: unconscious
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had been beaten senseless .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被打得失去了知觉。

Sense.DEF: a part of your body through which you see, smell, hear, taste, or feel something
the way that someone reacts to particular subjects or types of behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 感情〔人对某些话题或行为作出的反应〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: her religious sensibilities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的宗教感情

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Avoid using words that might offend someone’s racial or moral sensibilities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要避免使用可能会伤害种族或道德感情的词语。

Sense.DEF: the ability to understand feelings, especially those expressed in literature or art
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指对文学﹑艺术的〕感受力﹐鉴赏力﹐敏感性
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sensibility of the artist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位艺术家的感悟力

Sense.DEF: reasonable, practical, and showing good judgment
Sense.TRAN: 明智的﹐合理的﹐实际的﹐有判断力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She seems very sensible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她好像很明智。
Sense.EXAMPLE: sensible advice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合理的建议
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s sensible to keep a note of your passport number.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的护照号码记下来是明智的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Moving house seemed like the sensible thing to do .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 搬家似乎是明智的做法。
Sense.HINTTRAN: A sensible person is reasonable and shows good judgement. A sensitive person is easily upset, or understands other people’s feelings and problems. sensible 是指一个人有理智﹑具有良好的判断力﹔ sensitive 是指一个人敏感易生气﹐或善于理解别人的心情和问题。

Sense.DEF: suitable for a particular purpose, and practical rather than fashionable
Sense.TRAN: 适当的﹐合理的﹔朴素实用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eat a sensible diet and exercise daily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮食要得当﹐每天锻炼身体。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old woman in sensible shoes and a neat skirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿着朴素舒适的鞋子和整洁裙子的一位老妇人

Sense.DEF: noticeable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sensible increase in temperature
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温度的明显上升

Sense.DEF: to know or realize that something exists or is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was very sensible of the difficult situation she was in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很清楚她所处的困境。

Sense.DEF: able to understand other people’s feelings and problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sensitive and intelligent young man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位善解人意﹑非常聪明的年轻人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s made me much more sensitive to the needs of the disabled.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 它使我更加能够理解残疾人的需要。

Sense.DEF: easily upset or offended by events or things that people say
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very sensitive child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个很敏感的小孩

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Laura’s sensitive about her weight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳拉对自己的体重很敏感。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Throughout her career she remained very sensitive to criticism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在整个职业生涯中一直对批评很敏感。

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who is easily upset by small or unimportant things
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 敏感的人﹐容易生气的人

Sense.DEF: easily affected or damaged by something such as a substance or temperature
Sense.TRAN: 敏感的﹔易受影响的﹔过敏的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wetlands are environmentally sensitive areas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 湿地是容易受环境影响的区域。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a baby’s sensitive skin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婴儿敏感的皮肤

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Older people tend to be very sensitive to cold.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年人一般对寒冷都很敏感。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Increasing numbers of people are sensitive to cow’s milk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对牛奶过敏的人越来越多了。

Sense.DEF: a situation or subject that is sensitive needs to be dealt with very carefully, because it is secret or because it may offend people
Sense.TRAN: 需小心处理的﹐敏感的﹐可能触怒人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Abortion is a very sensitive issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 堕胎是个非常敏感的话题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: sensitive matters such as national security
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家安全之类的敏感问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: highly sensitive information
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高度敏感的情报

Sense.DEF: reacting to very small changes in light, temperature, position etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔对光﹑温度﹑位置等的细微变化〕敏感度高的﹐灵敏的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly sensitive electronic camera
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高敏感度的电子摄像机

GramExa.EXAMPLE: light-sensitive photographic paper
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 感光相纸

Sense.DEF: able to understand or express yourself through art, music, literature etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔对艺术﹑音乐﹑文学等〕感受力强的﹐有表现能力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very sensitive performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常细腻的演出

RunOn.EXAMPLE: It is an issue which needs to be handled sensitively.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个需要小心处理的问题。

Sense.DEF: the ability to understand other people’s feelings and problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: His comments show a lack of sensitivity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话有些欠考虑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Interviewing victims of crime must be done with sensitivity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与犯罪受害人谈话一定要非常小心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a teacher with great sensitivity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位善于体察的老师

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has always shown a sensitivity to audience needs and tastes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一向很照顾观众的需求和口味。

Sense.DEF: when a situation or subject needs to be dealt with carefully because it is secret or may offend people
Sense.TRAN: 〔应对某种情况或话题时所需的〕敏感性
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a matter of great political sensitivity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事在政治上非常敏感。

Sense.DEF: when someone reacts badly to a particular food, substance, animal etc and becomes ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: food sensitivity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食物过敏

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many children have a sensitivity to cow’s milk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多儿童对牛奶过敏。

Sense.DEF: when someone is easily upset or offended by things that people say
someone’s feelings and the fact that they could be upset or offended
Sense.EXAMPLE: racial sensitivities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 种族（问题）的敏感性

Sense.DEF: the quality of being able to express emotions through art, literature etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔艺术﹑文学等表达上的〕悟性﹐敏锐性

Sense.DEF: the ability to react to very small changes in light, heat, movement etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔感知光﹑热﹑活动等细微变化的〕灵敏度
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sensitivity of the detector can be increased.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种探测器的灵敏度还可以提高。

Sense.DEF: the fact of quickly reacting to new situations
Sense.TRAN: 〔应对新情况的〕敏感度﹐灵敏度
Sense.EXAMPLE: the market’s price sensitivity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场的价格敏感度

Sense.DEF: to give someone some experience or knowledge of a particular problem or situation so that they can notice it and understand it easily

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Volunteers need to be sensitized to the cultural differences they will meet in African countries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 志愿者需要认识到他们在非洲国家将遇到的文化差异。

Sense.DEF: if someone is sensitized to a particular substance, their body has begun to have a bad reaction whenever they touch it, breathe it etc
Sense.TRAN: 对…开始过敏﹐对…产生过敏反应

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many hospital workers have become sensitized to the latex in gloves.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多医务工作者开始对手套上的胶乳产生过敏反应。

Sense.DEF: to treat a material or a piece of equipment so that it will react to physical or chemical changes
Sense.TRAN: 使〔对物理或化学变化〕敏感
Sense.EXAMPLE: sensitized photographic paper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感光相纸

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment used for discovering the presence of light, heat, movement etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔探测光﹑热﹑活动等的〕传感器﹐感应装置

Sense.DEF: relating to or using your senses of sight, hearing, smell, taste, or touch
Sense.EXAMPLE: sensory stimuli such as music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐等的感官刺激
Sense.EXAMPLE: sensory deprivation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感觉丧失

Sense.DEF: relating to the feelings of your body rather than your mind
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sensual pleasure of good food
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美食的感官享受

Sense.DEF: interested in or making you think of physical pleasure, especially sexual pleasure
Sense.TRAN: 喜欢[激起]感官享受的﹔〔尤指〕刺激性欲的﹔性感的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the faint smile on his sensual mouth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他性感的嘴上的淡淡微笑
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sensual woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个性感女人

Sense.DEF: someone who is only interested in physical pleasure
Sense.TRAN: 追求感官享受的人﹐耽于酒色的人

Sense.DEF: pleasing to your senses
Sense.TRAN: 愉悦感官的﹐给人以快感的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sensuous feeling of silk on her skin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丝绸给她皮肤带来的美妙感觉
Sense.EXAMPLE: sensuous music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悦耳动听的音乐

Sense.DEF: attractive in a sexual way
Sense.EXAMPLE: full sensuous lips
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饱满性感的嘴唇
Sense.EXAMPLE: a beautiful and sensuous young woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个漂亮又性感的年轻女人

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
send

a group of words that usually contains a subject and a verb, and expresses a complete idea. Sentences written in English begin with a capital letter and usually end with a
full stop
or a
question mark
Sense.EXAMPLE: His voice dropped at the end of the sentence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到句子结尾处﹐他压低了嗓音。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to sum it up in one sentence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难用一句话来概括。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In a few short sentences, Quinn explained what he had done.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奎因用几句简短的话对自己所做的事作了解释。

Sense.DEF: a punishment that a judge gives to someone who is guilty of a crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: She received an eight-year prison sentence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被判八年徒刑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has just begun a life sentence for murder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他犯了谋杀罪﹐刚开始服无期徒刑。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was given a three-year prison sentence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被判三年有期徒刑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be likely to receive a sentence
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He faces a long prison sentence if he is caught.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他如果被抓住,就要面临漫长的刑期。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: spend time in prison
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her husband is serving a two-year sentence for credit-card fraud.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她丈夫因犯信用卡诈骗罪正在服两年徒刑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that is the punishment for that crime
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Rape should carry an automatic life sentence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 强奸罪应当自动判无期徒刑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: officially give someone a sentence
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The judge imposed a three-year sentence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官裁决判三年徒刑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: officially say what someone’s punishment will be
a long time in prison
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Police officers are demanding stiffer sentences for offenders.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察要求对违法分子处以更严厉的刑罚。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a short time in prison
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We’re hoping that he gets off with a light sentence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望对他能够从轻惩处。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: If found guilty, he faces a long jail sentence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果被证明有罪,他将面临长期监禁。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a punishment in which a person does not go to prison
five/eight etc years in prison
the most that can be given for a particular crime
prison for the rest of your life, or a very long time
a punishment of death
one which someone will serve only if they commit another crime

Sense.DEF: if a judge sentences someone who is guilty of a crime, they give them a punishment

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sanchez was sentenced to three years in prison.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑切斯被判了三年监禁。

Sense.DEF: an adverb that relates to the whole sentence that contains it
telling people how they should behave – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: sententious remarks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说教的话

Sense.DEF: able to experience things through your senses
Sense.TRAN: 有感知力的﹐有知觉力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Man is a sentient being.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人是有感知力的生命。

Sense.DEF: an opinion or feeling you have about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Similar sentiments were expressed by many politicians.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多政治家都表达了相同的观点。

GramExa.GLOSS: what most people think
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was more in touch with public sentiment than many of his critics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比起许多批评他的人﹐他更了解公众的意见。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the anti-immigrant sentiments expressed by some Americans
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些美国人表露出的反移民情绪

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘After all, it’s her decision.’ ‘ My sentiments exactly I agree .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “毕竟﹐这是她自己作的决定。”“我同意。”

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say feeling rather than sentiment .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说feeling,而不说sentiment
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They all expressed similar feelings .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们都表达了类似的想法。

Sense.DEF: feelings of pity, love, sadness etc that are often considered to be too strong or not suitable for a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no place for sentiment in business!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做生意哪能感情用事！

Sense.DEF: someone who is sentimental is easily affected by emotions such as love, sympathy, sadness etc, often in a way that seems silly to other people
Sense.TRAN: 多愁善感的﹔感情用事的﹔柔情的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She said a sentimental goodbye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她依依不舍地道别。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People can be very sentimental about animals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人有时候会非常怜爱动物。

Sense.DEF: based on or relating to your feelings rather than on practical reasons
Sense.TRAN: 感情上的﹐情绪上的﹐非理性的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wasn’t the sort of person who kept things for sentimental reasons .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不是那种会留什么东西作纪念的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sentimental journey to the place of his birth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到他出生地的一次怀旧之旅
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rings that were stolen were of great sentimental value important because of your feelings or memories relating to them .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些被偷的戒指都是很有纪念意义的。

Sense.DEF: a story, film, book etc that is sentimental deals with emotions such as love and sadness, sometimes in a way that seems silly and insincere
Sense.TRAN: 〔故事﹑电影﹑书等〕感伤的﹐故作伤感的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sentimental story set in Russia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一则以俄罗斯为背景的伤感故事

Sense.DEF: someone who behaves or writes in a sentimental way
Sense.TRAN: 多愁善感的人﹔感伤主义者

Sense.DEF: the quality of being sentimental
to speak, write, or think about only the good or happy things about something, not the bad things
Sense.TRAN: 只谈…的美好一面﹔感性对待
Sense.EXAMPLE: novels that sentimentalize the past
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怀旧小说

Sense.DEF: a sentry
a soldier standing outside a building as a guard
a tall narrow shelter with an open front where a soldier stands while guarding a building

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= September 九月

Sense.DEF: one of the small leaves directly under a flower
two things that are separable can be separated or considered separately

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Physical health is not always easily separable from mental health.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 身体健康和精神健康并不总是可以简单分开。

Sense.DEF: different
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use separate knives for raw and cooked meat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 切生肉和熟肉要用不同的刀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My wife and I have separate bank accounts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和妻子有各自的银行账户。

Sense.DEF: not related to or not affected by something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s a separate issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是另一个问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was attacked on two separate occasions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在两个不同的场合遭人袭击。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He tries to keep his professional life completely separate from his private life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他设法让自己的工作和私生活完全分开。

Sense.DEF: not joined to or touching something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gym and the sauna are in separate buildings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 健身房和桑拿浴室在不同的大楼里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Keep the fish separate from the other food.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把鱼和其他食品分开存放。

Subsense.DEF: if people go their separate ways, they stop being friends or lovers
if people who have been travelling together go their separate ways, they start travelling in different directions
Subsense.TRAN: 〔一起旅行的人〕分道而行﹐分手

RunOn.EXAMPLE: They did arrive together, but I think they left separately.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们确实是一起到的﹐但我想他们是分开走的。

Sense.DEF: if something separates two places or two things, it is between them so that they are not touching each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The lighthouse is separated from the land by a wide channel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 灯塔和陆地之间隔着一条宽阔的海峡。

Sense.DEF: to divide or split into different parts, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: This will keep your dressing from separating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样可以防止调味汁分层。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At this point, the satellite separates from its launcher.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个时候﹐卫星会脱离发射装置。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Separate the students into four groups.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把学生分成四组。

Sense.EXAMPLE: First, separate the eggs divide the white part from the yellow part .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一步﹐把蛋清和蛋黄分开。

Sense.DEF: if two people who are married or have been living together separate, they start to live apart
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jill and John separated a year ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉尔和约翰一年前分居了。

Sense.DEF: to recognize that one thing or idea is different from another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She finds it difficult to separate fact from fantasy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得事实和幻想很难分清。

Sense.DEF: if people separate, or if someone or something separates them, they move apart
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ed stepped in to separate the two dogs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃德上前把这两条狗分开。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the fog, they got separated from the group.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在雾中掉 队了。

Sense.DEF: to be the quality or fact that makes someone or something different from other people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The capacity to think separates humans from animals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 思维能力使人有别于动物。

Sense.DEF: if an amount separates two things, one thing is better or older than the other by that amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three points now separate the two teams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在这三分让两队分出了高下。

Sense.LEXUNIT: separate the men from the boys
Sense.DEF: to show clearly which people are brave, strong, or skilled, and which are not
Sense.TRAN: 区分出强者与弱者﹔分出高下

Sense.LEXUNIT: separate the sheep from the goats

Variant.LEXVAR: separate the wheat from the chaff

Sense.DEF: to separate the good things from the bad things
Sense.TRAN: 区分好的和坏的﹔区别优劣

Section.SECHEADING: TO MAKE SOMETHING SEPARATE 使某物分开

Exponent.DEF: to divide something into two or more parts or groups, or to divide one type of thing from another. You use separate especially when saying that the parts are different from each other.
Exponent.TRAN: 把…分成〔若干部分或若干类﹔尤指各部分之间存在差异〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Motorola is planning to separate the company into two public companies.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 摩托罗拉打算把公司分成两家上市公司。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The items are separated into recyclable and non-recyclable waste.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些物品被分成可回收和不可回收垃圾。

Exponent.DEF: to make something become two or more parts or groups
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The teacher divided us into groups.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师把我们分成几个小组。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The money was divided between them.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱他们俩分了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The house is divided into three apartments.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢房子分成三个套间。

Exponent.DEF: to separate something into two or more groups, parts etc – used especially when each part is equal in size
Exponent.TRAN: 把…分成〔若干部分﹔尤指平分〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The class was split into groups of six.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 全班按六人一组分成几个小组。

Exponent.DEF: to separate something into several smaller parts, especially to make it easier to deal with
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤为了便于处理〕把…分解成若干较小部分
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The phone company was broken up to encourage competition.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话公司分拆成若干较小公司,以鼓励竞争。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Police used tear gas to break up the crowd.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方利用催泪瓦斯驱散人群。

Exponent.DEF: to separate one group of people from others because of race, sex, religion etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因为种族﹑性别﹑宗教等原因〕隔离
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Schools were racially segregated.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校实行种族隔离。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some prisons segregate prisoners who are infected with HIV.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些监狱对感染艾滋病的囚犯实行隔离。

Exponent.DEF: to divide into different parts, especially in a natural way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A watery liquid separates from the milk during cheesemaking.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在干酪制作过程中有一种水样液体从牛奶中分离出来。

Exponent.DEF: to separate into two or more parts or groups – used especially when each part is equal in size
Exponent.TRAN: 分裂,分开〔尤指各部分之间大小相同〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What happens when an atom splits?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 原子分裂会产生什么结果？

Exponent.DEF: to separate into several smaller parts
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In spring, the icebergs begin to break up.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 春天来了,冰山开始融化。

Sense.DEF: to divide a group of people or things into smaller groups
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must separate out these different factors and examine each one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须把这些不同的因素整理出来逐个进行研究。

Sense.DEF: to remove one type of thing or person from a group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many older people may prefer not to be separated out from the rest of the adult population.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多老人可能不喜欢别人把他们和其他的成年人口区别开来。

Sense.DEF: not living with your husband, wife, or sexual partner any more
Sense.TRAN: 〔夫妻〕分居的﹔〔性伴侣〕不再同居的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve been separated for six months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们分居已有六个月。

Sense.DEF: women’s clothing, such as skirts, shirts, and trousers, that can be worn in different combinations
Sense.TRAN: 〔可以任意配套穿的〕单件女服

Sense.DEF: when something separates or is separate
Sense.EXAMPLE: the separation of church and state
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政教分离

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the zone of separation between the warring factions
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 交战各方之间的隔离地带

Sense.DEF: a period of time that two or more people spend apart from each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: the separation of families during wartime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战时家庭的离散

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a husband and wife agree to live apart even though they are still married
Sense.EXAMPLE: their separation and later divorce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的分居及后来的离婚

Sense.DEF: someone who belongs to a group that wants to start a new country with its own government, by separating from the country that they belong to now
Sense.TRAN: 分离主义者﹐独立主义者

Sense.DEF: a machine for separating liquids from solids, or cream from milk
a dark reddish-brown colour
a photograph, picture etc, especially an old one, that is dark reddish-brown
a dark reddish-brown ink used for drawing

an infection in part of the body, in which
pus
is produced
the ninth month of the year, between August and October

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I haven’t heard from him since last September.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自去年9月起我就没有听到过他的消息了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My birthday’s in September.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的生日在9月份。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The meeting will be on September 6th.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次会议定于9月6日召开。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘When’s the concert?’ ‘On 6th September.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “音乐会是什么时候？”“9月6日。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They arrive September 6.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们9月6日到。

Sense.DEF: a group of seven singers or musicians who perform together
Sense.TRAN: 七重唱组合﹔七重奏组合

Sense.DEF: a piece of music written for seven performers

a wound or part of your body that is septic is infected with
bacteria
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cut that went septic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受感染的伤口

Sense.DEF: a serious condition in which infection spreads from a part of your body through your blood
a large container under the ground, for holding human waste from toilets
someone who is between 70 and 79 years old
sad, serious, and slightly frightening
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sepulchral voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低沉忧郁的嗓音

Sense.DEF: dark, empty, and slightly frightening
Sense.EXAMPLE: in the sepulchral gloom of the church
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在教堂阴沉昏暗的光线中

Sense.DEF: a small room or building in which the bodies of dead people were put
a book, film, play etc that continues the story of an earlier one, usually written or made by the same person
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Star Wars’ and its sequels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《星球大战》及其续集

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s writing a sequel to her first novel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在写她第一本小说的续篇。

Sense.DEF: an event that happens as a result of something that happened before
Sense.TRAN: 随之而来的事﹔后果﹔后续的事﹔余波
Sense.EXAMPLE: The immediate sequel was an armed uprising in several cities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直接的后果就是波及几个城市的武装暴动。

Sense.DEF: the order that something happens or exists in, or the order it is supposed to happen or exist in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The questions should be asked in a logical sequence .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该按逻辑顺序来提问。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Be careful to perform the actions in the correct sequence .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 注意要按正确的顺序来完成动作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Number them in sequence, 1,2,3 etc.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用1, 2, 3等依次给它们编号。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The chapters may be studied out of sequence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些章节可以不按顺序来阅读。

Sense.DEF: a series of related events, actions etc that happen or are done in a particular order

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s had a sequence of business failures.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他生意上遭遇了接二连三的失败。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the sequence of events leading up to the war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 导致这场战争的一连串事件

Sense.DEF: one part of a story, film etc that deals with a single subject or action
Sense.TRAN: 〔故事﹑电影等中描述同一主题或动作的〕一段情节﹔片段﹔连续镜头
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dream sequence in the film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片中的梦境片段

Sense.DEF: when things are arranged in an order, especially events or actions
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指事件或动作的〕先后安排﹐编排顺序

Sense.DEF: relating to or happening in a sequence
Sense.TRAN: 连续的﹔相继的﹔顺序的﹔序列的

Sense.DEF: to keep a person or a group of people away from other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jury were sequestered during the trial.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 审判期间﹐陪审团被隔离开来。

Sense.DEF: to sequestrate
a sequestered place is quiet and far away from people
to take property away from the person it belongs to because they have not paid their debts
a small shiny flat piece of metal, sewn onto clothes for decoration
Sense.TRAN: 〔装饰衣服用的〕闪光金属小圆片

Sense.DEF: a tree from the western US that can grow to be very tall

a plural of
serum

one of the
angels
that protect the seat of God, according to the Bible
Sense.TRAN: 撒拉弗〔《圣经》中守护上帝宝座的天使〕

Sense.DEF:
extremely beautiful or pure, like an
angel
a song sung to someone, especially one that a man performs for the woman he loves while standing below her window at night
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指男子晚上站在其意中人窗外唱或奏的〕小夜曲

Sense.DEF: a piece of gentle music
if you serenade someone, you sing or play music to them, especially to show them that you love them
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤为表爱慕之情而〕对…唱[奏]小夜曲

Sense.DEF: when interesting or valuable discoveries are made by accident
Sense.TRAN: 〔有趣或有价值事物的〕碰巧发现﹐机缘巧合

Sense.DEF: very calm or peaceful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The child’s face was serene and beautiful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这孩子的神情宁静可爱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a serene mountain lake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 静谧的山间湖泊

Sense.DEF: someone in the past who lived and worked on land that they did not own and who had to obey the owner of the land
the system of using serfs, or the state of being a serf
strong woollen cloth used for making suits, trousers etc
a low rank in the army, air force, police etc, or someone who has this rank
Sense.TRAN: 军士〔一种低级军阶〕﹔中士﹔〔警察的〕巡佐

Sense.DEF: a military rank
a story that is broadcast or printed in several separate parts on television, in a magazine etc
Sense.TRAN: 电视连续剧﹔〔杂志等上的〕连载小说
Sense.EXAMPLE: a television serial
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视连续剧
Sense.EXAMPLE: a six-part serial
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 六集连续剧[连载故事]

Sense.DEF: someone who commits the same crime several times
Sense.EXAMPLE: a serial rapist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 连续作案的强奸犯

Sense.DEF: crimes that are done in the same way several times
arranged or happening one after the other in the correct order
Sense.TRAN: 顺序排列的﹐连续的﹔一连串[系列]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep the questions in the same serial order .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让这些问题保持原来的顺序。

Sense.DEF: printed or broadcast in several separate parts
Sense.TRAN: 连载的﹔以连续剧形式播出的
Sense.EXAMPLE: cheap serial publications
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 廉价的系列出版物

Sense.DEF: to print or broadcast a story in several separate parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: His book was serialized in The New Yorker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的书在《纽约客》杂志上连载。

Sense.DEF: when someone has a series of sexual relationships, rather than one long relationship or several relationships at one time – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 系列单配偶生活关系﹐连续单配偶关系〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a number put on things that are produced in large quantities, so that each one has its own different number
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each computer has a serial number on it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每台电脑都有一个序列号。

Sense.DEF: several events or actions of a similar type that happen one after the other
Sense.TRAN: 连续发生的同类事件﹔一系列[连串]事件
Sense.EXAMPLE: the series of events that led to the outbreak of war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 导致战争爆发的一系列事件
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police are investigating a series of attacks in the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方在调查该地区发生的一连串袭击事件。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s been a whole series of accidents on this road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条路上发生了一连串的交通事故。

Sense.DEF: a group of events or actions that are planned to happen one after the other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This autumn the BBC will be showing a series of French films.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年秋季英国广播公司将播出一系列法国电影。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Staff will hold a series of meetings over the next few weeks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来的几周里﹐员工将召开一系列会议。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a summer lecture series
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暑期讲座系列

Sense.DEF: a set of television or radio programmes that have the same characters or deal with the same type of subject, and are usually broadcast every week or several times a week
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视﹑广播等的〕系列片﹐系列节目
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new comedy series
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的喜剧系列节目

Sense.DEF: several books, articles etc that deal with the same subject or tell stories about the same characters

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a series of articles on community care
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关社区关怀的系列文章

Sense.EXAMPLE: a science fiction series
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科幻小说系列

Sense.DEF: several things of the same kind

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a series of laws against discrimination
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对歧视的一系列法规
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The area is linked by a series of canals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一地区由几条运河连接起来。

Sense.DEF: a set of sports games played between the same two teams

GramExa.GLOSS: in baseball
in cricket

Sense.DEF: being connected so that electricity passes through the parts of something electrical in the correct order
a short flat line at the top or bottom of some printed letters
Sense.TRAN: 衬线〔某些印刷体字母顶部或底部的短线〕

Sense.DEF: a serious situation, problem, accident etc is extremely bad or dangerous
Sense.EXAMPLE: the serious problem of unemployment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严重的失业问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: Luckily, the damage was not serious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还好﹐损坏不算严重。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Serious crimes have increased dramatically.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重大犯罪案件大幅度增加了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a serious accident on the freeway
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高速公路上的一宗严重事故

Sense.EXAMPLE: Oil spills pose a serious threat to marine life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原油泄漏对海洋生物构成了严重威胁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president was in serious trouble .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统遇到大麻烦了。

Sense.DEF: important and needing a lot of thought or attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is a very serious matter .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是件很重要的事情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the serious business of earning a living
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谋生这种正经事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be quiet, Jim. This is serious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安静﹐吉姆﹐这事很重要。

Sense.DEF: if someone is serious about something they say or plan to do, they really mean it and are not joking or pretending
Sense.TRAN: 〔所说的话或打算做的事〕认真的﹐严肃的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His voice suddenly became more serious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的语气突然变得认真起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a serious article
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严肃的文章

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is she serious about giving up her job?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她要辞职是认真的吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: definitely not joking
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She sounded dead serious.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的语气绝对认真。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Marry Frank? You can’t be serious!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嫁给弗兰克？你不是认真的吧！

Sense.DEF: careful and thorough attention etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll give your suggestion serious consideration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会认真考虑你的建议。

Sense.DEF: someone who is serious is very quiet and sensible, and does not laugh and joke much
Sense.EXAMPLE: a serious student
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严肃的学生

Sense.DEF: slightly worried or unhappy
Sense.EXAMPLE: You look serious. What’s wrong?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看上去心事重重的﹐出了什么事？

Sense.DEF: a serious romantic relationship is likely to continue for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s serious – they’ve been seeing each other for six months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是认真的﹐他们约会已经有六个月了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you really serious about her?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对她的确是认真的吗？
认真交往的男友/女友

Sense.DEF: very interested in an activity or subject, and spending a lot of time doing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s become a serious golfer since he retired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他自从退休以后就很热衷打高尔夫球。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chris is a serious photographer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯是个热衷摄影的人。

Sense.DEF: very good and often expensive
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s got a serious car!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有一辆很棒的汽车！

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are talking about a large amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: In industry, you can earn serious money .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做产业能赚大钱。

Exponent.DEF: very bad – used about problems, accidents, illnesses, or crimes
Exponent.TRAN: 〔问题﹑事故﹑疾病或罪行〕严重的,重大的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Violent crime is a serious problem in and around the capital.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力犯罪是首都及其周边地区的一个重大问题。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The boy was taken to hospital with serious head injuries.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩头部严重受伤,被送往医院。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Fortunately, the damage to the car was not serious.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸运的是,车子损坏得并不厉害。

Exponent.DEF: very serious – used about problems, injuries, and illnesses
Exponent.TRAN: 〔问题﹑伤势或疾病〕非常严重的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He suffered severe injuries in a car crash.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一场车祸中受了重伤。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The problem became so severe that they had to bring water in from other countries.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 问题变得非常严重,他们只得从其他国家运水进来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: severe epilepsy
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 严重癫痫

Exponent.DEF: used about a situation that is very serious and worrying, especially because it is dangerous or seems likely to get worse
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A thick fog descended and I knew that we were in grave danger.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 浓雾突然降临,我便知道我们遇到了极大的危险。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The situation is grave – war now seems inevitable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 形势很严峻——战争现在似乎是不可避免了。

Exponent.DEF: used about an illness, problem, or situation that has become very serious or dangerous, and needs to be dealt with quickly
Exponent.TRAN: 〔疾病﹑问题或形势〕严重的﹔紧急的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was taken to the hospital suffering from acute appendicitis.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因为急性阑尾炎被送到了医院。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In San Diego, the shortage of skilled workers is acute.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在圣迭戈,熟练工人严重短缺。

Exponent.DEF: used about a situation or problem that is very serious or dangerous, especially because a lot of people need urgent help
Exponent.TRAN: 〔形势或问题〕危急的,极其严重的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The situation is desperate – people here need aid before the harsh winter sets in.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 形势非常危急——这里的人们在严冬来临之前就需要得到援助。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The hospital is full of people in desperate need of medical attention.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院里人满为患,都急需救治。

Exponent.DEF: used about a situation that is very serious and dangerous and might get worse suddenly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In 1991, the food supply situation became critical.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 1991年,食物供应形势严峻。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Eight people were killed and four are still in a critical condition.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 八人死亡,四人依然伤势严重。

Exponent.DEF: used about a situation, illness, or condition in which someone could die
Exponent.TRAN: 〔形势﹑疾病或状况〕危及生命的,威胁生命的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her child had a potentially life-threatening illness.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的孩子患了一种有潜在生命危险的疾病。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The situation was not life-threatening, but it was very worrying.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 形势不至于危及生命,但是非常令人担忧。

Exponent.EXP: be a matter of life and death
Exponent.DEF: to be extremely serious – used when a situation is very urgent or important
Exponent.EXAMPLE: For people living with HIV, getting the right treatment is literally a matter of life and death.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于艾滋病病毒携带者来说,能不能得到适当的治疗真是关乎生死的事。

Exponent.DEF: not joking or laughing, or not pretending
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His voice sounded serious.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他语气严肃。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They seem to be serious about their relationship.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的关系似乎是认真的。

Exponent.DEF: very serious because of an important or sad occasion or ceremony
Exponent.TRAN: 庄重的,严肃的〔因为在重要或伤心的场合或仪式上〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My father looked solemn, the way grown-ups look at funerals.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲一脸庄重,就是大人们在葬礼上的那种表情。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The judge read the verdict in a solemn voice.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官语气郑重地宣读了判决。

Exponent.DEF: quiet and very serious – used especially about the way people look when something important or worrying happens
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指面临重要或令人担心的事情时〕严肃的,凝重的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She consulted Doctor Staples and returned looking grave.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她找斯特普尔斯医生看过了,回来时一脸严肃。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He listened with a grave expression on his face.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一脸凝重地听着。

Exponent.DEF: sad, quiet, or serious because something unpleasant or worrying has happened or is going to happen
Exponent.TRAN: 因为已经发生或即将发生不好或令人担心的事〕忧郁的,严肃的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They sat in sombre silence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一言不发地坐着,气氛凝重。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The meeting began in a sombre mood.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议在严肃的气氛中开场。

Exponent.DEF: very serious and sincere – often used about someone who is young and not very experienced
Exponent.TRAN: 〔常指涉世不深的年轻人〕诚挚的,认真的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was a rather earnest-looking young man.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是一个相当诚恳的年轻人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: That’s wrong,’ she said, her voice sounding very earnest.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “那是不对的。”她说,语气非常认真。

Sense.DEF: very much or to a great degree

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Was she seriously hurt?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她伤得严重吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m seriously worried about Ben.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常担心本。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Something was seriously wrong .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出大问题了。

Subsense.DEF: in a way that is not joking, especially because something is important
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s time we talked seriously about our relationship.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们该认真谈一谈我们的关系了。

Subsense.DEF: used to show that what you say next is not a joke
Subsense.TRAN: 说正经的〔用于表示将要说的话并非开玩笑〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Seriously though , I think Toby likes you.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不过说正经的﹐我觉得托比喜欢你。

Sense.DEF: to believe that someone or something is worth your attention or respect
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a teacher, it’s important that the kids take you seriously.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当老师很重要的一点就是要让孩子们把你当回事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s only a joke – don’t take it seriously!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只是开个玩笑——别当真啊！

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone if they really mean what they have just said
Sense.TRAN: 真的？〔用于弄清对方的话是否当真〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘The job’s yours.’ ‘Seriously?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这份工作是你的了。”“真的吗？”

Sense.DEF: the quality of being serious

Subsense.DEF: used to show that what you say next is not a joke, especially because it is important
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In all seriousness, if Tom does resign, a lot of other people will start leaving too.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说正经的﹐如果汤姆真的辞职﹐其他许多人也会走的。

Subsense.DEF: in a way that is not joking
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Playing with Richie was the highlight of my musical career,’ said Sonny in all seriousness.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “和里奇同台演出是我音乐生涯中最重要的时刻。”桑尼很认真地说道。

Sense.DEF: a talk given as part of a Christian church service, usually on a religious or moral subject

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The vicar gave a sermon on charity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 牧师作了一次关于仁爱的布道。

Sense.DEF: a long talk in which someone tries to give you moral advice that you do not want – used to show disapproval
to give a lot of moral advice to someone when they do not want it – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔喋喋不休地〕训诫﹐说教〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a chemical in the body that helps carry messages from the brain and is believed to make you feel happy
a snake, especially a large one
winding like a snake
Sense.EXAMPLE: the serpentine course of the river
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜿蜒曲折的河道

Sense.DEF: complicated and difficult to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: a serpentine plot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曲折的情节

Sense.DEF:
a type of small green
chilli pepper
that is very hot
Sense.TRAN: 墨西哥辣椒〔一种很辣的绿色小辣椒〕

Sense.DEF: having a sharp edge made of a row of connected points like teeth
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use a knife with a serrated edge .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用带锯齿刃的刀。

Sense.DEF: standing or arranged closely together in rows
Sense.EXAMPLE: the serried ranks of reporters waiting outside
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 密密麻麻地排在外面等待的记者

Sense.DEF: a liquid containing substances that fight infection or poison, that is put into a sick person’s blood
the thin part of blood or the liquid from a plant
someone, especially in the past, who was paid to clean someone’s house, cook for them, answer the door etc, and who often lived in the house
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many young girls became domestic servants .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多年轻姑娘成了家仆。

Sense.DEF: someone who is controlled by someone or something – often used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某物的奴仆〔常含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are we the servants of computers?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们是电脑的奴隶吗？

Sense.DEF: to give someone food or drink, especially as part of a meal or in a restaurant, bar etc
Sense.TRAN: 提供﹐端上〔饭菜等〕﹔侍候〔某人进餐〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The waiter was serving another table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那名侍应生在接待另一桌客人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sprinkle with cheese and serve immediately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 撒上干酪立刻上桌。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Serve the soup with crusty bread.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用脆皮面包配这道汤。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Breakfast is served until 9 a.m.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 早餐供应到上午9点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Meals can be served to you in your room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 饭菜可以送到你房间里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Teacakes should be served hot with butter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 茶点饼要趁热和黄油一起端上。

Sense.DEF: if food serves two, three etc, there is enough for that number of people
Sense.TRAN: 〔食品〕足够两人/三人/四人等吃

Sense.DEF: to help the customers in a shop, especially by bringing them the things that they want
Sense.TRAN: 接待（顾客）〔尤指为顾客取来所需之物〕﹐为（顾客）服务
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was only one girl serving customers .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有一个女孩在接待顾客。

Sense.DEF: to be useful or helpful for a particular purpose or reason

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sofa had to serve as a bed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只好拿沙发当床用了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The reforms served as a model for the rest of the Communist world.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些改革成为其他共产主义国家的范例。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A large cardboard box will serve the purpose .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个大纸板箱就解决问题了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her talent for organization should serve her well .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的组织才能应该对她很有帮助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: research projects that serve the needs of industry
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对工业有用的研究项目

Sense.DEF: to spend a period of time doing useful work or official duties for an organization, country, important person etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lord Herbert served as ambassador to France.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 赫伯特勋爵任驻法国大使。

GramExa.PROPFORM: serve in the army/air force/navy etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He returned to Greece to serve in the army.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他回到希腊服兵役。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ann serves on various local committees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安在当地的多个委员会里任职。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the women who served their country in the war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争中为国效力的妇女们

Sense.DEF: to have a particular effect or result

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her death should serve as a warning to other young people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的死对于其他年轻人应该是个警戒。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A single example serves to illustrate what I mean.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只需一个例子便可说明我的意思。

Sense.DEF: to provide an area or a group of people with something that is necessary or useful
Sense.TRAN: 为…提供服务﹐满足…的需要
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paris is served by two airports.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴黎有两个机场提供服务。

Sense.DEF: to spend a particular period of time in prison
Sense.EXAMPLE: He served an 18-month sentence for theft.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因盗窃罪服刑18个月。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you know that Les is serving time is in prison ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道莱斯在坐牢吗？

Sense.DEF:
to start playing in a game such as tennis or
volleyball
by throwing the ball up in the air and hitting it over the net
used to say that you think someone deserves something unpleasant that happens to them, because they have been stupid or unkind
Sense.TRAN: 某人活该﹐某人罪有应得
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘She kicked me!’ ‘Serves you right, teasing her like that.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她踢我！”“你活该﹐谁叫你这么取笑她。”

Sense.DEF: to learn a job or skill by working for a particular period of time for someone who has a lot of experience
to officially send or give someone a written order to appear in a court of law
Sense.TRAN: 发传票/令状等〔传某人出庭〕

Sense.DEF: to complete a particular period of time in prison or doing a job
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dillon’s almost served out his sentence in prison .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狄龙快服完刑了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Senator’s illness means he may not serve out his term .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位参议员的病意味着他有可能无法完成他的任期。

Sense.DEF: to put food onto plates
Sense.TRAN: 分发﹐分配〔食物到各人盘子里〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Serve out the rice, will you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你来给大家盛饭﹐好吗？

Sense.DEF: to give food to someone as part of a meal
Sense.EXAMPLE: What are you serving up tonight?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天晚上你给大家吃什么？

Sense.DEF:
the action in a game such as tennis or
volleyball
when you throw the ball in the air and hit it over the net

Subsense.DEF: the main computer on a network, which controls all the others
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The server’s down not working again.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主机又坏了。

Subsense.DEF: one of the computers on a network that provides a special service

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All data is stored on a central file server.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有数据资料都储存在中央文件服务器里。

Sense.DEF:
the player who hits the ball to begin a game in tennis,
volleyball
etc
a special spoon for putting a particular type of food onto a plate
Sense.EXAMPLE: salad servers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 色拉叉匙

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to bring you your food in a restaurant
Sense.TRAN: 〔餐馆里为顾客上菜的〕侍者﹐服务员

Sense.DEF: an office which has a large amount of computer equipment holding all the software and information for websites
the part of a restaurant where you get food to take back to your table
Sense.TRAN: 〔餐厅里摆放做好的食物供客人自己选取的〕供餐处﹐取餐处

Sense.DEF: the official system for providing something, especially something that everyone in a country needs to have, or the official organization that provides it
Sense.TRAN: 〔官方机构提供的〕公共服务系统﹐公共服务﹔公共事业机构
Sense.EXAMPLE: the health service
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗保健服务
Sense.EXAMPLE: the postal service
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邮政服务
Sense.EXAMPLE: the police service
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察部门
Sense.EXAMPLE: the prison service
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 监狱系统
Sense.EXAMPLE: Workers in the emergency services the police, hospital, and the fire service are forbidden from striking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧急服务机构的工作人员是禁止罢工的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There has been a decline in public services in recent years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近年来公共服务减少了。

EXAMPLE.GLOSS: the police, hospitals, fire service, and organizations that provide basic things such as water, gas, or electricity

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基础服务部门

Sense.DEF: a particular type of help or work that is provided by a business to customers, but not one that involves producing goods
Sense.EXAMPLE: A wide range of financial services are available.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有种类繁多的金融服务。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Datapost offers a delivery service to over 160 countries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 数据邮政公司的递送服务覆盖160多个国家。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our aim is to provide the best service at the lowest price.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的目标是以最低的价格提供最佳的服务。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the supply of goods and services
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 商品和服务的提供

Sense.DEF: the help that people who work in a shop, restaurant, bar etc give you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The service was terrible and so was the food.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 服务很差﹐饭菜也差。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At our bank we insist on high standards of customer service .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们银行坚持高质量的客户服务。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Service is included in your bill the charge for paying the people who serve you is included .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的账单里包含了服务费。

Sense.DEF: the work that someone does for a person or organization, especially over a long period
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指长期为个人或机构所做的〕工作﹐服务

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Brian retired after 25 years of service to the company.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布赖恩为公司服务25年后退休了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a long service award
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长期服务奖
Sense.EXAMPLE: a career in public service work done for the public or the government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在公共部门工作的职业

GramExa.GLOSS: all the good work you have done for someone or something
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 为某人/某事做出的贡献
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He received an award for services to sport.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获得了一个体育贡献奖。

Sense.DEF: skilled work or advice from a particular type of worker who you use to help you do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lydia obtained the services of a qualified nurse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉迪娅有一名合格的护士为她提供服务。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you offer your services as a tennis coach?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不去当网球教练呢？

Sense.DEF: something that ordinary people can be asked to do as a public duty or as a punishment
Sense.TRAN: 担任陪审员的义务/兵役/社区服务等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her attacker was sentenced to 120 hours’ community service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 袭击她的那个人被判为社区服务120小时。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about whether a piece of equipment, a vehicle etc is available to be used, or how long it can be used
Sense.TRAN: 〔设备﹑车辆等的〕使用﹐使用状况

GramExa.GLOSS: being used or available to be used
GramExa.EXAMPLE: These trains have been in service for many years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些火车已经使用很多年了。

GramExa.GLOSS: not being used or not available to be used
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The escalator is out of service.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自动扶梯暂停使用。

GramExa.GLOSS: work well and last a long time
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 提供良好/出色等的服务
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Steel tools give good service for years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 钢质工具能使用许多年。

Sense.DEF: a formal religious ceremony, especially in church
Sense.TRAN: 宗教仪式﹐〔尤指教堂的〕礼拜

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The service was held in the chapel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 仪式在小礼拜堂举行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a memorial service for the disaster victims
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为罹难者举行的追悼仪式

Sense.DEF: a country’s military forces, especially considered as a job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Maybe you should join the services.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许你应该去参军。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Her son is in the services .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她儿子在服兵役。

Sense.DEF: help that you give to someone

GramExa.GLOSS: be available to help someone, or for someone to use
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My secretary is at your service.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的秘书随时为你效劳。

GramExa.GLOSS: help someone
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can I be of any service?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能帮得上忙吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: do something that will help someone
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He did her a service by telling her the truth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把真相告诉了她﹐这帮了她的忙。

Sense.DEF: an examination and repair of a machine or car to keep it working properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m getting the bus home – my car’s in for a service .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要坐公共汽车回家——我的汽车送去检修了。

Sense.DEF: an act of hitting a ball through the air in order to start a game, especially in tennis
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s your service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该你发球了。

Sense.DEF:
a place near a
motorway
where you can stop and have a meal or drink, or buy food, petrol etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: How far is it to the next services?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到下一个服务站还有多远？

Sense.DEF: a set of plates, bowls, cups etc that match each other
a regular journey made by a bus, train, boat etc to a particular place at a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: the 8:15 service to Cambridge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 8点15分开往剑桥的班次

Sense.DEF: to be working or start working as a servant in someone’s house, especially in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指旧时在别人家里〕做佣人/当仆人

Sense.DEF: when someone is given a legal document telling them that they must do something or that something is going to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: the service of a summons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传票的送达

Sense.DEF: for work you have done or help you have given
Sense.EXAMPLE: payment for services rendered
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 服务酬劳

Sense.DEF: if someone services a machine or vehicle, they examine it and do what is needed to keep it working well
Sense.TRAN: 检修﹐维修﹐保养〔机器或车辆〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m having the car serviced next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下星期我要把车送去检修。

Sense.DEF: to provide people with something they need or want
Sense.EXAMPLE: schools that service local communities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为本地社区服务的学校

Sense.DEF:
to pay the
interest
on a debt
ready or able to be used
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of these old tools are still serviceable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些旧工具有些仍可使用。

Sense.DEF:
a place on a
motorway
where you can stop for petrol, food, toilets etc
an amount of money that is added to a bill in a restaurant as an extra charge for the service of the waiters
Sense.TRAN: 〔加在餐馆账单上的〕服务费﹐小费

Sense.DEF:
an amount of money paid to the owner of a block of
flats
for services such as cleaning the stairs
an amount of money that is added to the price of something in order to pay for the services that you use when buying it
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a service charge for advance tickets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提前订票要付服务费。

Sense.DEF:
a national organization made of smaller local groups in which members do things to help their
community
an industry that provides a service rather than a product, for example insurance or advertising
a man who is a member of the military
a place at the side of the road where you can stop to buy petrol, food, and other goods
Sense.TRAN: 〔路边供应汽油﹑食品等的〕服务站

Sense.DEF: a woman who is a member of the military
when a machine or vehicle is examined and things are done to keep it working well
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器或车辆的〕检修﹐维修﹐保养
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new model is quieter, needs less servicing, and is more fuel-efficient.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新型号噪声更小﹐保养周期更长﹐而且更节省燃油。

Sense.DEF:
a
napkin
very eager to obey someone because you want to please them – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 过分屈从的﹐卑躬屈膝的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a servile attitude
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卑躬屈膝的态度

Sense.DEF:
relating to
slaves
or to being a slave
an amount of food that is enough for one person
Sense.EXAMPLE: This should make enough for four servings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些应该够四个人吃的。

Sense.DEF: a spoon, dish etc that is used to serve food
Sense.TRAN: 分菜用的勺/盛食物的盘子等

Sense.DEF:
the condition of being a
slave
or being forced to obey someone else
a part of a machine which passes on or increases a force or movement
Sense.TRAN: 伺服系统﹐伺服动力传动装置
Sense.EXAMPLE: servo-assisted brakes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伺服辅助车装置

Sense.DEF: a tropical plant grown for its seeds and oil and used in cooking
a period of time used for a particular activity, especially by a group of people
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指一批人参加某项活动的〕一段时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: a training session for teachers about computers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给教师上的一节电脑培训课
Sense.EXAMPLE: question-and-answer sessions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 问答时间

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a session of group therapy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一段集体心理治疗时间

Sense.DEF: a formal meeting or group of meetings, especially of a law court or parliament
Sense.TRAN: 正式会议﹔〔法院的〕开庭﹔〔议会的〕会议

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the first televised session of parliament
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首次电视直播的议会会议

GramExa.GLOSS: meeting
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The court is now in session.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭现在开庭。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Board members met in closed session with nobody else present .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会成员举行了闭门会议。

Sense.DEF: a part of the year when classes are given at a college or university
to carefully put something down somewhere

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She set the tray down on a table next to his bed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把盘子放在他床边的桌子上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mark filled the pan and set it on the stove.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克把平底锅装满后放到火炉上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The workmen set the box down carefully on the floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们把箱子小心地放到地上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Remove the mushrooms and set them aside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把蘑菇挑出来放到一旁。

Sense.DEF: to put something into a surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gates should be hung on sturdy posts set well into the ground.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大门应该装在结实的柱子上﹐柱子要牢牢地植入地里。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be set into the wall/floor/ceiling etc
GramExa.GLOSS: be built into the surface of something so that it does not stick out
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 嵌入墙里/地板里/天花板里等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an alarm button set into the wall beside the door
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 嵌在门边墙里的警报器按钮

Sense.DEF: if a film, play, story etc is set in a particular place or period, the action takes place there or then

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The novel is set in France.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部小说以法国为背景。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All this romance is set against a backdrop of rural Irish life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个爱情故事以爱尔兰的乡村生活为背景。

Sense.DEF: to consider something in relation to other things
Sense.TRAN: 与…作对比﹐把…放在一起考虑

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These casualty totals have to be set against the continuing growth in traffic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些伤亡总人数要和交通流量的持续增加作对比。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This debate should be set in an international context .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场辩论应该放在国际大背景下来看。

Sense.DEF: to establish a way of doing something that is then copied or regarded as good

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Art and literature flourished and this set the pattern for the whole of Europe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艺术和文学兴盛了﹐这为整个欧洲树立了典范。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Prime Minister’s fierce speech set the tone for the rest of the conference.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相激烈的言辞为接下来的会议定下了基调。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It is important that parents set an example behave well .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母以身作则是很重要的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The outcome of the case will set a legal precedent .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此案的判决结果将在法律上开创一个先例。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His photographs set the standard for landscapes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的照片为风景照树立了标准。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Freud’s views on sexuality set the agenda for much of the century people paid attention to the subjects he dealt with .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗洛伊德对性问题的观点成了大半个世纪的话题。

Sense.DEF: to make something start happening or to make someone start doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A study by military experts was immediately set in motion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军事专家立即开始进行研究。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The chief executive will set in train the process of finding a successor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总经理将着手寻找接班人。

GramExa.PROPFORM: set sth on fire/alight/ablaze(also 又作 set fire to sth)
GramExa.GLOSS: make something start burning
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Protesters set fire to two buses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 抗议者放火焚烧了两辆公共汽车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her last remark has set me thinking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她最后那句话引起了我的深思。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wind set the trees rustling.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 风吹动树叶沙沙作响。

Sense.DEF: to decide and state when something will happen, how much something should cost, what should be done etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government has still not set a date for the election.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府仍未确定大选的日期。

Sense.EXAMPLE: International companies set the price of oil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跨国公司决定石油价格。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: high standards of hygiene set by the Department of Health
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卫生部制定的严格的卫生标准

Sense.DEF: to start doing something in a determined way, or to tell someone to start doing something
Sense.TRAN: 〔坚决地〕开始做﹔使〔某人〕开始做

GramExa.PROPFORM: set to work to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They set to work to paint the outside of the building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们开始粉刷大楼的外墙。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s about to set to work on a second book.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打算开始写第二本书。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boys were set to work collecting firewood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩子们被打发去拾柴火。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rocard set himself to reform public sector industry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗卡尔开始着手改革国营工业部门。

Sense.DEF: to move a switch on a machine, clock etc so that it will start or stop working at the time you want, or in the way you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you set the alarm ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把闹钟设定好了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Remember to set the video to record the film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别忘了把录像机设定好录下这部影片。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Usually, the heating is set on ‘low’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一般暖气设备都定在“低”挡。

Sense.DEF: to become hard and solid
Sense.EXAMPLE: How long does it take for the glue to set?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胶水凝结需要多长时间？

Sense.DEF: when the sun sets, it moves down in the sky and disappears
to say what you or someone else will or must try to achieve
Sense.TRAN: 给某人定下目标[布置任务]/向某人提出挑战
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s best to set realistic goals that you can achieve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好是订立切实可行的目标。
