Sense.EXAMPLE: He set himself the task of learning Japanese.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给自己规定了学日语的任务。

Sense.DEF: to want very much to have or achieve something, or to be determined to do something
Sense.TRAN: 一心想/决心要得到[做]某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ellen has completely set her heart on that house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃伦一心要得到那幢房子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He set his sights on crossing the Pacific by balloon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他决心要乘热气球横渡太平洋。

Sense.DEF: to achieve the best result in a sport, competition etc that has ever been achieved, by running fastest, jumping highest etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Kenyan runner set a new Olympic Record in the 3,000 metres.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位肯尼亚选手创下了3,000米赛跑的奥运会新纪录。

Sense.DEF: to arrange plates, knives, cups etc on a table so that it is ready for a meal

Subsense.DEF: to make a trap ready to catch an animal
to invent a plan to try and catch someone who is doing something wrong
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They decided to set a trap for him by leaving him in charge.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们决定给他设个圈套﹐让他来掌管。

Sense.DEF: to allow a person or an animal to be free
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the other hostages were finally set free.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他人质最后全都被释放了。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone the right way to do something or the true facts about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I set him right on a few points of procedure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我帮助他纠正了几个程序上的问题。

Sense.DEF: if your face or mouth sets into a particular expression, you start to have an angry, sad, unfriendly etc expression

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His mouth set into a rather grim line.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他嘴角紧绷﹐一副严肃的表情。

Sense.DEF: to move your lower jaw forward in a way that shows your determination

Subsense.DEF: if a doctor sets a broken bone, he or she moves it into position so that the bone can grow together again
if a broken bone sets, it joins together again

Sense.DEF: to give a student in your class a piece of work to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr Biggs has set us a 2,000-word essay.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比格斯先生给我们布置了一篇2,000字的作文。

Sense.DEF: to write the questions for an examination
Sense.EXAMPLE: The head teacher sets the questions for the English exam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 校长给英语考试出题目。

Sense.DEF: to arrange the words and letters of a book, newspaper etc so it is ready to be printed
Sense.EXAMPLE: In those days, books had to be set by hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时候的书只能靠手工排版。

Sense.DEF: to arrange someone’s hair while it is wet so that it has a particular style when it dries
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某人的湿头发〕梳理成某种发型﹐做〔头发〕

Sense.DEF: to start doing or dealing with something, especially something that needs a lot of time and effort
Sense.TRAN: 着手做〔尤指费时费力的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A team of volunteers set about the task with determination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一批志愿者毅然开始了这项任务。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How do senior managers set about making these decisions?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高级经理是怎么着手作这些决定的？

Sense.DEF: to attack someone by hitting and kicking them
Sense.EXAMPLE: They set about him with their fists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们挥拳殴打他。

Sense.DEF: to make someone start to fight or quarrel with another person, especially a person who they had friendly relations with before
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bitter civil war set brother against brother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激烈的内战使兄弟反目成仇。

Sense.DEF: to decide that you are opposed to doing or having something
Sense.TRAN: 坚决反对（做）某事﹐坚决不参加某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s set herself against going to university.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决意不上大学。

Sense.DEF: to officially record the money you have spent on something connected with your job, in order to reduce the amount of tax you have to pay
if a quality sets someone or something apart, it makes them different from or better than other people or things
Sense.TRAN: 使与众不同﹐使优于〔其他人或物〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Man’s ability to reason sets him apart from other animals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人的推理能力使其有别于其他动物。

Sense.DEF: to keep something, especially a particular time, for a special purpose
Sense.TRAN: 留出﹐拨出〔作某种用途﹐尤指在某个时间〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Traditionally, these days were set apart for prayer and fasting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统上﹐这几天是专门用于祷告和斋戒的。

Sense.DEF: to keep something, especially money, time, or a particular area, for a special purpose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Try to set aside some time each day for exercise.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每天设法留出点时间来进行锻炼。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a room that had been set aside for visitors
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 留给客人用的一个房间

Sense.DEF: to decide not to consider a particular feeling or thing because something else is more important
Sense.TRAN: 暂不考虑﹐不顾﹔对…置之不理
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both sides agreed to set aside the question of independence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方同意把独立的问题置不提。

Sense.DEF: to officially state that a previous legal decision or agreement no longer has any effect
Sense.TRAN: 宣布〔以前的判决或协议〕无效﹐撤销﹐驳回
Sense.EXAMPLE: The judge set aside the verdict of the lower court.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官宣布下级法院的判决无效。

Sense.DEF: if a farmer sets aside land, he or she agrees not to grow any crops on it, and accepts a payment from the government for this
Sense.TRAN: 〔农民同意接受政府的补贴而〕闲置〔农田〕﹐不耕种作物

Sense.DEF: to delay the progress or development of something, or delay someone from finishing something
Sense.TRAN: 延缓〔某事的进展〕﹔阻碍〔某人完成某事〕﹔拖…后腿
Sense.EXAMPLE: Environmental experts said the move would set back further research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境专家说这一举动将阻碍进一步的研究。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Illness had set me back a couple of weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场病耽误了我好几个星期的时间。

Sense.DEF: to cost someone a lot of money
Sense.TRAN: 使破费﹐使花费〔大笔金钱〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This jacket set me back over £1,000.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件夹克花掉了我1,000多英镑。

Sense.DEF: to write about something so that you have a record of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wanted to set my feelings down on paper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想把我的感想写下来。

Sense.DEF: to state how something should be done in an official document or set of rules
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clear guidelines have been set down for teachers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为教师制定了明确的准则。

Sense.DEF: to stop a car, bus etc and allow someone to get out
Sense.EXAMPLE: The driver set her down at the station.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 司机在车站停车让她下去。

Sense.DEF: to explain ideas, facts, or opinions in a clearly organized way in writing or in a speech
Sense.TRAN: 〔书面或口头〕陈述﹐阐明〔观点等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He set forth an idealistic view of society.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他提出了一种理想主义的社会观。

Sense.DEF: to begin a journey
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were about to set forth on a voyage into the unknown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们即将启程远航去探索那个未知世界。

Sense.DEF: if something sets in, especially something unpleasant, it begins and seems likely to continue for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Winter seems to be setting in early this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年的冬天好像来得早。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Further economic decline set in during the 1930s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪30年代出现了进一步的经济衰退。

Sense.DEF: to start to go somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll set off early to avoid the traffic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要早些出发避开交通拥堵。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jerry and I set off on foot for the beach.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和杰里步行前往沙滩。

Sense.DEF: to make something start happening, especially when you do not intend to do so
Sense.TRAN: 引起﹐激发〔尤指意外事件〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: News that the claims might be true set off widespread panic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种说法可能属实的消息引起了普遍的恐慌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hong Kong’s stock market fell, setting off a global financial crisis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香港股市下跌﹐引发了一场全球性的金融危机。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often say that something triggers a particular reaction or event, rather than sets it off , because it sounds more formal.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中,人们说某事引发某种反应或事件时,经常用trigger,而不用set off,因为trigger听上去更加正式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: This could trigger a global financial crisis.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这可能会引发一场全球性的金融危机。

Sense.DEF:
to make an
alarm
start ringing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smoke from a cigarette will not normally set off a smoke alarm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香烟的烟雾一般不会触发烟雾警报器。

Sense.DEF: to make a bomb explode, or cause an explosion
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any movement could have set off the bomb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何动静都可能引爆这颗炸弹。

Sense.DEF: if a piece of clothing, colour, decoration etc sets something off, it makes it look attractive
Sense.TRAN: 衬托某物﹔使某物显得更漂亮
Sense.EXAMPLE: The blue sundress set off her long blonde hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蓝色的太阳裙把她那金色的长发衬托得更加美丽。

Sense.DEF: to make someone start laughing, crying, or talking about something
Sense.TRAN: 激起某人的某种情感〔指引起某人发笑﹑哭泣﹑谈论某事等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t mention what happened – you’ll only set her off again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别提发生的事了——你这样只会让她又哭起来。

Sense.DEF: to officially record the money you have spent on something connected with your job, in order to reduce the amount of tax you have to pay
Sense.TRAN: 把某事物计入账里抵税
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some expenses can be set off against tax.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些开支可以入账抵税。

Sense.DEF: to make people or animals attack someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The farmer threatened to set his dogs on us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那农民威胁说要放狗来咬我们。

Sense.DEF: if you are set on by people or animals, you are suddenly attacked by them
Sense.EXAMPLE: A thirty-five-year-old man was set on by four youths last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名35岁男子昨晚突然遭到四个年轻人袭击。

Sense.DEF: to give someone information about a person who you think has done something wrong, because you want that person to be found and caught
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I refuse, he’ll set the police onto me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我拒绝﹐他就要向警方告发我。

Sense.DEF: to start a journey, especially a long journey

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kate set out for the house on the other side of the bay.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特动身前往位于海湾另一边的房子。

GramExa.PROPFORM: set out on a journey/drive/voyage etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The band are setting out on a European tour in March.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队将于3月份出发去欧洲巡回演出。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something or making plans to do something in order to achieve a particular result
Sense.TRAN: 〔为达到某个结果而〕开始做某事﹐着手进行

GramExa.EXAMPLE: salesmen who deliberately set out to defraud customers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有意欺骗顾客的销售员

GramExa.PROPFORM: set out with the idea/purpose/intention etc of doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They set out with the aim of becoming the number one team in the league.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一心想成为联盟中最强的球队。

Sense.DEF: to explain ideas, facts, or opinions in a clearly organized way, in writing or in a speech
Sense.TRAN: 〔清楚而系统地用书面或口头方式〕陈述﹐阐明
Sense.EXAMPLE: He set out the reasons for his decision in his report.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在报告中他陈述了作出这个决定的理由。

Sense.DEF: to put a group of things down and arrange them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The market traders began setting out their displays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场上的商贩开始摆出自己的商品。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something, especially something new, difficult, or important
Sense.TRAN: 开始做某事〔尤指新的﹑困难的或重要的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My nephew is just setting out on a career in journalism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的侄子刚刚开始从事新闻工作。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something eagerly and with determination
Sense.EXAMPLE: If we all set to, we’ll finish the job in half an hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们都努力干﹐就可以在半小时内完成这项工作。

Sense.DEF: to start a company, organization, committee etc
Sense.TRAN: 建立﹐成立﹐创立〔公司﹑机构﹑委员会等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They want to set up their own import-export business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想要成立自己的进出口公司。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: new regulations for setting up political parties
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 成立政党的新规定

GramExa.GLOSS: start your own business
GramExa.EXAMPLE: John decided to set up as a graphic designer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰决定自己开业做平面造型设计师。

GramExa.PROPFORM: set up shop/set up in business
GramExa.GLOSS: begin operating a business
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Now Betterware plans to set up shop elsewhere in Europe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在Betterware公司计划在欧洲的其他地方开分店。

Sense.DEF: to make the arrangements that are necessary for something to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll set up an appointment for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来为你安排约见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a lot of work involved in setting up the festival.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 筹备节庆活动要做大量的工作。

Sense.DEF: to prepare the equipment that will be needed for an activity so that it is ready to be used
Sense.EXAMPLE: The next band was already setting up on the other stage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一支乐队已经开始在另一个舞台布置设备了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can someone set the overhead projector up?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人能把投影仪调试好吗？

Sense.DEF: to place or build something somewhere, especially something that is not permanent
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve set up roadblocks around the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在城里各处设置了路障。

Sense.DEF: to trick someone in order to achieve what you want, especially to make it appear that they have done something wrong or illegal
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cox claimed that the police had tried to set him up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考克斯声称警方试图诬陷他。

Sense.DEF: to provide someone with money that they need, especially in order to start a business
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为帮助某人做生意〕资助某人﹐经济上帮助某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: After he qualified as a doctor, his mother set him up in a practice of his own.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他取得医生资格后﹐他母亲资助他自己开业行医。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Selling her share of the company has set her up for life .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卖掉了持有的公司股份后﹐她的钱一辈子都用不完了。

Sense.DEF: to make you feel healthy and full of energy
Sense.TRAN: 使某人觉得健康﹐使某人精力旺盛
Sense.EXAMPLE: A good breakfast will set you up for the day .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早餐吃得好一整天都会精力充沛。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately make people believe that you have the authority and skill to do something, especially when this is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: politicians who set themselves up as moral authorities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把自己装成道德权威的政客

Sense.DEF: to put someone in a position in which they are able to do something, or in which something is likely to happen to them
Sense.TRAN: 使某人处于某种位置﹐把某人置于某种境地

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If he won the fight, it would set him up for a title shot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果打赢这场拳赛﹐他就有机会问鼎冠军宝座。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anyone with public duties sets themselves up for attack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何担任公职的人都有可能招致批评。

Sense.DEF: to arrange for two people to meet, because you think they might start a romantic relationship
Sense.TRAN: 介绍﹐安排〔两个异性〕认识
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How did you meet Nick?’ ‘A friend set us up.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你是怎么认识尼克的？”“一个朋友介绍的。”

Sense.DEF: to get your own home, furniture etc, especially when you leave your parents’ home to live with a wife, husband, or partner
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指离开父母〕成家﹐过独立生活
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many parents try to help their children set up home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多父母都会设法帮助子女建立自己的家庭。

Sense.DEF: to start making a loud unpleasant noise
Sense.TRAN: 发出喧闹声/嘈杂声/吵闹声等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party guests were setting up a steady din.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 派对上的来宾乱哄哄地吵闹起来。

Sense.DEF: a group of similar things that belong together or are related in some way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a set of tools
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套工具
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We face a new set of problems.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们面临一系列新的问题。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The older generation have a different set of values.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老一辈人有一套不同的价值观。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a chess set
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一副国际象棋

Sense.DEF: a television, or a piece of equipment for receiving radio signals
Sense.EXAMPLE: a colour television set
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一台彩色电视机

Sense.DEF: a place where a film or television programme is filmed
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影或电视节目的〕拍摄场地﹐片场﹐摄影场

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cruise met Kidman on the set of ‘Days of Thunder’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克鲁斯在《雷霆壮志》的片场认识了基德曼。

Sense.DEF: the scenery, furniture etc used on a stage in a play or in the place where a film or television show is being made
Sense.TRAN: 布景﹐场景〔如自然景色﹑家具布置等〕

Sense.DEF:
one part of a game such as tennis or
volleyball
Sense.TRAN: 〔网球等的〕一盘﹔〔排球等的〕一局
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nadal won the second set 6 - 4.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳达尔以6比4赢了第二盘。

Sense.DEF: a group of people who are similar in some way and spend time together socially
Sense.EXAMPLE: a favourite meeting place of the smart set rich and fashionable people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时髦人物最喜欢的聚会场所
Sense.EXAMPLE: Val got in with a wild set at college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瓦尔在大学里结交了一帮放荡的人。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the set of sb’s face/jaw/shoulders etc
Sense.DEF: the expression on your face or the way you hold your body, which tells people how you are feeling
Sense.TRAN: 某人脸部的表情/下巴的姿势/肩膀的姿势等

GramExa.EXAMPLE: From the set of her shoulders, it was clear that Sue was exhausted.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从肩膀的姿势来看﹐休显然是筋疲力尽了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the hard set of his face
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脸上生硬的表情

Sense.DEF:
a performance by a singer, band, or
disc jockey
Sense.TRAN: 〔歌手﹑乐队或音乐节目主持人的〕连续表演
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sasha performed a three-hour set.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨莎连续唱了三个小时。

Sense.DEF:
a group of numbers, shapes etc in
mathematics
Sense.EXAMPLE: The set (x, y) has two members.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: （x, y）这个集里有两个项。

Sense.DEF: a group of children who are taught a particular school subject together because they have the same level of ability in that subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔在某个科目上水平相当因而一同上课的〕一班学生

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Adam’s in the top set for maths.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚当在数学优等班上课。

Sense.DEF: a small onion that you plant in order to grow bigger ones
Sense.EXAMPLE: onion sets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洋葱球茎

Sense.DEF: being in the position that is mentioned

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a medieval village set high on a hill
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高踞一处山丘上的一个中世纪村落
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a big house set back from the road
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座远离公路的大房子

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is in front of a particular background, especially in a way that is attractive

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a small town of white buildings, set against a background of hills
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 白色建筑物组成的一座小镇﹐背景是连绵的山峦
GramExa.EXAMPLE: pink petals set against dark green foliage
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 深绿色叶子衬托的粉红色花瓣

Sense.DEF: a set amount, time etc is fixed and is never changed
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were paid a set amount each week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每周领取一笔固定的工资。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The evening meal is served at a set time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚饭在固定时间供应。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Small children like a set routine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子喜欢固定的生活规律。

Sense.DEF: someone who is set for something is ready for it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you all set for the trip?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次旅行你们都准备好了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was just set to go when the phone rang.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正准备走的时候电话铃就响了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Get set get ready for a night of excitement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 准备好好乐一个晚上吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: On your marks – get set – go said to start a race .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各就各位——预备——跑。

Sense.DEF: determined about something
Sense.TRAN: 一心想/决心要/坚决反对（做）某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nina’s set on going to the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼娜铁了心要去参加这次派对。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government’s dead set completely determined against the plan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府坚决反对这个计划。

Sense.DEF: not likely to change
Sense.EXAMPLE: People had very set ideas about how to bring up children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们对养育孩子有根深蒂固的看法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark was 65 and rather set in his ways habits .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克65岁﹐生活习惯相当固定。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have your heart/sights set on sth
Sense.DEF: to want to do something very much, or to be aiming to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s got her heart set on going to France this summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她下了决心要在今年夏天去法国。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don has his sights set on a career in law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唐拿定主意要从事法律工作。

Sense.DEF: likely to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weather is set to change.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气可能要变。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This issue is set to cause some embarrassment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题很可能会引起尴尬。

Sense.DEF: eyes whose position is deep in the face, far apart on the face, or close together on the face
Sense.TRAN: 深陷的眼窝/分得很开的眼睛/靠得很近的眼睛

Sense.DEF: to be decorated with jewels
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gold bracelet set with rubies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个镶有红宝石的金手镯

Sense.DEF: a set meal in a restaurant has a fixed price and a more limited choice than usual
Sense.TRAN: 〔价格固定﹑菜式选择有限的〕套餐

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hotel does a very good set menu.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店提供非常出色的套餐。

Sense.DEF: a book that must be studied for an examination
if your face is set, it has a fixed expression on it, especially one that is angry, worried etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stared at her, his face set.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他沉着脸盯住她看。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kate’s face was set in a grim expression.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特一脸凝重。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Damn you,’ he said through set teeth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “去你妈的。”他咬牙切齿地说。

Sense.DEF: an arrangement in the European Union in which a government pays farmers to leave some of their fields empty, in order to avoid producing too much of a crop and to keep the price higher
Sense.TRAN: 休耕措施〔欧盟采取的一项措施﹐由政府给农民补贴让他们闲置部分农田﹐以防止某一作物产量过多﹐维持该作物较高的价格〕

Sense.DEF: an arrangement in the US in which a local government helps small businesses to develop by making financial help available to them
Sense.TRAN: 小企业补贴〔美国地方政府帮助小企业发展的一种补贴〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: In 1976, Connecticut established one of the nation’s first set-aside programs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1976年﹐康涅狄格州制订了美国最早的小企业补贴计划之一。

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that is kept so that it can be used for a special purpose
a problem that delays or prevents progress, or makes things worse than they were

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The December elections were a major setback for the party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 12月的大选是这个政党的一个重大挫折。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The team’s hopes of playing in Europe suffered a setback last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队赴欧洲参加比赛的希望昨晚遇到了阻碍。

Sense.DEF: part of a play, piece of music, painting etc that follows a well-known formal pattern or style, and is often very impressive
Sense.TRAN: 〔戏剧﹑音乐等中〕有固定模式的精彩片段﹔〔绘画中的〕有固定模式的精彩部分
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trial scene is a classic set piece.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 庭审这一场是个经典片段。

Sense.DEF:
a move such as a
free kick
or a
corner
in a game of football,
hockey
etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔足球﹑曲棍球等中的〕攻防套路

Sense.DEF: a flat piece of plastic or metal with three sides and one angle of 90˚, used for drawing or testing angles
Sense.TRAN: 〔绘图和测量直角用的〕三角板

Sense.DEF:
a passage in the ground made by a
badger
as a place to live
a long comfortable seat with a back and usually with arms, for more than one person to sit on
a long-haired dog often trained to help hunters find where animals or birds are
Sense.TRAN: 塞特猎犬﹐蹲伏猎狗〔一种长毛狗﹐常被训练帮助猎人寻找猎物〕

Sense.DEF: someone who does things that other people admire and try to copy
Sense.TRAN: 风格倡导者/潮流倡导者/标准制定者等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liz has always been a fashion-setter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利兹一直是时尚的引领者。

Sense.DEF: someone who decides or organizes something as part of a job
Sense.TRAN: 考试命题者/政策制定者等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who’s the question-setter for the quiz night?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁是问答比赛之夜的命题者？

Sense.DEF: the place where something is or where something happens, and the general environment

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an old farmhouse in a beautiful setting
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境优美的一座古老农舍

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cyprus is the perfect setting for a beach holiday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 塞浦路斯是海滨度假的绝佳去处。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve worked with children in various settings, mainly in secondary school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在许多地方教过孩子﹐主要是在中学。

Sense.DEF: the place or time where the events in a book, film etc happen
Sense.TRAN: 〔书﹑影片等中情节发生的〕背景

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Verona is best known as the setting for two of Shakespeare’s plays.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 维罗纳最出名的一点就是它是莎士比亚两部剧作的故事发生地。

Sense.EXAMPLE: London was used by Dickens as the setting for 'Oliver Twist'.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狄更斯把伦敦作为《雾都孤儿》的故事背景。

Sense.DEF: the position in which you put the controls on a machine or instrument
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器﹑仪器等调控装置的〕设定位置﹐调节点
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heating system was already on its highest setting .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 取暖系统已经调到了最高挡。

Sense.DEF: the metal that holds a stone in a piece of jewellery, or the way the stone is fixed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a diamond ring in a gold setting
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄金钻戒

Sense.DEF: music that is written to go with a poem, prayer etc
the time when the sun goes down
to end an argument or solve a disagreement
Sense.TRAN: 和解﹔结束〔争论〕﹔解决〔分歧〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rodman met with Kreeger to try and settle the dispute over his contract.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗德曼与克里格见了面﹐试图解决有关他合同的分歧。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We hope the factions will be able to settle their differences agree to stop arguing by peaceful means.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望各派系能以和平方式解决分歧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Forensic tests should settle the question of whether Bates was actually present at the scene of the crime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法医检验应该能够解决贝茨是否在犯罪现场的问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She finally settled with her former employers for an undisclosed sum.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后她和她以前的雇主以数目不详的一笔钱做了了结。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They might be willing to settle out of court come to an agreement without going to a court of law .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们或许会愿意庭外和解。

Sense.DEF: to decide what you are going to do, especially so that you can make definite arrangements
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nothing’s settled yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一切都还未定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s settled then. I’ll go back to the States in June.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那就这么定了﹐我六月份回美国。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘She’s only 15.’ ‘ That settles it that is enough information for a definite decision to be made ! We’re not taking her with us!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她才15岁。”“那好﹐我们不带她去喽！”

Subsense.DEF: to go to a place where no people have lived permanently before and start to live there
Subsense.TRAN: 〔在以前无人居住过的地方〕殖民定居﹐移民定居
Subsense.EXAMPLE: This territory was settled in the mid-1850s by German immigrants.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这地区在19世纪50年代中期开始有德国移民定居。

Subsense.DEF: to go to live in a new place, and stay there for a long time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many Jewish people settled in the Lower East Side.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多犹太人在（纽约曼哈顿）下东区定居。

Sense.DEF: to put yourself or someone else in a comfortable position

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Donna did not dare settle herself too comfortably into her seat, in case she fell asleep.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 唐娜不敢在椅子里坐得太舒服﹐她怕会睡着。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The dog settled on the grass to enjoy its bone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条狗舒舒服服地在草地上享受骨头的美味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A nurse settled the old man into a chair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名护士帮助这位老人坐到椅子上。

Sense.DEF: to become quiet and calm, or to make someone quiet and calm
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the children had settled, Miss Brown gave out the new reading books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们静下来后﹐布朗小姐给他们发新的故事书。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She breathed deeply to settle her nerves stop herself from feeling worried or frightened .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她深深地吸了口气平静自己的情绪。

Subsense.DEF: if dust, snow etc settles, it comes down and stays in one place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Snow settled on the roofs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雪花飘落到房顶上。

Subsense.DEF: if a bird, insect etc settles, it flies down and rests on something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A fly kept trying to settle on his face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只苍蝇老是想停到他脸上。

Subsense.DEF: if something such as a building or the ground settles, it sinks slowly to a lower level
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The crack in the wall is caused by the ground settling.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙上的裂缝是由地面沉降造成的。

Sense.DEF: to pay money that is owed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I always settle my account in full each month.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总是每月都把我的账全部结清。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: These insurance companies take forever to settle a claim.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些保险公司要拖很久才支付索赔款项。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was able to settle with his creditors, and avoid going to jail.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向债主还清欠款﹐避免了一场牢狱之灾。

Sense.DEF: to deal with all the details of a business or of someone’s money or property, so that nothing further needs to be done
Sense.TRAN: 处理﹐结算〔业务﹑钱或财物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: When it is finally settled, the Marshall estate may be worth no more than $100,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后处理完毕后﹐马歇尔庄园的价值可能不会超过10万美元。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After her husband’s death, Jackie went to the city to settle his affairs .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丈夫去世后﹐杰姬进城去料理后事。

Sense.DEF: to do something to hurt or cause trouble for someone because they have harmed or offended you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did he have any enemies – someone with an old score to settle ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是不是有什么仇人——和他结有宿怨的人？

Sense.DEF: if your eyes settle on something or someone, you notice them and look at them for a period of time
Sense.TRAN: 某人的目光停留在某人/某物上
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her gaze settled on a door, and she wondered what was on the other side of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的目光停留在一扇门上﹐心里在想﹐门的那一边会是什么呢？

Sense.DEF: written if a quality or feeling settles over a place or person, it begins and has a strong effect

GramExa.EXAMPLE: An uneasy silence settled over the room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里弥漫着一种令人不安的寂静。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Depression settled over her like a heavy black cloud.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 忧郁情绪就像一片沉重的乌云笼罩在她的心头。

Sense.DEF: written if a particular expression settles on your face, it stays there
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种表情在脸上〕固定下来﹐凝固
Sense.EXAMPLE: A disapproving frown settled on her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不悦地皱起了眉头。

Sense.DEF: if your stomach settles, or if something settles it, it stops feeling uncomfortable or making you sick
Sense.EXAMPLE: Georgia had taken pills to settle her stomach, but she was still throwing up every hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治娅已经吃了药来缓解胃部不适﹐但还是每小时吐一次。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: let the dust settle/wait for the dust to settle

Sense.DEF: to lean back in a bed or chair, and relax and enjoy yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vera settled back to enjoy the film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维拉舒服地坐着看电影。

Sense.DEF: to become quiet and calm, or to make someone quiet and calm
Sense.TRAN: （使某人）安静下来﹐（使某人）停止讲话
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shh! Settle down please! Now turn to page 57.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘘！请别讲话！现在把书翻到57页。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When Kyle was a baby, we used to take him for rides in the car to settle him down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯尔还是个小宝宝的时候﹐我们经常开车带他出去兜风让他安静。

Sense.DEF: to start living a quiet and calm life in one place, especially when you get married
Sense.TRAN: 安顿下来﹐安定下来〔尤指结婚〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’d like to see their daughter settle down, get married, and have kids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们希望女儿安顿下来﹐结婚成家﹐生儿育女。

Sense.DEF: to start giving all of your attention to a job or activity
Sense.TRAN: 开始专心于〔工作或活动〕﹐着手认真做〔某事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I sorted out my mail, then settled down to some serious work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把邮件整理好﹐然后定下心来做一些重要的事情。

Sense.DEF: if a situation settles down, it becomes calmer and you are less busy or less worried
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s been really hectic here. When things settle down , I’ll give you a call.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里乱哄哄的﹐等忙完了我会给你打电话。

Sense.DEF: to accept something even though it is not the best, or not what you really want
Sense.EXAMPLE: They want $2,500 for it, but they might settle for $2,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想卖2,500美元﹐但2,000美元他们可能也会接受。

Sense.DEF: to begin to feel happy and relaxed in a new situation, home, job, or school
Sense.TRAN: 适应﹐习惯〔新情况﹑新家﹑新工作或新学校〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How’s your new home? Are you settling in OK?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的新家怎么样？你习惯了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: It takes a few months to settle into life at college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 适应大学生活需要几个月时间。

Sense.DEF: to decide or agree on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They haven’t settled on a name for the baby yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们尚未决定给宝宝取什么名字。

Sense.DEF: to make a formal arrangement to give money or property to someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔正式安排〕把〔金钱或财产〕赠与某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: She settled a small yearly sum on each of her children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她每年给她每个子女一小笔钱。

Sense.DEF: to pay what you owe on an account or bill
Sense.EXAMPLE: We settled up and checked out of the hotel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们结清账﹐办了退房手续。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll settle up with the bartender, then let’s go.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去和酒保结账﹐然后我们就走。

Sense.DEF: remaining the same, and not likely to change
Sense.TRAN: 不大可能改变的﹐固定的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was tired of moving around and longed for a more settled existence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对搬来搬去已经感到厌烦了﹐很想过一种比较安定的生活。

Sense.DEF: if you feel settled, you feel comfortable about your life, your job etc, because you have been living or working somewhere a long time and you like the place, people, company etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔因长时间在某地生活或工作而〕感到自在的﹐习惯的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I still don’t feel settled in my job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对自己的工作还没有一种安定下来的感觉。

Sense.DEF: if the weather is settled, it is dry and not likely to change
an official agreement or decision that ends an argument, a court case, or a fight, or the action of making an agreement
Sense.EXAMPLE: Union leaders and company bosses will meet tomorrow in an attempt to reach a settlement .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会领导人和公司老板将于明天举行会议以期达成协议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His lawyers are understood to be negotiating a settlement .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说他的律师正在商谈一个协议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hopes grew that a workable peace settlement might emerge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达成一项可行的和平协定的希望越来越大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the search for a peaceful settlement of the Northern Ireland conflict
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 寻找和平解决北爱尔兰冲突的办法

Sense.EXAMPLE: She got her home as part of the divorce settlement .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据离婚协议﹐她拿到了房子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company paid out over $10 million in an out-of-court settlement .

Sense.DEF: when you pay all the money that you owe

Sense.DEF: the number 7

Sense.DEF: the number 17

Sense.DEF: coming after six other things in a series

Sense.EXAMPLE: her seventh birthday
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的七岁生日

Sense.DEF: to be extremely happy

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I’m planning to leave on the seventh the seventh day of the month .

Sense.DEF: one of seven equal parts of something
the number 70

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the early seventies, Sag Harbor was still a peaceful village.

Sense.DEF: to be aged between 70 and 79

Sense.DEF: if the temperature is in the seventies, it is between 70 degrees and 79 degrees

Sense.DEF: an old-fashioned record that plays while turning around 78 times a minute

Sense.DEF: to cut through something completely, separating it into two parts, or to become cut in this way

Sense.EXAMPLE: a severed rope

Sense.DEF: to end a relationship with someone, or a connection with something, especially because of a disagreement

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个国家断绝了外交关系。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had severed all contact with her ex-husband.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和前夫断绝了一切往来。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say cut off rather than sever .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说cut off﹐而不说sever
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The end of his finger had been cut off .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他手指被切断了一截。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The children's father had cut off all contact with them.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲和孩子们断绝了一切联系。

Sense.DEF: a number of people or things that is more than a few, but not a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: I visited him in Kansas several times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去堪萨斯州看过他几次。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several people have volunteered to go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个人自前往。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bill came to several hundred pounds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 账单高达好几百英镑。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Have you read any of his books?’ ‘Yes, several.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你读过他的什么书吗？”“读过几本。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several of her colleagues agreed with her decision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 同事中有几位同意她的决定。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to wait several more weeks before the results arrived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还要再等几个星期才能拿到结果。

Sense.DEF: different and separate

Sense.DEF: when you end your relationship or connection with another person, organization, country etc, especially because of a disagreement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the severance of diplomatic ties between the two countries
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国断绝外交关系

Sense.DEF: money or other things that you get when you have to leave a company because your employer no longer has a job for you

Sense.DEF: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场暴风雨造成了严重的破坏。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say an injury, a problem etc is serious rather than severe .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,说伤势﹑问题等严重用serious,而不用severe

F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的伤势非常严重。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幢相当简朴的红砖建筑

Sense.EXAMPLE: a plant that needs a lot of shade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喜阴植物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was sitting in the shade of a large oak tree.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐在一棵大橡树的树荫下。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The temperature was over 90 degrees in the shade.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 背阴处的气温超过90度。

Subsense.DEF: something you use to reduce or block light
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The shade on the lamp was slightly crooked.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灯罩稍有些歪。

Subsense.DEF: a covering that can be pulled down over a window

Sense.DEF: the dark places in a picture
Sense.EXAMPLE: strong contrasts of light and shade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明暗的强烈对比

Sense.DEF: a particular type of red, green, blue etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a bright shade of pink
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种艳粉色

Sense.DEF: a meaning etc that is slightly different from other ones
Sense.TRAN: 有细微差别的含义/意见/情感等
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is room in the Democratic party for many shades of opinion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主党能包容各种不同观点。

Sense.DEF: very slightly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Matt’s clothes were just a shade too big for me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马特的衣服我穿稍有点大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The results were a shade better than we expected.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 结果比我们预计的要稍好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was a shade under five feet tall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身高接近五英尺。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something reminds you of another person or thing
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某物的影子〔用于表示某人或某物让你想起另一个人或物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The food was horrible – shades of school dinners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食物太糟了——让人想起学校里的饭菜。

Sense.DEF: to be so good or impressive that other similar things or people seem much less important or interesting
Sense.TRAN: 使某人/某事物黯然失色
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re planning a festival that will put all the others in the shade.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在筹办一个要令所有其他类似活动都黯然失色的节庆活动。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have it made in the shade
Sense.DEF: to be extremely rich – used humorously
to protect something from direct light
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shading her eyes, Anita scanned the horizon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮塔手搭凉棚﹐眺望地平线。

Sense.DEF: to make part of a picture or drawing darker
Sense.EXAMPLE: She shaded in the circles in the last two letters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把最后两个字母的圈圈颜色涂深。

Sense.DEF: if one thing shades into another, it is difficult to know where one stops and another starts
Sense.TRAN: 渐渐与…分辨不清﹐逐渐变成
Sense.EXAMPLE: His impatience shaded into anger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他由不耐烦逐渐变成了愤怒。

Sense.DEF: the areas of a drawing or painting that have been made to look darker
slight differences
Sense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t understand the subtle shadings of legal language.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不理解法律语言中的细微差别。

Sense.DEF: the dark shape that someone or something makes on a surface when they are between that surface and the light
Sense.EXAMPLE: the long dark shadow of an old oak tree
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一棵老橡树长长的影子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was hot, and we decided to walk in the shadow of the wall along the wall, where its shadow would fall .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气很热﹐我们决定沿着墙的阴影走。

Sense.DEF: darkness caused by something preventing light from reaching a place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The room was half in shadow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房间有一半是暗的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the shadows, something moved.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阴影中﹐有个东西在移动。

Sense.DEF: the bad effect or influence that something has, which makes other things seem less enjoyable, attractive, or impressive

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For years, people had been living under the shadow of terrorism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们多年来一直生活在恐怖主义的阴影下。

GramExa.GLOSS: make something seem less enjoyable, attractive, or impressive
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The events of September 11th cast a shadow over the celebrations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “九一一”事件给庆典活动蒙上了一层阴影。

Sense.LEXUNIT: without/beyond a shadow of a doubt
Sense.DEF: used to say that something is definitely true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Without a shadow of a doubt, he’s the most talented player we have.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无疑问﹐他是我们最有天赋的球员。

Sense.DEF: if you are in someone’s shadow, they are much more famous and successful than you are
Sense.TRAN: 在某人的光环之下﹐在某人的盛名之下〔显得逊色〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kate grew up in the shadow of her film star sister.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特是在她当电影明星的姐姐的光环下长大的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be a shadow of your former self
Sense.DEF: to be weaker, less powerful, or worse than you were before
Sense.TRAN: 〔因身体虚弱﹑势力不如以前等而〕前后判若两人﹐前后天差地别
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lennox seemed like a shadow of his former self.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦诺克斯好像变了个人似的。

Sense.DEF: small dark areas under your eyes that you have when you are very tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked pale, with deep shadows under her eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看上去脸色苍白﹐有很深的黑眼圈。

Sense.DEF: someone who follows someone else everywhere they go
Sense.TRAN: 某人的影子﹐与某人形影不离的人

Sense.LEXUNIT: afraid/frightened/scared etc of your own shadow
Sense.DEF: easily frightened or very nervous
Sense.TRAN: 非常胆小﹐惊弓之鸟﹐草木皆兵

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make it appear
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The building cast a shadow across the narrow street.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 楼房在狭窄的街道上投下一道影子。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: appears on something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The footsteps came closer, and a shadow fell across the table.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 脚步声越来越近,然后有一个影子落在桌上。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: get longer, as it gets later in the day
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Already the shadows were lengthening.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 日影已越来越长。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She saw the dark shadow of a man in the doorway.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看见门口有个男人的黑影。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: flickering shadows
Candles cast strange flickering shadows on the wall.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 烛光在墙上投下摇曳的奇怪影子。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: shadows that move about quickly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Candles cast strange flickering shadows on the wall.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 烛光在墙上投下摇曳的奇怪影子。

Sense.DEF: to follow someone closely in order to watch what they are doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Detectives shadowed him for weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 侦探跟踪了他好几个星期。

Sense.DEF: to cover something with a shadow, or make it dark
Sense.EXAMPLE: a narrow street which was shadowed by a huge Catholic church
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被一个巨大的天主教堂的影子所笼罩的一条狭窄街道

Sense.DEF:
the politician in the main opposition party in the British parliament who would become
chancellor
etc if their party was in government, and who is responsible for speaking on the same subjects
Sense.TRAN: 影子财政大臣/外交大臣等〔指英国议会中主要反对党若执政时会成为财政大臣等的人〕

Sense.DEF: the group of politicians in the British parliament who would become ministers if their party was in government
Sense.TRAN: 影子内阁〔指英国议会中﹐若其政党执政则会成为部长的一群政治家〕

Sense.DEF:
fighting with an imaginary opponent, especially as training for
boxing
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指拳击训练时与假想对手进行的〕空拳攻防练习

Sense.DEF: business activities that are difficult for the authorities to find out about, for example because they are illegal
Sense.TRAN: 影子经济〔指政府很难发现的非法经济活动〕

Sense.DEF: mysterious and difficult to know anything about
Sense.EXAMPLE: the shadowy figures who control international terrorist organizations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 控制国际恐怖组织的神秘人物

Sense.DEF: full of shadows, or difficult to see because of shadows
Sense.TRAN: 多阴影的﹔幽暗的﹔模糊的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shadowy room
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幽暗的房间

Sense.DEF: protected from the sun or producing shade
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shady street
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 背阴的街道
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was nice and shady under the trees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树下好阴凉。

Sense.DEF: probably dishonest or illegal
Sense.TRAN: 可能不诚实的﹐可疑的﹔不正当的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shady character
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个鬼鬼祟祟的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s been involved in some shady deals .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她参与了一些不正当的事情。

Sense.DEF: a passage which goes down through a building or down into the ground, so that someone or something can get in or out

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a 300-foot elevator shaft
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个300英尺深的电梯井

Sense.DEF:
a long handle on a tool,
spear
etc
a narrow beam of light
a thin long piece of metal in an engine or machine, that turns and passes on power or movement to another part of the machine
Sense.EXAMPLE: a drive shaft
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 驱动轴

Sense.DEF: one of a pair of poles between which a horse is tied to pull a vehicle

an
arrow
to be treated very unfairly
Sense.TRAN: 受到亏待﹐遇到不公正对待

Sense.DEF: to treat someone very unfairly, especially by dishonestly getting money from them
Sense.TRAN: 不公正地对待〔尤指骗钱〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t believe you paid that much. You got shafted .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么给了那么多钱﹐你上当了。

Sense.DEF:
a
carpet
or
rug
with a rough surface made from long threads of wool
an act of having sex with someone
a large black sea bird

strong-tasting
tobacco
with thick leaves cut into small thin pieces
to have sex with someone
very tired
Sense.TRAN: 疲惫不堪的﹐精疲力竭的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not going – I’m too shagged!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不去——我累死了！

Sense.DEF: shaggy hair or fur is long and untidy
Sense.TRAN: 〔头发﹑皮毛〕又长又乱的﹐蓬乱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shaggy black beard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蓬乱的黑胡子

Sense.DEF: having shaggy hair
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shaggy sheepskin coat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长毛羊皮袄

Sense.DEF: a long joke that usually ends in a silly or disappointing way

another word for
shag 1
the title of the kings of Iran, used in the past
Sense.TRAN: 沙〔旧时伊朗国王的称号〕

Sense.DEF: to move suddenly from side to side or up and down, usually with a lot of force, or to make something or someone do this
Sense.TRAN: 〔上下或左右〕摇动﹐摇撼﹔（使）颤动
Sense.EXAMPLE: She shook him to wake him up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她摇摇他﹐想把他叫醒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shake the bottle before you open it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打开瓶子之前先摇一摇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole house started to shake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整幢房子摇晃起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car shook as it went over a bump.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车驶过一个隆起的地方时颠了一下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She shook the sand out of her shoes removed it by shaking .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把鞋里的沙子抖掉。

Sense.DEF: if someone shakes, or part of their body shakes, they make small sudden movements from side to side or up and down, especially because they are very frightened, cold, ill etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The little boy’s hand was shaking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这小男孩的手在发抖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I could see my neighbor shaking with laughter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到邻居笑得浑身直抖。

Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s wrong with you? You’re shaking like a leaf shaking a lot because you are very nervous or frightened .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么了？你浑身在哆嗦。

GramExa.GLOSS: be very nervous
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was shaking in my shoes – I thought he was going to fire me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我十分害怕﹐以为他要把我开除了。

Sense.DEF: to move your head from side to side as a way of saying no, or to show disapproval, surprise, or sadness
Sense.TRAN: 摇头〔表示否定﹑不赞成﹑惊讶或悲伤〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: When asked if he wanted anything else, he just shook his head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 问他是否要点别的﹐他只是摇了摇头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark shook his head in disbelief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克不相信地摇摇头。

Sense.LEXUNIT: shake sb’s hand/shake hands with sb
Sense.DEF: to move someone’s hand up and down with your own hand as a greeting or as a sign you have agreed something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He shook my hand warmly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他热情地和我握手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wilkins shook hands with him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威尔金斯和他握了握手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If we have a deal, let’s shake on it show that we have made an agreement by shaking hands .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们成交的话﹐就握手为定吧。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very upset or shocked
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kerrie was so shaken by the attack that she won’t go out alone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克丽被那次袭击吓得都不敢独自出门了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The murder shook the whole town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这桩谋杀案震惊了全镇。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel less confident, less sure about their beliefs etc
Sense.TRAN: 动摇某人的信心/信仰等
Sense.EXAMPLE: His confidence was badly shaken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的自信心受到很大的打击。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s voice is shaking, it is not steady and they sound very worried, angry, or frightened
Sense.TRAN: 某人〔因担心﹑愤怒或害怕而〕嗓音发颤
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her voice was shaking as she announced the news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她宣布这条消息的时候声音都在颤抖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Reg’s voice shook with rage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷吉气得声音都发抖了。

Sense.DEF: to show that you are angry by holding up and shaking your tightly closed hand
Sense.EXAMPLE: He shook his fist at the driver of the other car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对另一辆汽车的司机挥动拳头。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to hurry, or quickly start doing something
Sense.TRAN: 赶忙﹐赶紧﹐快点 用以催促别人开始做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: C’mon, shake a leg!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点﹐赶紧啦！

Sense.DEF: to get money from someone by using threats
Sense.EXAMPLE: Corrupt officials were shaking down local business owners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 腐败的官员对当地商家敲诈勒索。

Sense.DEF: to search a person or place thoroughly
if a new situation or arrangement shakes down, people start to get used to it and it becomes more effective
Sense.TRAN: 融入〔新环境〕﹐适应〔新安排〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The restructure has shaken down, and staff are showing a new sense of purpose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改组已经深入人心﹐员工们身上已展现出一种全新的使命感。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of an illness, problem etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t seem to shake off this cold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这感冒好像怎么也好不了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: shake off your image/reputation as sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Outside investment has helped Sheridan to shake off its image as a depressed industrial town.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 外来投资帮助谢里登摆脱了工业萧条城镇的形象。

Sense.DEF: to escape from someone who is chasing you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think we’ve shaken them off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们已经把他们甩掉了。

Sense.DEF: to shake a cloth, a bag, a sheet etc so that any small pieces of dirt, dust etc come off
Sense.EXAMPLE: He shook out the handkerchief and put it back in his pocket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抖了抖手帕﹐把它放回口袋里。

Sense.DEF: if an organization or industry shakes out, it becomes calmer after a difficult period of time
Sense.TRAN: 〔组织或企业经历困难期后〕稳定下来
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’ll look for bargains after the real estate market shakes out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等房地产市场稳定下来﹐他要去找找便宜的房子。

Sense.DEF: to change a situation by removing things from it that are not useful or that do not make a profit
Sense.TRAN: 把〔无用的或者不赚钱的部分〕抛弃﹐赶出市场
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the airline industry shakes out all but the very fittest, catering companies could face serious troubles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着航空业大幅度精简业务﹐餐饮公司可能会面临严重的困境。

Sense.DEF: to give someone a very unpleasant shock, so that they feel very upset and frightened
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was badly shaken up by the accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次事故把她吓坏了。

Sense.DEF: to make changes to an organization in order to make it more effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: the government’s plans to shake up the educational system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府改革教育体系的计划

Sense.DEF: if you give something a shake, you move it up and down or from side to side
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give the bottle a good shake before use.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用前要用力摇晃瓶子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He refused with a shake of the head a movement of the head from side to side to mean ‘no’ .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他摇摇头拒绝了。

Sense.DEF:
a cold drink made from milk,
ice cream
, and fruit or chocolate
Sense.TRAN: 奶昔〔一种用牛奶﹑冰激凌和水果或巧克力制成的饮料〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strawberry shake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯草莓奶昔

Sense.DEF: nervous shaking of your body caused by illness, fear, too much alcohol, not getting a drug you are dependent on etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔因生病﹑恐惧﹑喝酒过多或未能服用成瘾药物而引起的〕哆嗦
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I don’t smoke, I get the shakes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要是不吸烟就会浑身哆嗦。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in a couple of shakes/two shakes
Sense.DEF: very soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be back in two shakes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我马上回来。

Sense.DEF: not very skilful, or not very good
Sense.TRAN: 技术并不高明的﹔不大出色的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s no great shakes as a singer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为歌手﹐他水平不高。

Sense.DEF: to get or give someone fair treatment
Sense.TRAN: 得到/给予某人公平的待遇

Sense.DEF: when someone gets money from another person by using threats
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Mafia shakedown
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑手党敲诈

Sense.DEF: a thorough search of a place or a person
Sense.EXAMPLE: No weapons were found during the shakedown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次搜查没有发现武器。

Sense.DEF: a period of time when people start to get used to a new arrangement and it becomes more effective
Sense.TRAN: 〔人们对新安排的〕融入期﹐适应期

Sense.DEF: a period of time when prices are falling on a financial market
a final test of a boat, plane etc before it is put into general use
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new system is in its shakedown phase.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个新的系统正处于最后测试阶段。

Sense.DEF: the final situation, after a lot of other things have happened
Sense.TRAN: 〔许多事情发生后的〕最后的形势

Sense.DEF: upset, shocked, or frightened by something that has happened to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How’s Jacob?’ ‘Pretty shaken up, but he’ll be all right.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “雅各布怎么样？”“几乎吓坏了﹐不过他会没事的。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was badly shaken after the attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次袭击让他受惊不小。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which several companies fail because they cannot compete with stronger companies in difficult economic conditions
Sense.TRAN: 〔经济萧条时期小企业的〕被淘汰

Sense.DEF:
a
shakeup
a container with holes in the lid, used to shake salt, sugar etc onto food
Sense.EXAMPLE: a salt shaker
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盐瓶

Sense.DEF: a container in which drinks are mixed
a member of a US religious group who lived together and had a simple way of life. Shaker furniture is made in the plain, simple, and attractive style that Shakers used to make things
Sense.TRAN: 震颤派教徒〔震颤派是美国的一个教派﹐其教徒共同生活﹐生活方式很简朴﹔震颤派家具的风格朴实而简单〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Shaker chair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把震颤派家具风格的椅子

Sense.DEF:
a small container for shaking
dice
in the style of Shakespeare
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shakespearean language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莎士比亚风格的语言

Sense.DEF: relating to the work of Shakespeare
Sense.EXAMPLE: a famous Shakespearean actor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 著名的莎士比亚戏剧演员

Sense.DEF: a process by which an organization makes a lot of big changes in a short time to improve its effectiveness

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a big shakeup of the education system
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育制度的重大改革

Sense.DEF: weak and unsteady because of old age, illness, or shock
Sense.TRAN: 〔因年迈﹑疾病或惊吓而〕摇晃的﹐颤抖的﹐衰弱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shaky voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 颤抖的声音
Sense.EXAMPLE: Grandad was a little shaky on his feet not able to walk very well .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爷爷走路有点晃晃悠悠。

Sense.DEF: not sure about the exact details of something, or not likely to be completely right
Sense.TRAN: 不全面的﹔不完整的﹔没有把握的
Sense.EXAMPLE: My knowledge of history is a little shaky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的历史知识有点靠不住。
Sense.EXAMPLE: shaky evidence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可靠的证据

Sense.DEF: not firm or steady
Sense.EXAMPLE: shaky foundations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不牢固的基础

Sense.DEF: a smooth soft rock which breaks easily into thin flat pieces
used to make a suggestion, or ask a question that you want the other person to decide about
Sense.TRAN: …好吗？要不要…？〔用于提建议或要求他人作决定的问句中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shall I open the window?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要我开窗吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shall we say 6 o’clock, then?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么﹐我们就定在6点钟好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What shall I get for dinner?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚饭要我弄点什么？

Sense.DEF: used to say what you will do in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: We shall be away next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们下周要出去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I shall have to be careful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得当心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never liked her and I never shall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来都不喜欢她﹐以后也不会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We shall have finished by Friday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期五前我们就能完成了。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something will definitely happen, or that you are determined that something should happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The truth shall make you free.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真理必令你们得自由。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I said you could go, and so you shall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说了你可以去﹐你就一定可以去。

Sense.DEF: used in official documents to state an order, law, promise etc
Sense.TRAN: 应该﹐必须〔用于正式文件中﹐表示命令﹑法律﹑允诺等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: All payments shall be made in cash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有款项都必须以现金支付。

Sense.DEF: a vegetable like a small onion
measuring only a short distance from the top to the bottom
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shallow river
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浅河
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lake is quite shallow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这湖很浅。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the shallow end of the pool
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游泳池的浅水区
Sense.EXAMPLE: Place the meat in a shallow dish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把肉放在一个浅盘里。

Sense.DEF: not interested in or not showing any understanding of important or serious matters – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shallow argument
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肤浅的论点
Sense.EXAMPLE: If he’s only interested in your looks, that shows how shallow he is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他只是对你的外貌感兴趣﹐那说明他是多么浅薄。

Sense.DEF: breathing that takes in only small amounts of air
Sense.TRAN: 浅呼吸﹐微弱的呼吸〔只吸入少量空气〕

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He lay there unconscious, breathing shallowly .
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他躺在那里不省人事﹐呼吸微弱。

Sense.DEF: an area of shallow water
a Hebrew word used to say hello or goodbye
Sense.TRAN: 喂﹐你好﹔再见〔希伯来语﹐用来打招呼或道别〕

Sense.DEF: a phrase meaning ‘you shall’, used when talking to one person
loose trousers which are narrow at the bottom and a long loose shirt, worn by some South Asian women and, in some countries, men
Sense.TRAN: 收口宽松裤克米兹套装〔南亚妇女服饰﹐有些国家男子也穿〕

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is not what they are claimed to be – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 假冒者﹔假装﹐骗局〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The elections were a complete sham.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次大选完全是一场骗局。

Sense.DEF: when someone tries to make something or someone seem better than they really are
Sense.EXAMPLE: It all turned out to be sham and hypocrisy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一切原来都是虚情假意。

Sense.DEF:
a cover for a
pillow
, especially one used for decoration
made to appear real in order to deceive people
Sense.TRAN: 假的﹔仿制的﹔伪造的﹔冒充的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sham marriage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假结婚

Sense.DEF: to pretend to be upset, ill etc to gain sympathy or an advantage
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s not ill, she’s only shamming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没生病﹐只是在装病。

Sense.DEF:
a person in some tribes who is a religious leader and is believed to be able to talk to
spirits
and cure illnesses
to walk slowly and awkwardly, not lifting your feet much, for example because you are tired, weak, or lazy
Sense.TRAN: 〔因疲倦﹑虚弱或懒惰而〕拖着脚走﹐蹒跚而行

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The old man shambled out of the room muttering to himself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个老人蹒跚地走出房间﹐口中喃喃自语。

GramExa.GLOSS: a shambling way of walking

Subsense.DEF: if something is a shambles, it is very disorganized and there is a lot of confusion
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The meeting was a shambles from start to finish.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次会议从头到尾都开得一团糟。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The economy is in a complete shambles.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济混乱不堪。

Subsense.DEF: if a place is a shambles, it is very untidy
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My house is in an absolute shambles.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的房子里凌乱不堪。

Sense.DEF: very disorganized
Sense.EXAMPLE: the government’s shambolic efforts to deal with the crisis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府处理这场危机时毫无章法的努力

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’s a shame/what a shame etc
Sense.DEF: used when you wish a situation was different, and you feel sad or disappointed
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘She’s failed her test again.’ ‘What a shame!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她又没通过测验。”“真遗憾！”
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a shame that you have to leave so soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这么快就要走了﹐真遗憾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a shame we missed the wedding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们错过了这场婚礼﹐太可惜了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a shame about the weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气不好﹐真是遗憾。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is a shame to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a shame to cover this beautiful table with a tablecloth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这么漂亮的桌子用桌布盖起来真是可惜。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t imagine why they canceled your show, Tracy. That’s such a shame .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我搞不懂他们为什么把你的演出取消了﹐特蕾西。多可惜啊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was a crying shame that they lost the game.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们输了这场比赛真是太可惜了。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people usually say something is unfortunate rather than a shame .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中,人们一般说unfortunate,而不说a shame
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It’s unfortunate that these warnings were not taken seriously.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 真遗憾,这些警告没有得到重视。

Sense.DEF: the feeling you have when you feel guilty and embarrassed because you, or someone who is close to you, have done something wrong
Sense.TRAN: 〔因自己或亲近的人做错事感到的〕羞愧﹐羞耻﹐惭愧
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt a deep sense of shame.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他深深地感到羞愧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maria blushed with shame.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚羞得脸都红了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: To her shame it made her feel ashamed , she gained back all the weight she’d lost.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让她感到惭愧的是﹐她减掉的体重全又长回来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s brought shame on the whole family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他使全家蒙羞。

GramExa.GLOSS: look down, or feel like you should look down, because you feel so ashamed
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I bow my head in shame when I think of how I treated her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到我是如何对待她的﹐我就万分羞愧。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no shame in it should not make you feel ashamed saying ‘I don’t know’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说一句"我不知道”也没什么可难为情的。

Sense.DEF: the ability to feel shame
Sense.EXAMPLE: How could you do such a thing? Have you no shame ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么可以做这种事情？难道你没有羞耻心吗？

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone should feel guilty or embarrassed because of something they have done
Sense.TRAN: 你/他/他们等应该感到羞耻
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shame on you, Fred. I thought you were my friend!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗雷德﹐你真不害臊。我还把你当朋友呢！

Sense.DEF: to be so much better than someone or something else that it makes the other thing seem very bad or ordinary
Sense.TRAN: 使某人/某物黯然失色﹐使某人/某物相形见绌
Sense.EXAMPLE: His cooking puts mine to shame.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的厨艺让我自愧不如。

Exponent.DEF: the feeling you have when you feel guilty and embarrassed because you, or someone who is close to you, have done something wrong
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因自己或亲近的人做错事感到的〕羞愧,羞耻﹔惭愧
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She never overcame the shame of having abandoned her children.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她无法克服抛弃自己的孩子所带来的羞耻感。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Following the scandal, Garrison resigned in shame.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 丑闻发生后,加里森愧而辞职。

Exponent.DEF: a feeling of shame and embarrassment because you have been made to look weak or stupid in front of other people
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因人前出丑而感到的〕羞辱,屈辱
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What really upset me was the humiliation of having to ask her for money.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不得不开口问她要钱,这种耻辱实在让我懊恼。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He suffered the humiliation of defeat in the first round of the competition.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 首轮比赛就失利,让他蒙受了耻辱。

Exponent.DEF: the loss of other people’s respect because you have done something bad, or you have been unsuccessful
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His comments have brought shame and dishonour on him and his profession.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话令自己颜面扫地,也给他的同行丢了脸。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There is no dishonour in failure when you have done everything you possibly can to succeed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你已经竭尽所能,失败了也不可耻。

Exponent.DEF: the feeling that other people in society disapprove of you because of something that has happened to you, or because you feel different from most other people in some way – used especially when this seems unfair and unreasonable
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因不被认同或与众不同而产生的〕羞耻感,耻辱
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Even when someone has been found innocent of a crime, the stigma often remains.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个人即使已被证明无罪,羞耻感也往往会一直持续下去。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: At first Ifound the stigma of being unemployed very difficult to cope with.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 起初,我觉得很难克服失业的耻辱。

Exponent.DEF: a complete loss of people’s respect because you have done something very bad and shocking
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His actions brought disgrace on the family.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的行为给家人带来了耻辱。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The players were sent home in disgrace after admitting taking drugs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 球员承认吸毒之后被不光彩地遣送回家。

Exponent.DEF: a feeling of great shame and embarrassment because you have been made to look weak or stupid – a very formal use
Exponent.TRAN: 耻辱,丢脸〔为极正式的用法〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The team suffered the ignominy of losing five games in a row.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队蒙受奇耻大辱,连输五场比赛。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She hoped to avoid the ignominy of having to appear in court.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她希望能避免不得已出庭的耻辱。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel ashamed
Sense.EXAMPLE: It shames me to say it, but I lied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说出来真难为情﹐我撒谎了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt shamed and humiliated by the treatment he had received.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为自己受到如此对待感到蒙受了耻辱。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to do something by making them feel ashamed
Sense.TRAN: 使某人羞愧而不得不做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: His wife shamed him into handing the money back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的妻子令他羞愧得只好把钱交回去。

Sense.DEF: to be so much better than someone else that you make them seem bad or feel embarrassed
Sense.TRAN: 使黯然失色﹐使相形见绌
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their training record shamed other companies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的培训记录使其他公司相形见绌。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel they have lost all honour and respect
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had shamed her family name done something that made her family lose honour .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她玷污了家族的名声。

Sense.DEF: if someone is shamefaced, they look and feel ashamed because they have done something wrong or they have behaved badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Conner looked a little shamefaced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 康纳看上去略带愧色。

Sense.DEF: shameful behaviour or actions are so bad that someone should feel ashamed
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s shameful the way some people treat their pets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人如此对待自己的宠物﹐真 是可耻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shameful family secret
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家丑

Sense.DEF: not seeming to be ashamed of your bad behaviour although other people think you should be ashamed
Sense.TRAN: 无耻的﹐不知羞耻的﹐不要脸的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the shameless way he lied to us
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对我们恬不知耻的撒谎

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She shamelessly took advantage of him.

Sense.DEF:
a piece of
chamois
leather, used for cleaning or polishing
a liquid soap for washing your hair
Sense.EXAMPLE: What kind of shampoo do you use?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你用的是哪种洗发水？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bottle of shampoo
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一瓶香波

Sense.DEF: when someone washes your hair using shampoo
Sense.EXAMPLE: $21 for a shampoo, cut, and blow-dry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗﹑剪﹑吹共21美元

GramExa.GLOSS: when someone washes your hair and then dries it so that it has a particular style, especially using curlers

Sense.DEF:
a liquid used for cleaning
carpets
to wash something with shampoo
Sense.TRAN: 用洗发剂洗﹔用洗涤剂洗
Sense.EXAMPLE: She showered and shampooed her short dark hair .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她冲了淋浴﹐用洗发液洗了洗乌黑的短发。

Sense.DEF: a small plant with three green leaves on each stem, that is the national symbol of Ireland

a drink made of beer mixed with
lemonade 2
, or a glass of this drink
Sense.TRAN: （一杯）香蒂酒〔啤酒与柠檬水混合的饮料〕

Sense.DEF: to trick or force someone into doing something unwillingly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I got shanghaied into organizing the kids’ party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被逼着给孩子们办了聚会。

Sense.DEF: a distant beautiful imaginary place where everyone is happy. The name comes from the book Lost Horizon by James Hilton, about an imaginary valley in Tibet.
Sense.TRAN: 香格里拉〔想象中遥远的乐土﹐源自詹姆斯·希尔顿所著的《消失的地平线》﹐该书描写了位于西藏的一个想象中的山谷〕

Sense.DEF: a straight narrow part of a tool or object that connects the two ends
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hammer shank
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 榔头柄

Sense.DEF: a piece of meat cut from the leg of an animal
Sense.EXAMPLE: lamb shanks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几块羊腿肉

Sense.DEF:
the part of an animal’s or a person’s leg between the knee and
ankle
walking, rather than using a vehicle

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘shall not’
Sense.EXAMPLE: I shan’t see you again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不会再见你了。

Sense.DEF:
a small, roughly built hut made from thin sheets of wood,
tin
, plastic etc that very poor people live in
Sense.TRAN: 〔穷人居住的〕简陋小木屋﹐铁皮[塑料板]棚屋
Sense.EXAMPLE: Workers were living in tents and shanties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们住在帐篷和棚屋里。

Sense.DEF: a song sung by sailors in the past, as they did their work
Sense.TRAN: 〔昔日水手劳动时唱的〕号子﹐船夫号子﹐船歌

Sense.DEF:
a very poor area in or near a town where people live in small houses made from thin sheets of wood,
tin
etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔城镇或其附近的〕贫民区﹐棚户区

Sense.DEF:
the form that something has, for example round, square,
triangular
etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: What shape is the table?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那张桌子是什么形状的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can recognize a tree by the shape of its leaves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以根据树叶的形状辨认出是什么树。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dining room was square in shape.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 饭厅是正方形的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His battered old hat had completely lost its shape.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那顶破旧的帽子已经完全变形了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a silver pin in the shape of a large bird
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一枚大鸟形状的银胸针

Sense.EXAMPLE: The plants grow in every shape and size .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些植物有各种形状﹐各种大小。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children cut out shapes squares, triangles etc from the piece of cardboard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们把卡纸片剪成各种形状。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wheel had been bent out of shape.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个轮子弯曲变形了。

PIC.HEADING: SHAPES 形状
PIC.PICCONTENT: quadrilateral 四边形；trapezium BrE【英】/trapezoid AmE【美】；parallelogram 平行四边形；circle 圆形；pentagon 五边形；hexagon 六边形；rectangle 矩形；square 正方形；rhombus 菱形；octagon 八边形；triangle 三角形；pyramid 椎体；cylinder 圆柱体；sphere 球体；cube 立方体；cone 圆锥体；triangular prism 三棱柱

Subsense.DEF: in good, bad etc condition, or in good, bad etc health
Subsense.TRAN: 情况良好/不佳/糟糕等﹔健康状况良好/不佳/糟糕等
Subsense.EXAMPLE: For an old car, it’s in pretty good shape.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对一辆旧车来说﹐它的状况相当不错了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The economy is in worse shape now than it was last year.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在的经济状况比去年更糟。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Kaplan seemed to be in better shape than either of us.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡普兰的身体状况似乎比我们俩都好。

Subsense.DEF:
in a good or bad state of health or physical
fitness
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I was feeling totally out of shape.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到身体状况很不好。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got to get into shape before summer.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天到来之前我得让身体强健起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s bought an exercise bike to keep in shape.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她买了辆健身单车来锻炼身体。

Subsense.LEXUNIT: in no shape to do sth
Subsense.DEF: to be sick, tired, drunk etc, and not able to do something well
Subsense.TRAN: 〔因生病﹑疲劳﹑酒醉等原因而〕无法做某事﹐做不了某事
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Mel was in no shape to drive home after the party.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅尔在聚会结束后醉得无法开车回家。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something better so that they reach the necessary standard
Sense.TRAN: 把某人训练好﹔使某物达到标准
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of them lack experience, but we’ll soon knock them into shape.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有些人还缺乏经验﹐但我们很快就能让他们上手的。

Sense.DEF: the way something looks, works, or is organized

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Computers have completely changed the shape of our industry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机已经完全改变了我们的工业模式。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This new technique is the shape of things to come an example of the way things will develop in the future .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种新技术是未来的发展方向。

Sense.DEF: to develop into a clear and definite form
Sense.EXAMPLE: An idea was beginning to take shape in his mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个想法开始在他脑子里形成。

Sense.DEF: used to explain what something consists of
Sense.TRAN: 以…的形式〔用以解释某事物的组成〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Help came in the shape of a $10,000 loan from his parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他父母帮助他﹐借给他一万美元。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not in any shape or form

Variant.LEXVAR: not in any way, shape, or form

Sense.DEF: used to say that you will not accept something for any reason
Sense.TRAN: 不能以任何形式﹐不允许以任何方式
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will not tolerate racism in any shape or form.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决不能容忍任何形式的种族主义。

Sense.DEF: a thing or person that you cannot see clearly enough to recognize
Sense.TRAN: 〔物或人〕朦胧的形状﹐看不清的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: A dark shape moved behind them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个模糊的黑影在他们身后移动。

Sense.DEF: to influence something such as a belief, opinion etc and make it develop in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 形成〔某种信仰﹑看法等〕﹐影响〔某事物的发展等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: People’s political beliefs are shaped by what they see in the papers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们的政治观点受报纸的影响。

Sense.DEF: to make something have a particular shape, especially by pressing it
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过挤压等〕使成为某种形状﹐使成形

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shape the dough into small balls.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把面团搓成小圆球。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an L-shaped living room
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: L形起居室

Sense.DEF: to improve your behaviour or work
Sense.EXAMPLE: You kids had better shape up, because I’m in no mood to fool around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们这些孩子最好规矩点﹐我可不想浪费时间。

Sense.DEF: to make progress in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ken’s plans for the business are shaping up nicely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯为公司制订的计划进展良好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Immigration is shaping up as a major issue in the campaign.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 移民问题在此次竞选活动中逐渐成为一个重要的议题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s shaping up to be a pretty big party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 它逐渐发展为一个规模相当大的政党。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that if they do not improve, they will be made to leave a place or their job
not having a clear or definite shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shapeless dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 松松垮垮不成形的连衣裙

Sense.DEF: something such as a book or a plan that is shapeless does not seem to have a clear structure
Sense.TRAN: 〔书或计划之类〕结构凌乱的﹐条理不清楚的

Sense.DEF: having a body that has an attractive shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had long shapely legs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的双腿修长匀称。

Sense.DEF: a sharp piece of broken glass, metal etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a shard of pottery
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 陶器碎片

Sense.DEF: to have or use something with other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t have enough books so you’ll have to share.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们书不够﹐所以你们得合着用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The three of us shared a taxi.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们三个人合乘一辆计程车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have an office that I share with some other teachers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有一间和其他老师合用的办公室。

Sense.DEF: to let someone have or use something that belongs to you
Sense.TRAN: 和别人分享〔自己的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a kid he’d never share his toys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他小时候从不肯与人分享他的玩具。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Will you share your fries with me?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你肯让我也吃点你的炸薯条吗？

Sense.DEF: to divide something between two or more people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They shared the cake between them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把蛋糕分了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: At his death, his property was shared out between his children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他死后财产分给了子女们。

Sense.DEF: to have equal responsibility for doing something, paying for something etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We share the responsibility for the children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们共同承担照顾孩子的责任。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I own the house, but we share the bills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子是我的﹐但我们分摊账单。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We all share some of the blame for the accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这起事故我们都有一些责任。

Sense.DEF: to have the same opinion, quality, or experience as someone else
Sense.TRAN: 共同拥有〔某种看法﹑特质或经历〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Other parents share her belief in the importance of reading.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他父母和她看法一样﹐也认为阅读非常重要。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I believe my view is widely shared .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信我的观点为许多人所认同。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stubbornness was a characteristic he shared with his mother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 固执是他和他母亲共有的特征。

Sense.DEF: to tell other people about an idea, secret, problem etc
Sense.TRAN: 把〔想法﹑秘密﹑问题等〕向别人诉说
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students were able to share their experiences.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生相互之间能够交流经验。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you like to share your feelings with the group?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你意把自己的感受与组里的其他人分享吗？

Sense.DEF: if you share your life with someone, you spend your life together with them as their husband, wife etc
Sense.TRAN: 与某人共同生活﹐和某人结为夫妻
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not ready to share my life with anyone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没有准备好和谁共度此生。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you should share things fairly and equally between everyone
if you share in someone’s success, happiness etc, you have it or enjoy it with them
Sense.TRAN: 分享〔某人的成功﹑快乐等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: His daughters did not share in his happiness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的女儿们没有分享他的快乐。

Sense.DEF:
one of the equal parts into which the
ownership
of a company is divided

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve got shares in Allied Chemicals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有联合化工的股份。

Sense.DEF: the part of something that you own or are responsible for

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I gave them my share of the bill and left.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给了他们我该付的那份钱就走了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a share in the profits
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一份利润

Sense.EXAMPLE: I do my share do my part of the housework.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我做我那份家务活。

Subsense.DEF: if you have had your share of something, for example problems, success, or adventure, a lot of it has happened to you
Subsense.TRAN: 〔问题﹑成功或冒险经历〕相当多的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’ve sure had your share of problems, haven’t you?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你问题还真不少﹐是不是？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He’d had more than his fair share of adventure.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的冒险经历太多了。

Subsense.DEF: your share of something is the amount that you deserve to have
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry – you’ll get your fair share.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不用担心——你会得到应得的一份。

Sense.DEF: your part in an activity, event etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Employees are always given a share in decision-making.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇员一直有参与决策的权利。

Sense.DEF: when people live together in the same house or flat and pay the rent together

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A lot of the employees own shares in the company.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多雇员拥有公司股份。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I bought some shares in British Gas five years ago.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我5年前买了一些英国天然气的股份。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: This isn’t a good time to sell shares.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在不是卖股票的好时机。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: buy and sell shares as a business
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They make their money by trading in stocks and shares.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们靠买卖股票赚钱。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: their value increases
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company’s shares rose 5.5p to 103p.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司股票上涨5.5便士,到了103便士。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: their value decreases

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company’s share price has continued to go down.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司股价持续下跌。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government tried to encourage wider share ownership.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府试图鼓励分散股权。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: buying and selling shares as a business

Sense.DEF: a poor farmer who uses someone else’s land, and gives the owner part of the crop in return
Sense.TRAN: 收益分成的佃农〔耕种他人的土地﹐上交部分收成〕

Sense.DEF: someone who owns shares in a company or business
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shareholders have been told to expect an even lower result next year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股东们被告知明年的业绩还会更差。

Sense.DEF: if you have a shareholding in a business, you own shares in it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In 1992, United Distillers acquired a 75% shareholding in the company.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1992年﹐联合酿酒集团获得了这家公司75%的股权。

Sense.DEF:
an official and public list of
share
prices
when something, especially money or property, is divided between two or more people, or the amount each person receives when it is divided
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指钱或财产等的〕分配﹔分配额﹐份额

Sense.DEF:
free or cheap computer
software
, usually produced by small companies, that you can use for a short time before you decide whether to buy it
a system of religious laws followed by Muslims
a large sea fish with several rows of very sharp teeth that is considered to be dangerous to humans
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sharks were circling around our boat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲨鱼在我们的小船周围游弋。

GramExa.GLOSS: waters where there are a lot of sharks

Sense.DEF: someone who cheats other people out of money

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who uses their skill at pool or cards to cheat other players out of money
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 打落袋球/纸牌骗钱的人

Sense.DEF: having a very thin edge or point that can cut things easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure you use a good sharp knife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定要用锋利的好刀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Its teeth are razor sharp very sharp .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它的牙齿非常锋利。

Sense.DEF: a sharp turn or bend changes direction suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: We came to a sharp bend in the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们来到了急转弯路段。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Take a sharp left after the church.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了教堂后向左急转。

Sense.DEF: a sharp increase, rise, fall etc happens suddenly and is great in amount
Sense.TRAN: 〔增长﹑上涨﹑下跌等〕急剧的﹐猛烈的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sharp increase in prices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格的猛升
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sharp fall in unemployment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业人数的急剧下降

Sense.DEF: sharp differences are very big and very noticeable
Sense.EXAMPLE: sharp differences of opinion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观点的巨大分歧
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a sharp distinction between domestic and international politics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国内和国际政治之间有着明显的差别。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His honesty is in sharp contrast very different to some other politicians.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的诚实与其他的政治家形成了鲜明的对比。

Sense.DEF: a sharp pain or feeling is sudden and severe
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt a sharp pain in my back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉到背上一阵剧痛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was left with a sharp sense of disappointment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到深深的失望。

Sense.DEF: speaking in a way that shows you disapprove of something or are annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sharp rebuke
