Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严厉的斥责
Sense.EXAMPLE: John’s tone was sharp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰语气尖刻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boss can be very sharp with people when she’s busy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老板忙的时候说话会很尖刻。

GramExa.GLOSS: they speak in a very disapproving way which often upsets people

Sense.DEF: able to think and understand things very quickly, and not easily deceived
Sense.EXAMPLE: a journalist with an extremely sharp mind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头脑极其敏锐的新闻记者

Sense.LEXUNIT: keep a sharp eye on sb
Sense.DEF: to watch someone very carefully, especially because you do not trust them
Sense.TRAN: 密切注意某人〔尤指因对其不信任〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep a sharp eye on the kids at all times!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要一直睁大眼睛看住这些孩子！

Sense.DEF: having a very thin point that can draw an exact line
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure your pencils are sharp before we begin the test.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开始测验前﹐你们一定要把铅笔削尖。

Sense.DEF: a sharp sound or cry is loud, short, and sudden
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sharp cry of pain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 痛苦的尖叫声
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sharp intake of breath
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猛吸一口气

Sense.DEF: having a slightly bitter taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: sharp cheddar cheese
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 味道浓烈的切达干酪
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add mustard to give the dressing a sharper taste.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加些芥末使调料带点辛辣味。

Sense.DEF: attractive and fashionable
Sense.TRAN: 吸引人的﹐时髦的﹐入时的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tod looked really sharp in his tux.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托德穿无尾礼服看起来很时髦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sharp suit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时髦的套装

Sense.DEF: not rounded or curved
Sense.TRAN: 尖突的﹐有突边的﹐线条分明的
Sense.EXAMPLE: sharp features
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 棱角分明的五官
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her mother had a sharp little nose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她母亲长着一个尖尖的小鼻子。

Sense.DEF: if an image or picture is sharp, you can see all the details very clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The outlines of the trees were sharp and clear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些树轮廓清晰﹐枝条挺拔。

Sense.DEF: able to see and notice details very well

EXAMPLE.GLOSS: the ability to notice and deal with details

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对细节的敏锐观察力

Subsense.DEF:
a musical note that is sharp has been raised by one
semitone
from the note F, D, C etc

if music or singing is sharp, it is played or sung at a slightly higher
pitch
than it should be

Sense.DEF:
a very cold wind or a severe
frost
Sense.EXAMPLE: A sharp wind blew across the lake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵凛冽的寒风吹过湖面。

Sense.DEF: behaviour, especially in business, that is dishonest but not illegal
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指商业中〕合法但不诚实的行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been guilty of sharp practice in the past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以前干过不老实的勾当。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be on the sharp end (of sth)
Sense.DEF: to experience the worst effects of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were always on the sharp end of clients’ complaints.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 处理顾客投诉的压力总是由我们来承受。

Exponent.DEF: having a very thin edge or point that can cut things easily
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a sharp knife
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 锋利的小刀
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The dog’s teeth were very sharp.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条狗牙齿非常尖利。

Exponent.DEF: having an irregular edge with a lot of sharp points
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a jagged rock
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 嶙峋的怪石
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The floor was covered with jagged pieces of glass.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 满地都是尖利的玻璃碎片。

Exponent.DEF: having a lot of thin sharp points
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a spiky cactus plant
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一棵多刺的仙人掌科植物
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The hedgehog uses its spiky fur for protection.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 刺猬利用其多刺的皮毛保护自己。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some corals are quite smooth, others are sharp and spiky.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些珊瑚很光滑,其他的则尖利多刺。

Exponent.DEF: covered in a lot of small sharp points – used mainly about plants
Exponent.TRAN: 〔主要指植物〕布满刺的,多刺的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a prickly bush
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一簇荆棘
Exponent.EXAMPLE: prickly leaves
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 带刺的叶子

Exponent.DEF: a serrated edge on a saw or knife has a lot of sharp points on it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s best to use a knife with a serrated edge.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好使用有锯齿的小刀。

Exponent.DEF: extremely sharp
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The cat had razor-sharp claws.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只猫有着锋利的爪子。

Sense.DEF: at exactly 10.30, 2.00 etc
Sense.TRAN: 在十点三十分/两点整等
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re meeting at one-thirty sharp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将在1点30分会面。

Sense.DEF: if you turn sharp left or right, you make a sudden change of direction to the left or right
Sense.EXAMPLE: You turn sharp right at the crossroads.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到十字路口时﹐你要向右急转弯。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to do something quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you look sharp you might catch him before he leaves for London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你如果赶紧去﹐也许能在他出发去伦敦前见到他。

Sense.DEF:
played or sung at a slightly higher
pitch
than is correct
Sense.TRAN: 〔演奏或演唱得比正确的音调〕略为偏高地

Sense.DEF:
a musical note that has been raised one
semitone
above the note written
the sign (#) in a line of written music, used to show that a musical note should be raised
able to hear very well
to make something have a sharper edge or point, or to become sharper
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anne sharpened her pencil and got out her homework.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮把铅笔削尖﹐然后拿出家庭作业来。

Sense.DEF: to make a feeling stronger and more urgent
Sense.EXAMPLE: A series of attacks have sharpened fears of more violence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一连串的袭击事件使人们愈发担心会发生更多暴力事件。

Sense.DEF: to improve something so that it is up to the necessary standard, quality etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The course will help students sharpen their writing skills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课程将帮助学生提高写作技巧。

Sense.DEF: a tool or machine for sharpening pencils, knives etc
Sense.TRAN: 磨削的工具〔如铅笔刀﹑磨刀器等〕

Sense.DEF: able to see very well and notice small details
Sense.EXAMPLE: My sharp-eyed mother had already spotted him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我那眼尖的母亲已经看见他了。

Sense.DEF: quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’d better leave pretty sharpish if we want to catch that bus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们想赶上那趟公共汽车﹐那就最好快点动身。

Sense.DEF: suddenly and by a large amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prices have risen sharply over the last few months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去几个月里物价大幅度上涨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His politics have moved sharply to the right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的政治观点突然转向了右翼。

Sense.DEF: in a disapproving or unfriendly way
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What do you mean by that?’ Paul asked sharply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你那是什么意思？”保罗厉声问道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sharply critical report
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一篇言辞苛刻的报道

Sense.DEF: quickly and suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Graham looked up sharply, startled by a noise behind him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷厄姆被身后的声音吓了一跳﹐猛然抬头看了看。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Emily drew in her breath sharply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米莉急促地吸气。

Sense.DEF: used when saying that two things are clearly and noticeably very different
Sense.EXAMPLE: Opinion is sharply divided .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意见分歧明显。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His beliefs and values contrast sharply with are very different from his father’s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的信仰和价值观与他父亲截然不同。

Sense.DEF: someone who is very skilful at hitting what they aim at when shooting a gun
saying things in a disapproving or unfriendly way which often upsets people
Sense.TRAN: 说话刻薄的﹐言语尖刻的
Sense.EXAMPLE: his sharp-tongued wife
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那个尖酸刻薄的老婆

Sense.DEF: able to think and react very quickly
Sense.TRAN: 〔思维和反应〕敏捷的﹐敏锐的﹐机智的

Sense.DEF:
a past tense and past participle of
shit 3
to break suddenly into very small pieces, or to make something break in this way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plate hit the floor, and shattered into tiny bits.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 盘子掉到地板上﹐摔得粉碎。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The explosion shattered the building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次爆炸把大楼炸成一片废墟。

Sense.DEF: to completely destroy or ruin something such as someone’s hopes, beliefs or life
Sense.TRAN: 毁坏〔生活〕﹐使〔希望﹑信念〕破灭
Sense.EXAMPLE: A tragic accident shattered her dreams of Olympic glory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场不幸的意外事故使她获得奥运奖牌的梦想破灭了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A few weeks in a tiny damp room soon shattered his illusions about university life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在狭小潮湿的房间里生活了几个星期后﹐他对大学生活的幻想很快就破灭了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: people whose lives have been shattered by war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活被战争所毁的人们

Sense.DEF: if a loud noise shatters the silence or peace, it is suddenly heard
Sense.EXAMPLE: The silence was shattered by a warning shout.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一声警示的呼喊打破了寂静。

Sense.DEF: very shocked and upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t just disappointed, I was absolutely shattered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不仅是失望﹐我是彻底心灰意冷了。

Sense.DEF: very tired
Sense.TRAN: 精疲力竭的﹐极度疲劳的
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the time we got home we were both shattered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回到家时﹐我们两人都精疲力竭了。

Sense.DEF: very shocking and upsetting
Sense.TRAN: 令人震惊难过的﹔给人带来极大打击的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mother’s death was a shattering blow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他母亲的去世是一个沉重的打击。

Sense.DEF: making you very tired
Sense.TRAN: 使人疲倦的﹐使人精疲力竭的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve had a shattering day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这一天累得筋疲力尽。

Sense.DEF: shatterproof glass is specially designed so that it will not form sharp dangerous pieces if it is broken

to cut off hair very close to the skin, especially from the face, using a
razor
Sense.TRAN: 刮胡子﹐刮脸﹐剃须﹔刮去〔毛发〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hadn’t shaved for days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经好几天没刮脸了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brian had cut himself shaving .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布赖恩刮胡子时割破了脸。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She shaved her legs and underarms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她剃了腿毛和腋毛。

Sense.DEF: to remove very thin pieces from the surface of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shave thin strips of cheese over the pasta.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把干酪一层一层薄薄地刮到意大利面上。

Sense.DEF: to remove hair by shaving
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve decided to shave off my beard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定把胡须剃掉。

Sense.DEF: to remove very thin pieces from the surface of something, using a knife or other cutting tool
Sense.TRAN: 〔用刀或刨等〕刮去〔表层〕﹐把…刨去〔一层〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had to shave a few millimetres off the bottom of the door to make it shut.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只好把门的底部刨掉几毫米才能让它关上。

Sense.DEF: if you shave a small amount off something such as a price or a record, you make the price slightly smaller or the record time slightly shorter
Sense.EXAMPLE: She shaved half a second off the world record.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把世界纪录缩短了半秒。

Sense.DEF:
if a man has a shave, he cuts off the hair on his face close to his skin using a
razor
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked as if he needed a shave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去似乎需要刮刮胡子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll just have a shave before we go.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刮个胡子我们就走。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you only just avoid an accident or something bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: Phew, that was a close shave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唷﹐好险哪。

Sense.DEF: with all the hair shaved off
Sense.EXAMPLE: his shaven head
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那剃光的头

Sense.DEF: a small piece of electrical equipment used for shaving
Sense.EXAMPLE: He uses an electric shaver.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他使用电动剃须刀。

Sense.DEF: a brush used for spreading soap or shaving cream over your face when you shave
Sense.TRAN: 〔刮须前用以涂抹皂液的〕修面刷

Sense.DEF: a special cream that you put on your face when you shave
very thin pieces, especially of wood, cut from a surface with a sharp blade
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pile of wood shavings on the floor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地上的一堆木刨花

Sense.DEF:
a piece of cloth, in a square or
triangular
shape, that is worn around the shoulders or head, especially by women
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指女用的〕披巾﹐披肩大围巾

Head.GRAM: used as the subject of a verb

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a woman, girl, or female animal that has already been mentioned or is already known about
Sense.TRAN: 她 指女性或雌性动物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You could always ask Beth – she’s got plenty of money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你总是可以去问贝丝——她有很多钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw you talking to that girl. Who is she?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看见你和那个女孩子说话。 她是谁？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What did she say when you told her?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你告诉她时她怎么说？

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a country, ship, or vehicle that has already been mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 她﹐它〔指国家﹑船只或车辆〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was carrying over 1,500 passengers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它载着 1,500 多名乘客。

Sense.DEF: a female
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a cute puppy! Is it a he or a she?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多可爱的小狗！是公的还是母的？

Sense.DEF: female
Sense.EXAMPLE: a she-goat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母山羊
Sense.EXAMPLE: a she-devil evil woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女魔头

Sense.DEF: used in writing when the subject of the sentence can be either male or female
Sense.EXAMPLE: If any student witnesses a crime, s/he should contact campus police immediately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如有学生目击犯罪﹐她或他应该马上与校警联系。

Sense.DEF:
a type of oil from an African nut that is used in
moisturizer s
to make your skin less dry
Sense.TRAN: 乳木果油〔从非洲坚果中提取的一种油﹐用于制造润肤霜〕

Sense.DEF: several pieces of paper held or tied together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He laid a sheaf of documents on the desk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把一沓文件放在书桌上。

Sense.DEF: a bunch of wheat, corn etc tied together after it has been cut
to cut the wool off a sheep
to cut off someone’s hair
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her long fair hair had been shorn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她长长的金发已经剪掉了。

Sense.DEF: to have something valuable or important taken away from you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Though shorn of some of its powers, the party remains in control.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然被削去了一些权力﹐该党仍然掌握着控制权。

Sense.DEF: if part of something shears off, or is sheared off, it suddenly becomes separated, especially after being pulled or hit with a lot of force

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The left wing had been almost completely sheared off.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 左翼几乎完全折断了。

Sense.DEF: someone who cuts the wool off sheep
a heavy tool for cutting, like a big pair of scissors
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam was trimming the hedge with a pair of garden shears .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆拿着一把园艺剪刀正在修剪树篱。

Sense.DEF: a cover for the blade of a knife or sword
Sense.EXAMPLE: His sword was back in its sheath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的剑插回了剑鞘。

Sense.DEF:
a
condom
a protective covering that fits closely around something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wire is covered by an outer plastic sheath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电线外面覆盖着一层塑料保护层。

Sense.DEF: a simple, close-fitting dress
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was wearing a plain black sheath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿一件朴素的黑色紧身连衣裙。

Sense.DEF: to put a knife or sword into a sheath
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sheathed his sword.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把剑插入鞘内。

Sense.DEF: to be covered by something
Sense.TRAN: 被某物覆盖﹐被某物笼罩
Sense.EXAMPLE: The grassy hills were sheathed in mist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绿草如茵的群山雾气弥漫。

Sense.DEF: a protective outer cover, for example for a building or a ship
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物的〕保护性外层﹐包覆材料﹔〔船的〕船底包板

Sense.DEF: a knife with a fixed blade that is carried in a sheath

the plural of
sheaf
the whole thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a big project, and she’s in charge of the whole shebang.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是项大工程﹐由她负责全部事务。

Sense.DEF: a place where alcoholic drinks are sold illegally – used especially in Ireland
Sense.TRAN: 非法经营的酒馆〔尤用于爱尔兰〕
the short form of 缩略式= ‘she had’
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’d already gone when we got there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到那里时她已经走了。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘she would’
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’d like to come with us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想和我们一起去。

Sense.DEF: a small building, often made of wood, used especially for storing things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tool shed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工具棚
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cattle shed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛棚

Sense.DEF: a large industrial building where work is done, large vehicles are kept, machinery is stored
Sense.TRAN: 〔用作车间﹑停放大型车辆或存放机器等的〕工棚﹐厂房﹐库房

Sense.DEF: to get rid of something that you no longer need or want
Sense.TRAN: 去除﹐摆脱〔不需要或不想要的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is planning to shed about a quarter of its workforce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司正计划裁减约四分之一的人员。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The magazine is desperately trying to shed its old-fashioned image.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份杂志急于摆脱其过时的形象。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a diet to help you shed pounds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帮助你减肥的食谱

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Shed is used especially in journalism. In everyday English, people usually say that someone or something gets rid of something. shed
F2NBox.TRAN: 尤用于新闻文体,在日常英语中,人们一般说 get rid of。

Subsense.DEF: to make something easier to understand, by providing new or better information
Subsense.TRAN: 〔通过提供新信息等〕使〔某事物〕清楚些[易于理解]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Recent research has shed light on the causes of the disease.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的研究使人们对这种疾病的成因有了更多的了解。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Investigators hope to shed light on what started the fire.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查人员希望找出起火原因。

Subsense.DEF: if something sheds light, it lights the area around it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The lamp shed a harsh yellow light.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这盏灯发出刺眼的黄光。

Sense.DEF: if a plant sheds its leaves or if an animal sheds skin or hair, they fall off as part of a natural process
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trees were starting to shed their leaves .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树木开始落叶了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As it grows, a snake will regularly shed its skin .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛇在成长的过程中会定期蜕皮。

Sense.DEF: to drop something or allow it to fall
Sense.EXAMPLE: He strode across the bathroom, shedding wet clothes as he went.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大步走过浴室﹐边走边把湿衣服脱下来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A lorry shed its load of steel bars on the M25.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在25号高速公路上﹐一辆大卡车所载的钢条掉落。

Sense.DEF: to kill or injure people, especially during a war or a fight
Sense.TRAN: 流血〔尤指战争或打斗中的杀戮或伤害〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Too much blood has already been shed in this conflict.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次冲突已经造成太多的伤亡了。

Sense.DEF: to cry
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had not shed a single tear during the funeral.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在葬礼上她没流一滴眼泪。

Sense.DEF: if something sheds water, the water flows off its surface, instead of sinking into it
a lot of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve got shedloads of stuff for sale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有大量的东西要出售。

Sense.DEF: a soft smooth shiny appearance
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her hair had a lovely coppery sheen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头发闪着美丽的紫铜色光泽。

Sense.DEF: a farm animal that is kept for its wool and its meat
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sheep were grazing on the hillside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 羊群在山坡上吃草。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sheep farmer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 养羊的农民

GramExa.GLOSS: a group of sheep

Sense.DEF: if people behave like sheep, they do not think independently, but follow what everyone else does or thinks
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tourists were led around like sheep, from shrine to souvenir shop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游客就像羊群一般被领着一会儿到神庙﹐一会儿到纪念品商店。

Sense.LEXUNIT: separate the sheep from the goats
Sense.DEF: to find out which people are intelligent, skilful, successful etc, and which are not
Sense.EXAMPLE: This test should really separate the sheep from the goats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次考试应该能清楚地分出高下来。

Sense.DEF: to look at someone in a way that shows you love them
Sense.TRAN: 用充满爱意的眼神看某人﹐向某人送秋波

Sense.DEF: a chemical used to kill insects that live in sheep’s wool, or a special bath in which this chemical is used
Sense.TRAN: 浴羊药液〔一种用以杀死羊毛中寄生虫的消毒液〕﹔〔使用该药液的〕羊浴

Sense.DEF: a dog that is trained to control sheep
a dog of a type that is often used for controlling sheep
slightly uncomfortable or embarrassed because you know that you have done something silly or wrong
Sense.TRAN: 局促不安的﹐窘迫的﹐尴尬的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam looked a bit sheepish .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆看上去有些局促不安。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sheepish grin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窘迫的一笑

Sense.DEF: a small area of ground with a fence around it, used for keeping sheep together for a short time
the skin of a sheep with the wool still on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sheepskin coat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 羊皮袄

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is very heavy, large etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sheer size of the country makes communications difficult.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国幅员辽阔﹐造成了通信的困难。

Sense.DEF: luck, happiness etc with no other feeling or quality mixed with it
Sense.TRAN: 纯粹的运气/快乐/愚蠢等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll never forget the look of sheer joy on her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我永远也不会忘记她满脸喜悦的神情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: sheer hypocrisy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十足的虚伪

Sense.DEF: a sheer drop, cliff, slope etc is very steep and almost vertical
Sense.TRAN: 〔悬崖﹑斜坡等〕陡峭的﹐近乎垂直的

Sense.DEF:
sheer
nylon
, silk etc is very thin and fine, so that it is almost transparent
Sense.TRAN: 〔尼龙﹑丝绸等〕很薄的﹐几乎透明的
Sense.EXAMPLE: sheer stockings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 透明的女式长筒袜

Sense.DEF: straight up or down in an almost vertical line
Sense.EXAMPLE: cliffs which rose sheer from the sea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从海面垂直拔起的悬崖

Sense.DEF: to change direction suddenly, especially in order to avoid something
Sense.TRAN: 突然转向〔尤指为了避开某物〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boat sheered away and headed out to sea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这艘小船突然转向朝大海驶去。

Sense.DEF: a large piece of thin cloth that you put on a bed to lie on or lie under
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll go and find you some clean sheets and blankets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去给你们找些干净的床单和毯子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: white cotton sheets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白色的棉布床单

GramExa.GLOSS: put clean sheets on a bed

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper for writing on, or containing information

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sheet of paper with names and numbers on it
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 写了姓名和电话号码的一张纸

GramExa.GLOSS: one with no writing on it

Sense.DEF: a thin flat piece of something such as metal or glass, that usually has four sides
Sense.TRAN: 〔金属或玻璃等﹐一般有四边的〕薄片﹐薄板

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sheet of glass
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块玻璃

Sense.DEF: a large flat area of something such as ice or water spread over a surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A sheet of ice covered the lake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 湖面上覆盖着一层冰。

Sense.DEF: a sheet of rain or fire is a very large moving mass of it
Sense.TRAN: 一团﹐一片﹐一层〔移动的东西〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sheets of flame shot into the air.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 团团火焰冲向天空。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rain was coming down in sheets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大雨倾盆而下。

Sense.DEF: a rope or chain attached to a sail on a ship that controls the angle between a sail and the wind
material such as plastic or metal used to cover something and protect it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The roof was covered in plastic sheeting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房顶是用塑料薄板覆盖的。

Sense.DEF: cloth used to make sheets for a bed

a type of
lightning
that appears as a sudden flash of brightness covering a large area of sky
metal in the form of thin sheets
music that is printed on single sheets and not fastened together inside a cover
an Arab ruler or prince
Sense.TRAN: 〔阿拉伯的〕酋长﹐族长﹐首领﹔王子

Sense.DEF: an Islamic leader or teacher
a place that is governed by an Arab prince or ruler
Sense.TRAN: 〔阿拉伯〕酋长统治的领土﹐酋长国

Sense.DEF: a young woman – used in Australia and New Zealand
Sense.TRAN: 少妇﹐少女﹐女郎〔用于澳大利亚和新西兰〕

Sense.DEF: the standard unit of money in Israel
Sense.TRAN: 谢克尔〔以色列的货币单位〕

Sense.DEF: a long flat narrow board attached to a wall or in a frame or cupboard, used for putting things on

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Put it back on the top shelf.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把它放回顶层的搁板上。

Sense.EXAMPLE: shelves of books
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一层层书架的书
Sense.EXAMPLE: supermarket shelves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超级市场的货架
Sense.EXAMPLE: the amount of shelf space available
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可用的货架空间

Sense.DEF: a narrow surface of rock shaped like a shelf, especially under water
Sense.TRAN: 搁板状岩石﹔〔尤指海底的〕暗礁﹐大陆架

Sense.DEF: available to be bought immediately, without having to be specially designed or ordered
Sense.EXAMPLE: off-the-shelf software packages
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现货供应的计算机软件包

Subsense.DEF: if something is left on the shelf, it is not used or considered
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The album stayed on the shelf for several years, until it was finally released.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张专辑被搁置了几年﹐最后终于得以发行。

Subsense.DEF: too old to get married – used especially of women
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指女子〕因年龄太大而结不成婚

Sense.DEF: the length of time that a product, especially food, can be kept in a shop before it becomes too old to sell
Sense.TRAN: 〔食品等放在商店里的〕保存期﹐货架期
the short form of 缩略式= ‘she will’

Subsense.DEF: the hard outer part that covers and protects an egg, nut, or seed
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Never buy eggs with cracked shells.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 千万不要买破壳的蛋。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: peanuts roasted in their shells
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带壳的烤花生

Subsense.DEF:
the hard protective covering of an animal such as a
snail
,
mussel
, or
crab
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a snail shell
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜗牛壳
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The children were collecting shells on the beach.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在海滩上捡贝壳。

Sense.DEF: a metal container, like a large bullet, which is full of an explosive substance and is fired from a large gun
Sense.EXAMPLE: We ran for cover as shells dropped all around us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周围炮弹四处飞落﹐我们奔跑着寻找地方躲避。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an exploding mortar shell
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一枚爆炸的迫击炮弹

Sense.DEF: a metal tube containing a bullet and an explosive substance
the outside structure of something, especially the part of a building that remains when the rest of it has been destroyed
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指建筑物遭破坏后剩下的〕空壳﹐空架子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the burnt-out shell of a nightclub
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家夜总会烧毁后剩下的空架子

Sense.DEF: becoming less shy and more confident and willing to talk to people
Sense.TRAN: 不再羞怯﹐愿意与人攀谈﹐开始活跃起来
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had hoped that university would bring him out of his shell .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我原来希望大学生活能够使他胆子大一点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s started to come out of her shell a little.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始放开了一点。

Sense.DEF: to fire shells from large guns at something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The army has been shelling the town since yesterday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队从昨天开始就在炮轰这座镇子。

Sense.DEF:
to remove something such as beans or nuts from a shell or
pod
Sense.EXAMPLE: Josie was shelling peas in the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔茜在厨房里剥豆子。

Sense.DEF: to pay a lot of money for something, especially unwillingly
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不情愿地〕花大价钱﹐付大笔钱
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you want the repairs done right, you’ll have to shell out at least $800.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想好好修﹐至少得花 800 美元。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She ended up shelling out for two rooms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 结果两个房间花了她一大笔钱。

Sense.DEF: a type of transparent paint for protecting or hardening surfaces
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于保护表面或使表面坚硬的〕虫胶（清漆）

Sense.DEF: an explosion caused by shells being fired from large guns
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hospital badly damaged by shellfire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遭炮击损毁严重的医院

PIC.HEADING: SHELLFISH 水生有壳动物
PIC.PICCONTENT: clams 蛤；mussel 贻贝；oysters 牡蛎；lobster 龙虾；prawn BrE 【英】/shrimp虾

Sense.DEF:
an animal that lives in water, has a shell, and can be eaten as food, for example
crab s
,
lobster s
, and
oyster s
a dishonest method of doing something, in which you pretend to be doing one thing when you are really doing another
Sense.EXAMPLE: Critics called the proposal a shell game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 批评者称这项提议是一个幌子。

Sense.DEF: the firing of shells from large guns

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the shelling of villages
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对村庄的炮击

Sense.EXAMPLE: weeks of heavy shelling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 连续数周的密集炮轰

Sense.DEF: a type of mental illness caused by the terrible experiences of fighting in a war or battle
Sense.TRAN: 炮弹休克〔因战斗中的可怕经历而产生的一种精神异常〕

Sense.DEF: feeling tired, confused, or anxious because of a recent difficult experience
mentally ill because of the terrible experiences of war
Sense.TRAN: 〔因战争的可怕经历而〕患炮弹休克的

Sense.DEF: a light brightly coloured piece of clothing consisting of trousers and a jacket that fit tightly at the wrists and at the bottom of the legs
Sense.TRAN: 休闲装〔袖口和裤腿束紧﹑颜色鲜亮的一种轻便套装〕

Sense.DEF: a place to live, considered as one of the basic needs of life
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are in need of food and shelter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们急需食物和住处。

Sense.DEF: protection from danger or from wind, rain, hot sun etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We reached the shelter of the caves.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到了可以躲避的山洞里。

GramExa.PROPFORM: in/into/under etc the shelter of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were standing under the shelter of a huge tree.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们站在一棵大树下躲着。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The men took shelter in a bombed-out farmhouse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些男人躲在一间被炸毁的农舍里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All around me, people were running for shelter .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我周围的人都在奔跑着寻找地方躲避。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: An old hut gave shelter from the storm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一间旧茅舍成了躲避暴风雨的地方。

Sense.DEF: a building where people or animals that have nowhere to live or that are in danger can stay and receive help

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a shelter for battered women
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 受虐待妇女的庇护所

Sense.EXAMPLE: a homeless shelter for people who have no homes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无家可归者的收容所
Sense.EXAMPLE: an animal shelter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动物收容所

Sense.DEF: a building or an area with a roof over it that protects you from the weather or from danger
Sense.TRAN: 躲避风雨的地方﹔避难处

GramExa.GLOSS: a place to keep people safe from bombs dropped by planes
a small structure with a roof where you wait for a bus

Sense.DEF: to provide a place where someone or something is protected, especially from the weather or from danger
Sense.TRAN: 为…提供庇护处〔尤指躲避风雨或危险的地方〕﹔收容
Sense.EXAMPLE: Collins was arrested for sheltering enemy soldiers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科林斯因收留敌兵而被逮捕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Plant herbs next to a wall to shelter them from the wind.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把药草种在墙边以避风。

Sense.DEF: to stay in or under a place where you are protected from the weather or from danger

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We sat in the shade, sheltering from the sun.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们坐在背阴处﹐避免被晒到。

Sense.DEF: a life etc in which someone has been too protected by their parents from difficult or unpleasant experiences
Sense.TRAN: 备受呵护的生活/童年/养育等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had led a sheltered life and had never met prejudice before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直过着备受呵护的生活﹐以前从未遭遇过什么偏见。

Sense.DEF: a place that is sheltered is protected from extreme weather conditions
Sense.TRAN: 〔地方〕受掩护的﹐免遭恶劣天气影响的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sheltered valley
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有天然屏障的山谷

Sense.DEF: a place for people to live who cannot look after themselves properly and where help is provided if they need it
Sense.EXAMPLE: sheltered accommodation for the elderly
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年人收容所

Sense.DEF: to decide not to continue with a plan, idea etc, although you might continue with it at a later time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plans to reopen the school have been shelved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重新开办这所学校的计划被搁置了。

Sense.DEF: land that shelves is at a slight angle
Sense.EXAMPLE: The garden shelves gently towards the sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座花园微微向海的方向倾斜。

Sense.DEF: to put something on a shelf, especially books
Sense.TRAN: 将〔书等〕放在架子上﹐将…上架

Sense.DEF:
the plural of
shelf
a set of shelves fixed to a wall
wood, metal etc used for shelves
bad behaviour that is not very serious, or slightly dishonest activities
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wouldn’t put up with his shenanigans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不会忍受他的胡闹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: financial shenanigans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 财务上动的手脚

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to take care of sheep
to lead or guide a group of people somewhere, making sure that they go where you want them to go

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tour guides shepherded the rest of the group onto the bus.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 导游把团中的其他人带上了巴士。

Sense.DEF: a woman whose job is to take care of sheep
a traditional English dish made of small pieces of cooked meat, usually lamb, covered with cooked potato
a sweet frozen food made with water, fruit, sugar, and milk
Sense.TRAN: 果汁冰糕〔一种用水﹑水果﹑糖和牛奶制成的冷冻甜食〕

Sense.DEF: a powder that is eaten as a sweet

another form of
shard

an elected law officer of a
county
in the US
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国的〕县治安官〔由选举产生的县级司法长官〕

Sense.DEF:
the representative of the king or queen in a
county
of England and Wales, who has mostly ceremonial duties
Sense.TRAN: 〔英格兰和威尔士的〕郡长〔一种礼仪性职务〕

Sense.DEF:
the most important judge in a
district
or
county
in Scotland

the lower court of law in Scotland, dealing with
civil
and criminal cases
Sense.TRAN: 〔苏格兰的〕郡法院﹐初等法院〔兼管民事和刑事案件〕

Sense.DEF: a Himalayan person who is often employed to guide people through mountains and carry their equipment
Sense.TRAN: 夏尔巴人〔喜马拉雅山区人﹐常受雇当登山向导〕

Sense.DEF: a pale or dark brown strong wine, originally from Spain
Sense.TRAN: 雪利酒〔原产于西班牙的一种白色或深褐色烈性酒〕
the short form of 缩略式= ‘she is’
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s not feeling well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感觉身体不适。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘she has’
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s got a new bike.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有一辆新自行车。

Sense.DEF: a small strong horse with long rough hair
Sense.TRAN: 设得兰矮种马〔一种体小毛粗﹑强壮耐劳的马〕

Sense.DEF:
an old spelling of
show
used to tell people to be quiet
Sense.TRAN: 嘘〔用以叫别人安静下来〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shh! I can’t hear what he’s saying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘘！我听不见他在说什么了。

Sense.DEF: the Shiite branch of the Muslim religion
a Shiite

a Japanese form of
massage pressing and rubbing someone’s body
an old idea, custom, or principle that you think is no longer important or suitable for modern times
Sense.TRAN: 陈旧思想﹐陈规 陋习

Subsense.DEF: a large piece of metal or leather that soldiers used in the past to protect themselves when fighting
a piece of equipment made of strong plastic, used by the police to protect themselves against angry crowds
something in the shape of a shield, wide at the top and curving to a point at the bottom, that is given as a prize for winning a competition, especially a sports competition
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指体育比赛中的〕盾形奖牌

Subsense.DEF:
a drawing or model of a shield, wide at the top and curving to a point at the bottom, that is used as a
coat of arms

Sense.DEF: something that protects a person or thing from harm or damage

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The immune system is our body’s shield against infection.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 免疫系统是我们人体抵抗感染的屏障。

Sense.DEF: the small piece of metal that a police officer wears to show that they are a police officer
to protect someone or something from being harmed or damaged
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women will often lie to shield even the most abusive partner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪怕是再暴力的伴侣﹐女性也往往会撒谎保护他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He held up his hands, shielding his eyes from the sun.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抬手遮住眼睛免受阳光照射。

Sense.EXAMPLE: import tariffs that shield firms from foreign competition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保护企业免受外国竞争威的进口关税

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Shield is used mostly in journalism or literature. In everyday English, people usually say protect .
F2NBox.TRAN: shield主要用于新闻稿或文学作品中。在日常英语中,人们一般说protect
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He used his hands to protect his eyes from the sun.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用双手保护眼睛不受太阳照射。

Subsense.DEF: to move from one place or position to another, or make something do this
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Joe listened, shifting uncomfortably from one foot to another.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔听着﹐不安地把重心从一只脚转移到另一只脚。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She shifted her gaze from me to Bobby.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把目光从我身上移到博比身上。

Subsense.DEF: to move something, especially by picking it up and carrying it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Give me a hand to shift these chairs.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帮我挪一挪这几把椅子。

Sense.DEF: to change a situation, discussion etc by giving special attention to one idea or subject instead of to a previous one

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The White House hopes to shift the media’s attention away from foreign policy issues.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 白宫希望把媒体的注意力从外交政策问题上转移开。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In this stage of a rape case, the focus often shifts onto the victim and her conduct.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 强奸案审理到这一阶段﹐焦点往往会转移到受害人以及她的行为上去。

GramExa.GLOSS: change what you are doing
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s hard to shift gear when you come home after a busy day at work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上班忙了一天回到家里很难回过神来。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s opinions, beliefs etc shift, they change
Sense.EXAMPLE: Public opinion was beginning to shift to the right become more right-wing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众舆论开始右倾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: shifting attitudes towards marriage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 逐渐转变的婚姻观
Sense.EXAMPLE: He refused to shift his ground change his opinion .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拒绝改变自己的立场。

Sense.DEF: to make someone else responsible for something, especially for something bad that has happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a clear attempt to shift the responsibility for the crime onto the victim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这显然是想把罪责推给受害者。

Sense.DEF: to change the way that money is paid or spent
Sense.EXAMPLE: the need to shift more resources towards reducing poverty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把更多的财力转到减少贫困上去的需要

Sense.DEF: to remove dirt or marks from a surface or piece of clothing
Sense.TRAN: 除去〔表面或衣服上的污迹〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new washing powder that will shift any stain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种能洗掉任何污的新型洗衣粉

Sense.DEF:
to change the
gear s
when you are driving
Sense.EXAMPLE: I shifted into second gear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我换到二挡。

Sense.DEF: to sell a product, especially a lot of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The store shifted over 1,000 copies of the book last week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书上周在这家书店里售出了1,000多册。

Sense.DEF: a change in the way people think about something, in the way something is done etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the shift from one type of economic system to another
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从一种经济体系向另一种经济体系的转变

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an important shift in policy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政策上的重大改变

Sense.EXAMPLE: a marked shift noticeable change in attitudes towards women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对女性态度的明显变化

Subsense.DEF: if workers in a factory, hospital etc work shifts, they work for a particular period of time during the day or night, and are then replaced by others, so that there are always people working
Subsense.TRAN: 〔工厂﹑医院等轮班制中的〕当班时间

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dave had to work a 12-hour shift yesterday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫昨天要上一个12小时的班。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: I work shifts.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我轮班工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The thought of working night shifts put her off becoming a nurse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到要上夜班﹐她就打消了当护士的念头。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m on the early shift tomorrow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天我要上早班。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: people who do shift work
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 做轮班工作的人

Subsense.EXAMPLE: A shift system has been introduced.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实行了轮班工作制。

Subsense.DEF: the workers who work during one of these periods

GramExa.EXAMPLE: before the early shift goes off duty
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在早班工人下班之前

Sense.DEF:
a
shift key
Sense.EXAMPLE: To run the spell-checker, press SHIFT and F7.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要使用拼写检查程序﹐按shift键和F7键。

Sense.DEF: a simple straight loose-fitting woman’s dress

the
key 2 3
on a
keyboard 1 3
that you press to make a capital letter
lazy and having no interest in working hard or trying to succeed
Sense.TRAN: 懒惰的﹐不求上进的﹐得过且过的

Sense.DEF: looking dishonest
Sense.TRAN: 躲躲闪闪的﹐鬼鬼祟祟的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looks a bit shifty to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看他有点贼眉鼠眼的样子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: shifty eyes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一双贼眼

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
shitzu
a Muslim who follows one of the two main branches of the Muslim religion
an old British coin or unit of money. There were 20 shillings in one pound.
Sense.TRAN: 先令〔英国的一种旧货币单位﹐二十先令等于一英镑〕

Sense.DEF: the standard unit of money in Kenya, Uganda, Tanzania, and Somalia
Sense.TRAN: 先令〔肯尼亚﹑乌干达﹑坦桑尼亚和索马里的货币单位〕

Sense.DEF: to waste time or take too long to make a decision
to shine with a soft light that looks as if it shakes slightly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lake shimmered in the moonlight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月色下﹐湖面波光粼粼。

Sense.DEF: to move forwards or backwards while also quickly moving slightly from side to side
the front part of your leg between your knee and your foot
to climb quickly up or down a tree, pole etc by using your hands and legs
Sense.EXAMPLE: He shinned up a tree.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他噌的一下爬到了一棵树上。

Sense.DEF: the front bone in your leg below your knee
a noisy party – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 喧闹的聚会〔尤用于新闻报道〕

Sense.DEF: to produce bright light
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sun was shining .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光照耀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The moon shone brightly in the sky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皓月当空。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That lamp’s shining in my eyes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那盏灯正照着我的眼睛。

Sense.DEF: if you shine a light somewhere, you point it in that direction

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shine that torch over here, will you?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把那个手电筒往这里照﹐好吗？

Sense.DEF: to look bright and smooth
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marion polished the table until it shone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马里昂把桌子擦得锃亮。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had shining black hair .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头发乌黑亮丽。

Sense.DEF: to make something bright by rubbing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: His shoes were shined to perfection.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的鞋子擦得亮。

Sense.DEF: if your eyes shine, or your face shines, you have an expression of happiness

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘It was wonderful!’ Kate replied, her eyes shining with excitement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “太好了！”凯特回答说﹐她的眼里闪着兴奋的光芒。

Sense.DEF: to be very good at something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The concert will give young jazz musicians a chance to shine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场音乐会将给年轻的爵士乐手们一次大显身手的机会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Peter didn’t really shine at school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得在学校里表现并不突出。

Sense.DEF: something or someone that is an excellent example of a particular quality and should be admired

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house is a shining example of Art Deco architecture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢房子是艺术装饰派建筑的杰出典范。

Exponent.DEF: to produce bright light
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The sun was shining.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光照耀。

Exponent.DEF: to shine brightly for a very short time, or to shine on and off very quickly many times
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Lightning flashed across the sky.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 闪电划过天空。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The police car’s lights were flashing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警车灯在闪烁。

Exponent.DEF: to shine with a very strong light which hurts your eyes
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The sun glared in her eyes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 强烈的阳光刺着她的眼睛。

Exponent.DEF: to shine with an unsteady light – used about a flame or light
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The candle flickered and went out.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 烛火闪了闪,熄灭了。

Exponent.DEF: if stars or lights twinkle, they shine in the dark in a way that seems to change from bright to faint, especially because you are a long way away from them
Exponent.TRAN: 〔星星或灯光在远处〕闪烁,闪耀
Exponent.EXAMPLE: stars twinkling in the sky
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 天空中闪烁的星星
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The harbour lights twinkled in the distance.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 港湾的灯光在远处闪烁。

Exponent.DEF: to shine with a warm soft light
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Lights glowed in the windows.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗户里透出柔和的灯光。

Exponent.DEF: to shine very brightly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The lights of the factory were still blazing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 工厂里依然灯光通明。

Section.SECHEADING: TO SHINE BY REFLECTING LIGHT 因反射而发光

Exponent.DEF: if something sparkles, it shines with many small bright points when light is on it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The sea sparkled in the sunlight.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 海面在阳光照射下波光粼粼。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jewels glittered around her neck.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脖子上的珠宝熠熠生辉。

Exponent.DEF: to shine by reflecting the light – used especially about smooth clean surfaces, or about someone’s eyes or teeth
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指光洁的表面﹑某人的眼睛或牙齿〕闪闪发光
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The sword’s blade gleamed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 剑光闪闪。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a gleaming sports car
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 闪闪发亮的跑车
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His blue eyes gleamed with amusement.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他蓝色的眼睛里闪着愉悦的光芒。

Exponent.DEF: to shine with quick flashes of light
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The knife glinted in the sunlight.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小刀在阳光下一闪一闪。

Exponent.DEF: to shine – used about wet or oily surfaces﹐and especially when saying that someone’s eyes are full of tears, or someone’s skin is covered in sweat
Exponent.TRAN: 〔湿的或油的表面〕闪光,闪亮〔尤用于指某人眼里噙满泪水或皮肤上都是汗〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: As they were leaving, her eyes glistened with tears.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们走的时候,她眼里闪着泪光。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His forehead was glistening with sweat.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的额头上汗水闪闪发亮。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The wet chairs glistened in the afternoon sun.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 打湿的椅子在午后的阳光下闪闪发光。

Exponent.DEF: if something catches the light, it shines because it is reflecting light
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her diamond ring caught the light.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的钻戒被光一照闪闪发亮。

Sense.DEF: if a quality that someone has shines through, you can easily see that they have it
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种特质〕显而易见﹐表现明显
Sense.EXAMPLE: What shines through in all her work is her enthusiasm for life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的所有作品都洋溢着对生活的热情。

Sense.DEF: the brightness that something has when light shines on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lucy’s dark hair seemed to have lost its shine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露西的黑发好像失去了光泽。

Sense.DEF: to like someone very much when you have only just met them
one of many small thin pieces of wood or another building material, fastened in rows to cover a roof or wall
Sense.TRAN: 〔盖房顶或贴墙用的〕木瓦﹔屋面板﹐墙面板

Sense.DEF: small round pieces of stone on a beach
Sense.EXAMPLE: the crash of waves on the shingle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海浪对卵石的冲击
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shingle beach
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卵石滩

Sense.DEF: to start your own business, especially as a doctor or lawyer
a roof or wall that is shingled is covered with shingles
Sense.TRAN: 〔房顶或墙〕盖木瓦的﹐贴木瓦的

Sense.DEF: a disease caused by an infection of the nerve endings, which produces painful red spots
to climb quickly up or down a tree, pole etc by using your hands and legs
the ancient traditional religion of Japan
smooth and bright
Sense.EXAMPLE: shiny black shoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锃亮的黑皮鞋
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shiny polished table
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 擦得光亮的桌子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her hair was thick and shiny.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头发浓密且有光泽。

Sense.DEF: a large boat used for carrying people or goods across the sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ship’s captain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这艘船的船长
Sense.EXAMPLE: a luxury cruise ship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一艘豪华游艇

GramExa.EXAMPLE: supplies that came by ship
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮船运来的补给品

Sense.DEF: a large spacecraft
to send goods somewhere by ship, plane, truck etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A new engine was shipped over from the US.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从美国运来一台新的引擎。

Sense.DEF: to make a piece of computer equipment or software available for people to buy
Sense.TRAN: 推出〔计算机商品〕﹔（使）上市
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re now shipping their long-awaited new anti-virus software.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们现正推出大家期待已久的新杀毒软件。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both products are due to ship at the beginning of June.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两种产品都定于六月初上市。

Sense.DEF: to order someone to go somewhere

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was shipped off to a juvenile detention center.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被送进一个青少年拘留中心。

Sense.DEF: a particular position or job, or the time during which you have it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was offered a professorship the job of professor .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获聘为教授。
Sense.EXAMPLE: in Mr Major’s premiership when he was prime minister
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在梅杰先生的首相任期里
Sense.EXAMPLE: her application for British citizenship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对英国公民身份的申请

Sense.DEF: the state of having something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Private car ownership has almost doubled in the past ten years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 私家车的拥有量在过去十年里几乎翻了一番。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their friendship developed soon afterwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 之后不久他们之间就发展起了友谊。

Sense.DEF: a particular art or skill
Sense.EXAMPLE: his superb musicianship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他杰出的音乐才华
Sense.EXAMPLE: a work of great scholarship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部很有学术价值的著作

Sense.DEF: all the people in a particular group
Sense.EXAMPLE: a magazine with a readership of 9,000 with 9,000 readers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一份拥有9,000名读者的杂志

Sense.DEF: happening on a ship
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shipboard romance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船上恋情

Sense.DEF: a company that makes ships
the industry of making ships
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shipbuilding yard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 造船厂

Sense.DEF: the amount of goods or people a ship can carry
Sense.TRAN: 一艘船的装货量[载人量]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several shiploads of grain arrived in the harbor that day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天有好几船的粮食运达港口。

Sense.DEF:
a
sailor ’s
shipmate is another sailor who is working on the same ship
a load of goods sent by sea, road, or air, or the act of sending them
Sense.TRAN: 〔经海路﹑陆路或航空运送的〕货物﹔〔货物的〕装运﹐运送

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a shipment of grain
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一批粮食

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an illegal arms shipment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 非法军火运输

Sense.EXAMPLE: The goods are ready for shipment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 货物已经准备好装运。

Sense.DEF: someone who owns one or more ships
a company that sends goods to places by ship
ships considered as a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: The port is closed to all shipping.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个港口已经封港。

Sense.DEF: the delivery of goods, especially by ship

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a Danish shipping company
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家丹麦船运公司

Sense.EXAMPLE: a shipping route
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船运路线

Sense.DEF: the amount of money you pay a company to deliver goods to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jewelry can be yours for $15 plus shipping and handling .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只需 15 美元另加运费和手续费﹐这件珠宝就归你了。

Sense.DEF: a radio broadcast that says what the weather will be like at sea
an officially approved path of travel that ships must follow
Sense.TRAN: 〔官方规定的〕海上航道﹐船只航线

Sense.DEF: someone who sells equipment for ships
neat and clean
Sense.TRAN: 整齐清洁的﹐井井有条的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s get this house shipshape.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我们把这所房子收拾干净。

GramExa.GLOSS: shipshape
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 整齐干净的﹐井井有条的

Sense.DEF: providing communication between a ship and people on land
Sense.EXAMPLE: ship-to-shore radio
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船与岸之间的无线电

Sense.DEF: the destruction of a ship in an accident
Sense.EXAMPLE: survivors of the shipwreck
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此次海难的幸存者
Sense.EXAMPLE: narrowly escaping shipwreck
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 险些遭遇船只失事

Sense.DEF: a ship that has been destroyed in an accident
if someone is shipwrecked, they are in a boat or ship when it is destroyed in an accident
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beatty was shipwrecked off the coast of Africa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝蒂在非洲海岸附近遭遇了海难。

Sense.DEF: someone who builds or repairs ships
a place where ships are built or repaired

counties
in England that mostly consist of country areas
Sense.TRAN: 英格兰的几个郡〔多为农村地区〕

Sense.DEF:
a
county
a type of large powerful horse used for pulling large loads
Sense.TRAN: 拉车马﹐重挽马〔一种高大强壮的马〕

Sense.DEF: to deliberately avoid doing something you should do, because you are lazy
Sense.TRAN: 偷懒﹔〔因懒惰而〕逃避〔工作〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was fired for shirking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因偷懒被解雇了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: parents who shirk their responsibilities towards their children
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 逃避教养子女责任的父母

Sense.DEF: a piece of clothing that covers the upper part of your body and your arms, usually has a collar, and is fastened at the front by buttons
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have to wear a shirt and tie to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上班要穿衬衫打领带。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a check shirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格子衬衫

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone who is becoming angry that they should stay calm
Sense.TRAN: 保持冷静﹐不要发火〔用于劝说某人〕

Sense.DEF: to risk all your money on something
Sense.TRAN: 把所有钱都押在某事物上

Sense.DEF: the part of a shirt that covers your chest

a very offensive word for a man who is
homosexual
Sense.TRAN: 同性恋者〔有强烈冒犯意味〕

Sense.DEF:
wearing a shirt but no
jacket
the part of a shirt that covers your arm
the part of a shirt that is below your waist and is usually inside your trousers
bad-tempered, angry, and rude
Sense.TRAN: 脾气坏的﹔发怒的﹐粗暴的
Sense.EXAMPLE: No need to get shirty !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没必要发火！

Sense.DEF: small pieces of meat that are put on a long thin stick and cooked
used to express anger, annoyance, fear, or disappointment
Sense.TRAN: 呸﹐放屁﹐妈的〔表示气愤﹑害怕或失望〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shit! I’ve left my purse at home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈的！我把钱包忘在家里了。

Subsense.DEF:
solid waste that comes out of your body from your
bowel s
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a car covered in bird shit
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆落满了鸟粪的汽车

Subsense.DEF:
an act of getting rid of solid waste from your
bowel s

Sense.DEF: something that you think is bad or of very bad quality, or a bad situation
Sense.TRAN: 无用之物﹐劣质品﹔糟糕的情况
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not eating that shit!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那种垃圾食品我可不吃！

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 一件/一堆等没用的东西

Sense.DEF: something that someone says that you think is stupid or untrue
Sense.EXAMPLE: You expect me to believe that shit?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你以为我会相信那种屁话？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re full of shit the things you say are stupid or untrue .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你尽胡扯。

Sense.DEF: to not care at all about something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t give a shit what you think!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我才不管你怎么想呢！

Sense.DEF:
to have or get
diarrhoea an illness in which solid waste comes out of your body in a much more liquid form than usual
to allow someone to behave badly or treat you badly
Sense.TRAN: 允许（某人的）胡作非为﹐忍受（某人的）恶劣对待

Sense.DEF: someone who is very unpleasant and treats other people badly
to feel or look very ill, or to not look as neat and clean as you should
Sense.TRAN: 感到/看上去很不舒服﹔显得邋遢

Sense.DEF: to treat someone very badly
someone’s possessions, especially the things they have with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Get your shit together, then come on over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的东西收拾好快点过来。

Sense.DEF: used to say that sometimes bad things happen, and people cannot always prevent them from happening
used to say that there are more details that you could mention, but it should be clear to someone else what you mean
Sense.EXAMPLE: You said you had maps and shit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你说过你有地图之类的东西。

Subsense.DEF: used to express surprise or to check whether what someone has just said is true
Subsense.TRAN: 不会吧﹐真的吗〔表示惊讶或质疑〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘I can get you one for $50.’ ‘No shit?’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “50 美元我就可以给你弄到一个。”“真的吗？”

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize that what you are saying is true, or to agree that what someone else says is true
Subsense.TRAN: 真的﹐没错〔强调所说属实或同意某人说法〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They had like, no shit, 40 different kinds of beer.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有﹐40 种啤酒﹐这千真万确。

Sense.DEF: in a lot of trouble

Sense.LEXUNIT: beat/kick etc the shit out of sb
Sense.DEF: to beat, kick etc someone so violently that they are badly injured
Sense.TRAN: 把某人打得/踢得屁滚尿流

Sense.DEF: to insult someone or criticize them
used to say that there will be a lot of trouble when someone finds out about something
Sense.TRAN: 〔事情暴露时〕大麻烦到来﹐灾难临头

Sense.DEF: to feel very worried or frightened
Sense.TRAN: 吓得尿裤子﹔非常担[害怕]

Sense.DEF:
to pass solid waste out of your body from your
bowel s
to tell someone something that is untrue
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you shitting me?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是在糊弄我吗？

Sense.DEF: to treat someone very badly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This will teach you not to shit on me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是给你一个教训﹐叫你不要再欺负我。

Sense.DEF: very bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: a really shit job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 糟透了的工作

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m shit at tennis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我网球打得很糟。

Sense.DEF:
another word for
shit
very drunk
a very offensive word for someone who you think is very stupid or who you are very angry with
a place that is very dirty and unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 肮脏不堪的地方﹔令人极不愉快的地方

Sense.DEF: extremely good
to make someone feel very frightened
very frightened
Sense.TRAN: 吓得屁滚尿流的﹐吓坏的

Sense.DEF: someone who tries to cause or increase unfriendly feelings or arguments between people
very bad, unpleasant, or nasty
Sense.TRAN: 极坏的﹐糟透的﹔令人不愉快的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shitty job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很差劲的工作

Sense.DEF: a type of small dog with short legs, curly hair, long ears, and hair around its mouth that looks like a beard
to shake slightly because you are cold or frightened
Sense.TRAN: 〔因寒冷或害怕而〕颤抖﹐哆嗦﹐发抖
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jake stood shivering in the cold air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大冷天里﹐杰克站着冻得瑟瑟发抖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She shivered with fear and anger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她又是害怕﹐又是气愤﹐身体直发抖。

Sense.DEF: a slight shaking movement of your body caused by cold or fear
Sense.TRAN: 〔因寒冷或恐惧引起的〕颤抖﹐发抖
Sense.EXAMPLE: A shiver ran through went through me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我浑身一阵颤抖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt a shiver of apprehension.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感觉身体因为恐惧而抖了一下。

Sense.DEF: to make you feel afraid

Crossrefto.REFLEX: send shivers up (and down) your spine

Sense.DEF: trembling or shaking because of cold, fear, or illness
Sense.TRAN: 〔因寒冷﹑恐惧或疾病〕颤抖的﹐发抖的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt shivery and nauseous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他感到自己在发抖﹐犯恶心。

Sense.DEF: a large group of fish swimming together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a shoal of fish
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大群鱼

Sense.DEF: a small hill of sand just below the surface of water that makes it dangerous for boats
if something that happens is a shock, you did not expect it, and it makes you feel very surprised, and usually upset

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The news of his death came as a great shock to everyone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去世的消息让所有人都非常震惊。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it was a shock to find/discover etc that
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was a real shock to hear that the factory would have to close.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 听说工厂将被迫关闭﹐真是很震惊。

Sense.DEF: the feeling of surprise and disbelief you have when something very unexpected happens, especially something bad or frightening
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was shaking with shock and humiliation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她又是震惊﹐又是羞辱﹐身体直发抖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mom’s never really gotten over the shock of Dad’s death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈一直没有从爸爸去世的打击中完全恢复过来。

Sense.DEF: a medical condition in which someone looks pale and their heart and lungs are not working correctly, usually after a sudden very unpleasant experience
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was bleeding from the head and suffering from shock .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他头部流血﹐陷入休克状态。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is clearly in a state of shock .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他显然处于休克状态。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tanker driver was treated for shock and released.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油罐车司机因休克接受治疗后已经出院。

Sense.DEF:
an
electric shock

a
shock absorber
a very thick mass of hair
Sense.EXAMPLE: an energetic young man with a shock of red hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一头浓密红发﹑充满活力的年轻人

Sense.DEF: a sudden unexpected change which threatens the economic situation, way of life, or traditions of a group of people – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 〔突如其来的威胁经济形势﹑生活方式或传统的〕冲击﹐震荡〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the oil shocks of the 1970s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪70 年代的石油冲击

Sense.DEF:
violent shaking caused for example by an explosion or
earthquake
Sense.TRAN: 〔爆炸﹑地震等引起的〕剧烈震动
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shock was felt miles away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数英里之外都感觉到震动。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was a great shock to find out he had been lying.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 知道他一直在撒谎真让人震惊不已。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her death was a terrible shock to everyone.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的死让所有人都非常震惊。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: No one expected the factory to close – it was a complete shock.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 没人料到工厂会关闭——这让人非常震惊。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is very unpleasant and upsetting

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I got a shock when I saw how thin he had become.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到他变得这么消瘦,我很震惊。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Oh, you gave me quite a shock.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢,你让我吃惊不小。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He hasn’t got over the shock of losing his job yet.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他还没有从失业的打击中恢复过来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be very unexpected
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The collapse of the company came as a shock to us all.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的倒闭让我们所有人都感到震惊。

Collocate.COLLOC: be a bit of a shock
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be a shock, but not very serious or unpleasant
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t expecting to win, so it was a bit of a shock.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没想到会赢,所以有点意外。

Collocate.COLLOC: be a shock to the system
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be strange because you are not used to something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Having to work full-time again was quite a shock to the system.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 又得全天上班身体很不习惯。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be likely to have a shock
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Anyone who thinks that bringing up children is easy is in for a shock.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁认为抚养孩子容易,谁就会吃惊的。

Collocate.COLLOC: be in a state of shock
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be very shocked and upset

Collocate.COLLOC: get the shock of your life
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: get a very big shock

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very surprised and upset, and unable to believe what has happened
Sense.TRAN: 使震惊﹐使惊愕﹐使难以置信
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hatred in her voice shocked him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她语气中的仇恨让他震惊。

GramExa.PROPFORM: shock sb to hear/learn/discover etc that
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They had been shocked to hear that the hospital was closing down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 听说这家医院就要关闭﹐他们惊讶不已。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It shocked me to think how close we had come to being killed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到我们差点就没命﹐我心惊肉跳。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was shocked into action by the desperate situation in the orphanages.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被孤儿院里的惨境所震撼﹐行动了起来。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very offended, by talking or behaving in an immoral or socially unacceptable way
Sense.TRAN: 言语或行为〕惹人生气﹐使愤慨﹐使人不快
Sense.EXAMPLE: He seems to enjoy shocking people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他好像就喜欢惹人不快。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just ignore the bad language – they only do it to shock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要理会那些脏话——他们这样做只是想气你。

Sense.DEF: very surprising – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 令人震惊的﹐令人大感意外的〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: England’s shock defeat by Luxembourg
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰队对卢森堡队的意外败北

Sense.DEF: methods of achieving what you want by deliberately shocking people
Sense.TRAN: 震惊战术﹐突击手段〔故意使人吃惊以达到某目的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shock tactics are being used to stop drink drivers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 采用了“震惊战术”来制止酒后驾车者。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment connected to each wheel of a vehicle to make travelling on uneven ground more comfortable
the very quick use of a very large amount of force by the military, in order to make the enemy no longer want to fight
Sense.TRAN: 震慑战术〔使用大规模的军事力量进行快速打击以使敌军放弃抵抗的一种战术〕

Sense.DEF: feeling surprised and upset by something very unexpected and unpleasant

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was deeply shocked by Jo’s death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔的去世让我深受打击。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is shocked at what happened to his son.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿子的遭遇让他很震惊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She gave him a shocked look.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她吃惊地看了他一眼。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: For a few minutes she stood in shocked silence .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一时间﹐她惊愕地站着﹐一言不发。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We were too shocked to talk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们愕然无语。

Sense.DEF: very offended because something seems immoral or socially unacceptable
Sense.TRAN: 愤慨的﹐十分厌恶的〔因某事不道德或在社会上无法接受〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many people were shocked by the film when it first came out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片刚上映时﹐许多人都很反感。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were deeply shocked at her behaviour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对她的行为深感厌恶。

Exponent.DEF: feeling surprised and upset by something very unexpected and unpleasant
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was shocked when I heard what had happened.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听说了发生的事,感到很震惊。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We are all deeply shocked by his death.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们所有人都对他的死深感震惊。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They seemed shocked at the suggestion.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对这个建议似乎很震惊。

Exponent.DEF: shocked because something very unpleasant or frightening has happened – used when the experience has made you feel weak or nervous
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was badly shaken by the incident.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个事件让他大受打击。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She looked shaken by the news.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 看起来这个消息让她深受打击。

Exponent.EXP: be in a state of shock
Exponent.DEF: to feel shocked and unable to do normal things
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was uninjured but in a state of shock after the attack.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次袭击过后他没有受伤,但是受惊不小。

Exponent.DEF: very shocked because something unpleasant or frightening has happened
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因不愉快或可怕的事情发生而〕震惊的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was horrified to discover that her son had been taking drugs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发现儿子在吸毒后非常震惊。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was a horrified look on his face.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脸上的表情非常震惊。

Exponent.DEF: very shocked because you think something is very bad
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因认为某事极坏而〕非常震惊的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was appalled by his behaviour.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的行为让我非常震惊。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Emma was appalled at how he’d treated his mother.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃玛对他这样对待他母亲感到很震惊。

Exponent.DEF: so badly shocked that you are affected for a very long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The children were severely traumatized by years of civil war.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 多年内战使这些孩子受到严重的精神创伤。

Exponent.DEF: extremely shocked and angry
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The victim’s family were outraged at the short jail sentence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 受害者家属对于刑期之短感到十分愤怒。

Exponent.DEF: extremely shocked and sad – used when someone is extremely badly affected by something
Exponent.TRAN: 极度震惊的﹔极其悲痛的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Petra was absolutely devastated by the death of her daughter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 女儿的死让彼得拉悲痛欲绝。

Exponent.DEF: so shocked that you are unable to do or say anything immediately
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had been stunned by the news of his friend’s sudden death.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 朋友突然死亡的消息让他惊呆了。

Exponent.DEF: very shocked and unable to think clearly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He emerged from the wreck of the car, dazed but unhurt.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从汽车残骸中出来时吓呆了,但是没有受伤。

Exponent.DEF: shocked
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She looked aghast at the suggestion.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对这个建议显得很震惊。

Sense.DEF: a film, news story, action etc that shocks you – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 〔影片﹑新闻等〕引起震惊的东西〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: TV star in drugs shocker!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视明星吸毒的惊爆新闻！

Sense.DEF: very surprising, upsetting, and difficult to believe
Sense.TRAN: 惊人的﹐骇人的﹐令人难以置信的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the shocking news that Mark had hanged himself
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克上吊自杀的惊人消息
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shocking discovery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人震惊的发现
Sense.EXAMPLE: The anger in his face was shocking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脸上的怒色很吓人。

Sense.DEF: morally wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s shocking that hospitals can deny help to older people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院竟然拒绝帮助老人﹐真是令人发指。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shocking waste of money
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 惹人反感的金钱挥霍

Sense.DEF: very bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: The path was in a shocking state .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条小路的状况太糟糕了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a shocking cold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感冒得很厉害。

Sense.DEF: a very bright pink colour
someone on a radio show who plays music and talks about subjects that offend many people
Sense.TRAN: 口无遮拦的电台节目主持人

Sense.DEF: a watch, machine etc that is shockproof is designed so that it is not easily damaged if it is dropped or hit
treatment of mental illness using powerful electric shocks
Sense.TRAN: 〔治疗精神病的〕休克疗法﹐电休克疗法

Sense.DEF: the use of extreme methods to change a system or solve a problem as quickly as possible – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 休克疗法〔指用极端手段尽快改变制度或解决问题的方法﹐尤用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the government’s shock therapy economic programme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府休克疗法式的经济方案

Sense.DEF: soldiers who are specially trained to make sudden quick attacks

a very strong wave of air pressure or heat from an explosion,
earthquake
etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shock wave from the blast blew out 22 windows in the courthouse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爆炸的冲击波震碎了法院大楼里 22 扇窗户。

Sense.DEF: strong feelings of shock that people feel when something bad happens unexpectedly – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 〔对发生意想不到的坏事的〕震惊﹐震荡〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The child’s murder sent shock waves through the neighborhood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩被杀事件震惊了整个社区。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the shock waves caused by his resignation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的辞职引起的震荡

Sense.DEF: wearing shoes of the type mentioned

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children were well shod and happy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们穿着很好的鞋子﹐兴高采烈的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His large feet were shod in trainers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的一双大脚上穿着运动鞋。

Sense.DEF: made or done cheaply or carelessly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re not paying good money for shoddy goods.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们是不会花大钱去买劣质商品的。

Sense.DEF: unfair and dishonest
Sense.EXAMPLE: shoddy journalism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑暗的新闻业

PIC.HEADING: SHOES 鞋
PIC.PICCONTENT: ballet shoes 芭蕾舞鞋；court shoes BrE【英】/pumps AmE【美】浅帮女鞋；flip flops/thongs AmE【美】人字拖鞋；football boots BrE【英】足球鞋；hiking boots 远足鞋；shoehorn 鞋拔；kitten heels 弧形细中跟鞋；loafers 平跟船鞋；man's shoes 男鞋；moccasins 莫卡辛鞋；mules 拖鞋式女鞋；platform shoes 厚底鞋；pumps BrE【英】/flats AmE【美】平底鞋；slingback 露跟女鞋；sandals 凉鞋；slippers 拖鞋；heel 鞋跟；stilettos 细高跟女鞋；wedges 坡跟鞋；boots 靴子；trainers BrE【英】/sneakers AmE【美】运动鞋；clogs 木屐

Sense.DEF: something that you wear to cover your feet, made of leather or some other strong material
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sat down and took off my shoes and socks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我坐下来脱掉鞋子和袜子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What size shoes do you take?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你穿几号的鞋子？

Sense.DEF: in someone else’s situation, especially a bad one
Sense.TRAN: 处于某人的境地〔尤指恶劣处境〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t like to be in his shoes when his wife finds out what happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他妻子发现了这一切﹐他的日子就不好过了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyone in her shoes would have done the same thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何人碰到她这样的情况都会那么做的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be cross with them. Try to put yourself in their shoes imagine what it would feel like to be in their situation .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别生他们的气﹐要设身处地为他们想想。

Sense.DEF: to do a job that someone else used to do, and do it as well as they did
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll be hard to find someone to fill Pete’s shoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难找到合适的人接替皮特的位置。

Sense.DEF: a curved piece of iron that is nailed onto a horse’s foot

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was wearing smart black shoes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他穿着一双时髦的黑鞋。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Put your shoes on and get your coat.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿上鞋子,拿好外套。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They took off their shoes in the hallway.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在门厅脱下鞋子。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He tied his shoes in a double knot.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给鞋子打了个双环结。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: put them on or take them off quickly or gently
take them off by moving your legs

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her shoes and handbag were brown.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的鞋子和手提包是棕色的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You can’t walk round town all day in high-heeled shoes!
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能穿着高跟鞋在镇上走一整天呀！

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: flat shoes that are not very fashionable
with no high heel
with a thick base
fastened with laces

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I need a new pair of shoes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要一双新鞋子。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘put off your shoes’. Say 要说 take off your shoes .

Sense.DEF:
to put a
horseshoe
on a horse
Sense.EXAMPLE: We took the horses to be shod.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把马送去钉马掌。

Sense.DEF:
a
cardboard
box that shoes are sold in
a very small room, house etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was living in a shoebox in Clapham.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我住在克拉珀姆一所非常小的房子里。

Sense.DEF: a curved piece of metal or plastic that you put inside the back of a shoe when you put it on, to help your heel go in easily
a thin piece of material, like string, that goes through holes in the front of your shoes and is used to fasten them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Roger bent to tie his shoelace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗杰俯下身去系鞋带。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Your shoelaces are undone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的鞋带松了。

Sense.DEF: someone who makes shoes and boots
an occasion when someone polishes your shoes for money
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shoeshine stand
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个擦鞋摊

Sense.DEF: if you do something on a shoestring, you do it without spending much money

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The program was run on a shoestring.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这计划靠微薄的资金支撑。

Sense.DEF: a business, organization etc that does not have much money available to spend

a
shoelace
a military leader in Japan until the middle of the 19th century
Sense.TRAN: 幕府将军〔19 世纪中叶前统治日本的军事领袖〕

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
shine
Sense.TRAN: shine 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: used to tell an animal or a child to go away
Sense.TRAN: 嘘〔用以撵走动物或小孩〕

Sense.DEF: to make an animal or a child go away, especially because they are annoying you
Sense.TRAN: 发嘘声把〔动物或小孩〕赶走〔尤因受到他们烦扰时〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He shooed the kids out of the kitchen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他嘘了一声﹐把孩子们赶出厨房。

Sense.DEF: someone who is expected to easily win a race, election etc
Sense.TRAN: 比赛﹑选举等中〕预期会轻易取胜的人﹐稳操胜券者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was far from a shoo-in for president.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他当选总统尚无胜算。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He looked like a shoo-in to win the Democratic nomination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来他获得民主党提名是十拿九稳的事。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
shake
to deliberately kill or injure someone using a gun
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police shot one suspect when he pulled a gun on them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方在一名嫌疑人拔枪指着他们时击毙了他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smith killed his wife, and then shot himself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史密斯杀死妻子﹐然后开枪自杀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A woman was shot dead in an attempted robbery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名女子在一桩未遂抢劫案中中枪身亡。

GramExa.PROPFORM: shoot sb in the leg/head etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had been shot in the back while trying to escape.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图逃跑时背部中枪。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The guards have orders to shoot intruders on sight shoot them as soon as they see them .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卫兵们奉命一见到有人闯入就开枪。

Sense.DEF:
to make a bullet or
arrow
come from a weapon
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t shoot! I’m coming out with my hands up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别开枪！ 我现在举起双手出来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two guys walked in and started shooting at people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个家伙走进来﹐然后开始向人们开枪。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The soldiers had orders to shoot to kill shoot at someone with the intention of killing them .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵奉命开枪射杀。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They shot arrows from behind the thick bushes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们躲在茂密的灌木丛后面射箭。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tod’s grandfather taught him to shoot a rifle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 托德的祖父教他步枪射击。

Sense.DEF: to shoot and kill animals or birds as a sport
Sense.EXAMPLE: They spent the weekend in Scotland shooting grouse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们周末在苏格兰打松鸡。

Sense.DEF: to move quickly in a particular direction, or to make something move in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She shot past me into the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从我身边飞奔过去﹐跑进屋里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cat shot across the garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只猫飞快地蹿过花园。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Where does cotton come from?’ Ron’s hand shot up. ‘America, Miss!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “棉花来自哪里？”罗恩的手猛地举起。 “美国﹐老师！”
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fountain shoots water 20 feet into the air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喷泉把水喷射到 20 英尺高的空中。

Sense.DEF:
to kick or throw a ball in a sport such as football or
basketball
towards the place where you can get a point
Sense.EXAMPLE: Giggs shot from the halfway line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉格斯在中线上射门。

Sense.DEF: to look at someone quickly, especially so that other people do not see, to show them how you feel

GramExa.PROPFORM: shoot sb a quick/sharp/warning etc look/glance
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘You’re welcome to stay as long as you like.’ Michelle shot him a furious glance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “随你爱待多久都行。”米歇尔愤怒地瞪了他一眼。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack shot an anxious look at his mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克焦虑地看了母亲一眼。

Sense.DEF: to take photographs or make a film of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie was shot in New Zealand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片是在新西兰拍摄的。

Sense.DEF: if pain shoots through your body, you feel it going quickly through it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A sharp pain suddenly shot along his arm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的手臂上突然传过一阵剧痛。

GramExa.GLOSS: continuous short pains passing through your body

Sense.DEF: if people shoot it out, they fight using guns, especially until one person or group is killed or defeated by the other
Sense.TRAN: 用枪（与某人）决出胜负﹔开枪（与某人）决一死战
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scene in which the cops shoot it out with the drug dealers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察和毒贩拼死枪战的场面

Sense.DEF: to say or do something stupid that will cause you a lot of trouble
Sense.TRAN: 〔因说蠢话或做蠢事〕搬起石头砸自己的脚﹐自找麻烦
Sense.EXAMPLE: If he keeps talking, pretty soon he’ll shoot himself in the foot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他再讲下去﹐很快就会自取其咎。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone a lot of questions very quickly
Sense.TRAN: 对某人提出一连串的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prosecutor shot a series of rapid questions at Hendrickson.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原告律师连珠炮般向亨德里克森发问。

Sense.DEF: to talk about something that you should not talk about or that you know nothing about
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t go shooting your mouth off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别乱吹嘘了。

Sense.DEF: to have an informal conversation about unimportant things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cal and I were sitting on the porch, shooting the breeze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡尔和我坐在门廊里闲聊。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to start speaking
Sense.TRAN: 说吧﹐请讲〔用于让某人把话说出来〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I have a few questions.’ ‘OK, shoot.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我有几个问题。”“问吧。”

Sense.DEF: to say what you think in a direct way, or make a decision very quickly, without thinking about it first
to suddenly become very famous
Sense.TRAN: 一举成名/跃为明星/迅速成名
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brian, an air steward, shot to fame on the television show ‘Big Brother’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布赖恩﹐一名飞机乘务员﹐在电视节目《老大哥》中一举成名。

Sense.LEXUNIT: shoot to number one/to the top of the charts etc
Sense.DEF:
to suddenly become very successful in the popular music
charts the list of records that have sold the most copies that week
Sense.EXAMPLE: Westlife’s new album shot straight to the top of the charts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “西城男孩”的新专辑一跃升至排行榜榜首。

Sense.DEF:
to practise throwing
basketball s
into the basket
to sail a small boat along a river that is moving very fast over rocks, as a sport
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was shooting the rapids when his canoe capsized.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在玩激流划艇时他的独木舟翻了。

Sense.DEF:
to play the game of
pool

to play the game of
craps
if a plant shoots, a new part of it starts to grow, especially a new stem and leaves

to move the
bolt
on a door so that it is in the locked or unlocked position
to have used all of your money, power, energy etc

to
ejaculate

Exponent.DEF: to use a gun to fire bullets, or to kill or injure someone using a gun
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He ordered his men to stop shooting.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他命令部下停止射击。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The guards shot the man as he was trying to escape.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警卫在那人企图逃跑的时候开枪打死了他。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: President Kennedy was shot by a lone gunman.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯尼迪总统被一名独自行动的歹徒开枪射死。

Exponent.DEF: to shoot bullets from a gun, or send an explosive object towards someone or something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Soldiers fired into the crowd.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵向人群开枪。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Helicopters fired rockets at several buildings.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 直升机朝数幢建筑物发射火箭弹。

Exponent.DEF: to send a large rocket or missile into the air
Exponent.EXAMPLE: American warships launched cruise missiles.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国战舰发射了巡航导弹。

Exponent.DEF: to start shooting
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Nineteen students were injured after a gunman opened fire.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名歹徒开枪射击,造成19 名学生受伤。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Troops opened fire on a group of unarmed demonstrators.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队向一群手无寸铁的示威者开火。

Exponent.DEF: to fire shells metal containers filled with an explosive substance at enemy soldiers, cities etc in a war, using large guns
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Border towns have been shelled by enemy aircraft for the past two months.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 边境城镇在过去两个月里遭到了敌机的炮轰。

Exponent.DEF: to attack a place for a long time with shells or bombs
Exponent.TRAN: 〔用炮弹或炸弹〕连续轰炸,连续攻击
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Allied forces bombarded the coast prior to the invasion.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 盟军在入侵之前连续轰炸海岸。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Troops bombarded the area with shells.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队用炮弹轰击那个地区。

Exponent.DEF: to shoot at someone or something without aiming very carefully
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Someone tried to take a potshot at him, but hit the man behind instead.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人胡乱向他开了一枪,却击中了他身后的那名男子。

Sense.DEF: to make an enemy plane crash to the ground, by firing weapons at it
Sense.EXAMPLE: His plane was shot down over France in 1944.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1944 年他的飞机在法国上空被击落。

Sense.DEF: to kill or seriously injure someone by shooting them, especially someone who cannot defend themselves
Sense.TRAN: 开枪击伤﹐击毙〔尤指无自卫能力者〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The army were accused of shooting down unarmed demonstrators.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队被指控射杀手无寸铁的示威者。

Sense.DEF: to say or show that someone’s ideas or opinions are wrong or stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried to help, but all my suggestions were shot down in flames , as usual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想帮忙﹐但我所有的提议照例都被完全否定了。

Sense.DEF: to try to achieve a particular aim, especially one that is very difficult
Sense.TRAN: 试图达到﹐争取实现〔尤指困难的目标〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are shooting for a 50% increase in sales in the next financial year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们力争在下一个财政年度销售额增长 50% 。

Sense.DEF: to leave somewhere quickly or suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, but I’ll have to shoot off before the end of the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我得在会议结束前先走。

Sense.DEF: to leave a place quickly, especially in order to avoid someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 飞快地离开〔尤为避开某人或某事〕

Sense.DEF: to increase very quickly and suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Demand for water has shot up by 70% over the last 30 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去30年来﹐水的需求量猛增了70%。

Sense.DEF: if a child shoots up, he or she grows taller very quickly and suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t believe this is Joshua – he’s shot up since we last saw him!
