Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想不到这就是乔舒亚﹐我们上次见到他之后﹐他长这么高了！

Sense.DEF: to cause serious injury or damage to someone or something by shooting them with bullets
Sense.TRAN: 开枪击伤〔某人〕﹐开枪击毁〔某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Then two men came in and shot up the entire lobby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 然后两名男子进来﹐开枪把整个大厅打了个稀烂。

Sense.DEF: to put illegal drugs into your blood, using a needle
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kids as young as ten are shooting up heroin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有十岁的小孩都在注射海洛因。

Sense.DEF: the part of a plant that comes up above the ground when it is just beginning to grow, or a new part that grows on an existing plant
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tender green shoots will appear in February.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 二月份就会长出绿色的嫩芽来。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when someone takes photographs or makes a film
Sense.EXAMPLE: a photo shoot sponsored by Kodak
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由柯达公司赞助的照片拍摄

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s out on a video shoot .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她外出去拍录像了。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when people shoot birds or animals for sport, or the area of land where they do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The royal party was on a shoot when the incident occurred.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 事件发生时﹐皇室成员正在打猎。

Sense.DEF: the first sign that a situation is improving, especially an economic situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指经济状况〕（好转的）最初迹象﹐苗头

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are annoyed or disappointed about something
Sense.TRAN: 呸﹐倒霉〔用于表示懊恼或失望〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, shoot! I forgot to buy milk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐糟糕！ 我忘了买牛奶。

Sense.DEF: a simple computer game in which you try to kill as many enemies as possible
someone who shoots a gun
a gun

a
basketball
player who is good at throwing the ball through the basket
a situation in which someone is injured or killed by a gun
Sense.EXAMPLE: His brother was killed in a shooting incident last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他哥哥在去年的一次枪击事件中被杀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the accidental shooting of a child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名儿童的意外被枪杀

Sense.DEF: the sport of shooting animals and birds with guns
Sense.EXAMPLE: the grouse shooting season
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 松鸡狩猎季节
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shooting party set off shortly before dawn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拂晓前不久这群打猎者就出发了。

Sense.DEF: the process of taking photographs or making a film
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had two weeks of rehearsals before shooting began.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拍摄开始前﹐我们有两个星期的排练时间。

Sense.DEF: a place where people shoot guns at objects to win prizes
Sense.TRAN: 〔可赢取奖品的〕射击场﹐打靶场

Sense.DEF:
an empty building in a city, where people buy illegal drugs and
inject
them
Sense.TRAN: 毒品注射场所〔指城市中人们购买和注射毒品的闲置建筑物〕

Sense.DEF: everything, or an event that is the most complete of its kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re having a big church wedding with bridesmaids, a pageboy – the whole shooting match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将在教堂举行盛大的婚礼﹐有伴娘﹐有花童——一应俱全。

Sense.DEF: a piece of rock or metal from space, that burns brightly as it falls towards the Earth
a pointed stick with a top that opens out to form a seat
Sense.TRAN: 〔顶端打开可坐人的〕折叠座手杖

Sense.DEF: a fight using guns
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shoot-out with police
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和警察的枪战

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of nouns shop and store in British and American English. 名词 shop 和 store 在英国英语和美国英语中的使用频率。

Sense.DEF: a building or part of a building where you can buy things, food, or services

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her brother runs a record shop in Chester.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她弟弟在切斯特开了一家唱片店。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a barber’s shop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理发店
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fish-and-chip shop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸鱼薯条店
Sense.EXAMPLE: the local shops
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地的商店
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shirley saw her reflection in the shop window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雪莉在商店橱窗里看到了自己的影像。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: New potatoes are in the shops now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新马铃薯现已在店里出售了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m just going down to the shops .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正要去商店。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I spent a happy afternoon wandering around the shops.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一个下午都在开心地逛商店。

Sense.DEF: a place where something is made or repaired
Sense.EXAMPLE: The generators are put together in the machine shop .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发电机在金工车间装配。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bicycle repair shop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自行车修理店

Sense.DEF: a subject taught in schools that shows students how to use tools and machinery to make or repair things
Sense.TRAN: 工艺课﹐手艺课〔学校开设的教学生使用工具和机器制作或修理东西的课〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Doug made this table in shop.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 道格在手艺课上做了这张桌子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One auto shop class is run just for girls.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一个修车班是专门为女生开的。

Sense.DEF: to start a business
to close a shop or business, either temporarily or permanently
Sense.TRAN: 〔暂时或永久地〕停止营业﹐关店

Sense.DEF: to talk about things that are related to your work, especially in a way that other people find boring
Sense.TRAN: 谈论自己的工作〔尤指别人觉得厌烦〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m fed up with you two talking shop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们两个人老谈工作﹐我都听腻了。

Subsense.DEF: scattered around untidily
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There were bits of paper all over the shop.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小纸片撒得到处都是。

Subsense.DEF: confused and disorganized
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m all over the shop this morning.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今天早上真是乱得一团糟。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you go shopping, especially for food and other things you need regularly
Sense.TRAN: 买东西﹐购物〔尤指买食品或日常必需品〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She always does the weekly shop on a Friday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是在星期五进行每周一次的采购。

Sense.DEF: to go to one or more shops to buy things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I usually shop for vegetables in the market.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一般都在市场上买蔬菜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She always shops at Tesco’s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是在乐购购物。

Sense.DEF: to go to one or more shops to buy things, often for enjoyment
Sense.EXAMPLE: The next day, Saturday, we went shopping.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天是星期六﹐我们去逛商店了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mum’s out shopping with Granny.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈和奶奶去购物了。

Sense.DEF: to tell the police about someone who has done something illegal
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was shopped by his ex-wife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被前妻告发。

Sense.DEF: to compare the price and quality of different things before you decide which to buy
Sense.TRAN: 货比三家而后买﹐逐店比较地选购

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Take time to shop around for the best deal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 花点时间多逛几家商店﹐要买最合算的。

Sense.DEF: someone who loves to go shopping and buys lots of things they may not need
someone whose job is to help customers in a shop
bought in a shop, rather than made at home
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why buy shop-bought yoghurt when you can easily make your own?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自己做酸奶这么方便﹐为什么还要从商店买呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Homemade marzipan has a better flavour than most shop-bought varieties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自制的杏仁蛋白糖浆比大多数商店买来的品种味道更佳。

Sense.DEF: the job of putting equipment in shops, changing the way it looks etc
the area in a factory where the ordinary workers do their work

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The chairwoman started her working life on the shop floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位主席是从生产车间开始她的职业生涯的。

Sense.DEF: the ordinary workers in a factory, not the managers
Sense.TRAN: 〔工厂的〕普通工人〔非管理人员〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: negotiations between the shop floor and management
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳资双方的谈判

Sense.DEF: the outside part of a shop that faces the street
someone who owns or is in charge of a small shop
to take something from a shop without paying for it
the crime of stealing things from shops, for example by hiding them in a bag or under your clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had been falsely accused of shoplifting in a clothing store.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被冤枉在一家服装店里行窃。

Sense.DEF: someone who buys things in shops
Sense.EXAMPLE: The streets were crowded with shoppers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 街上挤满了购物的人。

Sense.DEF: the activity of going to shops and buying things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Late-night shopping is becoming very popular.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 深夜购物越来越普遍了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s gone on a shopping trip to New York.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她去纽约购物了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I went on a shopping spree went shopping and bought a lot of things at the weekend and spent far too much money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我周末大买特买了一番﹐花了好多钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got to do some last-minute shopping.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得去作最后一刻的大采购。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the busy Christmas shopping season
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忙碌的圣诞购物季

Sense.DEF: to go shopping to buy food and other things you need regularly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate doing the shopping at weekends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌在周末购物。

Sense.DEF: the things that you have just bought from a shop
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you help me carry the shopping, please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请帮我拿一下刚买来的这些东西好吗？

Sense.DEF: a large bag that you use to carry things which you have bought
a basket that you use to put things in as you walk around a shop

a large metal basket on wheels that you push around when you are shopping in a
supermarket
a group of shops together in one area, often in one large building
a list of things you need to buy when you go shopping
a group of shops together in one large covered building
an area in a town where there are a lot of shops and where cars are not allowed
Sense.TRAN: 〔城内禁止车辆通行的〕购物区﹐商业步行街

Sense.DEF:
a large metal basket on wheels that you push around when you are shopping in a
supermarket
a product that is shop-soiled is slightly damaged or dirty because it has been in a shop for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: shop-soiled goods
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 商店陈货

Sense.DEF: an idea that is shop-soiled is no longer interesting because it has been discussed many times before
Sense.TRAN: 〔观点因谈论过多次而〕不再有趣的﹐老套的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the same old shop-soiled arguments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还是那老一套的陈词滥调

Sense.DEF:
a worker who is elected by members of a
trade union
in a factory or other business to represent them in dealing with managers
conversation about your work, which other people may think is boring
Sense.TRAN: 〔会让他人感到厌烦的〕有关工作的谈话
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s enough shop talk for one evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 够了﹐谈了一晚上的工作了。

Sense.DEF: a product that is shopworn is slightly damaged or dirty because it has been in a shop for a long time
an idea that is shopworn is no longer interesting because it has been discussed many times before
Sense.TRAN: 〔观点因谈论过多次而〕不再有趣的﹐老套的
Sense.EXAMPLE: shopworn management techniques
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老一套的管理手法

Sense.DEF: the land along the edge of a large area of water such as an ocean or lake
Sense.EXAMPLE: We could see a boat about a mile from shore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看见离岸边大约一英里的地方有一艘船。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only a few survivors reached the shore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仅有几个生还者到达岸边。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She began to swim to shore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始朝岸边游去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a holiday resort on the shores of the Adriatic
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在亚得里亚海岸边的一处度假胜地

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We had a couple of hours on shore not on a ship .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在岸上逗留了几个小时。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The island is about three miles off shore away from the coast .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个岛离岸大约三英里远。

Sense.DEF: a country that has a border on the sea
Sense.TRAN: 这个国家/英国/我们的国家等〔指沿海的国家〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Millions of immigrants flocked to these shores in the 19th century.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无数移民在 19 世纪蜂拥到这个国家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: growing fears that English football players will be lured away to foreign shores
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对英国足球运动员被吸引到外国去的与日俱增的担心

Sense.DEF: to support a wall or roof with large pieces of wood, metal etc to stop it from falling down
Sense.TRAN: 〔用大块木头﹑金属等〕支撑〔墙或屋顶〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The roof had been shored up with old timbers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房顶一直用旧木材支撑着。

Sense.DEF: to help or support something that is likely to fail or is not working well
Sense.TRAN: 帮助﹐支持〔可能失败或运转不好的事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: attempts to shore up the struggling economy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为扶持摇摇欲坠的经济所作的努力

Sense.DEF: the land along the edge of a large area of water such as an ocean or lake
Sense.EXAMPLE: the bay’s 13,000 km of shoreline
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个海湾 1.3 万公里的海岸线

Sense.DEF:
a past participle of
shear
happening or continuing for only a little time or for less time than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: a short meeting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个短会
Sense.EXAMPLE: Morris gave a short laugh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫里斯笑了一声。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a short course on business English
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 商业英语短期课程
Sense.EXAMPLE: Winter is coming and the days are getting shorter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬天来临﹐白天变短了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve only been in Brisbane a short time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我才来布里斯班不久。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For a short while a short time , the city functioned as the region’s capital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城市曾经在很短的一段时间里是这个地区的首府。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I learned a lot during my short period as a junior reporter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在当初级记者的这段短暂时间里﹐我学到了许多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Germany achieved spectacular economic success in a relatively short period of time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德国在相对较短的时间里取得了非凡的经济成就。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They met and married within a short space of time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们从相识到结婚时间很短。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I promise to keep the meeting short and sweet short in a way that is good, especially not talking for a long time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我保证会议开得简短不拖拉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For a few short weeks they seemed to pass very quickly the sun shone and the fields turned gold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 短短的几个星期里﹐阳光照耀﹐田野变成了一片金黄。

Sense.DEF: measuring a small amount in length or distance
Sense.EXAMPLE: a short skirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条短裙
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anita had her hair cut short.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮塔把头发剪短了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They went by the shortest route, across the fields.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们抄近路从田野里穿过去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carol’s office was only a short distance away, and she decided that she would walk there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡罗尔的办公室并不远﹐她决定走着去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a short drive to the airport.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 开车去机场很近。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hotel is only a short walk from the beach.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店离海滩只有几步之遥。

Sense.DEF: someone who is short is not as tall as most people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a short plump woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个矮矮胖胖的女人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chris was short and stocky, with broad shoulders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯矮小敦实﹐双肩宽厚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a bit shorter than me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他比我稍矮些。

Sense.DEF: a book, letter etc that is short does not have many words or pages
Sense.EXAMPLE: a short novel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部短篇小说
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wrote a short note to explain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我写了张简短的便条作解释。

Subsense.DEF: if you are short of something, you do not have enough of it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you lend me a couple of dollars? I’m a little short.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能借点钱给我吗？我手头有点紧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our libraries are short of funds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的图书馆缺少经费。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have you all paid me? I’m about £9 short.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们都付钱给我了吗？我大概还差九英镑。

GramExa.GLOSS: I haven’t got much money at the moment

GramExa.PROPFORM: sb is not short of sth
GramExa.GLOSS: they have a lot of it
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your little girl’s not short of confidence, is she?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的小女儿自信心很足﹐是吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re not short of a few bob they are rich .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不缺钱。

Subsense.DEF: if something is short, there is not enough of it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Money was short in those days.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时候钱很紧。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s going to be difficult – time is short.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难办了——时间不够。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Gasoline was in short supply not enough of it was available after the war.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后汽油供应短缺。

Sense.DEF: to have less of something than you should have
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a nice guy, but a little short on brains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这家伙人不错﹐只是有点没头脑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president’s speech was long on colorful phrases but short on solutions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统的演讲辞藻华丽﹐但缺乏解决问题的方法。

Sense.DEF: a little less than a number

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her time was only two seconds short of the world record.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的时间和世界纪录只差了两秒钟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was just short of six feet tall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身高差一点六英尺。

Sense.DEF: if something is short notice, you are told about it only a short time before it happens
Sense.TRAN: 提前很短时间的通知﹐很迟才通知
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t make it Friday. It’s very short notice .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我星期五不行﹐时间太紧了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The party was arranged at short notice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 聚会是匆匆忙忙筹备的。

Sense.DEF: during the period of time that is not very far into the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: These measures may save money in the short term, but we’ll end up spending more later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些措施在短期内可能会省钱﹐但是到后来反而会花费更多。

Sense.DEF: if someone has a short memory, they soon forget something that has happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: Voters have very short memories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选民的记性是很差的。

Sense.DEF: to be a shorter way of saying a name
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her name is Alex, short for Alexandra.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她名叫亚历克丝﹐是亚历山德拉的简称。

Sense.DEF: to be unable to breathe easily, especially because you are unhealthy
Sense.TRAN: 呼吸短促﹐气喘吁吁〔尤因身体不健康〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He couldn’t walk far without getting short of breath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他路走长了就会气喘吁吁。

Sense.DEF: to speak to someone using very few words, in a way that seems rude or unfriendly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry I was short with you on the phone this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我今天上午在电话里怠慢了你。

Sense.DEF: to get angry very easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Yanto, who had a very short fuse, told her to get out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脾气非常暴躁的杨多先生叫她出去。

Sense.DEF: if you or your idea, suggestion etc is given short shrift, you are told immediately that you are wrong and are not given any attention or sympathy
Sense.TRAN: 〔观点﹑建议等〕当即遭到否定﹐受冷遇
Sense.EXAMPLE: McLaren got short shrift from all the record companies when he first presented his new band to them in 1976.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦克拉伦在 1976年第一次把他的新乐队推荐给各唱片公司时﹐受到了他们的一致冷落。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is very good, very surprising etc
Sense.TRAN: 毫不逊于…﹐简 直就是…〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her recovery seemed nothing short of a miracle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的康复简直是个奇迹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The results are little short of astonishing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结果太令人惊讶了。

Sense.DEF: to be given something difficult or unpleasant to do, especially when other people have been given something better
Sense.TRAN: 得个苦差事﹔比别人吃亏
Sense.EXAMPLE: Giles drew the short straw, and has to give us a talk this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贾尔斯运气不好﹐今天上午得给我们作报告。

Sense.DEF: to finish something quickly and easily, especially food or a job
Sense.TRAN: 迅速完成某事物﹐轻易解决某事物〔尤指食物或工作〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids made short work of the sandwiches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们很快就把三明治解决了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Computers can make short work of complex calculations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机能够迅速完成复杂的计算。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have/get sb by the short and curlies

Variant.LEXVAR: have/get sb by the short hairs

Sense.DEF: to put someone in a situation in which they are forced to do or accept what you want
Sense.TRAN: 强迫某人做﹐硬逼某人接受
Sense.EXAMPLE: I signed the contract – they’ve got me by the short and curlies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我签了合同﹐是他们硬逼着我签的。

Sense.DEF: used humorously to say that someone is a little crazy or stupid
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人〕有点冒傻气[愚蠢]〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lady, are you a few aces short of a deck?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女士﹐你是在犯傻还是怎么的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s one sandwich short of a picnic .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有点脑子不开窍。

Sense.DEF: when workers work for fewer hours than usual, because the company cannot afford to pay them their full wage
Sense.TRAN: 短工时﹐缩短工作时间〔因公司支付不起全额工资〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the workers were put on short time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分工人开工不足。

Sense.DEF: in a short time and without delay
Sense.TRAN: 在短时间内﹐毫不拖延地

Sense.DEF: to give someone less than the correct amount of something, especially in a shop
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指商店售货〕少给某人分量﹐给某人的分量不足

Sense.DEF: a short vowel is pronounced quickly without being emphasized, for example the sound of a in ‘cat’, e in ‘bet’, and i in ‘bit’

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He was suffering from shortness of breath.
Shirley was very conscious of her shortness and always wore high heels.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 雪莉对自己个子矮很在意﹐总是穿高跟鞋。

Exponent.DEF: not long
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I lived in Tokyo for a short time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我曾在东京短暂居住。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Smokers have a shorter life expectancy than non-smokers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟民的预期寿命比非烟民短。

Exponent.DEF: lasting only for a short time. Brief is more formal than short , and is used especially in written English.
Exponent.TRAN: 短暂的,短时间的〔brief比short正式,尤用于书面英语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The President will make a brief visit to Seattle today.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天总统将在西雅图作短暂访问。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He coached Hingis for a brief period in the 1990s.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在20世纪90年代曾短时间当过辛吉斯的教练。

Exponent.DEF: taking a short time to do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I had a quick look at the map.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很快地看了一眼地图。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had a quick shower and then went out.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他匆匆洗了澡,然后出去了。

Exponent.DEF: lasting only for a short time – used especially when someone wishes that a good situation had been able to last for longer
Exponent.TRAN: 短命的,短期的〔尤指某人希望好的状况能长久〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: short-lived success
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 短暂的成功
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The ceasefire was short-lived.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是短暂的停火。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a short-lived romance
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 短命的爱情
Exponent.EXAMPLE: short-lived optimism about the economy
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对经济的短暂乐观

Exponent.DEF: lasting only for an extremely short time – used especially when someone wishes that something had been able to last for longer
Exponent.TRAN: 转瞬即逝的,短暂的〔尤指某人希望某事物能持续更长时间〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a fleeting visit
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 匆匆的访问
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a fleeting smile
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一掠而过的笑容
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She caught a fleeting glimpse of him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只匆匆地了他一眼。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a fleeting moment of happiness
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸福的瞬间

Exponent.DEF: lasting for a very short time – used especially about feelings or pauses
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指情感或停顿〕片刻的,瞬间的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was a momentary pause in the conversation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈话中有片刻的停顿。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The momentary panic ended when he found his two-year-old son waiting happily outside the store.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到两岁的儿子开开心心地等在商店外面,他一时的惊恐消失了。

Exponent.DEF: lasting only for a short time – used especially when people are only interested in something or mention something for a short time
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指兴趣或对某事的提起〕短暂的,一时的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: passing fashions
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一时流行的风尚
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He made only a passing reference to war.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只略微提及战争。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s just a passing phase it will end soon .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只是一个暂时的阶段。

Exponent.DEF: lasting only for a short time, and ending quickly like everything else in this world
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Beauty is ephemeral.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美是短暂的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the ephemeral nature of our existence
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 生命的短暂
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His wealth proved to be ephemeral.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的财富最后转眼成空。

Exponent.DEF: someone who is short is not as tall as most people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was a short fat man.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他又矮又胖。

Exponent.DEF: quite short. This phrase sounds more gentle than saying that someone is short .
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She wasn’t very tall – maybe about 1.60 m.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不是很高——可能一米六左右。

Exponent.DEF: short and with a small body
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My mother was a small woman.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲是个个子矮小的女人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The girl was quite small for her age (=smaller than other girls of the same age).
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 以她的年龄来说,这女孩个子挺小的。

Exponent.DEF: used about a woman who is attractively short and thin
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was a petite woman with blonde hair.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是一个娇小的金发女子。

Exponent.DEF: used about a boy or man who is short, heavy, and strong
Exponent.TRAN: 〔男孩或男子〕矮而结实的,粗壮的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Harry was stocky and middle-aged.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里是一个敦实的中年人。

Exponent.DEF: short and fat
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a dumpy girl with red hair
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个矮墩墩的红头发女孩

Exponent.DEF: very short or small – used especially in descriptions in novels
Exponent.TRAN: 非常矮小的〔尤用于小说描写〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a diminutive figure dressed in black
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿着黑衣的矮小身影

Exponent.DEF: stubby fingers or toes are short and thick
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the baby’s stubby little fingers
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝胖乎乎的小手指

Sense.DEF: to be less than what you need, expected, or hoped for, or to fail to reach a satisfactory standard
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Republicans increased their share of the vote, but still fell short of a majority.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 共和党得票增加了﹐但仍达不到多数。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shares in the company dropped 26p yesterday, as profits fell short of City expectations .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天公司股票下跌 26 便士﹐因为其利润低于伦敦金融界的预期。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The economy fell short of the Treasury’s target of 2% growth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济未能达到财政部 2% 的增长目标。

GramExa.PROPFORM: fall far/a long way/well short of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Facilities in these schools fall far short of the standards required.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些学校的设施远远未达到所要求的标准。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: One or two songs on the album are interesting, but most fall short of the mark are not good enough .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张专辑中有一两首歌还算不错﹐但大部分都不怎么样。

Sense.DEF: if you are running short of something, or if something is running short, it is being used up and there will soon not be enough left
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re running short of coffee again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的咖啡又快没有了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our supplies of petrol were running short.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的汽油储备量不多了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, time’s running short !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点﹐时间不多了！

Sense.DEF: to almost do something but then decide not to do it
Sense.TRAN: 将要做某事时突然罢手﹐险些做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: They accused the president of incompetence, but stopped short of calling for his resignation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们指责总统无能﹐差点要求他辞职。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly stop speaking or stop what you are doing, because something has surprised you or you have just thought of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔在说话或做事时因吃惊或想到某事而〕突然停下
Sense.EXAMPLE: Seeing her tears, he stopped short.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到她在流泪﹐他吃惊地停了下来。

Sense.DEF: if something is cut short, it is stopped before you expect or before it is finished
Sense.EXAMPLE: His career was tragically cut short when, at the age of 42, he died of a heart attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他 42 岁时因心脏病发作早逝﹐事业不幸中断。

Sense.DEF: to interrupt and stop someone when they are speaking
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was halfway through my explanation when Walter cut me short.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正解释到一半时﹐沃尔特打断了我的话。

Sense.DEF: to surprise or shock someone so that they stop what they are doing or saying to think for a moment
Sense.TRAN: 让某人怔了一下﹐使某人愣了片刻
Sense.EXAMPLE: The question brought her up short, but, after a moment’s hesitation, she answered it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题使她愣了片刻﹐但她犹豫片刻之后还是回答了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: 3 metres/5 miles etc short of sth
Sense.DEF: without reaching a place you are trying to get to, because you are still a particular distance from it
Sense.TRAN: 距某处还差三米/五英里等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane touched down 200 metres short of the runway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这架飞机在距跑道 200 米的地方着陆。

Sense.LEXUNIT: two weeks/a month etc short of sth
Sense.DEF: two weeks, a month etc before something
Sense.TRAN: 距某时间不到两星期/一个月等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He died two days short of his fifty-sixth birthday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在 56 岁生日前两天去世了。

Sense.DEF: without actually doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Short of locking her in her room, he couldn’t really stop her from seeing Jack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他实在没有办法阻止她去见杰克﹐就差把她锁在房里了。

Sense.DEF: to fail to win or achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve been to the state tournament four times, but we’ve come up short every time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们四次参加州锦标赛﹐每一次都落败而归。

Sense.DEF: to have less of something than you need
Sense.EXAMPLE: She made sure that her children never went short.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她确保她的孩子什么都不缺。

Sense.DEF: to have a sudden strong need to go to the toilet when you are not near one
Sense.TRAN: 突然要上厕所〔而此时附近正好没有厕所〕

Subsense.DEF: short trousers ending at or above the knees
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a pair of shorts
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条短裤
Subsense.EXAMPLE: tourists in shorts and T-shirts
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿短裤和T恤的旅游者

Subsense.DEF: men’s underwear with short legs
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Craig was standing in the kitchen in his shorts.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克雷格穿着裤衩站在厨房里。

Sense.DEF: used when you want to give the main point of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carter hoped for greater trust between the two nations, more trade, more cultural exchanges – in short, a genuine peace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡特希望两国之间能够增进互信﹐增加贸易和文化交流——总而言之﹐要有真正的和平。

Sense.DEF: used as a shorter way of saying a name
Sense.EXAMPLE: His name’s Maximilian, but we just call him Max for short.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的名字叫马克西米利安﹐但我们简称他马克斯。

Sense.DEF: a short film shown in the cinema
a strong alcoholic drink that is not beer or wine, drunk in a small glass
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you fancy a short?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要来杯烈酒吗？

Sense.DEF:
a
short circuit
Sense.EXAMPLE: a short in the system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 系统短路

Crossrefto.REFLEX: the long and the short of it

Sense.DEF:
to
short-circuit
, or make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The toaster shorted and caused a fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烤面包机短路﹐引起了火灾。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which there is not enough of something that people need
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is no heating available due to fuel shortages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为燃料短缺﹐所以没有供暖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a shortage of skilled labour
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 熟练劳动力的短缺

Sense.EXAMPLE: There is no shortage of funds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不缺资金。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is a serious shortage of food in some areas.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些地区食物严重短缺。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very bad
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They were suffering because of an acute shortage of doctors and nurses.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于医护人员严重短缺,他们备受病痛折磨。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very serious and worrying
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is a desperate shortage of fresh water in the disaster area.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 灾区淡水极度缺乏。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very bad and existing for a long time
one that is increasing
a shortage of lots of different kinds of things or people

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 水资源/食物/住房等的短缺

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Poor harvests could cause food shortages in the winter.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 歉收会造成冬天食物短缺。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The strike led to serious shortages of fuel in some areas.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 罢工导致有些地区燃油严重短缺。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be likely to suffer a shortage
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The refugees face desperate shortages of food and water.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民面临食物和水的严重短缺。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make it less serious

Sense.DEF: a way of cutting a man’s hair so that it is very short at the back and sides of his head and slightly longer on top
Sense.TRAN: 男子盖式发型〔后面和两边剪得很短﹐顶部略长〕

Sense.DEF:
a hard sweet
biscuit
made with a lot of butter
shortbread

cake over which a sweet fruit mixture is poured, especially
strawberries
to treat someone unfairly by not giving them what they deserve or hoped for
Sense.TRAN: 不给〔某人〕应得的东西﹔欺骗﹔亏待
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the band only played for 15 minutes the fans felt they had been short-changed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队只演奏了15分钟﹐歌迷们觉得受骗了。

Sense.DEF: to give back too little money to a customer who has bought something and paid more than the exact amount for it
a failure of an electrical system, caused by bad wires or a fault in a connection in the wires
to have a short circuit or cause a short circuit in something
to get something done without going through the usual long methods
Sense.EXAMPLE: I short-circuited the whole process by a simple telephone call.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我绕过了整个程序﹐只打了个电话就搞定了。

Sense.DEF: a fault or weakness that makes someone or something less successful or effective than they should be
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peter was painfully aware of his own shortcomings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得痛苦地认识到了自己的短处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the shortcomings of our local government system
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们当地政府体制中的弊病

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The report suggested that there were severe shortcomings in police tactics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告暗示警方的策略存在严重缺陷。

Sense.DEF:
a type of
pastry
which breaks up easily and is used for making
pie s
a quicker and more direct way of getting somewhere than the usual one
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carlos decided to take a short-cut home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡洛斯决定抄近路回家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were late for the game, but found a short cut through the fields.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没能及时赶上看球赛﹐但找到了一条穿过田野的近路。

Sense.DEF: a quicker way of doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There aren’t really any short cuts to learning English.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学英语实在没有捷径可走。

Sense.DEF: to become shorter or make something shorter
Sense.EXAMPLE: The days are shortening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白天变得越来越短了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His name is often shortened to Pat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的名字常被简称为帕特。

Sense.DEF:
fat made from vegetable oil that you mix with flour when making
pastry l
Sense.TRAN: 起酥油〔以植物油制成﹐用于和面做糕点〕

Sense.DEF: the difference between the amount you have and the amount you need or expect

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Parents have been asked to pay £30 each to cover the shortfall in the budget.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长被要求每人支付30英镑以弥补预算的不足。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an estimated shortfall of about £1 million
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 估计有大约100万英镑的缺口

Sense.DEF: a fast method of writing using special signs or shorter forms to represent letters, words, and phrases

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The reporter took notes in shorthand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名记者用速记做记录。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a secretary who takes shorthand writes in shorthand
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会速记的秘书

Sense.DEF: a shorter but less clear way of saying something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s been ‘relocated’, which is shorthand for ‘given a worse job a long way away’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经被“重新安置”﹐这只是一个简单含蓄的说法﹐其实就是“被派到很远的地方做更差的工作”。

Sense.DEF: having fewer helpers or workers than you need

someone whose job is to use shorthand to write down what someone else says and then
type
a copy of it
a short-haul aircraft or flight travels a fairly short distance
Sense.EXAMPLE: short-haul routes within the UK
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国国内短途航线

Sense.DEF: a list of the most suitable people for a job or a prize, chosen from all the people who were first considered
Sense.TRAN: 入围[决选]名单﹐供最后挑选的人员名单

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Davies was on the shortlist for the Booker Prize.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维斯在布克奖的入围名单上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The panel will draw up a shortlist of candidates.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 专家小组将草拟候选人的入围名单。

Sense.DEF: to put someone on a short list for a job or a prize
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某人〕列入入围[决选]名单

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s been short-listed for the director’s job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被列入董事一职的决选名单。

Sense.DEF: existing or happening for only a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our happiness was short-lived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的快乐是短暂的。

Sense.DEF: soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ms Jones will be back shortly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼斯女士很快就会回来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The accident happened shortly before midday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故是在正午前不久发生的。

Sense.DEF: speaking in an impatient and unfriendly way
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ve explained that already,’ Rod said shortly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那个问题我已经解释过了。”罗德不耐烦地说。

Sense.DEF: someone in a restaurant kitchen who cooks food that can be prepared easily or quickly

short-range weapons or
missile s
are designed to travel or be used over a short distance
Sense.EXAMPLE: short-range nuclear weapons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 短程核武器

Sense.DEF: concerned only with the period that is not very far into the future
to fold the top sheet on a bed so that no one can get into it, as a trick
Sense.TRAN: 把…的上层床单叠起 〔一种恶作剧﹐把上层床单折叠起来﹐使人无法睡进去〕

Sense.DEF: unable to see objects clearly unless they are very close
not considering the possible effects in the future of something that seems good now – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 目光短浅的﹐无远见的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a short-sighted policy of reducing investment in training
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 减少培训投入的目光短浅的政策

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Thanks to the government’s short-sightedness, our hospitals are very short of cash.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于政府目光短浅﹐我们的医院资金非常紧缺。

Sense.DEF: having fewer than the usual or necessary number of workers
short-stay hotels, car parks etc are places that you can stay for only a short time
Sense.TRAN: 〔酒店〕可暂住的﹔〔停车场〕可临时停留的

Sense.DEF:
a player on a baseball team who tries to stop any balls that are hit between second and third
base 2 7
Sense.TRAN: 〔棒球第二垒与第三垒之间的〕游击手

Sense.DEF: a short written story about imaginary situations and characters
tending to become angry very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gets short-tempered when she’s tired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她累了就会脾气暴躁。

Sense.DEF: continuing for only a short time, or relating only to the period that is not very far into the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: The treatment may bring short-term benefits to AIDS sufferers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疗法对艾滋病患者可能会有短期效果。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the staff are on short-term contracts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分职员签的都是短期合同。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s suffering from short-term memory loss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她患有短期失忆症。

Sense.DEF: a way of planning or thinking that is concerned only with what gives you advantages now, rather than what might happen in the future
Sense.TRAN: 急功近利﹐注重短效〔只考虑目前利益的做法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: plans to combat short-termism among investors in British industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打击英国工业中投资者的短期效益主义的计划

Sense.DEF: a range of short radio waves used for broadcasting around the world
used as an insulting name for someone who is not very tall

a woman – used especially by people who play or listen to
hip-hop
music
Sense.TRAN: 女人〔尤为演奏或听嘻哈乐的人所使用〕

Sense.DEF:
a baby – used especially by people who play or listen to
hip-hop
music
Sense.TRAN: 婴儿〔尤为演奏或听嘻哈乐的人所使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shawna says she’s gonna be having my shorty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肖娜说她要给我生个孩子。

Subsense.DEF: an act of firing a gun
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He pulled out his rifle and fired three shots.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拽出步枪开了三枪。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She was killed by a single shot to the head.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被人击中头部一枪打死。

Subsense.DEF: the sound of a gun being fired
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Where were you when you heard the shot?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听到枪声时你在什么地方？

Subsense.DEF: someone who is good, bad etc at shooting
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sergeant Cooper is an excellent shot.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 库珀中士枪法非常好。

Subsense.DEF:
small metal balls that are shot, many at a time, from a
shotgun

large metal balls that are shot from a
cannon

Sense.DEF: an attempt in sport to throw, kick, or hit the ball towards the place where you can get a point
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shaw took a shot at the goal from the halfway line, but missed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肖从中场线射门﹐但没有射中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good shot!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好球！

Sense.DEF: a photograph

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a close-up shot of a demonstrator being beaten by a policeman
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名示威者被一个警察殴打的特写照片
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I managed to get some good shots of the carnival.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总算拍到几张狂欢节的精彩照片。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We hired a photographer to take some publicity shots .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们雇了个摄影师来拍宣传照。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: of football players ones taken of people while they are moving
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球运动员踢球时的照片

Sense.DEF: the view of something in a film or television programme that is produced by having the camera in a particular position
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the opening shot, we see Travolta’s feet walking down the sidewalk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在开场的镜头中﹐我们看到特拉沃尔塔的脚在人行道上行走。

Sense.DEF: an attempt to do something or achieve something, especially something difficult

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This is her first shot at directing a play.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是她第一次尝试导演戏剧。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If Lewis won his next fight, he would be guaranteed a shot at the title chance to win the title .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果刘易斯下一场拳赛获胜﹐他肯定有机会夺冠。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I decided to have a shot at decorating the house myself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定试试自己动手装修房子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t think I had much chance of winning the race, but I thought I’d give it a shot try to do it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得此次比赛自己获胜的机会不大﹐但我想我会尝试一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The network finally gave Keaton a shot at presenting his own show.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视台终于让基顿尝试主持自己的节目。

Sense.DEF: to make as much effort as you can to achieve something difficult
Sense.TRAN: 对某事尽自己最大的努力
Sense.EXAMPLE: This case is going to be tough, but I promise I’ll give it my best shot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个案子会很棘手﹐但我保证会尽力而为。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lydia didn’t get the job, but at least she gave it her best shot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉迪娅没有得到那份工作﹐但至少她已尽了最大的努力。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that a plan is worth trying, even though you think it is unlikely to succeed
Subsense.TRAN: 成功希望虽然不大﹐尽管不大可能成功
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s a long shot, but someone might recognise her from the photo and be able to tell us where she lives.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然希望不大﹐但也许有人会从照片上认出她﹐告诉我们她住在哪里。

Subsense.DEF: if someone is a long shot, they are not likely to be chosen for a job or to win an election, competition etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔在工作招聘﹑选举或比赛等中〕不大可能获胜
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Turner is a long shot to win next month’s mayoral election.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特纳在下个月的市长选举中获胜希望不大。

Sense.LEXUNIT: a 10 to 1 shot/50 to 1 shot etc
Sense.DEF: a horse, dog etc in a race, whose chances of winning are expressed as numbers
Sense.TRAN: 赔率为10比1/50比1的赛马［赛狗等］

Sense.DEF: an attempt to guess something without having any facts or definite ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: My answer to the last question was a complete shot in the dark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最后一道题的答案完全是蒙的。

Sense.DEF: a remark that is intended to criticize or hurt someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not going to sit here listening to you two take shots at each other all night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可不想坐在这里一整夜就听你们两个互相攻击。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She couldn’t resist a parting shot one that you make just before you leave – ‘And you were a lousy lover!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她临走时忍不住扔下一句话——“而且你是个非常糟的情人！”
Sense.EXAMPLE: That was a cheap shot ! one that is unfair and unreasonable
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样说不公平！

Sense.DEF: if you do something like a shot, you do it very quickly and eagerly
Sense.TRAN: 〔做事〕飞快地﹐毫不迟疑地﹐立刻
Sense.EXAMPLE: If he asked me to go to Africa with him, I’d go like a shot!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他叫我和他一起去非洲﹐我会毫不迟疑地去！

Sense.LEXUNIT: a shot across the bows/a warning shot (across the bows)
Sense.DEF: something you say or do to warn someone that you oppose what they are doing and will try to make them stop it – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 警告〔表示反对并会阻止某人做某事﹐尤用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president’s own supporters are firing a warning shot across his bows .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统自己的支持者对他提出了警告。

Sense.DEF: an important or powerful person, especially in business
Sense.EXAMPLE: a big shot in the record business
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唱片业的大腕

Sense.DEF: a small amount of a strong alcoholic drink

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a shot of tequila
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一小口特奎拉酒

Sense.EXAMPLE: a shot glass a small glass for strong alcoholic drinks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烈酒杯

Sense.DEF:
an
injection
of a drug when it is put into the body with a needle
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you had your typhoid and cholera shots?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你打过伤寒和霍乱的预防针了吗？

Sense.DEF: something that makes you more confident or more successful
Sense.TRAN: 鼓舞人心的事情﹐强心针
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new factory will give the local economy a much needed shot in the arm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家新工厂将会为当地的经济注入迫切需要的一针强心剂。

Sense.DEF:
a heavy metal ball that competitors try to throw as far as possible in the sport of
shot put

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The passenger in the car fired three shots.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 车上的乘客开了三枪。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: fire a shot trying to hit someone
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Someone took a shot at her, but missed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人朝她开了一枪,但是没有打中。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The shot hit the burglar in the chest and killed him instantly.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一枪击中窃贼胸膛,他当即毙命。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: doesn’t hit them
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 一枪没有打中某人/某物
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The first shot missed my head by inches.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一枪差点击中我的头部。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: is heard

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A pistol shot rang out in the darkness.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑暗中响起一声枪响。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: just one shot
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He died from a single shot to his heart.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被人一枪击中心脏而死。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the shot that killed someone
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It wasn’t clear who had fired the fatal shot.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 不清楚是谁开了致命的一枪。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one fired as a warning to someone
a number of shots fired quickly

Sense.DEF: in bad condition because of being used too much or treated badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: My back tires are shot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的后轮胎磨坏了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My nerves were shot to pieces after my driving test.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 驾驶执照考试结束后﹐我感到精疲力竭。

Sense.DEF: to get rid or want to get of someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 摆脱某人/某物﹐把某物处理掉
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know the director wants shot of me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道主管想把我开除掉。

Subsense.DEF: if a piece of cloth is shot through with a colour, it has very small threads of that colour woven into it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a fine silk shot through with gold threads
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 织有金线的精美丝绸

Subsense.DEF: to have a lot of a particular quality or feeling
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a charming collection of stories, shot through with a gentle humour
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本妙趣横生﹑引人入胜的短篇小说集

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
shoot
Sense.TRAN: shoot 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: a long gun fired from the shoulder, that shoots many small round balls at one time, used especially for killing birds or animals
Sense.EXAMPLE: The robbers were armed with sawn-off shotguns ones that have been made shorter, so the balls go in different directions .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抢劫者手持枪管被锯短的猎枪。

Sense.DEF: a wedding that has to take place immediately because the woman is going to have a baby
a sport in which you throw a heavy metal ball as far as you can

Subsense.DEF: used to say what is the right or sensible thing to do
Subsense.TRAN: 应当﹐应该〔用于表示做某事是正确或明智的〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He shouldn’t be so selfish.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不该这么自私。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Children shouldn’t be allowed to play in the street.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不应该让儿童在街上玩。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘I don’t care what people think.’ ‘Well, you should.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不在乎别人怎么想。”“噢﹐你还是应该在乎的。”
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Why shouldn’t I smoke if I want to?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我想抽烟﹐为什么不可以抽？

Subsense.DEF: used to say what would have been right or sensible, but was not done
Subsense.TRAN: 应当﹐应该〔用于表示某事应该做却没有做〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They should have called the police.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们应该报警的。

Sense.DEF: used to give or ask for advice
Sense.TRAN: 应当﹐应该 〔用于提供或征求建议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What should I do? Should I trust him?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我该怎么办？我应该相信他吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should read his new book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该读一读他的新书。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I should stay in bed if I were you .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要是你﹐就卧床休息。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you expect something to happen or be true
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It should be a nice day tomorrow.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天应该是个好天气。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Try phoning Robert – he should be home by now.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给罗伯特打个电话试试﹐他现在应该到家了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Australia should win this match.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 澳大利亚队应该能够打赢这场比赛。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Artistic people can be very difficult sometimes.’ ‘Well, you should know – you married one.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “搞艺术的人有时很难相处。” “这个你应该知道的——你就嫁了一个这样的人。”

Subsense.DEF: used to say what was expected, but did not happen
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It was an easy test and he should have passed, but he didn’t.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次测验很容易﹐他应该可以通过的﹐但却没有。

Sense.DEF: used to say what is the correct amount, the correct way of doing something etc
Sense.TRAN: 应该﹐应当〔用于表示正确的数量﹑做某事的正确方法等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every sentence should start with a capital letter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个句子都应该以大写字母开头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you mean, there are only ten tickets? There should be twelve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是什么意思﹐只有十张票？ 应该有十二张才对。
Sense.EXAMPLE: White wine, not red, should be served with fish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吃鱼应该喝白葡萄酒﹐而不是红葡 萄酒。

Sense.DEF: used in official orders and instructions
Sense.TRAN: 应该﹐应当〔用于官方指示〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Passengers should proceed to Gate 12.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘客请前往 12 号登机口登机。

Sense.DEF:
used in a
clause
beginning with ‘that’ after particular adjectives and verbs
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于 that 引导的从句中﹐跟在某些形容词和动词之后〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s strange that you should say that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这么说很奇怪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is essential that he should have a fair trial.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给他一个公正的审判﹐这一点非常重要。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The residents demanded that there should be an official inquiry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 居民要求进行官方调查。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about something that may possibly happen or be true
Sense.TRAN: 可能〔用于表示某事可能会发生或属实〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Naturally, he was nervous in case anything should go wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他当然担心﹐怕事情会出岔子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What if I should fall sick and not be able to work?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 万一我生病无法工作的话怎么办？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Should you need any help if you need any help , you can always phone me at the office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你需要什么帮助﹐随时可以打我办公室的电话。

Sense.DEF: used after ‘I’ or ‘we’ to say what you would do if something happened or was true
Sense.TRAN: 〔置于 I 或 we 之后﹐表示如果某事发生或属实的话会做什么〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If anyone treated me like that, I should complain to the manager.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果有人这样对我﹐我就会向经理投诉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I should be surprised if many people voted for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有许多人投他的票那才怪呢。

Sense.DEF: used to politely ask for something, offer to do something, or say that you want to do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于礼貌地表示想要某物﹐或想要做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I should be grateful if you could provide me with some information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你能为我提供一些消息﹐我不胜感激。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What can I get you?’ ‘I should like a long cool drink.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你要点什么？”“我想来一大杯清凉饮料。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: We should be delighted to help in any way we can.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们乐意尽我们所能提供帮助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I should like to thank you all for coming here tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感谢大家今天晚上来到这里。

Sense.DEF: used as the past tense of ‘shall’ after ‘I’ or ‘we’ to say what you intended or expected to do
Sense.TRAN: 〔用作 shall 的过去式﹐置于I或we之后﹐表示打算或期望做的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We knew that we should be leaving the next day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们知道我们第二天就要走。

Sense.LEXUNIT: what should I see but sth/who should appear but sb etc
Sense.DEF: used to show that you were surprised when you saw a particular thing, when a particular person appeared etc
Sense.TRAN: 你猜我看到了什么/你猜谁来了等〔用于表示惊讶〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just at that moment, who should walk in but old Jim himself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在那时﹐你猜猜谁进来了？ 就是那个老吉姆本人。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how funny, strange, beautiful etc something was that you saw or heard
Sense.TRAN: 你该亲眼看看/听听某事物〔用于强调所看到或听到的多么有趣﹑奇怪﹑漂亮等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should have seen the look on her face when I told her I’d won first prize.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我告诉她我得了一等奖﹐当时她脸上的那副表情你真该看看。

Sense.DEF: used to express surprise that something has happened or that someone has asked you a particular question
Sense.TRAN: 怎么会/为什么会…？〔用于表示惊讶〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why should anyone want to marry Tony?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎么竟然会有人意嫁给托尼？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t ask me. How should I know?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别问我﹐我怎么会知道？

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you think or hope something is true, when you are not certain
Subsense.TRAN: 我认为/估计/希望〔用于表示认为或希望某事属实﹐但不太肯定〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I shouldn’t think they’ve gone far.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想他们应该不会走远。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘I suppose there’ll be a lot of complaints?’ ‘I should imagine so.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我看会有很多投诉吧？”“我想是的。”

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are not surprised by what someone has told you because you have moral reasons to expect it
Subsense.TRAN: 我想应该如此〔用于强调对别人告知的事情不感到意外﹐因为出于道德上的原因你预计如此〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘She doesn’t like to hear me swearing.’ ‘I should think not.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她不喜欢听到我说粗话。”“我想这是当然的。”
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘He did apologize.’ ‘I should hope so, after the way he behaved.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他是道了歉。”“他那样的行为﹐理应道歉。”

Sense.DEF: one of the two parts of the body at each side of the neck where the arm is connected
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tapped the driver on the shoulder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拍拍司机的肩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He put his arm around her shoulders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用手臂搂住她的肩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His shoulders were broad and powerful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的肩膀宽阔强壮。

Sense.DEF: the part of a piece of clothing that covers your shoulders
Sense.EXAMPLE: a jacket with padded shoulders
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件有垫肩的夹克衫

Sense.DEF: the upper part of the front leg of an animal that is used for meat

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a shoulder of pork
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 猪肘子

Sense.DEF: to feel worried that something unpleasant is going to happen to you

Subsense.DEF: someone who gives you sympathy
Subsense.TRAN: 给予安慰的人﹐倾诉的对象
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Ben is always there when I need a shoulder to cry on.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我需要有个人倾诉一下时﹐本总是在我身边。

Subsense.DEF: to get sympathy from someone when you tell them your problems
Subsense.TRAN: 向某人倾诉〔以得到安慰〕

Subsense.DEF: having the same aims and wanting to achieve the same thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are working shoulder to shoulder with local residents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们和当地居民肩并肩共同努力。

Subsense.DEF: physically close together
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Blacks and whites stood shoulder to shoulder in the stands to applaud.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑人和白人并肩站在看台上鼓掌。

Sense.DEF: if blame or a difficult job falls on someone’s shoulders, they have to take responsibility for it
Sense.TRAN: 〔责任〕由某人承担﹔〔任务〕落在某人肩上
Sense.EXAMPLE: The blame rests squarely on Jim’s shoulders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过错全都归在吉姆身上。

Sense.LEXUNIT: put your shoulder to the wheel
Sense.DEF: to start to work with great effort and determination
Sense.TRAN: 甩开膀子干﹔开始奋力工作

Sense.DEF: an area of ground beside a road, where drivers can stop their cars if they are having trouble
a rounded part just below the top of something

Crossrefto.REFLEX: have a chip on your shoulder
be/stand head and shoulders above sb

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: raise them to show that you do not know or care about something
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 耸肩膀〔表示不知道或无所谓〕
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Susan just shrugged her shoulders and said nothing.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏珊只是耸耸肩膀,什么也没说。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: raise your shoulders and bend them forwards slightly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He hunched his shoulders against the rain.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在雨中耸起肩膀。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: look behind you
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He glanced over his shoulder and grinned at me.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他回过头来冲我咧嘴笑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: because they are crying or laughing
move downwards because they are sad or tired
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔因为伤心或疲倦〕某人肩膀垂下

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: move up and down because they are crying or breathing deeply
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔因为哭泣或深呼吸〕某人肩头起伏

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was of medium height, with broad shoulders.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他中等个子,肩膀宽阔。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had powerful shoulders and a thick neck.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他肩膀强壮,脖子粗。

Sense.DEF: to accept a difficult or unpleasant responsibility, duty etc
Sense.TRAN: 承担责任/过失/费用/负担等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The residents are being asked to shoulder the costs of the repairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 居民们被要求承担这笔修理费用。

Sense.DEF: to lift something onto your shoulder to carry it
Sense.EXAMPLE: They shouldered the boat and took it down to the river.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把船扛在肩上抬到河里。

Sense.DEF: to move through a large crowd of people by pushing with your shoulder
Sense.TRAN: 用肩膀挤着穿过/进入等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ran after her, shouldering his way through the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他挤过人群去追她。

Sense.DEF: an order given to soldiers telling them to hold their weapon against their shoulder
a bag that hangs from your shoulder
one of the two flat bones on each side of your back
as high as your shoulder
Sense.EXAMPLE: The grass was shoulder-high.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这草有齐肩高。

Sense.DEF: shoulder-length hair hangs down to your shoulders
a small thick piece of material that is fixed inside the shoulders of dress or jacket to make your shoulders look bigger
a long narrow piece of material on a dress or other piece of women’s clothing that goes over the shoulder
a long narrow piece of material fixed to a bag etc so that you can carry it over your shoulder

the act of looking over someone’s shoulder when they are putting their
pin number
into a machine, in order to use the number to steal money from their account
Sense.TRAN: 肩窥〔从别人背后偷看银行卡密码以盗取其账户存款的行为〕
the short form of 缩略式=‘should not’

Sense.DEF:
the second person singular form of the verb
should
Sense.TRAN: 动词 should 的第二人称单数形式

Sense.DEF: to say something very loudly
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no need to shout! I can hear you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用不着大声喊叫！我听得见！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wish you’d stop shouting at the children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你别再对孩子们大声嚷嚷了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We could hear them shouting for help .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们听到他们大声呼救。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Watch out!’she shouted, as the car started to move.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “小心！”汽车开动时﹐她大声喊道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was shouting insults at the lorry driver.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对卡车司机大声谩骂。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘He’s down here!’ she shouted to Alison.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “他在这里！”她对艾莉森大声喊道。

Sense.DEF: to call out loudly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Al shouted in pain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿尔痛得大叫起来。

Sense.DEF: to tell everyone about something because you want everyone to know about it
Sense.TRAN: 使某事尽人皆知﹐使某事家喻户晓

Sense.DEF: to write in capital letters in an email, which makes it look as if the writer is angry
Sense.TRAN: 使用大写字母〔写电子邮件﹐表示生气〕

Exponent.DEF: to say something very loudly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The two men were shouting angrily at each other.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个男人在互相叫骂。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Wait for me!’ he shouted.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “等等我！”他大喊。

Exponent.DEF: to shout very loudly, especially because you are angry, excited, or in pain. Yell is more informal than shout .
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因生气﹑激动或疼痛而〕大声喊叫〔yell比shout更通俗〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The children were yelling at each other across the street.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们隔着街对喊。

Exponent.DEF: to shout in order to get someone’s attention
Exponent.TRAN: 大喊,高叫〔以引起某人注意〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He called her name but she didn’t hear him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大声喊她名字,但是她没有听见。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Is anybody there?’ he called out.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “有人吗？”他大喊。

Exponent.DEF: to shout something loudly, especially because you are in pain, frightened, or very excited
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因疼痛﹑害怕或非常激动而〕大喊,高叫,大叫
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘I can’t move,’ Lesley cried.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “我动不了啦。”莱斯利大叫。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He cried out in panic.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吓得大叫起来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Look what I’ve found!’ she cried.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “看我找到了什么！”她高声喊道。

Exponent.DEF: to shout in a very loud high voice, because you are frightened, unhappy, angry etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因为害怕﹑不开心或气愤等而〕尖叫
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The baby wouldn’t stop screaming.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝尖声哭叫个不停。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She screamed as she jumped into the cold water.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她跳进冷水时尖叫了一声。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘It’s my money!’ she screamed at him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “这是我的钱！”她冲他尖声叫道。

Exponent.DEF: to shout in a loud deep voice
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The crowd roared their appreciation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群中响起一片赞叹声。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Stop this nonsense!'he roared.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “别胡说！”他吼道。

Exponent.DEF: to shout in a loud deep voice, especially when you want a lot of people to hear you
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指希望许多人听到而〕大声喊出
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was bellowing orders at the soldiers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正在对士兵发号施令。

Exponent.DEF: to shout in a loud and unpleasant way, because you are angry or unhappy
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因为生气或不开心而〕叫嚷,大喊
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘What are you doing?’ he bawled.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “你干什么？”他大声吼道。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The kids were bawling in the back of the car.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在汽车后座大声嚷嚷。

Exponent.DEF: to say something more loudly than normal, especially because you are angry
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I never heard my father raise his voice.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来没有听到过父亲提高嗓门说话。

Exponent.DEF: if a group of people cheer, they shout as a way of showing their approval
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The crowd cheered when the band came on stage.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队一上台,人群就欢呼起来。

Sense.DEF: to shout so that someone who is speaking cannot be heard
Sense.TRAN: 大声喊叫把〔某人的声音〕压下去
Sense.EXAMPLE: An older man tried to shout him down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位年纪稍大的人大声地喊着﹐想盖过他的声音。

Sense.DEF: to say something suddenly in a loud voice
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t shout out the answer in class, put up your hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上课时回答问题不要大声喊﹐要举手。

Sense.DEF: a loud call expressing anger, pain, excitement etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔表示生气﹑疼痛﹑兴奋等的〕喊叫（声）﹐呼叫（声）
Sense.EXAMPLE: a warning shout
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警告的呼喊声

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tom gave a shout of laughter when he saw them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆看见他们﹐发出一声大笑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: shouts of delight
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欢呼声

Sense.DEF: to go and find someone and tell them something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give me a shout when you’re ready to go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你准备好动身时告诉我一声。

Sense.DEF: a message to someone that is broadcast on radio, put on a website etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过广播送出或在网上发布等的〕给某人的留言
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just want to give a quick shout out to my friend Dave, who’s in hospital at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想给我的朋友戴夫简短地留个言﹐他目前正在住院。

Sense.DEF: someone’s turn to buy drinks
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s my shout. Same again?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这回轮到我请客了﹐还要同样的吗？

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in with a shout (of doing sth)
Sense.DEF: to have a chance of winning
Sense.TRAN: （做某事）成功在望﹐有获胜的机会

Sense.DEF: when people say things very loudly
Sense.EXAMPLE: We heard a lot of shouting and went to investigate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们听到一片嚷嚷声﹐就走过去看个究竟。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be all over bar the shouting
Sense.DEF: used to say that something is almost finished and there is no doubt what the result will be
an angry argument in which people shout at each other
to push someone or something in a rough or careless way, using your hands or shoulders
Sense.EXAMPLE: He shoved her towards the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他推着她走向汽车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone was pushing and shoving to see the prince.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都推着挤着要看王子。

Sense.DEF: to put something somewhere carelessly or without thinking much
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tidying the room seems to mean shoving everything under the bed!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整理房间好像就是把所有东西往床底下一塞就算完事了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: He shoved his hands into his pockets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把双手插进口袋里。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone in a very impolite way that you do not want something
Sense.TRAN: 去他的…﹐让…见鬼〔非常无礼地表示拒绝〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They can take their three cents an hour raise and shove it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去他们的每小时涨三美分。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone rudely or angrily to go away
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shove off! I’m busy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滚开！ 我忙着呢。

Sense.DEF: to push a boat away from the land, usually with a pole
to move along on a seat to make space for someone else
Sense.TRAN: 〔在座位上〕挪动身子〔给别人腾出地方〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shove up, mate, there’s no room to sit down here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朋友﹐挪过去一点﹐这里坐不下了。

Sense.DEF: a strong push
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give the door a good shove .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把门使劲推一下。

Sense.DEF: a tool with a rounded blade and a long handle used for moving earth, stones etc
a part of a large vehicle or machine used for moving or digging earth
Sense.TRAN: 〔推土机﹑挖土机前面的〕铲﹐铲形部分

Sense.DEF: to lift and move earth, stones etc with a shovel
Sense.EXAMPLE: The workmen shovelled gravel onto the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们把碎石铲到路面上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were out in freezing conditions shovelling snow off the pitch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在外面冒着严寒铲掉球场上的雪。

GramExa.GLOSS: shovel snow from a road or path
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 铲去私人车道/人行道等上的积雪
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everyone was out shovelling their sidewalks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都在外面铲人行道上的积雪。

Sense.DEF: to put something, usually food, somewhere quickly
Sense.TRAN: 迅速将某物〔一般指食物〕放进…里/放在…上
Sense.EXAMPLE: We shovelled food into our mouths as fast as we could.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们尽快把食物塞进嘴里。

Sense.DEF: the amount of coal, snow, earth etc that you can carry on a shovel

information that first appears in printed form, for example in a book or newspaper, and then is put onto the Internet or
cd-rom
without any new or interesting ways to look at or use the information
Sense.TRAN: 铲件﹐铲送品〔指对印刷品上首次出现的信息内容在因特网或只读光盘上所做的毫无新意的照搬〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of the educational software titles are nothing but shovelware.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多教育软件都只不过是些“铲送品”。

Sense.DEF: to let someone see something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children proudly showed me their presents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们自豪地给我看他们的礼物。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Show your ticket to the woman at the entrance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 向入口处的那位女士出示你的门票。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The man grinned, showing bad teeth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那男人咧着嘴笑﹐露出一口坏牙。

Sense.DEF: to provide facts or information that make it clear that something is true, that something exists, or that something has happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: Figures showed a 9% rise in inflation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数据显示通货膨胀上升了9%。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gary has shown his faith in the club’s future by agreeing to stay on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加里同意留下﹐表明了他对这家俱乐部的未来有信心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mike needed a copy of the will to show that the books had been left to him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克需要拿到那份遗嘱的副本来证明那些书是留给他的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have shown our critics that we can succeed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经向批评者证明﹐我们是能够成功的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This document shows how to oppose bad decisions about new housing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份文件说明如何抵制有关新住房的不当决定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She just wants a chance to show what she can do.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她就想有一个机会来展示自己的能力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Charles showed himself to be a fine leader.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯证明自己是一位出色的领导。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The campaign has been shown to be a waste of money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次宣传活动结果证明是在浪费钱财。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The new treatment has been shown to reduce the number of deaths.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种新疗法被证明可以减少死亡人数。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several studies have shown that aggressive toys lead to bad behaviour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 多项研究表明﹐有攻击性的玩具会导致不良行为。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The Polish economy began to show signs of recovery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 波兰的经济开始出现复苏的迹象。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It just goes to show proves how much people judge each other on how they look.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这恰恰证明人们相互之间经常就是以貌取人。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often prefer to use indicate , which sounds more formal than show .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中,人们往往会使用indicate,因其显得比show更正式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The latest statistics indicate that the country is falling deeper into recession.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 最新统计显示,该国的经济正陷入更深的衰退。
F2NBox.EXPL: In scientific contexts, they often prefer prove or demonstrate , which sound more definite.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在科技语境中,人们往往会使用prove或demonstrate,显得更为确定
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: This research demonstrates the need to treat cancer early.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项研究表明,癌症需要尽早治疗。

Sense.DEF: to let your feelings, attitudes, or personal qualities be clearly seen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Think positively and show some determination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要往好的方面想﹐拿出决心来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had learned not to show her emotions .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她早就学会了不流露出自己的感情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the sound a man might make when in pain but trying not to show it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一个人强忍着疼痛不愿表露出来时发出的声音。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary showed great interest in the children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽对这些小孩子表示出极大的兴趣。

Sense.DEF: to explain to someone how to do something, by doing it yourself or using actions to help them learn

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Show me how the gun works.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教教我这枪怎么用。

GramExa.PROPFORM: show sb how to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Maureen showed Peter how to feed the young animals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫琳给彼得示范怎样喂这些小动物。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you show Lucy the way to slice onions?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你来教露西切洋葱片好吗？

Sense.DEF: if a picture, map etc shows something, you can see it on the picture, map etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want a photograph that shows his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要一张能够看清他的脸的照片。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The map shows the main rivers of the region.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张地图上标示出了该地区的主要河流。

Sense.DEF: to go with someone and guide them to a place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you show Mrs Davies to the bathroom?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能带戴维斯太太去卫生间吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can show myself out out of the office or house .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我自己能出去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Come on, I’ll show you the way .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 来吧﹐我给你带路。

Sense.DEF: to let someone see where a place or thing is, especially by pointing to it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you show me exactly where he fell?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你指给我看他掉下去的确切位置好吗？

Sense.DEF: to make a film or television programme available on a screen for people to see, or to be on a screen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film was shown on television last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影昨晚在电视里播放了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The match was shown live could be seen on television while it was being played .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场比赛是现场直播的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s now showing at cinemas across London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在全伦敦的电影院都在放映这部电影。

Sense.DEF: if something shows, it is easy to see
Sense.EXAMPLE: His happiness showed in his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喜形于色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her scar doesn’t show, because her hair covers it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的疤看不见﹐被头发遮住了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stephen was worried, and it showed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看得出斯蒂芬很担心。

Sense.DEF: if material shows the dirt or a mark, it is easy to see the dirt or mark on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Light-coloured clothes tend to show the dirt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 淡颜色的衣服容易显脏。

Sense.DEF: to have an increase or decrease in something, or a profit or loss
Sense.TRAN: 显示﹐表明 〔增加或减少﹐赢利或亏损〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The price of players is the reason why many football clubs show big losses on their balance sheets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球员的身价是许多足球俱乐部的资产负债表上显示大笔亏损的原因。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Recent elections have shown significant gains by right-wing groups.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的选举表明右翼团体的得票数量大幅增加。

Sense.DEF: to put a group of paintings or other works of art in one place so that people can come and see them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her recent sculptures are being shown at the Hayward Gallery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她近期的雕塑作品正在海沃德画廊展出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Whitney Museum was the first to show Mapplethorpe’s photographs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 惠特尼美术馆最早展出马普尔索普的摄影作品。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you will prove to someone that you are better, more effective etc than they think you are
Sense.TRAN: 我要证明给他/他们等看

Sense.LEXUNIT: have sth to show for sth
Sense.DEF: to have something as a result of what you have been doing
Sense.TRAN: 在某个方面的努力取得某种成果
Sense.EXAMPLE: If he fails, he’ll have nothing to show for his time at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他考试通不过﹐他在学校里就是一无所成。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had plenty of money to show for all her work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她辛辛苦苦赚了很多钱。

Sense.DEF: if you will not show your face somewhere, you will not go there because you have a good reason to feel ashamed or embarrassed about being there
Sense.EXAMPLE: She never shows her face around here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从来不在这里露面。

Sense.DEF: to make your true power or intentions clear, especially after you have been keeping them secret
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指保密一段时间后〕显露实力﹔表明意图﹐摊牌
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were so many rumours that the company was forced to show its hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谣言满天飞﹐该公司被迫讲明意图了。

Sense.DEF: to put an animal into a competition with other animals
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you plan to show your dogs?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你打算让你的狗去参加比赛吗？

Sense.DEF: to arrive at the place where someone is waiting for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I went to meet Hank, but he never showed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去接汉克﹐可是他根本没有出现。

Sense.LEXUNIT: show sb in a good/bad etc light
Sense.DEF: if an action shows you in a good or bad light, it makes people have a good or bad opinion of you
Sense.TRAN: 使人们对某人有好/不好等的评价等
Sense.EXAMPLE: During an interview, you need to show yourself in the best possible light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面试的过程中﹐你得表现出自己最好的一面。

Sense.DEF: to make it clear that someone is not welcome and should leave
Sense.TRAN: 撵某人出去﹐对某人下逐客令

Sense.DEF: to prove to someone who is threatening your authority that you are more powerful than they are
Sense.TRAN: 让某人明白该听谁的﹐要某人服从指挥
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve got to show your dog who’s boss. When you say sit, he should sit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定要让你的狗学会服从。你叫它蹲下﹐它就得蹲下。

Sense.DEF: if you show the way for other people, you do something new that others then try to copy
to make it clear that you are willing to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hasn’t done any cooking yet, but at least he’s shown willing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他还没有下过厨﹐但至少表示愿意做。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to get out of bed

Sense.LEXUNIT: show (sb) a clean pair of heels
Sense.DEF: to run away very fast
used to tell someone to give or pay you a lot of money, rather than just talk about the fact that they will give it to you
Sense.TRAN: 把钱拿出来呀〔用于叫某人不要光说会给钱〕

Sense.DEF: to go around a place with someone when they first arrive there, to show them what is interesting, useful etc
Sense.TRAN: 带〔某人〕四处看看（某地）﹐带〔某人〕参观（某地）
Sense.EXAMPLE: Harrison showed her around the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里森带她在房子里转了转。

Sense.DEF: to try to make people admire your abilities, achieve-ments, or possessions – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 炫耀﹐卖弄﹐表现自己〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He couldn’t resist showing off on the tennis court.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他忍不住要在网球场上表现一番。

Sense.DEF: to show something to a lot of people because you are very proud of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a picture of the restaurant’s owners showing off their award
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 餐馆老板炫耀奖品的一张照片

Sense.DEF: if one thing shows off something else, it makes the other thing look especially attractive
Sense.TRAN: 使某物显得漂亮﹐衬托某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The white dress showed off her dark skin beautifully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白色的裙子把她黝黑的皮肤衬托得很漂亮。

Sense.DEF: to guide someone through an interesting building or a house that is for sale
Sense.TRAN: 带领…参观〔有趣的建筑物或待售的房子〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ingrid has a job showing visitors over the castle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格丽德的工作是带游客参观这座城堡。

Sense.DEF: to arrive, especially at the place where someone is waiting for you
Sense.TRAN: 到达〔尤指有人在等候之处〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Seth showed up, apologising for being late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塞思到了﹐道歉说来晚了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had 200 people show up for our seminar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的研讨会来了200人。

Sense.DEF: to make it possible to see or notice something that was not clear before
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sunlight showed up the marks on the window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳光把窗户上的污点显了出来。

Sense.DEF: to be easy to see or notice
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use a light colour which will show up on a dark background.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用浅颜色﹐这样在深色背景上会比较明显。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel embarrassed by behaving in a stupid or unacceptable way when you are with them
Sense.TRAN: 〔因举止失当〕使某人难堪[丢脸﹐尴尬]
Sense.EXAMPLE: She says I showed her up in front of her friends when they came to the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说﹐她朋友来家里时﹐我让她在他们面前丢脸了。

Section.SECHEADING: LET SOMEONE SEE 让某人看见

Exponent.DEF: to let someone see something, especially by holding it out in front of them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Everyone has to show their identity cards at the entrance to the building.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都必须在大楼入口处出示身份证件。

Exponent.DEF: to show something to someone very quickly
Exponent.TRAN: 亮出,很快地出示﹔闪现出
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘We’re police,’ he said, flashing his card at us.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们是警察。”他说着亮出证件给我们看。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Miranda flashed a surprised look into the mirror.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 米兰达看着镜子,眼中闪现出惊讶之色。

Exponent.EXP: let sb have a look/take a look
Exponent.DEF: to show something to someone, especially so that they can examine it, repair it etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If the wound doesn’t get better soon, you should let the doctor take a look at it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果伤口没有马上见好,就应该让医生给看一看。

Exponent.DEF: to let someone see or know about something that is usually hidden, or that you want to keep secret – often used about showing your feelings or private thoughts
Exponent.TRAN: 显露,显示〔情感或内心思想〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Suzy looked away quickly in order not to reveal her true feelings.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏济立刻把眼睛转向别处,以免泄露自己的真实情感。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He lifted the lid of the box to reveal a small snake.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打开箱盖,里面露出一条小蛇。

Exponent.DEF: to let someone see something that could not be seen before
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The receding tide had exposed huge expanses of sand.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 潮水已经退去,露出了一片片宽广的沙滩。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bear opened its mouth, exposing rows of sharp teeth.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那熊张开嘴,露出两排尖利的牙齿。

Section.SECHEADING: show someone how to do something 教某人如何做某事

Exponent.DEF: to explain to someone how to do something or how something works, especially by doing it yourself
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Laurie’s been showing me how to snowboard.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳里教我们如何使用滑雪板。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can I show you how the oven works?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来教你这烤箱怎么用,好吗？

Exponent.DEF: to show how to do something or how something works – especially to a group of people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A qualified instructor will demonstrate how to use the machines properly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 会有一名合格的培训员演示如何正确使用这些机器。

Exponent.DEF: to show someone how to do something, or how a process happens, especially something difficult or complicated
Exponent.TRAN: 指导/指引某人完成某事〔尤指困难或复杂的事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The book guides you through the different stages of starting your own business.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书指导你一步一步创业。

Sense.DEF: a performance for the public, especially one that includes singing, dancing, or jokes
Sense.TRAN: 娱乐表演﹐演出〔尤包括唱歌﹑舞蹈或讲笑话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I enjoyed the show immensely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常喜欢这场演出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The show starts at 7:30 pm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演出晚上7点30分开始。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve come to town to see a Broadway show.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们到城里来看一场百老汇演出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perry was the star of the show .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 佩里是这台演出的明星。

Sense.DEF: a programme on television or on the radio
Sense.EXAMPLE: The senator appeared on the CBS show ‘Face the Nation’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位参议员在哥伦比亚广播公司的《面对全国》节目中露面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new television quiz show
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的智力问答电视节目

Sense.DEF: an occasion when a lot of similar things are brought together in one place so that people can come and look at them
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Paris Boat Show
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴黎船展
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fashion show for charity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慈善时装表演
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kelly has a show of her latest work opening shortly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯莉最新作品的展览即将开幕。

Sense.DEF: being shown to the public
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paintings by Matisse are on show at the New York Gallery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马蒂斯的画作正在纽约美术馆展出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The designer clothes will go on show in Chicago next month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些名师设计的服装将于下月在芝加哥展出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Local antiques will be put on show in a new building especially built for the collection.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地的古玩将在专为这批收藏品而建造的一幢新大楼里展出。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when someone deliberately shows a particular feeling, attitude, or quality
Sense.TRAN: 某种情感 [态度﹐品质]的表现
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt I should make a show of dignity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得我应该表现出尊严来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The award will be seen as a show of support.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个奖将被视为支持的表示。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a strong and determined show of force by the police
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方坚决有力的一次力量展示

Sense.DEF: when you pretend to do or feel something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a show of gratitude
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 假装感激的样子
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Susan put on a show of regret all day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏珊一整天都装出遗憾的样子。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The waiter made a show of wiping the table.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名侍者装作在擦桌子。

Sense.DEF: with the purpose of looking attractive or impressive rather than being useful
Sense.EXAMPLE: He does actually play his guitar – it’s not just for show.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是真弹吉他﹐不是装样子。

Sense.DEF: an impressive scene, especially one that is very colourful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a glorious show of colour in the rose garden
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玫瑰园里色彩斑斓的美丽景象

Sense.EXAMPLE: Maple trees put on their best show in the autumn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了秋天﹐枫树便呈现出最绚丽的色彩。
