Sense.DEF: a competition between similar things or animals to choose the best
Sense.TRAN: 〔同类事物或动物进行比赛的〕展评（会）
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dog show was being held in the Agricultural Hall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狗展正在农展馆举行。

Sense.DEF: something which is being done or organized
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to find someone to run the show be in charge .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要找个人来负责这个活动。

Sense.LEXUNIT: put up a good/poor etc show
Sense.DEF: to perform, play etc well or badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our team put up a pretty good show, but we lost in the end.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们队表现得很不错﹐不过最后还是输了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: let’s get this show on the road
Sense.DEF: used to tell people it is time to start working or start a journey
Sense.TRAN: 我们开始干吧﹔我们出发吧

Sense.DEF: used to express your approval of something

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: broadcast on TV or radio as it is happening
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 现场直播的,实况转播的
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Tonight’s show is live from Wembley Stadium.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚的节目是从温布利球场现场直播的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What’s your favourite TV show?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最爱看什么电视节目？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in which people try to answer questions correctly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s the BBC’s most popular quiz show.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是英国广播公司最受欢迎的问答节目。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in which people play games or answer questions to win prizes
in which famous or interesting people talk to someone about themselves
one that is suitable for families and children to watch

Collocate.COLLOC: appear on/take part in a show
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: to be a guest on a show
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They were trying to persuade Daniel Radcliffe to appear on the show.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在试图说服丹尼尔·拉德克利夫参加节目。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: to be the person who introduces the different parts of a show, or who talks to guests
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He presents his own talk show on ITV.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在英国独立电视台主持自己的访谈节目。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: People of all ages watch the show.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 老老少少都看这个节目。

Sense.DEF: an activity for school children in which they bring an object to school and tell the other children about it
Sense.TRAN: 展示和讲述课〔指学童带一件物品到学校向其他同学介绍的活动〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ramona brought in a fossil for show and tell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉莫娜带了一块化石去上展示和讲述课。

Sense.DEF: if someone playing a sport is showboating, they are trying to make people admire them by doing skilful tricks, but are not playing effectively for their team
Sense.TRAN: 〔体育比赛中〕卖弄技巧﹐炫耀自己
Sense.EXAMPLE: What did he ever do other than showboat around the pitch, beat five players, and end up losing the ball to the sixth?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在球场上炫耀技巧﹐过了五个球员 后被第六个断了球﹐除了这些他还干什么了？

Sense.DEF: the entertainment industry, for example television, films, popular theatre etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Phyllis always wanted to be in show business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲莉丝一直想进入娱乐圈。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The restaurant is always full of show business personalities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家饭店总是坐满演艺界名人。

Sense.DEF: an event or situation that is designed to show the good qualities of a person, organization, product etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new musical is a good showcase for her talents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这出新的音乐剧充分展示了她的才华。

Sense.DEF: a glass box containing objects for people to look at in a shop, at an art show etc

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She wants to showcase African-American literature.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想展现美国黑人文学的魅力。

Sense.DEF: a meeting, argument, fight etc that will settle a disagreement or competition that has continued for a long time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a showdown with the striking workers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和罢工工人摊牌
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Britain has a World Cup showdown with Australia next month.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下个月英国队和澳大利亚队将有一场世界杯的决战。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that you stand under to wash your whole body
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why does the phone always ring when I’m in the shower?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么电话铃总是在我洗澡的时候响？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to use the shower if that’s all right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果可以的话﹐我想用一下这里的淋浴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bathroom has a separate shower cubicle a shower in a separate part of the room .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卫生间里有一个独立的淋浴间。

Sense.DEF: an act of washing your body while standing under a shower
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need a shower.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要洗个淋浴。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nick rolled out of bed and took a shower.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克翻身下床﹐去洗了个淋浴。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mary loves having a hot shower after she’s been swimming.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽游泳之后喜欢洗个热水澡。

Sense.DEF: a short period of rain or snow
Sense.EXAMPLE: More heavy showers are forecast for tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预报今晚还有强阵雨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shower of rain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场阵雨
Sense.EXAMPLE: a snow shower
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场阵雪
Sense.EXAMPLE: A few wintry showers are likely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有可能下几阵冬雨。

Sense.DEF: a lot of small light things falling or going through the air together
Sense.TRAN: 〔在空中洒落或出现的〕一大批﹐一阵〔小而轻的东西〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Peter kicked the fire and sent up a shower of sparks .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得踢了踢火堆﹐溅起一团火星。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A shower of leaves fell towards the ground.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 落叶纷纷扬扬飘向地面。

Sense.DEF: a party at which presents are given to a woman who is going to get married or have a baby
Sense.TRAN: 〔为将要结婚或生孩子的女子举行的〕送礼会
Sense.EXAMPLE: We gave a shower for Beth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们为贝丝办了个送礼会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a baby shower
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 准妈妈送礼会

Sense.DEF: a group of stupid or lazy people
to wash your whole body while standing under a shower
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mike shaved and showered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克刮了脸﹐冲了个淋浴。

Sense.DEF: to give someone a lot of things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She showered him with kisses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对他一阵狂吻。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tom showered Amy with presents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆送给埃米许多礼物。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had no children and showered her love on her three nieces.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有孩子﹐就把所有的爱都倾注在她的三个侄女身上。

Sense.DEF: to scatter a lot of things onto a person or place, or to be scattered in this way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The top shelf broke and books showered down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 顶层架子断裂书纷纷掉落下来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ship was showered with hot ash from the volcano.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这艘船上落满了滚烫的火山灰。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hundreds of leaflets were showered over the town.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 无数传单从小镇上空纷纷扬扬地落下。

Sense.DEF: a plastic hat that keeps your hair dry in a shower
a type of liquid soap that you use to wash yourself in a shower
showerproof clothes keep you dry in light rain but not in heavy rain
raining frequently for short periods
Sense.EXAMPLE: a showery day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多阵雨的一天

Sense.DEF: one of a group of women who sing or dance in a musical show

a large area of land where an event such as a farming show or a
fete
can be held
a house that has been built and filled with furniture to show buyers what similar new houses look like
an occasion when a film, art show etc can be seen or looked at, especially a special occasion that people are invited to
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw a private showing of the film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看了这部影片的私人专场放映。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the comedy’s first showing on TV.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是这出喜剧首次在电视上播出。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a person’s or thing’s level of success
Sense.EXAMPLE: Choose the candidate who makes the best showing in the interview.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选择面试时表现最佳的那个应征者。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Women made a strong showing in the election.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次选举中﹐女性表现很出色。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On present showing judging by the way it is now , there’s a lot to do to get the newspaper’s sales up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 按目前的情况看﹐要提高报纸的销量还有大量的工作要做。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: On this showing judging by this example , she is becoming a very good writer indeed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 照此来看﹐她确实要成为一名非常优秀的作家了。

Sense.DEF: a sport in which horses with riders have to jump a series of fences as quickly and skilfully as possible
someone who is good at entertaining people and getting a lot of public attention
Sense.TRAN: 善于娱乐公众并引起公众注意的人﹔爱出风头的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is the band’s best showman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是这支乐队中风头最盛的人。

Sense.DEF: skill at entertaining people and getting public attention
Sense.TRAN: 善于表演的能力﹔引起公众注意的技巧

Sense.DEF:
the past participle of
show
someone who always tries to show how clever or skilled they are so that other people will admire them – often used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 喜欢卖弄的人﹐爱炫耀自己的人〔常含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a bit of a show-off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有点爱卖弄。

Sense.DEF: a vote taken by counting the raised hands of the people at a meeting
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dispute was settled with a show of hands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 争执通过举手表决得到了解决。

Sense.DEF: something that an organization, government etc wants people to see, because it is a very good or successful example
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new stadium is a showpiece for the Greeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座新建运动场对希腊人来说是一个成功的典范。

Sense.DEF: a place which is open to the public because of its beauty, historical interest etc
Sense.TRAN: 风景名胜﹐古迹名胜﹐游览胜地

Sense.DEF:
a
pony small horse
that takes part in a competition which involves jumping fences or being judged on appearance
someone who is confident and enjoys being with other people, but who often tries to show how clever or skilled they are so that other people will admire them – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 爱出风头的人〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a large room where you can look at things that are for sale, such as cars or electrical goods
Sense.EXAMPLE: a car showroom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车展厅

Sense.DEF: a show-stopping performance is extremely good or impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a show-stopping dance routine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极为精彩的一套舞蹈动作

Sense.DEF: the time that a play or film will begin in a theatre or cinema
Sense.TRAN: 〔戏剧或电影的〕开演时间﹐开场时间

Sense.DEF: the time when an activity should begin

an unfair
trial
that is organized by a government for political reasons, not in order to find out whether someone is guilty
Sense.TRAN: 〔政府为政治目的而举行的〕作秀审判﹐摆样子的审判
Sense.EXAMPLE: A series of show trials were staged after the uprising.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起义之后进行了一连串的作秀审判。

Sense.DEF: something that is showy is very colourful, big, expensive etc, especially in a way that attracts people’s attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attractive shrub with showy flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一丛开有鲜艳花朵的漂亮灌木

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
shrink
small pieces of metal from a bomb, bullet etc that are scattered when it explodes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a soldier with shrapnel wounds in his chest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名胸部被弹片划伤的士兵

Sense.DEF: a small thin piece that is torn or cut roughly from something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a shred of paper
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条碎纸片

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The clothes were ripped to shreds and covered in blood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 衣服被撕成了碎片﹐上面血迹斑斑。

Sense.DEF: to criticize something very severely
Sense.TRAN: 把某事物批评得体无完肤
Sense.EXAMPLE: Within a year, other researchers had torn the theory to shreds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不到一年﹐其他研究者就把这一理论批驳得体无完肤。

Subsense.DEF: torn in many places
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Uncle Earl was exhausted and his shirt hung in shreds.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厄尔舅舅精疲力竭﹐衬衫也破破烂烂地挂在身上。

Subsense.DEF: completely ruined
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His ambitious plan was in shreds.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那雄心勃勃的计划彻底失败了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If Myra gossips about this, my reputation will be in shreds.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果迈拉把这事说出去﹐那我就名誉扫地了。

Sense.DEF: a very small amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s not a shred of doubt no doubt at all in my mind that we will win.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我心里丝毫不怀疑我们会赢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He does not have a shred of evidence he has no evidence at all to prove his claim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有任何证据可以证明他的说法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the last shred of hope
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后的一线希望

Sense.DEF: to cut or tear something into small thin pieces
Sense.TRAN: 把…切成细条﹐把…撕成碎片
Sense.EXAMPLE: Coleslaw is made with shredded cabbage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凉拌菜丝是用卷心菜丝做的。

Sense.DEF: to put a document into a shredder
Sense.TRAN: 把〔文件〕放进碎纸机粉碎
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carlson was collecting messages, reading them, then shredding them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡尔森在收集信息﹐看过之后就把它们放进碎纸机粉碎。

Sense.DEF: a machine that cuts documents into small pieces so that no one can read them
a very small animal like a mouse with a long pointed nose
an unpleasant woman who always argues and disagrees with people
good at judging what people or situations are really like
Sense.TRAN: 善于判断的﹐精明的﹐敏锐的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Malcolm is a shrewd businessman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马尔科姆是个精明的商人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was shrewd enough to guess who was responsible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很精明﹐一猜就知道是谁干的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Capra looked at her with shrewd eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡普拉眼神犀利地看着她。

Sense.DEF: well judged and likely to be right
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shrewd decision
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英明的决定
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bridget has a shrewd idea of what will sell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布里奇特很清楚什么东西好卖。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: ‘Something tells me you’ve already decided,’ he said shrewdly.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: “我看出来你已经决定了。”他精明地说。

Sense.DEF: a shrewish woman is one who always argues and disagrees with people
Sense.TRAN: 〔女人〕爱与人争执的﹐泼妇般的

Sense.DEF: to make a very high loud sound, especially because you are afraid, angry, excited, or in pain
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were dragged from their homes, shrieking and weeping.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们哭喊着被人从家里拖出去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He shrieked in agony.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他痛苦地尖叫起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A group of students were shrieking with laughter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群学生在尖声大笑。

Sense.DEF: to say something in a high loud voice because you are excited, afraid, or angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m pregnant,’ she shrieked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我怀孕啦。”她尖声叫道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ll kill you,’ Anne shrieked at him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “我要杀了你。”安妮冲着他尖声喊道。

Sense.DEF: a loud high sound made because you are frightened, excited, angry etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a shriek of laughter
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一声尖笑

GramExa.EXAMPLE: With a shriek of delight, Jean hugged Maggie.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼兴奋地尖叫一声﹐抱住了玛吉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ella let out a piercing shriek.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃拉发出一声刺耳的尖叫声。

Sense.DEF: a shrill sound is very high and unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘That’s not true,’ she protested in a shrill voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “不是这样的。”她尖声抗议道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shrill whistle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一声刺耳的哨子声
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fran uttered a shrill scream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰发出一声尖叫。

Sense.DEF: shrill complaints, criticism, demands etc are too loud or strong and seem unreasonable
Sense.TRAN: 〔投诉﹑批评﹑要求等〕尖刻的﹐无理取闹的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hated the shrill demands of the children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对孩子们吵个不休要这要那感到很讨厌。

Sense.DEF: to produce a very high and unpleasant sound
Sense.TRAN: 发出尖锐刺耳的声音﹐尖叫
Sense.EXAMPLE: The telephone shrilled twice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刺耳的电话铃响了两下。

Sense.DEF: to say something in a very high voice
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I hate you!’ she shrilled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我恨你！”她尖声叫道。

Sense.DEF: a small sea creature that you can eat, which has ten legs and a soft shell
someone who is very small – used humorously
shrimps without their shells that are cooked and put in a pink sauce, and eaten cold before the main part of a meal
the activity of fishing for shrimps
a place that is connected with a holy event or holy person, and that people visit to pray

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his pilgrimage to the shrine of St John
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去敬奉圣约翰的圣地朝圣

Sense.DEF: a place that people visit and respect because it is connected with a famous person or event
Sense.TRAN: 〔与名人或著名事件有关的〕圣地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elvis’ home has become a shrine for his fans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫王的故居成了歌迷的朝圣地。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The museum is a shrine to the great Spanish artist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座博物馆是瞻仰这位伟大西班牙画家的圣地。

Sense.DEF: to become smaller, or to make something smaller, through the effects of heat or water
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m worried about washing that shirt in case it shrinks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不太敢洗那件衬衫﹐怕它会缩水。

Sense.DEF: to become or to make something smaller in amount, size, or value
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔数量﹑体积或价值〕变小﹐减少﹐缩小
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city continued to shrink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城市继续缩小。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The firm’s staff had shrunk to only four people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司的员工缩减到只剩四个人了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Treatment can shrink a tumour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 治疗能够使肿瘤萎缩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We want to expand the business, not shrink it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要扩大业务﹐而不是缩小。

Sense.DEF: to move back and away from something, especially because you are frightened
Sense.EXAMPLE: She listened, shrinking under the blankets, to their shouts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她缩在毯子下面听他们咆哮。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Meredith was scared of him and shrank back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅雷迪思害怕他﹐直往后退。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His anger was enough to make the others shrink away from him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的怒火足以使别人退缩。

Sense.DEF: to avoid doing something difficult or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 避免做﹐不做〔困难或不愉快的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The leadership too often shrinks from hard decisions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 领导层常常回避作困难的决定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We will not shrink from making the necessary changes in policy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不会回避对政策作出必要的修改。

Sense.DEF:
a
psychoanalyst
or
psychiatrist
– used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 精神分析学家﹔精神科医生〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: the act of shrinking, or the amount that something shrinks
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pollution led to a shrinkage of grasslands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 污染导致草原面积缩小。

Sense.DEF: someone who is very shy – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 十分羞怯的人〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: goods that are shrink-wrapped are wrapped tightly in plastic
Sense.TRAN: 〔商品〕用收缩薄膜包装的﹐热缩包装的

Sense.DEF: if something shrivels, or if it is shrivelled, it becomes smaller and its surface becomes covered in lines because it is very dry or old
Sense.EXAMPLE: The leaves change colour, then shrivel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树叶变了颜色﹐然后干枯了。

Sense.DEF: a cloth that is wrapped around a dead person’s body before it is buried
something that hides or covers something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fog rolled in, and a grey shroud covered the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大雾滚滚而来﹐一张灰色的天幕笼罩着这个城市。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A shroud of silence surrounded the general’s death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将军的去世让周围一片死寂。

Sense.DEF: to cover or hide something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joseph was shrouded under a dark blanket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约瑟夫身上裹着一条深色的毯子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cliff was shrouded in mist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 峭壁被薄雾笼罩。

Sense.DEF: to keep information secret so that people do not know what really happened

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The incident has always been shrouded in mystery .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一事件始终蒙着神秘的色彩。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The work is shrouded in secrecy .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项工作被严格保密。

Sense.DEF: when people, especially doctors or politicians, publicly criticize the quality of medical care in the British National Health Service, in order to make the government provide more money for it
Sense.TRAN: 挥舞裹尺布〔尤指医生或政治家为促使政府增加拨款而公开批评英国国民医疗服务体系〕

Sense.DEF:
the day before the first day of the Christian period of Lent, when people in Britain traditionally eat
pancake s
Sense.TRAN: 忏悔星期二〔基督教大斋期的前一天〕

Sense.DEF: a small bush with several woody stems
shrubs planted close together
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tangled mass of overgrown shrubbery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 枝蔓交错﹑疯狂生长的灌木丛

Sense.DEF: a part of a garden where shrubs are planted close together
to raise and then lower your shoulders in order to show that you do not know something or do not care about something
Sense.TRAN: 耸（肩）〔表示不知道或不在乎〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just shrugged my shoulders and ignored him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是耸耸肩﹐没有理睬他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Melanie shrugged and walked away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅拉妮耸耸肩走开了。

Sense.DEF: to treat something as unimportant and not worry about it
Sense.TRAN: 对…满不在乎﹐对…不屑一顾
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can’t just shrug these objections off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不能不理会这些反对意见呀。

Sense.DEF: a movement of your shoulders upwards and then downwards again that you make to show that you do not know something or do not care about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Suit yourself,’ he said with a shrug.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “随你的便。”他耸耸肩说道。

Sense.DEF:
a very short
cardigan
Sense.TRAN: 女式紧身短套衫﹐女式带袖短披肩

Sense.DEF:
the past participle of
shrink
having become smaller or been made smaller
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shrunken old woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位干瘪的老妇人

Sense.DEF:
the style of humour that a particular actor or
comedian
is typically known for

another spelling of
schtum

to remove the outer cover of a vegetable such as corn, or the shell of
oyster s
Sense.TRAN: 剥去〔玉米等蔬菜〕的皮[荚]﹔剥去〔牡蛎〕的壳

Sense.DEF: to take off a piece of clothing
Sense.EXAMPLE: She shucked off her jacket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脱去外套。

Sense.DEF: used to show you are a little disappointed about something
Sense.TRAN: 唉！ 糟了！〔表示有点失望〕

Sense.DEF: to shake for a short time because you are afraid or cold, or because you think something is very unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 〔因恐惧﹑寒冷或认为某事令人不愉快而〕打战﹐颤抖
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maria shuddered as she stepped outside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚一走到外面就打了个冷战。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I shudder with embarrassment whenever I think about it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每当我想到这件事就会尴尬得直打哆嗦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She shuddered at the thought that she could have been killed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到差点丢了性命﹐她浑身颤抖。

Sense.DEF: if a vehicle or machine shudders, it shakes violently
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car shuddered briefly as its engine died.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引擎熄火时﹐汽车震动了一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The train shuddered to a halt .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车颤动着停下了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not want to think about something because it is too unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 我一想到…就颤抖〔用于表示不愿意去想非常不愉快的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I shudder to think what they’ll say when they see the mess the house is in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一想到他们看见房子这样脏乱会说些什么﹐我就心里打战。

Sense.DEF: to think that something is very bad or unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you love skiing but shudder at the cost, take advantage of our superb family offer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你喜欢滑雪却为价格发憷﹐就选择我们超值的家庭优惠套餐吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He shuddered at the thought of the conflict ahead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一想到即将发生的冲突就不寒而栗。

Sense.DEF: a shaking movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building gave a sudden shudder .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大楼突然颤动了一下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A shudder ran through him at the touch of her fingers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的手指触摸他时﹐他感到一阵战栗。

Sense.DEF: to walk very slowly and noisily, without lifting your feet off the ground

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The official signaled to one of the waiters, who shuffled forward.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名官员向其中一名侍者打了个手势﹐那个侍者便拖着脚步走上前来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: With sore legs and aching chest, he shuffled over to the bathroom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他腿酸﹐胸口痛﹐拖着步子走向浴室。

Sense.DEF: to move your feet slightly, especially because you are bored or embarrassed
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因厌烦或尴尬而〕移动双足
Sense.EXAMPLE: Monica shuffled her feet nervously and stared at the floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫妮卡紧张地把双脚挪来挪去﹐目光盯在地上。

Sense.DEF: to move something such as papers into a different order or into different positions
Sense.TRAN: 把〔文件等〕移来移去﹐改变…的顺序[位置]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack sat nervously shuffling the papers around on his desk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克紧张地坐着﹐把桌上的文件搬来搬去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Frances shuffled through a pile of magazines.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗朗西丝把一大堆杂志翻了个遍。

Sense.DEF:
to mix
playing card s
into a different order before playing a game with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is it my turn to shuffle?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮到我洗牌了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just shuffle the cards .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请洗牌吧。

Sense.DEF: a slow walk in which you do not lift your feet off the ground
the act of mixing cards into a different order before playing a game
to not be noticed or considered because there are so many other things to deal with
Sense.EXAMPLE: The information contained in the memo got lost in the shuffle once it reached headquarters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 备忘录中的这一信息到达总部后就在忙乱之中被遗忘了。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately avoid someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shy woman who shunned publicity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不爱抛头露面的羞怯女子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Victims of the disease found themselves shunned by society.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 患这种病的人发现﹐社会上的人都躲着 他们。

Sense.DEF: to move someone or something to another place, especially in a way that seems unfair
Sense.TRAN: 将…转移至另一地方〔尤指有欠公正〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Smith was shunted off to one of the company’s smaller offices.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 史密斯被调到公司下属的一个较小的办事处。

Sense.DEF: to move a train or railway carriage onto a different track
an act of moving a train or railway carriage to a different track
a crash, especially in a car race
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指赛车中的〕撞车事故﹐车祸

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone, especially a child, to be quiet
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Shush!’ said Jerry. ‘Not so loud.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “嘘！”杰里说﹐“别这么大声。”

Sense.DEF: to tell someone to be very quiet, especially by putting your fingers against your lips or by saying ‘shush’
Sense.TRAN: 使安静﹐使肃静〔尤指以手指抵住双唇或发“嘘”声表示〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He started to cry and Francesca shushed him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他哭了起来﹐弗朗西丝卡“嘘”了一声要他安静。

Sense.DEF: to close something, or to become closed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shut the window, Ellen!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃伦﹐把窗关上！
Sense.EXAMPLE: I heard his bedroom door shut.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到他的卧室门关上了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She lay down on her bed and shut her eyes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在床上躺下﹐闭上眼睛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She walked quickly in and shut the door behind her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她快步走进来﹐随手关上身后的门。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He shut the drawer and turned the key.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他关上抽屉﹐转动了钥匙。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to stop talking
to stop being open to the public for a short time or permanently
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔暂时或永久地〕关门﹐停止营业
Sense.EXAMPLE: The post office shuts at 5 o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邮局五点钟关门。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At midday we shut the shop for lunch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中午时分﹐我们关了店门吃午饭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lost his job when they shut the factory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把工厂关闭后﹐他失去了工作。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately refuse to notice or pay attention to something
Sense.TRAN: 对…视若无睹[置若罔闻﹐不加理会]
Sense.EXAMPLE: We ought not to shut our eyes to these facts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不应该对这些事实视而不见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She heard the boys shouting to her to stop, but she shut her ears to them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听到那些男孩在喊她停下来﹐但她不理睬他们。

Sense.LEXUNIT: shut sth in the door/drawer etc

Variant.ORTHVAR: shut the door/drawer etc on sth

Sense.DEF: to shut a door etc against something so that it gets trapped there
Sense.TRAN: 把某物夹在门缝里/抽屉缝里等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I shut my finger in the back door yesterday and it still hurts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天我的手指让后门夹了一下﹐现在还痛。

Sense.DEF: to put someone or something in a place away from other people where they cannot be seen
Sense.TRAN: 把…关起来﹐把…藏起来﹐使…与人隔开
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of people are classed as mad and shut away unnecessarily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人被当成疯子﹐被不必要地关了起来。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately avoid seeing people by staying at home or going to a quiet place, especially because you are very unhappy or want to study, write etc
Sense.TRAN: 把自己关起来﹐一个人躲起来〔尤因很不高兴或想学习﹑写作等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: When news came of Robin’s death, she shut herself away and saw no one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗宾去世的消息传来后﹐她一个人躲了起来﹐什么人都不见。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She shut herself away in her room to work on her novel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把自己关在房间里写小说。

Sense.DEF: if a company, factory, large machine etc shuts down or is shut down, it stops operating, either permanently or for a short time
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔公司﹑工厂等〕关闭﹔（使）〔机器〕停止运转
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our local hardware shop has shut down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们当地的五金店关门了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an accident which resulted in two of the plant’s nuclear reactors being shut down
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 导致这家发电厂有两个核反应堆被关闭的一次事故
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The way to shut the machine down is to type EXIT.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关闭这台机器的方法是键入 EXIT。

Sense.DEF: to prevent an opposing team or player from playing well or getting points
Sense.TRAN: 〔在比赛中〕阻止…正常发挥[得分]
Sense.EXAMPLE: We all knew that to win we’d have to shut down Bobby Mitchell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都知道﹐如果要赢﹐就得防住博比·米切尔。

Subsense.DEF: if you shut someone in a room, you close the door and stop them from getting out
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Her parents shut her in an upstairs room.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父母把她关在楼上的一个房间里。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He pushed the dogs into the breakfast room and shut them in.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把狗赶进早餐室关了起来。

Subsense.DEF: if you shut yourself in a room, you close the door and stay in there, and often stop other people from coming in
Subsense.TRAN: 把自己关在房间里﹐独自一人躲在房间里
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Ellie darted back to her room and shut herself in.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃莉冲回房间﹐把自己关在里面。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He shut himself in his room and wrote letters.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把自己关在房间里 写信。

Sense.DEF: if a machine, tool etc shuts off or if you shut it off, it stops operating
Sense.EXAMPLE: The iron shuts off automatically if it gets too hot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这熨斗过热时会自动关闭。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I let the engine run for a minute and then shut it off.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把引擎开了一分钟﹐然后把它关了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to shut off the water supply.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别忘了关闭供水系统。

Sense.DEF: to prevent goods or supplies from being available or being delivered
Sense.TRAN: 切断〔商品或物资〕的供应
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strike that closed the mines and shut off coal supplies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 导致矿井关闭﹑煤炭供应中断的一场罢工

Sense.DEF: to avoid meeting and talking to other people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was cold and remote, shutting himself off from her completely.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他态度冷漠而疏远﹐和她彻底不来往了。

Sense.DEF: to be separated from other people or things, especially so that you are not influenced by them
Sense.TRAN: 与某人/某事物隔绝〔尤指因而没有受到其影响〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The valley is shut off from the modern world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个山谷与现代世界完全隔绝。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately not let someone join you in an activity or share your thoughts and feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: How can I help you if you just keep shutting me out all the time?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一直排斥我﹐叫我怎么帮你？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I felt I was being shut out from all the family’s affairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉家里所有的事我都插不上手。

Sense.DEF: to prevent someone or something from entering a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: heavy curtains that shut out the sunlight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遮挡阳光的厚窗帘

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The door closed firmly, shutting me out from the warmth inside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 门紧紧地关着﹐不让我享受屋里的温暖。

Sense.DEF: to stop yourself from thinking about or noticing something, so that you are not affected by it
Sense.TRAN: 不去想〔某事〕﹐排除…的干扰﹐使自己不受…影响
Sense.EXAMPLE: People close their windows at night in a vain attempt to shut out the sound of gunfire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜里人们关上窗户﹐却依然挡不住那隆隆的枪炮声。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She shut out memories of James.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不让自己回忆起詹姆斯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jenny closed her eyes and tried to shut everything out .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮闭上眼睛﹐试图排除一切干扰。

Sense.DEF: to defeat an opposing sports team and prevent them from getting any points
Sense.TRAN: 〔在比赛中〕战胜〔对方〕使其一分未得﹐零封
Sense.EXAMPLE: Colorado shut out Kansas City 3-0.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科罗拉多队以 3 比 0 完胜堪萨斯城队。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to stop talking
Sense.TRAN: 闭嘴！ 住嘴！ 别说了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, shut up! I don’t want to hear your excuses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐闭嘴！ 我不想听你的借口。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just shut up and listen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闭上嘴好好听。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shut up about your stupid dog, okay!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再说你那条笨狗了﹐行不行！

Sense.DEF: to stop talking or be quiet, or to make someone do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t stand that woman. She never shuts up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我实在受不了那女人﹐她老是说个没完。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wish you’d shut up about Chris.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你别再提克里斯了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I only said that to shut her up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说那句话只是想要她闭嘴。

Sense.DEF: to keep someone in a place away from other people, and prevent them from leaving

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve had a terrible cold and been shut up in my room for a week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我患了重感冒﹐在房间里关了一个星期。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Was there any need to keep us shut up here?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有必要把我们关在这里吗？

Sense.DEF: to close a shop, room etc so that people cannot get into it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bernadette cleaned the attic and then shut it up for another year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝尔纳黛特把阁楼打扫干净﹐然后又把它封闭了一年。

Sense.DEF: to close a business or stop working, at the end of the day or permanently
not open
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is the door shut properly?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门关好了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: She kept the windows shut , for fear of burglars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把窗户关着﹐怕有窃贼进来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sat with his eyes shut .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他闭着眼睛坐着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The windows were tightly shut .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗户紧闭。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The door slammed shut behind him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 门在他身后砰的一声关上了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jenny pulled the window shut.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮把窗户拉上。

Sense.DEF: if a shop, bar etc is shut, it is not open for business
Sense.TRAN: 〔商店﹑酒吧等〕停止营业的﹐关门的
Sense.EXAMPLE: in the evening when the shops are shut
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚上商店关门时
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, but we’re shut.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抱歉﹐我们已经关门了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The first four hotels we tried were shut for the winter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们找的头四家宾馆都不在冬天营业。

Sense.DEF: the closing of a factory, business, or piece of machinery, either permanently or for a short time
Sense.TRAN: 〔工厂〕停工﹔〔企业〕歇业﹔〔机器〕停机

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Environmental groups had called for the permanent shutdown of the plant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境保护团体呼吁永久关闭这家工厂。

Sense.EXAMPLE: safety systems and automatic shutdown procedures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安全系统和自动关闭程序

Sense.DEF: sleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’d better get some shut-eye .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最好能睡一会儿。

Sense.DEF:
someone who is ill or
disabled
and cannot leave their house very easily
Sense.TRAN: 〔因生病或残疾〕不能随意外出的人

Sense.DEF: a game in which one team is prevented by the other from getting any points
one of a pair of wooden or metal covers on the outside of a window that can be closed to keep light out or prevent thieves from coming in
a part of a camera that opens for a very short time to let light onto the film
to close a business, office etc for a short time or permanently
Sense.TRAN: 〔暂时或永久地〕使停业﹐使关闭
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company shuttered its Hong Kong business a year ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司一年前停止了在香港的业务。

Sense.DEF: someone who likes to take a lot of photographs
with closed shutters, or having shutters
Sense.TRAN: 关上百叶窗的﹔装有百叶窗的
Sense.EXAMPLE: A gust of wind shook the shuttered windows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵狂风吹得百叶窗摇摇晃晃。

Sense.DEF:
a
space shuttle
a plane, bus, or train that makes regular short journeys between two places
Sense.TRAN: 〔定期往返于两地之间的〕短程穿梭航班[班车﹐火车]
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took the Washington - New York shuttle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他乘坐华盛顿－纽约的往返班机。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A shuttle bus operates to and from the beach of San Benedetto.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有穿梭巴士往返于圣贝内代托海滩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a shuttle service from the city center to the airport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从市中心到机场有穿梭班车服务。

Sense.DEF: a pointed tool used in weaving, to pass a thread over and under the threads that form the cloth
to travel frequently between two places

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Susan shuttles between Rotterdam and London for her job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏珊因为工作经常穿梭于鹿特丹和伦敦之间。

Sense.DEF: to move people from one place to another place that is fairly near
Sense.EXAMPLE: The passengers were shuttled to the hotel by bus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅客由班车送到酒店。

Sense.DEF:
a small light object that you hit over the net in the game of
badminton
international talks in which someone travels between countries and talks to members of the governments, for example to make a peace agreement
nervous and embarrassed about meeting and speaking to other people, especially people you do not know
Sense.TRAN: 羞怯的﹐腼腆的〔尤指在陌生人面前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a quiet shy man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个话不多﹑害羞的男人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was very shy with strangers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在陌生人面前很害羞。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a shy smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 羞怯的微笑
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a teenager, I was painfully shy extremely shy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我十几岁时害羞得很。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was too shy to come sit by me in class.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他胆子太小﹐上课都不敢过来坐在我身边。

GramExa.GLOSS: to suddenly become very shy
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oh, have you gone all shy, Jenny?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐珍妮﹐你害羞啦？

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb is not shy about (doing) sth
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone is very willing to do something or get involved with something
Sense.EXAMPLE: John has strong opinions and he’s not shy about sharing them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰有鲜明的观点﹐而且他也不忌讳将这些观点与他人分享。

Sense.DEF: unwilling to do something or get involved in something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Employees are urged not to be shy about reporting incidents of sexual harassment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工被力对性骚扰事件不要羞于启齿。

Sense.DEF: to have less than a particular amount of something
Sense.TRAN: 不足﹐未达到（…的）所需数量
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Democrats are three votes shy of a majority.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主党离多数票还差三票。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jessica died Monday. She was one week shy of her 13th birthday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰茜卡是星期一死的﹐还有一个星期就是她的13岁生日。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone does not like something and therefore tries to avoid it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Although publicity-shy , he recently agreed to be interviewed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然他不喜欢抛头露面﹐但最近还是同意接受采访。

Sense.DEF: shy animals get frightened easily and are unwilling to come near people
Sense.TRAN: 〔动物〕易受惊的﹐不近人的﹐胆小的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Deer are shy creatures .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鹿是胆小的动物。

Exponent.DEF: shy and not willing to say very much
worried and embarrassed about what you look like or what other people think of you
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因顾虑自己的外表或他人的看法而〕忸怩的,害羞的

Exponent.DEF: not brave or confident
not liking to express your emotions or talk about your problems
thinking a lot about your own interests, problems etc, and not liking to be with other people
quiet and not wanting to talk to other people, especially because you are unhappy
not liking to meet people and talk to them
not wanting to be with other people

Sense.DEF: if a horse shies, it makes a sudden movement away from something because it is frightened
Sense.EXAMPLE: The horse shied, throwing Darrel from his saddle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那马惊跳起来﹐把达雷尔从马鞍上掀了下去。

Sense.DEF: to avoid doing or dealing with something because you are not confident enough or you are worried or nervous about it
Sense.TRAN: 〔因缺乏信心﹑担心或紧张而〕回避﹐避开
Sense.EXAMPLE: They criticized the leadership, but shied away from a direct challenge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们批评领导层﹐但又不敢当面质疑。

Sense.DEF:
a dishonest person, especially a lawyer or
businessman
Sense.TRAN: 奸诈的人﹐不诚实的人〔尤指律师或商人〕

Sense.DEF: a type of cat that has blue eyes, short grey or brown fur, and a dark face
one of two people who are born joined to each other – sometimes considered offensive
Sense.TRAN: 连体双胞胎﹐暹罗孪生子〔有时被认为具有冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF: making or being an ‘s’ or ‘sh’ sound
Sense.TRAN: 发出咝咝声的﹔发咝咝音的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sibilant whisper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘁嘁喳喳的耳语

Sense.DEF: a sibilant sound such as ‘s’ or ‘sh’ in English
Sense.TRAN: 咝音〔例如英语中的 s 或 sh〕

Sense.DEF: a brother or sister
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most young smokers are influenced by their friends’ and older siblings’ smoking habits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数年轻的吸烟者都是因为他们的朋友或者哥哥姐姐有吸烟习惯而受影响的。

Sense.DEF: competition between brothers and sisters for their parents’ attention or love
Sense.TRAN: 手足相争〔指兄弟姐妹为得到父母的关注或宠爱的竞争〕

Sense.DEF: used after a word that you have copied in order to show that you know it was not spelled or used correctly
Sense.TRAN: 原文如此〔置于所引用文字之后﹐表示知道该词的拼写或用法不正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had seen several signs that said ‘ORANGE’S (sic) FOR SALE’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看到好几个写着 ORANGE’S（原文如此）FOR SALE 的牌子。

Sense.DEF: to tell a dog to attack someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He sicced his dog on me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他嗾使他的狗来攻击我。

Sense.DEF: used to tell a dog to attack someone
Sense.TRAN: 咬他！ 追他！〔嗾使狗攻击某人〕

Sense.DEF: to tell someone in authority that someone has done something wrong, so that they are punished

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He sicced his lawyers on them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向自己的律师告发了他们。

Sense.DEF: suffering from a disease or illness
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mother’s very sick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他母亲病得很重。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maria can’t come in today because she’s sick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚因为生病今天不能来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sick child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生病的孩子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sick animal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 患病的动物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have been sick with flu.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感冒了。

GramExa.GLOSS: become ill
GramExa.EXAMPLE: At the last minute, I got sick and couldn’t go.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在最后一刻病倒﹐不能去了。

GramExa.GLOSS: be away from work or school because you are ill
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two of his employees were out sick.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的两名员工因病没来上班。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was off sick for four days with the flu.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我因患流感休了四天病假。

GramExa.GLOSS: phone to say you are not coming to work because you are ill
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was upset because it was the first day of the sale and Astrid had called in sick.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很生气﹐因为那是大减价的第一天﹐阿斯特丽德却打电话来请了病假。

Sense.EXAMPLE: What will happen to the business if you fall sick become ill or die?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假如你生病或是去世了﹐公司怎么办？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took sick became ill and died a week later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他病倒后一周就去世了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pete’s at home in bed, sick as a dog very sick .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮特卧床在家﹐病得很重。

Sense.DEF: if you are sick, the food in your stomach comes up through your mouth
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I’m going to be sick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得自己快要吐了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He dashed to the bathroom and was sick again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他冲进卫生间﹐又吐了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cat’s been sick on the carpet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只猫吐在地毯上了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll be sick if you eat any more of that chocolate!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你再吃一口那巧克力﹐你会吐的！
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was violently sick suddenly and severely sick the last time I ate prawns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上次吃了大虾后吐得很厉害。

Sense.DEF: to feel as if you are going to vomit
Sense.EXAMPLE: As soon as the ship started moving I began to feel sick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮船一开动﹐我就感到恶心了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mary felt sick with fear.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽害怕得直恶心。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She began to shiver, feeling sick to her stomach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始颤抖起来﹐感到直反胃。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Virginia had a sick feeling in her stomach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗吉尼娅有些反胃。

Subsense.DEF: to make you feel very angry
Subsense.EXAMPLE: People like you make me sick!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像你这样的人真叫我生气！

Subsense.DEF: to make someone feel jealous – used humorously
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You make me sick with your ‘expenses paid’ holidays!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有公费度假﹐真叫我眼红啊！

Subsense.DEF: if something makes you sick, it makes you bring food up from your stomach through your mouth
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The smell of blood made him sick.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 血腥味使他吐了。

Subsense.DEF: if you make yourself sick, you do something to bring food up from your stomach through your mouth
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never been able to make myself sick.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来就没让自己吐过。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’ll make yourself sick if you eat any more!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你再吃的话就会吐的！

Variant.LEXVAR: be sick to death of (doing) sth

Sense.DEF: to be angry or bored with something that has been happening for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sick and tired of your excuses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的借口我都听厌了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I am sick of working for other people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我厌倦了为别人打工。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be worried sick/be sick with worry
Sense.DEF: to be extremely worried
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why didn’t you tell me you were coming home late? I’ve been worried sick!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不告诉我你要晚回家？ 我担心死了！

Subsense.DEF: someone who is sick does things that are strange and cruel, and seems mentally ill
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I keep getting obscene phone calls from some sick pervert.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我老是收到某个变态狂打来的下流电话。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’re sick!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你变态！
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a sick mind
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病态的心理

Subsense.DEF: sick stories, jokes etc deal with death and suffering in a cruel or unpleasant way
Subsense.TRAN: 〔故事﹑笑话等〕残忍的﹐残酷的﹐可怖的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to hear any of your sick jokes , thank you.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可不想再听你那些吓人的笑话﹐多谢了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: That’s really sick !
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那真是恐怖！

Sense.DEF: very unhappy, upset, or disappointed about something
Sense.TRAN: 很不愉快的﹔很难过的﹔很失望的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was sick at heart to think that I would never see the place again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到再也见不到这个地方时﹐我心中充满了忧伤。

Sense.DEF: extremely disappointed – used humorously
used by young people to say that something is very impressive and they admire it a lot
Sense.TRAN: 酷﹐棒〔年轻人用语﹐表示某物令人赞叹〕

Sense.DEF: people who are ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sick and wounded were allowed to go free.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤病员获得释放。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The phone box smelt of sick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话亭里有一股呕吐物的气味。

Sense.DEF: to bring up food from your stomach – used especially of children
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ruth had frequently sicked up her bottle milk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露丝用奶瓶喝奶时经常吐奶。

Sense.DEF:
a special paper bag for people to use if they need to
vomit
, for example when they are travelling on a plane
a room on a ship, in a school etc where there are beds for people who are sick
the bed where a sick person is lying

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The president carried on working from his sickbed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总裁卧病在床还继续工作。

Sense.DEF:
when chemicals and
germ s
stay in an office building and make the people who work there feel ill
Sense.TRAN: 病态建筑综合征〔指办公楼内化学物质﹑病菌等积聚使人不适〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A common household fungus can contribute to sick building syndrome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种常见的室内真菌就会引起病态建筑综合征。

Sense.DEF: to make you feel shocked and angry, especially because you strongly disapprove of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The thought of such cruelty sickened her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到如此残忍的行为﹐她就很愤慨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All decent people should be sickened by such a pointless waste of life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凡正派的人都会痛恨这样无谓地浪费生命。

Sense.DEF: to gradually become very ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: The older people just sickened and died as food supplies ran low.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食物供应不足﹐年纪较大的人就慢慢病倒死去了。

Sense.DEF: to be starting to have an illness
Sense.TRAN: 开始生…病﹐有生…病的症状
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps you’re sickening for something.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许你是生什么病了。

Sense.DEF: to lose your desire for something or your interest in it
Sense.TRAN: 对…感到厌烦﹐对…失去兴趣
Sense.EXAMPLE: He finally sickened of the endless round of parties and idle conversation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他终于厌倦了那些没完没了的聚会和无聊的谈话。

Sense.DEF: very shocking, annoying, or upsetting
Sense.TRAN: 令人震惊的﹔令人厌恶的﹔令人难受的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police described it as a sickening racial attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方说这是一起令人震惊的种族袭击事件。
Sense.EXAMPLE: their sickening hypocrisy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们那令人恶心的虚伪嘴脸

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is sickening that human beings have done this to two innocent young women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 竟然有人会对两个无辜的年轻女性做出这种事来﹐真是让人震惊。

Sense.DEF: an unpleasant sound that makes you think someone has been injured or something has been broken
Sense.TRAN: 可怕的重击声/碰撞声/声音等
Sense.EXAMPLE: His head hit the floor with a sickening thud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的头撞在地板上﹐发出砰的一声﹐让人听了心惊肉跳。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a sickening sound of tearing metal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传来一声可怕的金属断裂声。

Sense.DEF:
very unpleasant and making you feel as if you want to
vomit
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sickening stench of rotting rubbish rose into the air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 垃圾的腐臭味泛入空气中﹐令人作呕。

Sense.DEF: making you feel jealous
Sense.TRAN: 令人羡慕的﹔令人妒忌的
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Helen’s just bought herself a huge house in the South of France.’ ‘God, how sickening!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “海伦刚刚在法国南部买了一幢大房子。”“啊﹐真叫人羡慕！”

Sense.DEF: a day when you say that you are sick and do not go to work, even though you are not really sick
Sense.EXAMPLE: Looks like he’s thrown another sickie pretended to be sick and not gone to work .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来他又装病请假了。

Sense.DEF:
a
sicko
– used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 有精神病的人﹐心理变态的人〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a tool with a blade in the shape of a hook, used for cutting wheat or long grass
time that you are allowed to spend away from work because you are sick

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has been on sick leave for more than three months.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他休病假三个多月了。

Sense.DEF: a serious illness that mainly affects black people, in which the blood cells change shape, causing weakness and fever
Sense.TRAN: 镰状细胞贫血〔患此病者多为黑人〕

Sense.DEF: a sickly person or animal is weak, unhealthy, and often ill
Sense.TRAN: 虚弱的﹐不健康的﹐常生病的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sickly child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个体弱多病的孩子
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked pale and sickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看上去脸色苍白﹐身体虚弱。

Sense.DEF: a sickly smell, taste etc is unpleasant and makes you feel sick
Sense.EXAMPLE: A sickly smell clung to his clothes and hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的衣服和头发上有一股令人恶心的气味。

Sense.DEF: a sickly colour or light is unpleasantly pale or weak
Sense.EXAMPLE: The walls were painted a sickly green.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙上刷了一种惨淡的绿色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pale, sickly moon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苍白昏暗的月亮

Sense.DEF: the state of being ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: an insurance policy against long-term sickness and injury
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保长期患病和受伤的保险单
Sense.EXAMPLE: working days lost due to sickness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因病损失的工作日

Sense.DEF: the feeling that you are about to bring up food from your stomach, or the act of bringing food up

GramExa.GLOSS: sickness that some people get while travelling
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 旅行眩晕/动晕症/晕车/晕船等

Sense.EXAMPLE: Liam had suffered violent sickness and diarrhoea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利亚姆上吐下泻。

Sense.DEF: a particular illness
Sense.EXAMPLE: war-related sicknesses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与战争有关的疾病

Sense.DEF: the serious problems and weaknesses of a social, political, or economic system
Sense.TRAN: 〔社会﹑政治﹑经济制度的〕弊病﹐弊端
Sense.EXAMPLE: He said the idea of ‘success’ was part of the sickness of Western cultures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说﹐“成功”观念是西方文化弊 端之一。

Sense.DEF: money paid by the government to someone who is too ill to work
Sense.TRAN: 疾病补助金〔由政府发给因病不能工作的人〕

Sense.DEF: a note written by your doctor or your parents saying that you were too ill to go to work or school
Sense.TRAN: 〔医生开的〕病假单﹔〔父母为子女写的〕病假条

Sense.DEF: someone who gets pleasure from things that most people find unpleasant or upsetting
Sense.TRAN: 有精神病的人﹐心理变态的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: What kind of sicko would write something like that?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪个神经病会这样写？

Sense.DEF:
a
strike protest about pay or working conditions
in which all the workers at a company say they are sick and stay home on the same day
money paid by an employer to a worker who is too ill to work
a room where someone who is ill can go to lie down
one of the two areas that are on the left or the right of an imaginary line, or on the left or the right of a border, wall, river etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The south side of town is pretty run down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个镇的南边相当破败。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a scar on the right side of his face
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他右脸上的伤疤

Sense.EXAMPLE: Fuel is cheaper on the French side of the border.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 燃料在边境那边的法国要便宜些。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She tilted her head to one side, pretending to consider the question.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把头偏向一侧﹐装作在考虑这个问题。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A man stood watching me from the other side of the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个男人站在马路的对面看着我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His friends and family were all on the other side of the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的朋友和家人都在地球的另一边。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The restaurant was empty apart from another couple on the far side of the room the area that is furthest away from you .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饭店里空空的﹐只有最那边还有一对夫妇。

GramExa.GLOSS: the right side or the left side
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In Sri Lanka they drive on the left-hand side of the road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在斯里兰卡是靠马路左侧行驶的。

Sense.DEF: a position directly next to someone or something, on the right or the left

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stand on this side of me so Dad can get a photo.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 站到我这边来﹐让爸爸来拍一张照片。

GramExa.PROPFORM: at sb’s side/at the side of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A little girl was skipping along at her side.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个小女孩蹦蹦跳跳地跟在她身边。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a card tacked to the wall at the side of the photograph.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙上在照片的旁边钉着一张贺卡。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two large screens stood on either side of the stage one on the left and one on the right side of it .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 舞台的两边立着两块大屏幕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Maggie hurried to his side.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛吉赶快跑到他身边。

Sense.DEF: a surface of something that is not its front, back, top, or bottom

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He led the way round to the side of the building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他带路绕到大楼的侧面。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the side of her glass
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她杯子的侧壁
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Someone ran into the side of my car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人拦腰撞了我的车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: high-sided vehicles
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 车身高的车辆
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a straight-sided dish
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 直身盘子

Sense.DEF: the part of an object or area that is furthest from the middle, at or near the edge

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jack sat down heavily on the side of the bed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克重重地在床边坐下。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She pulled into the side of the road and stopped the car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把汽车开到路边停了下来。

Sense.DEF: one of the two surfaces of a thin flat object

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Write on only one side of the paper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只在纸的一面上写。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll paint the other side of the fence tomorrow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 篱笆的另一面我明天漆。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a scratch on one side of the record.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 唱片的一面有划痕。

Sense.DEF: the part of your body from the top of your arm to the top of your leg
Sense.TRAN: 〔肩膀以下至大腿上部的〕身体的侧边﹔胁
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a scar running right the way down his side.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的胁部从上到下有一条疤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Betty was lying on her side on the bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝蒂侧卧在床上。

Sense.DEF: one of the flat surfaces or edges of a shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: A cube has six sides.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 立方体有六个面。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a seven-sided coin
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一枚七边形的硬币

Sense.DEF: one of the sloping areas of a hill, mountain etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their house was on the side of the valley.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的房子在山谷的坡上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: sheep grazing on the steep hillside
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在陡峭的山坡上吃草的羊

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a steep-sided valley
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 陡直的山谷

Sense.DEF: a page of writing on one side of a piece of paper
Sense.EXAMPLE: How many sides have we got to write?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要写多少页？

Subsense.DEF: next to each other
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We walked along the beach, side by side.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们并排走在沙滩上。

Subsense.DEF: if people work side by side, they work together to achieve something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Local citizens worked side by side with emergency crews to pull their neighbors out of the rubble.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地居民和救援人员齐心协力﹐把邻居从瓦砾中救出来。

Subsense.DEF: if different things or groups exist side by side, they exist in the same place or at the same time, even though this may seem difficult or surprising
Subsense.TRAN: 〔不同的东西或团体〕并存﹐共处
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a visit to see how modern agriculture and wildlife can exist side by side
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体验现代农业和野生动植物如何并存的一次考察

Sense.DEF: first to one side, then to the other, several times or continuously
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Did you catch him?’ Matthew shook his head from side to side.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你抓住他了吗？”马修摇了摇头。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boat rocked violently from side to side.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小船剧烈地左右摇晃。

Sense.DEF: one part or feature of something, especially when compared with another part
Sense.TRAN: 〔某事物的〕一个方面〔尤指与其他方面相比时〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She takes care of the financial side of the business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她负责企业财务方面的工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can’t you see the funny side of all this?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不觉得这一切很可笑吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Environmental pollution gives great cause for concern, but, on the positive side , people are beginning to try and find solutions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境污染确实令人担忧﹐但从积极的方面去看﹐人们开始努力在想办法解决了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Look on the bright side see the good side of a situation – at least you learned something from the experience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 往好的方面想﹐至少你从这次经历中学到了一些东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a children’s book about fairies and magic, but it does have a dark side .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一本讲仙子和魔法的儿童读物﹐但也确实有阴暗的一面。

Sense.DEF: one of the people, groups, or countries opposing each other in a quarrel, war etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He fought on the Republican side in the Spanish Civil War.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在西班牙内战中为共和派作战。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a peace deal that is acceptable to both sides
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方都能够接受的一项和平协议
Sense.EXAMPLE: During the war, he changed sides several times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争期间他数次改变立场。

GramExa.GLOSS: support them
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Well, at least someone’s on my side.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 算了﹐至少还有人站在我这边。

GramExa.GLOSS: used when someone is arguing against you when they should be supporting you
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 你究竟站在哪一边？〔用于当应该支持你的人却发表了反对你的意见时〕

Sense.EXAMPLE: He always likes to be on the winning side .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是喜欢支持赢的一方。

Sense.DEF: one person’s opinion or attitude in an argument or disagreement
Sense.TRAN: 〔争论或分歧中的〕观点﹐态度﹐意见
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try and see my side of things for a change!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你换个角度﹐试着理解一下我的立场吧！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, I can see both sides . They both have a point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗯﹐我明白双方的意见﹐他们都有道理。

GramExa.GLOSS: one person’s opinion of what happened in a situation, especially someone who has been accused of doing something wrong
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We haven’t heard Mike’s side of the story yet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还没有听过迈克的说法呢。

Sense.DEF: to choose to support one person or group in an argument, and oppose the other one
Sense.TRAN: 选择支持一方﹐表明立场

Sense.DEF: a sports team
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re a good side, but I think we’re a better one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们球队是不错﹐但我认为我们更好。

Sense.DEF: one part of someone’s character, especially when compared with another part

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was a side of Shari that I hadn’t seen before.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是莎丽性格中我以前没有见过的一面。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a side to him that worried her, that seemed cold and cruel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的性格中似乎有冷酷和残忍的一面﹐这令她担忧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These days men are not all afraid to show their softer side.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今不是所有男人都害怕展露出较温情的一面。

Sense.DEF: a part of a family
Sense.EXAMPLE: My father’s side of the family are short, but my mother’s side are tall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲家里都是矮个子﹐但我母亲家里都是高个子。

Sense.DEF: what someone agrees to do as part of an agreement
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Russians kept their side of the bargain , and pulled out of East Germany.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 俄罗斯人履行协议﹐撤出了东德。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that someone does work in addition to their regular job
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Most consultants do private work on the side.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数顾问医生都另外干私活。

Subsense.DEF: secretly, and dishonestly or illegally
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His wife discovered that he had a woman on the side.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他妻子发现他背地里有个女人。

Subsense.DEF: food that is served on the side is ordered with the main dish in a restaurant, but is not usually part of that dish
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’d like eggs with toast on the side.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要鸡蛋配吐司。

Sense.DEF: a small amount of food that you order in a restaurant in addition to your main meal

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a hamburger with a side of fries
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉堡包配炸薯条

Subsense.DEF: in or from every direction
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Planes were attacking us from all sides.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机从四面八方攻击我们。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The town is surrounded on all sides by vineyards.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城镇四周都是葡萄园。

Subsense.DEF: by or from a lot of people with different opinions
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Clinton was praised on all sides for his warm manner and diplomatic approach.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克林顿的热情和练达受到了各方的称赞。

Sense.DEF: to save something to be dealt with or used later
Sense.TRAN: 把某事物置一边〔以待日后解决或使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s leave that question to one side for now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个问题我们暂时放在一边吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put a little money to one side each week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个星期都留出一点钱。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be at sb’s side/stay by sb’s side/not leave sb’s side
Sense.DEF: to be with someone, and take care of them or support them
Sense.TRAN: 在某人身边/不离某人左右〔照顾或支持他们〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He faced the reporters with his wife at his side.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他由妻子陪同面对那些记者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She nursed him through his illness, never leaving his side.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在他生病期间﹐她悉心照料﹐始终不离左右。

Sense.DEF: to take someone away from other people for a short time for a private talk
Sense.TRAN: 把某人拉到一旁〔私下交谈〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Before they left, Colette took me to one side and warned me about Bernard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们临走前﹐科利特把我拉到一边﹐提醒我要当心伯纳德。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have sth on your side/sth is on your side
Sense.DEF: used to say that you have an advantage that increases your chances of success
Sense.TRAN: 有某方面的优势/某事对某人有利

GramExa.PROPFORM: have time/luck/God/right etc on your side
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Barnes didn’t have much experience, but he had youth and enthusiasm on his side.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴恩斯没有多少经验﹐但他的优势是年轻﹑有热情。

Sense.LEXUNIT: get on the wrong side of sb
Sense.DEF: to annoy someone or make them angry, especially someone who can cause serious problems for you
Sense.TRAN: 使某人生气﹐惹毛某人﹐得罪某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be careful not to get on the wrong side of her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心不要得罪她。

Sense.LEXUNIT: keep on the right side of sb
Sense.DEF: to be careful not to annoy someone, because you want them to help you and not cause problems for you
Sense.TRAN: 对某人赔小心﹐小心不惹某人生气
Sense.EXAMPLE: We tried to keep on the right side of the housekeeper, so that she would let us bring beer in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们尽量和管家搞好关系﹐这样她就肯让我们带啤酒进来了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: on the right/wrong side of 30/40 etc
Sense.DEF: younger or older than 30, 40 etc
Sense.TRAN: 不到/已过 30 岁/40 岁等

Sense.DEF: a little too small, too high, too heavy etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trousers are a bit on the small side.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条裤子有点偏小。

Sense.DEF: before a particular time – used to say that something will not happen before then
Sense.TRAN: 圣诞节/半夜等之前〔用于表示某事在这之前不会发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I doubt we’ll see him this side of Christmas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怀疑圣诞节之前我们见不到他。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the best/biggest etc … this side of sth
Sense.DEF: used humorously to say that something is very good, big etc …
Sense.TRAN: 中最好/最大等的…〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the best Chinese food this side of Peking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北京最好的中国菜

Sense.LEXUNIT: on the wrong/right side of the law
Sense.DEF: breaking or not breaking the law

Sense.LEXUNIT: be on the side of the angels
Sense.DEF: to be doing what is morally right
to behave badly or do something that embarrasses or disappoints your family, friends etc
Sense.TRAN: 使自己人难堪﹐辱没自己一方

Sense.LEXUNIT: criticize/nag/hassle sb up one side and down the other
Sense.DEF: to criticize someone, complain to them in an annoying way etc without worrying about how they feel
Sense.TRAN: 不依不饶地批评/纠缠/烦扰某人

Sense.DEF: one half of an animal’s body, used as food
a television station
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s on the other side?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 另一个台在播什么？

Crossrefto.REFLEX: to be on the safe side
err on the side of caution
the other side of the coin
two sides of the same coin

Sense.DEF: in or on the side of something
Sense.TRAN: 旁边的﹐侧面的﹔在边上的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hannah slipped out through a side exit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉娜从一个侧门溜了出去。

Sense.DEF: from the side of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you get a side view?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能看到侧景吗？

Sense.DEF: to support or argue against a person or group in a quarrel, fight etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Frank sided with David against their mother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰克站在戴维一边反对妈妈。

Sense.DEF: a weapon carried or worn at someone’s side, for example a gun or sword
a separate part of something such as a newspaper article where extra information is given
Sense.TRAN: 〔报纸新闻等的〕补充报道﹐花絮报道

Sense.DEF:
an occasion when the lawyers and the judge in a
trial
discuss something without letting the
jury
hear what they are saying
Sense.TRAN: 私谈﹐私下商量〔审判时律师和法官之间不让陪审团听到的讨论〕

Sense.DEF: an additional advantage or good result that comes from something, besides its main purpose
Sense.TRAN: 附加的好处﹐另外的优点
Sense.EXAMPLE: A side benefit to filming close-up shots is that your microphone will pick up clearer sound.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拍摄特写镜头的一个附带好处是麦克风的录音会更 清晰。

Sense.DEF:
a long low piece of furniture usually in a
dining room
, used for storing plates, glasses etc
sideburns
hair grown down the sides of a man’s face in front of his ears

a small vehicle attached to the side of a
motorcycle
, in which a passenger can ride
a small amount of food such as a vege-table that you eat with a main meal
an effect that a drug has on your body in addition to curing pain or illness

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a natural remedy with no harmful side effects
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种没有不良副作用的天然药物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the side effects of the medication
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药物的副作用

Sense.DEF: an unexpected or unplanned result of a situation or event
Sense.TRAN: 意外后果﹔意想不到的结果
Sense.EXAMPLE: These policy changes could have beneficial side effects for the whole economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些政策变动可能会给整个经济带来意外的好处。

Sense.DEF: a subject or problem that is not as important as the main one, and may take people’s attention away from the main subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔可能分散注意力的〕次要问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tax proposal is really a side issue with us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个税收提议对我们来说其实是一个次要问题。

Sense.DEF: someone who spends time with or helps another person, especially when that other person is more important than they are
one of the two small lights next to the main front lights on a car
an activity that you do as well as your main job or business, in order to earn more money

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Zoë does a bit of freelance photography as a sideline.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 佐薇兼职做点自由摄影。

Sense.DEF: not taking part in an activity even though you want to or should do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can’t stay on the sidelines for ever; it’s time you got involved.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能一直袖手旁观﹐是时候参与进来了。

Sense.DEF: the area just outside the lines that form the edge of a sports field

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Wenger stood on the sidelines shouting instructions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 温格站在场外大声发出指示。

Sense.DEF: a line at the side of a sports field, which shows where the players are allowed to play
if you are sidelined, you are unable to play in a sports game because you are injured, or unable to take part in an activity because you are not as good as someone else
Sense.TRAN: 〔因受伤〕使无法上场比赛﹔ 〔因水平不够〕使不能参加活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: Owen was once again sidelined through injury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧文又一次因伤无法上场。

Sense.DEF: a way of looking at someone by moving your eyes to the side, especially so that it seems secret, dishonest, or disapproving
Sense.TRAN: 斜眼看〔尤表示有秘密﹑不诚实或不以为然〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave Oliver a sidelong glance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他斜睨了奥利弗一眼。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: ‘You looked very well this morning,’ she added, glancing sidelong at him.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: “今天早上你气色不错呀。”她加了一句﹐同时斜瞟了他一眼。

Sense.DEF: coming from one side rather than from in front or behind
Sense.EXAMPLE: a side-on collision
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 侧面相撞

Sense.DEF: a small amount of food ordered in a restaurant to be eaten with a main meal but served on a separate dish
Sense.TRAN: 〔餐馆中搭配主菜另点的〕配菜﹐小菜
Sense.EXAMPLE: a side order of onion rings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为小菜另点的洋葱圈

Sense.DEF: a road that is smaller than a main road, but is often connected to it
to ride or sit on a horse with both legs on the same side of the horse
Sense.TRAN: 横鞍骑马﹐偏坐在马鞍上〔双腿在同侧〕

Sense.DEF:
a separate small part of a
fair
or
circus
, where you pay to play games or watch a performance
Sense.TRAN: 〔游乐场或马戏团的〕穿插表演﹐助兴节目

Sense.DEF: an event that is much less important or serious than another one
Sense.EXAMPLE: The initial conflict was a mere sideshow compared with the World War that followed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最初的冲突同随后发生的世界大战相比﹐只是次要事件。

Sense.DEF: extremely funny
Sense.TRAN: 令人捧腹大笑的﹐极其滑稽的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He told some sidesplitting jokes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他讲了一些令人笑破肚皮的笑话。

Sense.DEF: to avoid dealing with something difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report sidesteps the environmental issues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告回避了环境问题。

Sense.DEF: to step quickly sideways to avoid being hit or walking into someone
Sense.TRAN: 横跨一步躲过﹐侧移一步闪开

Sense.DEF: a street that is smaller than a main street, but is often connected to it
if you take a sideswipe at someone or something, you criticize them while you are talking about something different
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sir Kenneth concluded with a sideswipe at his critics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯尼思爵士结束讲话时﹐对他的批评者含沙射影地抨击了一番。

Sense.DEF: to hit the side of a car with another car so that the two sides touch quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was going too fast and sideswiped a parked car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她车开得太快﹐蹭了一辆停着的汽车。

Sense.DEF: to make someone stop doing what they should be doing, or stop talking about what they started talking about, by making them interested in something else
Sense.TRAN: 使分散思路﹐使离题﹐使转移目标
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t get sidetracked by the audience’s questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要因为观众的提问而离题。

Sense.DEF: to delay or stop the progress of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: An effort to improve security was sidetracked by budget problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加强安全措施的行动因为预算问题被搁置。

Sense.DEF: a mirror attached to the side of a car
a hard surface or path at the side of a street for people to walk on
to or towards one side
Sense.EXAMPLE: A strong gust of wind blew the car sideways into the ditch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵狂风把汽车横着掀进了沟里。

Sense.DEF: with the side, rather than the front or back, facing forwards
Sense.EXAMPLE: They brought the piano sideways through the front door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把钢琴侧着从前门抬进来。

Sense.DEF: if you are moved sideways at work, you are given a job that is different from, but is at the same level as, your old job
Sense.EXAMPLE: He would be moved sideways, rather than demoted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他将被平级调动﹐而不是降职。

Sense.DEF: an old-fashioned type of ship which is pushed forward by a pair of large wheels at the sides
a short railway track connected to a main track, where trains are kept when they are not being used
long narrow pieces of wood, metal, or plastic, used for covering the outside walls of houses
to walk towards something or someone slowly and quietly, as if you do not want to be noticed
Sense.TRAN: 悄悄走近﹐鬼鬼祟祟地走向

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A woman sidled up to us and asked if we wanted to buy a watch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个女人鬼鬼祟祟地走近我们﹐问我们要不要买手表。

Sense.DEF: when a baby stops breathing and dies while it is sleeping, for no known reason
a situation in which an army or the police surround a place and try to gain control of it or force someone to come out of it
Sense.TRAN: 〔军队或警方对地方的〕围困﹐封锁﹐包围
Sense.EXAMPLE: The siege lasted almost four months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次封锁历时近四个月。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a three-day police siege at a remote country cottage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方对一座偏僻村舍历时三天的包围

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the siege of Leningrad
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 列宁格勒之围

GramExa.GLOSS: end a siege

Subsense.DEF: if the army or police lay siege to a place, they start a siege against it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In June 1176, King Richard laid siege to Limoges.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1176年6月﹐理查王对利摩日实施包围。

Subsense.DEF: if you lay siege to someone, you do everything you can to try and get them to talk to you
Subsense.TRAN: 〔为使某人和你说话而〕向某人展开攻势
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Then he set to work laying siege to her with letters.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接着他开始给她写信﹐向她展开攻势。

Subsense.DEF: to be surrounded by an army in a siege
to be being criticized, attacked, or threatened all the time
Subsense.TRAN: 不断受到批评[攻击﹐威胁等]﹐受到围攻
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The TV station has been under siege from irate viewers phoning in to complain.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视台受到愤怒观众的围攻﹐他们不断打电话来投诉。

Sense.DEF: the feeling among a group of people that they are surrounded by enemies and must do everything they can to protect themselves
Sense.TRAN: 受围心态〔一群人感觉被敌人围困因而必须想方设法自卫的心理〕

Sense.DEF: a yellowish brown colour
a row or area of sharply pointed mountains
Sense.TRAN: 锯齿山脊﹐峰峦起伏的山脉

Sense.DEF:
a US organization that tries to protect the environment, especially natural areas such as forests, mountains, and rivers. It is also a social club for people who like to
hike
.
Sense.TRAN: 塞拉俱乐部﹐峰峦俱乐部〔美国一环保组织﹐尤致力于保护山林﹑河流等自然区﹔该组织也是远足爱好者的社交俱乐部〕

Sense.DEF: a short sleep in the afternoon, especially in warm countries

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The stores all close after lunch when everyone takes a siesta.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 午饭后所有商店都关门﹐大家都睡午觉。

Subsense.DEF: a round wire kitchen tool with a lot of small holes, used for separating solid food from liquid or small pieces of food from large pieces
a round wire tool for separating small objects from large objects

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a memory like a sieve
Sense.DEF: to forget things easily
to put flour or other food through a sieve
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sieve the flour and cocoa powder into a bowl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把面粉和可可粉筛进碗里。

Sense.DEF: to put flour, sugar etc through a sieve or similar container in order to remove large pieces
to examine information, documents etc carefully in order to find something out or decide what is important and what is not
Sense.TRAN: 细查﹐详查﹐严密检查〔信息﹑文件等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police are sifting through the evidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方在筛查证据。

Sense.DEF: to separate something from other things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s hard to sift out the truth from the lies in this case.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种情况下真相和谎言难以分辨。

Sense.DEF: a container with a lot of small holes in the top used for shaking flour, sugar etc onto things
Sense.TRAN: 〔盖上有小孔的〕调味瓶﹐佐料瓶

Sense.DEF: a container with a handle and a lot of small holes on the bottom, used for removing large pieces from flour or for mixing flour and other dry things together in cooking
to breathe in and out making a long sound, especially because you are bored, disappointed, tired etc
Sense.TRAN: 叹气﹐叹息〔尤因厌烦﹑失望﹑疲倦等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Well, there’s nothing we can do about it now,’ she sighed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “唉﹐我们现在对此无能为力。”她叹口气说。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Frankie stared out of the window and sighed deeply.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗朗基凝望着窗外﹐深深地叹了口气。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He sighed with despair at the thought of all the opportunities he had missed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到自己错过的一个个机会﹐他绝望地叹了口气。

Sense.DEF: if the wind sighs, it makes a long sound like someone sighing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wind sighed in the trees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 林中风声呜咽。

Sense.DEF: to be sad because you are thinking about a pleasant time in the past
Sense.TRAN: 为〔过去的美好时光〕悲叹[叹惜]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Emilia sighed for her lost youth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米莉亚悲叹逝去的青春。

Sense.DEF: an act or sound of sighing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She let out a sigh of impatience.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不耐烦地叹了口气。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Laura shrugged, and gave a heavy sigh.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳拉耸耸肩﹐重重地叹了口气。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We all breathed a sigh of relief when we heard they were safe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听到他们平安无事﹐我们都松了一口气。

Sense.DEF: the physical ability to see
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anne’s sight is very good for someone of her age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮的视力对于她这个年龄的人来说算是非常好的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He began to lose his sight six years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 六年前他开始视力衰退。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an emergency operation to save his sight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挽救他视力的紧急手术
Sense.EXAMPLE: You will get a free sight test if you are under 16.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你不满16岁﹐可以免费检查视力。

Sense.DEF: the act of seeing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just the sight of him made her go all weak.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一看到他﹐她就两腿发软。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Marcie will faint at the sight of blood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马西看见血就晕。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The house is hidden from sight behind trees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子隐藏在树林后面﹐不会被看到。

Subsense.DEF: something you can see

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Street dentists are a common sight in Pakistan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在巴基斯坦﹐街头牙医随处可见。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: As he reached the front door, he saw a strange sight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走到前门﹐看到了一个奇怪的景象。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: the sights and sounds of the forest
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 森林的景致与声音

Subsense.DEF: famous or interesting places that tourists visit
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In the afternoon, you’ll have a chance to relax or see the sights .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家下午可以休息﹐也可以去参观名胜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: So, Maria’s showing you the sights of Copenhagen, is she?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么﹐玛丽亚要带你去参观哥本哈根的名胜﹐是吗？

Subsense.DEF: inside the area that you can see
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I glanced around me quickly. There was no one in sight .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我扫视四周﹐看不到一个人影。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They burned every house in sight .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们见到房子就烧。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The boys get home and eat every thing in sight .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩们回到家里﹐看见东西就吃。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Since my hotel was within sight, I told him he could go.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的酒店就在眼前﹐于是我就叫他走了。

Subsense.DEF: likely to happen soon
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Six months from the start of the strike, there is still no end in sight .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罢工开始至今六个月了﹐眼下还看不出结束的迹象。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Peace is now in sight.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和平在望。

Subsense.DEF: in the area where you can see something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We camped within sight of the lake.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在看得见湖的地方露营。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: At last they came in sight of the city.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们终于看见那座城市了。

Subsense.DEF: in a position where you will soon be able to get something or achieve something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Dan was now within sight of the championship.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹现在夺冠在望。

Sense.DEF: if you have someone or something in your sights, you intend to achieve it or get it for yourself, or to attack them
Sense.TRAN: 瞄准﹐盯住〔以期取得﹑得到或攻击〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rogers had victory firmly in his sights.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗杰斯下定决心要夺取胜利。

Sense.DEF: outside the area that you can see
Sense.EXAMPLE: Karen waved until the car was out of sight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡伦不断挥手﹐直到汽车再也看不见了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: out of sight, out of mind
Sense.DEF: used to say that people soon stop thinking about something or someone if they do not see them for a while
to disappear
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Will she be all right?’ asked Jen as the car disappeared from sight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她会没事吧？”汽车消失不见时珍问道。

Sense.DEF: to appear
Sense.EXAMPLE: when the ship at last came into sight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当这艘船终于出现时

Sense.DEF: as soon as you see someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The army has been ordered to shoot rebel soldiers on sight .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队奉命见到叛军就开枪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jo disliked him on sight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔第一眼见到他就不喜欢。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not let sb out of your sight
Sense.DEF: to make sure that someone stays near you
Sense.TRAN: 不让某人离开你的视线
Sense.EXAMPLE: Since the accident, Donna hasn’t let the children out of her sight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出事以后﹐唐娜就没有让孩子离开过自己的视线。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be sick of/can’t stand/hate the sight of sb/sth
Sense.DEF: to dislike someone or something very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alan and Sam can’t stand the sight of each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伦和萨姆都非常讨厌对方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everybody hates the sight of you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都讨厌你。

Subsense.DEF: someone or something that you feel very happy to see
Subsense.TRAN: 使人看着高兴的人﹔赏心悦目的东西

Subsense.DEF: someone or something that is very unattractive or very funny to look at
Subsense.TRAN: 难看的[样子滑稽的]人[物]

Sense.DEF: a lot more, a lot better etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know the place a damn sight better than you do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对这个地方比你要熟悉得多了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old lady is a sight cleverer than Sarah.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这老太太可比萨拉聪明多了。

Sense.DEF: to look very funny or stupid, or very untidy or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 看起来滑稽[愚蠢﹐脏乱﹐难看]
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’d had an all-night party, and the place looked a bit of a sight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开了个通宵派对﹐那地方脏乱得有点不成样子了。

Sense.DEF: if you buy or choose something sight unseen, you do it without looking at the thing first
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t believe you would rent a place sight unseen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我简直不敢相信﹐你看也不看就把一个地方租了下来。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be a (beautiful/strange/frightening etc) sight to behold
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something or someone looks very unusual, for example because they are very beautiful, strange, or frightening
Sense.TRAN: 看起来非同一般（的漂亮/奇怪/人等）
Sense.EXAMPLE: His garden was a sight to behold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的花园非同一般。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His face was not a pleasant sight to behold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的脸很吓人。
