Sense.DEF: the part of a gun or other weapon that guides your eye when you are aiming at something

Section.SECHEADING: SOMETHING THAT YOU SEE 所见之物

Exponent.DEF: something that you see
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A herd of elephants is a magnificent sight.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 象群出现是个壮观的景象。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Even Charles cheered up at the sight of the food.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一看到食物,连查尔斯都为之振奋。

Exponent.DEF: the area you can see from a window or place, especially when it is beautiful
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The view from the top of the mountain is amazing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 从山顶上往下看景色迷人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The hotel has great views of Lake Windermere.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这家宾馆能看见温德米尔湖的旖旎风光。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We had a good view of the firework display.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看到了精彩的烟花表演。

Exponent.DEF: an impressive view of a very large area that stretches a long way across in front of you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a panorama of snow-covered hills and mountains
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一览无余的雪山美景

Exponent.DEF: a view of a large area of beautiful scenery – used in written descriptions
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The road around the island offers some spectacular vistas.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿环岛公路能看见旖旎的风光。

Exponent.DEF: what you see in a place, especially where people are moving around and doing things
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Reporters described the horrific scenes which followed the bombing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 记者们描述了爆炸发生后的可怕景象。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His pictures are mainly of local scenes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的照片主要表现地方风情。

Exponent.DEF: something that you see that is very unusual, surprising, or strange
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It must have been an unusual spectacle.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时的场面一定是非同寻常。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I leaned over the balcony to get a look at the spectacle below.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我倚在阳台上,看着下面的壮观场面。

Exponent.DEF: pictures or parts of a film, video etc that people can see, as opposed to the parts you can hear
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Good visuals will help keep your audience’s attention.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 好的画面有助于保持观众的注意力。

Sense.DEF: to see something from a long distance away, or see something you have been looking for
Sense.TRAN: 〔从很远处或经过一番寻找后〕看见﹐发现
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sailors gave a shout of joy when they sighted land .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水手们看到陆地时高声欢呼起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several rare birds have been sighted in the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区已经发现了好几种珍稀鸟类。

Sense.DEF: someone who is sighted can see, and is not blind
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕看得见的﹐有视力的﹐不盲的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blind and sighted children are taught in the same classroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失明和视力正常的儿童在同一个教室里上课。
Sense.EXAMPLE: her partially sighted having limited ability to see father
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那有视力障碍的父亲

Sense.DEF: an occasion on which something is seen, especially something rare or something that people are hoping to see
Sense.TRAN: 看见﹐发现〔尤指见到罕见的或希望见到的事物〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were two unconfirmed sightings of UFOs in the area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区有两起未经证实的目击不明飞行物的事件。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Where was the latest sighting?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近一次是在哪里发现的？

Sense.DEF: blind
to play or sing written music when you look at it for the first time, without practising it first
Sense.TRAN: 视奏﹐视唱〔未经练习﹐直接看乐谱演奏或演唱〕

Sense.DEF: when you visit famous or interesting places, especially as tourists
Sense.EXAMPLE: She swam and sunbathed, went sightseeing and relaxed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她游泳﹐晒日光浴﹐观光﹐放松。

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a tourist, who is visiting a famous or interesting place
a piece of paper, metal, or wood with words or a picture that gives people information, warnings, or instructions
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sign on the door
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门上的标牌
路标
Sense.EXAMPLE: a no smoking sign
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁止吸烟的告示牌
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t ignore the fog warning signs .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要忽视雾警标志。

PIC.HEADING: SIGN 标志
PIC.PICCONTENT: sign 告示牌；poster 海报；placard 标语牌；notice 启事；hoarding BrE 【英】/billboard AmE 【美】广告牌

Sense.DEF: an event, fact etc that shows that something is happening or that something is true or exists

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A red morning sky is a sign of an impending storm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 早晨的红霞预示着暴风雨即将来临。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Crying is seen as a sign of weakness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哭被看作软弱的表现。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A paw print in the dust was a sign that a tiger was close.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙土里的一个爪印表明附近有老虎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were no signs of forced entry into the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有强行入室的痕迹。

Sense.DEF: a movement, sound etc that you make in order to tell someone something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the thumbs-up sign a sign that you make with your hand to show that something is successful
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 〔示意成功的〕翘拇指手势

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Wait until I give the sign.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 等我给你信号。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bruce made a sign that he was ready to leave.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布鲁斯做了个手势表示他可以走了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Three short blasts on the whistle was the sign to begin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三声短哨是开始的信号。

Sense.DEF: a mark or shape that has a particular meaning
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dollar sign
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美元符号
Sense.EXAMPLE: a minus sign
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 减号

Sense.DEF: a group of stars, representing one of 12 parts of the year, that some people believe influences your behaviour and your life
Sense.TRAN: 宫〔黄道十二宫之一〕﹐星座
Sense.EXAMPLE: What sign are you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是什么星座？

Sense.DEF: a language that uses hand movements instead of spoken words, used by people who cannot hear

Sense.LEXUNIT: there is no sign of sb/sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something is not in a place or cannot be found
Sense.EXAMPLE: I waited for two hours but there was still no sign of her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我等了两个小时﹐还是不见她的踪影。

Subsense.DEF: a movement that shows that someone is alive, or something that shows that there are people in a particular place
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She listened intently for signs of life.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她专注地听是否有人活动的迹象。

Subsense.DEF: something that shows that a situation is becoming more active
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Commercial property markets are now showing definite signs of life .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 商业地产市场现在出现了明显的复苏迹象。

Sense.DEF: something that shows how people live now
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s just a sign of the times that many children have mobile phones.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多孩子都有手机﹐这只是个时代特征。

Sense.DEF: the hand movement that some Christians make in the shape of a cross, to show respect for God or to protect themselves from evil

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There are clear signs of a slowdown in economic growth.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有明显的迹象表明经济增长放缓了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very clear sign
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was walking up and down, a sure sign that he was worried.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他来回踱步,显然是在担心。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 好的/积极的/令人鼓舞的迹象
Collocate.EXAMPLE: If she can move her legs, that’s a good sign.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果她的腿能动,就是个好的迹象。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The jury was taking ages to make up its mind, which he felt was probably a bad sign.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团久久没有作出决定,他感觉这可能是个不好的兆头。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that people can see clearly
one that shows something bad might be happening
signs that clearly show something bad
the first thing that shows something is happening, or something exists

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There are now signs of an improvement in the economy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在经济有了好转的迹象。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Did she show any signs of distress?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是否表现出痛苦的样子？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I could see some signs of improvement in her health.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到她身体有好转的迹象。

Exponent.DEF: an event, fact etc that shows that something is happening or that something is true or exists
Exponent.TRAN: 〔表明某事正在发生或某事属实或存在的〕迹象,痕迹
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The curtains were still drawn and there was no sign of activity.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗帘依然拉着,没有人活动的痕迹。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A score of 80 or more is a sign that you are doing very well.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 80 或80分以上说明你考得很好。

Exponent.DEF: a sign. Indication is more formal than sign .
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Recently there have been several indications of improving relations.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 近来有些迹象表明关系在好转。

Exponent.DEF: facts or signs that show clearly that something exists or is true, especially something that you are trying to prove
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Scientists are hoping to find evidence that there was once life on Mars.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家们希望找到火星上曾有生命存在的证据。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was not enough evidence to convict him of the murder.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有足够的证据证明他犯有谋杀罪。

Exponent.DEF: a sign that someone has an illness or that a serious problem exists
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The first symptoms are tiredness and loss of weight.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 初期症状是疲倦和体重减轻。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Is this a symptom of the decay of Western civilization?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是不是西方文明衰落的征候？

Exponent.DEF: a sign that shows you what is happening or what is true – used about a process, or about the state or level of something
Exponent.TRAN: 〔过程﹑状态或水平的〕指示物,指标
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There are a number of indicators of economic slowdown.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一些指标显示经济在放缓。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The tests are considered a good indicator of intelligence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些测试被认为能够很好地反映一个人的智力水平。

Exponent.DEF: a sign that shows that you should do something, or that you have a particular attitude
Exponent.TRAN: 〔应该做某物或有某种态度的〕信号
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Severe chest pain is a warning signal that cannot be ignored.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 胸口剧痛是一个不容忽视的警告信号。

Exponent.DEF: a sign, especially that you respect or honour someone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People stood in silence as a mark of respect.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们静默肃立以示恭敬。

Sense.DEF:
to write your
signature
on something to show that you wrote it, agree with it, or were present
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sign here, please.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请在这里签字。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The artist had signed his name in the corner of the painting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 画家在画的角上落了款。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You forgot to sign the cheque .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你忘记在支票上签名了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over a hundred people have sign ed the petition .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已有一百多人在请愿书上签了名。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Serena sign s her autograph every time she’s asked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每次有人请塞雷娜签名她都会签。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a signed photo of Paul McCartney
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张保罗·麦卡特尼的签名照片

Sense.DEF:
to make a document, agreement etc official and legal by writing your
signature
on it
Sense.TRAN: 签署协议书/合同/条约等
Sense.EXAMPLE: France has just signed a new trade deal with Japan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国刚刚和日本签署了一项新的贸易协定。

Sense.DEF: if a football team or music company signs someone, or if someone signs for them, that person signs a contract in which they agree to work for them
Sense.EXAMPLE: CBS Records had signed her back in 1988 on a three-album contract.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哥伦比亚唱片公司早在 1988 年就和她签订了发行三张专辑的合同。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Miller worked in the shipyards before signing for Rangers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 米勒在签约流浪者队之前在造船厂干活。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Before long, they had signed with Virgin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不久就和维珍唱片公司签了约。

Sense.DEF: to officially agree to something by signing a contract
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure the repairs are done before you sign on the dotted line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 确定修好了再签字。

Sense.DEF: if someone in authority signs something into law, they make it part of the law by signing an official document
Sense.TRAN: 经签署使议案/法规/协议成为法律

Sense.DEF: with all the necessary legal documents signed
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll all be signed and sealed by Friday, and you can move in then.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期五之前所有手续都会办完﹐到时你就可以搬进来了。

Sense.DEF: to try to tell someone something or ask them to do something by using signs and movements

GramExa.PROPFORM: sign to sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He signed to the maid to leave the room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他示意女仆离开房间。

GramExa.PROPFORM: sign for sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She signed for us to go inside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她示意我们进去。

Sense.DEF:
to use, or translate something into,
sign language
Sense.TRAN: 用手语表达﹔把…译成手语

Sense.DEF: to sign a document that gives your property or legal rights to someone else
Sense.TRAN: 签字放弃[让与] 〔财产或法定权利〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had signed away all claims to the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已签字放弃对房子的一切权利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt as if I was signing away my life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉这一签字似乎把自己的一生都放弃了。

Sense.DEF: to sign a document to prove that you have received something
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is a registered letter - someone will have to sign for it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是封挂号信﹐必须有人签收。

Sense.DEF: to write your name on a form, in a book etc when you enter a place such as a hotel, office, or club
Sense.EXAMPLE: Remember to sign in at reception.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别忘了在接待处签到。

Sense.DEF: to write someone else’s name in a book so that they are allowed to enter a club, an office etc
Sense.TRAN: 为〔某人〕登记〔使其得以进入俱乐部﹑办公室等〕

Sense.DEF: to end a radio or television programme by saying goodbye
to write your final message at the end of an informal letter
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s getting late so I’ll sign off now. Love, John.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时间不早了﹐就此笔。 爱你的 约翰。

Sense.DEF: if a doctor signs someone off, he or she gives them a note saying that they are ill and not able to work
Sense.EXAMPLE: For the last month, she has been signed off sick from work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上个月她请了一个月病假﹐没有上班。

Sense.DEF: to show that you approve of a plan or that something is finished by signing an official document
Sense.TRAN: 签字认可某事﹔签字确认某事结束
Sense.EXAMPLE: Major repainting work now needs to be signed off by a qualified engineer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在大的翻漆工程需要一名有资质的工程师签字验收。

Sense.DEF: to state officially that you are unemployed by signing a form, so that you can get money from the government
Sense.TRAN: 登记失业〔以领取政府的救济金〕

Sense.DEF: to sign a document to show that you agree to work for someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He signed on as a soldier in the US army.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他签约成为美国陆军的一名士兵。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll probably have to sign on with a nursing agency.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我也许得和护理介绍所签个约。

Sense.DEF: to write your name in a book when you leave a place such as a hotel, office, or club
Sense.TRAN: 〔离开酒店﹑办公室﹑俱乐部等时〕签名登记离开﹐签退

Sense.DEF: to write your name on a form or in a book to show that you have taken or borrowed something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bernstein signed out a company car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯恩斯坦登记借用了公司的一辆汽车。

Sense.DEF: to write in a book that someone is allowed to leave somewhere such as a school, office etc
Sense.TRAN: 替某人签退 离开学校﹑办公室等处〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parents must sign pupils out when collecting them for doctor’s or dentist’s appointments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长必须为学生签退才能领走他们去看医生或牙医。

Sense.DEF: to sign an official document that gives your property or legal rights to someone else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When he became ill, he signed his property in France over to his son.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他生病后便签字把他在法国的房产给了儿子。

Sense.DEF: to put your name on a list for something because you want to take part in it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m thinking of signing up for a yoga course.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在考虑报名参加一门瑜伽课。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Over half the people who signed up to do engineering were women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 报名读工程学的人半数以上为女性。

Sense.DEF: if someone is signed up by an organization, they sign a contract in which they agree to work for that organization
Sense.TRAN: 使某人签约受雇﹐签约雇用某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several well-known researchers have been signed up for the project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几位著名的研究人员已经签约参加这个项目。

Sense.DEF: the signs in or on a building, or in a public place
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物或公共场所的〕标记﹐标志
Sense.EXAMPLE: The signage at the hospital is being made clearer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院里的标志正在修改﹐以变得更加清楚。

Sense.DEF: a sound or action that you make in order to give information to someone or tell them to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When she got up from the table, it was obviously the signal for us to leave.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从桌边站起来﹐这显然是要我们离开。

Sense.EXAMPLE: At a prearranged signal the lights went out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预定的信号一发出﹐灯就全灭了。

Sense.DEF: an event or action that shows what someone feels, what exists, or what is likely to happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These results are a signal that the child may need special help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些结果表明这个孩子可能需要特别的帮助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The opinion poll is a clear signal of people’s dissatisfaction with the government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 此次民意调查清楚地表明了民众对政府的不满。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the danger signals of a heart attack
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 心脏病发作的危险信号

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We don’t want to give out the wrong signal to investors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不想向投资者发出错误的信号。

Sense.DEF: a series of light waves, sound waves etc that carry an image, sound, or message, for example in radio or television

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This new pay-TV channel sends signals via satellite to cable companies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个新的付费电视频道通过卫星把信号发送到有线电视公司。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a small antenna which can receive radio signals
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以接收无线电信号的小型天线
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The coastguard picked up a distress signal from a freighter 50 miles out at sea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海岸警卫队接收到一艘离海岸 50 英里的货船发来的求救信号。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment with coloured lights, used on a railway to tell train drivers whether they can continue or must stop
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stop signal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 停车信号灯
Sense.EXAMPLE: a signal failure when these lights do not work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信号灯故障

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: My body was giving me a clear signal that something was wrong.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 身体向我发出明确信号,我的健康出问题了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a signal showing that there is danger
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Managers should keep a watchful eye open for the danger signals.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理人员应时刻警惕危险信号。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: ones that do not give a true account of a situation

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The use of the army sends out a clear signal to protesters that their actions will not be tolerated.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 动用军队是向抗议者发出明确信号,他们的行为是不能容忍的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: to understand signals correctly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: President Nixon read the signals and decided it was time to resign.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克松总统读懂了信号,认为应该辞职了。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 3

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The signals are transmitted via satellites.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些信号通过卫星传送。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The device emits a signal which can be picked up by a submarine.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该设备发出一个信号,可以被潜水艇接收。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The antenna that will pick up the signals is a 12-metre dish.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 接收这些信号的天线是一个直径 12 米的碟形装置。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: allow it to travel along or through something

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I can’t use my phone because the signal isn’t strong enough here.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的手机不能用,因为这里信号不够强。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The signals were too weak for the receiver to pick up.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 信号太弱,接收器收不到。

Sense.DEF: to make a sound or action in order to give information or tell someone to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She signalled, and the waiter brought the bill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她打了个手势﹐侍者就拿来了账单。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whistle signalled the end of the match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哨声吹响﹐示意比赛结束。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mary signalled wildly at them, but they didn’t notice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽拼命向他们做手势﹐但他们没注意到。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The judge signaled to a police officer and the man was led away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官向一名警察示意﹐于是那个人就被带走了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He pushed his plate away and signalled for coffee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把盘子推开﹐示意要杯咖啡。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She signalled to the children to come inside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她示意孩子们进来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bell signaled that school was over.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 铃声响起表示放学。

Sense.DEF: to make something clear by what you say or do – used in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 〔用语言或行动〕表明﹐表示〔用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both sides have signaled their willingness to start negotiations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方都表示了启动谈判的意愿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: British sources last night signalled their readiness to talk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国方面昨晚表示愿意对话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Prime Minister’s speech today signals that there will be a shakeup in the cabinet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相今天的讲话表明内阁将进行改组。

Sense.DEF: to be a sign that something is going to happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the lengthening days that signal the end of winter
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 白昼变长标志着冬天的结束

Sense.DEF: to show the direction you intend to turn in a vehicle, using the lights
Sense.EXAMPLE: Signal before you pull out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 驶离路边时先要打灯示意。

Sense.DEF: important

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The university has done me the signal honour of making me an Honorary Fellow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所大学授予我荣誉院士头衔﹐让我深感荣幸。

Sense.DEF: a small building near a railway from which the signals and tracks are controlled

a
signalman 2
Sense.TRAN: 〔陆军或海军的〕信号手﹐信号兵

Sense.DEF: very noticeably
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has signally failed to deal with the problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府显然未能处理好这个问题。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to control railway signals
a member of the army or navy who is trained to send and receive signals
Sense.TRAN: 〔陆军或海军的〕信号手﹐信号兵

Sense.DEF: one of the people, organizations, or countries that signs an official agreement
Sense.TRAN: 〔正式协议的〕签署者﹔签署方﹔签署国

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The UK is a signatory to the Berne convention.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国是《伯尔尼公约》的签署国。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the signatories of the Helsinki Declaration
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 《赫尔辛基宣言》的签署国

Sense.DEF: your name written in the way you usually write it, for example at the end of a letter, or on a cheque etc, to show that you have written it
Sense.TRAN: 〔书信结尾处﹑支票上等的〕签字﹐签名
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her signature is totally illegible cannot be read .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的签字完全无法辨认。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school collected 4,000 signatures for the petition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校为这份请愿书收集到了四千个签名。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Ukrainians put their signatures to the Lisbon Protocol.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乌克兰签署了《里斯本协议》。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone’s forged my signature made an illegal copy of my name to deceive people on this letter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人在这封信中伪造了我的签名。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each child must obtain the signature of his or her parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个小孩都必须得到父母的签字。

Sense.DEF: the act of signing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We will send you a copy of the agreement for signature.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将把协议的一份副本送交你签字。

Sense.DEF: something that is closely related to an event, person, or style
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smith’s signature singing style
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史密斯标志性的演唱风格

Sense.DEF: a short piece of music used at the beginning and end of a television or radio programme
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视或广播节目开始和结束时的〕信号曲

Sense.DEF:
a flat piece of wood,
cardboard
etc in a public place, with writing on it that gives people information

a metal object used for printing a small pattern in
wax
as an official
seal 1 2
a ring that has a signet on it
the importance of an event, action etc, especially because of the effects or influence it will have in the future
Sense.TRAN: 重要性﹐意义〔尤指对将来的影响〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stella didn’t attach any significance to Doug’s query.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯特拉没有在意道格的提问。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the significance of climate change
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 气候变化的重要意义
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book assesses the significance of Stalin’s policies between 1927 and 1939.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书对 1927 到 1939 年间斯大林政策的意义作了评价。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The results of the study have a wider significance for all the profession.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项研究的结果对于整个业界来说具有更为广泛的意义。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The crime problem has great significance to the general public.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪问题对公众来说事关重大。

GramExa.GLOSS: fully understand something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The press were slow to grasp the significance of what happened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻界迟迟没有领会此次事件的意义。

Sense.DEF: the meaning of a word, sign, action etc, especially when this is not immediately clear
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不是显而易见的〕意思﹐含义

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the significance of the words that refer to the bread Christ shares with his disciples
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 讲到耶稣基督分饼给门徒的那段经文的含义

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Only later did we realize the true significance of his remark.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们直到后来才明白他那番话的真正含意。

Sense.DEF: having an important effect or influence, especially on what will happen in the future
Sense.TRAN: 重要的﹐重大的﹐影响深远的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His most significant political achievement was the abolition of the death penalty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他政治上最重大的成就是废除了死刑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please inform us if there are any significant changes in your plans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们的计划如有重大变动﹐请通知我们。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The result is highly significant for the future of the province.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一结果对该省的未来意义重大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is significant that the writers of the report were all men.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报告的作者都是男性﹐这一点很重要。

Sense.DEF: large enough to be noticeable or have noticeable effects
Sense.TRAN: 相当数量的﹔影响明显的
Sense.EXAMPLE: A significant number of drivers fail to keep to speed limits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有相当多的司机不遵守车速限制。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A significant part of Japan’s wealth is invested in the West.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日本有很大一部分财富投资在西方国家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a significant difference between the number of home births now and ten years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在家中分娩的人数和十年前相比有明显的差别。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rise in temperature is not statistically significant .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从统计角度来看﹐气温的上升并不明显。

Sense.DEF: a significant look, smile etc has a special meaning that is not known to everyone
Sense.TRAN: 〔眼神﹑微笑等〕意味深长的﹐别有含义的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave me a significant look.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他意味深长地看了我一眼。

Sense.DEF: a figure that is part of a number and is known to be correct. Significant figures start with the first figure on the left that is not zero, and end with the last figure on the right that is not zero (unless the zero is known to be correct). So the number 0.0302 has three significant figures.
in an important way or to an important degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: Health problems can be significantly reduced by careful diet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 注意饮食可以大大减少健康方面的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Methods used by younger teachers differ significantly from those used by older ones.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻教师所用的方法和老教师的方法有很大的差别。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Delia’s work has been significantly better this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年迪莉娅的工作明显进步了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is very important
Sense.TRAN: 值得注意的是〔用于表示某事非常重要〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Democrats, significantly, finished well behind the Green Party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 值得注意的是﹐民主党的得票数远远落后于绿党。

Sense.DEF: in a way that seems to have a special meaning
Sense.TRAN: 意味深长地﹐别有含义地
Sense.EXAMPLE: George paused, and glanced significantly in my direction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治停顿了一下﹐意味深长地向我这边看了一眼。

Sense.DEF: your husband, wife, girlfriend, or boyfriend
Sense.TRAN: 重要的另一位〔指丈夫﹑妻子﹑女朋友或男朋友〕

Sense.DEF: the intended meaning of a word
to represent, mean, or be a sign of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some tribes use special facial markings to signify status.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些部落使用特殊的面部标记来表示地位。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The image of the lion signified power and strength.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狮子的形象代表权力和力量。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The symbol used signifies that the frequency is measured in kHz.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用这一符号表示频率以千赫为单位。

Sense.DEF: if you signify a feeling, opinion etc, you do something that acts as a sign so that other people know your feeling or opinion

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hamilton waved his hand to signify that he didn’t mind what they decided.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉密尔顿摆摆手﹐表示他们作什么决定他都无所谓。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He turned away from her slightly to signify his indifference.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他稍稍背过脸以示对她的冷淡。

Sense.DEF: to be important enough to have an effect on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: These figures don’t really signify in the overall results.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些数字对于总体结果影响不是很大。

Sense.DEF: the act of writing your name at the end of a document to show that you agree with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The formal signing will take place on April 9th.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正式签字将于 4 月 9 日进行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the signing of the ceasefire agreement
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 停火协议的签署

Subsense.DEF: someone who has just signed a contract to join a sports team or work with a record company
Subsense.TRAN: 〔运动队或唱片公司的〕签约受聘者﹐签约受雇者
Subsense.EXAMPLE: New signing, Mark Brown, scored three goals in his first match.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新签约的球员马克·布朗在他的首场比赛中就进了三个球。

Subsense.DEF: when a sports team or record company prepares a contract which someone then signs to say that they will join the team or work with the company
Subsense.TRAN: 〔运动队或唱片公司〕签约聘用﹐签约雇用

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Birmingham City have completed the signing of Doug Bell from Shrewsbury Town.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯明翰城队已经签下了来自什鲁斯伯里城队的道格·贝尔。

Sense.DEF: the use of sign language to communicate to or between people who cannot hear well
a language that uses hand movements instead of spoken words, used by people who cannot hear well
a sign at the side of a road showing directions and distances
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure that signpost is pointing the wrong way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我敢肯定那块路标指错了方向。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just follow the signposts to the city centre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就按路标所指的方向去市中心。

Sense.DEF: something that helps you understand how something is organized, where to go, or what will follow – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 线索﹐迹象﹐征兆〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: As yet, there are few signposts pointing to success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到目前为止﹐几乎未见成功的迹象。

Sense.DEF: to be clearly or unclearly shown by signposts
Sense.EXAMPLE: The village isn’t very well signposted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个村子在路标上指示得不是很清楚。

Sense.DEF: to show something clearly so that everyone will notice and understand it – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 清楚地表明〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have signposted their conclusions in the report.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们已在报告中清楚地表明了自己的结论。

Sense.DEF: a member of an Indian religious group that developed from Hinduism in the 16th century
Sense.TRAN: 锡克教教徒〔16 世纪从印度教发展出来的一个宗教团体的信徒〕

Sense.DEF: the religion of the Sikhs
grass or other plants cut and stored so that they can be used as winter food for cattle
complete absence of sound or noise

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nothing disturbed the silence of the night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有任何声音打破这夜晚的寂静。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After the explosion, an eerie silence fell upon the scene.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爆炸之后﹐现场陷入一片可怕的寂静。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A loud scream shattered the silence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一声高声尖叫打破了沉寂。

Sense.DEF: complete quiet because nobody is talking
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a brief silence before anyone answered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沉默了片刻才有人回答。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The four men sat in silence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这四个人一声不吭地坐着。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘How long have you been here?’ I asked. There was complete silence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你在这里多久了？”我问。 回答我的是彻底的沉默。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Silence in court!’ roared the judge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “法庭上请保持肃静！”法官吼道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was an awkward silence between them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们之间出现一阵令人尴尬的沉默。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The accused exercised his right to silence the legal right to choose to say nothing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被告行使了沉默权。

Sense.DEF: failure or refusal to discuss something or answer questions about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government’s silence on such an important issue seems very strange.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府在如此重大的问题上保持沉默﹐显得很奇怪。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Once again the answer was a deafening silence a very noticeable refusal to discuss something .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回答又是彻底的沉默。

Sense.DEF: failure to write a letter to someone, telephone them etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: After two years of silence, he suddenly got in touch with us again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两年杳无音信之后﹐他突然又跟我们取得了联系。

Sense.DEF: a period of time in which everyone stops talking as a sign of honour and respect towards someone who has died
to make someone stop talking, or stop something making a noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: She held up her hand to silence the children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抬手示意孩子们安静下来。

Sense.DEF: to make someone stop expressing opposition or criticisms – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 使封口﹐压制 〔反对意见或批评﹐尤用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: attempts to silence the rumours
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平息谣言的努力
Sense.EXAMPLE: Barnes has failed to silence his critics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴恩斯未能封住批评者的嘴巴。

Sense.DEF:
a piece of equipment that is connected to the
exhaust
of a vehicle to make its engine quieter
Sense.TRAN: 〔与车辆排气管装置相连的〕消声器

Sense.DEF: a thing that is put on the end of a gun so that it makes less noise when it is fired

Subsense.DEF: not saying anything
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Alan was silent.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伦沉默不语。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She kept silent, forcing Buchanan to continue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她保持沉默﹐逼着布坎南继续下去。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: The crowd fell silent became silent when the President appeared.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统出现时﹐人群安静了下来。

Subsense.DEF: not talking much to other people

GramExa.GLOSS: a man who looks strong and does not talk very much

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Silent is used mainly in writing. In everyday English, people usually use not say anything rather than be silent .
F2NBox.TRAN: silent主要用于书面。 在日常英语中,人们一般说 not say anything ,而不说 be silent
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She didn’t say anything , so I carried on.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没说话,所以我就继续了。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The article doesn’t say anything about religion.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 文章没有说到宗教。

Sense.DEF: failing or refusing to talk about something or express an opinion

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The report was silent on the subject.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告对这个问题只字不提。

Sense.DEF: without any sound, or not making any sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: The large house was silent and lonely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢大房子寂静荒凉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At last the guns fell silent .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 枪声终于沉寂了下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Julie offered up a silent prayer that she would pass her exam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉默默地祈祷﹐希望能通过这次考试。

GramExa.GLOSS: completely silent in a mysterious or uncomfortable way

Sense.DEF: a silent film has pictures but no sound
a silent letter in a word is not pronounced
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ‘w’ in ‘wreck’ is silent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单词 wreck 中的字母 w 是不发音的。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He sat silently by the bed.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他默不作声地坐在床边。

Sense.DEF: the ordinary people in a country, who are not active politically and who do not make their opinions known
Sense.TRAN: 沉默的大多数〔指在政治上不积极的普通人〕

Sense.DEF: someone who owns part of a business but is not actively involved in the way it operates
a dark image, shadow, or shape that you see against a light background

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dark silhouette of domes and minarets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 穹顶和尖塔的黑色轮廓

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Soon the bombers would return, black silhouettes against a pale sky.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 轰炸机很快会再来﹐灰蒙蒙的天空又会出现一个个黑色的轮廓。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The old windmill stood out in silhouette.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那架古老风车的轮廓映衬出来。

Sense.DEF: a drawing of something or someone, often from the side, showing a black shape against a light background
Sense.EXAMPLE: silhouette pictures of snowmen and reindeer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雪人和驯鹿的剪影画

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a picture of Mozart in silhouette
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张莫扎特的侧面剪影

Sense.DEF: the particular shape certain clothes give you
Sense.TRAN: 〔穿上某种衣服后显出的〕体形﹐身段
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fitted clothes often give the neatest silhouettes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合身的衣服常常能够显出匀称的身段。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: tall chimney stacks silhouetted against the orange flames
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 橙色火焰映衬出的一座座高大烟囱的轮廓

Sense.DEF:
a chemical
compound
that exists naturally as sand,
quartz
, and
flint
, used in making glass
one of a group of common solid mineral substances that exist naturally in the Earth
a chemical substance that exists as a solid or as a powder and is used to make glass, bricks, and parts for computers. It is a chemical element: symbol Si
Sense.TRAN: 硅〔一种化学元素﹐符号为 Si〕

Sense.DEF:
a computer
chip
a chemical that is not changed by heat or cold, does not let water through, and is used in making artificial body parts, paint, and rubber
a piece of silicone that is put into the body, especially into a woman’s breasts to make them larger
Sense.TRAN: 硅酮植入物〔尤用于女子隆胸〕

Sense.DEF:
a part of California, in the area between San Francisco and San José, which is known as a centre of the computer industry. Many important inventions were discovered in this area, and many large and small companies producing computer
software
and
hardware
are based there. It is called Silicon Valley because the computer industry is based on the
silicon chip
.
Sense.TRAN: 硅谷〔位于加利福尼亚州旧金山和圣何塞之间的计算机工业中心﹐许多重要发明的诞生地及众多计算机软﹑硬件商的总部所在地。 因计算机行业以硅片为核心而得名〕

Sense.DEF: a thin smooth soft cloth made from very thin thread which is produced by a silkworm
Sense.EXAMPLE: pure silk stockings
a beautiful dress in raw silk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生丝面料的漂亮连衣裙

Sense.DEF: a very important lawyer
Sense.TRAN: 王室法律顾问﹐御用大律师
Sense.EXAMPLE: His practice quickly grew and he took silk became a QC in 1988.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的业务迅速扩大﹐1988年他成为了王室法律顾问。

Sense.DEF:
the coloured shirts worn by
jockey s people who ride horses in races
Sense.TRAN: 〔骑师在赛马时穿的〕彩色丝绸赛马服

Sense.LEXUNIT: make a silk purse out of a sow’s ear
Sense.DEF: to make something good out of something that is bad quality
Sense.TRAN: 化腐朽为神奇﹐以劣材制精品

Sense.DEF: soft, smooth, and shiny like silk
Sense.EXAMPLE: her silken hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那如丝的秀发

Sense.DEF: made of silk
Sense.EXAMPLE: a silken handkerchief
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丝绸手绢

Sense.DEF: silk screen prints are made by forcing paint or ink onto a surface through a stretched piece of cloth

a type of
caterpillar
which produces silk thread
soft, smooth, and shiny like silk
Sense.EXAMPLE: silky fur
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柔滑的毛皮

Sense.DEF: made of silk
Sense.EXAMPLE: the silky fabric of her dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她连衣裙的丝绸面料

Sense.DEF: a silky voice is gentle, and is used especially when trying to persuade someone to do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔声音〕柔和的﹐轻柔的〔尤指试图说服别人做某事时的话音〕

Sense.DEF: the narrow shelf at the base of a window frame
the part of a car frame at the bottom of the doors
Sense.TRAN: 底梁〔指汽车框架在车门以下的部分〕

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
syllabub
not sensible, or showing bad judgment
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop asking silly questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再问傻问题了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You made a lot of silly mistakes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你犯了许多愚蠢的错误。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I left my keys at home, which was a pretty silly thing to do .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我干了件傻事﹐把钥匙落在家里了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Shall we go for a walk?’ ‘ Don’t be silly , it’s dark.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们去散步吧？”“别犯傻了﹐天都黑了。”

Sense.DEF:
stupid in a
childish
or embarrassing way
Sense.EXAMPLE: I feel so silly in this outfit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿上这套衣服我觉得很可笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a silly hat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一顶傻里傻气的帽子
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate their parties – we always end up playing silly games.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌他们的聚会——最后总是玩一些愚蠢的游戏。

Sense.DEF: not serious or practical
Sense.TRAN: 随便的﹔不切实际的﹔不实用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: They served us coffee in these silly little cups.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们竟然用这种不实用的小杯子给我们上咖啡。

Sense.DEF: to make someone extremely bored
to drink or laugh etc so much that you stop behaving sensibly
Sense.TRAN: 喝得烂醉/笑得不成样子/吓得半死等

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you think they are not behaving sensibly
Sense.EXAMPLE: No, silly, I didn’t mean that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不﹐傻瓜﹐我不是那个意思。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone, especially a child, that they are behaving in a silly way
a period in the summer when newspapers print stories that are not very serious because there is not much political news
Sense.TRAN: 〔新闻界的〕无聊季节﹐新闻淡季〔指夏季﹐因政治新闻不多﹐报纸刊登不很严肃的内容〕

Sense.DEF: a tall structure like a tower that is used for storing grain, winter food for farm animals etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔贮藏谷物﹑牲畜冬季用饲料等的〕筒仓﹐青贮塔

Sense.DEF:
a large structure under the ground from which a large
missile
can be fired
sand, mud, soil etc that is carried in water and then settles at a bend in a river, an entrance to a port etc
if something silts up or is silted up, it becomes filled with silt
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old harbour silted up years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个老港湾在许多年前就淤塞了。

Sense.DEF: a valuable shiny, light grey metal that is used to make jewellery, knives, coins etc. It is a chemical element : symbol Ag
Sense.TRAN: 银〔一种化学元素﹐符号为 Ag〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a silver necklace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银项链
Sense.EXAMPLE: cups made of solid silver
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯银的杯子

Sense.DEF: spoons, forks, dishes etc that are made of silver
Sense.TRAN: 银餐具〔如汤匙﹑叉子﹑碟子等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was my job to polish the silver.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的工作是擦亮银餐具。

Sense.DEF: the colour of silver
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lake sparkled with shades of blue and silver.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 湖面上泛着蓝色和银白色的波光。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This season’s colours are rich golds and elegant silvers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本季的流行颜色是富丽的金色和高雅的银色。

Sense.DEF:
a
silver medal
Sense.EXAMPLE: He won a silver at the last Olympics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在上一届奥运会上获得一枚银牌。

Sense.DEF: coins that contain silver or are the colour of silver
Sense.EXAMPLE: He put his hand into his pocket and brought out a handful of silver.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把手伸进口袋﹐掏出一把银币。

Sense.DEF: made of silver
Sense.EXAMPLE: a silver teapot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银茶壶
Sense.EXAMPLE: a silver coin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一枚银币
Sense.EXAMPLE: a solid silver brooch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯银饰针

Sense.DEF: having the colour of silver
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old man with silver hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位银发老人

Sense.DEF: if something is given to you on a silver platter, you do not have to make any effort to get it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a scholarship handed to him on a silver platter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他毫不费力就拿到了一份奖学金。

Sense.DEF: something that solves a difficult problem very quickly and easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is no silver bullet for this problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 解决这个问题没有特效药。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be born with a silver spoon in your mouth
every cloud has a silver lining

Sense.DEF: to cover a surface with a thin shiny layer of silver or another metal in order to make a mirror
Sense.TRAN: 给…镀银[金属]〔以制作镜子〕

Sense.DEF: to make something shine and look the colour of silver
Sense.TRAN: 使发出银色光泽﹐使呈银色
Sense.EXAMPLE: The farmhouse appeared, silvered by the moon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农舍出现了﹐在月光下泛着银光。

Sense.DEF:
a type of tree that has a smooth silvery-white
trunk
and branches
a one-dollar coin that was used in the US in the past
a small silver-coloured insect that cannot fly and is found in houses
Sense.TRAN: 蠹鱼〔一种不会飞的室内银色小 昆虫〕

Sense.DEF: the date that is exactly 25 years after the date when something important happened, especially when someone became king or queen
Sense.TRAN: 尤英】二十五周年纪念〔尤指加冕纪念〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Queen’s Silver Jubilee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女王的 25 周年加冕纪念

Sense.DEF:
a
medal
made of silver that is given to the person who finishes second in a race or competition
paper that is shiny like metal on one side, and is used for wrapping food
Sense.TRAN: 锡纸﹐银箔纸〔用于包装食物〕

Sense.DEF: metal that is covered with a thin layer of silver
the film industry, especially in Hollywood
Sense.TRAN: 银幕﹐电影业〔尤指好莱坞〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: stars of the silver screen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影明星

Sense.DEF: someone who makes jewellery and other things out of silver
an old person who uses the Internet
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many silver surfers use the Internet to keep in touch with their grandchildren.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多老年网民利用因特网和他们的孙辈保持联系。

Sense.DEF: good at talking to people and making them like you, or persuading them to do what you want
Sense.TRAN: 讲话有说服力的﹐有辩才的

Sense.DEF: objects that are made of silver, for example dishes, plates, knives, forks etc
knives, forks, and spoons that are made of silver or a similar metal
Sense.TRAN: 银餐具﹔金属餐具〔如刀子﹑叉子﹑汤匙等〕

Sense.DEF: a silver cup that a person or team wins in a sports competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: The club has not yet given up hope of ending the season with some silverware.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该俱乐部仍未放弃在赛季结束时拿银杯的希望。

Sense.DEF: the date that is exactly 25 years after the date of a wedding
Sense.TRAN: 银婚〔结婚 25 周年纪念日〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a party to celebrate their silver wedding anniversary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 庆祝他们银婚的聚会

Sense.DEF: shiny and silver in colour
Sense.TRAN: 光亮如银的﹐有银色光泽的
Sense.EXAMPLE: her silvery hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的银发
Sense.EXAMPLE: the silvery light of the moon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银色的月光

Sense.DEF: a silvery voice or sound is light, pleasant, and musical
Sense.TRAN: 〔嗓音或声音〕银铃般的﹐清脆悦耳的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clara gave a small, silvery laugh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克拉拉发出一声银铃般的轻笑。

Sense.DEF:
a plastic card in a
mobile phone
that stores your personal information and allows you to use the phone
similar to a monkey
Sense.EXAMPLE: his dark hair and simian features
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他黑色的头发和猴子似的五官

Sense.DEF: relating to monkeys
Sense.EXAMPLE: simian diseases
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猴类疾病

Sense.DEF: almost the same
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have similar tastes in music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对音乐的品位相近。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both approaches seem to achieve similar results.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两种方法都得出了相似的结果。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A number of his friends had been affected in a similar way .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的一些朋友也受到了类似的影响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two products look quite similar .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两种产品看上去很相似。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her ideas are quite similar to mine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的观点和我的很相似。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two cars are very similar in size and design.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两辆汽车大小和设计都非常相似。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two groups have broadly similar aims.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个组织目标大致相似。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The speech was strikingly similar to one given by the American President earlier this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个演讲和美国总统在今年早些时候发表的演讲惊人地相似。

Exponent.DEF: almost the same
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jo said she’d had a similar experience.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔说她有过类似的经历。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The colours are very similar, but I like this one best.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些颜色都很像,但我最喜欢这种颜色。

Exponent.DEF: similar to something or someone else
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It tastes a little like chicken.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 味道有点像鸡肉。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She still looks like a teenager.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看上去还是像十几岁的人。

Exponent.DEF: very similar – used especially about the way people look or behave
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指人的外表或行为〕很相似的,相像的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She and her sister look alike.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和她妹妹长得很像。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Lawyers are all alike – I don’t trust them.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 律师都一样——我不相信他们。

Exponent.DEF: very similar
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The film bears a close resemblance to real life is very similar .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片和现实生活非常相似。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The painting is remarkably close to the original.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画酷似原作。

Exponent.DEF: very similar
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The glass is still made in much the same way as it was 100 years ago.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 玻璃的制作方法依然和一百年前几乎一样。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People are much the same, wherever you go.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人都差不多,不管你到哪里。

Exponent.DEF: exactly the same
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The two computers were identical in design.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两台电脑设计上一模一样。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: identical names
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 相同的名字

Exponent.DEF: having the same colour, style, pattern etc as something else – used about clothes or furniture that you wear or use together
Exponent.TRAN: 〔衣服或家具的颜色﹑风格﹑式样等〕相配的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She wore matching silver shoes and handbag.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脚上穿的银色鞋子和手提包很配。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a dining table and matching chairs
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张餐桌和配套的椅子

Exponent.DEF: fairly similar to something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: These dialects are akin to Arabic, though different in several respects.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些方言与阿拉伯语相似,但在若干方面有所不同。

Sense.DEF: if there is a similarity between two things or people, they are similar in some way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are some striking similarities between the two plays.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两出戏有一些异常相似之处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the song’s close similarity to traditional Jewish music
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这首歌曲和传统犹太音乐非常类似的地方
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The present crisis bears some similarity to the oil crisis of the 1970s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当前的危机和 20 世纪 70 年代的石油危机有些相似。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the similarity of their names
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们姓名的相似

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was struck by the similarities in their early lives.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们早年生活的相似之处让我吃惊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police are checking for similarities with other recent attacks in the area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方在核查这与该地区最近发生的其他几起袭击事件是否有相似之处。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are similarities with German, though Yiddish is a distinct language.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 依地语和德语有相似之处﹐尽管它是一种不同的语言。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They are both blonde, but there the similarity ends .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们俩都是金发﹐但相同之处也就仅此而已。

Sense.DEF: in a similar way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first letter she wrote me was less than a page long, and her second letter was similarly brief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她写给我的第一封信不到一页﹐第二封信也一样简短。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cost of food and clothing has come down in recent years. Similarly, fuel prices have fallen quite considerably.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吃穿的费用近年来下降了。 同样地﹐燃料价格也有大幅 回落。

Sense.DEF: an expression that describes something by comparing it with something else, using the words ‘as’ or ‘like’, for example ‘as white as snow’
to boil gently, or to cook something slowly by boiling it gently
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bring the soup to the boil and allow it to simmer gently for about half an hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把汤煮开﹐然后用文火炖半小时左右。

Sense.DEF: if you are simmering with anger, or if anger is simmering in you, you feel very angry but do not show your feelings
Sense.TRAN: 内心充满〔怒火〕﹔〔愤怒〕积聚

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was left simmering with rage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 留下他怒火中烧。

Sense.DEF: if an argument is simmering, people feel angry with each other but only show it slightly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The row has been simmering for some time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场争吵已经酿了一段时间了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Violent revolt was simmering in the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家里正酿着一场暴力反抗。

Sense.DEF: to become calm again after you have been very angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: We decided she needed some time to simmer down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们认为她需要些时间来平复情绪。

Sense.DEF: when something is boiling gently
Sense.TRAN: 慢慢沸腾的状态﹐文火炖﹐小沸
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bring the vegetables to a simmer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用文火煮这些菜。

Sense.DEF: a cake made with dried fruit that is traditionally eaten at Easter
Sense.TRAN: 水果蛋糕〔复活节传统食品〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is simpatico is pleasant and easy to like
in agreement
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re simpatico about most things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对大多数事情的看法都很一致。

Sense.DEF: to smile in a silly annoying way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Betsy simpered at him as she spoke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝齐一边说﹐一边对着他傻笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a silly, simpering girl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 傻笑的蠢姑娘

Sense.DEF: not difficult or complicated to do or understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: a simple but effective solution to the problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这个问题简单而有效的解决办法
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is no simple answer to this question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题没有简单的答案。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure there’s a perfectly simple explanation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信一定有一个很简单的解释。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Modern cameras are very simple to use.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代照相机用起来非常简单。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are relatively simple exercises to build strength.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有比较简单的运动可以增强体能。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We want to keep the costumes as simple as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们想使服装尽量简单。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can’t pay people any more money until the company is more profitable. I’m afraid it’s as simple as that .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有公司赢利更多﹐我们才能支付更高的报酬。 恐怕就这么简单。

Sense.DEF: made in a plain style, without a lot of decoration or unnecessary things added
Sense.EXAMPLE: She dressed with simple elegance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的穿着朴素而优雅。
Sense.EXAMPLE: simple but delicious food
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简单美味的食物
Sense.EXAMPLE: a building constructed in a simple classic style
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风格古朴典雅的建筑

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that only one thing is involved
Sense.EXAMPLE: Completing the race is not just a simple matter of physical fitness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跑完比赛不仅仅是纯粹的体力问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The simple fact is, he’s not very good at his job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事实就是这样﹐他不是非常擅长做自己的工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their motive was greed, pure and simple .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的动机就是贪婪﹐别无其他。

Sense.DEF: made or built of only a few parts, and not having a complicated structure
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a very simple machine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一台结构非常简单的机器。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They evolved from simple life forms that existed millions of years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它们是从几百万年前就存在的简单的生命形式进化而来的。

Sense.DEF: honest and ordinary and not special in any way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joe was just a simple farmer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔只是一个普普通通的农民。

Sense.DEF:
simple tenses are not formed with an
auxiliary
such as ‘have’ or ‘be’
life without too many possessions or modern machines, usually in the countryside
Sense.TRAN: 简朴生活 〔常指乡村的生活〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is simple is not very intelligent
Sense.TRAN: 头脑简单的﹐笨的﹐智力低下的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid Luke’s a bit simple.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得卢克有点笨。

Sense.DEF: an injury in which a bone in your body is broken but does not cut through the flesh that surrounds it

interest
that is calculated on the sum of money that you first
invest ed
, and does not include the interest it has already earned
not very intelligent, and unable to understand complicated things
someone who has a very low level of intelligence
Sense.TRAN: 智力低下的人﹐傻子﹐蠢人

Sense.DEF: the quality of being simple and not complicated, especially when this is attractive or useful
Sense.TRAN: 朴素﹐简朴﹐简单〔尤指吸引人的或有用的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mona wrote with a beautiful simplicity of style.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫娜的文笔朴实优美。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For the sake of simplicity, the tax form is divided into three sections.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为简明起见﹐税单分成三个部分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: James’ solution to this problem was simplicity itself very simple .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯对这个问题的解决办法十分简单。

Sense.DEF: to make something easier or less complicated
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to simplify the tax system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简化税制的尝试
Sense.EXAMPLE: The law needs to be simplified.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部法律需要简化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a simplified version of the game
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个游戏的简化版

RunOn.EXAMPLE: These figures are a simplification. The real situation is much more complicated than this.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些数据是简化过的﹐实际情况要比这复杂得多。

Sense.DEF: treating difficult subjects in a way that is too simple
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is a very simplistic approach to the problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这应该对该问题过分简单化的处理办法。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize what you are saying
Sense.TRAN: 实在﹐根本﹐简直〔用于强调所说的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This work is simply not good enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这工作做得实在不够好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He simply won’t accept the committee’s decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他根本不接受委员会的决定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That would be simply wonderful!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那简直太棒了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is quite simply the most ridiculous idea I’ve ever heard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这简直是我听到过的最荒唐的想法。

Sense.DEF: only
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some students lose marks simply because they don’t read the question properly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些学生丢分只是因为没有好好读题目。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not simply a question of money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这不仅仅是钱的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What we need is not simply a smaller organization, but a more efficient one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要的不仅仅是一个精简的机构﹐而是一个更有效率的机构。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how easy it is to do something
Sense.TRAN: 只是﹐只要〔用于强调某事多么容易〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Simply fill in the coupon and take it to your local store.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要把这张优惠券填好﹐拿到当地的门店去就行。

Sense.DEF: if you say or explain something simply, you say it in a way that is easy for people to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to express yourself more simply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量把你的意思表达得更简单明了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: To put it simply, the tax cuts mean the average person will be about 3% better off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简单地说﹐这次减税意味着普通人的收入将增加 3% 左右。

Sense.DEF: if you live simply, you live in a plain and ordinary way, without spending much money
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to live very simply on my father’s small salary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只能靠父亲微薄的工资过着非常简朴的生活。

Sense.DEF: something that is made to look like another thing
to make or produce something that is not real but has the appearance or feeling of being real
Sense.EXAMPLE: a machine that simulates conditions in space
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一台模拟太空环境的机器
Sense.EXAMPLE: Interviews can be simulated in the classroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以在教室里模拟面试。

Sense.DEF: to pretend to have a feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: He found it impossible to simulate grief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他无法装出悲伤的样子。

Sense.DEF: not real, but made to look, sound, or feel real
Sense.TRAN: 模仿的﹐模拟的﹐仿真的﹔假装的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a simulated nuclear explosion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 模拟核爆炸
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked at the report with simulated interest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她装出感兴趣的样子看那份报告。

Sense.DEF: the activity of producing conditions which are similar to real ones, especially in order to test something, or the conditions that are produced
Sense.TRAN: 模拟﹐仿真〔尤用于试验〕﹔模拟的环境
Sense.EXAMPLE: a computer simulation used to train airline pilots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用于训练航空公司飞行员的电脑模拟程序

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a simulation of a rainforest environment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 模拟的热带雨林环境

Sense.DEF: a machine that is used for training people by letting them feel what real conditions are like, for example in a plane
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于人员训练的〕模拟装置﹐模拟器
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flight simulator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞行模拟装置

Sense.DEF: to broadcast a programme on television and radio at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 〔在电视和广播上〕同时播出﹐联播

Sense.DEF: things that are simultaneous happen at exactly the same time
Sense.EXAMPLE: They grabbed each other’s hands in simultaneous panic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们俩同时惊慌起来﹐相互抓住对方的手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Up to twenty users can have simultaneous access to the system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最多可有20名用户同时登该系统。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The withdrawal of British troops should be simultaneous with that of US forces.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英军应该和美军同时撤离。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The speeches will be broadcast live, with simultaneous translation immediate translation, as the person is speaking into English.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些演讲将作现场直播﹐并配有英语同声传译。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The opera will be broadcast simultaneously on television and radio.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场歌剧将在电视和广播中同步播出。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say that two things happen at the same time , rather than say that they are simultaneous .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,说两件事情同时发生,人们经常用 at the same time ,而不说 simultaneous
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Up to twenty people can use the system at the same time .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 该系统最多容许20个人同时使用。

Sense.DEF: an action that is against religious rules and is considered to be an offence against God
Sense.TRAN: 〔违犯宗教法规的〕罪﹐罪恶﹐罪孽

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the sin of pride
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 傲慢之罪

Sense.EXAMPLE: She needed to confess her sins and ask for forgiveness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她需要忏悔罪过﹐请求宽恕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He knew that he had committed a terrible sin .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他知道自己犯下了可怕的罪行。

GramExa.GLOSS: seven bad feelings or desires, in the Christian religion

Sense.DEF: something that you think is very wrong

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is a sin (to do sth)
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s so much lovely food here, it would be a sin to waste it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里有这么多的美食﹐浪费的话真是罪过。

Sense.DEF: if two people live in sin, they live together in a sexual relationship without being married
very unhappy, ugly, or guilty
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw Margaret this morning looking as miserable as sin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天早晨我看见玛格丽特很不高兴的样子。

Sense.DEF: an expression used to suggest jokingly that you have to do something as a punishment
Sense.TRAN: 自作自受﹐活该﹐自作孽〔用于自嘲〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I work at head office now, for my sins.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在我到总部上班了﹐真是自作自受。

Sense.DEF: to do something that is against religious rules and is considered to be an offence against God

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You have sinned against God.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你违背上帝的旨意犯了罪。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be more sinned against than sinning
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone should not be blamed for what they have done wrong, because they have been badly treated by other people
Sense.TRAN: 人负己甚于己负人﹐过错无多而报应太重〔指所受的不公超过所犯的过失〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=sine正弦

Sense.DEF:
a place away from the playing area where players in some sports, for example
ice hockey
, are sent if they break the rules
Sense.TRAN: 〔冰球等的〕被罚下场的球员座席﹐受罚席

Sense.GRAM: generally used with a perfect tense in the main clause
Sense.GRAMTRAN: 通常与主句中完成式连用
Sense.DEF: from a particular time or event in the past until the present, or in that period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve been waiting here since two o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们从两点钟开始就在这里等了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t played rugby since I left university.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我大学毕业后就没打过橄榄球。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She left London ten years ago, and I haven’t seen her since.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她十年前离开伦敦﹐此后我再没有见过她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The factory has been here since the 1970s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家工厂从 20 世纪 70 年代起就在这里了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was exactly five years since her father had died.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从她父亲去世到现在正好满五年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Since the end of the war, over five thousand prisoners have been released.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从战争结束以后﹐已有五千多名战俘获释。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lost his job five years ago, but has since found other work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他五年前失去工作﹐但此后找到了其他工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I left school in 1995, and since then I’ve lived in London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我 1995 年离开学校﹐此后就在伦敦生活。

GramExa.GLOSS: all the time since
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve been friends ever since we were at school together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们从上学的时候起就一直是朋友。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s been terrified of the sound of aircraft ever since the crash.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从那次飞机失事后﹐她就一直害怕听到飞机声。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We came to the UK in 1974 and have lived here ever since.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们 1974 年来到英国﹐此后就一直在这里生活。

Sense.DEF: used to give the reason for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Since you are unable to answer, perhaps we should ask someone else.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 既然你回答不了﹐那我们也许该问问别人。

Sense.DEF: used in questions to show that you are very surprised or angry
Sense.TRAN: 从什么时候起？〔用于问句﹐表示惊讶或气愤〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Since when have you been interested in my feelings?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你从什么时候起开始关心我的感受了？

Sense.DEF: if something has long since happened, it happened a long time ago
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve long since forgiven her for what she did.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我早已原谅她的所作所为了。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法: since, for
F2NBox.EXPL: Use since to say that something started at a point in time in the past, and is still or was continuing . since
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示某事于过去某一时间开始,并且现在仍在继续
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He has been living in Leeds since 1998.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从 1998 年起就住在利兹。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We’ve known about it since May.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们从五月份起就知道这件事了。
F2NBox.EXPL: Since is usually followed by a time expression (‘last year’, ‘this morning’, ‘4 o’clock’ etc) or by the simple past tense. Use the present perfect or the past perfect in the other clause . since
F2NBox.TRAN: 后面常跟表示时间的短语（如last year,this morning,4 o’clock等）,或是跟一般过去时。在另一个分句中要用现在完成时或过去完成时
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He had been seriously ill since Christmas.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从圣诞节开始就一直病得很重。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I have loved movies since I first went to the cinema.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我第一次去电影院后就喜欢上了电影。
F2NBox.EXPL: Speakers of British English usually say it is a long time/two weeks etc since …, and speakers of American English it has been a long time/two weeks etc since …, but both uses are correct .
F2NBox.TRAN: 英国英语一般说 it is a long time/two weeks etc since … ,而美国英语则一般说 it has been a long time/two weeks etc since … ,两种说法都是正确的
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It’s weeks (BrE【英】)/It’s been weeks (AmE【美】) since I saw Grandma.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经好几个星期没有见到祖母了。
F2NBox.EXPL: Use for when you state the length of time that something has been or had been happening . for
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示某事发生的时间长度
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We have known each other for ten years (NOT不说 since ten years).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们认识已经有十年了。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I had been waiting for hours (NOT不说 since hours).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经等了好几个小时了。

Sense.DEF: a feeling, belief, or statement that is sincere is honest and true, and based on what you really feel and believe
Sense.TRAN: 由衷的﹐真诚的﹐真心实意的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I would like to say a sincere thank you to everyone who has helped and supported me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要对所有帮助和支持过我的人表示由衷的感谢。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Please accept my sincere apologies .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请接受我真诚的道歉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: his sincere desire to find out the truth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想查明真相的真切愿望

Sense.DEF: someone who is sincere is honest and says what they really feel or believe
Sense.EXAMPLE: a warm-hearted, sincere man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个热心﹑真诚的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were obviously sincere in their beliefs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的信仰显然是虔诚的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t sure that he was sincere in what he was saying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不敢肯定他说的话是真心诚意的。

Sense.DEF: if you feel or believe something sincerely, you really feel or believe it and are not just pretending
Sense.TRAN: 由衷地﹐真诚地﹐真心实意地
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sincerely hope I’ll see her again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我衷心希望再见到她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are sincerely grateful for your help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们由衷地感谢你的帮助。

Sense.DEF: an expression used to end a formal letter, especially one that you have begun by using someone’s name
Sense.TRAN: 谨上﹐敬上﹐谨启〔用于以某人名字开头的正式信件的末尾〕

Sense.DEF: when someone is sincere and really means what they are saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t doubt her sincerity, but I think she’s got her facts wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不怀疑她的诚意﹐但我认为她没弄清楚事实。
Sense.EXAMPLE: May I say in all sincerity that we could not have achieved this much without your help and support.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请允许我真心诚意地说: 没有你们的帮助和支持﹐我们就不可能取得这样的成绩。

Sense.DEF:
the
fraction 2
calculated for an angle by dividing the length of the side opposite it in a
triangle
that has a
right angle
, by the length of the side opposite the right angle
a job which you get paid for even though you do not have to do very much work
Sense.TRAN: 〔有薪酬而工作不多的〕闲职﹐挂名职务﹐领干薪的职位

Sense.DEF: something that you must have, or which must exist, before something else can happen
Sense.TRAN: 必要的条件﹐必需的东西﹐必备的资格

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The control of inflation is a sine qua non for economic stability.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 控制通货膨胀是经济稳定的必要条件。

Sense.DEF: a part of your body that connects a muscle to a bone
Sense.TRAN: 腱﹐肌腱〔连接骨与肌肉的索状组织〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sinews on his neck stood out like knotted string.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他颈部的肌腱像打结的绳般凸出。

Sense.DEF: something that gives strength or support to a government, country, or system
Sense.TRAN: 某物的力量源泉 [支柱﹐关键]
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have begun building the sinews of an independent nation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们已开始建设一个独立国家的命脉。

Sense.DEF: a sinewy person has a thin body and strong muscles
Sense.EXAMPLE: a big man with long, sinewy arms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胳膊又长又壮的大个子

Sense.DEF: against religious rules, or doing something that is against religious rules
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dancing was believed to be sinful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跳舞曾被认为是不道德的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wicked, sinful man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邪恶﹑不道德的人

Sense.DEF: very wrong or bad
Sense.TRAN: 有严重过错的﹐极不应该的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sinful waste of taxpayers’ money
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对纳税人钱财的可耻浪费

Sense.DEF: to produce a musical sound with your voice
Sense.EXAMPLE: She can sing beautifully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她唱歌很好听。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most children enjoy singing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数孩子都喜欢唱歌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a great time singing some of the old songs .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们唱了一些老歌﹐非常开心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My mother used to sing to me when I was young.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我小时候妈妈常常唱歌给我听。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was singing to himself quietly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在轻声地哼唱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Come on, sing us a song!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 来吧﹐唱首歌给我们听！

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never been able to sing in tune sing the correct notes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我唱歌总是跑调。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She patiently sang the baby to sleep .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她耐心地唱歌哄宝宝入睡。

Sense.DEF: if birds sing, they produce high musical sounds
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could hear the birds singing outside my window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到鸟儿在窗外歌唱。

Sense.DEF: to make a high whistling sound
Sense.TRAN: 呜呜作响﹐发嗡嗡[嗖嗖]声
Sense.EXAMPLE: A kettle was singing on the stove.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炉上的水壶在呜呜作响。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A bullet sang past my ear.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一颗子弹从我耳边呼啸而过。

Sense.DEF: to praise someone very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Edwards was singing your praises today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱德华兹太太今天对你大加赞扬。

Sense.DEF: to say something different from what you said before
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re singing a different tune now!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在你又变卦了！

Sense.LEXUNIT: be singing from the same hymn sheet/book
Sense.DEF: used to say that a group of people all have the same aims or all express the same opinion on a particular subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔在某主题上〕目标[观点]一致﹐唱同一个调子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Union representatives are all singing from the same hymn sheet on the issue of pay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会代表在工资问题上全都是一个调子。

Sense.DEF: to tell people everything you know about a crime when they ask you questions about it - used especially by criminals and the police
Sense.TRAN: 招供﹐交代罪行〔尤为罪犯和警察所使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think he’ll sing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他会招供的。

Sense.DEF: to sing with someone else who is already singing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sing along if you know the words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你们知道歌词﹐就跟着一起唱吧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jess was singing along to the radio.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰斯在跟着收音机一 起唱。

Sense.DEF: to shout or sing some words clearly and loudly
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Freeze!’ a shrill voice sang out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “不许动！”一个尖锐的声音高喊道。

Sense.DEF: to sing loudly so that people can hear you easily
Sense.TRAN: 高声唱﹐大声唱〔以便让人听到〕

Sense.DEF: to sing more loudly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sing up, boys, I can’t hear you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唱得再响亮点﹐男孩们。 我听不见！

Sense.DEF: an informal occasion when people sing songs together
to burn the surface of something slightly, or to be burned slightly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flames had singed her hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火焰燎了她的头发。

Sense.DEF: a mark on the surface of something where it has been burnt slightly
someone who sings

GramExa.EXAMPLE: her favourite pop singer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她最喜欢的流行歌手
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a famous Italian opera singer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位著名的意大利歌剧演唱家

Sense.EXAMPLE: the lead singer main singer of Slade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 施莱德乐队的主唱
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tina Turner’s backing singers people who sing with her
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂纳·特纳的伴唱歌手

Sense.DEF: someone who writes songs and sings them
the activity of producing musical sounds with your voice
Sense.EXAMPLE: He entered the Royal College of Music to study singing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他进入皇家音乐学院学习演唱。

Sense.DEF: only one
Sense.TRAN: 单一的﹐唯一的﹐仅一个的
Sense.EXAMPLE: A single tree gave shade from the sun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唯有一棵树遮阴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They won the game by a single point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们仅以一分的优势赢得比赛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the highest price ever paid for a single work of art
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为单件艺术品所支付的最高价格
Sense.EXAMPLE: a single-sex school one for only boys or girls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单一性别的学校

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are talking about every person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t write down every single word I say.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不必把我说的每一个字都写下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He works every single day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他每天都工作。

Sense.DEF: no people or things at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane was brought down safely and not a single passenger was killed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机安全降落﹐没有一名乘客丧生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We didn’t get a single reply to the advertisement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个广告我们连一个回应也没有收到。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are talking about the one thing that is the biggest, greatest etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cigarette smoking is the single most important cause of lung cancer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抽烟是导致肺癌的最重要原因。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tourism is the country’s single biggest earner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游业是这个国家最大的收入来源。

Sense.DEF: not married, or not involved in a romantic relationship with anyone
Sense.TRAN: 未婚的﹐单身的﹔没有男[女]朋友的﹐没有情侣关系的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The changes in tax rates will benefit single people the most.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 税率改变的最大获益者是单身人士。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is he single?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是单身吗？

Sense.DEF: a bed, room etc that is meant to be used by one person only
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to pay extra for a single room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要单人房就必须加钱。

Sense.DEF: a single ticket etc is for a trip from one place to another but not back again

a
cd
that has only one song on it, not a number of songs, or a song which is sold in this way
Sense.TRAN: 单曲唱片﹔单曲唱片的歌曲
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you heard their latest single?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你听过他们最新的单曲唱片没有？

Subsense.DEF:
one
run 2
in a game of
cricket

a hit that allows the person who is hitting the ball to reach first
base
in a game of baseball

Sense.DEF: a game, especially in tennis, in which one person plays on their own against another person
Sense.EXAMPLE: I prefer playing singles .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢单打。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who won the women’s singles?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女子单打谁赢了？

Sense.DEF: people who are not married and are not involved in a romantic relationship with anyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The show is especially popular among young singles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个节目尤其受年轻单身者的欢迎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a singles night at the club
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在俱乐部举行的单身之夜

Sense.DEF: a ticket for a trip from one place to another but not back again
Sense.EXAMPLE: A single to Oxford, please.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请给我一张到牛津的单程票。

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper money worth one dollar
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anybody have five singles?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁有五张一美元纸币？

Sense.DEF: a room in a hotel for just one person
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid we haven’t got any singles available.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕我们已经没有单人房间了。

Sense.DEF: to choose one person or thing from among a group because they are better, worse, more important etc than the others

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t see why he should be singled out for special treatment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不懂为什么单单要给他一个人特殊待遇。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One programme was singled out as being particularly good.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一个节目被选为特别精彩。

Sense.DEF: a single-breasted jacket or suit has only one set of buttons down the front
when one person, usually a soldier, fights against one other person
Sense.TRAN: 一对一的搏斗〔一般指士兵〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had already defeated an enemy champion in single combat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经在一次单挑中击败了一名敌方勇士。

Sense.DEF: thin cream that you can pour easily
a unit of money that is shared by several different countries
Sense.TRAN: 单一货币 〔几国共用的货币单位〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Europe is moving steadily towards a single currency.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲正朝着单一货币的方向稳步前进。

Sense.DEF: a bus with only one level
a number below

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Interest rates have stayed in single figures for over a year now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利率保持在个位数已有一年多了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The number of cases of the disease is now down to single figures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疾病的病例现在已经降到了个位数。

Sense.DEF: moving in a line, with one person behind another
Sense.EXAMPLE: We walked in single file across the bridge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一个接一个依次过桥。

Sense.DEF: if one person does something single-handedly, they do it without help from anyone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: She brought up three children single-handedly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她独自一人把三个孩子抚养成人。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a single-handed voyage across the Atlantic
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 只身横渡大西洋的航行

Sense.DEF: a university degree course in Britain in which you study only one main subject
Sense.TRAN: 单科学位课程〔英国只修一门主课的大学学位课程〕

Sense.DEF: a group of countries in Europe that allow goods to be moved, bought, and sold between them with very few controls
someone who is single-minded has one clear aim and works very hard to achieve it
Sense.TRAN: 一心一意的﹐专心致志的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tough, single-minded lady
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位性格坚强﹑做事专注的女子
Sense.EXAMPLE: He worked with single-minded determination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对工作抱有坚定的决心。

Sense.DEF: great determination when you are working to achieve something
a mother or father who looks after their children on their own, without a partner
a piece of clothing that you wear for sport which covers the top part of your body but not your arms
a road that is only wide enough for one car to go along it
alone, or one at a time
Sense.TRAN: 单独地﹔一个一个地﹐各自地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plant the trees singly or in small groups.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这些树单棵或成小片种植。

Sense.DEF: a prison in New York State, known in the past for controlling prisoners very strictly
Sense.TRAN: 新新监狱〔美国纽约州监狱﹐曾以严格控制犯人闻名〕

Sense.DEF: a way of speaking in which your voice keeps rising and falling
Sense.EXAMPLE: I recognized her soft singsong immediately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我立刻就听出了她那柔和婉转的声音。

Sense.DEF: an informal occasion when people sing songs together
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a bit of a singsong later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们后来一起唱了一会儿歌。

Sense.DEF: a singular noun, verb, form etc is used when writing or speaking about one person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: the singular form of the noun
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该名词的单数形式
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the subject is singular, use a singular verb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果主语是单数﹐就用单数动词。

Sense.DEF: very great or very noticeable
Sense.EXAMPLE: He showed a singular lack of tact in the way he handled the situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他处理这局面的方式显得极不得体。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a singular achievement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非凡的成就

Sense.DEF: very unusual or strange
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wondered why she was behaving in so singular a fashion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真奇怪她为什么会有如此异常的行为。

Sense.DEF: the form of a word used when writing or speaking about one person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Datum’ is the singular of ‘data’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: datum是 data 的单数形式。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Should the verb be in the singular or the plural?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个动词应该用单数形式还是复数形式？

Sense.DEF:
an extremely small point in space that contains an extremely large amount of material and which does not obey the usual laws of nature, for example a
black hole
or the point at the beginning of the universe
Sense.TRAN: 奇点〔宇宙中含有大量物质的极小的点﹐不遵循自然规律﹐如黑洞或宇宙开端时的点〕

Sense.DEF: the quality of something that makes it unusual or strange
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had an attractive singularity of viewpoint.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的观点新奇有趣。

Sense.DEF: in a way that is very noticeable or unusual
Sense.EXAMPLE: a singularly foolish plan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极为愚蠢的计划
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has singularly failed to live up to his promises.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他显然没有履行自己的诺言。

Sense.DEF: someone who belongs to the race of people that forms the largest part of the population in Sri Lanka
the language used by the Sinhalese
making you feel that something evil, dangerous, or illegal is happening or will happen
Sense.TRAN: 不祥的﹐凶兆的﹔阴险的﹔邪恶的

GramExa.PROPFORM: there is something/nothing sinister about sb/sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was something sinister about Mr Scott’s death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯科特先生的死有点蹊跷。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a sinister side to these events.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些事件有邪恶的一面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a handsome man, in a sinister sort of way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他英俊的外貌中带着一点阴险。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sinister atmosphere
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不祥的气氛

Sense.DEF: to go down below the surface of water, mud etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their motorboat struck a rock and began to sink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的摩托艇触了礁﹐开始下沉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids watched as the coin sank to the bottom of the pool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们看着那枚硬币沉到池底。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heavy guns sank up to their barrels in the mud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些沉重的大炮深陷在泥里﹐只露出炮管。

Sense.DEF: to damage a ship so badly that it sinks
Sense.EXAMPLE: A luxury yacht was sunk in a bomb attack yesterday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一艘豪华游艇在昨天的炸弹袭击事件中被击沉了。

Sense.DEF: to move downwards to a lower level
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sun was sinking behind the coconut palms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夕阳渐渐沉入椰树林后。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her chin sank onto her chest, and she looked despairing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她下巴耷拉到胸前﹐显得很绝望。

Sense.DEF: to fall down or sit down heavily, especially because you are very tired and weak
Sense.TRAN: 倒下﹔颓然坐下〔尤因非常疲倦或虚弱〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She let out a groan and sank into a chair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她呻吟了一声﹐颓然倒进椅子里。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He let go of her shoulders and she sank at once to the floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他松开她的肩膀﹐她顿时倒在地板上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Marion sank down on a rock, and wept.
