GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽昂跌坐在一块岩石上﹐哭了起来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The minister sank to his knees he went down into a kneeling position and prayed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 牧师跪下来祷告。

Sense.DEF: to gradually get into a worse condition

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They lost all their money and sank into desperate poverty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们赔光了所有的钱﹐变得一无所有。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The good mood left me and I sank into depression.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好心情离我而去﹐我陷入沮丧之中。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor said that the boy was sinking fast getting weaker and about to die .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生说那男孩的病情在急剧恶化。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you lose hope or confidence
Sense.TRAN: 心情沉重﹐情绪低落〔用于表示失去信心或希望〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: His heart sank the way it always did when she left him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他心情沉重﹐她离开他时他总是这样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt desperately tired, and her spirits sank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到筋疲力尽﹐情绪低落。

Sense.DEF: to go down in amount or value
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shares in the company have sunk as low as 620p.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司的股票跌到了 620 便士的低点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The population of the village sank to just a few families.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个村子的人口已经减少到只剩几户人家了。

Sense.DEF: if your voice sinks, it becomes very quiet

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her voice sank to a whisper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的声音变成了耳语。

Sense.DEF: the unpleasant feeling that you get when you suddenly realize that something bad is going to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a sinking feeling inside as I realized I was going to fail yet again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我意识到自己又要失败﹐心情很低落。

Sense.DEF: to be in a situation where you are certain to fail or have a lot of problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I don’t get paid by next week, I’ll really be sunk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下星期再拿不到工资的话﹐我就惨了。

Sense.DEF: if something sinks without trace, it fails quickly or no one pays attention to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made a few records, which all sank without trace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他录过几张唱片﹐但都无人问津。

Sense.DEF: to be dishonest enough or selfishenough to do something very bad or unfair
Sense.TRAN: 不诚实[自私]到这种地步﹐堕落到干出这种事来
Sense.EXAMPLE: How could he have sunk so low?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他怎么会堕落到这种地步？

Sense.DEF: to put your teeth or something sharp into someone’s flesh, into food etc
Sense.TRAN: 用〔牙〕咬﹔用〔尖锐的东西〕戳﹐捅

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dog sank its teeth into my arm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条狗在我的手臂上咬了一口。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She sank her fork into the pie.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把叉子插进馅饼。

Sense.DEF: if you sink something such as a well or part of a building, you dig a hole to put it into the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: A well was sunk in the back garden, and water could be pumped up into the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后花园里挖了口井﹐可以把水抽上来接到厨房。

Sense.DEF: to succeed or fail without help from anyone else
Sense.TRAN: 自生自灭﹐成败全靠自己
Sense.EXAMPLE: They don’t give you a lot of guidance – you’re just left to sink or swim, really.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不会给你很多指导——就让你自生自灭﹐真的。

Sense.DEF: to spend a lot of money on something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They sank their entire savings into their house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把全部存款都投到他们的房子上了。

Sense.DEF:
to put a ball into a hole or
basket
in games such as
golf
or
basketball
Sense.TRAN: 将〔球〕击入洞中﹔将〔球〕投入篮中

Sense.DEF: to agree to stop arguing and forget about your disagreements, especially in order to unite and oppose someone else
Sense.TRAN: 摒弃分歧﹐摒除歧见〔尤指为了联合对付别人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nations must sink their differences to achieve greater security.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各国必须摒弃分歧﹐以实现更高的安全性。

Sense.DEF: to drink alcohol, especially in large quantities
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sank a few pints at the pub first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们先在酒馆里喝了几品脱啤酒。

Sense.DEF: if information, facts etc sink in, you gradually understand them or realize their full meaning
Sense.TRAN: 〔信息﹑事实等〕逐渐被充分理解
Sense.EXAMPLE: He paused a moment for his words to sink in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他停顿了片刻﹐好让人充分理解他的话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The implications of Labour’s defeat were beginning to sink in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们开始意识到工党败选所带来的影响。

Sense.DEF: a large open container that you fill with water and use for washing yourself, washing dishes etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dirty plates were piled high in the sink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脏盘子在洗涤槽里堆得很高。

Sense.DEF: an area where people live or a school that is in a very bad condition and seems unlikely to improve
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go to almost any city and you find sink estates where you get the feeling that the council hates the place and the people too.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎每到一个城市你都会发现有一些垃圾小区﹐让人感觉当地的市政会讨厌那里﹐也讨厌那里的人。

Sense.DEF: money saved regularly by a business to pay for something in the future

someone who has
sin ned
by not obeying God’s laws
Sense.TRAN: 〔违犯上帝律法的〕罪人﹐有罪过者

Sense.DEF: Chinese and something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sino-Japanese trade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中日贸易

Sense.DEF: relating to China
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Sinologist someone who studies Chinese culture, language, history etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉学家

Sense.DEF: moving with smooth twists and turns, like a snake
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sinuous grace of a cat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫的灵活优美

Sense.DEF: with many smooth twists and turns
Sense.EXAMPLE: They followed the sinuous trail deep into the mountains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们沿着弯弯曲曲的小径进入深山。

Sense.DEF: your sinuses are the spaces in the bones of your head that are connected to the inside of your nose
Sense.TRAN: 窦﹐窦道〔颅骨中与鼻孔相通的空穴〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: blocked sinuses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阻滞的窦道
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sinus infection
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窦感染

Sense.DEF: a condition in which your sinuses swell up and become painful
to drink something slowly, taking very small mouthfuls
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was sitting at the table sipping her coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐在桌边呷着咖啡。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He sipped at his wine with pleasure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他愉快地呷着酒。

Sense.DEF: a very small amount of a drink

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sip of water
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一小口水

Sense.EXAMPLE: She poured more wine and took a sip .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她又倒了些酒﹐抿了一小口。

Sense.DEF: a bent tube used for getting liquid out of a container, used by holding one end of the tube at a lower level than the end in the container

a type of bottle for holding
soda water
, which is forced out of the bottle using gas pressure
to remove liquid from a container by using a siphon
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took him only a few minutes to siphon off the petrol and drive away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只用了几分钟就用虹吸管吸出汽油﹐开车走了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Crews began siphoning oil from the leaking boat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 船员开始用虹吸管从漏水的船上把油抽走。

Sense.DEF: to dishonestly take money from a business, account etc to use it for a purpose for which it was not intended
Sense.EXAMPLE: Emergency aid was siphoned off by foreign ministry officials for their own use.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧急救济款被外交部官员挪作私用了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I found she had siphoned thousands of dollars from our bank account.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现她偷偷地从我们的银行账户里转移走了数千美元。

Sense.DEF: a plastic cover with a small hole in it that you put on a cup of coffee, tea etc, so that you can drink from the cup while walking, travelling etc
Sense.TRAN: 吸嘴盖 〔咖啡杯或茶杯上一种带小孔的塑料盖﹐方便行走或旅行时边走边喝〕

Sense.DEF: used when speaking to a man in order to be polite or show respect
Sense.TRAN: 先生﹐长官〔对男子的敬称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Report back to me in an hour, sergeant.’ ‘Yes, sir.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “一小时后向我报告﹐中士。”“是﹐长官。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I help you, sir?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能为您效劳吗﹐先生？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sir! You dropped your wallet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先生！ 您的钱包掉了。

Sense.DEF: used at the beginning of a formal letter to a man or to people you do not know
Sense.TRAN: 敬启者〔对男子或不知其名者的称呼﹐用于正式信函的开头〕

Sense.DEF:
a title used before the first name of a
knight
or
baronet
Sense.TRAN: 爵士〔冠于爵士或准男爵名字之前的尊称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sir Paul McCartney
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗·麦卡特尼爵士
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sir Jasper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贾斯珀爵士

Sense.DEF: used by children at school when speaking to or talking about a male teacher
Sense.TRAN: 老师〔中小学生对男教师的直接或间接称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sir, I’ve forgotten my homework.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师﹐我忘记做家庭作业了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look out – sir’s coming back!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 注意——老师回来了！

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize a statement or an answer to a question
Sense.TRAN: 绝不！/的确！〔用于强调所说的话或对问题的回答〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I will not have that man in my home, no sir!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不要那个人待在我家里﹐绝对不行！

Sense.DEF: used when speaking to a king
Sense.EXAMPLE: The people await you, sire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 臣民在恭候您﹐陛下。

Sense.DEF: the father of a four-legged animal, especially a horse
Sense.TRAN: 〔四足动物的〕雄性种兽﹔〔尤指〕种马

Sense.DEF: to be the father of an animal, especially a horse or dog
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指雄性的马或狗〕生殖﹐繁殖
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stallion that has sired several race winners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 繁殖了好几匹赛马冠军的种马

Sense.DEF: to be the father of a child
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam sired eight children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆育有八个孩子。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that makes very loud warning sounds, used on police cars, fire engines etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔警车﹑消防车等的〕汽笛﹐警报器
Sense.EXAMPLE: the wail of the ambulance sirens
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 救护车汽笛的尖啸
Sense.EXAMPLE: I heard police sirens in the distance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到了远处的警笛声。

Sense.DEF: encouragement to do something that seems very good, especially when this could have bad results
Sense.TRAN: 诱人的花言巧语〔尤指可能有不良后果〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: siren voices calling for the sale of weapons to the region
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鼓动把武器出售给该地区的谗言

Sense.DEF: a woman who is very attractive but also dangerous to men - used especially in newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 妖艳而危险的女人﹐妖妇〔尤用于报纸〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Hollywood siren
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个好莱坞妖妇

Sense.DEF: a group of women in ancient Greek stories, whose beautiful singing made sailors sail towards them into dangerous water
Sense.TRAN: 塞壬〔古希腊故事中用美妙歌声引诱水手进入危险水域的一群女妖〕

Sense.DEF:
a name used, especially in newspapers, for a typical British
civil servant someone who works for a government minister, but who is not a politician
of high rank. The name is based on a character called Sir Humphrey Appleby, in the humorous British television programme Yes, Minister, who uses clever and dishonest methods to make sure that his minister always does what Sir Humphrey wants.
Sense.TRAN: 汉弗莱爵士〔尤用于报纸上的一个人名﹐指英国典型的高级公务员。汉弗莱爵士是英国电视喜剧《是﹐大臣》中的人物﹐他总是用狡猾的方法让自己的上司内阁大臣被自己所利用〕

Sense.DEF:
a good-quality piece of
beef
which is cut from the lower part of a cow’s back
Sense.TRAN: 〔一块〕上好的牛上腰肉﹐牛里脊肉﹐西冷牛排

Sense.DEF: a hot wind that blows from the desert of North Africa across to southern Europe
Sense.TRAN: 西罗科风〔由北非沙漠吹向南欧的一种热风〕

Sense.DEF: a name used when speaking to your sister
Sense.TRAN: 姐姐﹐妹妹〔用于称呼自己的姊妹〕

Sense.DEF:
a Central American plant whose leaves produce strong
fibre s
, also called sisal, which are used in making rope
Sense.TRAN: 剑麻﹐菠萝麻﹐西沙尔麻〔一种中美洲植物﹐可用于制绳〕

Sense.DEF: a boy that other boys dislike because he prefers doing things that girls enjoy
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wanted to go to dance classes, but he was afraid the other boys would call him a sissy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想去上舞蹈班﹐但又怕其他男孩会说他女里女气的。

Sense.DEF: a girl or woman who has the same parents as you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Janet and Abby are sisters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮特和阿比是两姐妹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has two sisters and a brother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有两个姊妹和一个弟弟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My older sister is a nurse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我姐姐是护士。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Where’s your little sister?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的小妹妹在哪里？

Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s my twin sister .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是我的孪生妹妹。

Sense.DEF: a newspaper etc that belongs to the same group or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Daily Post’s sister paper, the Liverpool Echo
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《每日邮报》的姊妹报纸《利物浦回声报》

Sense.DEF:
a
nun
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good morning, Sister Mary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早上好﹐玛丽修女。

Sense.DEF: a nurse in charge of a hospital ward
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ward sister
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病房护士长
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m feeling a bit better today, Sister.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今天感觉好些了﹐护士长。

Sense.DEF: a word used by women to talk about other women and to show that they have feelings of friendship and support towards them
Sense.TRAN: 姊妹﹐姐妹〔妇女对其他妇女表示友好和支持时的用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We appeal to our sisters all over the world to stand by us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们呼吁全世界的姊妹们支持我们。

Sense.DEF: a way of talking to or about an African-American woman, used especially by African Americans
Sense.TRAN: 大姐﹐小妹﹐小姐〔尤指非裔美国人对非裔美国女子的直接或间接称呼〕

Sense.DEF:
a special loyal relationship among women who share the same ideas and aims, especially among
feminist s
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指女权主义者之间的〕姊妹情谊
Sense.EXAMPLE: the special bond of sisterhood that joins women together
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把妇女联合起来的那种特殊的姐妹情

Sense.DEF: a group of women who live a religious life together
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Christian sisterhood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基督教修女会

Sense.DEF: the sister of your husband or wife
Sense.TRAN: 丈夫[妻子]的姊妹﹔姑子﹔姨子

Sense.DEF: your brother’s wife
Sense.TRAN: 兄长[弟弟]的妻子﹔嫂子﹔弟媳

Sense.DEF: the wife of the brother of your husband or wife
Sense.TRAN: 配偶的兄弟之妻﹔妯娌﹔舅嫂

Sense.DEF: typical of a loving sister
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave Lee a sisterly kiss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她像姐姐一样亲了李一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their friendship can best be described as sisterly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用亲如姐妹来形容她们的友谊是最恰当的。

Sense.DEF: in ancient Greek stories, an evil king whose punishment after death was to roll a very large stone to the top of a steep hill. Each time he got near to the top of the hill, the stone rolled down to the bottom, and he had to start again, and he had to continue doing this forever. A very difficult job that seems impossible to finish is sometimes described as a ‘Sisyphean task’.
Sense.TRAN: 西叙福斯〔古希腊神话中一位邪恶的国王﹐他死后得到的惩罚是把一块巨石滚上陡峭的山坡。每次快要滚到山顶﹐巨石都会滚落回山脚﹐他又得重新开始﹐如此永远反复下去。一项不可能完成的艰巨任务有时被形容为 a Sisyphean task（西叙福斯的劳作）〕

Subsense.DEF:
to be on a chair or seat, or on the ground, with the top half of your body upright and your weight resting on your
buttock s

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I sat on the shore and looked at the sea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我坐在岸上看海。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was sitting in a chair by the fire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐在炉火边的椅子上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s the girl who sits next to me at school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是在学校里坐在我旁边的女孩。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: In the driving seat sat a man of average height.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 驾驶座上坐着一名中等身材的男子。

GramExa.GLOSS: sit facing it
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jean sat at the table writing a letter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼坐在桌前写信。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They sat sipping their drinks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们坐着啜饮料。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: We used to sit and listen to her for hours.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们以前总是一坐几个小时听她讲。

Subsense.DEF: to get into a sitting position somewhere after you have been standing up
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He came over and sat beside her.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走过来坐在她旁边。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sam sat opposite her and accepted a cigarette.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆在她对面坐下﹐接过一支香烟。

Subsense.DEF: to make someone sit, or help them to sit

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I gently led her to the chair and sat her on it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我小心地把她带到椅子边扶她坐下。

Sense.DEF: to be in a particular position or condition
Sense.TRAN: 位于﹐坐落在 〔某位置〕﹔处于〔某状况〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a little church sitting on a hillside
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐落在山坡上的一座小教堂

Sense.EXAMPLE: The parliament building sits in a large square.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 议会大楼位于一个大广场上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s got a computer sitting on his desk, but he doesn’t use it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有一台电脑放在书桌上﹐但他不用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My climbing boots were sitting unused in a cupboard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的登山靴在橱柜里﹐一直没有穿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house has sat empty for two years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢房子已经空置两年了。

Sense.DEF: to stay in one place for a long time, especially sitting down, doing nothing useful or helpful
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spent half the morning sitting in a traffic jam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我遇上塞车﹐坐在车里等了半个上午。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, I can’t sit here chatting all day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐我可不能整天坐在这儿闲扯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you just going to sit there complaining?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你就打算坐在那里发牢骚吗？

Sense.DEF: to be a member of a committee, parliament, or other official group
Sense.TRAN: 成为〔委员会﹑议会或其他官方组织〕的成员

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They both sat on the management committee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们两个都担任管理委员会的委员。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was the first journalist to sit in parliament.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是第一位任议会议员的新闻记者。

Sense.DEF: to have a meeting in order to carry out official business
Sense.EXAMPLE: The council only sits once a month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会每月只开一次会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The court will sit until all the evidence has been heard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法院将一直开庭到所有证词都陈述完毕为止。

Subsense.DEF: to be in, or get into, a resting position, with the tail end of the body resting on a surface
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The cat likes to sit on the wall outside the kitchen.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只猫喜欢蹲在厨房外面的墙头上。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell a dog to sit with the tail end of its body resting on the ground or floor

if a bird sits on its eggs, it covers them with its body to make the eggs
hatch

Sense.DEF: to look after a baby or child while its parents are out

Subsense.DEF: to stay where you are and not move
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Just sit tight – I’ll be there in five minutes.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 待着别动——我五分钟后就来。

Subsense.DEF: to stay in the same situation, and not change your mind and do anything new
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’re advising all our investors to sit tight till the market improves.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们建议我们所有的投资者按兵不动﹐等待市场复苏。

Sense.DEF: to be in a very good or favourable position
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve paid off the mortgage, so we’re sitting pretty now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经还清抵押贷款﹐现在轻松了。

Sense.DEF: to give your opinion about whether someone has done something wrong, especially when you have no right to do this
Sense.TRAN: （对某人）进行评论〔尤指妄加评论〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How can you sit in judgement on somebody you hardly know?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么可以对几乎不了解的人妄加评论呢？

Sense.DEF: if a situation, plan etc does not sit well with someone, they do not like it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had never before been accused of stealing, and it did not sit well with him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从来没有人说过他偷东西﹐这一指责让他觉得很委屈。

Sense.DEF: to avoid saying which side of an argument you support or what your opinion is about a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weakness of the book is that it sits on the fence on important issues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书的缺点是在重要问题上没有明确的态度。

Sense.DEF: to delay taking action when you should do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Workers are losing their jobs while the government sits on its hands and does nothing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人在失业﹐而政府却坐视不理。

Sense.DEF: to take an examination
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tracy’s sitting her GCSEs this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特蕾西今年要参加普通中等教育证书考试。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were preparing children to sit for the entry examination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在帮助孩子们准备入学考试。

Sense.DEF: to sit somewhere so that you can be painted or photographed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She sat for was painted by Holman Hunt and Millais.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她给霍尔曼·汉特和米莱当过模特。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: without moving
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Young children find it almost impossible to sit still.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子几乎很难坐着不动。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: without talking
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Mac sat quietly in the back of the car.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克静静地坐在汽车后座上。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was sitting comfortably on the sofa.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她正舒服地坐在沙发上。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with your back straight
suddenly sit up very straight, for example because you hear something
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 突然坐直〔如因为听到某事〕

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with your legs bent and crossed over in front of you

Exponent.DEF: to be resting your weight on your bottom somewhere, or to move into this position
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was sitting in front of the fire.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正坐在火炉前。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She sat on the bed and kicked off her shoes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐到床上,蹬掉鞋子。

Exponent.DEF: to sit on a chair, bed, floor etc after you have been standing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I sat down on the sofa.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在沙发上坐下来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Come in and sit down.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 进来坐。

Exponent.DEF: to be sitting in a particular chair or place
Exponent.TRAN: 坐在〔某把椅子或某个位置上〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: John was seated on my left.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰坐在我的左边。

Exponent.DEF: to sit – used especially when asking someone to sit down
Exponent.TRAN: 就座〔尤用于请某人坐下〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Please take a seat – she will be with you in a minute.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 请坐——她马上就来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Would the audience please take their seats – the show will begin in five minutes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 请各位观众入座,演出五分钟后开始。

Exponent.DEF: to sit in a comfortable chair and let yourself fall back into it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We switched on the TV and sank into our armchairs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们打开电视,倒进扶手椅里。

Exponent.DEF: to sit in a very comfortable relaxed way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They lounged around all day by the pool.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们整天懒洋洋地坐在游泳池旁边。

Exponent.DEF: to sit on the edge of something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He perched on the arm of the sofa.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坐在沙发的扶手上。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My sister was perched was sitting on a high stool.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妹妹坐在高脚凳上。

Exponent.DEF: to be sitting while leaning against something, especially because you are injured, drunk, or asleep
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They found him slumped against the steering wheel.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们发现他趴在方向盘上。

Exponent.DEF: to sit with your knees bent under you, your bottom just off the ground, balancing on your feet
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A little boy was squatting at the edge of the pool.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个小男孩蹲在水池边。

Sense.DEF: to spend a lot of time sitting and doing nothing very useful
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sat around for a bit, chatting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们闲坐着聊了一会儿。

Sense.DEF: to get into a comfortable position, for example in a chair, and relax
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sit back and relax– I’ll open a bottle of wine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐下来放松一下——我来开瓶酒。

Sense.DEF: to relax and make no effort to get involved in something or influence what happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t just sit back and wait for new business to come to you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要坐等新的业务来找你。

Sense.DEF: to allow something wrong or illegal to happen without doing anything about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not going to sit by and watch a man go to prison for something I’ve done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能坐视别人因我的所作所为而进监狱。

Sense.DEF: to be in a sitting position or get into a sitting position
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was good to be sitting down eating dinner with my family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐下来和家人一起用晚餐感觉真好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sit down, Amy – you look tired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐吧﹐埃米﹐你看上去很累。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sit yourself down and have a drink.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐下来﹐喝一杯吧。

Sense.DEF: to make someone sit down or help them to sit down
Sense.TRAN: 使某人就座﹐使某人坐下

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I helped her into the room and sat her down in an armchair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我扶她进了房间﹐让她在扶手椅上坐下来。

Sense.DEF: to try to solve a problem or deal with something that needs to be done, by giving it all your attention
Sense.TRAN: 坐下来专心解决[认真处理]某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The three of us need to sit down and have a talk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们三个需要坐下来好好谈谈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sit down and work out just what you spend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐下来算一算你花了多少钱。

Sense.DEF: to be present at a meeting but not take an active part in it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you like to sit in on some of my interviews?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你愿意来旁听我的几场面试吗？

Sense.DEF: to do a job, go to a meeting etc instead of the person who usually does it
Sense.TRAN: 代理〔某人的〕工作﹔代表〔某人〕出席会议
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is Alan James sitting in for Suzy Williams on the mid-morning show.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是艾伦·詹姆斯﹐代替苏济·威廉斯主持今天上午的节目。

Sense.DEF: to delay dealing with something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sent my application about six weeks ago and they’ve just been sitting on it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我大约六周前就把申请寄去了﹐可他们就是一直拖着不办。

Sense.DEF: to stay where you are and do nothing until something finishes, especially something boring or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 一直等到…结束〔尤指无聊或不快之事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had two weeks to sit it out while she waited to hear if she had got the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她要干等两个星期才能知道是否会得到这份工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was prepared to sit out the years of Jack’s jail sentence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她准备熬过这些年﹐直到杰克刑满释放。

Sense.DEF: to not take part in something, especially a game or dance, when you usually take part
Sense.TRAN: 不参加〔通常都参加的比赛或跳舞活动〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Johnson sat out the game with a shoulder injury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊因为肩伤﹐只能旁观比赛。

Sense.DEF: to attend a meeting, performance etc, and stay until the end, even if it is very long and boring
Sense.TRAN: 一直待到〔会议﹑演出等〕结束
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t the least bit interested in all the speeches I had to sit through.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对这些非听完不可的一场场演讲毫无兴趣。

Sense.DEF: to be in a sitting position or get into a sitting position after you have been lying down
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was sitting up in bed, reading his book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坐在床上看书。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sat up and reached for her glass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐起来伸手去拿杯子。

Sense.DEF: to help someone to sit after they have been lying down

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll sit you up on the pillows and you’ll be nice and comfortable.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我扶你坐起来靠在枕头上﹐这样你就舒服了。

Sense.DEF: to sit in a chair with your back straight
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just sit up straight and stop slouching.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐直身子﹐别无精打采的。

Sense.DEF: to stay up very late
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes we just sit up and watch videos all night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时我们通宵熬夜看录像。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly start paying attention to someone, because they have done something surprising or impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: If Maria succeeded, then everyone would sit up and take notice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚要是成功了﹐大家都会对她刮目相看。

Sense.DEF:
a very long musical instrument from India, similar to a
guitar
, with two sets of strings and a round body
Sense.TRAN: 西塔（尔）琴〔一种印度乐器﹐形似吉他﹐有两排琴弦﹐琴身为圆形〕

Sense.DEF: a funny television programme in which the same characters appear in different situations each week
a sit-down meal or restaurant is one in which you sit at a table and eat a formal meal
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sit-down meal for 20 people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 供 20 人吃的宴席

Sense.DEF: a protest in which people sit down, especially to block a road or other public place, until their demands are considered or agreed to
if you have a sit-down, you sit and rest for a short while
Sense.EXAMPLE: You look as if you need a sit-down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看上去好像需要坐下休息休息。

Sense.DEF: a place where something important or interesting happened
Sense.TRAN: 〔发生过重要或有意思的事件的〕场所﹐地方﹐地点
Sense.EXAMPLE: an archaeological site
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考古现场

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house is built on the site of a medieval prison.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢房子建在一座中世纪监狱的遗址上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the site of the air crash
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机失事的地点

Sense.DEF: an area of ground where something is being built or will be built

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the site of a proposed missile base
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拟建导弹基地的选址
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a site for a new airport
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用于建造新机场的一块地皮

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He managed to get himself a job on a building site.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他好不容易在建筑工地上找了一份工作。

Sense.DEF: a place that is used for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: a camping site
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 营地

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a nesting site for birds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸟类筑巢地

Sense.DEF:
a
website
at the place where people work, study, or stay
Sense.TRAN: 在现场〔在人们工作﹑学习或逗留的地方〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a bar, restaurant, and gym on site.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内有酒吧﹑餐馆和健身房。

Sense.DEF: to place or build something in a particular place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some of this new housing has been sited in inner city areas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些新住房有些选址在内城区。

Sense.DEF: designed and made to to be used in a particular place, or relating to a particular place
Sense.TRAN: 在某一地区使用的﹔定点的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a site-specific policy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 定点政策

Sense.DEF: a type of protest in which people refuse to leave the place where they work or study until their demands are considered or agreed to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several thousand students staged sit-ins and protest marches.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 几千名学生举行了静坐示威和抗议游行。

Sense.DEF:
a
babysitter
someone who sits or stands while someone else paints them or takes photographs of them
Sense.TRAN: 〔坐着或站着供人画像或拍照的〕模特

Sense.DEF: one of the times when a meal is served in a place where there is not enough space for everyone to eat at the same time
Sense.EXAMPLE: School dinners are served in three sittings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校午餐分三批用餐。

Sense.DEF: during one continuous period when you are sitting in a chair
Sense.TRAN: 在持续坐着的一段时间里
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sat down and read the whole book in one sitting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我坐下来﹐一口气看完了这本书。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you have yourself painted or photographed
a meeting of a law court or parliament
someone who is easy to attack or easy to cheat
Sense.EXAMPLE: Out in the open, the soldiers were sitting ducks for enemy fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在毫无掩蔽的地方﹐战士们就成了敌人炮火的活靶子。

Sense.DEF: someone who is a member of a parliament at the present time
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sitting member for Newbury
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽伯里的现任议员

Sense.DEF: the room in a house where you sit, relax, watch television etc

someone who lives in a rented house or
flat
, especially when this gives them legal rights to stay there
Sense.TRAN: 〔房屋或公寓的〕承租人﹐现住房客

Sense.DEF: to describe or consider something as being part of something else or related to something else
Sense.TRAN: 认为…是〔另一事物〕的部分﹔把…和〔另一事物〕联系起来考虑

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The women have the opportunity to situate their own struggles in a wider historical context.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些女性有机会把她们的斗争和更宽广的历史背景联系起来。

Sense.DEF: to be in a particular place or position

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house is situated near the college.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢房子位于学院附近。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a farm situated in the valley
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 位于山谷里的一个农场

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hotel is ideally situated near the seafront.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店的位置理想﹐靠近海滨。

Sense.DEF: a combination of all the things that are happening and all the conditions that exist at a particular time in a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: I explained the situation to everyone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向大家介绍了一下情况。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She coped well in a very difficult situation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她面对困境应付自如。

Sense.DEF: the type of area where a building is situated - used especially by people who sell or advertise buildings
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物的〕环境﹐位置〔尤用于房地产广告〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house is in a charming situation, on a wooded hillside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子位于林木茂密的小山坡上﹐环境十分优美。

Sense.DEF: a job
Sense.EXAMPLE: She managed to get a situation as a parlour maid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她设法找到了一份做女仆的工作。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: cause it to happen
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Tom’s arrival created an awkward situation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆的到来使场面显得尴尬。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Ballater was trying to assess the situation objectively.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴拉特试着客观地分析形势。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: watch to see how it develops
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The bank is monitoring the situation closely.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行正在密切关注局势。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had no idea how to deal with the situation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他根本不知道该如何应付这局面。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They are doing what they can to improve the situation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在尽力改善局面。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make people less angry
it happens
it happens

Collocate.EXAMPLE: This book will show you how to deal with difficult situations.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书教你如何处理棘手问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very difficult
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I was in an impossible situation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的处境非常困难。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The situation was becoming increasingly dangerous.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 形势变得越来越危险。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The present situation in Afghanistan is very worrying.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿富汗目前的局势非常令人担忧。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The country’s economic situation continued to deteriorate.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家的经济形势继续恶化。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: how safe a place is
how much money someone has
a situation in which someone is with other people
a situation at work
one in which there will be a bad result whatever happens
one in which everyone gets what they want

Sense.DEF:
a
sitcom
an exercise to make your stomach muscles strong, in which you sit up from a lying position, while keeping your feet on the floor
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jerry says he does two hundred sit-ups a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰里说他每天做两百个仰卧起坐。

Sense.DEF:
a standard unit of measurement in an international system used especially by scientists. SI units include the metre, kilogram, second,
ampere
, and
kelvin
.
Sense.TRAN: SI单位﹐国际标准度量单位

Sense.DEF: the number 6
Sense.EXAMPLE: six months ago
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 六个月前
Sense.EXAMPLE: She arrived just after six six o’clock .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她六点刚过就到了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He learnt to play the violin when he was six six years old .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他六岁学拉小提琴。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a number that is between 100,000 and
Sense.EXAMPLE: The final cost of the project will easily run into six figures be over £100,000 or $100,000 .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目的最终成本很可能要达到六位数。

Sense.DEF: disorganized and confused
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the visitors arrived, we were still at sixes and sevens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 客人到来时﹐我们这儿还是乱七八糟的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’s six of one and half a dozen of the other
Sense.DEF: used to say that both people or groups who are involved in a situation are equally responsible for something bad that happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: In any family quarrel, it’s usually six of one and half a dozen of the other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭争吵一般都是双方都有错。

Sense.DEF: to affect someone strongly in a bad way
Sense.TRAN: 极大地影响某人﹐对某人打击很大
Sense.EXAMPLE: Losing his job really knocked him for six.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丢了工作对他打击很大。

Sense.DEF:
a hit in
cricket
that scores six
runs
because the ball crosses the edge of the playing area before touching the ground
used to describe a number that is 100,000 or more, especially an amount of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: a six-figure sum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一笔六位数的金额
Sense.EXAMPLE: a six-figure salary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 六位数的薪金

Sense.DEF: by six times as much or as many
Sense.EXAMPLE: Burglaries have increased sixfold .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 入室盗窃案已增至六倍。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a sixfold increase in teenage pregnancies
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 少女怀孕人数的六倍增长

Sense.DEF: a Rugby Union competition that takes place every year between teams from England, Ireland, Scotland, Wales, France, and Italy
Sense.TRAN: 六国锦标赛〔橄榄球联合会举行的一年一度的比赛﹐参赛国家及地区包括英格兰﹑爱尔兰﹑苏格兰﹑威尔士﹑法国和意大利〕

Sense.DEF: six cans or bottles of a drink, especially beer, sold together as a set
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指啤酒等饮料的〕六罐[瓶]装﹐半打装
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a six-pack in the fridge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰箱里还有一盒半打装的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a six-pack of beer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 六罐装的啤酒

Sense.DEF: well-developed muscles that you can see on a man’s stomach - used humorously

a small silver-coloured coin worth six old
pennies
, used in Britain in the past
a small gun that holds six bullets
the number
Sense.EXAMPLE: sixteen years later
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 16年后
Sense.EXAMPLE: He moved to London when he was sixteen 16 years old .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他 16 岁时搬到了伦敦。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Let’s have dinner on the 16th the 16th day of the month.

Sense.DEF: one of 16 equal parts of something

a musical note which continues for a sixteenth of the length of a
whole note
coming after five other things in a series
Sense.EXAMPLE: her sixth birthday
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的 6 岁生日
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sixth century
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 6世纪

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Let’s have dinner on the sixth the sixth day of the month .

Sense.DEF: one of six equal parts of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: About one sixth of the children admitted to taking drugs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约六分之一的儿童承认吸毒。

Sense.DEF:
the highest level in the British school system. Children aged between 16 and 18 stay in the sixth form for two years while they prepare to take
a level s the highest level of school exams
.
Sense.TRAN: 第六学级〔英国中学的最高学级﹐学生为 16 至 18 岁的孩子﹐他们上两年第六学级﹐准备参加高级程度考试〕

Sense.DEF:
a type of school in Britain for students who are preparing to take
a level s the highest level of school exams
Sense.TRAN: 第六学级学校﹐预科学校〔英国为准备参加高级程度考试的学生开设的学校〕

Sense.DEF: a special ability to know things without using any of your five ordinary senses such as your hearing or sight
Sense.EXAMPLE: He seemed to have a sixth sense for knowing when his brother was in trouble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他好像有第六感﹐知道弟弟什么时候有麻烦。

Sense.DEF: the number
Sense.EXAMPLE: sixty years ago
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 六十年前

Sense.DEF: the years from 1960 to 1969
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book was written in the sixties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书写于 60年代。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the student riots in Paris in the late sixties
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 60年代末巴黎的学生骚乱

Sense.DEF: to be aged between 60 and
Sense.TRAN: 69 在六十到六十九岁之间﹐是六十多岁

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d say she was in her late sixties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我估计她快70岁了。

Sense.DEF: if the temperature is in the sixties, it is between 60 degrees and 69 degrees

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fine spring day, with the temperatures in the low sixties
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 气温略高于60度的一个晴朗春日

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
sizeable
how big or small something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a small boy, about John’s size.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个小男孩﹐个子和约翰差不多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jensens’ house is about the same size as ours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹森的房子和我们的差不多大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The firm underestimated the size of the market for their new product.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司低估了他们新产品的市场规模。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I saw a spider the size of the same size as my hand in the backyard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在后院看到一只有我手那么大的蜘蛛。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s quite a big dog, but he’s still not full size yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条狗体型很大﹐但还没有长足。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The apartment is roughly 360 square feet in size.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这套公寓的面积大约有 360 平方英尺。

GramExa.GLOSS: as big as that or this
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In a class this size, there are bound to be a few troublemakers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这么大的一个班里﹐必然会有几个捣蛋鬼。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We can’t give loans of that size to just anyone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不能把这样大的一笔贷款贷给随便什么人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These phones come in all shapes and sizes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些电话机有各种形状和大小。

GramExa.GLOSS: fairly big
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The breakfast room is a good size.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个早餐室相当大。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is very big

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t believe the size of her car!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我简直不敢相信﹐她的车好大啊！
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sheer size of the classes makes learning difficult for students.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 班级这么大﹐给学生的学习造成了困难。

Sense.DEF: one of a set of standard measures according to which clothes and other goods are produced and sold
Sense.EXAMPLE: These shoes are one size too big.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这双鞋子大了一码。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shirts come in three sizes: small, medium, and large.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些衬衣有三个尺码: 小号﹑中号和大号。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have these pants in a size 12?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这裤子有 12 号的吗？

Sense.DEF: of a particular size, or about the same size and shape as something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a medium-sized car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中型汽车
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pocket-size mirror
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小镜子

GramExa.GLOSS: big enough for a particular purpose

Sense.DEF: if you cut, make, or prepare something to size, you make it the right size for a particular use
Sense.TRAN: 把某物做成合适的尺寸
Sense.EXAMPLE: The materials will be provided, and everything is already cut to size.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 材料会提供好﹐并且全部都已经剪成合适的尺寸。

Sense.LEXUNIT: that’s about the size of it
Sense.DEF: used to agree that someone’s description of a situation is correct
Sense.TRAN: 情况大约就是这样〔用于赞同某人的说法〕

Sense.DEF:
a thick sticky liquid used for giving stiffness and a shiny surface to cloth, paper etc, or used to prepare walls for
wallpaper
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于使纸张﹑布料等坚挺有光泽﹐或用于贴墙纸的〕胶料﹐浆料

Exponent.DEF: how big someone or something is
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What size is that shirt?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那件衬衫是多大尺寸？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The price will depend on the size and quality of the carpet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 价钱要视地毯的大小和质量而定。

Exponent.DEF: the length, width, and height of an object, room, building etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔物体﹑房间﹑建筑物等的〕长宽高,尺寸
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What are the dimensions of the table?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张桌子的长宽高是多少？

Exponent.DEF: the length, width, or height of something, or of someone’s body
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I need to check the measurements of the window.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要核实窗户的尺寸。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My waist measurement is 31 inches.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的腰围是31英寸。

Exponent.DEF: the relative sizes of the different parts of an object, room, building etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔物体﹑房间﹑建筑物等各部分尺寸的〕比例
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The proportions don’t look right to me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看比例不对。

Exponent.DEF: the amount of space that a flat surface such as a floor or field covers
Exponent.EXAMPLE: To measure the area of a room, you need to multiply the length by the width.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算房间面积要把长和宽相乘。

Exponent.DEF: the size of a large area
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The extent of the ranch is enormous.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个农场面积很大。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The island measured about 1,600 kilometres in extent.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个岛的面积约1,600平方公里。

Exponent.DEF: the very large size of something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The statue’s massive bulk made it difficult to move.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这尊雕像体积巨大,很难移动它。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: his enormous bulk
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他巨大的块头

Exponent.DEF: the amount that a container will hold
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The capacity of the tank is around 500 gallons.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 水箱的容量约为 500 加仑。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All the storage units were filled to capacity.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的储藏单元都装满了。

Exponent.DEF: the amount of space that a substance fills, or that an object contains
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The average domestic swimming pool has a volume of 45,000 litres.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 普通家庭游泳池的容积是45,000升。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This instrument measures the volume of air in your lungs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个仪器是测肺活量的。

Sense.DEF: to sort things according to their size
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shrimp are sized and selected for canning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虾按大小分类制成罐头。

Sense.DEF: to make something into a particular size or sizes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most costume patterns are sized for children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数化装服的纸样是按儿童尺寸制作的。

Sense.DEF:
to put
size 1 7
on a wall before decorating
Sense.TRAN: 〔装潢前〕给…上胶料[上浆﹐上涂料]

Sense.DEF: to look at or consider a person or situation and make a judgment about them
Sense.EXAMPLE: It only took a few seconds for her to size up the situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只用几秒钟就对情况作出了判断。

Sense.DEF: fairly large

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sizeable amount of money
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 数目可观的一笔钱

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Part-time students make up a sizeable proportion of the college population.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 非全日制学生在大学生总人数中占了很大的比例。

Sense.DEF: the smallest size of women's clothing in the US
Sense.TRAN: 零码﹐零号尺寸〔美国女性服装的最小尺寸〕

Sense.DEF: a woman who is very thin
Sense.TRAN: 零号身材女性〔指非常瘦的女子〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: These clothes only look good on size zeroes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些衣服只有身材纤瘦的女性穿着才好看。

Sense.DEF: to make a sound like water falling on hot metal
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bacon began to sizzle in the pan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 熏猪肉在平底锅里开始咝咝作响。

Sense.DEF: very hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sizzling afternoon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个酷热的下午

Sense.DEF: very exciting, especially in a sexual way
Sense.TRAN: 热烈的﹐刺激的〔尤指性方面〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sizzling scandalous affair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火热的不伦之恋

Sense.DEF:
a kind of popular music from the West Indies with a fast regular beat, similar to
reggae
Sense.TRAN: 斯卡乐〔一种源于西印度群岛的节奏明快的音乐﹐与雷鬼乐相似〕

Sense.DEF: very unpleasant or dirty
Sense.TRAN: 令人极不舒服的﹐肮脏的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The toilets there are really skanky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那里的厕所太脏了。

Sense.DEF: a skanky woman is or looks very willing to have sex – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔女子〕 风骚的﹐放荡的〔含贬义〕

PIC.HEADING: SKATES 冰鞋
PIC.PICCONTENT: skateboard 滑板；ice skates 冰鞋；in-line skates 直排轮旱冰鞋；roller skates 四轮旱冰鞋

Sense.DEF: one of a pair of boots with metal blades on the bottom, for moving quickly on ice
one of a pair of boots or frames with small wheels on the bottom, for moving quickly on flat smooth surfaces
a large flat sea fish that can be eaten
Sense.TRAN: 鳐 〔一种可食用的扁平大海鱼〕

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to hurry
Sense.TRAN: 赶快﹐赶紧 〔用于催促别人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put your skates on, or you’ll be late for school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动作快点﹐不然你上学要迟到了。

Sense.DEF: to move on skates
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children skated on the frozen pond.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在结冰的池塘上滑冰。

Sense.DEF: to be doing something that may get you into trouble
to avoid mentioning a problem or subject, or not give it enough attention
Sense.TRAN: 避免提起 〔某问题或话题〕﹔把〔问题等〕轻轻带过
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President was accused of skating over the issue of the homeless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统被指责在无家可归者的问题上轻描淡写。

Sense.DEF: a short board with two small wheels at each end, which you can stand on and ride for fun or as a sport
an area for skateboarders to use, which has special slopes or other structures
the activity or sport of moving around on skates for fun or as a sport
Sense.EXAMPLE: We went skating in Central Park.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去中央公园溜冰了。

Sense.DEF: a place or building where you can skate
to leave a place quickly, especially because you do not want to be caught - used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 逃跑﹐仓皇逃窜〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: the sport of shooting at clay objects that have been thrown into the air
to make someone feel sick or upset because they think something is unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate touching raw meat. I just get skeeved out .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌碰生肉﹐我会恶心的。

Sense.DEF:
a long loosely wound piece of thread, wool, or
yarn
a complicated series of things that are related to each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: a skein of lies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一连串谎言

Sense.DEF: like a skeleton or relating to a skeleton
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police discovered the skeletal remains of a corpse buried near the river.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方发现了埋在河边的一具尸骨。

Sense.DEF: someone who is skeletal is so thin that you can see their bones through their skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: prisoners whose clothes hung loosely on their skeletal bodies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骨瘦如柴﹑衣服松松垮垮地挂在身上的囚犯

Subsense.DEF: the structure consisting of all the bones in a human or animal body
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the human skeleton
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人体骨骼

Subsense.DEF: a set of these bones or a model of them, fastened in their usual positions, used, for example, by medical students
Subsense.TRAN: 〔医学研究用的〕骨骼标本﹐骨骼模型

PIC.HEADING: SKELETON 骨骼
PIC.PICCONTENT: skull 颅骨；breastbone 胸骨；pelvis 骨盆；fibula 腓骨；tibia 胫骨；knee cap 髌骨；femur 股骨；ulna 尺骨；radius 桡骨；ribs 肋骨；shoulder blade 肩胛骨；collarbone 锁骨

Sense.DEF: the most important parts of something, to which more detail can be added later
Sense.EXAMPLE: We agreed on a skeleton outline of the proposal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们给提案商定了一个基本框架。

Sense.DEF: an extremely thin person or animal
Sense.EXAMPLE: The disease had reduced Harry to a skeleton.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场病后﹐哈里瘦得只剩皮包骨了。

Sense.DEF: the main structure that supports a building, bridge etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Minutes after the explosion, all that remained was the skeleton of the bridge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爆炸发生几分钟后﹐这座桥就只剩一副框架了。

Sense.DEF: an embarrassing or unpleasant secret about something that happened to you in the past
only enough workers or services to keep an operation or organization running
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bus company is operating a skeleton service on Christmas Day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴士公司在圣诞节这天只提供最基本的营运服务。

Sense.DEF:
a sport in which you slide down a special ice track while lying on your front on a type of
sledge
, or the vehicle you slide on
a key made to open a number of different locks

the American spelling of
sceptic

the American spelling of
sceptical

the American spelling of
scepticism
a simple, quickly made drawing that does not show much detail

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cantor drew a rough sketch of his apartment on a napkin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 坎托在餐巾上画了一幅他公寓的草图。

Sense.DEF: a short humorous scene on a television programme, in a theatre etc, that is part of a larger show
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视节目﹑剧院里等的〕滑稽短剧
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her TV programme is made up of a series of comic sketches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的电视节目由一系列滑稽短剧组成。

Sense.DEF: a short written or spoken description

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a brief sketch of the main weaknesses of the British economy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对英国经济主要弊病的简述
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a thumbnail sketch very brief description of topics treated in depth elsewhere
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对其他地方有深入讨论的话题的概述

Sense.DEF: to draw a sketch of something
to describe something in a general way, giving the basic ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: Holford sketched a 10-year programme for rebuilding the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍尔福德简单介绍了城市重建的十年规划。

Sense.DEF: to add more information about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to sketch in a few details for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想给你补充几点细节。

Sense.DEF: a number of sheets of paper fastened together and used for drawing
not thorough or complete, and not having enough details to be useful
Sense.TRAN: 不完全的﹐粗略的﹐简略的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Details of the accident are still sketchy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故的详细情况依然不完全。

Sense.DEF: if something skews the results of a test etc, it affects them, making them incorrect
Sense.TRAN: 影响〔测试结果等〕的准确性﹐使偏颇
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the people we questioned lived in the same area, which had the effect of skewing the figures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们询问的人全都生活在同一地区﹐这影响了数据的准确性。

Sense.DEF: to affect or influence someone’s ideas, actions, or judgment, especially in a way that makes the ideas etc not correct or fair
Sense.EXAMPLE: These assumptions about Communism skewed American foreign policy for decades.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于共产主义的这些臆断使美国外交政策数十年来有失偏颇。

Sense.DEF: an opinion, piece of information, result etc that is skewed is incorrect, especially because it has been affected by a particular thing or because you do not know all the facts
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因受某事影响或对事实掌握不全使得看法﹑信息﹑结果等〕偏颇的﹐不正确的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The media’s coverage of the election has been skewed from the very beginning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 媒体对此次大选的报道从一开始就失之偏颇。

Sense.DEF: something that is skewed is not straight and is higher on one side than the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: The picture on the wall was slightly skewed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙上的画稍微有点歪。

Sense.DEF: a long metal or wooden stick that is put through pieces of meat to hold them together while they are cooked
Sense.TRAN: 〔金属或木质的〕串肉扦﹐烤肉扦

Sense.DEF: to make a hole through a piece of food, an object etc with a skewer or with some other pointed object
Sense.TRAN: 〔用烤肉扦或类似东西〕把…串起来

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone very strongly, often in a way that other people find humorous
Sense.EXAMPLE: Du Bois skewered Washington’s policies in his book, ‘The Souls of Black Folks.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杜波伊斯在他《黑人的灵魂》一书中讽刺了美国政府的政策。

Sense.DEF: not straight
Sense.EXAMPLE: The top of the bookcase is skew-whiff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 书橱顶是歪的。

Sense.DEF: one of a pair of long thin narrow pieces of wood or plastic that you fasten to your boots and use for moving on snow or on water
Sense.EXAMPLE: ski slopes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滑雪坡
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ski resort where people can go skiing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滑雪度假胜地

Sense.DEF: a long thin narrow piece of strong material, fastened under a small vehicle so that it can travel on snow
to move on skis for sport or in order to travel on snow or water
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m learning to ski.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在学滑雪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We skied down to the village of Argentière.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们滑雪下坡﹐到了阿让蒂耶尔村。

Sense.DEF: a specially made boot that fastens onto a ski
if a vehicle or a wheel on a vehicle skids, it suddenly slides sideways and you cannot control it
Sense.TRAN: 〔车辆或车轮〕打滑﹐失控滑向一侧
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car skidded as she turned onto the highway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她转向上公路时车打滑了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bus skidded off the road and into a ditch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车打滑冲出公路﹐掉进了沟里。

Sense.DEF: a sudden sliding movement of a vehicle that you cannot control
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn the car towards the skid if you lose control of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果汽车失去控制﹐就往打滑的方向转。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He slammed on the brakes and we went into a long skid started to skid .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他猛力踩下车﹐我们的车子打滑了很长一段路。

Sense.DEF: in a situation that is bad and getting worse
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been on the skids since losing his job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他丢了工作以后﹐境况越来越糟。

Sense.DEF: to make it likely or certain that something will fail
Sense.EXAMPLE: The recession put the skids under his plans for starting a new business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济衰退使他开新店的计划告吹了。

Sense.DEF: a period of time during which a person or team is not successful – used in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 〔运动员或球队的〕低迷期〔用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Red Sox victory ended a six-game skid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红袜队的这次胜利结束了连输六场的低迷期。

Sense.DEF:
a flat narrow part that is under some aircraft such as
helicopter s
, and is used in addition to wheels for landing
a piece of wood that is put under a heavy object to lift or move it
Sense.TRAN: 〔支撑重物的〕垫木﹔〔使重物易于滑动的〕滑动垫木

Sense.DEF: a long mark that is left on the ground when a vehicle skids
Sense.TRAN: 〔车辆打滑后在地面上留下的〕滑行痕迹
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were skid marks on the road where the crash occurred.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路上发生车祸的地方有打滑的痕迹。

Sense.DEF: a dirty mark inside someone’s underwear
a small motor vehicle for travelling fast over snow
if someone is on skid row, they drink too much alcohol and have no job, nowhere to live etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔失业酒徒〕无家可归﹐流落街头

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a part of a city with a lot of old buildings in bad condition, where poor people who drink too much alcohol spend their time

someone who
ski s

the plural of
sky
a small light boat for one person
a type of popular music played in the 1950s and often using instruments made by the musicians themselves
Sense.TRAN: 噪音爵士乐﹐史基佛音乐〔20 世纪 50 年代的一种流行音乐﹐其乐器常由演奏者自制〕

Sense.DEF:
the sport of moving down hills, across land in the snow, or on water wearing
ski s
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to go skiing in Colorado this winter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年冬天我们要去科罗拉多滑雪。

Sense.DEF:
a sport in which a
skier
is pulled over snow or ice by one or more dogs

a long steep sloping
platform
which people go down on
ski s
and jump off to see how far they can go through the air in sports competitions
good at doing something, especially something that needs special ability or training
Sense.EXAMPLE: a skilful footballer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 技巧娴熟的足球运动员

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After a few years, he became very skilful at drawing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 几年以后﹐他的绘画技艺已经非常纯熟了。

Sense.DEF: made or done very well, showing a lot of ability
Sense.TRAN: 制作精良的﹔处理巧妙的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the skilful use of sound effects
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对音响效果的巧妙运用
Sense.EXAMPLE: sensitive and skillful leadership
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 善解人意﹑手腕巧妙的领导才能

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She had used make-up skilfully to mask the bruise.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用巧妙的化妆把瘀伤遮住了。

Exponent.DEF: good at doing something, especially something that needs special ability or training
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a skilful player
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 技巧嫺熟的球员
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the artist's skillful use of color
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 艺术家对色彩的巧妙运用

Exponent.DEF: able to do something well
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Maria is extremely good at her job.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚对她的工作得心应手。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was very good at swimming.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他游泳游得非常好。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I'm not very good at Maths.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我数学不是很好。

Exponent.DEF: having a lot of training and experience, and able to do a job well
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There is a demand for carpenters and other skilled craftsmen.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在需要木工以及其他熟练工匠。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The country needs highly skilled foreign workers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家需要高技能的外来劳工。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Our advisors are skilled at dealing with financial problems.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的顾问善于处理财务方面的问题。

Exponent.DEF: having a natural ability to do something well
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a talented artist
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有天赋的艺术家
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She's an exceptionally talented student.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个才华出众的学生。

Exponent.DEF: having a great natural ability, which few people have
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a gifted writer
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 天才作家
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a gifted player
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有天赋的球员
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a special school for gifted children
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 专门招收天才儿童的学校

Exponent.DEF: very skilful because you have had a lot of experience of doing something – used especially about musicians, artists, performers etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指音乐家﹑画家﹑演艺人员等〕有造诣的,有才艺的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a highly accomplished pianist
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位造诣精深的钢琴家
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She is one of the most accomplished theatre performers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是最有才华的戏剧演员之一。

Exponent.DEF: extremely skilful and having a lot of knowledge about doing something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was an expert skier.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是滑雪高手。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Students learn to cook French food with the help of expert chefs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生在名厨指导下学做法国菜。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Politicians are expert at deflecting criticism.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政客们都善于转移批评。

Exponent.DEF: extremely skilful and impressive – used especially about musicians, performers, or performances
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指音乐家﹑演艺人员或表演〕技艺高超的﹐精湛的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a virtuoso violinist
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小提琴演奏大师
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The team gave a virtuoso performance in the final.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队在决赛中的表现极为精彩。

Sense.DEF:
a piece of equipment that carries
skier s
up to the top of a slope
Sense.TRAN: 〔运送滑雪者到坡顶的〕上山吊椅

Sense.DEF: an ability to do something well, especially because you have learned and practised it
Sense.TRAN: 技能﹐技巧﹐技艺〔尤指通过学习和实践获得〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reading and writing are two different skills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阅读和写作是两种不同的技能。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many jobs today require computer skills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今的许多工作都需要计算机技能。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was valued for his skill in raising money for the company.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因为替公司筹集资金的本领而受到重视。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole team played with great skill and determination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 整支球队表现出精湛的技巧和争胜的决心。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He didn’t have the right skills for the job.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不具备适合做这项工作的技能。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: People can acquire new skills while they are unemployed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们可以在待业期间学习新的技能。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We will give you the opportunity to develop your skills.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会给你发展技能的机会。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I am sure you can use your communication skills to get your message across.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信你可以发挥你的交际能力,让人接受你要传递的信息。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: to need skill
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s a difficult task, which requires skill and experience.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是项艰难的任务,需要技术和经验。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a lot of skill
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He played with great skill.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打得非常有水平。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He’s got good management skills.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有良好的管理能力。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The basic skills can be acquired very quickly.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 基本技能很快就能掌握。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Students will have the opportunity to learn a lot of practical skills.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生将有机会学习很多实用的技能。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the ability to communicate well with people
the ability to get on well with people
the ability to deal with people
the ability to use a language

Exponent.DEF: an ability to do something well, especially because you have learned and practised it
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指通过学习和实践获得的〕技能,技巧,技艺
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He plays the piano with great skill.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的钢琴演奏技艺高超。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: communication/language/computer etc skills
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 交际/语言/计算机等技能

Exponent.DEF: a natural ability to do something well which can be developed with practice
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was a young artist with a lot of talent.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是一名很有天赋的年轻艺术家。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She showed a talent for acting from an early age.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从小就表现出了表演天赋。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He is a man of many talents .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个多才多艺的人。

Exponent.DEF: very great ability, which only a few people have
Exponent.TRAN: 〔只有少数人拥有的〕天才,天分
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The opera shows Mozart’s genius as a composer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部歌剧表现了莫扎特的作曲天分。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Picasso was a painter of genius .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 毕加索是一位天才画家。

Exponent.DEF: a natural ability to do something very well, which you were born with
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You can see that he has a gift for the game.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以看出他有这项运动的天赋。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Winterson has great gifts as a writer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 温特森很有写作天赋。

Exponent.DEF: skill for doing something, especially something that needs imagination and creativity
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指从事需要发挥想象和创造力的事情的〕才能,天赋
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The job does require some creative flair.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 做这项工作确实需要一些创造力。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She has a flair for languages.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有语言天赋。

Exponent.DEF: specialized knowledge of a technical subject, which you get from experience of doing that type of work
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The technical expertise for building the dam is being provided by a US company.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 修建大坝由一家美国公司提供技术方案。

Exponent.DEF: a special skill for doing a particular thing, especially a simple everyday thing
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指做日常简单事情的〕诀窍,本领
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Breadmaking is easy once you get the knack.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一旦你掌握了诀窍,做面包是很简单的事情。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He has a knack for making people feel relaxed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有办法让人感到放松。

Sense.DEF: someone who is skilled has the training and experience that is needed to do something well
Sense.EXAMPLE: Skilled craftsmen, such as carpenters, are in great demand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对木工之类的熟练工匠需求量很大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is fortunate to have such highly skilled workers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司有这样一些技能熟练的工人真是幸运。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s very skilled at dealing with the public.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和公众打交道很有一套。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The school offers a program for students who are skilled in metalwork.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校为精于金工的学生开设了一门课程。

Sense.DEF: skilled work needs people with special abilities or training to do it
Sense.TRAN: 〔工作〕需要特殊技能的﹐需受过专门训练的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bricklaying is very skilled work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 砌砖是一项很需要技术的工作。

Sense.DEF: a flat heavy cooking pan with a long handle

the American spelling of
skilful
to remove something from the surface of a liquid, especially floating fat, solids, or oil
Sense.TRAN: 撇去〔液体表面的浮油或固体物质〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After simmering the meat, skim the fat from the surface.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把肉用文火炖过后再撇去表面的油脂。

Sense.DEF: to read something quickly to find the main facts or ideas in it
Sense.TRAN: 略读﹐浏览〔以找出主要信息〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Julie skimmed the sports page.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉浏览了体育版。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just skim through the second section to save time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了节省时间﹐第二节就浏览一下吧。

Sense.DEF: to move along quickly over a surface, never touching it or not touching it often
Sense.EXAMPLE: seagulls skimming the waves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 掠过浪尖的海鸥

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ball skimmed across the grass and stopped against the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 球掠过草地﹐在墙边停了下来。

Sense.DEF: to throw smooth flat stones into a lake, river etc in a way that makes them jump across the surface
to take the best people or the best part of something for yourself
Sense.TRAN: 挑走〔最优秀的人〕﹔选取〔精华〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Professional sport skims off all the best players.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业体育运动把最优秀的选手都挑走了。

Sense.DEF: to take money illegally or dishonestly
Sense.EXAMPLE: For years his business partner had been skimming off the profits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的生意伙伴多年来一直在私吞利润。

Sense.DEF: milk that has had all the fat and cream removed from it

the crime of using a
card reader machine that checks the details on a credit card or debit card
to get private information about someone’s
credit card
in order to steal money from them
Sense.TRAN: 侧录﹐滑卡〔用读卡器盗取信用卡或借记卡上的私人信息来偷钱的犯罪行为〕

Sense.DEF: to not spend enough money or time on something, or not use enough of something, so that what you do is unsuccessful or of bad quality
Sense.TRAN: 舍不得花〔足够的钱或时间〕﹐吝啬

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s vital not to skimp on staff training.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工培训不能少﹐这一点十分重要。

Sense.DEF: a skimpy dress or skirt etc is very short and does not cover very much of a woman’s body
not enough of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a skimpy meal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不够吃的一 顿饭

Sense.DEF: the natural outer layer of a person’s or animal’s body
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had thick black hair and smooth dark skin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一头浓密的黑发﹐皮肤黝黑光滑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The skin on his hands was dry and rough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他手上的皮肤干燥粗糙。

Sense.DEF: the skin of an animal, sometimes including its fur, used to make leather, clothes etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a leopard skin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 豹皮

Subsense.DEF: the natural outer cover of some fruits and vegetables
Subsense.EXAMPLE: banana skins
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香蕉皮

Subsense.DEF:
the outer cover of a
sausage

Sense.DEF: a thin solid layer that forms on the top of a liquid, especially when it gets cold
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指液体冷却后上面形成的〕薄层
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cover the soup to stop a skin from forming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把汤盖起来以免表面凝结。

Sense.DEF: a layer that is part of a vehicle, building, object etc, especially on the outside
Sense.TRAN: 〔车辆﹑建筑物﹑物体等的〕外壳﹐外层
Sense.EXAMPLE: The outer skin of the aircraft was not punctured.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机的外壳没有被打穿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lampshade has a double skin so that it remains cool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个灯罩有两层﹐不会发烫。

Sense.DEF: the way particular information appears on a computer screen, especially when this can be changed quickly and easily
to be easily upset or not easily upset by criticism
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is not a job for someone with thin skin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这工作脸皮薄的人干不了。

Sense.DEF: if someone gets under your skin, they annoy you, especially by the way they behave
Sense.EXAMPLE: What really gets under my skin is people who push straight to the front of the line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些插队的人真叫我恼火。

Sense.LEXUNIT: by the skin of your teeth
Sense.DEF: if you do something by the skin of your teeth, you only just succeed in doing it, and very nearly failed to do it
Sense.TRAN: 好不容易才…﹐差点就没…﹐勉强
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two others made it by the skin of their teeth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 另外两人勉强通过。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very uncomfortable or slightly afraid
Sense.TRAN: 使某人恶心﹐让某人起鸡皮疙瘩
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her singing makes my skin crawl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她唱歌让我起鸡皮疙瘩。

Sense.DEF: to be extremely thin in a way that is unattractive and unhealthy

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’s no skin off sb’s nose
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone does not care what another person thinks or does, because it does not affect them
Sense.TRAN: 某人根本不在乎﹐某人才不管呢
Sense.EXAMPLE: If she doesn’t want me to help, it’s no skin off my nose!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果她不要我帮忙﹐我才不在乎呢！

Sense.DEF: used to say that something may seem to be important or effective, but it really is not because it only affects the way things appear
Sense.TRAN: 某物只是肤浅的﹐某事仅仅是表面的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beauty is only skin deep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美貌只是皮相。

Sense.DEF:
papers for rolling a cigarette, especially one with
marijuana
in it
Sense.TRAN: 卷烟纸〔尤指卷大麻的纸〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I have fair skin that burns very easily.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我皮肤白,很容易晒伤。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: a girl with beautiful dark skin
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有着漂亮深色皮肤的女孩

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the colour typical of people from Greece, Italy etc

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His skin was slightly tanned.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的皮肤晒得略呈棕色。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her skin was smooth and pale.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的皮肤光滑白晳。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: smooth and without any red spots
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Vitamin E helps keep your skin healthy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 维生素E让你的皮肤保持健康。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with many spots or marks
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I had terrible skin when I was a teenager.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在十几岁的时候皮肤很不好。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: perfect, with no spots or marks
becoming red or sore easily
making you want to scratch
not smooth or soft
thick and dry
covered in lines because of age
hard and dry, like the skin on animals such as lizards

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Strong sunlight can damage your skin.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 强烈的阳光会灼伤皮肤。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make a hole in it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Luckily the skin wasn't broken.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 所幸皮肤没有破损。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It's important to use suntan lotion to protect your skin.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要使用防晒霜保护皮肤。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make it red or sore
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some types of make-up can irritate your skin.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些化妆品会刺激皮肤。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: to stop it feeling painful or uncomfortable
it looks healthy
Collocate.EXAMPLE: beauty products that will make your skin glow
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 能让皮肤亮起来的美容产品

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the top layer comes off after you have had a sun tan
it hangs down in loose folds, because you are old

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is still discrimination on the basis of skin colour.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 肤色歧视依然存在。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: how light or dark someone’s skin is
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Do the colours of your clothes enhance your skin tone?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 衣服的颜色能够衬托你的肤色吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She suffers from a nasty skin condition.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她患有严重的皮肤病。

Sense.DEF: to remove the skin from an animal, fruit, or vegetable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add the tomatoes, skinned and sliced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把去了皮并切成片的番茄加进去。

Sense.DEF: to hurt yourself by rubbing off some skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fell and skinned her knee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她摔了一跤﹐擦伤了膝盖。

Sense.DEF: to punish someone very severely – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 严厉惩罚某人﹐活剥某人的皮〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad will skin you alive when he sees this place!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸看到这地方非剥你皮不可！

Sense.DEF: to completely defeat someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The football team really skinned Watertown last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支足球队去年把水城队打得落花流水。

Sense.LEXUNIT: there’s more than one way to skin a cat
Sense.DEF: used to say that there are several ways of achieving something

to make a cigarette with
marijuana
in it
things that you do in order to improve the condition of your skin, especially the skin on your face
Sense.TRAN: 皮肤护理〔尤指脸部皮肤护理〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: expensive skincare products
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昂贵的护肤产品

Sense.DEF: the sport of swimming under water with light breathing equipment but without a protective suit
Sense.TRAN: 浮潜〔仅带轻便呼吸装备而不穿潜水衣的潜水〕

Sense.DEF: someone who hates spending money or giving it away – used to show disapproval
to drink a lot of alcohol and become drunk
a medical operation in which healthy skin is removed from one part of your body and used on another part to replace burned or damaged skin
a young white person who has hair that is cut very short, especially one who behaves violently towards people of other races
Sense.TRAN: 光头仔〔尤指对其他种族的人采取暴力行为的白人青年〕

Sense.DEF: very thin, especially in a way that is unattractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some supermodels are far too skinny.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些超级模特也太瘦骨嶙峋了。

Sense.DEF: skinny trousers fit tightly all the way down the legs
Sense.EXAMPLE: skinny jeans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧身牛仔裤

Sense.DEF:
made with
skimmed milk milk with all the fat and cream removed from it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a skinny latte
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脱脂拿铁咖啡

Sense.DEF: swimming with no clothes on
Sense.EXAMPLE: As soon as it got dark, we all went skinny-dipping .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天一黑﹐我们全都去裸泳了。

Sense.DEF: having no money, especially for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m skint at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在身无分文。

Sense.DEF: skin-tight clothes fit tightly against your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: skin-tight jeans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧身牛仔裤

Sense.DEF: to not do something that you usually do or that you should do
Sense.TRAN: 不做〔本来常做或应做的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She skipped lunch in order to go shopping.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了去购物﹐她没有吃午饭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Williams skipped the game to be with his wife in the hospital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉斯为了在医院里陪他妻子而放弃了这场比赛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He skipped chemistry class three times last month.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上个月他逃了三次化学课。

Sense.DEF: to not read, mention, or deal with something that would normally come or happen next
Sense.EXAMPLE: I decided to skip the first chapter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定跳过第一章。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let’s skip to the last item on the agenda.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们跳到议程的最后一项吧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I suggest we skip over the details and get to the point.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我建议我们略过细节﹐就谈要点。

Sense.DEF: to go from one subject to another in no fixed order

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to have a conversation with her because she skips from one topic to another.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和她谈话很困难﹐因为她总是随意变换话题。

Sense.DEF: to move forward with quick steps and jumps

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He turned and skipped away, singing happily to himself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他转身蹦蹦跳跳地跑了﹐嘴里高兴地哼着歌。

Sense.DEF: to jump over a rope as you swing it over your head and under your feet, as a game or for exercise
to leave a place suddenly and secretly, especially to avoid being punished or paying debts
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为了逃避惩罚或债务〕逃出城/出国
Sense.EXAMPLE: Then they found that Zaffuto had already skipped town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后来他们发现扎富托已经逃出城了。

Sense.DEF: used to say angrily and rudely that you do not want to talk about something
Sense.TRAN: 〔生气地说〕别提这件事了！不说这个了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Sorry, what were you saying?’ ‘Oh, skip it!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “对不起﹐你说什么？”“噢﹐不说这事了！”

Sense.DEF: to throw smooth, flat stones into a lake, river etc in a way that makes them jump across the surface
if a ball or something similar skips off a surface, it quickly moves away from that surface after hitting it – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 〔球等碰击某物后〕跳离﹐飞离〔尤用于新闻报道〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ball skipped off Bonds’ glove and bounced toward the fence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 球从邦德的手套上反弹出去﹐蹦向围栏。

Sense.DEF: to start a new school year in a class that is one year ahead of the class you would normally enter
to leave suddenly and secretly, especially in order to avoid being punished or paying money
Sense.TRAN: 突然溜走〔尤指为了逃避惩罚或债务〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He skipped off without paying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没付钱就溜了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tenants who skip out on utility bills are the focus of a new law.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欠着公用事业费逃跑的租客成了一部新法律的焦点。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Joel skipped out on his wife when she was 8 months pregnant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔尔在妻子怀孕八个月时撇下她走了。

Sense.DEF: a skipping movement
a large container for bricks, wood, and similar heavy waste

thick trousers with long thin pieces of cloth that fasten over your shoulders, worn while
skiing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of ski pants
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条滑雪裤

Sense.DEF: tight trousers with a band of cloth that goes under your foot, worn by women
an aircraft that has long thin narrow parts on the bottom instead of wheels, for landing on snow
Sense.TRAN: 〔装有滑橇﹑可在雪地上停降的〕雪上飞机

Sense.DEF:
one of two pointed short poles that you hold to help you balance and push off the snow when
skiing
the person in charge of a ship
the leader of a sports team
to be in charge of a ship, sports team etc – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 当 〔船〕的船长﹔当〔运动队等〕的队长〔尤用于新闻报道〕

Sense.DEF: a long piece of rope with handles that children use for jumping over
a fight between small groups of soldiers, ships etc, especially one that happens away from the main part of a battle – used in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 小规模战斗﹐小冲突〔用于新闻报道〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The young soldier was killed in a skirmish with government troops.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名年轻士兵在和政府军的一次小冲突中被打死了。

Sense.DEF: a short argument, especially between political or sports opponents
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指政治或体育运动对手间的〕小争论﹐小冲突﹐口角

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bates was sent off after a skirmish with the referee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝茨和裁判发生冲突后被罚下场。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a budget skirmish between the President and Congress
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统和国会在预算问题上的冲突

RunOn.EXAMPLE: They skirmished briefly with soldiers from Fort Benton.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们和来自本顿堡的士兵发生了短暂的冲突。

Sense.DEF: a piece of outer clothing worn by women and girls, which hangs down from the waist like the bottom part of a dress
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wore a white blouse and a plain black skirt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿着白衬衣和纯黑的裙子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a green velvet skirt
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 绿色的丝绒裙

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a short skirt and high heels
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 短裙和高跟鞋

Sense.DEF: the part of a dress or coat that hangs down from the waist

Sense.LEXUNIT: the skirts of a forest/hill/village etc
Sense.DEF: the outside edge of a forest etc
Sense.TRAN: 森林/小山/村子等的外围

Sense.DEF: an offensive expression meaning an attractive woman
Sense.TRAN: 骚娘儿们〔对漂亮女子的冒犯说法〕

Sense.DEF: to go around the outside edge of a place or area
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old footpath skirts around the village.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古老的小径围绕着村庄。

Sense.DEF: to avoid talking about an important subject, especially because it is difficult or embarrassing – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 绕过﹐避开〔重要话题﹔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a disappointing speech that skirted around all the main issues
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回避所有主要问题的令人失望的演说

Sense.DEF: trying to have sexual relationships with many different women – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 花心的﹐拈花惹草的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She finally left her skirt-chasing husband.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她终于离开了她那个花心的丈夫。

Sense.DEF: a long narrow piece of wood that is fastened along the bottom of the walls in a room
Sense.TRAN: 〔墙壁与地板相接处的〕壁脚板﹐踢脚板

Sense.DEF:
a track that has been marked on a slope so that people can
ski
on it

a snow-covered part of a mountain which has been prepared for people to
ski
down
a short humorous performance or piece of writing
to move very quickly and lightly, like a small animal

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Something skittered across the alley.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个东西轻快地跑过小巷。

Sense.DEF: an animal, especially a horse, that is skittish gets excited or frightened very easily
Sense.TRAN: 〔动物﹐尤指马〕易激动的﹐易受惊的

Sense.DEF: a person who is skittish is not very serious, and their feelings, behaviour, and opinions keep changing

if people who buy
share s
are skittish, they are nervous and worried about them dropping in value, and might sell the shares that they own because of this
Sense.TRAN: 〔购买股票者〕紧张不安的﹐担心股价下跌的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some skittish Wall Street investors are staying away from the market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些患得患失的华尔街投资者不敢入市。

Sense.DEF: a British game in which a player tries to knock down objects shaped like bottles by rolling a ball at them
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国的〕撞柱戏﹐九柱戏〔沿球道以球击倒数根瓶状木柱的游戏〕

Sense.DEF: one of the objects you roll the ball at in the game of skittles
to avoid work or school by staying away or leaving without permission
Sense.TRAN: 逃避工作﹐旷工﹔逃学﹐旷课

Sense.DEF: a servant who does only the dirty unpleasant jobs in a house
Sense.EXAMPLE: You iron your shirt - I’m not your skivvy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你自己熨衬衣吧——我又不是你的佣人。

Sense.DEF: a man’s underwear
to do all the dirty unpleasant jobs in a house, as if you were a servant
secretly dishonest or illegal activity – also used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 弄虚作假﹐诡计﹐花招﹔非法活动〔亦作幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: to hide or move about secretly, trying not to be noticed, especially when you are intending to do something bad
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为了不良企图而〕躲藏﹐潜伏﹔鬼鬼祟祟地走动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was still skulking around outside when they left the building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们离开大楼时他还在外面鬼鬼祟祟的。

Sense.DEF: the bones of a person’s or animal’s head

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb can’t get it into their (thick) skull
Sense.DEF: someone is unable to understand something very simple
Sense.TRAN: 某人的笨脑袋无法明白
Sense.EXAMPLE: He can’t seem to get it into his skull that I’m just not interested in him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这个笨蛋好像无法明白我根本对他不感兴趣。

Sense.DEF:
a picture of a human skull with two bones crossed below it, used in past times on the flags of
pirate
ships
Sense.TRAN: 骷髅图〔旧时海盗旗图案〕

Sense.DEF: a picture of a human skull with two bones crossed below it, used on containers to show that what is inside is poison or very dangerous
Sense.TRAN: 骷髅图标志〔用于容器上﹐表示有毒或危险〕

Sense.DEF: a small round close-fitting hat for the top of the head, worn sometimes by Christian priests or Jewish men
Sense.TRAN: 〔牧师或犹太男子有时戴的〕无檐便帽

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
skulduggery
