a small black and white North American animal that produces a strong unpleasant smell if it is attacked or afraid
Sense.TRAN: 臭鼬〔一种北美洲产的动物〕

Sense.DEF:
a very strong type of
marijuana
a place where a large company gives a small group of workers the job of trying to develop new products within a shorter period of time than usual
Sense.TRAN: 研发重地〔大公司给一小批员工在短时间内开发新产品的地方〕

Sense.DEF: the space above the earth where clouds and the sun and stars appear
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sky grew dark, and a cold rain began to fall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天色转暗﹐开始下起冰冷的雨来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A shooting star sped across the sky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一颗流星划过天空。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There wasn’t a cloud in the sky.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 天空晴朗无云。

Sense.DEF: a word meaning ‘sky’, used especially when describing the weather or what the sky looks like in a place
Sense.TRAN: 天空〔尤用于描述天气或某处的天空情况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a land of blue skies and warm sunshine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天空碧蓝﹑阳光和煦的一片土地
Sense.EXAMPLE: The skies were overcast, and it was chilly and damp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天空阴暗﹐天气寒冷而潮湿。

Sense.DEF: used to say that there is no limit to what someone can achieve, spend, win etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔花费〕没有上限﹔〔成就﹑成绩等〕不可限量
Sense.EXAMPLE: Francis believes the sky’s the limit for the young goalkeeper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗朗西斯认为﹐这名年轻的守门员前途不可限量。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The sky was blue and the sun was shining.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 蔚蓝的天空,阳光普照。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Rain was starting to fall from the grey sky.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 灰暗的天空下起雨来。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Fireworks burst up into the dark sky.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟花蹿升到漆黑的天空中。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with clouds
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Cloudy skies were forecast.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 预报是阴天。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: without clouds
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The sun rose higher in the cloudless sky.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳升得更高了,天空中没有一丝云彩。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: bright blue
with a lot of stars
becoming darker
a large area of sky

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The sky darkened and thunder rolled in from the west.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 天色变暗,雷声从西面滚滚而来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: clouds appear
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The sky was beginning to cloud over.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 天空中开始云层密布。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the clouds disappear

Sense.DEF: bright blue, like the colour of the sky when there are no clouds
someone whose job is to carry passengers’ bags at an airport

the sport of jumping from a plane and falling through the sky before opening a
parachute
Sense.TRAN: 〔延缓张伞的〕跳伞运动﹐特技跳伞

Sense.DEF: extremely high
Sense.EXAMPLE: sky-high prices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天价
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her confidence is sky-high.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她信心十足。

Sense.DEF: to destroy something completely with an explosion
a small bird that sings while flying high in the sky
a window in the roof of a building
the shape made by hills or buildings against the sky
Sense.TRAN: 〔山或建筑物在天空映衬下的〕轮廓（线）﹐天际线
Sense.EXAMPLE: the famous New York skyline
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 著名的纽约天际线

Sense.DEF:
a specially trained person who carries a gun and whose job is to travel on a passenger plane and protect it from attacks by
terrorist s
Sense.TRAN: 空中警察〔受过特殊训练﹐在客机上保护乘客不受恐怖分子袭击的携枪警察〕

Sense.DEF: software that can be used to make telephone calls over the Internet

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我回头在网上用Skype和你聊。

Sense.DEF: if a price or an amount skyrockets, it greatly increases very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trade deficit has skyrocketed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贸易逆差已经急剧增长。
Sense.EXAMPLE: skyrocketing inflation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飙升的通货膨胀率

Sense.DEF: a very tall modern city building
up into the sky or towards the sky
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bird soared skywards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸟儿直冲云霄。

Sense.DEF: a thick flat piece of a hard material such as stone
Sense.EXAMPLE: a concrete slab
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水泥板
Sense.EXAMPLE: paving slabs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铺路石板

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They used a slab of concrete as a lid.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们用一块水泥板当盖子。

Sense.DEF: a large flat piece of cake etc
Sense.TRAN: 一大块蛋糕/巧克力/肉等

Sense.DEF:
lying dead in a hospital or
mortuary
hanging loosely, or not pulled tight
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep the rope slack until I tell you to pull it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让绳子松着﹐直到我叫你拉紧。

Sense.DEF: with less business activity than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: Business remained slack throughout the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一整天生意都很冷清。

Sense.DEF: not taking enough care or making enough effort to do things correctly – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 懒散的﹐懈怠的﹐马虎的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Slack defending by Real Madrid allowed Manchester United to score.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皇家马德里队松懈的防守使曼联队得以进球得分。

Subsense.DEF:
to make a system or organization as
efficient
as possible by making sure that money, space, or people are fully used
Subsense.TRAN: 〔通过充分利用金钱﹑空间﹑人员等〕使效率提高
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Without another contract to help pick up the slack, employees may face job losses.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果不能再承接一份合同把闲散人员都利用起来的话﹐员工就可能面临失业。

Subsense.DEF: to do something that needs to be done because someone else is no longer doing it
to make a rope tighter

Sense.DEF: part of a rope that is not stretched tight
money, space, people, or time that an organization or person has available, but is not using fully
Sense.TRAN: 〔资金﹑地方﹑人员﹑时间等的〕富余部分﹐闲置部分
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is still some slack in the budget.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预算尚有富余。

Sense.DEF: to allow someone to do something without criticizing them or making it more difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hey, cut me some slack, man, I’m only a few bucks short.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘿﹐饶了我吧﹐老兄﹐我就差了几块钱嘛。

Sense.DEF: trousers
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of slacks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条裤子
Sense.EXAMPLE: dress slacks for more formal occasions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正装裤

Sense.DEF: very small pieces of coal
to make less effort than usual, or to be lazy in your work
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was accused of slacking and taking too many holidays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被指责工作不努力﹐休假太多。

Sense.DEF: to gradually become slower, weaker, less active etc, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heavy rain showed no signs of slackening off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大雨没有减弱的迹象。

GramExa.GLOSS: go or walk more slowly
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Guy slackened his pace as he approached the gate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 盖伊快到大门时放慢了脚步。

Sense.DEF: to make something looser, or to become looser
Sense.EXAMPLE: He did not let her go, but his grip on her slackened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不让她走﹐但抓着她的手却放松了。

Sense.DEF: someone who is lazy and does not do all the work they should – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 懒惰的人﹐偷懒者〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: having your mouth slightly open, especially because you are surprised or stupid
Sense.TRAN: 微张着嘴的〔尤因吃惊或愚蠢〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They looked at him, slack-jawed with disbelief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们张着嘴﹐难以置信地看着他。

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for a woman who has sex with a lot of different people. Do not use this word.
a waste material similar to glass, which remains after metal has been obtained from rock
to criticize someone in an unpleasant way, especially when this is not fair
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s always slagging her off behind her back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他老是在背后说她的坏话。

Sense.DEF: a pile of waste material at a mine or factory

the past participle of
slay
to drink so that you are not thirsty any more
to satisfy a desire etc

a race for people on
ski s
or in
canoe s
down a curving course marked by flags
Sense.TRAN: 障碍滑雪赛﹐回转赛﹔皮划艇激流回旋赛

Sense.DEF: if a door, gate etc slams, or if someone slams it, it shuts with a loud noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: We heard a car door slam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们听到有车门砰的一声关上了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He slammed the door shut .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把门砰地关上。

Sense.DEF: to put something on or against a surface with a fast violent movement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Henry slammed the phone down angrily.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利气呼呼地摔下电话。

Sense.DEF: to hit or attack someone or something with a lot of force

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All 155 passengers died instantly when the plane slammed into the mountain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机一头撞到山上﹐155 名乘客顷刻间全部丧生。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone or something strongly – used especially in newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 猛烈抨击〔尤用于报纸上〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Local media slammed plans to build a prison in the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地媒体猛烈抨击要在该地区建一座监狱的计划。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The council was slammed for its unfair selection procedure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会因其不公正的选拔程序而受到猛烈抨击。

Sense.DEF:
to make a car stop very suddenly by pressing the
brake s
very hard

Sense.LEXUNIT: slam the door in sb’s face

Subsense.DEF: to close a door hard when someone is trying to come in
Subsense.TRAN: 砰的一声把某人关在门外﹐让某人吃闭门羹

Subsense.DEF: to rudely refuse to meet someone or talk to them
Subsense.TRAN: 〔粗鲁地〕拒绝见某人﹐拒绝与某人谈话

Sense.DEF: the noise or action of a door, window etc slamming
Sense.TRAN: 砰的一声﹔猛关[摔﹐击﹐撞等]

Sense.DEF:
when a
basketball
player jumps high above the net and throws the ball down through it
a very impressive act
Sense.TRAN: 令人赞叹的行为﹐令人瞩目之举
Sense.EXAMPLE: The biggest legal slam dunk came when a judge sentenced four men to 505 years in prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律界出现了一件最为轰动的事﹐有位法官判处四名男子 505 年监禁。

Sense.DEF:
to put a ball through the net in
basketball
, by jumping very high and throwing the ball down through the net
prison

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had to spend his twentieth birthday in the slammer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只能在牢里过他的20 岁生日了。

Sense.DEF: a false spoken statement about someone, intended to damage the good opinion that people have of that person
the crime of making false spoken statements about someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is being sued for slander .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被控犯有口头诽谤罪。

Sense.DEF: to say false things about someone in order to damage other people’s good opinion of them
a slanderous statement about someone is not true, and is intended to damage other people’s good opinion of them
Sense.TRAN: 诽谤的﹐诋毁的﹐造谣中伤的
Sense.EXAMPLE: slanderous remarks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诽谤性言论

Sense.DEF: very informal, sometimes offensive language that is used especially by people who belong to a particular group, such as young people or criminals
Sense.EXAMPLE: schoolboy slang
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生俚语

Sense.DEF: an angry argument in which people insult each other
to slope or make something slope in a particular direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sun’s rays slanted through the trees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光透过树木斜照下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: slanting eyes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斜眼

Sense.DEF: to provide information in a way that unfairly supports one opinion, gives an advantage to one group etc
Sense.TRAN: 有偏向性地陈述﹐带偏向性地报道
Sense.EXAMPLE: The researchers were accused of slanting their findings in favour of their own beliefs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究人员被指责使调查结果向自己的观点倾斜。

Sense.DEF: a way of writing about or thinking about a subject that is based on a particular opinion or set of ideas
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某一意见或观点的〕倾向性﹐倾斜
Sense.EXAMPLE: The article had an anti-union slant .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇文章有反工会倾向。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Each article has a slightly different slant on the situation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每篇文章对局势的分析都略有不同的倾向。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Recent events have put a new slant on the president’s earlier comments.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的事件使人们对总统早些时候说的话有了新的理解。

Sense.DEF: a sloping position or angle

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house seems to be built on a steep slant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子好像建在一个陡坡上。

Sense.DEF: providing facts or information in a way that unfairly supports only one side of an argument or one opinion – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 有偏见的﹐带倾向性的〔含贬义〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The report was heavily slanted towards the city council’s version of events.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 报道严重倾向于市政委员会对事件的说法。

Sense.DEF: sloping
Sense.EXAMPLE: her slightly slanted eyes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有点斜的眼睛

Sense.DEF: to hit someone with the flat part of your hand
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah slapped Aaron across the face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉在阿龙的脸上掴了一巴掌。

Sense.DEF: to put something down on a surface with force, especially when you are angry
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指生气时〕啪的一声放下﹐重重地放下
Sense.EXAMPLE: Giles slapped his cards down on the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贾尔斯把手里的牌啪的一声摔在桌上。

Sense.DEF: to hit someone on the back in a friendly way, often as a way of praising them
Sense.TRAN: 拍拍某人的背〔通常表示称赞〕

Sense.DEF: to hit a surface with a lot of force, making a loud sharp sound

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Small waves slapped against the side of the boat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 细浪拍击着船舷。

Sense.DEF: to rudely tell someone that their suggestions, questions, ideas etc are stupid
to put or spread something quickly or carelessly onto a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: She ran upstairs and slapped on some make-up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她跑上楼﹐匆匆上了点妆。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We could slap some paint on it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以在上面刷点漆。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly announce a new charge, tax etc or say that something is not allowed – used especially when you think this is unfair
Sense.TRAN: 强制实行〔尤用于认为不公平时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many tour operators slap on supplements for single people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多旅游公司向独行游客强行收取额外费用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In 1977, the president slapped a ban on the commercial reprocessing of nuclear fuel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1977年﹐总统突然颁布禁令﹐禁止核燃料的商用再处理。

Sense.DEF: a quick hit with the flat part of your hand
Sense.EXAMPLE: Julia gave Roy a slap on the cheek.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉娅扇了罗伊一个耳光。

Sense.DEF: an action that seems to be deliberately intended to offend or upset someone, especially someone who has tried very hard to do something
a punishment that you think is not severe enough
an action of hitting someone on the back in a friendly way, especially as a way of praising them
if you run, drive etc slap bang into something, you hit it with a lot of force

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I ran slap bang into a lamp-post.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我猛地撞在灯柱上。

Sense.DEF: exactly in a particular place or at a particular time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anne’s house is slap bang next to the station.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮的家就在车站隔壁。

Sense.DEF: careless and done too quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very slapdash piece of work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干得非常马虎的工作

Sense.DEF: careless, silly, and likely to make mistakes
Sense.TRAN: 大大咧咧的﹐粗心大意的

Sense.DEF:
an impolite word for someone who is
bald has little or no hair on their head
an offensive word for a woman who has sex with lots of people
humorous acting in which the performers fall over, throw things at each other etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slapstick comedy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打闹喜剧

Sense.DEF: a very large enjoyable meal
to cut or try to cut something violently with a knife, sword etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone had slashed the tires.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人把轮胎割破了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The leopard’s claws slashed through soft flesh.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 豹的爪子扎入柔软的肉里。

Sense.DEF: to greatly reduce an amount, price etc – used especially in newspapers and advertising
Sense.TRAN: 大幅度削减 〔数量﹑价格等﹔尤用于报纸和广告〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The workforce has been slashed by 50%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳动力已削减了 50%。

Sense.DEF:
to cut the
vein s
in your wrists with the intention of killing yourself
a quick movement that you make with a knife, sword etc in order to cut someone or something
a line (/) used in writing to separate words, numbers, or letters
Sense.TRAN: 斜线符号〔用以分隔单词﹑数字或字母〕

Sense.DEF: a long narrow cut in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cut several slashes across the top of the loaf before baking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面包烘烤前在上面切几道口子。

Sense.DEF:
to
urinate
a very violent film
a thin flat piece of wood, plastic etc, used especially in furniture
a dark grey rock that can easily be split into flat thin pieces
a small piece of slate or similar material that is used for covering roofs
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were several slates missing from the roof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房顶有几块石板瓦掉了。

Sense.DEF: a dark blue or grey colour
a list of people that voters can choose in an election, or who are being considered for an important job
a small black board or a flat piece of slate in a wooden frame used for writing on in the past
to arrange to pay for something later, especially food or drink
Sense.TRAN: 赊账﹐挂账〔尤指对食物和饮料〕

Sense.DEF: to criticize a book, film etc severely, especially in a newspaper
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在报纸上〕严厉批评〔书﹑电影等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doherty’s most recent novel has been slated by the critics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多尔蒂最新出版的小说受到了评论家的严厉批评。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be slated to do sth/be slated for sth
Sense.DEF: if something is slated to happen, it is planned to happen in the future, especially at a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is slated to appear at the Cambridge Jazz Festival next year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他将出席明年的剑桥爵士音乐节。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every house on this block is slated for demolition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个街区的每幢房子都要拆除。

Sense.DEF: to cover something with a thick layer of a soft substance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a slice of homemade bread, slathered with jam
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片涂了厚厚果酱的自制面包

Sense.DEF: a dirty untidy woman – used to show disapproval
to kill an animal, especially for its meat
to kill a lot of people in a cruel or violent way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hundreds of innocent civilians had been slaughtered by government troops.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数百名无辜平民遭政府军屠杀。

Sense.DEF: to defeat an opponent in a sport or game by a large number of points
Sense.EXAMPLE: We got slaughtered, 110-54.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们以54比 110惨败。

Sense.DEF: when people kill animals, especially for their meat
Sense.EXAMPLE: the export of live animals for slaughter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屠宰用活畜的出口

Sense.DEF: when large numbers of people are killed in a cruel or violent way
Sense.EXAMPLE: the slaughter of defenceless women and children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对毫无自卫能力的妇孺的杀戮

Sense.DEF: very drunk
Sense.EXAMPLE: We all got completely slaughtered last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚我们全都喝得酩酊大醉。

Sense.DEF: a building where animals such as cows or pigs are killed for their meat
someone who belongs to any of the races of Eastern and Central Europe who speak Slavic languages such as Russian, Bulgarian, Polish etc
Sense.TRAN: 斯拉夫人〔讲俄语﹑保加利亚语﹑波兰语等斯拉夫语的东欧人和中欧人〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is owned by another person and works for them for no money

GramExa.GLOSS: the buying and selling of slaves, especially Africans who were taken to America
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 奴隶买卖〔尤指过去对被抓到美洲的非洲人进行的买卖〕

Sense.DEF: to be so strongly influenced by something that you cannot make your own decisions – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 成为某事物的奴隶﹐完全受某物的控制〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slave to fashion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时尚的奴隶

Sense.DEF: to work very hard with little time to rest

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve been slaving away at this report.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直在拼命写这份报告。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s been slaving over his history essay.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直在拼命写历史课论文。

GramExa.GLOSS: cook – used humorously
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 围着灶台转〔指下厨做饭﹐幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: someone who makes people work very hard – used in a disapproving or humorous way
Sense.TRAN: 逼迫他人拼命干活的人﹐苛刻的监工〔含贬义或幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: work done by slaves, or the people who do this work
Sense.TRAN: 奴隶做的苦工﹔做苦工的奴隶

Sense.DEF: work for which you are paid an unfairly small amount of money

to let
saliva liquid produced inside your mouth
come out of your mouth, especially because you are hungry
someone who sells slaves
a ship for moving slaves from one place to another
the system of having slaves
Sense.EXAMPLE: attempts to abolish slavery officially end it
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 废除奴隶制的努力

Sense.DEF: the state of being a slave

GramExa.GLOSS: sell someone as a slave

Sense.DEF: relating to the Slavs or their languages
Sense.TRAN: 斯拉夫人的﹔斯拉夫语的

Sense.DEF: obeying, supporting, or copying someone completely – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 奴隶般的﹔盲从的﹔一味照搬的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slavish adherence to the rules
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对规章的盲目遵从

RunOn.EXAMPLE: not a rule to be slavishly followed in every instance
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 不是在任何情况下都要盲从的一条规章

Sense.TRAN: 斯拉夫人的﹔斯拉夫语的

Sense.DEF: to kill someone – used especially in newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 杀害﹐残杀﹐谋杀〔尤用于报纸上〕

Sense.DEF: to amuse someone a lot
an act of killing someone – used especially in newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 杀害﹐残杀﹐谋杀〔尤用于报纸上〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: gang-related slayings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和犯罪团伙有关的谋杀

Sense.DEF: immoral behaviour, especially involving sex or lies
Sense.TRAN: 不道德行为﹔卑劣行为〔尤涉及性或欺诈〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people are tired of all the sleaze on TV.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人都厌倦了电视上这些乌烟瘴气的东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: sleaze and corruption in politics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治上的肮脏和腐败

Sense.DEF: someone who behaves in an immoral or dishonest way
a sleazy place is dirty, cheap, or in bad condition
Sense.TRAN: 〔地方〕肮脏低级的﹐乌烟瘴气的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sleazy bar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乌烟瘴气的酒吧

Sense.DEF: relating to sex or dishonest behaviour – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 淫秽的﹐卑劣的﹐奸诈的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sleazy lawyer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个卑劣的律师

Sense.DEF:
a
celebrity
– used especially in magazines
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve got gossip on all the top slebs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们掌握了所有顶级名流的八卦新闻。

Sense.DEF: a small vehicle used for sliding over snow, often used by children or in some sports
to travel on a sledge
a large heavy hammer
a vehicle or other object that is sleek has a smooth attractive shape
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车等〕线条流畅的﹐造型优美的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sleek lines of the new Mercedes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这款新梅赛德斯汽车的优美外形

Sense.DEF: sleek hair or fur is straight, shiny, and healthy-looking
Sense.TRAN: 〔头发﹑皮毛〕油亮光滑的﹐有光泽的

Sense.DEF: someone who is sleek looks rich and is well dressed
to make hair or fur smooth and shiny by putting water or oil on it
Sense.TRAN: 〔在头发或皮毛上抹水或油〕使平滑光亮

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His hair was sleeked back with oil.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的头发用发油向后梳理得平滑光亮。

Sense.DEF: to rest your mind and body, usually at night when you are lying in bed with your eyes closed
Sense.EXAMPLE: I usually sleep on my back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一般仰卧着睡觉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you sleep well?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你睡得好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s lucky because at least he has somewhere to sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他算是幸运的﹐至少还有个睡觉的地方。

Sense.DEF: to sleep outdoors in uncomfortable conditions, especially because you have no money
to not make a decision about something important until the next day
Sense.TRAN: 〔把重要的事〕留待第二天决定

Sense.DEF: said especially to children before they go to bed to say that you hope they sleep well
Sense.TRAN: 睡个好觉〔尤用于对睡觉前的小孩子说〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good night, Jenny. Sleep tight!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚安﹐珍妮﹐睡个好觉！

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone no longer has to worry about something
Sense.TRAN: 某人可以睡个安稳〔表示不用再为某事担心〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unlike some other Internet sites, when you buy from us, you can sleep easy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们和其他的网站不一样﹐你从我们网站购买﹐可以完全放心。

Sense.DEF: to have enough beds for a particular number of people
Sense.TRAN: 可供两人/四人/六人等睡
Sense.EXAMPLE: The villa sleeps four.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这栋别墅可供四人住宿。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately avoid mentioning a subject, so that you do not cause any trouble or argument
Sense.TRAN: 别惹是生非﹔别自寻烦恼

Sense.DEF: if a village, house etc sleeps, it is very quiet during the night
Sense.TRAN: 〔入夜后的村庄﹑房子等〕寂静无声

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I haven’t been sleeping well lately.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最近睡得不好。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Eleanor slept badly that night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃莉诺那晚睡得很不好。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in a way that means you are not likely to wake
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Within seconds, Maggie was sleeping soundly.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 没一会儿,玛吉就睡熟了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Celia slept peacefully beside him.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 西莉娅在他身边安然入睡。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: sleep badly, waking up after short periods, especially because you are worried
not wake up until late in the morning

Exponent.DEF: to rest your mind and body with your eyes closed. Sleep is usually used when talking about how long, how deeply, or where someone sleeps. When saying that someone is not awake, you use be asleep .
Exponent.TRAN: 睡,睡觉〔sleep一般用于指某人睡得多久﹑多深或睡在哪里,说某人是睡着的要用be asleep〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Most people sleep for about eight hours.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数人睡八小时左右。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He slept downstairs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他睡在楼下。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Did you sleep well?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你睡得好吗？

Exponent.DEF: to be sleeping
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The baby’s asleep – don’t wake her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝睡着了——别叫醒她。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was fast asleep completely asleep by the time I got home.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 等我到家的时候他已经睡得很熟了。

Exponent.DEF: to sleep for longer than you intended so that you wake up late in the morning
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I overslept and was late for work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我睡过头,上班迟到了。

Exponent.DEF: to sleep for a short time during the day
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I think I’ll have a nap.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想小睡一会儿。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She had been awake all night and was looking forward to taking a nap.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一夜没睡,很想打个盹。

Exponent.DEF: to sleep for a short time, especially in a chair, not in a bed
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I think I’ll have a quick snooze.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想打个盹。

Exponent.DEF: to sleep lightly, for example in a chair, and be easily woken
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t really asleep – I was just dozing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有真的睡着——只是打了个瞌睡。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I must have dozed off (=started sleeping) halfway through the film.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我肯定是电影看到一半就瞌睡过去了。

Sense.DEF: to have sex with a lot of different people without having a serious relationship with any of them – used to show disapproval
to let yourself sleep later than usual in the morning
Sense.EXAMPLE: We usually sleep in on Sunday mornings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们星期天早上通常睡懒觉。

Sense.DEF: to sleep until you do not feel ill any more, especially after drinking too much alcohol
Sense.TRAN: 用睡眠消除〔不适﹐尤指在醉酒后〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He went to his room to sleep it off .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他到自己的房间去睡一觉来消除酒醉。

Sense.DEF: to sleep at someone’s house for a night – used especially by children
Sense.TRAN: 在别人家里过夜﹐借宿〔尤为儿语〕

Sense.DEF: to sleep while something is happening and not be woken by it
Sense.TRAN: 睡着没有被某事物吵醒
Sense.EXAMPLE: How did you manage to sleep through that thunderstorm?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷雨那么大你怎么能睡得着？

Sense.DEF: to sleep continuously for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I slept right through till lunchtime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一觉睡到吃午饭的时候。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The baby slept peacefully through the night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝安然睡了一整夜。

Sense.DEF: if people sleep together, they have sex with each other
to have sex with someone, especially someone you are not married to
Sense.TRAN: 与某人〔尤指非配偶〕发生性关系
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everybody in the office knows he’s been sleeping with Kathy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室里人人都知道他和凯茜有一腿。

Sense.DEF: the natural state of resting your mind and body, usually at night
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t get much sleep last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我昨天晚上睡得不多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her eyes were red through lack of sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为缺少睡眠﹐她双眼通红。

GramExa.GLOSS: while you are sleeping
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ed often talks in his sleep.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃德睡觉时常常说梦话。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She died peacefully in her sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在睡梦中安然去世。

Sense.DEF: a period when you are sleeping
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a little sleep in the afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下午我小睡了一会儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was woken from a deep sleep by a ring at the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在熟睡中被门铃声吵醒了。

Subsense.DEF: to start sleeping
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I went to sleep at 9 o’clock and woke up at 6.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我9点钟睡﹐6点钟醒来。

Subsense.DEF: if a part of your body goes to sleep, you cannot feel it for a short time because it has not been getting enough blood

Sense.DEF: to worry about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a practice game - I wouldn’t lose any sleep over it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一场练习赛﹐我不会为它担心的。

Subsense.DEF: to give drugs to a sick animal so that it dies without too much pain – used to avoid saying the word ‘kill’
Subsense.TRAN: 把〔患病动物〕人道毁灭〔用于避免使用单词 kill〕

Subsense.DEF: to make someone unconscious before a medical operation by giving them drugs
Subsense.TRAN: 〔手术前用麻醉药〕使某人失去知觉

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb can do sth in their sleep
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is able to do something very easily, especially because they have done it many times before
Sense.TRAN: 某人闭上眼睛都能做某事〔尤因已做过多次〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She knew the music so well she could play it in her sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对这首乐曲太熟悉了﹐闭上眼睛也能奏出来。

Subsense.DEF: to make someone go to sleep
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The combination of warmth and music sent him to sleep.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暖意加上音乐让他进入了梦乡。

Subsense.DEF: if something sends someone to sleep, it is extremely boring
Subsense.TRAN: 〔某事极其乏味〕使某人昏昏欲睡

Sense.DEF: a substance that forms in the corners of your eyes while you are sleeping
Sense.EXAMPLE: She rubbed the sleep from her eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她擦去眼屎。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: start sleeping
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He turned over and went to sleep.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他翻身睡了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: start sleeping, especially without meaning to
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She’d drifted off to sleep on the sofa.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不知不觉在沙发上睡着了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: succeed in starting to sleep
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Last night I couldn’t get to sleep.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚我睡不着。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: sleep again after waking up
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He shut his eyes and went back to sleep.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他闭上眼睛又睡着了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make someone start sleeping
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She hoped the music would send her to sleep.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她希望这音乐能使她睡着。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: sleep for a while
Collocate.EXAMPLE: You’d better get some sleep.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好睡一会儿。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: sleep for a short while
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Are you going to have a sleep after lunch today?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天吃过午饭你打算睡一会儿吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: sleep after not having enough sleep
make someone sleep by singing etc
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 唱歌/轻摇/轻哼哄某人入睡

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He needed a decent meal and a long sleep.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他需要吃顿好饭,睡个长觉。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I always have a little sleep in the afternoon.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我下午总是要小睡一会儿。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a sleep from which you cannot easily be woken
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The noise woke him from a deep sleep.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那噪音把他从深睡中吵醒。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a sleep from which you can easily be woken
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I fell into a light sleep.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我浅浅地睡去。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: because you were very tired
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 因为极度疲劳而睡的觉

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in which you keep moving or waking
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 时断时续的/不安稳的睡眠

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when you sleep well
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The next day, I woke up refreshed after a good night’s sleep.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天,睡了一夜好觉醒来时,我感到神清气爽。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 五小时/八小时等的睡眠
Collocate.EXAMPLE: After eight hours’ sleep, I woke up in pitch blackness.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一觉睡了八个小时,醒来时只见一片漆黑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: cry until you fall asleep

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘go sleep’. Say 而要说 go to sleep .

Sense.DEF: someone who sleeps in a particular way

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who wakes easily
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 睡得不熟的人﹐易醒的人

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who does not wake easily
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 睡得很熟的人﹐不易醒的人

Sense.DEF: someone who is asleep

a heavy piece of wood or
concrete
that supports a railway track

Subsense.DEF: a night train with carriages that have beds for passengers to sleep in

a
sleeping car
a bed on a train for a passenger to sleep in

Sense.DEF: a film, book etc which is successful, even though people did not expect it to be
a piece of clothing for a baby that covers its whole body including its feet

a
spy
who is sent to a particular place and who lives an ordinary life there until a later time, when they begin their spying activities
a large warm bag that you sleep in, especially when camping

the main character in a
fairy tale
called Sleeping Beauty, who is a princess who lives in a castle. An evil
fairy
makes the princess and everyone else in the castle fall asleep forever. A thick forest grows around the castle and hides it until, after a hundred years, a prince finds Sleeping Beauty and kisses her, and then she and everyone else in the castle wake up. Someone who seems to be sleeping peacefully is sometimes described as ‘Sleeping Beauty’
Sense.TRAN: 睡美人〔童话故事《睡美人》中的主人公﹔睡得安详的人有时被形容成“睡美人”〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just look at Sleeping Beauty there!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看那边的睡美人！

Sense.DEF: a railway carriage with beds for passengers to sleep in
someone who owns part of a business but is not actively involved in running it

a
pill
which helps you to sleep
a narrow raised part in a road which makes traffic go slowly
Sense.TRAN: 减速垄﹐减速带〔为防止车速过快而横设于路面的隆起物〕

Sense.DEF:
a serious
tropical
disease that is carried by the
tsetse fly a type of insect
. It causes extreme tiredness and fever, and makes you lose weight.
Sense.TRAN: 昏睡病〔由采采蝇传播的一种严重的热带疾病﹐会引起极度疲倦﹑发烧和消瘦〕

Sense.DEF: a night when you are unable to sleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: Adrian spent a sleepless night wondering what to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿德里安一夜未眠﹐在想该怎么办。

Sense.DEF: unable to sleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: She lay sleepless for hours, worrying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她忧心忡忡地躺了几个小时都无法入睡。

Sense.DEF: a party for children in which they stay the night at someone’s house
Sense.TRAN: 睡衣聚会〔在某个孩子家里过夜的儿童聚会〕

Sense.DEF: someone who walks while they are sleeping
tired and ready to sleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: The warmth from the fire made her feel sleepy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暖洋洋的炉火使她昏昏欲睡。

Sense.DEF: a sleepy town or area is very quiet, and not much happens there
someone, especially a child, who looks as if they want to go to sleep
Sense.TRAN: 瞌睡虫﹐贪睡的人〔尤指孩子〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s time for bed, sleepyhead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该上床了﹐瞌睡虫。

Sense.DEF: half-frozen rain that falls when it is very cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: scattered sleet and snow showers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 零星冻雨和阵雪

RunOn.EXAMPLE: It was sleeting so hard we could barely see for 30 yards.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨夹雪下得那么大﹐我们几乎看不到30码远。

Sense.DEF: the part of a piece of clothing that covers all or part of your arm
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dress with long sleeves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长袖连衣裙

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a short-sleeved shirt
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 短袖衬衫

Sense.DEF: to have a secret plan or idea that you are going to use later
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry. He still has a few tricks up his sleeve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐他还有几个妙招没使出来呢。

Sense.DEF: a stiff paper cover that a record is stored in
a sleeveless jacket, dress etc has no sleeves
a large open vehicle with no wheels that is used for travelling over snow and is pulled along by animals
the use of quick and skilful movements with your hands when doing a magic trick, so that people cannot understand how you did the trick
the use of skilful tricks and lies in order to deceive someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔为欺骗某人而耍的〕手腕﹐花招

Sense.DEF: thin in an attractive or graceful way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is slender and stylish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身材修长﹐穿着时髦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Laura’s tall, slender figure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳拉高挑的身材

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 修长的腿/纤长的手臂/纤细的手指等

Sense.DEF: small or very limited in amount or size
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company only has a slender hope of survival.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司维持下去的希望很渺茫。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Republicans won the election by a slender majority.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 共和党以微弱多数赢得选举。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to make the most of our rather slender resources.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须充分利用我们相当紧缺的资源。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Slender sounds rather literary. In everyday English, people usually say slim or thin .
F2NBox.TRAN: slender听上去比较有文学色彩。在日常英语中﹐ 人们一般说slim或thin
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I don’t know how she stays so slim.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道她是怎么把身材保持得如此苗条的。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
sleep
Sense.TRAN: sleep 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: someone who tries to find out information about a crime
to turn or slide in a different direction suddenly and violently, or to make a vehicle do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I lost control of the car and it slewed sideways into the ditch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的车子突然失去控制﹐向一侧滑去﹐翻进了沟里。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
slay
a large number of things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a whole slew of cheap motels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多廉价的汽车旅馆

Sense.DEF: a thin flat piece of food cut from a larger piece

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a slice of bread
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片面包

Sense.EXAMPLE: pizza slices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比萨块

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a thin slice of ham
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一薄片火腿

Sense.EXAMPLE: Cut the tomatoes into slices .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把番茄切成片。

Sense.DEF: a part or share of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everybody wants a slice of the profits.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这利润每个人都想分一杯羹。

Sense.DEF: a kitchen tool used for lifting and serving pieces of food
a way of hitting the ball in sports such as tennis or golf, that makes the ball go to one side with a spinning movement, rather than straight ahead
Sense.TRAN: 〔网球﹑高尔夫球等的〕削球﹐斜切球﹐侧旋球

Sense.DEF: a film, play, or book which shows life as it really is
Sense.TRAN: 反映现实生活的电影[戏剧﹐书]

Sense.DEF: to cut meat, bread, vegetables etc into thin flat pieces
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thinly slice the cucumbers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把黄瓜切成薄片。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Slice up the onions and add them to the meat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把洋葱切成片﹐然后加到肉里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: sliced ham
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 切片火腿

Sense.DEF: to cut something easily with one movement of a sharp knife or edge

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The blade’s so sharp it could slice through your finger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这刀片锋利得很﹐一下就能割破你的手指。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Slice the eggs in two and arrange them on a serving dish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这些蛋切成两半后在餐盘上排好。

Sense.DEF: to move quickly and easily through something such as water or air
Sense.TRAN: 轻松迅速地划过〔水面等〕﹔ 轻快地穿过〔空中等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boat was slicing through the sparkling waves.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小船轻快地划过波光粼粼的水面。

Sense.DEF: to hit a ball, for example in tennis or golf, so that it spins sideways instead of moving straight forward
Sense.TRAN: 〔网球﹑高尔夫球等的〕削〔球〕﹐斜切〔球〕﹐打〔侧旋球〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: With an open goal in front of him, Wiltord sliced his shot wide of the left post.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面对空门﹐维尔托德一脚侧旋球﹐球从离左门柱很远的地方飞了出去。

Sense.DEF: whatever way you choose to consider the situation
Sense.TRAN: 无论你怎样考虑这个问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s the truth, any way you slice it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管你怎么想﹐这是事实。

Sense.DEF: to remove part of something by cutting it with one movement of a sharp knife or edge
Sense.EXAMPLE: His knife had slipped and sliced off the top of his finger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的刀一滑﹐把他的指尖削掉了一块。

Sense.DEF: to reduce a cost or total by a particular amount quickly and easily
Sense.TRAN: 大量降低﹐大幅度削减〔成本或总额〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: By using volunteers, we were able to slice £10,000 off the cost of the project.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 通过使用志愿者﹐我们把这个项目的费用降低了一万英镑。

Sense.DEF: bread that is sold already cut into slices

Sense.LEXUNIT: the best/greatest thing since sliced bread
Sense.DEF: used humorously to say that something new is very helpful, useful etc
Sense.TRAN: 非常有用的新东西〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He reckons his new mobile phone is the best thing since sliced bread.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他认为他的新手机是最好的。

Sense.DEF: if something is slick, it is done in a skilful and attractive way and seems expensive, but it often contains no important or interesting ideas
Sense.TRAN: 徒有其表的﹐华而不实的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slick Hollywood production
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部场面恢宏但内容肤浅的好莱坞电影
Sense.EXAMPLE: slick advertising
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虚华的广告
Sense.EXAMPLE: The presentation was very slick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个展示会非常华而不实。

Sense.DEF: if someone is slick, they are good at persuading people, often in a way that does not seem honest
Sense.TRAN: 油嘴滑舌的﹐巧舌如簧的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slick used-car salesman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油嘴滑舌的二手车推销员

Sense.DEF: done smoothly and quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He got round the defender using some slick footwork.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用灵巧的步法突破了后卫的防守。

Sense.DEF: smooth and slippery

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cars were sliding off roads that were slick with rain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多汽车滑出因下雨而湿滑的道路。

Sense.DEF: very good or attractive
an area of oil on the surface of water or on a road
Sense.TRAN: 〔水面或路面的〕浮油﹐油层﹐油膜

Sense.DEF: a magazine printed on good quality paper with a shiny surface, usually with a lot of colour pictures
Sense.TRAN: 精美杂志 指用优质有光纸印刷并有大量彩色图片的杂志〕

Sense.DEF: a smooth car tyre used for racing
to make hair smooth and shiny by putting oil, water etc on it
Sense.TRAN: 〔抹上油﹑水等〕使〔头发〕光滑发亮
Sense.EXAMPLE: His hair had been combed back and slicked down with something to make it neat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的头发往后梳﹐而且还抹了什么东西﹐显得油亮齐整。

Sense.DEF: a coat made of smooth shiny material that keeps out the rain
to move smoothly over a surface while continuing to touch it, or to make something move in this way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Francesca slid across the ice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗朗西丝卡从冰面上滑过。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He opened the oven door and slid the pan of cookies in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打开烤箱门﹐把甜饼烤盘滑了进去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He slid open the door of the glass cabinet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他滑开玻璃柜的门。

Sense.DEF: to move somewhere quietly and smoothly, or to move something in this way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Daniel slid out of the room when no one was looking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼尔趁没人看见﹐偷偷溜出了房间。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She slid into the driver’s seat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她偷偷溜进驾驶座。

GramExa.PROPFORM: slide sth into/out of etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He slid the gun into his pocket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他悄悄地把枪滑进口袋。

Sense.DEF: if prices, amounts, rates etc slide, they become lower
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stocks slid a further 3% on the major markets today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天主板市场上的股票价格继续下滑了 3%。

Sense.DEF: to gradually become worse, or to begin to have a problem
Sense.TRAN: 逐渐败坏﹔开始出现问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students’ test scores started to slide in the mid-1990s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪90年代中期﹐学生考分开始下降。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Murphy gradually slid into a pattern of drug abuse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 墨菲逐渐染上了吸毒的恶习。

Subsense.DEF: to let a situation get gradually worse
Subsense.TRAN: 任某事恶化﹐放任不管某事
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Management has let safety standards slide at the factory.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理层对工厂的安全标准放任不管。

Subsense.DEF: to ignore a mistake, problem, remark etc, without becoming angry or trying to punish it
Subsense.TRAN: 〔对错误﹑问题﹑言论等〕不加改进﹐不加制止﹐不加理睬
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Well, I guess we can let it slide this time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好吧﹐我们这次就随它去算了。

Sense.DEF: a large structure with steps leading to the top of a long sloping surface which children can slide down
a decrease in prices, amounts etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔价格﹑数量等的〕下降﹐跌落﹐减少

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the current slide in house prices
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房价目前的下跌

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company’s shares were on the slide again yesterday, down 7p at 339p.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司股票昨天再次下跌﹐跌7便士﹐收盘报339便士。

Sense.DEF:
a small piece of film in a frame that you shine a light through to show a picture on a
screen
or wall
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slide show
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幻灯片放映

Sense.DEF: a situation in which something gradually gets worse, or someone develops a problem

GramExa.EXAMPLE: School administrators were unable to explain the slide in student performance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校管理人员无法解释学生成绩下降的原因。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a slide into economic chaos
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 陷入经济混乱的状态

Sense.DEF:
a small piece of thin glass used for holding something that you want to look at under a
microscope

a sliding part of a machine or musical instrument, such as the U-shaped tube of a
trombone
Sense.TRAN: 滑动部件〔如长号的U形伸缩管〕

Sense.DEF: a sliding movement across a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car went into a slide .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车打起滑来。

Sense.DEF: a sudden fall of earth, stones, snow etc down a slope
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rock slide
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 岩崩

Sense.DEF: a small metal or plastic object that holds your hair in place

a piece of equipment that shines a light through
slide s
so that pictures appear on a screen or wall
an old-fashioned instrument used for calculating numbers, that looks like a ruler and has a middle part that slides across
Sense.TRAN: 计算尺﹐滑尺〔一种旧式计算工具〕

Sense.DEF: a door that opens by sliding to one side
a system for calculating how much you pay for taxes, medical treatment etc, in which the amount that you pay changes according to different conditions
Sense.TRAN: 浮动费率制﹐浮动计算法 〔根据不同情况浮动计算税款﹑医疗费等的制度〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fees are calculated on a sliding scale.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 按浮动费率制计算费用。

Sense.DEF: small in degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slight improvement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 些许的改进
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slight increase
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 少许的增加
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slight change of plan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计划的略微变动
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slight pause
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稍稍的停顿
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slight problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小问题

Sense.DEF: no chance, doubt etc at all
Sense.TRAN: 没有一点机会/怀疑/差别等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t have the slightest idea who that man was.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我根本不知道那人是谁。

Sense.DEF: someone who is slight is thin and delicate
not at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Did he mind lending you the car?’ ‘Not in the slightest.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他介意把汽车借给你吗？”“一点都不。”

Sense.DEF: to offend someone by treating them rudely or without respect
Sense.EXAMPLE: Derek felt slighted when no one phoned him back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没人给德里克回电话﹐他觉得自己受了冷落。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She may take it as a slight on her ability as a mother.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她可能认为这是藐视她当母亲的能力。

Sense.DEF: a little
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slightly different color
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 略微不同的一种颜色
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slightly more powerful engine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一台功率稍大的引擎

GramExa.EXAMPLE: January’s sales were slightly better than average.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1月份的销售额稍高于平均数。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was someone I already knew slightly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这个人我已略有所知。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slightly tart flavor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 些微的酸味
Sense.EXAMPLE: He leaned forward ever so slightly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他微微向前俯身。

Sense.DEF: having a thin and delicate body
someone who is slim is attractively thin
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slim young woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身材苗条的年轻女子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slim waist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纤腰

Sense.DEF: very small in amount or number
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s only a slim chance that anyone survived the crash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次失事有人生还的机会极为渺茫。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Republicans held a slim majority in the Senate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 共和党在参议院中略占多数。

Sense.DEF: not wide or thick
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slim volume of poetry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 薄薄的一册诗歌集

Sense.DEF: to make yourself thinner by eating less, taking a lot of exercise etc
to reduce the size or number of something, or to become reduced in size or number

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company is trying to slim down its workforce.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司想裁减员工。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Cabinet has been slimmed down to 16 members.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 内阁已被精简到16名成员。

Sense.DEF: to make your body thinner, or to become thinner, especially in order to be healthier or more attractive

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How can I slim down my hips?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怎样才能让臀部变瘦点？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She slimmed down to a healthy 61 kilos.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她减到了健康体重——61公斤。

Sense.DEF: an unpleasant thick slippery substance
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pond full of green slime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个满是绿色黏质物的池塘
Sense.EXAMPLE: the trails of slime left by snails
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜗牛留下的黏液痕迹

Sense.DEF: someone who is immoral, extremely unpleasant, and cannot be trusted – used to show disapproval

a slimline drink has fewer
calorie s
than the normal type
a slimline piece of equipment is smaller or thinner than others of the same type
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slimline dishwasher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小型洗碗机

Sense.DEF: the activity of trying to make yourself thinner by eating less, taking exercise etc
making you look thinner
Sense.EXAMPLE: Solid colors are more slimming than patterns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单色要比图案显瘦。

Sense.DEF:
covered with
slime
, or wet and slippery like slime
Sense.EXAMPLE: slimy mud
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黏糊糊的泥巴

Sense.DEF: friendly in an unpleasant way that does not seem sincere – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 谄媚的﹐讨好的﹐假惺惺的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slimy politician
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假惺惺的政客

Sense.DEF: to throw or put something somewhere with a careless movement and some force
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lou slung his suitcase onto the bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卢把手提箱扔到床上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sling me the keys.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把钥匙抛给我。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Pete slung his bag over his shoulder .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮特把包甩到肩上。

Sense.DEF: to make someone leave or go to a place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sam was slung into jail for punching a cop.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆因出拳殴打警察而被投进监狱。

Sense.DEF: to hang something loosely
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave wore a tool belt slung around his waist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫腰上搭了一条工具带。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to go away
Sense.TRAN: 走开﹐滚蛋〔用于叫某人离开〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of cloth tied around your neck to support an injured arm or hand
Sense.TRAN: 〔手臂或手受伤时起支撑作用的〕悬带﹐吊带

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had her arm in a sling.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的手臂吊着吊带。

Sense.DEF: a set of ropes or strong pieces of cloth that are used to lift and carry heavy objects
Sense.TRAN: 〔用以提起或吊起重物的〕吊索﹐吊链

Sense.DEF: a special type of bag that fastens over your shoulders, in which you can carry a baby close to your body
a piece of rope with a piece of leather in the middle, used in past times as a weapon for throwing stones
problems or criticisms
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve all suffered the slings and arrows of day-to-day living.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都遭遇过日常生活的种种磨难。

Sense.DEF: a woman’s shoe that is open at the back and has a narrow band going around the heel
Sense.TRAN: 露跟女鞋〔鞋后帮为一条窄带〕

Sense.DEF: a small Y-shaped stick with a thin band of rubber across the top, used to throw stones
to move somewhere quietly and secretly, especially because you are afraid or ashamed
Sense.TRAN: 悄悄地移动﹐偷偷溜走〔尤因害怕或难为情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Edward was hoping to slink past unnoticed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱德华希望能悄悄地溜过去。

Sense.DEF: a slinky dress, skirt etc is smooth and tight and shows the shape of a woman’s body in a way that looks sexually attractive
Sense.TRAN: 〔衣服﹑裙子等〕紧身的﹐显出体形线条的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slinky black dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧身的黑色连衣裙

Sense.DEF: slinky movements, music, or voices are slow in a way that is sexually attractive
Sense.TRAN: 〔动作﹑音乐或嗓音〕柔美的﹐柔媚的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a song with slinky bass lines
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一首带有柔媚低音旋律的歌曲

Sense.DEF: to slide a short distance accidentally, and fall or lose your balance slightly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wright slipped but managed to keep hold of the ball.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赖特滑了一下﹐但球还抓在手里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He slipped on the ice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在冰上滑倒了。

Sense.DEF: to go somewhere, without attracting other people’s attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben slipped quietly out of the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本悄悄地溜出了房间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One man managed to slip from the club as police arrived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察到来时﹐一个男子设法溜出了俱乐部。

Sense.DEF: to put something somewhere quietly or smoothly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ann slipped the book into her bag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安把书悄悄塞进包里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A letter had been slipped under his door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一封信被悄悄塞在他的门下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carrie slipped her arm through her brother’s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡丽利落地把手插进她弟弟的臂弯里。

Sense.DEF: to give someone something secretly or without attracting much attention

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I slipped him a ten-dollar bill to keep quiet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我偷偷塞给他一张十美元钞票﹐让他别声张。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Carr slips the ball to King who scores easily.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡尔悄悄地把球传给金﹐金轻松得分。

Sense.DEF: to move smoothly, especially off or from something
Sense.EXAMPLE: As he bent over, the towel round his waist slipped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他弯腰的时候﹐系在腰间的毛巾滑了下来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He watched the sun slip down behind the mountains.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看着太阳落下山。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ring had slipped off Julia’s finger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戒指从朱莉娅的手指上滑脱了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cally slipped from his grasp and fled.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡利从他手中挣脱逃跑了。

Sense.DEF: if a knife or other tool slips, it moves so that it accidentally cuts the wrong thing
Sense.TRAN: 〔刀或其他工具〕滑脱〔误割到别的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The knife slipped and cut his finger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刀滑脱了﹐割破了他的手指。

Sense.DEF: to become worse or lower than before
Sense.EXAMPLE: Standards have slipped in many parts of the industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一行业中许多方面的标准都已下滑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His popularity slipped further after a series of scandals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一连串丑闻之后﹐他的支持率进一步下降。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re slipping, Doyle! You need a holiday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你状态更差了﹐多伊尔！你需要去度个假。

Sense.DEF: to gradually start being in a particular condition

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had begun to slip into debt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始欠债了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She slipped into unconsciousness and died the next day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她陷入昏迷﹐第二天就去世了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The project has slipped behind schedule.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目工期落后了。

Sense.DEF: to put a piece of clothing on your body, or take it off your body, quickly and smoothly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Peter was already at the door slipping on his shoes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得已经在门口穿鞋子了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She slipped out of her clothes and stepped into the shower.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她麻利地脱掉衣服﹐走进淋浴间。

Sense.DEF: if time slips away, past etc, it passes quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The search for the missing child continued, but time was slipping away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 寻找失踪小孩的工作继续进行﹐但时间在一天天流逝。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hours slipped past almost unnoticed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 时间在不知不觉中溜走了。

Sense.DEF: if something slips your mind, you forget it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I meant to buy some milk, but it completely slipped my mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我原本想买些牛奶﹐可是忘得一干二净。

Sense.DEF: to say something without meaning to, when you had wanted it to be a secret
Sense.TRAN: 无意中说出某事﹐泄露某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: He let it slip that they were planning to get married.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说漏了嘴﹐说他们打算结婚了。

Sense.DEF: to get free from something that was holding you
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dog slipped his collar and ran away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条狗挣脱项圈跑掉了。

Sense.DEF: if someone or something slips through the net, they are not caught or dealt with by the system that is supposed to catch them or deal with them
Sense.TRAN: 漏网﹔未得到应有的处理
Sense.EXAMPLE: In a class of 30 children, it is easy for one to slip through the net and learn nothing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一个有 30 个孩子的班级里﹐很容易有个别孩子不能被照顾到﹐什么也学不到。

Sense.DEF: to not take an opportunity, offer etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t let a chance like that slip through your fingers!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别错失这么一个机会！

Sense.DEF: to deceive or play a trick on someone
to suffer an injury when one of the connecting parts between the bones in your back moves out of place
to leave a place secretly or without anyone noticing
Sense.EXAMPLE: He slipped away into the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他溜进人群中。

Sense.DEF: if something such as an opportunity slips away, it is no longer available
Sense.EXAMPLE: This time, Radford did not let her chance slip away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次雷德福没有错过机会。

Sense.DEF: to use a word or say something without attracting too much attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had slipped in a few jokes to liven the speech up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他穿插了几个笑话来活跃演讲的气氛。

Sense.DEF: if something slips out, you say it without really intending to
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t mean to say it. The words slipped out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是故意说的﹐是说漏了嘴。

Sense.DEF: to make a mistake
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company apologized for slipping up so badly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司为这么严重的疏忽表示歉意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Someone had slipped up on the order.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人把订单给弄错了。

Sense.DEF: a small or narrow piece of paper
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slip of paper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张纸条
Sense.EXAMPLE: an order slip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 点菜单
Sense.EXAMPLE: a betting slip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赌注单

Sense.DEF: a small mistake
Sense.EXAMPLE: Molly knew she could not afford to make a single slip .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫莉知道自己一个小错误都不能犯。

Sense.DEF: a small mistake you make when you are speaking or writing, especially by using the wrong word
Sense.TRAN: 口误/笔误〔尤指误用词语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was just a slip of the tongue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只是一个口误。

Sense.DEF: to escape from someone who is chasing you
Sense.TRAN: 摆脱某人的追踪﹐甩掉某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Somehow she’d given them the slip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她设法甩掉了他们。

Sense.DEF: a piece of underwear, similar to a thin dress or skirt, that a woman wears under a dress or skirt
Sense.EXAMPLE: a white silk slip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白色的真丝衬裙

Sense.DEF: an occasion when something becomes worse or lower

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a slip in house prices
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房价的下跌

Sense.DEF: an act of sliding a short distance or of falling by sliding

Sense.LEXUNIT: a slip of a girl/boy etc
Sense.DEF: a small thin young person – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 瘦小的女孩/男孩等〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF:
a part of the field where players stand, trying to catch the ball in
cricket
Sense.TRAN: 〔板球运动中击球员右后方的〕防守位置

Sense.DEF: a mixture of clay and water that is used for decorating pots

a plastic container for a
cd
or a
dvd
a hard cover, like a box, for putting a book in
a loose cloth cover for furniture
a knot that you can make tighter by pulling one of its ends
shoes that do not have a fastening
failure to do something at the planned time, at the planned cost etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Slippage on any job will entail slippage on the overall project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何一项工作延误都会导致整个项目延误。

Sense.DEF: when something becomes worse or lower

GramExa.EXAMPLE: slippage in sales
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售额的下降

Sense.DEF: when something slips
Sense.EXAMPLE: snow slippage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 积雪滑移

Sense.DEF: a painful injury caused when one of the connecting parts between the bones in your back moves out of place
a light soft shoe that you wear at home

something that is slippery is difficult to hold, walk on etc because it is wet or
greasy
Sense.TRAN: 〔因潮湿或有油脂而〕滑的﹐滑溜的
Sense.EXAMPLE: In places, the path can be wet and slippery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路上有些地方可能又湿又滑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Harry’s palms were slippery with sweat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里手心滑溜溜的都是汗。

Sense.DEF: someone who is slippery cannot be trusted
Sense.EXAMPLE: Martin is a slippery customer someone you should not trust so be careful what you say to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马丁是个滑头﹐所以和他说话要多留神。

Sense.DEF: not having one clear meaning and able to be understood in different ways
Sense.EXAMPLE: the slippery notion of ‘standards’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “标准”这一模糊概念

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a process or habit that is difficult to stop and which will develop into something extremely bad
Sense.TRAN: 〔过程或习惯〕走向极坏的境地

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is on the slippery slope to a life in crime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正滑向犯罪的深渊。

Sense.DEF: a slippy surface or object is slippery

a road for driving onto or off a
motorway
done too quickly and carelessly – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 马虎的﹐随便的﹐草率的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slipshod piece of work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 草草完成的工作

Sense.DEF: the area of low air pressure just behind a vehicle that is moving quickly
Sense.TRAN: 〔疾速行驶的交通工具后面形成的〕低压气穴

Sense.DEF: a careless mistake
Sense.EXAMPLE: We cannot afford another slip-up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不能再有任何失误了。

Sense.DEF: a sloping track that is used for moving boats into or out of the water
to make a straight narrow cut in cloth, paper, skin etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guy slit open the envelope.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盖伊拆开信封。

GramExa.GLOSS: kill someone by cutting their throat
try to kill yourself by cutting your wrists

Sense.DEF: a long straight narrow cut or hole
Sense.EXAMPLE: light shining through a slit in the door
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 透过门缝照进来的光线
Sense.EXAMPLE: a skirt with a slit up the side
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 侧边开衩的裙子

PIC.HEADING: SLITHER 蜿蜒地滑动
PIC.PICCONTENT: A snake slitheredacross the grass.一条蛇蜿蜒爬过草丛。

Sense.DEF: to slide somewhere over a surface, twisting or moving from side to side
Sense.TRAN: 蜿蜒地滑动﹔摇晃地滑行
Sense.EXAMPLE: A snake slithered across the grass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条蛇蜿蜒爬过草丛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He slithered down the muddy bank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在泥泞的河岸上踉踉跄跄地走。

Sense.DEF: unpleasantly slippery
a small pointed or thin piece that has been cut or broken off something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sliver of glass
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块玻璃碎片
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sliver of cake
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一小块蛋糕

Sense.DEF: someone who is lazy and untidy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lazy slob
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个懒惰又邋遢的家伙

Sense.DEF: to spend time doing nothing and being lazy

to let
saliva the liquid produced by your mouth
come out of your mouth and run down
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate dogs that slobber everywhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌到处淌口水的狗。

Sense.DEF: to show how much you want, like, or love someone or something, without controlling yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: I caught Rick slobbering over the models in a magazine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到里克对着杂志上的模特垂涎欲滴。

Sense.DEF: a slobbery kiss or mouth is unpleasantly wet
Sense.TRAN: 〔吻或嘴巴〕口水多的﹐湿得讨厌的

Sense.DEF:
a small bitter fruit like a
plum

an alcoholic drink made with sloes,
gin
, and sugar
to work hard at something without stopping, especially when the work is difficult, tiring, or boring
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mother slogged all her life for us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈为我们操劳了一辈子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After a day slogging away at work, I need to relax.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 辛苦工作了一天﹐我需要放松一下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You just have to sit down and slog through long lists of new vocabulary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须坐下来好好地啃一啃长长的新词汇表。

Sense.DEF: to make a long hard journey somewhere, especially on foot
Sense.TRAN: 长时间艰苦地行进﹐艰难地走〔尤指徒步〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been slogging round the streets delivering catalogues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他奔波在街头递送商品目录。

GramExa.PROPFORM: slog your way through/round etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He started to slog his way up the hill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始艰难地往山上爬。

Sense.DEF: to fight, compete, or argue about something until one side wins
Sense.EXAMPLE: The teams will be slogging it out on Saturday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两队将在星期六决一雌雄。

Sense.DEF: a piece of work that takes a lot of time and effort and is usually boring
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll be a slog, but I know we can do it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这工作费时费力﹐但我知道我们能完成。
Sense.EXAMPLE: months of hard slog
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个月的辛勤劳动

Sense.DEF: a long period of tiring walking
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long hard slog uphill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艰苦的长途爬山

Sense.DEF: a short phrase that is easy to remember and is used in advertisements, or by politicians, organizations etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: an advertising slogan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一句广告口号
Sense.EXAMPLE: demonstrators shouting political slogans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高喊政治口号的示威者
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Democrats’ campaign slogan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主党的竞选口号

Sense.DEF: the use of slogans in advertisements or by politicians, organizations etc – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔广告﹑政治家或团体的〕标语[口号]的使用〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: political sloganeering
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喊政治口号

Sense.DEF: used to describe action that appears to happen more slowly than it really happens, in computer games, on video etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机游戏或录像带中〕慢动作的
Sense.EXAMPLE: slo-mo mode
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慢动作模式

Sense.DEF:
a small ship with one central
mast pole for sails
if liquid slops somewhere, it moves around or over the edge of a container in an uncontrolled way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Coffee slopped over the rim of her cup.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咖啡从她的杯口溢了出来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: With each wave, more water slopped into the cabin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着一个个浪头打来﹐更多的水漫进了船舱。

Sense.DEF: to put a liquid somewhere in a careless way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She put the glass down, slopping beer onto the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她放下玻璃杯﹐啤酒溅到了桌上。

Sense.DEF: to feed slop to pigs
to relax, wearing clothes that are untidy or old
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jan would never slop around in old jeans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简从来不会穿着旧牛仔裤到处闲逛。

Sense.DEF: if prisoners slop out, they empty their toilet buckets
waste food that can be used to feed animals

dirty water or
urine
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prisoners had to use slop buckets at night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 囚犯在夜里只能使用便桶。

Sense.DEF: food that is too soft and tastes bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you actually expect us to eat this slop?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你竟然要让我们吃这种难以下咽的稀烂东西？

Sense.DEF: a piece of ground or a surface that slopes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a steep slope
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陡坡
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gentle not steep slope
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缓坡
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked back up the grassy slope.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她回头望了一眼那绿草如茵的坡地。

Sense.DEF:
an area of steep ground covered with snow that people
ski
down
Sense.EXAMPLE: We got to Tahoe on Friday, and hit the slopes skied on them the next day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们星期五到达塔霍﹐第二天就上坡滑雪了。

Sense.DEF: the angle at which something slopes in relation to a flat surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slope of 30 degrees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 30˚ 的坡度

Sense.DEF: if the ground or a surface slopes, it is higher at one end than the other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pleasant garden that slopes down to the river
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座向河边倾斜的宜人花园

Sense.DEF: to leave somewhere quietly and secretly, especially when you are avoiding work
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为了逃避工作〕悄悄离开﹐溜掉
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mike sloped off early today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克今天提早溜了。

Sense.DEF: not done carefully or thoroughly
Sense.TRAN: 马虎的﹐不仔细的﹐草率的
Sense.EXAMPLE: sloppy work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 草率的工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: His written reports are incredibly sloppy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的书面报告写得极其马虎。

Sense.DEF: sloppy clothes are loose-fitting, untidy, or dirty
Sense.TRAN: 〔衣服〕宽松的﹐不整洁的﹐邋遢的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ann was dressed in a sloppy brown sweater.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安穿了一件邋遢的棕色羊毛衫。

Sense.DEF: expressing feelings of love too strongly and in a silly way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film is a sloppy romance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一部肉麻的爱情片。

Sense.DEF: not solid enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: sloppy jelly
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 软塌塌的果冻

Sense.DEF:
a type of sandwich, made from
beef
with spices added and served on a
bun
if a liquid sloshes somewhere, or if you slosh it, it moves or is moved about in an uncontrolled way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Water was sloshing about in the bottom of the boat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 水在船底哗啦哗啦地荡漾。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He put the glass down hard and beer sloshed over the edge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他重重地把杯子放下﹐啤酒从杯沿溅了出来。

Sense.DEF: to put a liquid in a container or on a surface in a careless way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jo sloshed more wine into her glass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔往她杯子里哗啦哗啦地倒了更多的酒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Slosh a bit of paint on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 倒点油漆上去。

Sense.DEF: to walk through water or mud in a noisy way
Sense.EXAMPLE: People were sloshing around in the mud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家在烂泥里吧唧吧唧地走。

Sense.DEF: drunk
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of them were too sloshed to notice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们大部分人都醉得很厉害﹐所以没注意到。

Sense.DEF: a long narrow hole in a surface, that you can put something into
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alan dropped another quarter into the slot on the pay phone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伦往付费电话的投币口里又塞了一枚 25 分的硬币。

Sense.DEF:
a short period of time allowed for one particular event on a programme or
timetable
Sense.TRAN: 〔节目或时间表里的〕一段时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ten-minute slot on the breakfast show
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早餐节目中的一个十分钟栏目
Sense.EXAMPLE: landing slots at Heathrow Airport
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希思罗机场的降落时间表
Sense.EXAMPLE: A new comedy is scheduled for the 9 p.m. time slot .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚上9点档排了一部新的喜剧片。

Sense.DEF: to go into a slot, or to put something in a slot

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mary slotted a cassette into the VCR.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽把盒式磁带插进录像机里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Each length of board slots easily into the next.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每块木板之间都能轻松接合。

Sense.EXAMPLE: All the wood parts come pre-cut so that they can be slotted together put together using slots .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的木部件都预先切割好﹐可以拼装起来。

Sense.DEF: to fit something or someone into a plan, organization etc, or to fit in
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stewart has slotted in well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯图尔特已经很适应了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We should be able to slot the meeting in before lunch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该可以把会议安排在午饭之前。

Sense.DEF: an animal in Central and South America that moves very slowly, has grey fur, and lives in trees
laziness
lazy or not active
Sense.TRAN: 懒惰的﹐懒散的﹐不活跃的

Sense.DEF: a machine used for playing a game, that starts when you put money into it
Sense.TRAN: 吃角子老虎机﹐投币式自动赌博机

Sense.DEF: a machine that you buy cigarettes, food, or drink from
a large spoon with holes in it
to stand, sit, or walk with a slouch
Sense.TRAN: 低头垂肩地站[坐﹐走]﹐无精打采地站[坐﹐走]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jimmy slouched back in his chair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉米懒洋洋地靠在椅子上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She slouched across the living room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她无精打采地穿过起居室。

Sense.DEF: to be very good at something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Horowitz was no slouch at languages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍罗威茨在语言方面很厉害。

Sense.DEF: a way of standing, sitting, or walking with your shoulders bent forward that makes you look tired or lazy
Sense.TRAN: 〔站﹑坐﹑走路时的〕低头垂肩的姿势

Sense.DEF: to get rid of a dead layer of skin
to get rid of something, especially something that is damaging you
Sense.TRAN: 抛弃﹐摆脱﹐消除〔尤指于己不利的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president wanted to slough off the country’s bad image.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统想消除国家的不良形象。

Sense.DEF: a bad situation or a state of sadness that you cannot get out of easily

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Harry was in a slough of despondency for weeks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里几个星期来都陷在沮丧的深渊里。

Sense.DEF: an area of land covered in deep dirty water or mud
lazy, untidy, and careless
Sense.TRAN: 懒散的﹔邋遢的﹔不修边幅的﹔马虎的
Sense.EXAMPLE: slovenly habits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邋里邋遢的习惯
Sense.EXAMPLE: a large slovenly woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个身材高大﹑不修边幅的女人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slovenly way of speaking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随便的说话方式

Sense.DEF: not moving, being done, or happening quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car was travelling at a very slow speed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车正以非常慢的速度行驶。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slow walker
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慢慢走着的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The economy faces a year of slower growth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济将面临增长更缓慢的一年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take a few deep, slow breaths.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慢慢地深吸几口气。

Sense.DEF: taking too long
Sense.EXAMPLE: Taylor was concerned at the slow progress of the investigations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰勒为调查进展太慢而担忧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The legal system can be painfully slow much too slow .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个法律体系有时效率极低。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wound was slow to heal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤好得很慢。

Sense.DEF: if you are slow to do something, you do not do it as soon as you can or should

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Farmers have been slow to exploit this market.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 农民迟迟没有开拓这个市场。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Their attitude was slow to change.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的态度迟迟不肯改变。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has been slow in announcing the name of his successor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他迟迟没有宣布继任者的名字。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: New ideas have been slow in coming.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迟迟没有想出新的办法来。

Sense.DEF: taking a longer time than something similar
Sense.TRAN: 〔比同类事物〕缓慢的﹐费时长的﹐耗费时日的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We got on the slow train one that stops at more stations by mistake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们误上了一趟慢车。

Sense.DEF: if business or trade is slow, there are not many customers or not much is sold
Sense.EXAMPLE: Business is often slow in the afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下午生意通常清淡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is experiencing slow sales.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司目前销售不旺。

Sense.DEF: if a clock or watch is slow, it is showing a time earlier than the correct time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The clock is about five minutes slow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这钟慢了大约五分钟。

Sense.DEF: not good or quick at understanding things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teaching assistants have time to help the slower pupils.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教学助理有时间帮助学得比较慢的学生。

Sense.DEF: not quick to understand something new
Sense.TRAN: 〔对新事物〕理解得慢﹐领悟得慢
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes Tim’s a little slow on the uptake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆有时理解得有点慢。

Sense.DEF: not quick enough at reacting to something
to slowly get angry
Sense.TRAN: 慢慢生起气来﹐怒火慢慢地涌上心头
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tony fumbled the ball and I could see the coach doing a slow burn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尼漏接了球﹐我能看出教练的怒气慢慢上来了。

Sense.DEF:
if a group of people give someone a slow handclap, they
clap
their hands slowly to show their disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 慢吞吞的鼓掌〔表示不满〕

Sense.DEF:
an
oven
that is at a low temperature
a slow film does not react to light very easily

Exponent.DEF: not moving quickly or not doing something quickly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was always one of the slowest runners in my class.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总是班上跑得最慢的几个人之一。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My computer’s really slow compared to the ones at school.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的电脑比起学校的电脑来真是太慢了。

Exponent.DEF: happening, developing, or changing slowly over a long period of time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a gradual rise in the Earth’s temperature
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球气温的逐渐上升
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve noticed a gradual improvement in his work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现他的学习在逐渐进步。

Exponent.DEF: moving or doing something slowly, especially because you are enjoying what you are doing and do not have to hurry
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a leisurely breakfast
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 慢慢享用的早餐
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They walked at a leisurely pace.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们悠闲地走着。

Exponent.DEF: moving or doing something in a slow and calm way, without rushing at all
Exponent.TRAN: 不慌不忙的,从容不迫的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She continued to listen, seeming relaxed and unhurried.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她继续听着,显得镇定而从容。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the doctor’s calm unhurried manner
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生不慌不忙的从容态度

Exponent.DEF: moving or reacting more slowly than usual, especially because of a loss of power or energy. Also used when business, sales, or the economy seem very slow.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因失去动力〕行动缓慢的,反应迟钝的﹔〔生意等〕萧条的,停滞的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The car seems rather sluggish going uphill.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这车上山速度很慢。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The drink was making her sluggish.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝酒使她反应变迟钝了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the company’s sluggish performance this year
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司今年的低迷业绩

Exponent.DEF: moving slowly, because you feel as if you have no energy and no interest in doing anything
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She woke up feeling heavy and le-thargic.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她醒来时昏昏沉沉,浑身乏力。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His son seemed depressed and lethargic.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的儿子神情消沉,没精打采。

Exponent.DEF: slow and with very little energy or activity – used about people, actions, or periods of time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She lifted her hand in a languid wave.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有气无力地扬了扬手。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a long languid afternoon in the middle of summer
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 盛夏里一个漫长而慵懒的午后

Sense.DEF: to become slower or to make something slower
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her breathing slowed and she fell asleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她呼吸慢下来﹐睡着了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ian slowed up as he approached the traffic lights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊恩在驶近红绿灯时放慢了速度。

Sense.DEF: to become slower or to make something slower
Sense.EXAMPLE: Growth in sales has slowed down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售的增长放慢了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ice on the road slowed us down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于路面结冰﹐我们放慢了速度。

Sense.DEF: to become less active or busy than you usually are
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is important to slow down, rest, and eat sensibly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放慢节奏﹑适当休息和注意饮食是很重要的。

Sense.DEF: slowly
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you go slower, you’ll see much more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你慢慢地走﹐就能看到更多。

Sense.DEF: someone who moves or does things too slowly
Sense.TRAN: 慢性子﹐慢郎中﹐行动缓慢的人

Sense.DEF: a reduction in activity or speed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a slowdown in the US economy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国经济的放缓

Sense.DEF: a period when people deliberately work slowly in order to protest about something
the part of a large road where vehicles drive more slowly than the other vehicles on the road
if a company, organization etc is in the slow lane, it is less successful than others
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司﹑团体等〕处于落后状态﹐落在后面
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country is expected to remain in the slow lane of economic recovery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的经济复苏预计将继续处于落后状态。

Sense.DEF: at a slow speed
Sense.EXAMPLE: He shook his head slowly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他慢慢地摇了摇头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘That’s true,’ said Joe slowly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “没错。”乔慢吞吞地说道。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that a change is happening, although it is happening slowly
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are slowly but surely gaining the support of the public.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的确正逐渐赢得民众的支持。

Exponent.DEF: at a slow speed
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Large white clouds drifted slowly across the sky.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大片大片的白云在空中慢慢飘过。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The situation is slowly improving.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 情况在慢慢好转。

Exponent.DEF: happening slowly over a period of time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I practised every day, and gradually got better.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我天天练,慢慢地越来越好。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many of our forests are gradually disappearing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有许多森林在逐渐消失。

Exponent.DEF: slowly, in a series of small amounts or stages
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Add the olive oil, little by little.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 加橄榄油,一点一点地加。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s best to do the work bit by bit.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这活儿最好慢慢地做。

Exponent.DEF: extremely slowly, especially when this is annoying
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Traffic was moving at a snail’s pace.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 车流像蜗牛在爬行。

Sense.DEF: movement on film or television shown at a slower speed than it really happened

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let’s see that goal again in slow motion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们用慢镜头重播﹐再来看一遍这个进球吧。

Sense.DEF:
a game like
softball
, usually played by mixed teams of men and women
Sense.TRAN: 慢投垒球〔一种男女混合对打的垒球〕

Sense.DEF: someone who moves or does things too slowly
not good at understanding things
soft thick mud, especially at the bottom of a liquid
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指沉淀于液体底部的〕软泥﹐烂泥

Sense.DEF:
the solid substance that is left when industrial waste or
sewage the liquid waste from toilets
has been cleaned
thick dirty oil in an engine
a small creature with a soft body, that moves very slowly and eats garden plants
a bullet
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perez still has a slug lodged in his left shoulder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 佩雷斯的左肩仍嵌着一颗子弹。

Sense.DEF: a small amount of a strong alcoholic drink

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a slug of brandy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一口白兰地

Sense.DEF: a piece of metal shaped like a coin, used to illegally get a drink, ticket etc from a machine
Sense.TRAN: 〔用以非法从自动售货机获取饮料﹑票等的〕硬币状金属片﹐假硬币

Sense.DEF: someone who gets to work by standing in a particular place until a driver stops and lets them go with them in their car
if two people slug it out, they fight or compete until one of them has won
to hit someone hard with your closed hand
to hit a ball hard
to drink an alcoholic drink, especially by swallowing large amounts at the same time
a situation in which people are arguing or fighting in a rude or angry way
Sense.TRAN: 激烈的争吵﹔激烈的打斗

Sense.DEF: a baseball player who hits the ball a very long way
a system, used in some American cities, of sharing car rides to work with people you do not know, in which people wait in a particular place for a driver to pick them up
Sense.TRAN: 拼车〔存在于美国的一些城市里﹐要拼车的人事先到指定地点等待司机来接〕

Sense.DEF: moving or reacting more slowly than normal
Sense.TRAN: 行动缓慢的﹔反应迟缓的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alex woke late, feeling tired and sluggish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚历克斯醒得很晚﹐感到很倦怠。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Economic recovery has so far been sluggish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济复苏的速度目前仍然缓慢。

Sense.DEF: a passage for water to flow through, with a special gate which can be opened or closed to control it
to wash something with a lot of water

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was sluicing down the table and the floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正在冲洗桌子和地板。

Sense.DEF: if water sluices somewhere, a large amount of it suddenly flows there
a house or an area of a city that is in very bad condition, where very poor people live
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slum area
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫民区
Sense.EXAMPLE: slum housing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫民区的住房
Sense.EXAMPLE: the slums of London
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦的贫民区

Sense.DEF: a very untidy place
to spend time in conditions that are much worse than you are used to – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 过穷日子﹐过简陋生活〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jeremy doesn’t slum it when he goes away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰里米出门在外是不会亏待自己的。

Sense.DEF: to sleep
sleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: He passed into a deep slumber.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他酣然入梦。

Sense.DEF: a children’s party when a group of children sleep at one child’s house
Sense.TRAN: 睡衣聚会〔儿童的聚会﹐当晚都在一个孩子家里过夜〕

Sense.DEF: someone who owns houses in a very poor area and charges high rents for buildings that are in bad condition
Sense.TRAN: 〔出租简陋房屋收取高额租金的〕贫民窟房东

Sense.DEF: to fall or lean against something because you are not strong enough to stand
