GramExa.EXAMPLE: She slumped against the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身子一歪倚在了墙上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Carol slumped back in her chair, defeated.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡萝尔颓然倒在椅子上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ben staggered and slumped onto the floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本踉跄着栽倒在地板上。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly go down in price, value, or number
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sales slumped by 20% last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年销售额骤减 20%。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The currency slumped to a record low.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 币值跌到了历史低点。

Sense.DEF: if your shoulders or head slump or are slumped, they bend forward because you are unhappy, tired, or unconscious
Sense.TRAN: 〔肩或脑袋〕耷拉着〔由于不开心﹑疲倦或失去知觉〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her shoulders slumped and her eyes filled with tears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她耷拉着双肩﹐眼里噙满泪水。

Sense.DEF: a sudden decrease in prices, sales, profits etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔价格﹑销售额﹑利润等的〕突然下跌

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a slump in car sales
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车销售量的骤降

Sense.DEF: a period when there is a reduction in business and many people lose their jobs
Sense.EXAMPLE: The war was followed by an economic slump.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后出现了经济萧条。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a worldwide slump
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全球性的经济萧条

Sense.DEF: a period when a player or team does not play well

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Dodgers have been in a slump for the last three weeks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 道奇队在过去三周里一直处于低迷期。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
sling
Sense.TRAN: sling 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
slink
Sense.TRAN: slink 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: to speak unclearly without separating your words or sounds correctly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was slurring her words as if she was drunk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她好像喝醉了似的﹐说话含糊不清。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His voice sounded slurred.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的声音听起来含混不清。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone or something unfairly
to play a group of musical notes smoothly together
an unfair criticism that is intended to make people dislike someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Milton regarded her comment as a slur on his country.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 米尔顿把她的话看作是对他祖国的诋毁。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: How dare she cast a slur on criticize my character?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她竟敢诽谤我的人格？

Sense.EXAMPLE: a racist slur
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 种族主义的诽谤

Sense.DEF: a curved line written over musical notes to show they must be played together smoothly
to drink a liquid while making a noisy sucking sound
Sense.TRAN: 出声地喝﹐咕嘟咕嘟地喝

Sense.DEF: a mixture of water and mud, coal, or animal waste
Sense.TRAN: 泥浆﹐淤浆〔水和泥﹑煤或牲畜粪便的混合物〕

Sense.DEF: partly melted snow
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children were sliding around in the snow and slush.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在尚未化尽的雪地上到处滑行。

Sense.DEF: feelings or stories that seem silly because they are too romantic
Sense.TRAN: 庸俗的浪漫情调﹔无聊的爱情故事
Sense.EXAMPLE: sentimental slush
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滥情的无聊爱情故事

Sense.DEF: a drink made with crushed ice and a sweet liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: cherry slush
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 樱桃冰沙

Sense.DEF: an amount of money kept for dishonest purposes, especially in politics
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用于政治目的的〕行贿基金﹐非法基金

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for a woman who has sex with a lot of different people. Do not use this word.
someone who is sly cleverly deceives people in order to get what they want
a smile, look etc that shows you know something secret
Sense.TRAN: 诡秘的微笑/一瞥/眨眼等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He leaned forward with a sly smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他俯身向前诡秘地一笑。

Sense.DEF: secretly, especially when you are doing something that you should not do
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’d been seeing each other on the sly for months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们已经偷偷约会了好几个月。

Sense.DEF: to hit someone, especially a child, with your open hand in order to punish them
Sense.TRAN: 用巴掌打﹐掴〔小孩﹐以示惩罚〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the debate about whether parents should smack their children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关父母该不该打孩子的辩论

Sense.DEF: to hit something hard against something else so that it makes a short loud noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: He smacked the money down on the table and walked out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他啪的一声把钱扔在桌上就走了出去。

Sense.DEF: to make a short loud noise with your lips before or after you eat or drink something to show that it is good
Sense.TRAN: 出声地咂嘴唇〔表示味道好〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He drained his glass and smacked his lips appreciatively.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一口气喝光了杯里的东西﹐满意地咂咂嘴。

Sense.DEF: to hit someone hard with your closed hand
if a situation smacks of something unpleasant, it seems to involve that thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: To me, the whole thing smacks of a cover-up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我看来﹐整件事有点藏藏掖掖的感觉。

Sense.DEF: to hit someone hard many times with your hand
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t make me come over there and smack you up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别惹我过来抽你一顿。

Subsense.DEF: a hit with your open hand, especially to punish a child
Subsense.TRAN: 打一巴掌〔尤指给小孩的惩罚〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’re going to get a smack in a minute!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马上就让你挨巴掌！

Subsense.DEF: a hard hit with your closed hand

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Talk like that and I’ll give you a smack in the mouth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 再这样说话﹐我就让你嘴巴吃拳头。

Sense.DEF: a short loud noise caused when something hits something else
Sense.TRAN: 啪的一声〔尤指一物打着另一物的响声〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book landed with a smack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 书啪的一声掉下来。

Sense.LEXUNIT: give sb a smack on the lips/cheek
Sense.DEF: to kiss someone loudly
Sense.TRAN: 给某人的嘴唇/脸颊一个响吻

Sense.DEF: a small fishing boat
exactly or directly in the middle of something, in front of something etc
Sense.TRAN: 恰好﹐准确地﹐不偏不倚地

GramExa.PROPFORM: smack in the middle/in front of sth etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a hole smack in the middle of the floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地板正中央有个洞。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s smack dab in the middle of an earthquake zone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 它就在震区的正中心。

Sense.DEF: if something goes smack into something, it hits it with a lot of force
Sense.TRAN: 猛烈地﹐砰的一声〔碰击某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car ran smack into the side of the bus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小汽车砰的一声撞到了公共汽车的侧面。

Sense.DEF: a pound or a dollar
a loud kiss
not large in size or amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small piece of paper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一小片纸
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆小汽车
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small town
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小镇
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small dark woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个皮肤黝黑的小个子女人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The T-shirt was too small for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件 T 恤衫他穿太小了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sweater comes in three sizes - small, medium and large.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这羊毛衫有三个尺寸: 小号﹑中号和大号。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only a relatively small number of people were affected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有相对少数的人受到了影响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small amount of money
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一小笔钱
Sense.EXAMPLE: A much smaller proportion of women are employed in senior positions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受雇担任高级职位的女性比例要小得多。

Sense.DEF: a small problem, job, mistake etc is not important or does not have a large effect
Sense.TRAN: 〔问题﹑工作﹑错误等〕不重要的﹐没大影响的﹐微不足道的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We may have to make a few small changes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们也许要作些小小的变动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s been a small problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个小问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s only a small difference between them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它们之间只有细微的差别。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was good to feel we had helped in some small way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能帮上一点小忙﹐我们感到真高兴。

Sense.DEF: a large degree, achievement etc
Sense.TRAN: 不小的程度/成就/任务等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The success of the project is due in no small measure to the work of Dr Peterson.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 项目的成功在很大程度上要归功于彼得森博士的努力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That is no small achievement in the circumstances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这种情况下﹐那是个不小的成就。

Sense.DEF: a small child is young
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has three small children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有三个年幼的孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve known him since he was a small boy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从他还是个小孩子起﹐我就认识他了。

Sense.DEF: a business that does not involve large amounts of money or does not employ a large number of people
Sense.TRAN: 小企业/小公司/小农场主等
Sense.EXAMPLE: grants for small businesses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给小企业的补贴

Sense.DEF: small letters are letters in the form a, b, c etc rather than A, B, C etc

Sense.LEXUNIT: conservative with a small ‘c’/democrat with a small ‘d’ etc
Sense.DEF: someone who believes in the principles you have mentioned, but does not belong to an organized group or political party
Sense.TRAN: 支持保守党/民主党等的党外人士

Sense.DEF: a small voice is quiet and soft
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What about me?’ she asked in a small voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我呢？”她轻声问道。

Sense.DEF: to seem or feel stupid, unimportant, or ashamed
Sense.EXAMPLE: She jumped at any opportunity to make me look small .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她逮到机会就要让我出丑。

Sense.DEF: used to express surprise when you unexpectedly meet someone you know or find out that someone has an unexpected connection to you
Sense.TRAN: 世界真小〔用于在意外地遇见认识的人﹐或发现某人跟自己有意想不到的关系时表示惊讶〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you know David went to school with my brother? It’s a small world, isn’t it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道吗？戴维和我哥哥是同学。世界真小啊﹐是不是？

Sense.DEF: a large amount of money

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It must have cost him a small fortune.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这肯定花去了他一大笔钱。

Sense.DEF: coins of low value
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t have any small change for the parking meter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有投停车计时收费器的零钱。

Sense.DEF: to be pleased that a bad situation is not even worse
Sense.TRAN: 为坏情况没有到更糟的地步而庆幸
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wasn’t too badly hurt, so we should be thankful for small mercies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她伤得不太重﹐我们应该感到庆幸。

Sense.DEF: the early morning hours, between about one and four o’clock
Sense.TRAN: 凌晨时分〔约凌晨1点到4点〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He finally fell exhausted into bed in the small hours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凌晨时分他终于筋疲力尽地上了床。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The party continued into the wee small hours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 派对一直进行到凌晨。

Sense.DEF: guns that you hold with one or both hands when firing them
Sense.TRAN: 轻武器〔可用单手或双手拿着射击的武器〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something is not important, especially when compared to other people or things
Sense.TRAN: 无足轻重的人[事物]﹐微不足道的人[事物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even with £10, 000 to invest, you are still small beer for most investment managers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使投资一万英镑﹐对大多数的投资管理人来说你还是个小人物。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He writes so small I can’t read it.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他字写得这么小﹐我看不清楚。

Exponent.DEF: not large in size, amount, or effect
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a small boat
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小船
Exponent.EXAMPLE: small businesses
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小企业
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a small amount of money
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一小笔钱
Exponent.EXAMPLE: small changes
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 微小的变化

Exponent.DEF: small – used about objects, places, and living things, and especially with other adjectives to show how you feel about someone or something
Exponent.TRAN: 〔物体﹑地方和有生命之物〕小的〔尤与其他形容词连用表示对某人或某物的感觉〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a very pretty little town.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一个非常漂亮的小镇。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The poor little dog has hurt its leg.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怜的小狗腿上受伤了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The cake was decorated with little flowers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛋糕上点缀着一朵朵小花。

Exponent.DEF: used about prices, rents, levels, or standards
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People on low incomes are finding it difficult to pay fuel bills.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 低收入人士觉得难以支付燃油账单。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The crime rate in the area is relatively low.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区犯罪率相对较低。

Exponent.DEF: small and not very important or not very noticeable
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a slight problem
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻微的问题
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s been a slight improvement in his health.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的健康略有好转。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a slight increase in sales
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售的略微增长

Exponent.DEF: small and not important or not serious
Exponent.TRAN: 小的,不重要的,不严重的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: minor injuries
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻伤
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We’ve made some minor changes to the program.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对计划作了几处小小的改动。

Exponent.DEF: small – used about places, buildings etc in which space is used effectively, or about phones, cameras, cars etc which are designed to be much smaller than usual
Exponent.TRAN: 〔地方﹑建筑物等〕紧凑的﹔〔手机﹑照相机﹑汽车等〕小巧的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The apartments are very compact.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些公寓都非常紧凑。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a compact camera
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 袖珍照相机

Exponent.DEF: used about a room, house etc that is too small
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a poky bedroom
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 狭小的卧室
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a poky flat
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 拥挤的公寓

Exponent.DEF: used about a space, room, or vehicle that is too small because people do not have enough room to move around
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They all lived together in a cramped apartment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们全部生活在一套拥挤的公寓里。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The car feels cramped with four adults in it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这车坐进四个大人就觉得拥挤了。

Exponent.DEF: very small – used about objects, numbers, or amounts
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a tiny island
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 极小的岛
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Dairy foods provide your body with a tiny amount of vitamin D.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 奶制品为人体提供微量维生素D。

Exponent.DEF: very small – used for emphasis
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I'll just have a teeny bit of cream.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只要一丁点奶油。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There's just one teeny little problem.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有一个很小很小的问题。

Exponent.DEF: extremely small and extremely difficult to see or notice
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They found minute traces of poison in his body.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在他体内发现了微量毒素。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The differences are minute.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 差别很细微。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: minute creatures
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 微小生物

Exponent.DEF: a miniature camera, watch, railway etc is made in a very small size. A miniature horse, dog etc is bred to be a very small size.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔照相机﹑手表﹑铁路等〕微型的﹔〔马﹑狗等〕小种的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The spy used a miniature camera.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名间谍使用了微型相机。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the fashion for miniature pets
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 饲养微型宠物的时尚

Exponent.DEF: extremely small and impossible to see without special equipment
Exponent.TRAN: 微小的,要用显微镜才能看见的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: microscopic organisms
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 微小生物
Exponent.EXAMPLE: microscopic particles of dust
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 粉尘微粒

Exponent.DEF: extremely small in a surprising way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was wearing a minuscule bikini.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿着一件很小的比基尼。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The threat is minuscule compared to other risks in our lives.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 相对于我们生活中的其他危险而言,这种威胁是微不足道的。

Sense.DEF: the lower part of your back where it curves
underwear
an advertisement put in a newspaper by someone who wants to buy or sell something
Sense.TRAN: 小广告﹐分类广告〔报纸上求购或出售物品的短广告〕

Sense.DEF: a court where people can make legal claims involving small amounts of money
people or things that are not important when compared to other people or things
Sense.TRAN: 〔相比之下不重要的〕小人物﹐小事情
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no point in arresting the small fry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 逮捕这些小卒子是毫无意义的。

Sense.DEF: someone who has a smallholding
a piece of land used for farming, that is smaller than an ordinary farm
the long tube that food goes through after it has gone through your stomach
fairly small
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s smallish with red hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她个子不高﹐一头红发。

Sense.DEF: thinking too much about your own life and problems and not about important things – used this to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 眼界小的﹐思想狭隘的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: People around here are so small-minded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的人思想很狭隘。

Sense.DEF:
a room in someone’s home, with electronic equipment such as a computer and a
fax
machine, that is used as a place in which to work
a serious disease that causes spots which leave marks on your skin
all the rules and details relating to a contract or agreement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Always read the small print before you sign anything.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管是什么﹐一定要阅读细则之后再签字。

Sense.DEF: involving only a small number of things or a small area
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small-scale study
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小规模的研究

Sense.DEF: television – used especially when comparing television to the cinema
Sense.TRAN: 电视 〔尤用于和电影比较〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a film made for the small screen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视电影

Sense.DEF: polite friendly conversation about unimportant subjects
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stood around making small talk .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们站着闲聊。

Sense.DEF: a criminal who is not involved in large or serious crimes
from, or relating to, a small town
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small-town newspaper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一份小镇上的报纸

Sense.DEF: relating to ideas, qualities etc that people in small towns are supposed to have, which sometimes include a lack of interest in anything new or different
Sense.EXAMPLE: small-town attitudes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狭隘的看法

Sense.DEF: polite in an insincere way – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 奉承的﹐讨好的﹐假殷勤的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: smarmy comments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奉承话
Sense.EXAMPLE: a smarmy car salesman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个逢迎讨好的汽车推销员

Sense.DEF: intelligent or sensible
Sense.EXAMPLE: The smart kids get good grades and go off to college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 聪明的孩子成绩好﹐可以去上大学。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was smart enough to wait for a week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很明智﹐等了一个星期。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His decision to become a director was a smart move sensible thing to do .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他决定要做导演﹐这是明智之举。

Sense.DEF: trying to seem clever in a disrespectful way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t get smart with me, young man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别跟我耍小聪明﹐年轻人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made some smart remark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他讲了些不恭不敬的话。

Subsense.DEF: a smart person is wearing neat attractive clothes and has a generally tidy appearance
Subsense.TRAN: 衣着整洁漂亮的﹐衣冠楚楚的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’re looking very smart .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看上去很帅气。

Subsense.DEF: smart clothes, buildings etc are clean, tidy, and attractive
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a smart black suit
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漂亮的黑色套装
Subsense.EXAMPLE: smart new offices
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整洁漂亮的新办公室

Sense.DEF: fashionable or used by fashionable people
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of Bonn’s smartest restaurants
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 波恩最时髦的餐馆之一

Sense.DEF: smart machines, weapons, materials etc are controlled by computers and are designed to react in a suitable way depending on the situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: smart weapons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 智能武器

Sense.LEXUNIT: the smart money is on sb/sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular person or thing is likely to do something or be successful
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某物很有可能做某事[成功]

Sense.DEF: a smart movement is done quickly, especially with force
Sense.EXAMPLE: a smart blow on the head
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头上的一记重击
Sense.EXAMPLE: She set off at a smart pace fairly fast .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她快步跑了起来。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个衣着光鲜的年轻人
RunOn.EXAMPLE: He turned smartly and walked away.

Sense.DEF: to be upset because someone has hurt your feelings or offended you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was still smarting from the insult.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她还在为受到侮辱生气。

Sense.DEF: if a part of your body smarts, it hurts with a stinging pain
Sense.EXAMPLE: My eyes were smarting with the smoke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的眼睛被烟熏得发痛。

Sense.DEF: to make funny rude remarks
someone who always says clever things or always has the right answer, in a way that is annoying
Sense.TRAN: 自作聪明的人﹐自以为是的人

Sense.DEF: a smart alec
Sense.TRAN: 自作聪明的人﹐自以为是的人

Sense.DEF: a bomb that is fired from an aircraft and uses a computer to hit a particular place
a small plastic card with an electronic part that records and remembers information
to make yourself look neat and tidy
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’d better smarten yourself up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好打扮得干净整齐。

Sense.DEF: to make something look neater
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to smarten the place up a bit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要把这地方整理一下。

Sense.DEF: to improve the way you behave or do something
Sense.TRAN: 改进自己的行为/让自己变得更高明
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company needs to smarten up their act if they are to keep customers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司若要留住客户﹐就需要学聪明一些。

Sense.DEF:
a
mobile phone
that also works as a
pda
intelligence
Sense.EXAMPLE: If she had any smarts, she’d get rid of the guy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她要是有点脑子﹐就会把那家伙甩掉。

Sense.DEF: someone who always says clever things or always has the right answer, in a slightly annoying way
Sense.TRAN: 自以为是的人﹐自诩聪明的人

Sense.DEF: to break into pieces violently or noisily, or to make something do this by dropping, throwing, or hitting it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vandals had smashed all the windows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 破坏分子打碎了所有的窗子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Firemen had to smash the lock to get in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防员不得不砸锁而入。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several cups fell to the floor and smashed to pieces .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个杯子掉到地上摔得粉碎。

Sense.DEF: to hit an object or surface violently, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: A stolen car smashed into the bus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆被偷的汽车猛地撞上了公共汽车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He smashed his fist down on the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把拳头狠狠地砸在桌上。

Sense.DEF: to do something much faster, better etc than anyone has done before
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film smashed all box office records.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片打破了所有的票房纪录。

Sense.DEF: to destroy something such as a political system or criminal organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police say they have smashed a major crime ring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方说他们捣毁了一个主要的犯罪团伙。

Sense.DEF: to hit a high ball with a strong downward action, in tennis or similar games
Sense.TRAN: 〔在网球等运动中〕杀〔球〕﹐猛扣〔球〕

Sense.DEF: to hit a door, wall etc violently so that it falls to the ground
to hit something so violently that you break it and make a hole in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The door had been smashed in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这扇门被砸穿了。

GramExa.GLOSS: hit someone hard in the face or head
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll smash his head in if he comes here again!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他要是再来﹐我就打碎他的脑袋！

Sense.DEF: to deliberately destroy something by hitting it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hooligans started smashing the place up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 流氓开始对这个地方进行打砸。

Sense.DEF: a serious road or railway accident – used especially in newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 严重的交通事故﹔车祸〔尤用于报纸上〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young boy hurt in car smash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男童在车祸中受伤。

Sense.DEF: a new film, song etc which is very successful
Sense.TRAN: 非常成功的新电影[新歌曲等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a box-office smash a film which many people go to see at the cinema
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高票房电影

Sense.DEF: a hard downward shot in tennis or similar games
the loud sound of something breaking

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He heard the smash of glass.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听到玻璃打碎的声音。

Sense.DEF: a crime in which someone robs a shop by breaking the window and stealing things quickly
very drunk or affected by a drug
Sense.TRAN: 烂醉的﹔吸毒后精神恍惚的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s just an excuse to go out and get smashed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只是一个为了出去喝个大醉的借口。

Sense.DEF: someone who you think is very attractive, or something that is very good
Sense.TRAN: 非常漂亮的人﹔极好的东西

Sense.DEF: a very successful new play, book, film etc
Sense.TRAN: 非常成功的新戏[新书﹐新影片等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had a smash hit with their first single.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的首张单曲唱片大受欢迎。

Sense.DEF: very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a smashing holiday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的假期过得非常棒。

Sense.DEF: a small number or amount of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a smattering of applause
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 零星的掌声

Sense.DEF: to have a small amount of knowledge about a subject, especially a foreign language
Sense.TRAN: 略知﹐懂得一点点〔某门学科﹐尤指外语〕

Sense.DEF: a dirty mark made by a small amount of something spread across a surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a smear of paint
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块油漆污迹

Sense.EXAMPLE: It left a black smear on his arm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这在他的左臂上留下了一点黑色的污迹。

Sense.DEF:
a
smear test
Sense.TRAN: 子宫颈涂片检查﹐涂片试验

Sense.DEF: an untrue story about a politician or other important person that is told in order to make people lose respect for them – used especially in newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 污蔑﹐诽谤〔尤用于报纸上〕

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只污迹斑斑的玻璃杯

Sense.DEF: to spread a liquid or soft substance over a surface, especially in a careless or untidy way
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指粗心或胡乱地〕涂﹐抹〔液体或酱状物〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His face was smeared with mud.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他满脸泥污。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Elaine smeared suntan lotion on her shoulders.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊莱恩把防晒霜胡乱抹在 肩上。

Sense.DEF: to tell an untrue story about someone important in order to make people lose respect for them – used especially in newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 污蔑﹐诽谤〔尤用于报纸上〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to smear the party leadership
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 污蔑党领导的 企图

Sense.DEF: to put dirty or oily marks on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: smeared windows
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脏了的窗户

Sense.DEF: if writing, a picture, or paint smears or is smeared, the ink or paint is accidentally touched and spread across the surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several words were smeared.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好几个单词被涂污了。

Sense.DEF: a deliberate plan to tell untrue stories about an important person in order to make people lose respect for them – used especially in newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 抹黑行动〔指蓄意诽谤重要人物以损害其名声的行为﹐尤用于报纸上〕

Sense.DEF:
a medical test in which some cells are removed from the entrance to a woman’s
womb the place where a baby grows
and examined under a microscope
Sense.TRAN: 子宫颈涂片检查﹐涂片试验

Sense.DEF: the quality that people and animals recognize by using their nose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The air was filled with the smell of flowers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 空气中弥漫着花香。

Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s that horrible smell?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是什么味道﹐这么难闻？

Sense.DEF: an unpleasant smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think the smell’s getting worse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得这气味越来越难闻了。

Sense.DEF: the ability to notice or recognize smells
Sense.EXAMPLE: loss of taste and smell
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 味觉和嗅觉的丧失
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dogs have a very good sense of smell .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狗的嗅觉非常灵敏。

Sense.DEF: an act of smelling something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have a smell of this cheese; does it seem all right?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闻一闻这块干酪﹐没变味吧？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There was a strong smell of burning in the air.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 空气中有股强烈的焦味。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not strong
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I noticed a faint smell of perfume.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我闻到一股淡淡的香水味。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very strong
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The smell of disinfectant was overpowering.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 消毒剂的味道非常强烈。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There was a lovely smell of fresh coffee.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有现磨咖啡的香味。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The smell in the shed was awful.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 棚屋里的气味非常难闻。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What’s that funny smell?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 是什么怪味？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a pleasant smell of food
sweet and unpleasant
strong and unpleasant
strong and bitter
old and not fresh
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 发霉/不新鲜/酸腐的气味
有强烈的/芬芳的等气味
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The flowers had a lovely sweet smell.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些花有一种很好闻的香味。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: produce a smell
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Rubber gives off a strong smell when it is burned.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 橡胶燃烧时会发出强烈的气味。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He detected a faint smell of blood.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他闻到淡淡的血腥味。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A delicious smell of baking came from the kitchen.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房飘来烤面包的香味。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: moves there through the air

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘feel the smell of sth’. Say 而要说 smell sth .

Exponent.DEF: something that you can recognize by breathing in through your nose
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the smell from the kitchen
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房传来的味道
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What’s that awful smell?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是什么味道,这么难闻？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the sweet smell of roses
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 玫瑰的芳香

Exponent.DEF: something that you smell for a short time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He caught a whiff of her perfume.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他闻到她淡淡的香水味。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a whiff of apple blossom
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵苹果花香

Exponent.DEF: a smell – used especially about the pleasant smell from flowers, plants, or fruit. Also used about the smell left by an animal.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指花﹑植物或水果的〕香气﹔〔动物的〕气味,臭迹
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The rose had a beautiful scent.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这玫瑰有股馨香。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Cats use their scent to mark their territory.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫用臭迹标明自己的领地。

Exponent.DEF: a pleasant smell, especially from flowers, plants, or fruit. Fragrance and perfume are more formal than scent .
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指花﹑植物或水果的〕芬芳,香气〔比scent正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the sweet perfume of the orange blossoms
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 橙子花的甜美芳香
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Each mango has its own special fragrance.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 每一种芒果都有特殊的香气。

Exponent.DEF: a pleasant smell from food or coffee
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the aroma of fresh coffee
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 现磨咖啡的香味
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The kitchen was filled with the aroma of mince pies.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房里弥漫着百果馅饼的香味。

Exponent.DEF: an unpleasant smell
Exponent.EXAMPLE: An unpleasant odour was coming from the dustbins.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 垃圾桶里传来一股难闻的气味。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the odor of stale tobacco smoke
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 污浊的香烟味

Exponent.DEF: an unpleasant smell
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What’s that horrible pong?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是什么臭味？

Exponent.DEF: a very strong and unpleasant smell
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t get rid of the stink of sweat.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我除不掉那股汗臭味。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The toilet gave off a terrible stench.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 厕所里发出一股恶臭。

Sense.DEF: to notice or recognize a particular smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can smell burning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我闻到烧焦的气味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you smell something?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你闻到什么气味了吗？

Sense.DEF: to have a particular smell

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The stew smelled delicious .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这炖菜闻起来真香。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mm! Something smells good !
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 呣！什么东西这么香！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My clothes smelt of smoke.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的衣服上有烟味。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It smells like rotten eggs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这闻起来像臭鸡蛋。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: sweet-smelling flowers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 气味芬芳的花朵

Sense.DEF: to have an unpleasant smell
Sense.TRAN: 发出臭气﹐有难闻的气味
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your feet smell!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的脚好臭！
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room smelled to high heaven had a very bad smell .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房间臭气熏天。

Sense.DEF: to put your nose near something in order to discover what kind of smell it has
Sense.EXAMPLE: She bent down and smelt the flowers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她弯下腰闻了闻花儿。

Sense.DEF: to have the ability to notice and recognize smells
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a cold and I can’t smell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得了感冒﹐闻不出味道。

Sense.DEF: to feel that something is going to happen, especially something bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: Miller had smelled trouble the moment she said who she was.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一说她是谁﹐米勒就感觉到有麻烦了。

Sense.DEF: to guess that something wrong or dishonest is happening
Sense.TRAN: 怀疑事情不对头﹐感到其中有诈

Sense.DEF: to seem dishonest or untrue
Sense.TRAN: 似乎不对劲/靠不住/奇怪等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole thing is beginning to smell fishy to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开始感到这整件事有点可疑。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: come up/out of smelling of roses

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Use an adjective after smell, not an adverb, to say that something has a good, bad, or strange smell.
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示某物的气味如何,在 smell 之后用形容词,不要用副词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The house smelled awful (NOT不说 awfully).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子里有股臭味。
F2NBox.EXPL: You can use smell with of to say what has given something a smell.
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示某物有某种气味,用 smell of
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Her breath smelled of onions (NOT不说 smelled onions).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她嘴里有股洋葱味儿。
F2NBox.EXPL: You can use smell with like to say that something has the same kind of smell as something else.
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示某物闻起来像什么,用 smell like
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: a glass of wine that smelled like flowers
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯闻着有花香的葡萄酒
F2NBox.EXPL: If you say that something or someone smells , you always mean they have a bad smell.
F2NBox.TRAN: 如果说某物或某人 smells ,意思是他们发出了臭味
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Your socks smell.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的袜子有臭味。
F2NBox.EXPL: To say that someone notices a smell, use can smell or just smell , followed by a noun .
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示某人闻到某种气味,用 can smell ,或者就用 smell ,其后跟名词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I can smell coffee.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我闻到了咖啡的味道。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We smelled smoke.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们闻到了烟味。

Sense.DEF: to find something by smelling
Sense.EXAMPLE: They use dogs trained to smell out explosives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们使用受过训练能嗅出爆炸物的狗。

Sense.DEF: to find or recognize something because you have a natural ability to do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ll be able to smell out any corruption.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们将能觉察到任何腐败行为。

Sense.DEF:
a strong-smelling chemical that you hold under someone’s nose to make them conscious again when they have
faint ed
having a strong unpleasant smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: smelly feet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 臭脚

Sense.DEF:
a past tense and past participle of
smell
Sense.TRAN: smell 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: to melt a rock that contains metal in order to remove the metal
a very small amount of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I added just a smidgin of chilli sauce.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只加了一点点辣椒酱。

Sense.DEF: to make your mouth curve upwards, in order to be friendly or because you are happy or amused

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Susan smiled at him and waved.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏珊朝他笑着挥挥手。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had to smile at his enthusiasm she was amused by it .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的热情把她逗笑了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: her smiling face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的笑脸

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I haven’t had much to smile about lately.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 近来我没什么开心的事情。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mark read the message and smiled to himself smiled or felt pleased .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克读着那条信息﹐笑了起来。

Sense.HINTTRAN: You smile at someone. Do not say ‘smile to someone’. 对某人笑是 smile at someone﹐不要说 smile to someone。

Sense.DEF: to say or express something with a smile
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It’s good to have you back,’ she smiled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你回来了真好。”她微笑着说。

Sense.LEXUNIT: fortune/the gods etc smile on sb
Sense.DEF:
if
fortune
, the gods etc smile on you, you have good luck
Sense.TRAN: 幸运之神/神等在向某人微笑

Exponent.DEF: to make your mouth curve upwards, in order to be friendly or because you are happy or amused
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She smiled when she read his email.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她笑眯眯地读着他的电子邮件。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: 'I’m delighted to meet you,'George said, smiling at the girl.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “很高兴见到你。”乔治笑着对那女孩说。

Exponent.DEF: to give a big smile
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The two boys were grinning at each other.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个男孩咧着嘴冲对方笑。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The coach was grinning from ear to ear (=was grinning a lot) when the team scored.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队进球得分,教练笑得合不拢嘴。

Exponent.DEF: to give a big happy smile for a long time, because you are very pleased or proud
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因非常高兴或自豪而〕满面笑容,眉开眼笑
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She beamed with pride as her son collected the award.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿子领奖的时候,她满脸自豪的笑容。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The wedding couple were outside beaming at the camera.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那对新人在外面对着镜头笑意盈盈。

Exponent.DEF: to smile in an unpleasant way, for example because you are pleased about someone else’s bad luck or because you know something that someone else does not know
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The children smirked when the teacher dropped all the books on the floor.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师把所有的书都弄掉在地上,孩子们就幸灾乐祸地笑了起来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What are you smirking about?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你幸灾乐祸地笑什么？

Exponent.DEF: to smile in a silly and annoying way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a group of simpering schoolgirls
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群咯咯傻笑的女学童
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I hated the way she simpered every time a man spoke to her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌每次有男人跟她说话时她傻笑的样子。

Sense.DEF: an expression in which your mouth curves upwards, when you are being friendly or are happy or amused
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a big smile on his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他笑容满面。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Oh, I’m fine,’ Anna replied with a smile.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “噢,我很好。”安娜笑着回答。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: wipe the smile/grin off sb’s face

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The boy gave a friendly smile.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩露出友好的微笑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: give a quick smile
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She flashed him a smile.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她冲他一笑。

Collocate.COLLOC: have a smile on your face/lips
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They all had broad smiles on their faces.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们个个都满脸笑容。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be happy or friendly and smile a lot
Collocate.EXAMPLE: One moment he’s all smiles, the next moment he shouts at me.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一会儿笑容可掬,一会儿又冲我大叫大嚷。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: smile when you do not really feel happy or friendly
have a smile on your face
smile back at someone

Collocate.COLLOC: sb breaks into a smile/sb’s face breaks into a smile
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: they suddenly smile

Collocate.COLLOC: a smile spreads across sb’s face
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: they smile
it gets bigger
they stop smiling
when you are very happy
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She had a big smile on her face.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上挂着灿烂的笑容。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Peter Leary welcomed Rachel with a warm smile.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得·利里以热情的微笑欢迎蕾切尔。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She gave him an apologetic little smile.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她歉意地向他微微一笑。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She gave him a quick smile.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她向他匆匆一笑。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A slow smile spread across his face.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脸上慢慢绽开一个笑容。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a big smile which shows someone’s white teeth
when you are very happy
when you look very happy, but you may not feel happy
when you are not really happy or friendly
when a situation is bad but also amusing
when you feel slightly sad
when you know something secret

Sense.DEF: a sign that looks like a face when you look at it sideways, for example :-), used in email messages to show that you are happy or pleased about something
Sense.TRAN: 笑容符〔电子邮件中使用的表示愉快或高兴的符号﹐如 :-)〕

Sense.DEF: done or said with a smile
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Of course,’ she replied smilingly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那当然。”她微笑着回答。

Sense.DEF: to smile in an unpleasant way that shows that you are pleased by someone else’s bad luck or think you are better than other people
Sense.TRAN: 幸灾乐祸地笑﹔自鸣得意地笑
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boys tried not to smirk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩们强忍住得意的笑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What are you smirking at?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你幸灾乐祸地笑什么？

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He had a self-satisfied smirk on his face.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一脸沾沾自喜的笑容。

Sense.DEF: to hit something with a lot of force
to destroy, attack, or punish someone
someone who makes and repairs things made of iron
a maker of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gunsmith someone who makes guns
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 枪炮匠
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wordsmith someone who works with words, for example a journalist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文字工作者

Sense.LEXUNIT: smash/blow etc sth to smithereens informal
Sense.DEF: to destroy something by breaking it into very small pieces, or with an explosion
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shop was blown to smithereens by the explosion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家商店被炸得粉碎。

Sense.DEF:
a place where iron objects such as
horseshoe s
were made and repaired in the past
suddenly feeling that you love someone very much
Sense.TRAN: 突然爱上…的﹐突然迷上…的
Sense.EXAMPLE: As soon as he saw her, he was smitten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一见到她﹐就为她倾倒了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was totally smitten with Steve.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她完全被史蒂夫迷住了。

Sense.DEF: suddenly affected by an illness or a feeling
Sense.TRAN: 突然染上某种病/突然产生某种感情
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dan was smitten with remorse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹顿时悔恨不已。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole family were smitten with flu.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全家人都患上了流感。

Sense.DEF:
the past participle of
smite
a long loose shirt or a loose dress
Sense.TRAN: 宽松式长衬衫﹔宽松式连衣裙

Sense.DEF: a loose piece of clothing worn by artists or other workers to protect their other clothing
Sense.TRAN: 〔艺术家或其他工作人员穿的〕罩衣﹐工作服

Sense.DEF: a type of decoration made on cloth by pulling the cloth into small regular folds held tightly with stitches

dirty air that looks like a mixture of smoke and
fog
, caused by smoke from cars and factories in cities
Sense.TRAN: 烟雾﹐雾霾〔指城市里由汽车和工厂废气所造成的不洁空气〕

Sense.DEF: white, grey or black gas that is produced by something burning

GramExa.EXAMPLE: black smoke
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 团团黑烟

Sense.EXAMPLE: cigarette smoke
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香烟的烟雾
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smoke from burning fields drifted across nearby roads.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地里燃烧产生的烟雾飘到了附近的公路上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pall of smoke thick cloud of smoke that hung over the city
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 笼罩在城市上空的浓烟

GramExa.GLOSS: a small amount of smoke
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rangers watched from their fire towers for any wisps of smoke.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 园林管理员在火警望塔上观察是否有烟雾出现。

Sense.DEF: an act of smoking a cigarette etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He went outside for a quiet smoke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他到外面去静静地吸一支烟。

Subsense.DEF: if something goes up in smoke, it burns so that it is completely destroyed
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The whole factory went up in smoke.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整座工厂付之一炬。

Subsense.DEF: if a plan or some work goes up in smoke, it fails or you cannot continue with it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We haven’t worked this long just to see everything go up in smoke.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们干了这么长时间﹐可不想看到一切都化为乌有。

Sense.DEF: a cigarette or drugs that are smoked
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where are the smokes, Jeff?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰夫﹐香烟在哪儿？

Sense.DEF: used to say that if something bad is being said about someone, it is probably partly true
Sense.TRAN: 无火不冒烟﹔无风不起浪﹔事出必有因

Sense.DEF: when things have stopped happening and the results can be clearly seen
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the smoke clears, I think you’ll find the company is in a stronger position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等到这一切都过去以后﹐我想你会发现公司将更加强大。

Sense.DEF: London or any large town or city
to suck or breathe in smoke from a cigarette, pipe etc or to do this regularly as a habit
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t smoke and I don’t drink much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不吸烟﹐酒也喝得不多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you mind if I smoke?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我抽烟你介意吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sat on the grass smoking a cigarette.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坐在草地上吸烟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He admitted that he had smoked marijuana when he was a student.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他承认在读书时吸过大麻。

Sense.DEF: if something smokes, it has smoke coming from it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a smoking chimney
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冒烟的烟囱

Sense.DEF: to give fish or meat a special taste by hanging it in smoke
to fill a place with smoke in order to force someone or something to come out
Sense.EXAMPLE: He smoked the bees out of their nest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用烟把蜜蜂熏出蜂窝。

Sense.DEF: to discover who is causing a particular problem and force them to make themselves known
Sense.EXAMPLE: an operation to smoke out double agents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清查双重间谍的行动

Sense.DEF: a piece of electronic equipment which warns you when there is smoke or fire in a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: The smoke alarm went off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟雾警报器响了起来。

Sense.DEF: something that lets out clouds of smoke when it is thrown, used especially by police to control crowds
Sense.TRAN: 烟雾弹〔尤为警察用来控制人群〕

Sense.DEF: fish, meat etc that has been left in smoke to give it a special taste
Sense.TRAN: 熏三文鱼/咸猪肉/香肠等

Sense.DEF:
a
smoke alarm
glass that is a dark grey colour
used to talk about a place where plans or decisions are made secretly by a small group of powerful people rather than in an open way – used especially in newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 〔少数权势人物秘密制订计划或做决定的〕密室〔尤用于报纸上〕

Sense.DEF: a place where people are not allowed to smoke
Sense.EXAMPLE: new laws to create a smoke-free environment at work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旨在创造无烟工作环境的新法律

Sense.DEF:
fuel
that burns without producing smoke
tobacco that you chew rather than smoke

someone who smokes cigarettes,
cigar s
etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: My grandad was a heavy smoker someone who smokes a lot .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爷爷烟瘾很大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a smoker’s cough a cough caused by smoking cigarettes regularly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因为经常吸烟而得了咳嗽病。

Sense.DEF: something that you do or say to hide your real plans or actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: a government that rules behind a smokescreen of democracy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以民主作烟幕实行统治的政府

Sense.DEF: a cloud of smoke produced so that it hides soldiers, ships etc during a battle
Sense.TRAN: 〔战役中用以掩蔽士兵﹑船只等的〕烟幕

Sense.DEF: a message sent out to people who are far away, using the smoke from a fire, used especially by Native Americans in past times

a tall
chimney
at a factory or on a ship
a big traditional industry such as car making
Sense.TRAN: 烟囱工业〔指汽车制造业等传统的重工业〕

Sense.DEF: the activity of breathing in tobacco smoke from a cigarette, pipe etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I gave up smoking nearly ten years ago.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我差不多十年之前就戒烟了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The sign says ‘No Smoking’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 告示牌上写着“禁止吸烟”。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a no smoking area
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁烟区
Sense.EXAMPLE: the risks of passive smoking breathing in smoke from other people’s cigarettes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸二手烟的风险

Sense.DEF: something that shows who is responsible for something bad or how something really happened
a formal jacket that men wore after dinner in the past
Sense.TRAN: 吸烟服〔旧时男子晚饭后穿的一种外衣〕

Sense.DEF: a room where smoking is allowed in a public building
filled with smoke
Sense.EXAMPLE: a smoky room
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟雾弥漫的房间

Sense.DEF: producing too much smoke
Sense.EXAMPLE: a smoky engine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冒出大量烟的引擎

Sense.DEF: having the taste, smell, or appearance of smoke
Sense.EXAMPLE: smoky green eyes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟青色的眼睛
Sense.EXAMPLE: a smoky flavour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟熏的味道

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
smoulder
if two people smooch, they kiss and hold each other in a romantic way, especially while dancing
a smoochy song is slow and romantic
a smooth surface has no rough parts, lumps, or holes, especially in a way that is pleasant and attractive to touch
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her skin felt smooth and cool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的皮肤摸上去又滑又凉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a smooth pebble
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 光滑的卵石
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stone steps had been worn smooth .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石阶被磨得光溜溜的了。

Sense.DEF: happening or operating successfully, without any problems
Sense.TRAN: 顺利的﹐无困难的﹐无问题的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sarah is responsible for the smooth running of the sales department.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉负责销售部的顺畅运作。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The new government has promised a smooth transition of power.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新政府承诺保证政权的顺利交接。

Sense.DEF: with no sudden movements or changes of direction, especially in a way that is graceful or comfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Swing the tennis racquet in one smooth motion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挥动网球拍动作要流畅﹐一气呵成。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jet made a smooth landing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这架喷气式飞机平稳降落。

GramExa.GLOSS: a comfortable trip in an airplane or car
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It wasn’t a very smooth ride.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 车行驶得不是很平稳。

Sense.DEF: someone who is smooth is polite, confident, and relaxed, but is often not sincere
Sense.EXAMPLE: a smooth salesmen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个圆滑的推销员
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a smooth talker .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个很会说话的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: George is a smooth operator someone who does things in a smooth way .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治是个八面玲珑的滑头。

Sense.DEF: a liquid mixture that is smooth has no big pieces in it
Sense.TRAN: 无结块的﹐均匀无颗粒的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beat the eggs and flour until they are smooth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把鸡蛋和面粉打均匀。

Sense.DEF: a voice or music that is smooth is soft and pleasant to listen to
Sense.EXAMPLE: smooth jazz
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圆浑的爵士乐
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has one of those silky smooth very smooth voices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的嗓音柔和圆润。

Sense.DEF:
a drink such as wine, coffee,
whisky
, or beer that is smooth is not bitter but tastes pleasant
Sense.TRAN: 〔酒﹑咖啡等饮料〕不苦的﹐味美的﹐醇和的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a smooth full-bodied wine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 味道醇和浓郁的葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: to make something such as cloth or hair flat by moving your hands across it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liz smoothed her skirt and sat down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利兹抚平裙子坐了下来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She smoothed back her hair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把头发往后捋了捋。

Sense.DEF: to make a rough surface flat and even
Sense.TRAN: 把〔粗糙的表面〕弄平整﹐使光滑
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wood was smoothed and trimmed to size.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木头被刨平并切割成需要的尺寸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smooth down all the surfaces before you start painting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上油漆前把全部表面都磨平整。

Sense.DEF: to rub a liquid, cream etc gently over a surface or into a surface
Sense.TRAN: 轻轻地涂擦〔液体﹑面霜等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She smoothed suntan lotion over her legs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她轻轻地给双腿抹上防晒霜。

Sense.DEF: to make it easier for something to happen, by dealing with any problems first
Sense.EXAMPLE: Staff helped smooth the way for the new administration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工帮助新的管理层铺平了道路。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of problems or difficulties
Sense.EXAMPLE: A few objections have to be smoothed away before we can start the project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们先要消除几个反对意见才能开始这个项目。

Sense.DEF: to make something such as paper or cloth flat by moving your hands across it
Sense.EXAMPLE: They smoothed out the map on the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在桌上摊平地图。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smooth out all the wrinkles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把所有的皱褶弄平整。

Sense.DEF: to make something happen in an even regular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes central banks intervene to smooth out price fluctuations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候中央银行会出面干预以平息物价波动。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of problems or difficulties
if you smooth over problems, difficulties etc, you make them seem less serious and easier to control, especially by talking to the people who are involved in the problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sally managed to smooth over the bad feelings between them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨莉设法缓和了他们之间的敌对情绪。

Sense.DEF: someone who is confident and attractive, but is often not sincere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kyle’s a real smoothie .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯尔真是个圆滑的人。

Sense.DEF:
a thick drink made of fruit and fruit juices mixed together, sometimes with ice, milk, or
yoghurt
Sense.TRAN: 思慕雪〔一种用水果﹑果汁﹐有时加冰﹑奶或酸奶制成的饮料〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strawberry-banana smoothie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 草莓香蕉思慕雪

Sense.DEF: in a steady way, without stopping and starting again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Traffic flowed smoothly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路上交通畅通。

Sense.DEF: if a planned event, piece of work etc goes smoothly, there are no problems to spoil it
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll take about three hours if everything goes smoothly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果一切顺利的话﹐大约需要三小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Donna keeps the office running smoothly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唐娜让办公室运转得很顺利。

Sense.DEF: if you say something smoothly, you say it in a calm and confident way
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘All taken care of,’ he said smoothly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “都搞定了。”他平静地说道。

Sense.DEF: in a way that produces a smooth surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jacket fit smoothly over her hips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件外套非常合身地罩着她的臀部。

Sense.DEF: a smooth-talking person is good at persuading people and saying nice things, but you do not trust them
Sense.TRAN: 油嘴滑舌的﹐花言巧语的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a smooth-talking salesman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花言巧语的推销员

Sense.DEF: a large variety of different things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a smorgasbord of art from around the world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自世界各地的艺术大杂烩

Sense.DEF: a meal in which people serve themselves from a large number of different dishes

the past tense of
smite
to completely cover the whole surface of something with something else, often in a way that seems unnecessary or unpleasant

GramExa.EXAMPLE: noodles smothered in garlic sauce
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 盖了厚厚蒜蓉酱的面

Sense.DEF: to kill someone by putting something over their face to stop them breathing
Sense.EXAMPLE: A teenage mother was accused of smothering her 3-month-old daughter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个少女妈妈被指控闷死自己三个月大的女儿。

Sense.DEF: to stop yourself from showing your feelings or from doing an action
Sense.EXAMPLE: The girls tried to smother their giggles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩们使劲忍住不笑出声来。

Sense.DEF: to give someone so much love and attention that they feel as if they are not free and become unhappy
Sense.TRAN: 〔因爱得太过分〕使受不了﹐使不自在
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want him to feel smothered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想让他感到窒息。

Sense.DEF: to kiss someone a lot
to make a fire stop burning by preventing air from reaching it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We used a wet towel to smother the fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们用一块湿毛巾把火扑灭。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of anyone who opposes you – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 清除﹐压制〔反对者﹔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They ruthlessly smother all opposition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们无情地清除所有异己。

Sense.DEF: if something such as wood smoulders, it burns slowly without a flame
if someone smoulders, or if their feelings smoulder, they have strong feelings that they do not fully express
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sensed a smouldering hostility towards him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他感觉到有人对他暗怀敌意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had spent the evening smouldering with resentment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一晚上心里都愤愤不平。

Sense.FULLFORM: short messaging system or short message service
Sense.DEF:
a feature on a
mobile phone
that allows a user to send or receive written messages
a dirty mark

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a smudge of lipstick on the cup
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杯子上的口红印

Sense.DEF: if ink, writing etc smudges, or if you smudge it, it becomes dirty and unclear because it has been touched or rubbed
Sense.TRAN: 〔墨迹﹑字迹等〕被弄脏﹐被蹭脏﹔把…擦模糊
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t touch it! You’ll smudge the ink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别碰它！你会把墨水抹花的。

Sense.DEF: to make a dirty mark on a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone had smudged the paper with their greasy hands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人用油腻的手把这张纸弄脏了。

Sense.DEF: showing too much satisfaction with your own cleverness or success – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 自满的﹐自鸣得意的﹐沾沾自喜的〔含贬义〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What are you looking so smug about?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在得意什么？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘I knew I’d win,’ she said with a smug smile.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “我知道我会赢的。”她得意地笑着说。

Sense.DEF: to take something or someone illegally from one country to another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The guns were smuggled across the border.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些枪被偷运过境。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Illegal immigrants are smuggled into the country by boat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 非法移民被小船偷运进这个国家。

Sense.DEF: to take something or someone secretly to a place where they are not allowed to be

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He smuggled his notes into the exam.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把笔记偷偷带进了考场。

Sense.DEF: someone who takes something illegally from one country to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: a drug smuggler
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒品走私者

Sense.DEF: the crime of taking something illegally from one country to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was arrested in connection with drug smuggling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因牵涉毒品走私被捕。

Sense.DEF: books, stories, talk etc that offend some people because they are about sex
Sense.TRAN: 淫秽图书 [故事]﹔淫词秽语
Sense.EXAMPLE: I won’t have smut like that in my house!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不准家里有那种淫秽物品！

Sense.DEF:
dirt or
soot black powder produced by burning
, or a piece of dirt or soot
books, stories etc that are smutty offend some people because they are about sex
Sense.EXAMPLE: smutty jokes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下流笑话

Sense.DEF:
marked with small pieces of dirt or
soot
a small amount of food that is eaten between main meals or instead of a meal
Sense.EXAMPLE: I grabbed a quick snack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我赶紧吃了点零食。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Drinks and light snacks are served at the bar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒吧里供应饮料和小吃。
Sense.EXAMPLE: snack foods like crisps and peanuts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸薯片和花生之类的小吃

Sense.DEF: to eat small amounts of food between main meals or instead of a meal
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m trying not to snack between meals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正努力不在两餐之间吃点心。

Sense.DEF: a place where you can buy snacks or small meals
to take something quickly, especially before anyone else has had the time or the chance to do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: I managed to snaffle a couple of biscuits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我抢到了几块饼干。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a plan does not happen in the way it should
Sense.TRAN: 〔因未按计划而发生的〕混乱（局面）
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were no major snafus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有出什么大的乱子。

Sense.DEF: a problem or disadvantage, especially one that is not very serious, which you had not expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s an interesting job. The only snag is that it’s not very well paid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一份有趣的工作﹐唯一的缺憾是工资不高。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The grand opening hit a snag when no one could find the key.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 盛大的开幕典礼上出了个小小的意外: 谁也找不到那把钥匙了。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Snag is slightly informal. In written English, people usually prefer to use problem or disadvantage instead.
F2NBox.TRAN: snag略为不正式。在书面英语中,人们一般更喜欢说 problem 或 disadvantage
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The only disadvantage is that it takes a little longer.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 唯一的不足之处是时间长了一点。

Sense.DEF: a part of a dead tree that sticks out, especially one that is under water and can be dangerous
Sense.TRAN: 〔死树伸出水面的〕残桩﹔〔尤指水下死树的〕暗桩

Sense.DEF: a sharp part of something that sticks out and holds or cuts things that touch it
to damage something by getting it stuck on something sharp
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh no! I’ve snagged my stockings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀﹐坏了！我把长筒袜给钩破了。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in getting something, especially something difficult to get
Sense.TRAN: 获得﹐抢到 〔尤指难以得到的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I snagged a parking space in the last row.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我抢到了最后一排的一个停车位。

Sense.DEF: a list of small but important jobs that remain to be done on a new building, and which have to be done before the building is considered to be completely finished
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑完工前的〕重要小事项清单

Sense.DEF: a snaggle-toothed person has uneven or broken teeth
a small soft creature that moves very slowly and has a hard shell on its back
extremely slowly
Sense.TRAN: 以蜗牛的速度﹐极慢地﹐慢吞吞地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Traffic was moving at a snail’s pace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车辆移动的速度慢得像蜗牛。

Sense.DEF: the system of sending letters by post, as opposed to using email – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 蜗牛邮件﹐普通邮件〔相对于电子邮件而言﹐幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: an animal with a long thin body and no legs, that often has a poisonous bite
Sense.EXAMPLE: A snake slithered across our path.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条蛇蜿蜒爬过我们的小路。

Sense.DEF: someone who cannot be trusted
if a river, road, train, or line snakes somewhere, it moves in long twisting curves

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The road snaked along the valley far below.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公路在下面幽深的山谷里蜿蜒延伸。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The train was snaking its way through the mountains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车正在山中蜿蜒穿行。

Sense.DEF: the bite of a poisonous snake
someone who controls snakes by playing music to them, in order to entertain people
Sense.TRAN: 〔用音乐使蛇起舞的〕耍蛇者﹐弄蛇人

Sense.DEF:
a situation in a game in which a pair of
dice
both show one spot
Sense.TRAN: 蛇眼 〔指一对骰子同时掷出一点〕

Sense.DEF: something that is claimed to be a solution to a problem, but is not effective
Sense.TRAN: 狗皮膏药〔声称能解决某问题但实际无效的东西〕

Sense.DEF: someone who deceives people by persuading them to accept false information, solutions that are not effective etc
the skin of a snake used to make shoes, bags etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: snakeskin shoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛇皮鞋

Sense.DEF: to break with a sudden sharp noise, or to make something do this
Sense.TRAN: （使）啪的一声折断 [断开]﹔使啪嗒作响
Sense.EXAMPLE: A twig snapped under my feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一根细枝在我脚下嚓一声断开了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wind snapped branches and power lines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大风刮断了树枝和输电线。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I snapped the ends off the beans and dropped them into a bowl.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把菜豆掐掉两头﹐扔进碗里。

GramExa.GLOSS: break into two pieces
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The teacher snapped the chalk in two and gave me a piece.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师把粉笔折成两段﹐给了我一段。

Sense.DEF: to move into a particular position suddenly, making a short sharp noise, or to make something move like this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pieces just snap together like this.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个部件就像这样啪嗒一声合起来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The policeman snapped the handcuffs around her wrist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察用手铐啪的一声铐住她的手腕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She snapped her briefcase shut.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她啪嗒一声合上公文包。

Sense.DEF: to say something quickly in an angry way
Sense.TRAN: 厉声说（话）﹐怒气冲冲地说（话）
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What do you want?’ Mike snapped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你想干什么？”迈克厉声说道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He snapped at Walter for no reason.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他无缘无故地斥责了沃尔特一顿。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly stop being able to control your anger, anxiety, or other feelings in a difficult situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔精神等〕突然崩溃﹐突然失去自制力
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stress began to get to her, and one morning she just snapped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始受不了这样的压力﹐一天早晨突然就崩溃了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Something inside him snapped , and he hit her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一下子火起来﹐动手打了她。

Sense.DEF: if an animal such as a dog snaps, it tries to bite you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dog started snapping at my heels.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条狗开始咬我的鞋跟。

Sense.DEF: to take a photograph
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave snapped a picture of me and Sonia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫给我和索尼娅拍了一张照片。

Sense.DEF: to make a short sharp noise by moving one of your fingers quickly against your thumb, for example in order to get someone’s attention or to mark the beat of music
used to tell someone to hurry and do something immediately
Sense.TRAN: 赶快﹐快干〔用于催促别人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, snap to it – get that room cleaned up!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来﹐快点﹐把那个房间打扫干净！

Sense.DEF: to end a series of events – used especially in newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 结束﹐停止〔一系列事件﹐尤用于报纸上〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Rockets snapped a seven-game losing streak by beating Portland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火箭队击败波特兰队﹐结束了连输七场的霉运。

Sense.DEF: if soldiers snap to attention, they suddenly stand very straight
to switch something on or off, or to switch on or off
Sense.EXAMPLE: A light snapped on in one of the huts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中有一间小屋的灯亮了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kathy snapped off the light.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯西把灯关掉。

Sense.DEF: to stop being sad or upset and make yourself feel better
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chantal’s been depressed for days. I wish she’d snap out of it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尚塔尔情绪低落好几天了﹐我希望她能够振作起来。

Sense.DEF: to buy something immediately, especially because it is very cheap
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因十分便宜〕把…赶快买下﹐抢购
Sense.EXAMPLE: People were snapping up bargains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们在抢购便宜货。

Sense.DEF: to eagerly take an opportunity to have someone as part of your company, team etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Owen was snapped up by Liverpool before he’d even left school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧文还没有离开学校就被利物浦队抢去了。

Sense.DEF: a sudden loud sound, especially made by something breaking or closing
Sense.TRAN: 啪嗒一声〔尤指突然折断或关上某物发出的声音〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He shut the book with a snap.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他啪的一声把书合上。

Sense.DEF: a photograph taken quickly and often not very skilfully
Sense.EXAMPLE: holiday snaps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假日留影

Sense.DEF: to be very easy to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: The test was a snap.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次测验容易得很。

Sense.DEF: a small metal fastener on clothes that works when you press its two parts together
Sense.EXAMPLE: baby clothing with snaps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带揿扣的婴儿服

Sense.DEF: a sudden sound made by quickly moving one of your fingers against your thumb
Sense.EXAMPLE: At a snap of his owner’s fingers, the dog came running.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主人打了个响指﹐那狗就跑过来了。

Sense.DEF: a card game in which players put down one card after another and try to be the first to shout ‘Snap!’ when there are two cards that are the same
Sense.TRAN: “对儿”牌戏〔玩家轮流出牌﹐出现两张相同纸牌时要抢先叫 “对儿”〕

Sense.DEF: a judgment or decision made quickly, without careful thought or discussion
Sense.TRAN: 仓促的判断/匆忙的决定

Sense.DEF: an election that is announced suddenly and unexpectedly
Sense.TRAN: 突然宣布的大选﹐临时选举

Sense.DEF: used when you see two things that are exactly the same
Sense.TRAN: 真巧啊﹐一模一样〔发现两件相同物品时的惊叹语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hey, snap! My hat’s the same as yours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊﹐太巧啦！ 我的帽子和你的一样。

Sense.DEF: said in the game of snap when two cards that are the same are put down
Sense.TRAN: “对儿”〔“对儿”牌戏中出现两张相同纸牌时喊出的话〕

Sense.DEF: a garden plant with white, red, or yellow flowers
Sense.TRAN: 金鱼草﹐龙嘴花〔一种庭院植物〕

Sense.DEF: a snap-on part of something can be fastened on and removed easily
a type of fish that lives in warm seas, often used as food
Sense.TRAN: 啮鱼〔产于热带海域的一种食用鱼〕

Sense.DEF: a snappy title or phrase is short, clear, and often funny
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need a snappy title for the book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要给这本书起个短小有趣的书名。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep your answer short and snappy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的回答要简短干脆。

Sense.DEF: quick to react in an angry way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She seemed snappy and impatient.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她好像既急躁又不耐烦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s no need to be so snappy with the children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没必要对小孩子这样恶声恶气的。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to hurry
Sense.EXAMPLE: Get me a drink and make it snappy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我一杯饮料﹐快一点。

Sense.DEF: snappy clothes, objects etc are attractive and fashionable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a snappy suit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套时髦的套装

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who wears fashionable clothes
